Review Text: My dog, as much as I love him, sheds like crazy.  I have laminate floors and it has been a constant battle keeping up with the dog hair everywhere.  People with dogs that shed a lot probably know what I'm talking about, dog hair tumbleweeds and such.  I bought this Roomba and it has been a game changer.I run it daily, either when away from home or in the middle of the night via the scheduling feature on the app.  No more constant battle with dog hair for me.  I was skeptical at first because it just seems to go around in random directions but somehow at the end of the cleaning cycle it manages to get all of my main floor.  I put some 1 inch rubber pads under my sofa legs so the Roomba could fit under it where dog hair seems to accumulate and it goes under and cleans it up.Running it daily also seems to cut down on the amount of dusting I have to do.  It runs on average about an hour and 15 minutes.  It goes under and around my tables, and along the baseboards and when done, docks itself to recharge.  I empty the bin daily to prepare it for its next job.  It is somewhat noisy, but not standard vacuum cleaner noisy so even when I run it in the middle of the night it doesn't wake me.  I would say it is about as loud as  coffee grinder when running.Overall, I'm very happy with it.  It's not something that will perform on the level of spring cleaning but I don't think anyone would expect that.  It will keep your floors mostly clean and dog hair free when run on a daily basis.  I've not tried it on carpet so I can't give feedback on that.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2019

Review Text: Roomba confirmed that this product will not work with 5 G networks which ATT is in process of upgrading to. If I bought this and they upgraded tomorrow, I would have a useless Robot. Roomba should have disclosed that with a sub window or something before the purchase. When I asked for a replacement they informed me that it was not 250.00 like the one I bought.  It is 500.00 !!! They have 2 models that will  work with either network.  I spent 2.5 hours between phone time and failed installation and I am not happy and feel deceived. If you intend to buy any robot ask these questions.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020

Review Text: We've heard nothing but good things from friends and family who have Roombas, so we thought we'd give it a try. The first thing we were told was, "Make sure you spend the money for the real thing: the others may be a lot cheaper, but they're headaches waiting to happen."  Okay, fine, but the 675 isn't exactly a bank breaker, especially if you get it during a sale. And if we just made our lives easier AND avoided l'agita for less than $250, that's even better.I don't care about packaging until it's inadequate or off-the-charts excessive, and neither was the case here.The setup was breathtakingly simple - I forgot to breathe for a few seconds when I looked at the unit in the charger and after installing/starting the app, pressing 2 buttons, and naming the robot ("Sucka" - I know, that's so original), I saw that my phone was reporting that setup was complete.  I thought, "Really, that's it?  What'd I miss?" As it turns out, I missed nothing. Easy-peasy.  So, I thought I'd just let it charge overnight and then I'd play with it the next day.The next day, while working in my home office, I started the app and selected "Vacuum Everywhere".  I heard it wake up with cheerful little beeps and start working.  It really isn't too loud, so between meetings I followed the sound, coffee in hand, to watch it work.  I was kind of fun to watch it careening around like a drunken toddler, gently crashing into stuff and bouncing counter-clockwise until it could move again. I half-expected it to exclaim, "Uh-oh!"  And if something was light enough, it just pushed it around until it hit something solid enough to make it bounce.  I wish I'd waited until after working hours so that I could watch it with an adult beverage or two.  The 14-year-old in me is definitely going to set up some obstacle tests.Like any toddler, it requires a little bit of supervision. It got stuck on a thick power cable beneath a bed, so it beeped, called out with a voice to ask for help, and alerted my phone app; I rescued it and sent it on its way.  (Note to 14-yr-old-self: see if there's a way to hack the firmware to change the voice alerts to something really wrong. Maybe a toddler-like voice yelling, "Aw, s**t!" or "FML!")Also like a toddler, it eventually needs a diaper change and a feeding/nap. After a while, I had to empty the dust bin and pull some hair off of the brushes and wheels, so I put it back on the charger for a bit.  So, it's napping right now. After lunch, I'll fire it up again and see if it finds its way into my office.It may need some decoration, too.  Maybe some googly-eyes and a rude bumper sticker? Or a tiny pirate flag flying from the rear?So, for the important part: does it clean well?Yes. Judging from look of the floors and the amount of crud in the dustbin, it does a solid job.  And, apparently, I don't: my weekly floor sweeping/Bona mopping appears to be missing some stuff.Ah, the app tells me that it's already back to full charge (just under 2 hours!), so I'm gonna turn Sucka loose again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020

Review Text: I bought this Roomba 675 when it was on sale on Amazon for $200 back in January. It’s a “manual” model (no fancy home-mapping feature), which was just right for finding out whether or not this concept would work for us. It didn’t hurt that it was recommended by The Wirecutter.After running it on manual over the first weekend, I set up a Monday - Wednesday – Friday schedule. By Wednesday of week one, I noticed that the dirt cup was completely full every time, so I expanded the schedule to every day of the week except Sunday.For the balance of week one through Monday of week two, the dirt cup continued to be full at the end of the run. On Tuesday and Wednesday of this week, the dirt cup was less than half full on both days, so I reverted back to the MWF schedule. The dirt cup was only about a third full after it ran on Friday.It looks like we’re finally getting caught up with cleaning the floors downstairs after about a week and a half of running the Roomba almost every day. If the amount of dirt in the cup continues to go down next week, I may cut back to a twice a week schedule.So far, I’m perfectly happy with this model, even if I do occasionally have to get it unstuck or help it find its way back to its charging station before it runs out of battery power. Our downstairs floor is cleaner than it’s been since right after we moved in over two years ago. I don’t think that we need either the whole-house mapping or self-emptying features of the more-expensive models.I have no illusions about never having to use our upright vacuum cleaner again, as the carpets and rugs will need periodic deep cleaning, and there will always be places that the Roomba won’t be able to get to. Manually emptying the dirt cup after each run gives me useful feedback on the efficacy of the current schedule, as well as giving me the opportunity to vacuum off the dirt filter each time (to extend the useful life past he recommended 1 month).Note that I work from home, so I’m here to keep an ear on the Roomba while it’s moving around the house. As it gets stuck about once every time it runs, I’d definitely say that YMMV if you’re planning on running it when you’re not at home (and depending on how many “robot traps” you have).I have noticed that how long it can work depends on where its random path algorithm takes it. The more time it spends on carpeted areas, the shorter the run time—about 70 minutes if it’s staying on carpet, compared to about 80+ minutes on tile or wood flooring.Installing the iRobot Home phone app was a big help, both for the initial setup and for controlling the Roomba. It also generates push notifications if the Roomba gets stuck or confused and needs assistance to resume cleaning.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020

Review Text: This is driving me crazy.  The job is finished, it tries to dock maybe once or twice but fails so off it goes again not to return.  I have tried placing it on the dock.  It sits for a second then off it goes again.  My husband has tried securing the base several different ways but no luck.  Im so mad right now I was ready to throw it out the window.Also very loud so there is no way to talk during its cleaning and free flowing sessions.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2019

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   We recently replaced much of our carpeting with LVT. After a few days, we noticed dog hair everywhere, especially along the walls. We never realized how the carpeting hid the dog hair. Since we don’t want to sweep several times a day, we decided to buy a Roomba. After reading the reviews of the 694 and other brands, I opted for the 694.We got it today. I plugged it in to charge, downloaded the app and proceeded to set it up. Set up mainly consists of connecting it to your router. You can set up different cleaning routines for different areas of your house or just let it explore.For its maiden voyage, we had it vacuum the dining room. It is raised about 7 inches above the living room and is a distinct separate area. Ideal for a test trial. I created the favorite, Vacuum Dining Room, which just consists of giving it a name and putting Roomba in the room with its base. I started the routine from my iPad and it came out of its base. I quickly realized I needed to pull out the chairs from the table so it could get under them. And, you need to make sure there is enough room for it to get into every area of the room where you want it to clean.The video shows Roomba cleaning the dining room. My husband and I really enjoyed watching it and watching it learn. It got stuck once when it nearly fell off the raised area. It called for help and requested it be moved to another area. I picked it up, put it down and off it went. When it was done, it went to its garage and announced it was done.We decided to give it a shot in a bigger area which included the LVT.While our dog totally ignored it when it was in the dining room, she perked up when it started cleaning in the living room. The photo shows our dog watching it, half asleep. Interestingly, when it headed towards her, our dog just got up and stepped out of the way. Right now it is about 60 feet away cleaning the laundry room. The battery indicator is red and it should be coming home soon. It’s smart so I think it will find its way.Well, Roomba ran out of gas! It sent a message saying it needed to be returned to the base station. We finally found it in a corner of the laundry room, exhausted, near death. After emptying the dust bin, we carried it back to the base station. It is charging now. We will let it fully charge before sending it out again.It is a great device. My only criticism it that it doesn’t alert you when the dust bin needs emptying. So, it can keep running around, unable to pick up more. We do have a very large house, so this may not be a problem for most.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2021

Review Text: Use every day for cat hair, litter, and general dust.  Love that it goes under my bed, coffee table, and dining room table.  It also glides over area rugs and goes on to clean porcelain floors.  Works well on all of my carpeted rooms.  It is such a time saver and the floors are always clean.  Can’t live without it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2019

Review Text: Pros: amazing vacuum. It picked up so much on its first run.Cons: it’s so much work to follow it around when it gets stuck. It also misses so much. I genuinely bought this just for the location where my cats’ litter box is. I would have thought that it would develop a pattern of vacuuming, but no it’s a complete pinball machine of a vacuum. I’ve had to lock it in the bathroom a few times just to get it to clean decently.I’ve ran it three times so far. Each time for a half hour. It’s consistently missed the same room each time.It’s very loud which wouldn’t be a big deal but it looks like it would have to run for over an hour to clean my small apartment. The noise terrifies my cats and it’s just not worth it.At this point I’m considering returning it for a wireless vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2021

Review Text: This “vacuum” is a joke. You’d think the originator of robot vacuums would be the best but I’ve now bought and returned 4, 1 being this one. It is louder than any other brand, picks up the least and has zero organization or room pattern.ECOVACS deebot ended up being a life saver. Don’t waste your time with anything roomba 🤮
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020

Review Text: My husband insisted we should get one.He picked this kne out.  Maybe he was subtly trying to tell me something?I wasn't sure what to think- but I like this thing!  The first couple of uses I wasn't sure how it was going to work out because it took quite a while to get the area done.  But the AI seems solid.  So now it has learned the layout and has cut the cleaning time in half.The App is really useful.  It has let us know when the irobot has become stuck. We have set it to go off in the morning every other day.  Definitely pick up everything from the floor! (Might be a good way to get the kids to pick up their toys) also close doors to any place you dont want it to go.  Block access to small spaces it could get stuck under.Lol for me, I had a really low bar of expectation it had to meet - I just wanted it to make it back to its docking station! - but the bar was met.My only complaint is that the charging cord is a little lose at the charging station.  But it has not been a problem.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020

Review Text: Received the Roomba and everything was self explanatory.  I downloaded the app to my Android phone and had it connected to my wi-fi in less than five minutes.  After charging several hours, "Mable" was itching to get started.I sent her out and she amazed me.  Her sensors slow her down as she approached walls so she only lightly bumps into them.She easily went from hardwood to carpet.  She deep cleans both.  The carpet was lifted as she went alongWhen emptying the collection bin, it had tons of hair as well as very fine dirt.  She got under the table, couch, bed and dresser...My house has NEVER been this clean.

Review Text: This Roomba has blown my mind! I have 2 dogs that shed like crazy. I have to sweep and vacuum twice daily. So I set up a daily schedule for Steve(yes he has a name) and then place him to spot clean once if needed. He does take a long time but I'm good with it because I'm not doing it. Lol. Steve does struggle with mirror finished furniture but to me that makes sense and he isn't damaging the furniture so no real issue there.To sum it up, this might be the best purchase I've ever made.

Review Text: My husband, the retired chef, tends to just chop/dice and swipe it off the counter onto the floor like he's back at his restaurant with a cleaning crew. I tend to shed as much as our long haired cat.  We named our Roomba Rosie, from the Jetson's Cartoon, and after only two days, I can tell you Rosie is my new favorite relative!  She has mastered the main portions of the house with no programing on my part, that's a big plus for me.  We're running her right now when we can watch her, because the cat and the grandson really get a kick out of that, but eventually, we'll just push her clean button at night before we go to bed and wake up to clean floors!

Review Text: Bought this Vacuum to replace a Shark Ion which we had used for 3 years until it had issues.  Wish I would have got another shark. Review Text: We mainly got this for keeping up with dog hair. We have 2 white dogs, and they shed horribly. We have a fairly open house, and it gets the whole lower level easily. It’s great when it works right, but for $250, I feel like it should at least hold up for at least a year. I will update if the company decides to replace.

Review Text:

   We ordered the vacuum for our new house. We only use it for the open areas of the living room, dining room, kitchen, sun room and bar area. All are wood flooring but 2 area rugs in dining and living room.This is good for daily runs to pick up pet hair, we have 2 dogs and a cat, and dirt from outside. It runs for about 1 1/2 hours and can get most spots. A good purchase for our use.Downfalls are that we still use vacuum to deep clean the carpets since the robot only picks up the hair on the top and suction is not good enouth to get everything.  The furniture isn't moved but the robot still seems to get lost or cannot map the area very well. It runs into the table, couch and end tables all the time. It also doesn't always return to the charging station so you have to find it and put it back on.No issues emptying the bin daily and still feel it was a good purchase. To me, it is not worth the extra money to upgrade and get one that will self empty on its dock since you still have to empty that.

Review Text: I LOVE my roomba. I bought it to help my husband’s allergies. I’m not a great house keeper, but I will run this thing 2-3 times a week and it does inspire me to be a little bit better house keeper. I do have two cats (one of which is incredibly fluffy) and a dog, so I only run it when I’m home because I’ve heard the horror stories about roomba+poop. Also, I only have place rugs, no carpet.With all of the pet hair and my hair I do have to clean the brushes of hair about every other run of the house (1100 square feet), but it is incredibly easy to open up the brush compartment, remove them, pull/cut the hair off, and reinstall.Things of note:-the pattern is VERY erratic to the observer, but it does get to everything. If you can’t deal with this it’s probably not for you.-it works great for hair, but you have to put in a small effort keep the brushes clean-police cords before running-I have never felt floors so clean before. It really does break up embedded dirt, although I still run a swifter every so often.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2019

Review Text: We did return the vacuum, even though it was as advertised and did an excellent job of cleaning.  Our problem was that we had just downsized from a 2200sf house to a 900sf apartment and have a lot of "stuff" sitting on the floors causing too many obstacles for the unit to avoid.  We had to be with it almost constantly to remove items from its path and, sometimes had to pick it up to avoid them.  This is our bad, not a problem with the machine.  We certainly would recommend it to anyone that has wide open spaces for it to roam about in.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020

Review Text: My device is still trying to figure out the layout of the house and I had difficulty finding a spot where I could place it. It needs to have plenty of unobstructed space around it, including above it, in order for it to dock. In a smaller home that is problematic. I don't recommend leaving it alone while it is running as it can get caught and knock light weight items over. Pets may find it scary and annoying, especially when it moves their toys around. It does a great job cleaning the floors and love the fact that it goes under beds, tables and dressers. Now if it could only close and open doors so that dust bunnies behind the doors get sucked up.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019

Review Text: Gentlemen,Have you ever been on your gaming device and it’s suddenly occurred to you that your significant other told you at 3:23am to clean the house before she comes home? She pulls up in the driveway and you know you’re in trouble. All she wanted is a clean house. All you wanted was to relax and play video games. Your S/O will love you. You’ll get to kick back and have this thing clean for you. All you have to do is press one button on your phone. You’re already on your phone watching TikTok between games. Review Text: If you have carpet or area rugs keep looking. This model spends most of its time “stuck on a cliff” aka my area rug so I’m constantly babysitting it. It also tries to climb up my barstools so I have to remove them before starting it. When not stuck on a cliff it does clean well. Much easier and faster to vacuum the old fashioned way.

Review Text: I had been wanting one of this for some time, but couldn't see the price.  THEN, I had to have major surgery, and couldn't use the vacuum.  I hired a cleaner at $25 per hour, minimum $50!  Are you kidding me?  Just to vacuum?  So, I bit the bullet and bought this irobot.  I love it!  I have long hair and it picks it up and keeps on moving.  It finds dust in places that have been neglected forever.  It makes my place so tidy and neat looking.  I really love this machine.  I even named her Rosie after the Jetson's robotic maid.

Review Text: I have dogs who shed, plus they constantly drag in dirt and debris from the back yard, making it nearly impossible to stay on top of it with a big, clunky vacuum cleaner.  The Roomba has been the perfect solution.  I just start it up when I take them for their daily walk and when I return it is done!  I'm also super impressed with how this robot finds its way home.  Very cool ...

Review Text: We have dogs and a cat. I was vacuuming every day because of the hair and I can't stand walking bare foot on dirty floors and having dirt or hair stick to my feet.  This has been amazing!  I turn it on at the end of the day and it does a great job of picking up the daily grime that comes with pets and kids.  It does a good job on carpet too, but doesn't replace a deep clean with your primary vacuum cleaner.  I can really tell a difference and am very happy with this purchase.

Review Text: Never had a robotic vacuum before so I don't know what to expect.  We wanted a quick and effortless means for picking up after our yellow lab and this, it does well.  I can't understand the directional algorithms but given 90 minutes, it will more or less clean our 2200 sq. ft. house.  WiFi app is good for nothing more than turning on and off and checking on remaining battery level.  It you tell the Roomba to return to base, it usually can't find the base.  Great Black Friday deal!

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   My husband and I bought this Roomba 675 for our first floor that is mostly wooded. We have two cats so it's helpful to manage the cat hair between cleanings. There are quite a few Roomba models out there so we pretty much took a chance on this one because it was on sale at the time. Biggest pros are that you can use Alexa to power it up (see video) and can also fire it up remotely. It picks up a lot of stuff each time it runs and the collection compartment is big enough for our purpose. Biggest cons are that it's louder than I would like so I mostly have it clean while we are not in the house. It gets stuck sometimes (although it seems to be getting smarter as it "learns" the room). It also takes a little longer than I would like to find its way back to the dock once instructed. Overall quite pleased with the product for the price. My husband wants to get one for upstairs as well!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2018

Review Text: I have a german shepherd that sheds like crazy in the spring. It definitely helps keep up on the dog hair. It goes in a random pattern and often goes over the same spot multiple times but it always looks like it is doing a good job. The tray is full every day. I'd say once a week it dies before finding home but whatever I like it. Husband was mad I didnt get the one with mapping technology but I think this does just fine. It is pretty loud so I run it while I am at work.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2020

Review Text: Literally the worst thing ever. Constantly gets lost, stuck, etc. Spends all day bee-lining to the same corners and furniture it gets stuck on every day. Goes into a corner and keeps trying the 3 directions that won't get it out and skipping the fourth (the way it came in). To paint you a picture, it will enter "corner" in the house where 3 sides are blocked by walls, furniture, whatever. It will spin in a circle banging into side 1, 2, 3 attempting to get out and then spins right past the exit and continues to bang into the 3 sides and skip the exit...until it runs out of battery or gives an error. Have given the Roomba two entire months to maybe learn the house or stop being terrible but no chance. Have never disliked a product as much as this one ever. Do not recommend.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2021

Review Text: Oh roomba where have you been all my life? I cannot believe I resisted owning this until I got it for Christmas. What the hell was wrong with me? Good news! I’ve been redeemed! Roomba (we named him Microwave, don’t ask) has literally changed my life. Pick crap off floor, let my friend run around cleaning while I sleep. EVERYONE NEEDS THIS IN THEIR Life. Don’t wait!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2021

Review Text: This machine really gets the job done, it even suctioned a chicken nugget that a toddler left on the floor, it cleans up lots of dust and hair.Cons: it repeats in the same area for too long in circles, and when press to go back to base make sure the base is pressed up against the wall or it’ll turn circles trying to connect.All & All a great purchase!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2021

Review Text: Bought this to help keep up with day to day cleaning on the first floor of our house. I love it! I truly hate sweeping and vacuuming and this little sucker does it for me pretty darn efficiently. It is louder than I expected but I don’t really care because it saves me a lot of hassle. I love that you can program it to run at specific times and it seems like it knows the floor plan better each time it vacuums. We have a rug that has very long fibers but it can’t get on to it so I don’t have to worry about it ruining the rug. We don’t have a pet so I don’t know how well it would do with hair but so far, we love it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2021

Review Text: This is the 2nd Roomba in 12 months.  Will not align to docking station properly...cannot get a charge
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2020

Review Text: Iroomba is a good concept but these lower end models have no proper programming, so it goes around randomly, misses lot of spots and goes over same spots too many times for no reason. there is no pattern or tracking of where it already vacuumed. So it wastes lot of electricity. Cannot recognize things on the floor, so it may suck up and get stuck with small items that are on the floor. The latest models seems to have a better organized pattern of cleaning and maybe better but are super expensive
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020

Review Text: I've been a diehard Roomba fan for years and was excited to get this latest model in the fall of 2019. Much to my dismay, however, this model is a definite step back from the one we previously owned. Here's how:1) The "plug in" option to recharge has been removed, meaning that your only option is the contact charger, which is  quite touchy if your floor is not *perfectly* level. We often have to spend 5+ minutes getting the charger to sit right. The auto-dock feature will frequently move the charger itself as it tries to dock, meaning that using it generally just means that the Roomba confusedly pushes around the dock for ten minutes before giving up.2) The "Max" feature, which allowed Roomba to clean a room until the battery wore out, has been removed, meaning that frequently Roomba will half-clean a room and then turn off, necessitating multiple manual restarts.  This is super inconvenient if, like us, you like to set Roomba in a large room before you go to bed.3) The wireless features (which are very basic) drain battery, meaning that you can go from a full battery to a dead battery in the course of day unless it is docked (which, see #1, is frequently difficult to do.)4) The audio cues are loud and persistent (they've woken up our sleeping children, even when they're in different rooms) and they can't be turned off.It cleans well. I love the modular repair options. However, we'll probably look at different company the next time we need a robotic vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2019

Review Text: The Roomba is a little noisy but I can live with that.  I have new waterproof vinyl flooring in the whole house so it picks up cat hairs very well (I have 4 cats) and goes over the rugs easily.  It has a tendency to stick to the same area sometimes unless I pick it up and put it in another room.  I must confess that I have a lot of cat toys all over the place so that may be why it gets stuck in one area.  It still has trouble finding the dock.  On the upside I think once I use it more often I will get used to it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2019

Review Text: Not worth the money nor time. Takes twice as long to clean as my Dyson, keeps going over the same area, missing other that need to be cleaned, and gets stuck going from hardwood to carpet. Don't waste your time or money on iRobot!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2020

Review Text: I can’t judge the suction power or how well it cleans because in a week of us the thing hasn’t made it past 10 minutes of a job without getting stuck under furniture.This is my third Roomba, and it’s the WORST!My others never got stuck. This thing gets even near a piece of furniture and seems to shove itself under.The app is great... for telling me that it failed to clean and is just sitting there spinning it’s wheels figurative and literally.I’ll try a bit more but I’m leaving towards returning this useless thing.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019

Review Text: I’ve always thought about buying a roomba but always talked myself out of it because of the price. But in cyber Monday I decided to buy it and it was a great choice. I have a black that sheds so much. My carpets are lighter because of all of the fur it’s picked up. Sometimes it has a little trouble making it back to the docking station but in the grand scheme of things it was a great purchase.UPDATE: after a week I had trouble with the roomba charging while on its home dock. I readjusted the roomba to make sure it was seated correctly, cleaned the charging ports, unplugged it and plugged it back in, took the front wheel out and cleaned the wheel housing and none of those options worked. I used the app to factory reset it and it reconnected again and started to charge. If this continues to be a problem I might take a star or two off.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019

Review Text: We really like our Roomba as it does the intermediate spot treatment throughout the week when we don't have time to clean up dog and cat hair.Our biggest problem with Roomba after having it for a year now is returning to the home base after a job. We have the base in a very accessible spot and for some reason it either takes 20+ tries to take the 2-foot path home or it runs out of battery while this attempt goes on. Even when the Roomba makes it back to the dock, it seems that the pins under the Roomba do not align well with the dock and the Roomba will back up and start the docking process all over again. The pads on both ends are clean and the surface is level so not sure what that is about.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2020

Review Text: I think or I thought this was a great idea when I entertained the idea of buying the unit due to the Black Friday price drop. I mean a robot vacuum going around sweeping, who wouldn't like that? The vacuum works, just let the machine run around a few minutes and you will have debris in he catch tray, vacuums pretty good.  Problem is, you will be getting your broom out and sweeping certain areas anyway because of the missed debris. The spinning brush probably knocks debris out of the way a quarter of the time instead of guiding it to the suction part underneath.  If you have long hair, the spinning brush will only last as long as it takes to make contact with 1 or 2 long hairs before it is rendered immobile, the hair will be wrapped around the brush head. I cannot say this is a smart device either, for it has a hard time finding the charge base home before it has no battery life left. I used this unit largely in a wide open space too, it appears that it has to fumble around the room until it makes direct contact with the charger sensor in order for it to go home, used where you have attached open rooms may not be the best bet for this machine. I could see it working decent in a single large room. Otherwise, you have to buy the boundary devices to keep the unit in a certain area. I foresee an old fashion, upright vacuum in my nearby future......
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2018

Review Text: I was pretty afraid to spend nearly 300 on one of these, but so far so good! It actually picks up pretty well. I have 3 cats and 2 are maincoons. So, they are pretty hairy. It really helps keep the hair gone! I recently moved to a smaller house and use my roomba less, but I still love it! When I used it more I had to keep hair out of the wheels and such more, but that's pretty easy tbh. I saw people complain about having to dump the bin a lot, and clean hair off the wheels. I thought that was dumb. You have to take care of things if you want them to keep working? And for 290 something I'm def taking care of it lol Anyway, it's not one that maps your house, and goes in a specific pattern each time. It figures your house out some tho for sure. Its pretty spuratic when it cleans, but it certainly gets the job done! It's pretty smart too. It goes back to its home pretty well. It knows to slow when it bumps into things. I named mine Debs too. Kind of cool you can name it. Oh, I will say since I've moved I cant seem to get it to hook to my wifi. Idk if it's my wifi or the roomba. Or I just suck and cant figure it out lol I'm sure it's some easy fix tho. I dont set mine to a schedule so it's ok for now, but I do like using the app to stop and start it. All around I think it's great. I love my Debs. Ive had her a couple of months now and I hope she last me a while!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2019

Review Text: I have had the Roomba for just over a year (Nov 2019) and the little spinning brush on the side has failed. The screw which holds that spinning brush is so small that it has very little thread engagement to hold it on the vacuum. The plastic threads in the bottom of the vacuum have stripped. Also we lost one of the screws that holds the bottom cover on to the vacuum as well. I cant recommend buying a Roomba as its not worth the money for the length of time I have had it and its now broken.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021

Review Text: We have a large dog (Rottweiler). His hair is always everywhere. This machine does not go in straight lines back and forth, but it sure makes my job easier. My husband doesnt like it because it has its own algorithm. However, moms and busy women. If you just let it do its thing its great.I dont like to watch it clean because I'm more organized in cleaning. However, it is very rewarding to empty its container and see it results. Also, it may take a fewminutes to get unstuck. Just let it figure it out. It figures out where the chair legs are and such.What a great little helper.P.s. my cat hates the roomba. Beware of cat attacks.

Review Text: I got the roomba because I have a husky and it's so hard to keep up with all her shedding. Running the roomba once a day is a perfect solution to all the dog hair everywhere! Not just the hair but the dirt that we all bring in throughout the day, the roomba picks it right up! The only problem is it doesn't have a set path like some robot vacuums where they map out the room and get every spot, THIS DOES NOT. So if thats what your looking for this model is not for you!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020

Review Text: Congratulations I Robot.  I was skeptical about this kind of vaccum cleaners, but after a month of using it,  I have to accept that  the Roomba 675 does a pretty good job in our home.I was looking for a budget robot vaccum to clean our tiling. and my decision criteria was price, durability, suction power and access to supplies and parts.  I finally decided for the Roomba because  it met all my requirements.  Maybe I could find  a more stylish and quieter robot vaccum and with more suction power but so far this model has enough suction  power for our type of floor  as I can see the difference in the floor when it finishes.Even though this model moves around the house in a somewhat chaotic pattern it sure does manage to cover the whole area and it is obviousely not perfect  because there are some spots that it can not reach because of its size or obstacles in its way
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2021

Review Text: No bias reviews here.I bought this for my elderly parents who haven't vacuumed in months. The first time we used it, it kicked up a lot of dust you could smell it in the air. They have a reasonably sized home 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, 2 car garage, and a basement.The living room gets heavy traffic and after wandering around that room it was almost full of mainly dust balls and hair. I could have let it fill up a little more, but I emptied it. After that it vacuumed the kitchen, foyer and family room(which gets minimal use). The bin was only about half empty after doing these rooms. It preformed all this in under an hour.After using it a second time, there was not a dust smell in the air, and not much dirt in the bin. My parents were very happy with this gift. I would do a manual vacuum every now and then, but you could definitely get by with this for a while. It has great range of motion but wanders in a wall to wall motion. Outlining whatever gets in its path, but  will get to troubled spots eventually. It really does good at going along the edge of something and vacuuming. I have not used the scheduled feature or cycle. I have only used the app to start and dock it. Good so far.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019

Review Text: Just recieved my Roomba today, and I am obsessed! We have 2 dogs, one a lab that sheds nonstop, I can literally sweep and mop and you cant tell I lifted a finger the bext day. I was ready to get rid of my dogs!!!No more obsessively sweeping the floor when no one is looking, and every morning sweeping beforeI put my yoga mat down on the wood floor! My feet feel so clean....best purchase I have EVER made so far, glides smoothly over floors and moves up out of our quiet room, I was worried it would not cause there is a half i ch difference. So happy with this purchase!

Review Text: I compared products, before purchasing the Roomba 675 robotic vacuum.  This one had a 4 1/2 star rating.  I was excited to get it.  Charged it up and it ran the next day.  There was no logic as to the directions it would go.  One of the little brush arms broke the first time I used it.  It didn't go to all the rooms but continued going to the same ones over and over.  It couldn't find its way back to the charging station without help from me.  Very disappointed.

Review Text: This was my second robotic vacuum and when I saw it on sale I wanted to give the Roomba a try. My first one was the ILife. I liked the Roomba's cleaning capabilities and some of the features on the app controller. What made me return this vacuum was that it is very loud and I really could send it back to it's charging station from the app or even control its movements. It was also quite tall compared to some other models, which required me to add some furniture lifts so the vacuum can go under. It's a great robotic vacuum, but I wanted a slimmer and quieter one. I'd still recommend this.

Review Text: I bought this item and immediately thought my vacuuming days were over. I was elated to finally rid myself of my least favorite chore. The Roomba connected to my WiFi easily and the app is very simple to navigate. I even set it up to connect to my echo dot. My disappointment started as soon as I said, “Alexa, start the Roomba.” From there, dreams were crushed. I watched in dismay as the Roomba spent 40 minutes cleaning the same 200 ft space. And by cleaning, I mean it kicked around dirt for 40 minutes. I cleaned the filter(it wasn’t very full) and set the vacuum outside of it’s favorite square space of my living room. Then watched it fumble around and do the same for another 30 minutes. I do not recommend this product. Do what I did not, take your money and buy a Dyson. Yes you may have to vacuum still but at least your home will be clean.

Review Text: I LOVE this vacuum. I named her. I turn her on. She goes to work and gives me no trouble. I’m so glad I spent the money and bought this Roomba.

Review Text: I am so dissappointed with the suction of the Roomba 675. We have hardwood floors and it will go right over a blade of grass on the floor and not pick it up. The random cleaning pattern messes with my ocd and makes it necessary to run the vacuum longer to allow it time to randomly get the majrity of the area.

Review Text: I had a Roomba years ago and for some reason decided it wasn't my thing.  But after having to wear shoes in my house for 10 years, I decided to try another one.  I LOVE IT.  I don't use the scheduler because yes, you do have to pick stuff up sometimes, but I just set it when I leave for work or put it in a room I'm not using.  I love getting a notification that he's finished and charging.  He went almost 2 hours this morning!  I decided to add a virtual wall too, figured why not.  It's not perfect as it gets stuck and takes a few passes in a room to get everything, but it beats having dirty floors.

Review Text: I have two dogs and one that sheds a decent bit. Cleaning up my home to maintain the dog hairs has been a struggle but it wasn't the reason I purchased it. I got it for my mom as a Christmas gift but she enjoys the "manual" vacuuming process and gave it back. Once I got it I couldn't wait to see how well it'll do the cleaning in corners and picking up my dog's hair. Well, the fact the Roomba was full of dog hair and my floors looked cleaned was impressive. The next day it ran again and picked up some more dog hairs which were less than the day before. To me, this is amazing as now I have the feeling that I can keep up with the shedding without the worry or work of maintaining. Oh, by the way, it cleaned my rug super well too. Didn't have any issue going from laminate to rug and back.

Review Text: Keeps going over the same area.  Doesn't pick up items the size of cheerios.  Keeps running into the baseboard.  Could not return to base. Just simply not a good product.

Review Text: I was skeptical as to wether or not I would like this and if it really did what it is supposed to, but I have to admit it is pretty neat! It cleans under the beds with ease and roams through the house. It seems to go randomly all over the place but it does pick up the dirt and clean.It didn’t go back to it’s charging station when it ran out of battery, so I am curious to see if this was just an initial start up problem or if this will be a recurring event. But even if so, it cleans great and I’ve already grown attached to this little thing that my daughter named ‘Echo.’I would definitely recommend this to anyone that doesn’t want to be stuck vacuum g all the time. It surely helps me a lot, as I am working. We also have a longer haired cat and hardwood floors with carpets. It cleans them all without ease. I just love to see all those dust bunnies and hair disappear.

Review Text: The Roomba is awesome . It actually does what it says it can do.  I set it for 3 a.m. and I wake up to a house without dust and dirt.  I even run it during the afternoon being I have three small children making messes constantly.  As for the suction power, I would have to say it's almost too good (when you keep the bin free of all the dirt it picked up) because it vacuums stuff that it has no business vacuuming and then gets jammed.  I don't see this as a malfunction but rather how aggressive the Roomba is when it comes to cleaning.  I'm very impressed with it.  My wife won't admit but she loves it too.

Review Text: I don’t have pets but have 3 daughters with long hair and i used to busy in vacuuming all the time.Recently got “IRobot Roomba”. It has excellent suction power, specially for hair as compared to other same priced robot vacuum brands.I recently got a one of another famous brand on black friday but that had zero suction power for human hair, i just returned it  within 2-3 days and got IRobot Roomba on cyber monday. Review Text: This was a my favorite Christmas gift.  My husband bought it for me, but was hesitant.  It was easy to set up and we did so right after I opened it.Within 2 hours the Roomba was charged and cleaning our first floor.  My husband became a believer after its first run. We have 2 cats and it does a great job cleaning up the hair.  Our hardwood and carpets never looked so clean!We are going to get a second one this way we don’t need to keep bringing the unit and base up and down (not like it’s that much of an inconvenience)!It gets stuck every now and again and gets lost on its way to home base on occasion.  But it does a great job.  If you were on the fence, purchase one!

Review Text: Upset because the sweeper does not stop for invisible walls. I had a shark and it was much cheaper and came with strips to put down to not let the roomba into certain areas. For example I have an open concept so I don’t want the roomba to go in my kitchen because it gets caught on rugs. Suction power seems good so far just upset about the lack of strip stoppers.

Review Text: I was hesitant for year. literally years, to buying a robot vac. I have a Siberian husky and reviews for how these things handle dog hair and pet dander is mixed. BUT wow, I bought this vac on a Black Friday/cyber Monday deal and I am very pleased. I will add that my house is all tile with the only rugs being some floor and door rugs. I also have an open floor plan. im thinking these things contribute to its success. either way, I def recommend trying this vac in your home. I do not give my reviews lightly or frequently.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   I absolutely love my iRobot!  I used to think I kept a pretty clean home.  I run him every other day and he amazes me by finding tons of dirt and hair I had no idea was there!  I’m very happy with my purchase.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020

Review Text: I had a house cleaner, every 2 weeks —- but with three dogs, I really need to vacuum every day. Now, I schedule my Roomba, and it makes all the difference. Yes, it misses a few places... But it can also get all the way under the beds, and some other places that I could never reach. I love this little robot, even named her Hazel!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020

Review Text: Where to start? I shed a lot of hair (long, thick) and it has always been a problem. Having guests over was such a pain sometimes just because of all the floor cleaning I had to do to get rid of hair.To make it short, this is no longer an issue. Crumbs on the kitchen floor are no longer an issue. Dusty corners are no longer an issue. I use it 3-4x a week on tile and carpet, and may I just say, dreams do come true.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2020

Review Text: This thing isn’t for you if you want to use it in your kitchen and have an island or kitchen table. This is only good for wide open spaces with no furniture. Don’t get me wrong, it cleans well, but it’s not very smart. It gets stuck easily and takes forever to make its way back to the docking station. It’s one of the most expensive, mostly useless purchases I’ve ever made.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020

Review Text: The programming is stupid. I am a programmer, I can tell what they intended when writing some of the cleaning-pattern algorithms for this robot, and some of them are clearly lacking, in ways that should have been fixed for this price tag.Additionally, iRobot always promotes how their vacuums use smart mapping.... you have to pay hundreds more for those features. The "lower end" vacuums, like this one, just bounce around at random angles like a pinball, and you just have to hope it's lucky enough to cover most of the floor eventually. And it rarely finds its way back to the charger without help.It's also loud on our hard floors.Disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020

Review Text: Vacuum is our 2nd Robot vacuum.  1st was cheap and too simple.  This item has unique!  Works fine most of the time.  But seems to want to nap more than expected.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2021

Review Text: Molly and I are getting along nicely.  I do not have any carpet and she seems to be cleaning up a lot of stuff from the floors.  We work together pretty well.  I do have a problem keeping her in a room until she is done.  She tends to want to go from room to room in a willy-nilly manner and I have to get her back on track.  The first time I used her I only cleaned the dust bin at the end.  This time I cleaned it in the middle of cleaning and again at the end and I think she did a better job.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019

Review Text: Her name is Lady Diedre and she was delivered from the heavens. I just moved into a new apartment that has a lot of square footage and I have all the cleaning acumen of a famished piglet. I send her on her journey every few days and let her do the dirty. I'm blown away by how perfectly she makes me appear like an adult who has her life together! She's like a live-in lady maid and I love her like one. Could not recommend more. Please note- I do not have a pet and I chose short rugs for the sake of easier cleaning.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021

Review Text: Not a terrible product, I won’t lie; I may or may not have sat in my underwear for two hours watching it once I first purchased it.During those two hours, I watched a mindless droid slam into the same door at at least twenty times until I finally had enough. (Also my wife may or may not have finally opened said door pleading to end the poor things suffering.)I will say it did some heavy-duty cleaning, but that may be the only pro to this sad little guy. I have about five or six different rooms for it to clean, and to watch him suffer for two hours in the same one did it in for me. I returned him the following day.If you have a small studio apartment, he’s the man of your dreams. Other than that, invest in something that has mapping technology, very much worth the price.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020

Review Text: I'm not so sure about this particular one. I must have got a dumb one. It's constantly getting stuck on a cliff, which is actually a chair leg. It'll go over one of my rugs but won't go over another one which is the same in a different color.Maybe it's jusy WiFi connection but when I dock it it spins around aimlessly for minutes before it attempts to dock which takes it several attempts.I'd probably go for one that has more brainpower/features.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020

Review Text: Dang this thing is great. We don't run it on a regular schedule or anything - with 4 preschool kids in the house there's no telling when the floor will be picked up enough to let it really do its job. But we basically never use a regular vacuum cleaner any more. We just empty the bin and push the button on this thing and go to bed. We lay a rolled up towel across the hallway to keep it from bonking into the bedroom doors - that's our low-tech and completely free "virtual wall". Works just fine. If our hallway were hard floors, it would possibly just push the towel out of the way.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019

Review Text: First of all, the good things: It cleans quite well and doesn't get hung up on the fringe of rugs like a different brand used to do.  Also, the app is useful for scheduling cleaning times.  However...1.  I really wish there were some way to steer the unit from the app: a simple set of directional arrows could do the trick, and2.  It cannot seem to locate the charging station, even if it is within three open feet of it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020

Review Text: I waited a couple of months because I wanted to try it out fairly, and just not a fan.  I like that it picks up what even human housekeepers miss, but the charging process is far too unreliable.  It goes back to dock, and ostensibly charges, however, any little thing bumps it ever so slightly and it stops charging without warning.  Go to use it next time and the battery is dead.  Looking at a return.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2021

Review Text: Yes this thing will drive you crazy if you watch it run!  There is no rhyme or reason for it’s scattered pattern, or lack of.  However, it cleans and that is all that matters!  I have a dog and it gets all of her small hair along with all of my long hair.  I have an older home with the original hard wood floors and it does an amazing job.  Before I had to sweep, then dust, then clean with a cleaner.  This does it all.  I only have to put a cleaner on it once a month.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020

Review Text: I loved that I can schedule and have this run daily at a convenient time for our household!  It does a great job keeping dust, dirt and dog hair off the floor.  Always amazed at the amount of debris it picks up when we don't see stuff!  So when it's time to mop, the work is must easier!  Would certainly buy again!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2021

Review Text: I LOVE EVERYTHING about this Robot!!!  We have had her almost 6 months now.  We use it every other day throughout a 1300 sf house of hardwood floors, a severely shedding Rottweiler (yes he’s on allergy shots, now) and crazy clutter.  I run through pick up cords and small toys, and she never gets stuck.  I DO have to ‘push pause and empty small chamber’ every 10-15 minutes, but the amount of time that she has given me to start and complete other tasks is TRULY A BLESSING.  We should’ve bought her YEARS ago!!!
