Review Text: The vacuum doesn’t work well with pet hair and spends more time crash into corners than going to vacuum. The app also doesn’t send it home when directed to do so. I use the app to set a timer to clean and it continues to clean after regardless. Definitely a let down compared to all the reviews and the description.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021

Review Text: well it worked wonderfully since i bought it but now that i got a rug with dark squares on it, it wont go over it for some reason. I have to manually clean parts of the floor now so this little guy has become kinda useless unfortunately.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020

Review Text: We love the roomba family. This is our third and the firs "smart" roomba.  I really like the brushes on this compared to the solid materials of the other Roombas. The brushes seem to do a better job and replicate what a real vacuum would do.  I also like that I can control it from my phone. We have it scheduled, but it is nice to turn it off from your phone when you are on a Zoom call.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020

Review Text: This vacuum got stuck between the wall and chair leg and continued to run and wore o whole in my carpet. I would expect a more smarter design. It can't seem to find it's way out of a corner. Before use I have to move furniture around so it dont get stuck.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020

Review Text: This little robot has actually saved my sanity. I’m a full time college student, with 2 full time jobs and a long hair Great Dane lab mix, and a Maine coon cat. My living space has always been filled up with hair and dust! With little time to really take care of sweeping every single day, this thing has given me clean floors and less of a headache. Is it perfect? No. I wasn’t expecting a perfect solution, but I did expect some help doing a task a hardly have time for, and to say it has exceeded my expectations would be an understatement. I always read reviews before I buy things and I think some people have this idea that this thing is going to clean for them the way a hired person would and it won’t. But it will help. I would recommend this a few times over.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2021

Review Text: I run my Roomba every day. I have a young golden retriever so it is very helpful for picking up loose hair on my white ceramic floor. It definitely picks up a ton of hair that I don’t even see - I know because I empty the bin everyday.My only complaints are that it is extremely loud and it is super annoying if it happens to find a cord.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2021

Review Text: “Heather” does rather well at picking up dirt and hair but she has the hardest time rolling into the kitchen. We have two raised dividers that lead into the kitchen; one of the dividers completely immobilizes her 98% of the time. It’s the weirdest thing tho bc both barriers are the same height but she only manages to get stuck on one of them. Besides that she loves to lock herself in the laundry room and chase the cat around. Maintenance parts are rather expensive, so factor that in before you decide to buy.Skip over this model and buy a robovac with smart mapping. Shark IQ is priced comparatively and works far better.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2020

Review Text: I purchased this Roomba after seeing a neighbors house who had it.  As I am finding out, there are "smart" Roombas and there are "stupid" Roombas.I purchased this 600 series.  My wife and I have a 1300 square foot condo, and thought this would be sufficient.  After using it for a month, I wanted to write a review and tell you what I think.  The idea of the Roomba is great, and apparently if you buy the "high end" ones at 6-$700 they do what you need.  I can't see spending that kind of money on a vacuum on a for a small condo.The issues I am finding:1)  This is a "Stupid" Roomba.  It does not map the floor plan of your house.  It just goes in whatever direction and cleans.  It will wander into a room, clean a little, and wander in to another room.  The higher end units you can map the house, and also pick the rooms you want to clean.  This just does what it wants with no rhyme or reason.  To sold this, I put it into one room and close the door.  After about 15 minutes  I move it to the next room and close the door.  For a $249.00 Vacuum cleaner, I expect more.2)  It often dies in the middle of the house.  Rather than finding it's way back home after it has run it's own course, it often dies somewhere and does not go back to recharge as it should.3)  While the cleaning works, and it does a relatively good job, there are always objects it has missed.  Again this is the haphazard way it cleans.  The higher end have a row by row capability.  This should be on all Roomba's, no matter what the price.4)  App is inadequate.  Being "Stupid"  again, you can't change much on the App.  I turned it off for a day here and there, yet it still ran.  I had it set for 2 pm each day.  All of a sudden it is running at 12 noon.  The App still says 2pm, but it has a mind of it's own.  You can't change the time on the App, and you can't pick a room as your only choice is "Everywhere"5) Get the model with self dumping.  Unless your memory is real good, it is a pain to have to dump the waste bin every day.Overall, I did not expect this to be such a low end product for the price paid.  Would I buy it again?  Probably not.  I can get a good Hoover for $100.00 and I refuse to pay $600 for what is probably a good quality clean.Jim H
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2021

Review Text: I purchased the IRobot because I wanted something to pick up dog hair.  I have 3 Poms who shed continuously so I vacuum every single day.  I thought the IRobot would help with that chore because I have to cut hair off the roller everytime I use my Shark.  After the first use, the roller of the IRobot was full of hair and the small filter box needed cleaning.  The little whirling brush had hair rolled up in it that was twisted so I cleaned it.  It took about 25 minutes to cut hair out of the roller, empty the filter, cut hair off the rollers and the little whirling brush.  My Shark vacuum took less time to just cut hair off brush.  The IRobot is great if you don't have pets.  It was programmed to vacuum every morning at 9 a.m. and it gets under a chair and goes around and around until you move it.  Great idea, but product needs for perfecting before I buy another one.  Needless to say, I returned it.  I'll just keep cutting hair off the roller of my Shark vacuum until someone comes out with a real vacuum for dog hair!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019

Review Text: I was VERY hesitant about purchasing this product when I initially made the decision to order. I dug around online, checked out videos, read every review I could find. Finally, I decided to go ahead with the purchase after having assured myself that if I wasn’t completely charmed, I’d return it. I was both delighted and surprised to see this thing get to work. I have a household that needs LOTS of vacuuming: two cats, and three people with long, luscious locks. We run Major Tobo (as we have lovingly named our faithful assistant) once a day, and are consistently impressed with the amount of hair and dust that come up. Having the roomba has SIGNIFICANTLY decreased the number of times we need to pull out our Dyson. One half of our home is hardwood, and the other half is carpet- Major Tobo cleans both with ease. The dust bin is very easy to clean out, and we usually have to pull hair out from the bristles, but that’s the case with any vacuum at our house. The roomba genuinely leaves our house looking clean- we can turn it on for a session before having company over and rely on it to have the place looking good when they get here. We’ve had it for just about four months now and the only problem we’ve run into has been it’s habit of getting stuck on the fringe of our carpet, at which point I get a helpful alert to my iRobot app to inform me that Major Tobo is stuck and needs my help. Our cats (one of whom is an anxious boi) do not take rides on the roomba, but they remain unperturbed when Major Tobo is making it’s rounds. Very happy with this purchase, I’d recommended this product to anyone who has a busy schedule and likes to keep a tidy home.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2020

Review Text: There are a lot of similar choices now that the patent expired, but after very careful consideration I chose a Roomba. Why? First, it was on sale for $199. But other than that, my  thinking is that other, newer manufacturers simply cannot beat the experience iRobot has amassed since they invented these things long ago. All the little bits and pieces of feedback they received over the years I believe has made the Roomba machine a solid choice. For example, I was reading reviews for another brand that made clear a common failure was the rubber seal around the filter kept breaking and people had to spend another $9 or so to buy a replacment part, which the manufacturer happily sold you. I believe iRobot fixed all the little fails over the years and the result is a more reliable product. I have owned 3 previous Roombas and I watched each model add little features that addressed preformance and reliability issues.  The fact this model looks only slightly changed from the last one I bought 9 years ago tells me they have perfected it. With other manufacturers, they are still in the learning process and you are the Guinea Pig. Also, I have always received good, if not excellent, customer service from iRobot, which may not be the case, according to customer reviews, with some of the newer manufactuers.  Obviously, the lower prices of newer brands is tempting, and you could say having to spend extra for replacement parts still costs less than a Roomba, and you don't mind the downtime, and the difficulties dealing with their customer service. But, I buy vacuum robots for the convenience and I place a value on reliability and customer service , so I chose to go with the brand I have always had a good experience with and it's worth it to me.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020

Review Text: This is great for picking up hair and dust. I’m not sure where it is constantly picking up dust from but it is never empty and it’s frequently full of dust in our pet free home. It picks up a ton of those long women’s hairs. We run it 7 days a week on a schedule and it goes for like an hour. It gets stuck on an object like string or a clothing item like once a week. It sometimes doesn’t get in the charger right and won’t charge.  It’s otherwise good for maintenance cleaning. I’d still do a vacuum once a month in a pet free home.My big complaint is that the vacuum bin fills easier than an older model we have for another floor.  It’s almost half the dust capacity so it fills after 2-3 days instead of once a week.  It vacuums like 900 square feet per day.The WiFi feature is cool, the app gives you messages but they’re frequently not correct. It loves to say it’s stuck on a cliff when it has tangled in a children’s toy.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019

Review Text: So what did I, a little old lady from Iowa, know about robots.  I know vacuum cleaners but I leave robots to my grand sons.  What was I expecting?  I had visions of sitting in my recliner with a remote control like the kids use to run their cars, trucks, even airplanes and drones.  I named my Roomba IT and yes it does resemble something out of a Stephen King novel, at least that’s what my dogs think.  IT doesn’t scare the dogs as much as a regular vacuum does.  IT is a lot quieter.  I was kind of disappointed at first until I figured out the best use of IT.  I already knew I had too much furniture and too much stuff around and I quickly learned to clear out spaces and create barriers where I want to clean.  I take it to the bedroom and move stuff off the floor, then close the door and let IT run.IT’s favorite room is the kitchen breakfast room.  IT happily runs across the floor and does an amazing job of getting under the edges of the cabinets.  In part of the living area I use a swiffer with  a long handle to keep IT on the path I choose.  We work pretty well as a team.  The good thing is that even picking IT up and herding it around my back doesn’t hurt at all afterwards like it wouldIf I pushed the big vacuum around.  So I’m still disappointed that it doesn’t have a remote controller, but it does pick up lots of dust and dog hair.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2021

Review Text: Purchased this item for my yoga studio.  There couldn't be an easier cleaning layout.  A 900 sq ft empty rectangle with a low pile commercial type carpet and no obstructions.  Two minutes into it's first clean up it stopped and sent an ERROR 10 message to my phone (right wheel obstruction).  I went thru the trouble shooting protocol and there were no blockages or obstructions.  Two minutes in..stopped again..same ERROR code.  After several attempts called customer support and they agreed there must be something wrong with the wheel sensor and they sent me a new wheel assembly.  Two days later I install the new wheel according to video, easily installed no problem...except for two minutes in ERROR 10..then again two minutes after that.  Contacted customer support and they agreed to send me a new unit altogether.Packaged up the old unit...set up the new unit..two minutes in...ERROR code 10...right wheel obstruction.  Again..no obstructions just defective equipment...after a week of wasted time and effort I returned this unit and opted for a refund and a purchase from another manufacturer.  Waiting on the new unit now and hoping for the best.Just received my alternate purchase...ECOVACS N79S... comparable feature wise to the Roomba 675... cost $100. Less and get this... IT WORKS!!Thank you Roomba for guiding me towards a better product.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019

Review Text: Love this Roomba! Took me a while to decide to get this, so when it was on sale, I jumped in. It does what it says - vacuum. I don't have time during the day to vacuum and on weekends I do other things so the last thing I want to do is vacuum the whole house. It takes 'Robbie', yes, I named him, 90 minutes to do a estimated 1100 sq. ft., not counting the bedrooms or bathrooms. Hallways, family room, kitchen, and dining area is what I need for him to concentrate on, as I have 2 little dogs - pom and shitzu mix - so their furry balls need sweeping up. Toys and cords need to be out of the way and dining chairs pulled out to give Robbie space to do his thing and my floors are clean.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020

Review Text: So torn. I might have some buyers remorse on this one, wishing I had tried out one of the offbrand that had more features.  It is much more expensive with less features, and lately the off brands have come a long way and are highly rated.Efficiency: This thing will drive you nuts if you watch it bc it will go in a million different directions and not towards the crumbs you are staring at. Will it eventually get those crumbs? Maybe. Probably? In an hour by chance? Wish I could have bought 3 different models and tried them out but alas—it’s mine now, so DJ Roomba is here to stay. It is MUCH louder than I anticipated so I run it when gone. I like that it works with google. It rarely finds the dock, but I knew ahead of time that my docking station would lend to that (under a desk in a corner, out of eye site). I’m ok with that.Use: One reviewer nailed it by telling us: deep clean floors first. Then introduce the roomba daily for maintenance. I like this plan. There IS ALWAYS dust/hair in the bin even with daily use of this guy. And we have no pets and keep a clean house! How did I live with that prior to DJ Roomba in da house?! I can’t go back now!Ps - it went on Black Friday sale a week after I bought it. But Amazon is so great, they honored the difference and sent me a refund for that part.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2021

Review Text: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT!  I have toddlers and I feel like I spend a ton of time vacuuming the house.  This little ROOMBA is so awesome!  I am so happy with the purchase.  I was going through reviews for the newer models and decided to go with this model and I am super happy I did!  One of the greatest purchases I have made so far this year.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019

Review Text: The little vac that could!  Just started using it but its zips around our house and we're amazed at how much stuff it picks up! With country living and 2 cowboys and a dog who all go in and out of the house  a million times a day every day, our house is almost NEVER clean.....until now!  That little hum is the sound of freedom! Pretty remarkable how it works around obstacles. I get so much joy dumping the dirt trap and amazed at how much dirt/hair is in there EVERY time! Wish I'd had it for the past 25 years! Were so happy with Katie, who is named after my obsessively clean grandmother.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2018

Review Text: I am SO EXCITED to have this little robot to help me clean!! It was easy to set up and it started cleaning right out of the box.  I love how it cleans wood floors, but also switches to being able to clean the pet hair from my area rug seamlessly.  SUCH A NEAT CONCEPT and very well-done/made!!I also like supporting the original robot vacuum company, which is designed in the U.S. also (and has been around for at least 15 years, when my brother bought one back in the day).  Prefer to support them vs. Chinese competitors.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020

Review Text: I just got this due to our new house is nothing but hardwood floors and tile. It always looks dirty even after cleaning, the Roomba 675 was a blessing. the house is looking great without too much fuss. But, this model is constantly bumping into things and has weird cleaning patterns. It also may or may not clean all the bedrooms if the door is open. It is also kind loud. You can still talk next to it, but you will have to raise your voice a bit. So, my next Roomba purchase will be at least the 900 series or the e series with intelligent mapping like my Braava Jet M6. Which I absolutely love and will clean all the rooms. I give this 4 stars just because it seems to wander around the house and clean instead of actually cleaning like i do. The floors look great, but it may miss some things.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019

Review Text: This is my first review of anything I purchased this room a a few months ago because I have hardwood floors and a cat. The fur seemed to always be everywhere and I spent my weekends sweeping. Long story short I love this product great value for the money. I decided to purchase a second one because I have two levels and while you can bring it upstairs and downstairs I decided I would just get one for each floor. The first one I got was rather loud but I noticed that the second one I got is much more quite. They are the exact same product I find this very interesting! I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants a robot vacuum it does not want to spend a lot of money!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2018

Review Text: I find it simply FANTASTIC. I'm working from home during COVID-19, and watching this thing do all the work for me :)))  It cleans really well. Yes, it might need to do a few rounds, but overall, it goes all over the place, it circles the chairs and furniture and cleans all the edges; in other words, it's not that the Robot just hits something and turns back; it really 'makes an effort' to follow the edges and clean thoroughly. I love this thing!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2020

Review Text: This is the best product I have ever used for vacuuming. You can set up a vacuuming schedule it tells you via message on your phone if there is an issue. Best part is that we really don't have to spend time vacuuming up dog hair. We have a shih tzu and she sheds, Young Mi (We named our Roomba after the Korean girls Olympic curling team) cleans up all the dog hair, we have her scheduled to vacuum 4 times per week. This product saves time, a great value. I would recommend to anyone.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019

Review Text: This is a very NOISY vacuum!Forget about talking, watching tv or doing anything around the vacuum when it is at work!I have tile floors and it does a pretty good job cleaning up the hair from our cat. It takes a long time for it to clean, I probably would not recommend this if you don’t have a pet, you can vacuum your house better and much faster!It is a life saver because we have an animal that sheds hair crazy and the house needs vacuuming everyday!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 5, 2020

Review Text: The vacuum seemed to just spend all its time in one area. I vacuumed my whole house with my cordless vacuum in the time it took the roomba to do one area. It just kept going back and forth to the same area over. And over. And over again. Don't know what all the hype is about the roombas. Also, left a couple of clumps of dog fur on an area rug and did not do corners
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019

Review Text: I've used this three times since I received it and I did enjoy having my one bedroom apartment cleaned in the time it takes me to get ready in the morning.  The first two times I used this it worked great, it took about one hour plus to clean then found it's "home."  The third time I used it (yesterday) it was confused and kept telling me to place it elsewhere, which was very frustrating.  This time it miss a few places in my kitchen and it could not find it's home base.  I had to block it to be able to dock home.  So right now I'm not sure if I find this worth the money.  Hopefully next time I run it it'll impress me
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2019

Review Text: Cleans ok, but with how much it gets stuck and randomly stops it's not much better than regular cleaning. It goes around randomly, so it cleans the room it starts in like 3 times, and might make it to other rooms if you're lucky. Gets stuck on everything it can though, on a rug: stuck, on a black rug: stuck, found the power cord for my router: stuck. It really needs an off button. It randomly glitches out, and starts moving around when I don't tell it to.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2020

Review Text: I got my roomba because I was not particularly disciplined about vacuuming. I'm generally pleased with this; I set it to go to work when I go to work, and my floors are much cleaner than they used to be.The annoying thing is that you need to make sure there's nothing on the ground that it will get caught on; it's not like a vacuum cleaner where you it goes where you push it. The roomba goes where it wants to go, and if there are cords on the ground, it'll get caught on them. I've also learned which chairs it can maneuver around, and which i need to move for roomba to clean under.So, it takes a bit of figuring out what it can and can't do, but for the most part, it's set it and forget it (and empty it).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2019

Review Text: This robot vac has made the floors so much cleaner! But understand, it isn't perfect. Rosie, as I call her, gets hung up on things.she seems to wander around aimlessly. Out of 10 cleanings, she has only once completed her job and docked herself. However, she usually doesn't get hung up for an hour or so and gets a lot done before she stops. And my floors are noticeably cleaner. The only thing she won't clean is a mostly black rug, because she thinks it's a staircase. But she has no trouble with other Turkish rugs that have a bit of black in the design. She is great at stopping at the stairs. I usually schedule one cleaning on the main level and then take her to one of the other levels in the morning or evening. Saved me a lot of work--plus, she slips in some places that are hard to get to without moving furniture. Rosie--you are a champ!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2019

Review Text: Overall good robot vacuum. I bought 2 of them so they can clean my floors twice as fast... um not really, I haven't really tried setting up parameters they just go do their thing. The times they clean it's random and they usually end up getting stuck or never find the dock. They do work good picking up my husky hair patches and overall dirt, crumbs etc
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2020

Review Text: Overall it’s a good vacuum. It picks up tons of pet hair and small debris left on the floor.It’s surprisingly loud. Definitely best to run it when your not home. Except, during every cleaning cycle we have some sort of error. Stuck, spinning in circles, hanging off a cliff, it always needs our attention at some point.I wonder if the higher end models have the same issues.If I had to purchase again I would spend a little more money and get a higher end model.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020

Review Text: I have had a lot of Roombas and similar products over the years. This is the worse one. I call it the Dumba. It claims to have a cliff sensor, it doesnt. Mine stops at the edge of the steps 100% of the time. Then, when it hits a solid object, a lot of the time rather than turn, it just keeps spinning its wheels.I would avoid this one
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021

Review Text: I loved my previous Roomba but it was used so much it was getting worn out.  This replacement has even better suction than the previous one and has wifi connection so the app tells me if it gets stuck or otherwise needs attention while out of sight.  If you don’t like vacuuming then this will save you lots of effort and keep you out of trouble with your wife.  You will also be surprised at the amount of stuff this picks up if you have never had one before.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020

Review Text: This little vacuum is amazing and does a great job picking up everything, including dog hair.  My problem is that it picks so much stuff up, I have to stop it halfway through a cycle to empty it.  It really does a great job, but if I were to do this again, I would look at one with the self-emptying feature.  If I didn't have dogs, this particular model would be perfect for me.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020

Review Text: I love that you can put on a schedule on your phone and it just goes to work.  I have it set for 2 days on and 1 day schedule and it cleans so well that I have to clean it out because it's completely full.  (We are are renovating and re-landscaping so we are messy than normal everyday use and have 2 yorkies that are on/out using a doggie door).Only dislike is it's a little louder than I had hope but I can live with it since it works so well!!  Love not sweeping everyday now :)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020

Review Text: I like that the machine is super easy to clean (easy to get the hair and lint/dust out). What I do not like is that the first few runs it scratched my dark furniture. It is learning so it is not hitting the furniture as hard but it still hits the dark furniture which leaves marks. I do notice that on the white baseboards it does not have an issue. It also has good suction power, so good that it pulled a shirt off the hanger on my lower rack. I would recommend that you pick up all the items off the floor (thick mats, slippers), scale, and the toilet paper stand as they confuse the machine.  Overall, I like it and will keep it because the scratches on the furniture are there already and it does a great job of getting up the dust from under the bed. One less thing for me to do!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020

Review Text: Wow!  Did a practice run on the charge it was shipped with.  It ran for a little over an hour.  It didn't make it back to it's base to charge, instead just dying where it was.  We pulled out the cup and it was literally packed with....stuff!  Our hardwoods are raised from the tile in the kitchen and it just goes up the little hill like it's not even there.  Goes up onto the rugs on the hardwood too.  But the rug on the tile has a black border and it won't go over it.  Relatively quiet too.  Just worried it'll die under the couch or bed since it didn't go home and I'll have to find it and I'll have to just place it on the rug with the black border.  Overall though....for it to find that much stuff to pick up in a house that gets maid service,  we're impressed and will probably buy one for upstairs.  Get one!  You'll be glad.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2019

Review Text: When I called the company to request a replacement electrical cord for the 675, I was told they first needed the serial #. I found the serial # on the back of the docking station (which is what the missing cord was for), but they insisted they must have the serial # for the Roomba itself.It was a real pain having to remove the bin in order to locate this number. Not impossible, but so unnecessary. Why couldn't the serial # be located on the back of the machine? Alternatively, why wasn't the serial # of the docking station sufficient to get a replacement for a part that should have been included in the first place?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2020

Review Text: Roomba-quite the ordeal getting it connected to my Samsung 9 phone. Amarey-no connection needed. Extremely easy set up. Liked the way the Roomba came with an extra filter and loved the way the Amarey came with 2 extra sweeper arms and a filter.  Husband was impressed with the way she didn't fall down the stairs. I'm impressed by the "going back home" to recharge and then finish up later.  Very pleased overall. Was hoping my cats would take a ride on her, but they just ignored them!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2018

Review Text: Cleans the whole bottom floor of a 2600 sq foot house in a little over an hour. Docks itself back with about 45% battery life. Goes over carpet and hardwood floors. Does not scratch or mark up walls. The only time it got stuck was when I left a cord on the floor. Works with Alexa, as well as the smartphone app.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2018

Review Text: I have had two myself over the last 20 years for quick pickups. Since it won't get corners of rooms, I use a paper towel with 409 Cleaner for those places.  I have a cannister vacuum for the rest of the house, although I could use this as well.  This was a wedding present, and they love it!  I plan to buy one for all of my grandchildren when they get married as well.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020

Review Text: We love this roomba!  It works great on flat surfaces and on carpet, we were amazed how well it works on carpet.  Prior to the roomba we had another different brand lower end vacuum bot, we we thought worked pretty well, but in fact does not really compare to this Roomba.  Roomba may get stuck once in a while but it does talk to you and turn off if you don’t get to it right away, which I like.  The battery life is pretty good, runs for an hour and a half at least and picks up a good amount of cat hair and dust.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2019

Review Text: This is the 4th Roomba I have owned and it will be the last. It did great for the first year. I took very good care of Moe (that’s what the kids named him). Having owned Roombas previously, I learned that occasionally, you have to remove the bottom plate and clean out the pet hair that gets in all of the cracks and crevices. After taking good care of Moe for a year, he just stopped working. The brushes no longer spin. This happened on an older model we had, as well. It is a very good product concept, but just not well executed,  as the product has a short life span for such a high price.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020

Review Text: Does amazing cleaning up (if it puts itself on the dock properly) finally realize after a night sleep. Battery is still dead, then I’m trying to mess with the robot and the dock to connect properly. I think it’s connected properly because there are no lights saying that it’s charging, then three hours later, the battery is still dead because it hasn’t been charging. Would love a light as it’s charging. The lights when you connect the robot on the doc, they disappear, it isn’t enough.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2021

Review Text: Does exactly what it should do. I have a Great Pyrenees and he sheds like crazy. I run this overnight every day and my house stays clean. Keep in mind you do still need to clean the vacuum out every few days as it does need maintenance but only takes about 5 minutes.  Love this and will be getting another one for upstairs
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021

Review Text: Waste of money and time. I bought this because I traveland ess hotel this would keep dust on floors down... it is completely useless. Not one had this device been able to complete a vacuuming without mr having to pick it up and move it back to the charging cradle. The amount of dust and dirty missed is at least as great as the little bit it picks up. It gets stuck all the time under the sofa, closes itself in the laundry,  and today just ran out of charge after 15 minutes of vacuuming and couldn't make it back to the base either. It's just awful
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2019

Review Text: I've had this Roomba model for a little over a week now and love it. It does a great job on our hardwood, tile, and low-pile rugs. Of course, this model doesn't do mapping of your floor plan, but I've noticed that it still hits most places every day. I also love that it self-docks. To help it focus on the higher-traffic areas (kitchen, dining room, living room), I close the doors to all the other rooms a couple of days a week so it stays in those high-traffic areas for its full cleaning time. Depending on your style of furniture and where cords are located, you might want to to also get some Command cord clips to clip your cords along the baseboards so they are out of the roomba's way. I would recommend being home the first couple of times it runs so you can see what areas might cause obstacles and problems and figure out solutions for those. Overall, it's a great product that does exactly what I wanted for the price I paid for it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020

Review Text: I was very hesitant to make this purchase. I have three Dyson sweepers and they do a good job but I have three cats in the house and a Pom-Chi dog. I sweep every day sometimes twice a day. I wasn’t sure this would be strong enough to pick up the pet hair or go on my carpet. I must say I am so pleasantly surprised! I’ve only had it three days and it takes awhile for it to cover all the floor space I have. But it goes with any hesitation from hard wood flooring over the thresh holds onto the carpet. It gets under my end tables, coffee tables and kitchen table without me having to move them to sweep with the regular vacuum. It has great suction and picks up all the pet hair! I think it might do a better job than my regular vacuum. I turn it on and I’m free to do other chores. I absolutely love it!!! I hope it lasts a long time and continues to perform well.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2020

Review Text: I love it! It is a game changer, especially if you have a dog. Luckily she doesn't shed but we do find occasional hair when she happens to catch her tail. The app is so easy to use and I love the schedule feature. Plus, I love being able to send commands using Google Home. If you have carpet, you'll be amazed by how quiet it is. However, it is loud on hardwood (we have both). It had a hard time finding its dock the first few runs but now it's fine.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2020

Review Text: Have has this for close to a year, worked great when we first got it, new to a mostly hard floor home and not used to all the crumbs my young children leave all around the house. About 6 months in it started having issues docking to charge, now I have to position it just so to charge or it will not charge, even then when I leave it it will get off and not charge at all.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2020

Review Text: A single ROOMBA  is not good for a big house. It may do a good job for small 2 or three bedroom uncluttered house and definitely cant have things laying around. Wires must be kept away. They trap the roomba. It is not as efficient as I expected. It needs to be supervised. It get stuck in a narrow corner easily. It also has a tough time going back to its charging station. Unless it is close. I don't know if I am going to keep it. Got it as a gift.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019

Review Text: Don't know what we did before we got our Roomba! Does an excellent job of collecting all the dog hair our two fur babies drop everywhere. Doesn't scrub the floor, but it sure picks up anything loose that it can get hold of. A great time and energy saver - makes life much easier for the lady of the house.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2021

Review Text: The battery of this product is worse. It couldn't operate longer than an hour after a month of use and it will get stuck on the carpet or dies due to low battery almost every day.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020

Review Text: I love the freedom it gives us.  It is very thorough, way more than our previous vacuum cleaner.  It is quieter and very efficient.  It will go everywhere and fits in lots of places so it can be challenging to keep it where you want it to focus.  It is also small, so does need to be emptied frequently.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2021

Review Text: Really wish I had bought one of these years ago.  It works great.  It does take a bit for the robot to learn your rooms and for you to learn where you want to go or not.  I also purchased the beam that keeps it from falling down the stairs and that has been a great addition.  I have a large house so I really only want bathrooms, kitchen, sitting room, dining room and living room cleaned.  I leave the bedrooms for different times.  You need to learn what the robot can or cannot get over and then pick that up as an obstacle. I let it go and it re-docks itself when it needs to charge.  Give it a couple of hours and send it out again.  My floors look really clean.  Truly like this robot as it makes it so I don't have to sweep or vacuum again.  Plus it gets all the cat hair from under things too,  It is great.  We named the robot Alice and absolutely LOVE Her!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2020

Review Text: I love this Roomba. It took some getting used to and playing around with the dock placement but it cleans my entire apartment (medium size NYC apartment) minus the areas that have a step up, but you can buy ramps for that. It always finds its way back to the dock without issue now that I have found a central place for it. It cleans well and is the best value for the best price. I love the app because I can set it to clean before I get home.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020

Review Text: Bought this to replace our Ilife robot. It does a good job but i think its a little noisy. Also we do have a low pile carpet and it does not want to go on there.It treats it as a wall and turns around.  I put it on the carpet and it just spins around, so maybe better for hardwood floors and low rugs.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021

Review Text: At one time Roomba was the leader in this space, but in the past couple of years Roomba has been riding its name. This model still uses the poor random bouncing around method which does a poor job of cleaning. We can put stuff around the room and in five or six full runs the 675 will not hit that area. Its cleaning is just okay, misses the dock about 1/5 runs, and gets end stuck 3/5 runs.If it was less expensive then I would not mind the problems cleaning and always having to find it hung up. It is just too expensive for the features.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2019

Review Text: I expected more from Roomba. Not very efficient. It would spend two hours roaming the floors and I would still have to go back after it with the regular vacuum and finish the job. It did seem to pick up quite a bit of dust, always had to clean out the dust catcher. It did pick up lots of cat hair, from my two cats. Kind of pointless though  to have it if I had to run the regular vacuum anyway, so I sold it off.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2020

Review Text: I called Rooma, my 675 was missing the charger.This model doesn't go back to the station by itself I was told that 675 is an older model ( doesn't do nearly what i4,i7 or i8 )Detail section: is very misleading!!The question and answer section is misleading.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020

Review Text: I bought this for wife. She loves it. We have put it on schedule using the smartphone app. And it starts and stops on it’s own. After few cleans it pretty much knows the area and cleans without hitting the walls. Good cleaning machine. Has pretty solid suction power for carpets. May not do an excellent job on kitchen floors due to uneven tiles. But still, cleans pretty well. Happy with what I bought.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2020

Review Text: I am so upset I bought this. It has never done a proper job. It maybe gets a little bit of dust but it has NO suction power and just runs around doing..I'm not sure what. The photos is of an hour of it running then giving the alert to change..ummm, do you see the filter is empty? SUCH a waste of money and SO disappointed. Really wondering if I was sold a fake item.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2020

Review Text: Update. The Roomba didnt find its base the first couple of times, one time battery drained before it docked. Roomba customer service said light needs to be on for the Roomba at night.Love how its cleans dog hair from my hardwood floors. Got to remember to empty the bin after each use and pull hair from the rollers. Now if they would make a roomba that mops.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020

Review Text: The product is easy to use, helps reduce the amount of crumbs and pet hair on floors and carpet between deep cleanings. The compartment that holds the dirt and dust is relatively small, we have to empty it out during use. We have pets and I have long hair, which gets wrapped around the brush, so you have to take it apart to remove the hair. It transitions well between hard floors and carpet. It doesn’t clean in a pattern, so it misses spots and goes over the same spot several times.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2020

Review Text: I've had this vacuum for 2 months and am really disappointed. It stopped charging this morning. When it did work its battery life was awful. It will maybe vacuum for 20 minutes before dying. Its cleaning capabilities were mediocre at best. Maybe I got a dud but my last vacuum was a Deebot that I got for $130 and I would definitely buy that one again before i purchased this.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2020

Review Text: I have heard my friends rave about their Roombas for years, so I decided to get one for my small office.  Granted, I bought the lowest priced model, but I had high hopes for it.  I have found this Roomba to be a bit disappointing.  It does pick up some of the excessive dog hair in the office, but not as much as we had hoped.I had heard the Roombas have an amazing ability to learn the terrain and be highly efficient in its path, but I have not witnessed that.  It seems this one just bumps and turns its way around in a haphazard way.  It has had a hard time finding its way around the office and runs out of battery within 45 minutes.  There are many areas that are not visited by the Roomba.If I had known there would be this much difference between the low end and higher priced options, I probably would not have bought this and would have instead bought a higher end Roomba or an upright vacuum instead.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2019

Review Text: Roomba is wonderful IF you don’t store anything on the floor, don’t have cords/chargers, don’t have cat toys, don’t have doors that close. He keeps getting stuck inside our bathroom (yes, it’s a he) by coming in, closing the door, then running in circles. It’s wonderful, but you will end up wanting the more advanced version. It also doesn’t have a giant storage capacity. Save your money, buy the cordless Dyson!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2020

Review Text: Our dog is getting older and constantly having to clean up drifts of hair was starting to bum me out.  Enter roomba.  Sets up pretty quickly although it took a couple tries to connect everything to the wifi via the app.  We run roomba, which my wife has named "Nelson" most days on the main floor.  It will run for 70-80 minutes or so.  Picks up a surprising amount of stuff everyday.  I do empty it daily and do some hand cleaning of the brushes to pull out excess dog hair every other day.  The floors are noticeably cleaner.  The brushing action picks up more stuff than our Miele vacuum cleaner off the hardwood.  I would definitely recommend this product for people who have pet hair issues or who just want cleaner hardwood floors.  My one peeve is that it has not been doing a good job redocking itself on the charger.  Not sure why, may contact customer service about this.  I just put it back by hand, no big deal.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2019

Review Text: "Wally" does a good job.  He sometimes needs a little help when he gets stuck, but in general, does a very good job cleaning.  We use him to clean hardwood and carpet floors and are happy with how he performs.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020

Review Text: This Roomba is not quiet, in comparison to a washer or dryer ... sure. We have to put the volume up pretty high on the TV to try and drown out the noise. It doesn’t go under our couch which is a real bummer. We really needed it to go under our couch to pick up dog hair. It does pick up well on carpet and rugs so no complaints . If it’s not near it’s dock when you command it to dock it takes a while. Make sure your dog is against the wall or it just keeps bumping it until it’s pushed against the wall and can shove its self onto it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020

Review Text: I have owned an old Deebot for 3 years and wanted another robot vacuum for a different floor.In short, returned this as it1. Doesn't clean well.2. Is extremely loud.3. Gets stuck very easily.4. Doesn't return back to base.Try a different model or different brand. This one is very mediocre at best.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020

Review Text: Product stopped charging after 4 months.  Have worked endlessly with iRobot to replace or fix item.  They sent a fix one time and it worked for a week.  It's back to not working and iRobot isn't helping.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020

Review Text: Title^It will do the little stuff. It’s a good daily cleaner. But you will still need to sweep and vacuum on your own. The suction is terrible. It does not pick stuff up that you would expect it to: wrappers, cheerios, etc. (sorry I have small kids).It does better on carpet than hardwood. On hardwood it kind of just spreads the mess and picks up every other item.I do not mind the random pattern it vacuums in but it spends a lot of extra time in one room vs others at times. Or one half of a room vs the other.Again it’s nice to have for just a daily “cleaning” but it could be better with more suction power.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019

Review Text: These require cell service and Blue Tooth to operate. A lot of places don't get cell service, and where I want to use it at a mountain cabin is one of those. It's useless to me. You're forced to download an app, have cell service, and the app tracks your usage details. The app is not written well and causes all sorts of problems; check the feedback for it. What happened to simple and and anonymous?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020

Review Text: For a long time, I wondered how well a robotic vacuum could really clean.  I'm SO HAPPY to have finally tried a Roomba!  We cleaned everything the day before "Rosey" arrived, yet she found so much.  With two dogs and a cat, it's not easy keeping up with hair and dust, but Rosey works very hard so we don't have to.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2021

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   Its taken me 3 hours and I can't get it to connect to wifi. Then I just hit the clean button and it started going. It won't pick up fuzz or hair and I have a dog and a cat. This is some fuzz from my dogs toys he likes to pick up and it went over it three times. I wanted one of these for so long and it's just not worth the money.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020

Review Text: I absolutely LOVE my roomba!  I had been wanting one of these for a long time but was so afraid it would be a complete waste of my money.  I isn’t a waste of my money!!  It was money well spent!  I have 3 dogs, 2 of which are large and all of them shed.  It works great on the pet hair.  I have mostly hardwood floors, but it is working great on my carpets too.  Of course you can’t expect this to completely replace your regular vacuum from time to time, but it has made a huge difference in the maintenance of my floors.  Not to mention it’s so nice to come home to a already vacuumed home!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020

Review Text: This product is overall excellent. It runs for a very long time, even if it’s running several times a day. It withstands ALL the daily messes of children and combats almost all of the fly away dog hair! We have two dogs, malamute and labradoodle mixes, and the Roomba picks up a majority of the stray clumps of dog hair! On top of that, it also picks up ALL the dirt and crumbs in your house! We solely use it on our hardwoods, but it also works really well on our carpets. Overall this is an excellent product, especially if you’re vacuuming several times a day due to daily messes of kids and pets!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2020

Review Text: I received a dead unit.  It will not take a charge.  I followed the instructions perfectly.  I did some research on Roomba/IRobot batteries... a lot of people are complaining about how they die so quickly. That's unfortunate, you would think a robot company would have mastered battery products by now.  I will not be buying any IRobot products again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2020

Review Text: I got this product 10/06/20. I consistently have problems with it failing to dock on the charging unit and frequently have to help it along. The functionality of the App is overstated in the description and you cannot program it as the TV commercials lead you to believe. Had I’d known in advance I would have bought and upgraded model.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020

Review Text: Product is as advertised good for doghair, actually it is simply great.  I have a yellow lab who sheds 24/7/365.  Now my wifi and the Roomba do not get along, so every other day I take it off its charger, place it on the floor and hit CLEAN. For about an hour and a half it does it's thing and PRESTO...clean floor.  And it docks itself when finished.  I do have to clean it of dog hair after each use, but a teensy price to pay for painlessly getting nice clean floors .  We named her Ruby Roomba, and we like her a whole lot.  So do my allergies.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2019

Review Text: Ours is named Gary, and he is my best friend. Nothing more satisfying that sitting down, drinking a beer, and watching something else clean your house. We have two large, long haired dogs that love to shed, and Gary keeps our floors clean. We do have to clean his brushes 1-2 times a week to get rid off the hair, but much easier than vacuuming. Does bump into furniture quite a bit since this model doesn’t have the mapping feature. Does well on hardwood, tile and carpet.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2021

Review Text: I cannot recommend this product highly enough!  We have 3 cats and 1 dog and this keeps the pet hair under control!  I love being able to vacuum effortlessly everyday.  We have a pretty open floor plan; so that helps it run smoothly.  However, you do have to keep things off the floor (small cat toys in our case) that could get caught in the machine. Also, you have to keep cords out if its way.  If you start with a clean floor, it keeps it clean; but, you’ll still need to use your regular vacuum occasionally. I love my Roomba and have no complaints!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2019

Review Text: I really, really wanted to love this vacuum. I suffer from really bad allergies and have to vacuum a lot because I have a dog and a cat. But I hate it and really wish I could get my money back. It is annoyingly loud, it goes around crashing into things - it even broke my molding in two different places. It gets stuck almost every single time, and I really don’t have that much for it to get stuck on, so it can only do my kitchen and living room. And it honestly leaves a lot on the floor. I have only turned it on like 10 times because it causes such a ruckus and knocks things over every time. And if I’m not home, no time passes before I get an alert saying it’s wheel is stuck.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021

Review Text: I do not vacuum at all anymore. He had a hard time finding the docking station the first two times. However, Geeves [Robot] works like a charm.  The floor looks vacuumed as he leaves his little crop circles around the bed posts. also cleaning lines throughout the "job".  I dont have animals, so not sure about that hair factor.  I read through the feedback about this model and all I can say is that I have no problems with purchase and would suggest that everyone needs one. You can take your time back from sweeping and vacuuming.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2020

Review Text: I have had this product for about 4 weeks and have used it 4-5 times per week since receiving it.  Maybe twice out of about 18 or so uses did the vaccuum actually make it back to it's home base.  The 'runs for up to 90 minutes before automatically docking & recharging' is fake news.  It runs for as long as it possibly can before dying in the most inconvenient locations, as far out of reach as possible, such as under the bed.  It also has difficulty finding it's home base.  Once it's done cleaning and is attempting to return home (according to the app), it aimlessly wanders around the house, nowhere near where it is supposed to return to.  I gave it 3 stars because it does clean the floors well, but definitely does not work as advertised when it comes to being 'smart', so if you're buying this particular model because of this park, go elsewhere.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2020

Review Text: I bought this 2 years ago and never wrote a reviewafter buying this one i bought another as a gift and both are still working after 2 years
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2021

Review Text: It’s been a week and it works great for cleaning up hair from my two cats. It hasn’t found its way back to the base at the end of cleaning yet, but that doesn’t bother me much as my kid thinks hunting for it is fun, and to be fair it got stuck trying to eat a towel last time, which was my fault. I’m very pleased with this purchase.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2021

Review Text: I’m now a few months into the purchase, it is the best investment I’ve made in a long time. I have 1500 sq feet of hard floor - tile, hard wood & vinyl/laminate, 4 kids and a long haired dog. This thing gets anything and everything picked up and makes my life much easier. It doesn’t get stuck and always returns home to the base. I’ll be purchasing their mop next.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2020

Review Text: We've had our Roomba for a few months and it's a time saver.It works great in our tiled kitchen.  We have little kids and they are constantly dropping things on the floor: cereal, chips, crumbs, chocolate chips, oatmeal, sugar, legos, etc. We run the Roomba several times a day; usually, the final time just before bed and it keeps our kitchen floor reasonably clean.The best part is the Roomba can happily clean under carts and tables without moving them.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020

Review Text: Honestly I would have never purchased this if I knew how much of a terrible job it would do. I understand it doesn’t have eyes but jeez, it goes around and around and will never get every spot. Goes over the same spots multiple times and not the ones you really need it to go to. If it’s picking up dirt why doesn’t stay around that area? No it passes by it and goes around the same spots it already picked up! Noisy and gets stuck a few times especially under the table and chairs
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021

Review Text: I have 2 huge dogs. A German Shepherd and a German Shepherd mix. There is SO. MUCH. HAIR. We have hardwood, so there was clumps of hair everywhere constantly. This little guy, who we named bumbletater, is a life saver. If we run him daily the hair stays under control. This requires no effort if you have a smart home device. All we have to do is say "hey Google, run the bumbletater," and he does his thing. It's designed to be extremely easy to empty and clean. The app is nice. All in all it was a great purchase.

Review Text: My iRobot Roomba stopped working after 2 weeks. I kept receiving Error 2 which told me to clean the brushes. I cleaned everything including checking the gears and watched multiple videos (it's not hard at all). Not sure what happened but a replacement for iKaren (my kids named it because it such because it keeps asking for the manager and running into things with reckless abandon) is on the way. I also went to Roomba's website and since it was under warranty I ordered a new set of brushes in case this occurs with the new one...

Review Text: Love my Eufy! It worked great for a year and one half.  I took out the extra warranty and I'm so glad I did.  Asurian is a five star warranty company that promises service and communication and they live up to their promises!! My Eufy broke down and Asurian came to my rescue.  Fix and happy!!

Review Text: This thing gets stuck in a couple of places every day, 1-4 times a day. How am I supposed to go to work, expect roomba to work, get home and it got stuck the first 15 min?I thought after a bit it gets smart and learns your house?It has also torn all the paint off the stair bottom and around my kitchen island. It leaves dirt marks around my kitchen island, also.

Review Text: In a beautiful Sunday morning, when you are finally in the mood of doing some house keeping, you pressed the magical button in the smart app that would instruct the little machine to do its job, and then you happily continue to do something else, while expecting the little machine to return you a clean house.You left your house to the grocery store, coming back only to find a disordered house, papers all over the place, guitar falling onto the ground, and our hero, who supposed to return to its home after around 30 minutes, still dedicatedly banging itself to the bathroom door.To be honest, this thing can really piss you off. Be prepared.

Review Text: I love my rumba, it surface cleans excellent, but I have cats so you gotta make sure the front holding spot gets emptied because it is small. But it really cleans well. It looks confused but if you leave it alone it does the job! One more point is to move throw rugs and be sure your recliner is in the recline position or it will get stuck in there. Plus it’s not really to smart about cords. Besides that I love it!

Review Text: I absolutely LOVE my iRobot Roomba!!! I can't rave enough about it!!!! It is meticulous at reaching those little in between crevices and small, small particles. Don't mention the pet hair ( 2 cat & 2 dogs)!!! This machine is a MUST have!!!!  I am so glad I finally have one in my household!!! I highly recommend it!!!It is a bit loud while it vacuums but I don't mind it at ALL as it has made my life easier!!!I may even get a second one! LOL

Review Text: Great machine press and it goes to work effectly. . Put blocks out to kep it away from spots not to be entered. Blocks are sold eparaltely but a must have i. Mop has rechargable battery dont know why they didnt do that for rumba. Review Text: Looks, Works & cleans like the old roomba, which is a good thing.Problem is irobot replaced the onboard scheduling interface with a wireless interface requiring a app on your smartphone.This interface is not very good in terms of its reliability & the initial setup will fail very easily by not connecting to wifi. It also tends to easily loose its connection to wifi after you finally get the initial connection.Be prepared for a potential frustrating experience.Irobot should get the bugs out of wireless interface & also restore the onboard interface.

   I absolutely love it! My husband bought it as a Christmas present and it has been a blessing. I have a bad shoulder and using a regular vacuum was very uncomfortable. Review Text: I was fairly disappointed in this Roomba. My parents have a Roomba and it keeps their floors fairly clean. I have smooth hardwood floors throughout my house, but this vacuum had a difficult time sucking up the fine hair and fur. When it came to dirt clumps or a bit larger debris, it did fine. I have a cat and a dog and it couldn’t keep up with the finer hair.I have been told a Shark vacuum does a better job at this.

Review Text: This little guy works wonders. It will occasionally get hung up on the bathroom rug or a charging cord I forgot to pick up, but this are my fault, not the Roomba’s. I love that I can have it run around the apartment while I’m at work and come home to a vacuumed apartment.It’s not a direct replacement for cleaning your place as it will occasionally miss a spot or two, but for keeping the place tidy in between full cleanings it can’t be beat.

Review Text: The Roomba is a huge disappointment. Seemingly programmed by someone not familiar with what a vacuum is supposed to do. It covers random areas, gets stuck A L L the time, sucks up rugs, and worse, sucks up cords underneath the bed. I was so excited to get this product based on all the reviews. Do not spend the money. I have never been more unhappy with a product.

Review Text: I have been using for six months.  Try a different model or manufacturer.  I used a different model/manufacturer prior to this model.  The previous model:  Cleaned ~85% as well as the 675 but it was ~$100 less, vacuuming logic was superior, rarely missed docking or got stock(Roomba 675 is not docking or getting stuck ~15-20% of time), and 50% quieter .  I really see nothing smart about this model.  It does clean better than my previous non-Roomba model during operation.  I truly believe one is paying for name and marketing.  Others are available with similar/same functionality at less cost.

Review Text: I have not had it a year yet and now it won't charge. It would go over the same spot many times before moving on and did not get all the dog hair like it said it would.Was easy to clean kind of.  But for less than a year of use? What's going on Roomba? Mostly was used on tile and hardwood. It would run a while if it didn't get stuck & can not just go over high rugs.

Review Text: Overall love this vacuum- with 3 pets (one being a shed-prone German Shepard/lab mix)  it does great to get the hair up daily. Just wish it was more systematic in its cleaning (if it gets stopped at a corner/wall it often completely redirects so the pattern is off) but i run it longer while we’re lounging or running errands and it does great!

Review Text: I have had two of these and the replacement had the same problem as the original. After a month or two they would stop charging and it’s be unusable. I am beyond frustrated with this model. I think there’s a defect in their charging system because two of them with the same problem is not a coincidence. When it’s working it works fantastic. Review Text: My mother has gotten weaker as she ages and no longer pysh a heavy sweeper around her house.  She'd have to rely on someone to come over and sweep when they had time. I saw this was on sale and thought, "Why not. If it doesn't work, we can always send it back." She loves the thing. It works well with Alexa and has the suctionpower to clean up cat hair. It riams around and even sends messages to my phone when it is done or has an error. The catch basket is easy to remove and east to empty.
