Review Text: Bought this for my mom, who's in her late 70's.  She enjoys watching it do it's thing, and it's good for picking up dog hair and dusty bits.  You can see what it picks up in a short time by checking the bin.  Her house is usually very clean just by looking at it, yet this little robot found a lot of stuff to pick up!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2021

Review Text: Loveeeee the roomba. It actually picks up a lot of dirt/dust balls/hair/whatever that a broom cannot. It’s very rare that it can’t pick up something off of carpets, but other than that, definitely does a good job cleaning so that I don’t have to. The only downside is that sometimes it takes a while getting to the other rooms in my apartment because it bumps into things and then turns around and then takes a different route before finally going into my room/bathroom. Highly recommend buying.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2020

Review Text: This is a very help tool, it cleans well and has good battery. It cleans my entire down floor and lasts around 2 hours. It does tile and carpet really well, and transfers between them easily. It picks up hair very well but it tangled up in the brushes and was very difficult to clean. Also one brush is rubber and the hair cut through it and damaged the rubber brush pretty good. It's easily disassembled to clean and easy to empty the bin. My only real problem is that hair is extremely difficult to clean out of the brush and the rubber isn't very durable to the hair cutting through it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2020

Review Text: I have a dog and I am always barefoot.  I cannot stand the feeling of dirt and dog hair under my feet but despite endless sweeping, there always manages to be dirt left on the floor.  Besides, who wants to do endless sweeping?  I got my Roomba and excitedly put it on the charger in anticipation of its first performance.  It's now been three months and all I can say is I LOVE MY ROOMBA.  It does a good job of covering ground, picks up a shocking amount of hair and dirt, and it even notifies you if it encounters a problem.  With the app on my phone, I'm able to launch it remotely (which is great after I've had a party, didn't run it the day after and just remembered while I'm sitting at work that I need to vacuum the floors!).  Thankfully it fits under most of my furniture.  We don't have a huge house and there are some rooms I'll close off but it has enough juice to fully clean two bedrooms, the hall, the living room, dining room, and my kitchen.  And it even knows how to get home to recharge.  It's super easy to empty and even disassemble when it's time to clean the heads.  One thing is for certain, I'll never be without a Roomba again.  EVER.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2019

Review Text: What a machine. Got it today, very simple to set up. App is well made. Easy to use. I did not think I had that dirt until it finished. Container was full. I was amazed. If you are considering a robot vacuum, this is the one to get. 90 minute run time. It is solidly made. If the rest is like today, wife is really pleased.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2021

Review Text: Love it! I’ve wanted one for as long as I can remember and got it as a Christmas gift to myself. A little noisier than I imagined - and bigger. It’s the size of a large serving bowl but short. It’s got little legs to help it up and over ledges. And it makes happy chimes when it starts cleaning and when it’s done! I get more help with housework from this little robot than my partner 🤣 but no seriously, cannot recommend this enough. It needed a little encouragement to explore other rooms (I ended up dropping it in the middle of my living room its  second run because it only wanted to clean the bedroom and my kitchen) but it does a pretty good job!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021

Review Text: I have another irobot Roomba perfectly working. This is an addition.Like most, it is less noisy. Performance much better than older model. It runs more easily over bulky rugs.Like less, it didn't come with accessories. It was a flat machine with the basics: charger and two filters.Any way, no complaint. Like it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020

Review Text: I contemplated and flip flopped on getting one of these for several years. I understand that these are more of a novelty and doesn't replace regular vacuuming, but it has helped out alot! One of my favorite aspects of new toys/tech is the research. I love learning about things as I decide which option is the best option and value for me and it resulted in the purchase of this Roomba 675.With that said, never did I come across anything about the brushes on these things (or I totally missed it). Apparently, they make a difference. This Roomba has a bristle brush and a rubber one. The bristle brush is a PAIN to clean and it needs it often. There are 3 girls in my house with long hair and this bristle brush gets clogged up SUPER fast. Long hair is hard on vacuums anyway, but the design and style of the brush causes the hair to knot and tangle in the bristles resulting in a long, tedious process cleaning it out about once every other week.So, if I ever get another one, I will specifically search for two rubber brushes.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2021

Review Text: I've had this roomba since November 2018 & a few things REALLY bother me about this machine.I have long hair, which gets tangled around the brush wheel, and i have to cut my hair off of the brush every single day if I want it to work properly. If I don't it just flat out doesn't clean.The side brush (the once that looks like a propeller) has started coming off over the last couple of months... I've tried changing the brush & the screw that holds it in, but it comes out literally every 5 minutes, so if I'm not standing over it to watch it eats the screw & I've got to dig it out of the waste bin and find the brush and put everything back together.  I've tried just leaving the side brush off, but it does a surprising amount of the cleaning (it funnels the debris to the main bridges) and I have to run it about 3 times to get the house clean instead of 1 with the brush.With that level of maintenance I'd rather just buy a $75 vacuum and pay my 10 year old a couple bucks a day to vacuum... it couldn't be any spottier than this thing without the side brush!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2019

Review Text: Hubby and I picked up a Roomba for me for Christmas.  I honestly wish we had gotten one years ago.  I can't sweep daily or even every other day because the fibro won't let me, that is life.  I have 2 kids, 2 dogs and an oddly dirty cat, so not being able to sweep daily means no one keeps white socks white.  The Roomba means I don't have to get irked because the floor is grubby.  I don't have to hurt myself to do something one would expect an adult to be able to do.  I love that little thing, even if it does get "trapped" behind the Christmas tree I need to move to the shed once hubby has that ready.  It does a pretty good job and leaning over to clean out the dust try is a lot easier than leaning over with a dust pan for me.  I didn't get the newest or fanciest version so it is a bit loud but honestly no worse than kiddo playing Minecraft.  I also like that my youngest calls it "Goomba" like a Mario Brothers baddie.  I like the App for my phone because even if I cannot get out of bed, I can still get the floors clean.  We have all hard wood and tile, so I cannot speak to how it does on carpet.  Ok, it tried to sweep up the little rug in the bathroom, so either close those or pick up the rugs during cleaning.  It slides easily under my bed, under the futon in the living room, around the table in the kitchen and back to its home without problems.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020

Review Text: I’ve had this vacuum for a little over a month now and I run it every day with minimal issues in my 945sqft house with hardwood, tile & area rugs. Sometimes it gets stuck near the stairs, sometimes it gets wedged under one specific chair & I have to rescue it, once or twice it couldn’t find the dock, but those are all minimal compared to how much time and energy this thing saves me. I just do minimal vacuuming once a week to reach areas she can’t & my house looks and feels so much cleaner all the time! I am not the type who vacuumed every day, because who wants to do that, but I set “Rosie” up once to have a cleaning schedule and it’s been good to go ever sense. I have very long hair that sheds like crazy and I also have a cat and dog & am amazed each day with how full the bin gets. She easily clears all the thresholds in the house & fits under beds, nightstands, dressers, etc that are all areas I’m guilty of not vacuuming under as often as I should, but Rosie takes care if it for me. I do like to be at home while she’s cleaning, just in case she gets stuck on something & she is a little noisy, but not as much as a regular vacuum. I recommend this as a great introduction to a robot vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020

Review Text: This has been the worst piece of garbage I’ve ever bought immediate issues was it couldn’t charge immediately I was told to take it apart and clean under the front wheel and make sure the metal contacts were clean (before first use) have had nothing but charging issues since day 1 it’s not smart enough to hit something snd move away instead in keeps trying until it gets itself wedged under or in something. Do yourself a favor and find a better vacuum I figured since the name was well know it would be great I was very disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020

Review Text: I thought there was good chance that our new friend "Norbert" would spread cat litter around the house (more than it already gets spread).  However, Norbert does a surprisingly good job.  He has not fallen down the stairs either which is a huge plus.We have found that if we lock Norbert in a room by himself that he does a better job than if you give him full run of the house.  His mind has a tendency to wander a little in that regard so constraining his territory makes it more likely that he'll find all of the cat hair "tumbleweeds", litter, dirt from outside and other stuff that happens to hit the floor.Norbert, despite his relatively low IQ and seemingly random movements, apparently recognizes both of our cats and apparently has an appetite for cat tails.  Our furry friends have decided that avoiding Norbert's brushes and wheels is best and make for high ground when they hear him start his cleaning routine.Overall, Norbert joining our house has made our lives easier by giving us time to no longer do the vacuuming ourselves and instead spend time watching him creep across the floor, under chairs and into some of the areas of our house that we realize that we should have vacuumed ourselves before he came into our lives.  Never has an animated object garnered such attention and entertainment in our house from all of use (cats and humans).  We cheer every time he finds a chunk of dirt and face-palm when he bumps into the same four legged chair for a few moments.  If the cats decide that they decide he is a mode of transportation for their lazy asses, I will update this review.  However, the manufacturer says that Norbert is not a cat transport device (contrary to ample evidence supplied by YouTube).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020

Review Text: This is our first one, and it works fine but it does not do a complete job. It was very easy to install and run on WiFi. It is doing the job for picking up the cat hair in open spaces, but it gets stuck in any and all rooms for hours cleaning the same spots. It does not go back to the docking station, so we have to find it in the last spot that it was cleaning because it died, and that is a pain when it happens under beds or furniture. So far it cleans for about 95-100 minutes. The roll on this machine gets full of hairs and it is difficult to clean. I can see that this model will be good for a small apartment with not that many furniture and more open blueprint. For us, still considering a return.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2020

Review Text: I was so excited to get this. Although I am home most days, I thought how cool will it be to have a vacuum that vacuums while I am doing something else. I wish this little baby would’ve worked out but here is why it didn’t:1.) Biggest problem - would not get up on higher pile/plush  rugs (think shag) and even when put on the rug - would not travel and clean.2.) I found myself watching it work on the flooring it would travel on - no rhyme or reason and that drove me nuts. Now I admit- this was MY problem for watching it do it’s job. So - should you buy one (which BTW - if you have mainly uncarpetted or lower pile carpeting - go for it! What a wonderful convenience) do one of two things. Either buy the Roomba with the mapping feature OR leave the house or work on a different floor of the house so you don’t see the irrational pattern flow (it does seem to EVENTUALLY hit all the spots.3.) it did not return to the docking station as it was suppose to.Let me close by saying I really really wanted to love this machine - the reality of under beds and furniture getting vacuumed on a regular basis made me giddy. And I think I would still be thrilled with a machine that had mapping and worked on my shags. So don’t be too hastily turned off to a Roomba if these would not be issues for you.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020

Review Text: First off, I was very excited to get this Roomba. It's packaging was very nice and simple to un-pack. The setup looked easy but that's were the problem is if you have an auto switching WiFi router for 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz . The Roomba only operates on 2.4 GHz and you can't finish the setup if your phone is not on 2.4 GHz also. My issue is that my Orbi router is auto switching (it selects the fastest freq for the device it is talking to). This kind of router is now more common today. My iphone will only connect to my router at 5 GHz so I couldn't get past the setup even through the Roomba was talking to my network (could see it on my router command screen using 2.4 GHz). So, how did I learn all about this - 3 hours working with the Roomba tech support. Very nice people but they just have a bad product wifi config setup. I finally gave up when they wanted me to disconnect my satellite wifi station (in the attic), disconnect all my other devices, and reconfigure my router to only 2.4 GHz (hard coding) to get past the setup screen. No thanks - this experience cost be enough time and I didn't want to screw up my wifi setup. Sadly, had to return the Roomba. Now looking for a non-wifi competitor version.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020

Review Text: I received “Brenda” today and she worked really hard for over an hour on my floors! 😂 Here’s what I think so far... In order for Brenda to perform at her fullest you need to prep your space. Unplug the cords and lift them off the floor, so that Brenda doesn’t choke on them while working. Same goes for anything else that she can trip on. You will need to watch her the first time to get an idea of how she behaves in your space. I live in Las Vegas in a 1300sq ft home. House layouts here can be a little tricky and since my Brenda doesn’t have a mapping feature I need to think for her in order to make her job a bit easier. For example, in order for her to clean my large living room efficiently, I need to put up a barricade so she doesn’t go into my hallway area and then into one of the bedrooms. I also have a pony wall in the living room so that confuses her a little bit too. However, she did perform to the fullest on her first run and collected a lot of fine dust, dog hair and other random particles. I recently got rid of all carpets in favor of  luxury vinyl floor planks. Brenda seems to like this surface a lot! Like some reviewers I also had an issue with her not being able to go home to charge. She seemed to want to park herself near the WiFi router but her dock was in the living room. So I moved her condo to the office where the router is and just like magic she made it back home in a snap. I also think that in order for hear to clean each room efficiently she needs to be locked in there instead of letting her wander the house. Bottom line - this is a great vacuum for the money and it will definitely help to keep house in the desert between the main clean-ups!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2019

Review Text: Good: generally good at getting everywhere, stops and circles when it detects a lot of dirt, and fun to watch as well.OK: Doesn't always get everything, not the kind of Roomba that "maps" the room so it can run out of power before it finds the charging station.Bad: It would always get stuck on our Xmas tree stand and would have to be rescued.Indispensable: No more sweeping all the time!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2021

Review Text: I wish I would have gotten this sooner, it's been a complete game changer.  We have an F1 mini goldendoodle that sheds just like a retriever.  You could vacuum the entire house one day and have tumble weeds of fur 2 days later.  We set this on a timer on our phone app to come on every weekday at 9am. It works excellent on hard surface floors,  okay on low to medium pile carpet.  We are finally in control of the fur situation in our house! Best purchase of the year for us.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2020

Review Text: Overall, I love this thing. Most of my house is hardwood so dirt and hair show pretty quick. I was really surprised by how much hair and dirt this thing picked up. The robot runs for about 1.5 hrs before needing to recharge which was also nice. Cons:  it sometimes loses connection with the WiFi and it has to be reset. The suction is good but doesn’t get a lot in the cracks in the hardwood. Overall, I would purchase again and am planning another to help with coverage of the house.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019

Review Text: I have a combination of hardwood, area rugs and carpet. The area rug in the living room catches a lot of cat hair and I wanted to use this, in particular, to clean this rug - it's mostly black and needs constant attention. The robot would stop at the edge of the rug (not high pile or fringed) then move away. Also, in the living or dining rooms, it would continually rotate in circles, to the point I would have to pick it up and move it to another area.On the upside, it thoroughly cleaned the bedroom carpets.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2021

Review Text: I love this little machine. It cleans up pet hair and dust well. I have three cats, so pet hair has been a way of life until I got this machine. You program it and it will clean while you do other things or even if you’re out!  Never would have thought it would work this well. Very happy with purchase.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021

Review Text: Unfortunately this product has not worked well for us. We had a Bobi and the battery failed even after buying a replacement so we spent the money for the Roomba. This has only worked a handful of times in the past six months. It constantly says bumpers are stuck. I have followed instructions on how to fix this error and it still continues to happen and now it hasn’t been able to work in a couple months. Prior to that it did fine on hard surfaces but couldn’t get up onto our rug, which the Bobi had no problem with. This has been a frustrating purchase. We don’t use Alexa so not sure how that would work but seemed to respond to the app on phone.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019

Review Text: I love how the product works on our hardwood floors. However, we have several rigs and it just agitates them enough to make the shed and leave a bigger mess than doing nothing. This  particular model doesn’t allow you to block certain zones from cleaning.Also, it’s not consistent in behavior with charging. Sometimes it will charge and sometimes it won’t. At least 20% of the time it does mid-job and we just find it somewhere. But I thought it was smart enough to go back and dock if it was running too low.This product was a “good price” but it is just so-so on performance- making it over priced in my opinion.

Review Text: It does a great job cleaning our floors. We have mostly tile and throw rugs around the house and it has been nice not to step on random objects left behind by our three daughters. We do have to extract the occasional sock or hair tie but the notifications the app gives us letting us know it’s stuck, is extremely helpful. You can even have it play a song to help you find it, since it might be hiding under the couch. We’ve had it for almost a month and got the replacement brushes and accessories since it’s been working so hard for us. Totally recommend. We still have to vacuum our large rug since it can’t roll on top of it. A little bit of a bummer but a small issue that wont stop me from using it.

Review Text: So glad my husband talked me in to getting this vacuum. We have two young children so this is great. It goes over toys that we miss or the kids leave out. It holds a lot and does a great job cleaning our whole house (1600 sq ft) generally in one cleaning. The app gives you a lot of details too like how many "dirt events" there were, battery life, history and time on the job.  It is handy to have when you're trying to multitask... you can do other things (like bathtime, make dinner, etc) while the roomba (we named Weebo) cleans for you!

Review Text: Got my IRobot 600 series this week. Looks good, well made . Had a little trouble getting the dock to recognize the vacuum but finally got it to work. The pairing process was also a little difficult but when it finally connected it worked well. I will say (skip,) our IRobot, cleans well but in a very random pattern. I have discovered that if you pay "alot"more you can get one that actually knows where it is going. I was a little disappointed that the technology for this unit was not more  sophisticated in  its recognition software . I have not read anything about upgrades or if that is possible.The IRobot Home app is nice but not explanatory on some of its features like having a dock button you can push without having to go through several steps to get to it.( found this out from support) The scheduling feature is nice and the maintenance graph is useful.I have only had it for a short time and I choose Romba because of reviews and it's history. So far I have found it to do what I wanted, and that was to vacuum so I don't have too. It definitely cleans  better in places I don't vacuum often and seems to pull up a lot of the dog hair we suffer from.I have to empty it often because of that.My review is four star because of the random vacuum pattern it has,the line of sight only docking ability which may cause you to move the dock around so it want just run out of power before it finds home.I would say you get a great vacuum for the price you pay, or pay more for features you want.

Review Text: Don't buy if you can legitimately afford a better series. Don't buy if you're OCD. It will eventually get the job done... however the magic happens in a random and unorganized fashion that will not be mapped. You're just going to have to have faith that it went everywhere.  This is basically a functioning "antique prototype" collector's item.I honestly went back to my push vacuume, until I upgraded.

Review Text: I have two cats and live in a tiny apartment so keeping up with their insane amount of shedding can be a real pain - the roomba helps a ton with that! After doing some tinkering, I found that iRobot uses cheap plastic gears that wear down really quickly. I bought a replacement mechanism at $28 that seems to do the trick but it seems crazy to have to spend $28 a year on maintenance for something that could easily be avoided if iRobot would simply use metal gears!

Review Text: Yeah, I went there.  Doing a good job so far. Easy to maintain. Knows enough to not go down stairs. Handles dog hair just fine. Figures out table and chair legs. Pushes my floor-length curtains out of the way instead of eating them. Docks itself when low on battery. Runs for a good 90 minutes. Works on both hardwood and plush carpet. Easy to hook up to WIFI. Works well with voice command using Google home and a Google Hub. User-friendly. Got a USB chord caught in it one time; it alerted me to the problem, then went right back to work after I removed it. Very smart and very solid little robot. Would recommend.

Review Text: i have birds. this roomba model 675 did a awesome job! my daughter has a newer model and had told me they don't clean all that well but i'm very happy with this model! it is not wifi compatible but i had read the reviews and this older model is suppose to clean much better. i'm very happy! amazon made it affordable, and the biggest bonus is they shipped it in 3-4 days. thank you amazon!i gave it the 4 stars but only bc of the wifi compatibility. i did not rate it for deep cleaning as my floors are all wood d mostly ceramic tile.

Review Text: We bought this product as an upgrade from our Shark that the motor broke in. I have to say I am disappointed. I thoroughly enjoyed our Shark and would get joy knowing how clean the floors were. This product seems to have some hiccups. It works don't get me wrong, and I definitely still appreciate the floors being clean. However, it might take it awhile to get there. I do not feel like our whole house is ever clean. It will go in circles quite often and clean the same areas frequently. It does not deal well with my long female hair nor the pet hair. They seem to get wrapped in every crevice. The battery life is not as good as our previous one. It also does not find its dock well and errors out more than I would like. I am very disappointed and would send it back if I could. Especially for the price, our last robot was ~$149 and far superior. I am giving this an average rating because perhaps if I had never had a better one, I would not know the difference.

Review Text: First off, I have a Aussie mix dog who sheds up a storm. I live in a place with no carpeting (see first sentence). However, I am in California with indoor/outdoor living 9 months out of the year, so dirt and sand get tracked in all the time. So, this little robot has been put to the test! The pros are: excellent cleaner, easy to use, sturdy design that is top-notch around legs of furniture and getting over door saddles into other rooms. Also gets under beds, sofas and rolls over wires and doesn't get caught up in them.The only negative is that it is noisy when operating. So I always program it to clean when I am gone, or turn it on just as I leave the house. You just have to plan and use it wisely, and this little bot is a very good investment. You will be pleased with the results. Highly recommend. I also got it on sale, so wait for just after a major holiday and they will usually discount it. Worth the money.

Review Text: Why do these rumba's always have a personality, it's so weird. Review Text: We bought one because a friend of ours loves hers and her floors look amazing. We reset it and started from scratch. This has happened 3 times now. It also gets "stuck on cliffs" that are not there. Like in the middle of my living room. Its very random when it happens. I would definitely purchase the one that cleans itself when it docks if you have any animals. We did not and regret it. Review Text: I love my Roomba. I am not sure why other reviews say it cleans the same area. I just let it be and I don’t know where it finds all the dirt and pet hair it picks up!! Review Text: I like this Roomba but I'm not completely in love with it. Our Roomba's name is "Betsy" and I will refer to her as that on here. She literally drove AROUND a wad of dog hair the other day as if it were a piece of furniture. When she bumps into furniture, I never know which direction she's going to turn to as sometimes she continues down the line and around corners and the next time she may venture off into a path of no return. With all that being said, I like her because she gets up the majority of the dog hair and I don't have to worry about putting the baby down to sweep or vacuum but she is kind of a loud mouth also so I can't run her when the baby is sleeping for fear he might get woke up. I would recommend Roomba as a product as it's very convenient but just wish Betsy was a little more sane. :)

Review Text: This thing is junk......no other way to describe it...... get's stuck every few minutes...and gives you anerror message so you have to pick the stupid thing up and move and restart it.....Easier to just vacuume yourself...It's also noisy....Trying it a bit longer but I'm sure returning it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020

Review Text: First time purchasing an automated vaccuum cleaner. I have 2 kids, 2 dogs and high traffic from and to the back patio, so I was looking for some help on controlling the dirt.  The WiFi configuration was confusing and after 20 unsuccessful minutes I delegated that task to husband, which in 5mins he got it down. So, I could argue that it may not be userfriendly on the set up for some.  The first time we turned it on, was in the afternoon, and I thought it was loud. I'm running it now at night, after the kids go to bed, and it's definitely loud. =S  You won't be able to watch TV or listen to music while it runs, even in the day time and could possibly wake up light sleep kids at night.  I'm not sure when is the best time to run it if you're at home all day.  The random wondering around can be frustrating considering one could clean a 20x20 room in 10mins, yet it takes 90mins to clean and still misses some areas.  Despite the time it takes and the loudness, it does a good job (not excellent) but it does pick up lots of dirt. The suction on a low area rug is not strong (it didn't pick up all the shedding hair from the dogs). I have yet to let it run in the bedroom high carpet areas, but I don't have high expectations on it doing a good job there.  Overall, I'd give it a high 'A-' grade on wooden floors cleaning since the vaccuum was quite full when we emptied it and the floors did feel cleaner in the end. However it gets a C+ on carpet cleaning, which it only passed through my low area rug and it didn't do a good job on fully cleaning it (forget a deep clean) despite the multiple time going over the same spots.I'm not sure if I'm going to keep it. The loud noise is a big factor since we're all at home due to Covid, the kids with virtual learning and us working remotely, I can't just let it run and disrupt the school/work day. I'd like a quieter one and with a more strategic and controlled vaccuming tragectory to save time, but I see that those models are quite more expensive than what I'm willing to pay. I say it's a good enough purchase if you're not at home and you're okay with area rugs lightly vaccumed and some floor areas not vacummed over. I'd say it's not worth paying the full price, so wait for the next holiday event to get it at a discount, as I did for Black Friday.  Will keep you posted if I find a better one.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   I love this robot! We call it Rosie (after the robotic maid in The Jetsons). I cannot stop talking about this with my friends who don't own one already. In fact, I actually just gifted 3 roomba 675's within a month of purchasing this one. It does a very thorough job of cleaning and at the beginning would take over an hour to clean our living room. But over time, it has adapted to our room and now takes about 45 minutes to do a sweep of the living room (about 400 sq ft.). It's great that this is able to connect to the virtual wall barrier as we use it divide our kitchen from living room. We run maintenance activities around once a month (hair removal, wheel clean-up) and it's not too much to do (takes 10-12 mins) especially when the robot does the cleaning for you everyday and saves time! I spent about 14-15 hours doing research on various roomba models, and I must say that at this price, this entry level model is a steal! It works just as good as the i3 or i7. If you have a single level home, I highly recommend this model. If you have a multi-level house, I would suggest an i7 since it can save the maps and remember the rooms. Over time, we have also noticed that the robot has adapted to our room and now takes a more regular path versus completely random zig-zag. It also connects via wifi, so we have it connected with our Alexa and just say 'Alexa, clean our house' and it does everything and re-docs after its done.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021

Review Text: I'm not sure how I lived so long without a robot vacuum.  This little guy is such a help for a working mom who always puts sweeping on the back burner.I did a ton of research before I settled on the iRobot version and everything pointed to iRobot from suction power to speed.  The only thing that never came up in my research was the noise.  This guy is loud.  If I'm working from home I have to take calls from another room while he's on (although that doesn't happen often since I've scheduled him to run while I'm usually not on phone calls).  It didn't dawn on me just how loud he was until I was at a friends house who has a deebot which is SO darn quiet.  We had no idea it was running till my son pointed out "they have a robot too!"  We were floored.With that being said - I'm not aware of the suction power or quality of hers in comparison to the iRobot.  I just wanted to add "noise" to my review so others who are researching will be aware that this little guy is loud!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2020

Review Text: This vacuum does a good job cleaning, and it is very convenient that it can be programmed to start early in the morning, or from a smartphone, but...It's also supposed to return to its charging station, and that's something it does very rarely. More commonly, it chokes on something forgotten on the floor, but which is a bit inconvenient, or its battery dies while it tries to find its way back. And it's that last that has me quite annoyed, as it seems to be a really bad error in its programming.When the vacuum gets stuck, I can at least open the app and hear it (usually) complain. When its battery dies, though, it won't respond to the app at all, and I have to hunt all over the house to find it. Surely it could be programmed to give up finding its way back while it still has battery left? The chances that trying just a few minutes longer will result in success seem kind of low if it hasn't actually detected the charger, so it might just as well give up and save its battery.And speaking of which... there should really be a 'find' button on the app so that I don't need to quit it and start over again to get it to make noise.A few years ago, this was probably state-of-the-art. Now it seems to fall far short of what a modern piece of equipment should do.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020

Review Text: So I've been using this for a few weeks now and it's amazing with pet hair and everything else. My issue with it is the following which aren't really deal breakers but things that you should know before buying.1.Sometimes it doesn't dock well so it won't charge. So you'll find yourself a dead Roomba with half the job done or worse yet one that is docked and didn't start at all2. Even if you have the space for the dock as recommended if it's too far way... Let's say in a hallway it won't find it.3. If the wheels are wet it won't get enough traction to climb over small borders like a balcony rail. So those are tedious with wet floors.4. Storage capacity kinda sucks especially with alot of pet hair has to be emptied after every clean.5. Works with Alexa but it's not an instant response so let say you tell Alexa "start Roomba" Alexa will respond "welcome to robot home for electric powered vaccumm like Brava.... Roomba... Something else, I can help you do things like "start Roomba" what will you like to do?" Which is well annoying having to wait 15-16 seconds every time.6. When you set a schedule it doesn't send a notification if it started or not, I believe it does when it finishes.Other than this great product. More traction for the wheels would be nice. Oh and this will eat any cables laying around.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020

Review Text: I purchased this IRobot after owning a Shark for 2 years-was looking for something quieter. I run one in the front of the house and one in the back.My iRobot has never found it’s way home, get’s stuck every time I use it. Does not pick up half the dirt my shark picks up and has scratched my wood floor just trying to dock.my Shark on the other hand, cleans the front and back of the house and makes it home 98% of the time, doesn’t leave dirt behind. keeps up with hair from two cats and 2 dogs, and has never damaged the floor upon docking. By the way, they are both about the same lever of noice during operation.To top it off, if you want to keep your iRobot away from certain areas, forget the magnetic strips that so inexpensively accompany your shark and work great, you have to buy a separate devise and move it throughout the house to keep your iRobot out of tight spaces your Shark has had no problem navigating
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020

Review Text: It's does what it should but in a very disorganized way. It kind of just bounces off of things from here to there in no determinable order. And it runs into everything...hard. If you have a glass of wine on a side table, it will run smack into that table and your wine will spill (which reminds me, I need to get some stemless wine glasses). I guess I was expecting more. I had a Hoover robot vacuum and the app to run it was terrible and after a year the whole thing stopped working completely BUT it would sense things and stop before running into it, and prior to first use, it ran a cycle and scanned your house for a map (we had to redo ours because it thought the dog was a piece of furniture and would never vacuum over that spot lol). You could see on the map where it went, and it had a very sensible back and forth pattern, similar to what you'd do with a regular vacuum. The Roomba just literally runs around like a chicken with its head cut off. Sometimes it gets my living room, other times all it does is the hallway before heading back to dock (and the battery is FULL). I'm hoping maybe it gets better the more runs it does but I've seen similar complaints. It's also pretty loud compared to my last one. The only pros compared to my previous one is that it is thinner and can easily fit under our couches and cabinets. It also can play a sound if you can't find it.  Needless to say, I'm a little disappointed because I expected more from this brand, for this price.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2020

Review Text: I really wanted this Roomba to work for me and unfortunately there were too many negatives. First it wouldn't vaccum the area rug, which is beige but has a black 1/2" wide trim border. I found out that the clif sensors often mistake black edges for cliffs. Sure enough, I covered the sensors (there's no stair access for the roomba on my main level) and it would go on the carpets! But it did an awful job. Literally driving over the top of visible dog and cat hair and not picking it up. Needless to say, not what I was hoping for. The final straw of my 1 week trial with it was when it died in the middle of the hallway for the SECOND time, instead of returning to base when it's battery was low. I emailed tech support and they informed me that my main level being 1200 sq ft is too much for a roomba that doesn't have the mapping software, and I would have to buy a virtual wall to keep it within 600 square feet so it didn't get so far from the base station and die. Needless to say, that is not going to work for me, as I can buy a model with mapping for the cost of this roomba plus a virtual wall.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020

Review Text: Easy to program and use. The app works well. Picked up a good amount of dust and dog hair from the hard wood floors.On the negative side it got stuck several times at the edge of the steps and it got stuck constantly / daily under our dressers and end tables. I had measured the height underneath and the height of the Roomba but yet it still wedges itself under the front edge of dresser even tho the Roomba is 1/4" taller. Kinda dives under at an angle then grinds its tires trying escape. You literally have to wiggle and pull to get it unstuck.After several months we gave up and bought a thinner competitors model and moved this Roomba to the first floor. Now it has a new list of negative habits... it gets stuck daily on one of the thin throw rugs. If it doesn't ball it up underneath then it simply won't traverse the edge. Many times it gets onto the rug then will not drive itself off the edge back onto the hardwood.Very very disappointing because it does a decent job of picking up dust dirt and dog hair when it is actually running but unfortunately it is stuck more often than it runs.Our older model Roomba without WiFi and edge sensors did a much better job of not getting stuck and completing a cleaning cycle.The competitors model purchased for the upstairs is half as loud, fits under most of our furniture, runs much more smoothly with less bumping into objects and has a longer runtime. We will probably purchase another Eufy in the future. Especially with the price difference.Update... Added a pic of how easily it gets stuck.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020

   This was going to be my first robotic vacuum, if I hadn’t returned it. First, just as I unboxed it i noticed that it was packaged so that one of its sweeping bristly white brushes was bent in the cardboard  (see pic) so bad that it was angled upward making it unable to sweep anything. Which was weird because this is supposed to be a good brand you’d think someone would take care to package it carefully so as not to damage it’s own product...Second it really does just roll randomly and cleans in an unorganized way and I think I’d rather try the higher end model that cleans in a systematic pattern making the product more efficient...Lastly the robot would not “go home” back to its charging station. I tried placing it in 3 different areas of my home no stairs and no clutter in front and on it’s sides. Through the app I would press “stop job & go home” on my cell, the green dock light would illuminate on the roomba but it wouldn’t change course it just kept on cleaning around furniture.

I have to keep removing it from the same areas each time I turn it on which is quite annoying. If I wanted to move around so much I would have bought a hand held vacuum and do it myself

Review Text: The Roomba was better than excepted! You do need to empty it out each time after it runs. I have just made it a habit to do it when I get home from work. It picks up almost all my cats fur that is all over the place. I have a open concept living room, dining room & kitchen area but I do have large furniture in the way and it manages to maneuver through 10 chairs/bar stools, dining room table, kitchen island, 2 couches, 2 lounge chairs, coffee table and entertainment center. I have made sure no shoe laces, springs, cords etc are on the ground in the way. Does it leave a lil piece of dirt here and there, yes! But I’m sure I don’t get every piece when I sweep either. I can it once a day at 9am takes about 1hr 30-1hr 45 to complete all 3 rooms. We walk on the hardwoods barefoot and nothing sticks to our feet. Completely worth the time it saves me sweeping!

Review Text: I love that I can just set it down in a room, turn it on, close the door, come back in 30 minutes, and the floor is clean.  I wish I'd bought a Roomba years ago when my daughter-in-law first told me about it!

Review Text: The Rommba cleaned the area rugs without any type of pattern. Cleaned diagonally at random  and missed much of the rug. The unit could not transfer from hard wood to area rugs. Roomba did not have enough power to lift itself from the hardwood floor up onto the area rugs. We have 1/2" high area rugs and Roomba could not lift itself up on them. Maybe if you have flat area rugs it may work. Doesn't teach itself as stated and just runs in a random pattern. On hardwoods, it didn't clean well and the rotating circular brushes semmed to move the dirt around and not vacuum up the dirt. We returned this item and I would not recommend it.

Review Text: Was so excited to receive this.  After running one cycle the home base stopped working.  So the roomba would not charge up or work anymore.  major disappointment for the cost of this.  Amazon replaced the roomba and sent me a new one.Again excited to receive the new one.  After running one cycle the roomba has a bumper error that won't go away even after following all the trouble shooting methods.Poor quality to have so many issues with a new item.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020

Review Text: I needed a second Robot Vac. Seeing as I already had the Neato, I was wondering how much better the Roomba was! I found out quick! This thing SUCKS! And not up the dirt. It doesn't like to charge and I keep having to adjust it on its base to get it to charge. It doesn't return to its dock to charge when its done. It just beeps til I come get it. The dirt bin is tiny, and it leave stuff EVERYWHERE! Long story short, having both a Roomba and Neato, I'd say Neato is the right decision, go ahead and skip this IRobot unless you want to be Irate at yourself for purchasing it!

Review Text: I specifically purchase this model to be able to connect it to smart device, after a dozen tries with both android and iphone, I still cannot it get it connected, and I am a computer engineer. The quality of the app or the wifi hardware is just poor.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020

Review Text: Got this for my recently widowed mom.  She’s been doing all the house cleaning herself.  I thought I’d treat her to this since my dad is no longer around to do this.  It works amazing and even lifts up the nap of the carpet.  Mama does have to work so hard now
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2021

Review Text: Purchased this vacuum to clean up pet hair on a daily basis.  It does a good job cleaning up hair IF it doesn't get stuck.  It has not finished a job once since I got it (26 jobs) as it gets stuck at the top of the stairs or in the kitchen by the cabinets.  I had to purchase a virtual wall accessory and that keeps it from stopping at the stairs but it still gets stuck.  The one or two times it doesn't get stuck - it doesn't dock.  So I'm always looking for where it ended up when I get home so I can manually re-dock it.  It cleans the hair up great but has a lot of hiccups with the docking and getting stuck all the time.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2019

Review Text: I have hardwood floors which I expected was the ideal surface for the Roomba. It cleans well enough, but almost never can dock without my intervention. It just pushed the flimsy, too light docking station  around, then get totally disoriented and wonders off to the opposite end of the room.Also, when I need ro interrupt a cleaning cycle and send the Roomba home to dock it is almost never able to find the dock.This product fails to meet my expectations in terms of its intelligence.  Nearly every cleaning cycle the Roomba needs manual intervention, which really limits its usefulness and defeats the purpose of having a robot do the work.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020

Review Text: Love love love this thing! This little thing has made my life so much more pleasant. We have a toddler and a giant German Shepherd that sheds more than any dog I’ve ever had. I used to have to sweep and vacuum at least once every day but now I only vacuum the shag rug that the vacuum can’t get to and sweep where the Roomba doesn’t go. It gets stuck quite often but that’s our issue. Just wish that it had a broader signal with the home base.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019

Review Text: My Roomba is ok. It works really well in picking up the daily dog hair. The cons are that it bumps into the walls and furniture pretty hard, it can't find it's home, and it doesn't always charge when it goes back home. iRobot is sending me a new base and battery to see if that is the problem. I purchased a refurbished one so I wasn't too surprised that it would have an issue. When it works, I am super happy about it. When it doesn't, it's frustrating. I bought the product to make my life easier and I would say it's made it 65% easier.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021

Review Text: I've been wanting a Roomba for a long time and I've really impressed with this model for the price. It generally finds its way home after about 1.5 hrs of cleaning. Sometimes it gets stuck because I have a high carpet in one area but its not an issue, I just pick it up and restart it. I don't recommend having it run when you're not home because it can get stuck and just sit there until it dies. The suction is great. I'm honestly surprised with how much it picks up. I don't need a normal vacuum because of this Roomba!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020

Review Text: I thought it would be good to have it do the kitchen often.  We have tile floors.  It resides in the dining room.  It has a hard time running straight and therefore turns here, there and everywhere rather than just clean an area.  If I tell it to dock, it isn't a straight path.  But it does work.  Easy to empty and kinda fun.  I just wish it would go straight, turn around and go straight again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020

Review Text: Day 3 of having this product and I am incredibly unimpressed. The only good thing I have to say is that the suction is strong. Otherwise, it is loud, has a very small dust bin, maneuvers with no direction and not thoroughly, can't find it's way back to the docking station (even though dock is on a wall all by itself) and has somehow managed to get deep gashes all over the top of it (doing what, I do not know).

Review Text: I have a blonde Labrador who sheds. Since I purchased the iRobot Roomba 675 Robot Vacuum my wood floors are hair free. It is great for daily vacuuming and has made my cleaning job so much easier.

Review Text: Aaron (we named our Roomba Aaron) does a fantastic job on the surfaces he hits, and the battery life is great.  I’m pretty impressed overall. His pattern seems somewhat random and the “learning” of the house doesn’t really seem to be learning.  Whether or not an area gets hit sometimes seems like luck.  But for a quick day to day vacuum to keep down pet hair, he is fantastic!

Review Text: It’s great at what it does. It’s going to require your attention sometimes, especially at first, but it does get much smarter with time. Honestly I could do everything it does in half the time. My point is, I don’t have to. I can watch it vacuum and watch tv or aggravate the dog at the same time.

Review Text: This product is a "God Send" my floors were constantly in need of cleaning (dog hair) the iRobot picks up dog hair (I have a Australian Cattle Dog, Terrier Mix) It takes about 90 minutes to thoroughly clean a little over 700 sq ft.  I love it it and wonder why I waited so long to purchase one

Review Text: Bought this from my house for the tile floor. It has been great in picking up the dog hair they just accumulates daily. We no longer need to vacuum every day. But it also goes under a lot of tables that we can not get to with a regular vacuum.

Review Text: Bought this to replace a poor quality model from a different manufacturer.Quality tells.  This model is unobtrusive, does a very good job cleaning, is relatively quiet, and is easy to maintain.If you buy a cheap knock-off, you're wasting your time.  This one is worth it.

Review Text: Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. This vacuum bumps really hard on things, passes multiple times over the same spot, doesn't pick up all the dirt, and to find the home base starts bumping all the walls until by elimination it gets to the base. Review Text: The power cord did not fit the charger.  Only worked if I pushed and held the connection.  The unit was supposed to come charged.  The Roomba unit did not. I was then routed to a telephone number which attempted to sell me auto parts.  STAY AWAY from this product.

Review Text: How I love starting my Roomba, leaving my barn tack room and coming back to find the the carpet and floor clean. Sad Roomba needs rescue! If the Roomba’s dirt basket is full, it goes home to its dock. I love it!

Review Text: It is very loud compared to the Eufy vacuums and will wake you up especially if going over tile or wood floors. It gets stuck about the same as other vacuums. Review Text: It does an ok job cleaning the floors.  I just don't like the randomness of cleaning.  I find that it hangs out in an area for some time before moving onto another. Review Text: We have 2 dogs and 2 cats and it does a great job cleaning up.  we still run our trusty Dyson pet vac every now and again, but this will do a nice job on the carpets when we give it time.  the only drawback is the random bouncing around the room, the more expensive versions can track its own movement.  the only drawback is the the canister is kinda small for our needs with the animals, but it can do a complete cycle without having to empty it.  suction is good, it will pick up small legos and such, so you need to have things that that cleaned up before you run it.

Review Text: I am having to have a replacement. I received it already broken. The bin would not click into the machine. I am super disappointed. It is such a hassle to pack it back up and return it. Review Text: Between 5 people home from quarantine, 3 cats and a dog I was ready to check myself in trying to keep up. The app is a great perk too and all I have to do is ask Alexa or Google to start or stop her. Worth every penny and then some.

Review Text: This little vacuum does a great job!! I love mine. Review Text: Love this. Sadly, it needs emptying of tray constantly as we have a long haired dog. It does a remarkable job on carpet. Review Text: I love this vacuum. No, it doesn't clean as good as a good ol upright, but it cleans in places I miss. I have it set to run at 2 AM in the front of the house so I get up with clean floors!!

Review Text: I was a bit skeptical regarding this item. I heard from friends that this item works great. So I gave it a try. Wow! This vacuum does not disappoint! Review Text: I have a lot of furniture and loose stuff which Roomba runs into and then goes elsewhere (okay), but it can't see where the dirt is so it might take it forever to accidently run over it. Review Text: This a great vacuum and I love the fact that it’s working while I’m not home. It’s great for pet hair. Only reason I gave it 4 stars is the damn thing can’t seem to find its way home! Review Text: So far so good!  Took a while to get the mobile app connected, as it took me re-reading several times and tries to get the right series of buttons to make the connection!  Operator error there.  All in all, I have followed it around and it does a fairly good job pulling up dust and bits of dirt off the floor. But - it will keep my floors way cleaner than I could.

Review Text: I got one in November of 2019 and really loved it!  It worked great until about mid January when it started to curve rather than do straight lines. The side brush stopped working again this week (3/3/2020).  Returning for a full refund and will try another brand.

Review Text: The first time I used it, I had to let it run 10 times. Because the bin kept filling before it could finish. But since then, I run it every other day. It’s great. Review Text: My husband had been asking for a robot vacuum for years now, and I kept putting him off because I wasn’t sure how well they worked.  Well, I broke down and got him one for his birthday. She picks up all of the dog hair, cat hair, dust, etc. The only problem we have is that she gets stuck under our dishwasher (like under the cabinet). Luckily, she turns off, so the battery doesn’t continuously run! Also, she has made us keep our house picked up, because she will drag cords around.This has been one of the best purchases we have made since we have been married (8 years) and we highly recommend this product!

Review Text: There seems to be no rhyme or reason to efficiency as it wanders through the house. Returning it as very dissatisfied with its performance.

Review Text: I absolutely love my Roomba.  In fact I’m so happy with this product, I almost feel like I should tip her.  (I call my Roomba a her, the way some people personalize their cars).I have a house of teenagers, cats and dogs so there is an endless amount of fur and dirt.  This little robot cleans and everything looks so nice.  I love that I can turn it on remotely and when I get home from work, my house is vacuumed.  I have several different flooring types in my house- carpet, hardwood, tile.She does it all.  The only part she doesn’t get to well is corners and all the edges.  Still 100% worth it.  I love this product and can’t stop raving about it.

Review Text: This little device does clean well when it goes over a surface. The problem is that it gets stuck so often. It seems to also stay in one room longer than necessary. Review Text: Definitely glad I got this. I have 3 dogs, and 3 kids, all hardwood floors, and this keeps everything so much cleaner than sweeping and the normal vacuum. But the maintenance is so easy, I am lifetime customer for sure. And so much cheaper (price NOT quality) than the other top name brands.

Review Text: Hace el trabajo adecuadamente, quizás en algún momento le ha faltado un poco de poder de succión pero en general funciona perfectamente. La única situacióon que hemos tenido es que en algunos casos no ha limpiado todas las áreas aunque tenía bateria para seguir trabajando.

Review Text: The suction isn't that good. It goes to the same room over and over and over again. Review Text: I had a roomba which was wonderful, eventually it died and I did not hesitate to replace it. This one, however is horrible. It even has trouble docking itself. I am very disappointed in this model. Try a more expensive model maybe that will not have the same issues.

Review Text: Great vacuum but you get what you pay for. Not gonna do the job you would probably expect out of a $800+ Roomba, but for $200 I love it. Review Text: I got this for my elderly parents to help out around the house a bit. They really seem to like it and use it often. I dont think my dad has it hooked up to his google home yet, but I know he'll be excited when he does. Such a cool feature. Seems like something from The Jetsons!

Review Text: I have two huge dogs one German Shepherd at 80 pounds in the other at 160. We emptied a a couple of times a day but it’s been great with maintenance and we love it;We wish we bought it along time ago

Review Text: I bought specifically for dog hair as a lot of reviews raves about that feature. It cleans very random and does not pick up all hair. Personally, it’s very pricey for what you are getting.

Review Text: I own 2 cats and one large wooly dog and I was sceptical about it’s cleaning embedded hair on carpets. I expected well vacuumed wood floors but amazed how well it has performed on my carpets. With the pets I do use the Roomba everyday and do maintenance after “Scooter’s” session.  But it’s cleanup is a breeze and only takes a few minutes.If you schedule your Roomba to run while you are away from home, you should watch it the first time it vacs your place.  It can get stuck around certain  furniture  and knowing where - you can place items like shoes or books to block that area. You don’t want to get an app notice that your Roomba is stuck while you are at work!  I really love my Roomba and my floors have never before been so clean.

Review Text: So unhappy with this product! Does not function as advertised. Doesn’t clean all rooms in my small apartment or finish job or dock at home before running out of battery. Customer support is terrible. I’ve called 5 times in the 2 weeks since I purchased product, waiting 30 min. minimum to reach tech support. I’ve followed their instructions... wipe contacts with damp cloth, clean brushes, change locations, reboot. Nothing helps. Supervisor told me there is nothing wrong with it... that it works as it should and that if I want better results I need to purchase higher end IRobot. If not, then I should move my Roomba from room to room to clean my apartment, one room at a time!!!!DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!!

Review Text: I have had a Roomba 650 that I loved.  It was simple to run and simple to know when it was charged.  I nice orange light blinked around the Clean button when the Roomba was in the base to let me know it was charging.  The 675 model does not have this feature.  You get a Wifi and battery Icon (both small and you won't know they are they if you don't look) when it is charging as well as a green light on the dock and around the Clean button.  These all go OFF minutes after docking.  So when you go to use it again you will may find it is not charged.  Buy a 650 if you don't need Wifi.  I HATE this model and would return it if I could.  Not just my issue.  My friend has found the same problem.

Review Text: Works perfect and so much better than i excpected have a great dane and a yorkie and claens the hair andthe house. The alexa and phone apps to run it are a great bonus.

Review Text: My apartment carpet is almost 14 years old. I've tried the Rug Doctor and other shampooers to keep it clean but it always looks dirty. This little bad boy had done an amazing job and even though it's far from sparkling clean, the carpets (and floors) have never looked better.

Review Text: So frustrating that I cannot recommend this product. The vacuum is excellent and does a thorough and reliable job on wood floors and carpets. Why the poor review? Problem solved.

Review Text: It's nice to let somebody else do the sweeping around the house. After about an hour or so, the little guy has usually got the place looking spotless. In 10-15 years, we'll probably have some newer version of the Roomba that will make this thing look like a screw-driver. But I'm glad to be supporting the technology in its early days.

Review Text: Got this for my daughter for Xmas. She’s has two dogs.  With those two dogs comes lots of hair! She said this does a wonderful job. Only drawback is that she has to clean it every day. Review Text: I have had this for 2 days. I’m oddly a person that cannot stand to vacuum (lol) yet cannot stand a dirty house! This Roomba, for me, is a dream come true! Review Text: I loved my first Roomba so much that I bought a second one for my upstairs! I love watching it negotiate the stairs without falling down them. Definitely worth the investment and with frequent use, it cuts down on major push/pull vacuuming which hurts my back!

Review Text: We bought this Roomba in mid-November 2020. This is our 2nd Roomba. Works fine. We disassembled the machine and cleaned the inner works. Same error. This thing can sit on the floor of a fancy museum, it's so clean. Just don't expect it to vacuum the museum floor. We determined that the main brush motor died after just 3 months of use. No bueno!

Review Text: I have been using Roomba since they first came out.  Last year, my old Roomba stopped working.  I probably should have contacted Customer Service and looked into replacing the battery.  Instead, I donated it to Goodwill.  I have truly missed my Roomba.  I just purchased my second one.  I don't need fancy gadgets.  Just need dust vacuumed up.  We don't have pets or small children.  But, when I come in from outside and notice that my hard wood floors look a little dusty, all I have to do to press the button.  This keeps my rugs and floors looking beautiful until I am ready to do a deep clean probably once a month by using my big bulky heavy vacuum cleaner.  Definitely a great little helper.

Review Text: Has been working great since Christmas 2019. Review Text: This is incredibly noisy. It is difficult  to have a conversation on the phone or in person with somebody if it’s running. To be honest I’m not sure if it actually does a good job because it’s so noisy I don’t run it as often as I shouldThis is my third robotic vacuum and by far the loudest

Review Text: I love this Roomba!!  I was skeptical initially, but I am now a believer.  Amazingly, it covers the entire floor and then when the battery gets low it knows where the home charger is and goes back to it, connects itself and turns itself off. Fantastic!!  It picks up pet hair and pretty much anything else.  Another thing I like is it’s simplicity to work on.  A couple of times there has been dust or hair that has clogged the brush.  It’s just a simple matter of a screwdriver, remove the material clogging it and re-attach it.  Less than a minute!  I highly recommend this vacuum!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2020

Review Text: Was skeptical of these for years, didn’t think they really did anything, and were a novelty.  I was DEAD wrong!  This thing finds cat hair ( wood floors, area carpet) that my Dyson vacuum can’t find or pull up!  A pleasure to empty the bin after each cleaning to see “what we got today”.  I just tell Alexa to start Hazel and she’s off ....
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020

Review Text: I love this little vacuum! One complaint is that it gets stuck over a vent in the kitchen. If I sit something heavy on it, it works just fine. When the spinning brush stops turning I just clean out the roller brush and anything obscuring the spinning brush.  It works fine after that.  It cleans far better than I expected.  With 5 dogs in the house- 2 shed A LOT - it keeps the hair cleaned up....much better than I can with a broom or dust mop!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2019

Review Text: Works great but you’ve got to be patient with her . It will take time to clean up the entire house. It is noisy , so imagine having it on for 1:40 min - 2 hour ; but she makes sure to clean everywhere . For me it’s mostly the dust and the crumbs from the kids food throwing all over the place . I’m very happy with her . Make sure there is enough clearance below your couch if you want her to go under your couch , for me shes perfect :)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2021

Review Text: I didn't know I could love a vacuum this much but here we are. After reading mixed reviews, I wan't sure what to expect when it came to cleaning. I am more than impressed. Set up took longer than anticipated, (make sure you wipe down the battery connectors upon arrival) but one it was charged we were ready to go. I have had 3 rugs in my apartment since I moved in 2 years ago that I could never quite get clean with my vacuum or with a rubber rake. Roomba picked everything right up! This is the cleanest my floors have been since I moved in.It does take forever for the Roomba to finish the job and if you're watching it vacuum none of it makes any sense. But, just set it to go while you're out and you avoid that all together.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2019

Review Text: We love our new Roomba! He is very smart and finds his way around easily.  He doesn't do well getting onto rugs (I have to pick him up and put him on the rug, and if he goes off of the rug, he can't get back on.) Cleans up dog hair well. However, he doesn't always sweep every room.  The app is great!

Review Text: Literally sucks so bad. If you're dead set in getting one of these robot vacuums then go with the shark or something smarter. This one is not smart

Review Text: I would recommend for anyone! Had it for a couple years now and it is still going well. It definitely remembers where it hasn't cleaned. And it gets stuck under the bed a lot. But we just have a fun game of "find Bop" when that happensLong hair will tangle in the moving parts. But of course it does! Just clear out the brushes often. Keep replacement parts handy. And you will be happyDefinitely buy it

   Excellent. Picks up tiny cat litter that drops off the paws! I'm super busy with work & grad school. This saves me serious time on cleaning & does a great job. It seems loud but really isn't. I have the tv going & only slightly increased volume. It seems random but this is it's first go around in my room. I'm extremely pleased with my purchase.

Review Text: So I’ve had the roomba for about 7 months now and i regret buying this brand. I definitely should have done more research. Review Text: This iRobot is the best thing I could have ever purchased.  It takes a day or two to get the layout of your home but once it does , it goes like crazy.  The app is easy to download you can turn it on and send it to its home from there .  If iRobot gets stuck you are notified and it’s easily found . My home has no more dust bunnies and is cleaner than ever.  I could never get everything off the floor with a broom or vacuum cleaner!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020

Review Text: Ahhhh, the joys of technology. A simple command from your phone (or a hit of the ‘start’ button), and this little guy will be off to work on your floors.  As for suction, it’s no Kirby, but it also doesn’t cost $2K, and Kirby’s don’t run themselves. It’s a great product for a quick pickup, but save the deep cleans for the “big” vacuums.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2021

Review Text: My second one. Got one many years ago and had to get another one. Between the two I bought an off brand. Never again. "Roomie 2" lives up to his grandfather.They have improved it over the years. Great job to the designers. It deep cleans and the suction is great for all the dog hair in the house.

Review Text: First, the good--this has made my life so much easier, as it has pretty good suction and saves me time cleaning. It's supposed to return to the dock to charge when it's running low on battery power, but mine can't seem to find the dock, even if it's right beside it. And then it has problems docking properly, so even if you put it up against the docking station, it sometimes doesn't charge.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020

Review Text: I bought this vacuum as a gift for someone in Jamaica but little did I know that the iRobot home app wouldn’t work in the country. I am very disappointed and if I’d known I would have purchased a different item. I think they need to state that the Home app only works in certain region and frankly speaking I don’t see the need to block the app to certain regions. Luckily, I didn’t purchase the more expensive type because I would have been really pissed. The app needs to open for everywhere so everyone can benefit from it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020

Review Text: I was very skeptical when I first reviewed this product. I read review after review with mixed emotions, then I finally decided to give it a shot. I’ve had this roomba for 2 weeks now. The first day I got it I couldn’t wait to get the box open and let it run. Set up was easy, I let it charge for a couple hours, then I let it do it’s thing. I hadn’t vacuumed in 4 days, I wanted to see how well of a job the roomba would do. I have a Beagle and he sheds like crazy! The Roomba on its first round did an okay job, it didn’t get all of the dog hair out of my low sitting rug. So I figured I would set it to run everyday. A couple days in, the rug was as clean as the first day I bought it, and the rest of the house was cleared of dog hair! This roomba exceeded my expectations. My house in general is very clutter free, and has tile floor in the main areas. I only let it run in my living room, dining room, kitchen and hallways. The bedrooms have very dense carpet, and this is not made for that, which I knew when I bought it. As long as you keep all cords tucked away and clutter out of its way, it is worth the buy! If you are a pack rat and think this thing will navigate all your stuff, you are mistaken.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2019

Review Text: I do not know how we even lived before Roomba. I can finally walk barefoot in my own house without looking like I’ve been wandering the streets for 6 years without shoes. Don’t get me wrong, we are clean people, but we have 4 cats, 2 dogs, and 2 kids. So the floors are a constant mixture of dirt, sand, dog hair tumble weeds and glitter. I don’t even understand how roomba does it, because it just kinda wanders around the house in patterns that make no sense and then all the sudden the floors are spectacularly clean. The only regret I have is waiting so long to get the actual iRobot and wasting so many years on off-brands. We have the 675, and love the app, the Alexa connectivity, and just the all around power it has. It’s like the OCD son I never had.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2019

Review Text: Sadly, we opt to return product, but are ordering a lower end  Roomba model  Not anything wrong w/ the  Roomba except we are just not up to date on technology. and decided to go with a simpler one.I did use once - Pre vacuumed room, then used Roomba - Amazed at what she picked up that i missed. We have 2 dogs

Review Text: Gets “stuck” on a cliff every time. has yet to complete its task of two rooms. Makes one path in one room then goes to the other room and makes a single path, then goes pack to the first room. Then gets “stuck” on simple floor transition from floor to carpet. Gets stuck every night and has yet to complete its task. It runs well enough once it manually gets unstuck from a simple transaction or nominal object. Not for deep vacuuming. Good for surface dust.

Review Text: I LOVE this product! I have a 90 lb labradoodle that sheds enormous amounts of hair and tracks in dirt from the yard. This little gem picks up the hair, dirt and dust perfectly. I simply empty the tray after each cleaning and BOOM, done! Easy to move floor to floor by just moving the unit and docking station. If I could afford it, I’d have one on every floor if my home. I run this unit daily, takes the vacuum chore off my plate.(except for stairs) moves easily from hard surfaces over low pile rugs.

Review Text: How did I ever live without this thing? It is a ravenous consumer of dog hair. It learns its way around. The "Beep" when it starts is like music. It gets along with my Jack Russell more or less  (He's still a little suspicious, though when it gets near his feeding dish.). It is easy to clean, although the bin might be larger. It's a tad noisy, but hell it's a vacuum cleaner and still quieter than the useless HEPA thing I used to push around. It goes under things mostly, although the dishwasher door trapped it once. Oh, and the phone ap and WiFi is flawless. I used water to clean the filter twice and it seems to be holding up. There. That's my report Mrs. Amazon.

Review Text: I have a Golden Retriever... Does pick up hair but completely tangels in the brushes..spend a lot of time getting hair out if brushes. Could never leave home with it going it stops several times, have mostly hardwood with area rugs...Good for a first time experience, will probably research another brand or model in a year or so....For now Yes it will help me keep dog hairs at Bay between Regular Vacuum cleanings & that is what I wanted!

Review Text: I have four dogs living in my house; before getting a roomba, my laminate floors were essentially carpets made of dog fur. Plus, the the soil in my yard is a sand/dirt combo, so you can imagine how much of that got tracked in by the dogs. I had to sweep multiple times a day just to keep up with it all. Now I run my roomba every night and wake up to a clean floor every morning. No more having to wear socks around the house all the time or sweeping every day. This has changed my life and make living in my house with the four dogs so much nicer! It's not perfect and we do still sweep, vacuum, and mop every other week or so, but it has helped drastically!

Review Text: I’ve owned iRobot before and was extremely happy with my robot.  I think this time I got the robot that did not do well in school. I have rebooted and rebooted. Review Text: It's pretty good. It doesn't take the place of a real vaccum but it gets me through the week. It kind of just does what it wants. It will vaccum all rooms sometimes and other times not.
