Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   I bought both the eufy and Roomba robot vacuums but I have to say I preferred the eufy brand. I did some research for many months on the type of robot vacuums to get and glad I went with eufy. Roomba is a very popular brand and there’s a lot of rave about it but I honestly don’t know why that is. It is super loud when cleaning and gets aggressive when it hits obstacles. It has a random motion like other robo vacs in the price range so I didn’t see why it was much better than other robot vacuums. I also loved that my eufy came with a remote control which the Roomba doesn’t and I find that handy if I want to quickly clean a particular spot. Here are the pros and cons to the Roomba but I’ll go with eufy!PROS:-Since it’s a popular brand, it’s been known for its reliability.-Voice notifications from the robot-Easy to use app-I like the detailed cleaning notification on the app-Alexa enabled-You can click the home button from the robot itself. I didn’t like that my eufy didn’t have this function but luckily the newer model does.CONS:-Super loud!! Yes that is a huge turn off!-Bigger than eufy so makes it hard to go under furniture-Quite aggressive when cleaning..when it reaches obstacles it always wants to push through rather than go a different direction.In conclusion I prefer my eufy to Roomba.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020

Review Text: We had another brand robot vacuum from some Chinese knockoff that was cheaper and worked better.  Extremely disappointed.My complaints for hard surface:- instead of sucking up dust, it usually shoots it out in front.- literally goes right over small debris sometimes and doesn’t pick it up.- supposed to self dock and charge but doesn’t. Literally stops somewhere in the same room as the dock and receive verbal instructions from the roomba to dock it. Seriously?- suction seems very weak.- vacuum pathing is soooo random and all over the place that it takes forever to clean a room, IF it even stays in the same room. Usually leaves the room long before it can go over even half the room.Sooo disappointed. I thought getting this name brand vacuum would be a good experience. I even check out video reviews but just can’t believe this is the same thing that received top reviews.Seriously thinking to give this to a friend and buying something else. What a waste of money.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020

Review Text: Good battery life about hour and half.Strong suction good for carpet.Hair will get stuck around the sweeper brush.Often gets stuck on rug and says “it’s on a cliff”.Can’t get instead over any thresholds in doorways.App is convenient I wish I could control the direction from the app.Make sure it’s docked exactly in position to charge. The slightest bit off and it won’t charge.Doesn’t have felt bumpers to prevent scratching.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2021

Review Text: It is December 2020 and I only got this machine in August 2020 and I hate it!  This machine is the most unreliable "smart" machine I have ever dealt with.  It is very chaotic in how it goes about cleaning when it does.  It has a very hard time self docking and recharging. I will think it "went home" and is on the dock charging but isn't and then doesn't charge and will not go out on next programed cleaning day.  Even when I clean both the unit and docking station and place the unit on the dock myself, it doesn't stay on and rarely completely charges. It constantly "redocks" itself, it won't return to the home base even after pressing the home button on the unit and then through the app.  It doesn't really work with the laser boundary devices either as it is always still going past them and going in places i have "blocked off"  It is the most frustrating device i have in my home and would not recommend to anyone!  DO NOT BUY!  I hate this device, worst purchase ever.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020

Review Text: This thing was amazing for the first 6 months! Takes care of the job that I hate. However, i clean it daily and it kinda just wipes the hair around anymore. It also doesn’t dock on its own anymore, so now it just dies in random places around the house and you stub your toes on it when you forget to put it back. Oh, and the roomba no longer charges either, I have to shove a lego under its butt to connect to the docking station.I loved it, but will not be buying another IRobot brand in the future. I wish I got a little more good use out of it, there are better, cheaper, alternatives out there.Pros:I didn’t have to sweep as much the first 6 months.Cons:huge hassle to get to charge nowNo longer docks even if you press the buttonSweeps randomly, leaving messes and kitty litter all over the place, neglects rooms.SO LOUD.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2021

Review Text: BOTTOM LINE: My floors have never been cleaner. As a busy young professional I simply cannot compete with something that will vacuum for 90 minutes per day, every single day.  For that reason I will likely be a lifelong customer of robot vacuums, most likely this brand.That being said, this device is not without issues.  The primary thing that I run into is that it gets stuck 90% of the time.  That's fine with me, and this point I just expect it, and then move it when I get home.  It will get stuck behind a couch, it will get stuck on staircases, it will get stuck if it runs over a shirt.  The other major problem is that it won't necessarily clean the entire house it'll just clean a certain area and think it's done.  If it goes into a room and then manages the shut the door of that room, then it will vacuum that area and then stop.  There's no map in this version so it just mindlessly roams and sometimes that's just in a smaller space.The last thing that I wish was different, was the loud "ROOMBA STUCK" announcement at 3am, if you forgot to re-dock the vacuum. Or, if the Roomba decides it's not placed optimally on the charging station, the vacuum will turn on and then move around a bit until its in a better spot (again in the middle of the night).All of that being said, this just feels like we are in the beginning stages of an excellent technology. My house is clean, and thats why I bought this.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2020

Review Text: If I could give it 0 stars I would. I had to pick it up every five minutes because it would either say it was stuck or on edge of cliff, and when I would go to it it would be in the middle of the floor around nothing or beside the wall. Oh and if you have carpet don’t bother it doesn’t pick anything up. And it also can’t find its way back to the docking station half the time. And it looses WiFi connectivity with the app a lot. I had this thing for 24hrs and I’m already sending it back.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2019

Review Text: It's fun watching Harry (you get to name it) cruise around the house. However, it can get wrapped around things. One day my husband left his shoes out. Harry got the shoelace wrapped around the brush. Another day there was a string on my area rug. Again Harry got stuck and tangled up. I had a cord hanging down from a table for a Christmas lamp. Harry grabbed the cord and pulled the lamp down. It's Christmas and Harry got tied up in the tree skirt. So instead of child proofing my house, I have to "Harry proof" it each morning. It is loud, and it does bang into things. Wish it would be easier on the furniture. It works well with Alexa. If he's stuck somewhere you can ask Alexa where Harry is and he'll start beeping. If you're tired of the noise you can tell Alexa to send Harry home, and he'll return to the docking system.  I have 2 huskies and it does a great job keeping up on both the hair, and the dirt they track in all day (we have a dog door). You can schedule a timer for when to start. Overall I'm very satisfied.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019

Review Text: Why, why, why didn't I buy one of these sooner?? I am an animal lover and vacuumed nearly every day to keep up on the fur, dirt and litter. I always assumed this wouldn't work because my carpet is very high pile.I was wrong. I recently replaced my living room with wood floors so I thought it would be a good time to invest now that I had a space appropriate for it. But this little robot who could paid no mind and headed straight to the bedrooms (still carpeted) and did a fantastic job! I think he cleans better than my big vacuum.I run him twice a day and my house is cleaner than ever, all while I go about other tasks with the time I am saving. I'll be honest that he is a bit louder than I expected, but 3 of my 4 cats aren't scared of him, so he must not be that loud.I also think he can sense the cats because I swear he follows them around (and vice versa).So happy with my roomba purchase!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020

Review Text: I anticipated this being a budget friendly vacuum and not getting too much from it. We’ve had it for a few weeks now and I must say I’m extremely pleased. I have 4 dogs and 2 cats. I run it every 1-2 days. I have to empty it and or clean the wheels a few times a week. It has been amazing keeping the hair off the floor. And surprisingly it gets pretty good size debris. Extremely pleased with this purchase. Highly recommend if you’re on a budget.Update: after about 3-4 months of regular use, it has gotten progressively worse. Thinking the (same since we bought it) area rug is a “cliff”, not finding its dock to charge, dying in the middle of a cycle, getting stuck in the chair legs etc. it was awesome at first, but it’s more of a hassle to run this thing then just vacuuming ourselves.

Review Text: I've had this for a couple months. My husband got this for me and I wasn't 100% in. I have a small house and figured that it would be a waist of money for me. But I am amazed at how much it picks up. I love that it gets underneath my furniture and gets those dust bunnies. I have wood floors and carpets in the bedrooms. It has no problem going from floor to carpet. I just run it everyday while I'm doing dishes or laundry it is doing the vacuuming for me. Love it

Review Text: This product sucks...but not in the way it should. It will not vacuum on area rugs because it sees them as a danger and gets fully stuck underneath cabinets in the kitchen. I am so disappointed. I'm buying my old Shark again...

Review Text: This product is awesome! It does a great job. I turn it on when I'm dusting and by the time I'm finished, the floors are clean, too.  It's such a great product, I wish I'd gotten the more expensive model. You can't leave this one on unattended as it will get itself stuck on occasion. Worth the price, absolutely.

Review Text: Best investment.  Purchased as a birthday present so I didn’t need to vacuum every other day.  Love this!  Have 4 pets and the hair was getting to be unmanageable.  Need to clean the vacuum every other day (empty dirt trap and clean the pet hair off the brushes) but is so much nicer than doing the cleaning of the floors by myself. Review Text: Best best best purchase we ever made in our lives! We run it everyday and it helps SO much to cut down on me having to vacuum everyday! Only thing is it doesn’t do a good job going back to its dock. Takes forever! It is a little loud so we don’t watch tv with it on! I have really long hair and I shed myself so my hair gets trapped in the bottom of it and the little brush that spins. Other then that amazing to have! Love it!

Review Text: This is an great entry level robot. Cleans really well. Two things buyers should know: It doesn't do great around transition zones between carpet and wood and it can't be controlled or piloted through the smart phone app. I'm not sure why it connects to an app in the first place.

Review Text: I got this model on sale but found it very loud. The suction seemed subpar and I found most debris just seemed to be at the edges of my rugs rather than cleaned. It had some difficulty finding its base. Ended up returning and getting a Eufy 30 C Max instead, which I’ve been much happier with this far.

Review Text: I have used this twice and am not happy with it.  I have a 4 x 6" rug in my bedroom, not at all thick, and it will not go on to it from the hardwood floor or even when I set it on the rug and turn it on, it cleans a very few seconds, and stops. I would not purchase it again.

Review Text: The Roomba’s path is much too erratic to ever do a good job.  I believe it could run all day—if the battery would last that long—and never touch parts of my living room floor.  (My living room is definitely not that big!)It would probably do better if it occasionally made 45 degree turns from something that it touches, but it never seems to do anything that logical.  Don’t get rid of your regular vacuum or your dust mop.

Review Text: I LOVE IT! Most of my house is laminate flooring and the bedrooms are carpet. My Roomba cleans both types of floor very well. I clean the trash bin after every use. I have long hair and so does my daughter. So, I clean the hair out of the brush every 3, or so, uses. It really picks up a ton of hair!  I haven’t needed to sweep my kitchen and living area in weeks. I just turn on my roomba and she does the work for me. She does tend to get stuck easily, but the app on my phone notifies me when I need to go save her. This has been a huge help around my house. I love my Roomba!

Review Text: This replaced my 8 year old Neato vacuum robot. It is as loud as the old one. This model is taller so it doesn't go under certain furniture that my previous model cleaned well. It also gets stuck under some furniture... It is faster than the previous one... Pattern seems more erratic but it has good coverage.

Review Text: I bought this roomba vacuums for my mom's birthday. She has always wanted one but they are all so expensive. I found this one as the cheapest price that is $199 not including tax and shipping. It is helping her throughout the day so she doesn't need to clean after the dog's fur, or if she cooks and drops crumbs on the kitchen floor she doesn't need to sweep. Review Text: I considered other versions since I have so many pets and I wanted it to be able to pick up kitty litter, hair, and other dirtiness around the house. Review Text: Works great for picking up what can be seen from a standing height. In other words, it’s cleans the surface well only. Keep your Kirby for that once a month deep cleaning. Too late to return it now though.

Review Text: I have wanted a Roomba for years now. I have two cats and a pug and they all shed like crazy. I was having to sweep/swiffer daily to keep up. Review Text: Wanted this to work over my 2 yr old Ecovac Deebot but sadly it pales in comparison. 1. It's bulky and doesn't fit under my sofa sets, 2. It's loud and roams about aimlessly,  3. Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2021

Review Text: I have a Roomba downstairs  and another one for upstairs, and I like them so well that I bought this one for a family member.  I don't use the timer or the Wi-Fi connectivity because I have a cat that's prone to coughing up nasty hairballs, and find that it's best to make a visual inspection of the area that is to be cleaned before setting the Roomba to work.  They do a fine job on hardwood, tile, and carpet, and make the transition from one type of surface to another without difficulty.  The only reason that I didn't give it a 5-star rating is that I have three oriental carpets that have rather large areas of black in the background and the Roomba won't go over the "abyss".
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2020

Review Text: I bought a 1044 square foot condo in May (one floor). I also own a very messy cat who likes tossing kitty litter out of her box. I have tried a lot of things to contain the mess but nothing works. I figured I could buy this and it would be able to clean that mess up perhaps daily and it would help keep my floors clean. So I went ahead and purchased it.The first time I used it, it only cleaned the carpet in the living room running over the same spots again and again and again (which wasn't even that dirty, really). I let it go for about 15 minutes but had to stop because it was getting late and I didn't want to keep my downstairs neighbors up. Ah, yes, the sound. Let's discuss that.It is not quiet. It's quieter than a traditional vacuum, sure, but sometimes when the wheels are pointing a certain way on the hardwoods, tile or vinyl, it does make rolling noise that I'm sure my neighbors are hearing. Since it runs for a VERY LONG TIME (more on that later), even though it's not as loud as a traditional vacuum cleaner, it's super annoying anyway.I let Anastasia (they want you to name them on the app) clean again the next day, this time uninterrupted with free and reckless abandon. She cleaned for one hour and 16 minutes. The only "prep" work I did was to remove all cat toys from the floor. She did an OK job in living room and kitchen and dining areas, however, she knocked into my cat's water bowl twice, spilling water everywhere. Note to self: remove cat bowls before starting. She ran over cords  (I was worried about that but she did well--no damage), she ran into a boot tray with winter boots on it, knocking it about 2 feet away but she did not get stuck, much to her credit. Note to self: remove boot tray before starting. She also knocked door stops out of under doors and moved those over a couple of feet. Note to self: remove door stops before starting. She had trouble with dining room chairs, and going under the table. Note to self: pull the chairs out slightly to give her more room. Even though she was running for an hour and 16 minutes, she missed two rooms: one small bathroom and one bedroom. Not sure why. She got stuck under one dresser in a bedroom and could not extricate herself. She had to be manually removed (and it wasn't easy).I looked in her bin and it was pretty full, much to my shame and embarrassment. Wow. I didn't realize my house was that dirty. Thanks Anastasia!Next time I ran her (after removing the cat dishes, door stops, cat toys, and boot tray), she ran for about 59 minutes until out of sheer annoyance I stopped her manually because it was just too annoying to let her continue. I could barely hear my TV. I thought, people are probably running her when they aren't home. She went over the same spots over and over and over again. She did venture further into the rooms she had missed before, the bathroom and bedroom but she didn't do the entire bedroom. I read online that the more you use her, the better she will get. The jury is still out on that one.  She went under that same dresser she got stuck under previously, this time without issues. She extricated herself just fine.  Again, the bin was quite full and I even found an SD card in it! I panicked for a few minutes, wondering if SHE had an SD card in her which I knocked loose, then realizing, no, she must have sucked this up from the floor in a bedroom or something. Whew!The last time I ran her, she again ignored that second bedroom again. I picked her up by her handle, and placed her in that bedroom, where she happily cleaned for a little while but missed sections of it, then left, never to return. I noticed some white paint on her from my baseboards as well.Next time I ran her, she did over an hour. Again, the drill: pick up cat toys, pick up boot tray, pick up water bowl, pick up door stops, pull out dining room chairs, pull out stools from island. Ugh. That is when I wondered to myself, is this even worth it? Seriously? I thought about it and said well, if I was manually vacuuming, I would be taking the same precautions, right? I wouldn't be running over cat toys with it. I let her continue and manually stopped her after a little over an hour. This time her bin was not quite as full. Finally, my house is clean?!?!? So basically, I have not allowed her to run more than an hour while I'm home because it's just too annoying. However, I don't feel comfortable letting her rip while nobody is home in case she gets stuck or does damage.Anyway, now for the good and the bad:  The good is that she does a decent job picking up debris, food particles, cat food particles, kitty litter, dust bunnies and hair. She does a fine job of docking herself. She hasn't actually destroyed anything. That's it for the good.Now for the bad: you have to do a lot of prep work before running, she runs for over an hour which is annoying, she goes over the same spots over and over again and totally misses other spots, so there is constant babysitting involved, which negates the cleaning when you aren't home benefit. If you have to constantly prep your area, and babysit this thing, is it worth the money? I say no. It's not. It would be faster, easier and cheaper to just run a regular vacuum around the house. Oh, and my cat is absolutely terrified of her. There will be no cute You Tube videos uploaded of her "riding" Anastasia.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2020

Review Text: I used a Roomba for about 3 weeks and sent it back. It is by no means a way to keep your house clean the way a manual vacuum does. It misses areas and the battery runs out before it finishes cleaning all areas. My carpet is a charcoal color and it wouldn’t vacuum it at all. After researching this, it’s a flaw in the computer that thinks my dark carpeting is a cliff. There are a couple ideas on YouTube to fix it but they are not an acceptable solution for me. It also bumped into my light colored wood trim and scuffed it up quite a bit. I would NOT recommend buying one. I am going back to my dyson.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020

Review Text: This was my first roomba, though my parents had one over ten years ago so that was my only point of comparison. I assumed that it would have advanced a lot since then, but I think the main way in which it is different is that they've improved how much you need to clean the roomba itself. I have two cats and live in a 670 sq ft apartment with carpet and hardwood floors. This roomba is great for people on a budget! I think they easily could have included some of the nicer features of the more expensive ones in this base model, but I understand that they probably spent lots of money on researching the tech and need to make it back. Here's a pros/cons list:Pros:- This little guy has an instantly cute personality. He sings a little song when he successfully docked (more on that in the cons section) and is so stupid with the way it knocks into stuff that it's charming.- My floors are so clean all the time. I'm on the messier side and all of the surfaces in my apartment are so much dirtier than my pristine floors! It really does a good job of actually cleaning.- I thought it might struggle on carpet but it actually likes carpet and arguably does better on it than hardwood. I think this is another way in which it's improved since my parents had one. It can keep moving even with level changes of around an inch in height with no problem.- It can cover my small apartment well in about 30m, which is pretty good considering its path is random.- I have had it for a few months, but I haven't had to clean any of the brushes yet (it claims it'll let me know when I need to). Will update if cleaning them is a pain. But the back compartment that you empty is super easy to clean and pretty clean to do as well! That's rare for emptying vacuums. All you do is unhinge this plastic cover over the trash can and then put it back after the dirt falls out. Easy!Cons:- I get not including some features from the nicer models for reasonable business purposes. However, there is no reason that the dock needs to be hollow and light as a feather. This makes it so much harder for the roomba to dock as it SUCKS at docking. Even when approaching in a straight line super carefully it still messes up and misses around half or even more of the time. The design of the dock needs to be redone because the roomba's terrible docking success rate is just embarrassing and unnecessary. Though the song it sings of success after finally docking after multiple failed attempts makes the success all the cuter. But not worth it. Please redesign the dock roomba people! The literal least you could do is make it heavier so it doesnt get pushed around when the roomba misses. (This docking issue is the main reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5)- If you're getting this to be lazy about cleaning, just be aware that you will need to be on top of picking things up off the floor that the roomba could get stuck on or knock over such as wires, food bowls for pets, shoe laces, etc. If you forget to protect these types of items the roomba always manages to go directly for those things as the first thing it does, almost like it's doing it on purpose.- The scheduling aspect is there so that in theory the roomba can be on while you're not home. I personally don't feel comfortable doing this because it is quite stupid and gets stuck sometimes or needs help docking. So I try to be around when it's doing its thing, but it is pretty loud so it's not the most relaxing thing in the world.Overall, for the money, this is an amazing purchase and I highly recommend it. The biggest con is definitely the docking aspect, but it really isn't enough to negate the fact that I don't have to vacuum anymore and my floors are always on point. If you have the money, it might be worth getting the more expensive models because I wish that the roomba could map out my apartment and I could tell it which rooms to clean. The self-emptying dock sounds amazing as well. Now if I could just get a robot to hang my clothes back up for me...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2021

Review Text: If you’re looking for a machine that does little more than displace your rugs, get stuck on the edge of carpet, and needs to be put back into its charging cradle by hand, this is the one for you.When it’s not directly running over debris and leaving it behind, it’s grabbing the debris and throwing it clear across the room. I find myself spending the same amount of time cleaning up and straightening things around the house that it has displaced, as I would if I had just vacuumed myself. Which I still have to do on the carpet after it’s done. Don’t waste your money on this garbage.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2021

Review Text: We bought 2 Roombas about 6 months ago to clean 2 separate floors in our house, and it was a challenge from the start. It's gone downhill since. This review will describe the product in the first weeks and recent month.1. First weeks. They did a good job of picking up pet hair (2 large dogs) and child crumbs and filth. I liked how they can "dig" around chair feet to grab hair that was stuck to the chair feet. But they were LOUD. So loud that they could not be used unless we were out of the house or put on headphones. They weren't very "smart" in that they didn't seem to cover ground efficiently, but they "usually" got the job done. I say usually, because as often as not, they wouldn't find the base, or they would have trouble docking and couldn't charge. The base is so light that when the vacuum tries to dock, the base just spins around with it. It helps to put a rug underneath if you're on hardwood, but this is not foolproof. Sometimes, they would get lost and didn't make it back to base at all, so I often had to play "find the Roombas" with the kids. The Roombas missed charging often enough that I didn't even bother trying to set up the programed features, so I can make no comments about the programs. Still, my house was more clean, so I dealt with the noise and charging hassle without too much annoyance.2. Recent month or so. As I said, it's gone downhill. Neither Roomba charges at all without some intervention on my part. As you can see from the photos, one must have a very heavy stone weight placed at a certain location to the right in order to charge. The second one must have a lift from underneath. Even with these interventions, neither Roomba charges fully, ever. The one with the cardboard underneath only runs for about 20 minutes before dying in a random location. The one with the heavy weight runs about 40 minutes before death. Well short of the 90 minute run time they claim. In turn, my house isn't clean, and the fur piles are starting to accumulate.Based on the very short life span of these devices, a 1-star rating is in order. I am currently browsing for other robot vacuum options.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2020

Review Text: A Roomba is the equivalent of a lazy teenager with a vacuum cleaner. Rather than start in one area and carefully sweep side to side making sure to clean every square foot, the teenager and the Roomba randomly zig zag around the room maybe cleaning 70% of the floor and call it done. That's a Roomba - the lazy zig-zagging teen. We own a 2000 square foot home with carpeted bedrooms and hard surfaces in the living areas with area rugs. We have 2 dogs and so there are dust bunnies and pet hair scattered around. We bought the Roomba mainly so that when we leave, it would clean the hard surfaces and collect all the pet hair. It does not. It will zigzag around randomly for 45 minutes. When the cycle is done, the Roomba is full of pet hair and dust. Where it goes, it does clean very well. However, it does not clean everywhere. Imagine you have a large square room that is empty. Imagine an even coat of dust on the entire floor. After a Roomba cycle, imagine a bunch of zigzag lines where it cleaned some of the dust and left some behind.Bottom line, we paid $300 for a machine that will run randomly about the house, often get stuck on or under something and stop. When it does complete a cycle, it will be full of dirt, but we still need to use the vacuum to clean all the pet hair that was left behind. If you have lots of hard surfaces and want to come home to a floor completely clean, you'll either need to hire a maid or vacuum yourself. As I mentioned in the header, where it goes it cleans, but it goes randomly about and leaves lots behind where it doesn't go.Not sure we'd buy one again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2021

Review Text: It looks like my last Roomba but thats the only similarity. It struggles in ever way. It is not nearly as powerful as my olf iRhomba in any way. First it struggles at the carpet edges to transition onto them from my hardwood. I have flat non plush rugs and it just pushes up my carpet edges like there is a wall versus moving onto them over that simple height. So it has yet to return to base before getting stranded because there is always some carpet to climb which it treats like a wall. The battery life is about 45 minutes. So the wireless feature to locate it is useless because by the time it stops from struggling against fictitious walls (rug edges) , the battery is too low for it to respond.  Next, the brushes don't get clogged up with pet hair nearly as often as my first iRomba but it's likely because the quality of suction just didn't or couldn't pick any pet hair up.  So when I empty the debri chamber (which holds half the old iRomba capacity due to the oversized filter in it)  it is generally filled with lint only.... Never cereal, a pin and defintely not a penny or anything heavy like the older IRomba handled. So those those non rubber brush may look like they can do something but im comparison, it don't really address much due to the weak suction.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2020

Review Text: Great product just works and works so much you want to pet it!!:)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2018

Review Text: If I could give zero stars, I would. Stopped working a few weeks after we purchased it. My husband was able to troubleshoot it and get it working again. It stopped working again and we can’t get it running. Contacted Amazon who was no help to us. We had to contact iRobot directly which is a pain in the ass. Won’t be purchasing electronics through Amazon anymore.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2020

Review Text: Works well, but have to go out of my way to prepare my apartment before it runs - ie putting chairs up on tables, making sure no cords touch the floors, etc.I even bought new dining chairs and while considering which ones to get, I tried to get ones my roomba wouldn't get stuck under - it still gets stuck on my new chairs.Out of the about 20 cleaning jobs its done, it finds something to get stuck on about 90% of the time.This is not the model with ai that can learn to avoid areas that previously gave it trouble. My apartment is nothing out of the ordinary, so unless you have an especially open floor plan with practically levitating furniture and no thick rugs, this thing will most likely not be anywhere close to perfect.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018

Review Text: This is the third robot vacuum that I have owned. My last two were a different brand, which I loved, but because they didn't last more than a couple of years, I thought I would try something new. This model had great reviews. And while the vacuum does a nice job cleaning, it is so incredibly loud. I was able to run my old robot vacuum any time of day without being disturbed. This vacuum is so loud I have to run it in between meetings because of the volume. I am not happy with the purchase for that reason.

Review Text: This lovely invention has made a huge difference in the amount of dog hair in our home. Our yellow lab sheds a great deal, and after having the roomba for at least two weeks, we could see a visible difference. I still need to vacuum rugs and carpets, but the daily chore for controlling dog hair is well taken care of by roomba.

Review Text: Constantly gets stuck under furniture. Doesn’t map so that it can avoid the places it gets stuck. Would prefer a thinner model.

Review Text: The iRobot works very well on our wood floors. It runs for about an hour and a half then finds it's way back to home base about 80% of the time depending on how complex your floor plan is. It can get hung up on electrical cords or on furniture. It will send you a message on your phone when finished or hung up. It worked so well we had our daughter get one and she has two dogs and lots of dog hair. It works great for her too!

Review Text: Finally, I have found the vacuum that picks up all the dog hair that my dog leaves around the house! For those who aren't aware you can connect the vacuum with your google home or alexa. I recommend using "IFTTT" app to do so. I have mine set up so I can just say "Clean Up" and the roomba starts. The roomba also has scheduling options and it text's me when it's stuck!

Review Text: bought this product on sale over black friday and i was super excited for it!!!Things I like about it:-pretty decent for basic cleaning, even on carpet-connected to an app via WIFI for troubleshoot, cleaning schedulingThing that you should know-the battery life is very low, even in the first few runs; took hours until full charge, dies in an hour; this is a MAJOR MAJOR issue for me, because our house is ~3500 sqft and the battery dies not even half way through...I won't recommend this product.

Review Text: We followed the instructions EXACTLY and had absolutely no problems yet.  Surprised at how much it picks up!! Review Text: I’m not exactly sure what I was expecting here but I find this product very frustrating. It cleans in an extremely weird pattern, like a drunk person would. It doesn’t RE-dock well. It just doesn’t do anything all that great. Again, maybe expectations were unrealistic but I just expected some kind of uniform coherent process, not totally random and sporadic cleaning. It will miss many spots but hit the same clean spot 15 times on one clean, get lost, and not make it back to the charger. Will be returning.

Review Text: Our dogs don’t shed but apparently my girls and I do because it picks up lots of our hair. I have to remove from the rollers after every use. Works very well although sometimes it will take forever to go back to its station after being told to do so.

Review Text: the brush stopped working and I've been trying to contact customer service without any luck... it's ok for hardwood floors but not for carpet.it's nice that you can do other stuff while it's "cleaning" but you still have to supervise it as it goes aimlessly...it goes over the same area and misses  a lot along the way

Review Text: It got clogged frequently, constantly got trapped under a piece of furniture.  The brush got tangled and distorted.  Every five minutes I had to rescue it and untangle something, take it out fromUnder the bed etc.  more work than a regular vacuum

Review Text: I love this roomba! Perfect for me I have long haired pets, so this really helps with keeping my carpet cat/dog hair free. BUT something to think about before you buy. If you have a pet that isn’t house broken, or kids/pets that track in mud the roomba will run over the mess and spread it around. Not to mention that you’ll have to also take the little guy apart to clean it. Also before you run the roomba do a quick check under furniture for small objects that can get stuck in the roomba. Other than that it’s soooooo worth it I hardly ever have to vacuum any more. I just set up the cleaning schedule for the week  and empty the dust bin when I get home.

Review Text: He gets in corners and under furniture very well and gets all the dust and hair on the surface of floors and rugs. He sometimes gets stuck on plush (> 1" thick) bathroom rugs because he thinks he's going to fall off a cliff. He can only run for about an hour and a half to two hours a day and sometimes can't make it back to home base in a house with 2,200 ft². Our floors are so much cleaner now.

Review Text: Her name is Betty. She's my very best friend. The cats don't mind her too much, and I cannot live without her. You can have my Betty over my cold, dead body.

Review Text: I love this iRobot, but, one of the green rollers is already broken and the other is on its way. I’ve tried to call but haven’t been able to reach anyone who can help me. No sense of direction at all, and it gets stuck all the time! If you have a semi thick rug forget about it! It can’t get on top of it. Review Text: After receiving my IRobot Roomba 675, I got help from my adult son to hook it up. He said it wasn't that complicated. I was surprised at how well it works. Review Text: Don’t waist your money!! Couldn’t connect to IPhone , WiFi. My opinion it rolls around randomly. But if you have furniture I’m it’s way, ex. Review Text: The only thing I’m sad about is I did not own one sooner.  It has made my life so much easier and cleaner!!  My daughter and grandson moved back home with us for a little while. Review Text: Meh, people say this thing is amazing. It is not. It's cool if you hate vacuuming but it takes over an hour to navigate my home. Review Text: This little beauty works awesome.  I am always surprised how much dust and dirt it finds in a short time.  It is great for under beds and funiture.  It has NO problems with rug fringe (something I was concerned with before purchase).  It has only been hung up on lose small rugs and on TV cables.  It can’t “see” table posts so it tends to hit them hard.  It gets banged up a bit from doing that.  I wish it was programmed to go in circles more, as it tends to be random and misses areas.  Overall, I’d buy it again.

Review Text: If it wasn’t for the dog hair it was picking up that I couldn’t see I would have sent it back. Just bounces all over the place missing a lot of spots. But after thinking about it I really should have sent it back. Shark seems to have a better product. At least it learns the floor plan whereas this one does not. Wish I had sent it back.

Review Text: This vacuum was great at first. However 7 weeks later the front brush doesn't spin anymore and there is not any hair or anything around it preventing it from moving. For the price of this vacuum I expected it to last longer than 7 weeks. It makes very loud noises now The quality just is not there.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2021

Review Text: 6 months later will sit on base but will not charge. Have cleared all contacts. Never would return to base either.  Would just vacuum and stop where it died. Very disappointed.

Review Text: I love this little vacuum! I use it daily to keep dark hardwood floors looking tidy. It’s very useful!

Review Text: This would be great as a hand held vacuum because it really does have great suction and cleans dirty very well.The problem is the “room mapping” technology, which is basically just the thing bumping into walls and then turning in a random direction. It will go over the same spot 20 times while there’s a pile of dirt 2 feet away and in those 20 times it will find a way to get stuck on something. So unless you have a square room with basically no furniture, you really need to babysit the thing and can’t leave it alone. And it’s not very quiet, so you might as well just vacuum yourself because it’s gonna take 5x as long for it to bump into the places that need to get cleaned.

Review Text: I can’t recommend this Roomba enough! Efficient, cleans really well and runs well over an hour before battery dies or job is complete. I only have about a 1k square foot apartment so it works great for me. Best part is how easy it is to clean the two brushes. I have long hair and fuzzy carpets but cleaning and emptying the canister is a breeze. 10/10 tell everyone to get this much more affordable then newer models and does phenomenally at reaching every inch of my place. The Braava is next on my wish list!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019

Review Text: Love this little gem. I have new carpet in my living room and I set the schedule to run every day just over the new. Occasionally I will run my Shark over the same carpet and there will be nothing  in the canister!!!

Review Text: I have owned a Roomba before and I really missed having one. With such a bargain price for one I decided to purchase one again. I think everyone deserves a Roomba in their life to make life a little easier.

Review Text: I’m always amazed at what I get out of the dust compartment each time I run it. Things you didn’t know was there. Between my cat and my hair it has been really convenient and beats sweeping constantly. I hope it lasts for a long time

Review Text: The iRobot 675 was very disappointing, once it goes  back to the charging dock to recharge, it's done.  It will never charge and go out and finish  cleaning.  It also didn't do the job I thought it would.  I've since purchased a Neato D7, and it is perfect.

Review Text: Hate it.  Hate it.  Hate it.  Inefficient, rarely makes it back to the charger.  1 hour and a half and it is out of power, needless to say - that might clean one room.  For comparison I had a Eufy - it was ten times the vacuum as this cumbersome lug - and would clean for a minimum of three hours and always find its way back to the charger.

Review Text: Vet dissatisfied with the performance of this. If we put all the chairs up and block off areas it may do ok but it gets stuck on little edges sometimes.

Review Text: Best features:  Quiet; cleaning the debris collector is easy; smart set-up was a breeze.Docking has been a problem with this machine.  Sometimes the robot will clean one room repeatedly (rather than moving to the next room) until out of power and then just stop.  Many times it has returned to base without properly connecting.  There is no indication that the robot is not charging but is out of power the next time we want to use it.  Clearance is another issue--the robot get stuck under our recliners unless we remember to extend them before starting the cleaning process.

Review Text: I was skeptical about how well this could actually clean. Review Text: I purchased for my Mom as a gift to help her post surgery.  The first one had an issue with the sensors and repeated an error message.  Kudos to Amazon for a simple return process!  Second one arrived quickly and worked as promised.  Unit does a good job overall.  It goes where it wants to so dont expect a uniform cleaning.  It can be a  bit mischievous and has grabbed small area rugs, a bathmat etc and dragged them off.  It locked itself in the bathroom once by pushing the door shut and then the battery died.  It’s all quite entertaining for my mom.  It does a good job on a high pile rug that her expensive upright never could quite get clean. All in all, very pleased and will be purchasing one for me!

Review Text: I was very Leary about buying a robotic vac. I always felt that it could not do a good enough job . This Roomba 675 was on sale near Christmas, so I took the chance ! Review Text: I don't have pets, so nothing newsworthy. But, for everything else -- dust, dirt, pine needles, errantly-dropped breadcrumbs, etc. -- it did a great job! And the one time it got tangled in some string I inadvertently left hanging on a low shelf, I got a phone alert letting me know...perfect!  My only issue is how loud it can be, but it DOES have to suck things up and move around, so that's something I can easily work around. Bottom line:  A wonderful product that does what if says it will do.

Review Text: It does 90% of the job.  yes it leaves out some but at the end of the cycle the floor looks much clean.  i am able to walk on the floor bare feet.  you should start the cycle and forget it,  it takes a long time but you can focus on other work.  when i need to use only high traffic area where it is dirty,  i use in that area by restricting its movement by blocking pathways but it couldn't find the base when i do that.  once in a while it gets stuck so not sure how it will work when you start remote or schedule and you are not available.  overall i am happy with the product my house is much cleaner.

Review Text: Rascal is a Cavalier King Charles Spaniel. His breed is at the top end of shedders. The iRoomba does a great job of picking up!!! Review Text: I only gave this a 5 star because my issue with the lousy squeaking noise was handled fast.  It works Amazing for non carpeted floors. Review Text: There wasn’t much explanation on how the rumba works so the first time I used it I didn’t think I would like it but the more I used it The more I liked it.  It does a great job of cleaning and it seems to learn the floor plan. It’s a little noisy but you can live with it. I’m house bound so I am always here. You can run it when you are not home. Put the app on your phone and you are able to control the rumba if your not home.

Review Text: So where do I start. I've had this for about two months and the spinning sweeper brush is already broken. I followed the cleaning guide but I can clearly see that the plastic is broken. Review Text: Okay, I have a Neato that we've had for at least five or six years. That one gets it. It can overlap, it knows where it's been and knows where it's going. And only cost about $300. It starts up, randomly takes care of the house missing parts of the Carpet and Floors. I'll never buy one of these again.

Review Text: I am using for general cleaning of the floor. I have no pets and floor is ceramic and deep carpet.I start to have problems from the beginning. Almost every day it did stack somewhere or lost the battery power in the middle of cleaning. I had a message for help on my phone, but I am not at home. After coming back home I do whatever necessary and sometimes it starts in the morning and sometimes it asking for help again. Unfortunately I missed the time to return it back to Amazon. It does required  additional design time.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2021

Review Text: If you’re looking to never use a hand vacuum ever again, then this is not for you; because you will be severely disappointed.This is a machine that will bump its’ way around your home and travel in no particular direction. However, that is exactly what you signed up for. This model of the Roomba does not have a mapping feature, so to ask why it wonders around aimlessly is pointless. If you’re looking for a machine that’s going to replace your hand vacuum forever and clean as efficiently as a cleaning service, then you might need to look at the $700+ models that DOES have a mapping feature and higher specs. This $200+ is more or less a base model and is not ever going to replace your hand vacuum.I have myself and one dog in a 700 sq ft apartment (no stairs; but lots of floor rugs!) There is a consistent layer of dog and human hairs on the carpet and floorboards. What the Roomba does, is it zooms around my apartment during the week, picking up stray hairs and dust bunnies as well as get under the coffee tables and cupboards. Getting to those harder to reach places; or items of furniture I’m always too lazy to move out of the way to vacuum. This means that in between the times that I use my hand vacuum (about once a week), I don’t have a crazy amount of dog hair floating around and I don’t need to go out of my way to vacuum in those hard to reach places. It has had no trouble at all climbing over all of my area rug, doormats, bathroom rugs (high pile with tassels!) or any of the multiple smaller area rugs in the hallway or the bedroom.You do need to clean the dustbin out after each use, and it says that as part of the maintenance. Running this Roomba for an hour in my 700 sq ft apartment, with one dog and one human’s worth of hairs will fill up the dust bin. If you’re buying this to run continuously in your 3000 sq ft home; again you’re going to be very disappointed. Owning this particular model of the Roomba, there are going to be some limitations. You can’t compare a $200 product to a $700+ product and expect that they perform the same way with the same bells and whistles. If you’re looking for a robot vacuum that picks up the hairs and dust that life throws at you in between deep cleans, then this is for you.Customer Service with the iRobot team has also been great. I had some connectivity issues and they were super responsive and solution orientated.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2021

Review Text: This little robot makes me regret ever having given any other item a 5-star rating.  The fact that any other purchase shares a rating with this Roomba somehow feels like sacrilege.  If only I'd known the degree to which this little semi-sentient cylinder would take on an air of the sacred, perhaps I would have done everything differently.  For starters, I would have gotten one sooner - much sooner.If Amazon would let me pick just one purchase and give it a 7-star rating, it would be this one.The first week with this little robot was very telling.  We could run this thing on what we thought was a clean floor, only to find its dust bin clogged with filth.  We repeated this twice a day for a week, constantly in awe of the amount of detritus that was making the transition from our floors to our trash can.  We run this every night now, so things have settled down a LOT in the filth department.  It's difficult to even think of those dark days when a bare foot or a white sock would be darkly stained after a quick jaunt through our home.You may be thinking to yourself:  "There's too much junk on my floors."  "The kids' toys are everywhere."  "What if it hits a wet mess?"  "It's going to tangle up a power cord."  "It's going to be a pain to empty."  "I can just vacuum the old-fashioned way."Stop. Stop. Stop.  Why do you treat yourself this way?Knowing that a machine is about to vacuum every square inch of home while you do something else WILL CHANGE YOU.  It will change the way you live.  Cleaning up the clutter will no longer be an unrewarding drudge.  Organizing your power cords will bring you joy.  Everything you do that clears a path for this little mechanical joy emitter will make you feel like a hero.  You will become attuned to any mess that could possibly interfere with the Roomba's sacred mission.  Don't worry about whether the Roomba will fit into your life.  It will change your life.Emptying the bin takes 30 seconds, most of which is a walk from the charging station to the trash can.  Everything on this robot that needs maintenance or cleaning is designed to easily pop out and pop back in.  Once a month, I pop out the rollers and cut out the accumulated hairs (we're a long-haired people).  That takes a few minutes, depending on how thorough I want to be.  I put in a clean filter occasionally - another 10 seconds.Other tidbits:* This vacuums under my sofa and bed.* Last month, I put my Oreck upright in the attic.  It hadn't been touched in months.* I hooked this up to my Google Home account, so I just say "hey Google, run the vacuum" to turn this on sometimes.* It reminds me of when I was a child and I didn't much care about leaving a mess because I knew someone else would take care of it.* My kids love it, and they have learned that whoever wins the "toy cleanup championship" gets to push the button to turn it on* This feels like one of those technological advances that will completely consume its predecessors.  Children won't understand why old phones had rotary dials or why old vacuums had handles.Twenty years from now, I'm going to look back on 2020 as the year I got a Roomba.Okay, maybe that's a stretch.  I will say, though, that it has been a source of unmitigated pleasure in a year where such delights were tough to come by.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2021

Review Text: Review for:  "iRobot Roomba 675 Robot Vacuum-Wi-Fi Connectivity, Works with Alexa, Good for Pet Hair, Carpets, Hard Floors, Self-Charging"We bought a Roomba i4 (4150) at Costco and loved it so much for its ability to clean the hardwoods & tile floors downstairs that we bought this Roomba 675 (a week later here on Amazon) for dedicated cleaning in our Florida room (330 sq. ft.), where the i4 can't reach because of a step-down.The Florida room has our cat litter boxes and also a wood stove, so there are plenty of opportunities for debris on the ceramic tile floor, such as cat hair, cat litter granules and dirt, ash & wood debris.  Daily cleaning is a must in this room and the 675 does a great job!  We have a schedule to have her run overnight.  It's nice coming down to a clean room every morning!The app is good and provides status, scheduling and feedback.  Since we have two Roombas running from the same app, we named the 675 "Flo" (for Florida room), and the i4 "Rosie," who cleans the entire downstairs.  We'll get messages such as, "Flo completed her job but needs to be emptied," or "Flo is stuck - go help her!"  Cute and handy.  You don't have to use the app though - if WiFi is unavailable you can just use the buttons on top of the unit.Notes:1.  Long hair will occasionally get tangled around the brushes.  Cat hair is NOT a problem though - gets sucked right up!2.  Like other Roombas, move cords out of the way.3.  I clean Flo's brushes, wheels and the fine particulates filter about once a week or so.  Your mileage may vary, depending on how often you use it and how dirty the room is.4.  The 675 can sometimes have difficulty getting back up on the docking/charging station.  Not because of any technical issues with homing but rather getting the nose wheel up over the initial hump of the docking station.  I may sand down the front of the docking station to create a more gentle angle for the wheel.  The i4 does not have this issue.5.  Use Command™ strips to hold the docking station to the floor & keep it from moving.The bottom line for these Roombas:  they do clean and make a noticeable difference with how the house looks and you can get some time back from having to vacuum.  I recommend any Roomba - model 675 and higher - without hesitation.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021

Review Text: At first I was not happy with the Roomba. I have laminate floors with several area rugs. One under the dining table, in front of the sofa, a runner at the door and in the kitchen, all in a "great room." It would not reliably transition from the floor to the rugs. and once on a rug it would often go into error stating it had reached a cliff. It would not cross the threshold into the bathroom transitioning from laminate to vinyl. It was frustrating to say the least. I decided to try it in my bedroom. It still could not deal with the rugs. I was determined to figure a way to get my money out of it. Ultimately I used, smaller, thinner rugs next to the bed set firmly in place using tacky putty.  It even mattered where they were positioned, the distance between rug and nightstand because of how it approached the rug. After a few adjustments of other obstacles it got hung up in, it has worked flawlessly since. It is smart, and programmable, and through the Wi-Fi  connection it tells me on my phone when it needs help or completes a job. It vacuums under the bed and running it twice a week is adequate to keep my floor spotless. I would recommend it if your floor is of one composition. I decided to try a Eufy Boost upstairs since they were on sale and boasted of large wheels and traction. That thing runs like a 4wd. It will climb your foot. It tries to climb the stainless bases of my bar stools and polishes them in the process. It has no problem with rugs or thresholds and once again, after adjusting obstacles it encounters, has worked flawlessly. It is not as smart as the Roomba and runs in a random pattern, but after a few sessions it has cleaned the floor and kept it that way. It has two options, program it to run everyday at a certain time, or on demand. Not needing it every day,  I do not mind starting it on demand when I want because it is so quiet in comparison to the Roomba. So I can be watching TV without it disturbing me. I am definitely going to buy a 3rd robot for the mudroom/laundry so all the floors are covered but it will not be a Roomba because it has thresholds and rugs. So analyse what your needs are before you buy one of these robots and save yourself a headache.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019

Review Text: I've only used on hard (bamboo) floors, so not sure how well it would work on carpet.  This is such a time saver for me.  I have 2 dogs, one cat, and three young kids so our floors get plenty dirty.  I programmed it run at night when we are in bed.  It makes a fair amount of noise, but it doesn't bother us because I use it on the lower level and we sleep on the second floor.  I empty the dustbin every morning and it's usually pretty full.  The only annoying thing is that it gets stuck on our rubber floor mat.  It goes over a different one easily as it is thinner.  I pick up the thicker mat and the rag rug I have, along with our kitchen stools every evening so it can do a thorough job.  Strangely, it hadn't gotten stuck on the Christmas tree skirt at all yet.  I'll also add that we have a sunken livingroom so there's a step down and it has never fallen off the edge.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2020

Review Text: Like someone else said in their review, to say that this vacuum runs around my house like a drunken sailor would be an insult to the sailor lol. There's no rhyme or reason, but it seems to get the job done, hasn't gotten stuck anywhere (knock on wood) and has made it back to its charger. It's quite a bit louder than a different brand that I purchased but that one also didn't have as much suction and got stuck fairly often.All that being said, I've run the vacuum quite a few times and it never seems to make it into the bedrooms, and if it does then it makes a pass or two and then heads back out the door. All in all I think it's a great vacuum for the money, which is why I rated it 4 stars. Unfortunately, since our floor plan is kind of compartmentalized I think we'll need to go with one with a mapping feature.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020

Review Text: The kids always want new pets. So we adopted Alfred, The Roomba. The most helpful pet ever.However, after the maiden voyage:*Alfred reminded me a lot of drunken college students. He bumped into everything, needed a lot of help, and made a bigger mess than he cleaned up (though he vacuumed nicely).* The "object sensing" feature apparently means "not-so-gently rams things".  ALL the things.  He staggered through the kitchen, broke a decent sized mirror I had leaned up against the wall to rehang and didn't bother to clean up after himself.*Alfred texted me twice while I was in the shower to tell me he needed help.  One text said he was stuck on a cliff. He's a bit dramatic.*In my 20 minute shower, my other half had to rescue and redirect him a couple of more times.*He ate a phone cord.*His "mapping" feature looked a whole lot like him going in random drunken, squiqqly paths everywhere.In summary, he cleaned with a better attitude than I do, but he was loud and obnoxious about it.  The dog is terrified.  The cat stalked Alfred like a lion on a wildebeest.  Alfred shattered a glass mirror all over my kitchen floor and drove away like nothin happened.  So in his 45 minute maiden voyage, we had to rescue him a total of four times, spent 15 minutes cleaning up his mess of broken glass (which, of course, I cut myself on), the dog needed a puppy-pot chew to calm down, but the floors look awesome!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2021

Review Text: The Roomba 675 seems to be of high quality but it makes a lot of noise as it cruises around. It doesn't detect narrow legged furniture so it rams into such fine furniture at high speed, ramming and ramming so I had to stop it as I was concerned that it may break the legs of our fine-legged furniture. I would expect that it works well with furniture with wide legs. On wide strips of baseboard it slows and gently taps it, but on baseboard corners it rams into it at high speed, promising to eventually leave black marks. I don't understand why the manufacturer doesn't provide soft white foam bumpers on it. The navigation engine is not brilliant as it seemed to repeat its patterns and thus missing areas to be cleaned. The wifi connection didn't work for me, but I didn't put a lot of time into troubleshooting it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020

Review Text: OK. I am in an interesting position where I can compare 2 of these vacuums. I previously owned a Deebot N79. It ran for about 3 years with a battery change last year. It finally stopped charging even with a new battery. So I bought a Roomba... Ok, I have 2 small, husky type dogs that blow their coat every 6 months, a cat, and laminate floors with a couple of fluffy door mats. The house is open plan but has quite a bit of furniture to negotiate. So both vacuums had the same task. The Deebot was better.1. The Roomba only has a single front brush. So bits tend to get flipped across the floor. Also when it circles, it circles on the brush side, which seems counter-intuitive2. The Roomba is noisier, quite a bit loader.3. The Roomba moves faster, tends to overrun dirt rather than always picking it up4. The Roomba sits higher. Pros and cons for this. It doesn't get stuck so often under cabinet overhangs, especially the kitchen.5. Finally, the fuzzy logic/AI that creates the 'random' path that the machine tracks around the house means the Roomba doesn't cover the whole house. This was the most frustrating part. I would have to keep relocating it to a part of the house it hadn't covered because it would become 'obsessed' with a specific part of the house. When the machine had bashed your ankles for the 5th time in the kitchen yet hadn't even got into the front room, its just irritating.Both machines would run for about 2 hours on a full charge. Both would need regular emptying, especially in shedding season. But the Deebot did a better job of cleaning and covered more area. These are both older models so it interesting to see how a newer version would cope. Also, I never used the wifi connectivity, which was available on both. I was happy to press the button when needed. But I do appreciate having a robot vacuum, very useful.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   We named it "Davros", and would love it even more if we could program it to say "exterminate" every time it picked up dirt (Dr. Who fans will understand)... Alas, we can't. Read on for details on cleaning...This is - BY FAR - the best purchase we have ever made to keep the house clean. We have very dark wood floors and live in New Mexico, so our floors were ALWAYS dirty. It drove me nuts.When we got it I was mildly disappointed at first - and my husband thought it was a wasteful. The first time it ran our floors were still pretty dirty, and the bin was FULL. The second time, same result. The third time it was a bit better. After about the fourth day, we noticed an incredible difference in the cleanliness of our floors! Now Davros runs every day while we're at work, and we only have to spot clean for spills and such. It has been a HUGE time-saver and our floors are always spotless. I would buy this again!

Review Text: I purchased this for my new home with hardwood floors. I have a dog, so I was excited to be able to pre-set the cleanings throughout the week. Monitoring the machine took longer than sweeping would have. I'm very disappointed.

Review Text: Excellent for the price I paid. Cleans carpet and tile nicely. It’s suction is very good with long hair and Domestic Short Hair cat hair. I was surprised that the bin holds about 2 full size rooms worth of dirt. Cleaning the brushes and bin is a breeze. If some particles are too big it not suck them up.  I’m pleased as this is my 1st bot vacuum.

Review Text: Don't buy this just because of the Roomba name. I am returning it and going with something else. If you put dirt under this guy, it will pick it up; no question. I literally watched this thing go over the same spot NINE times, and an entire half of my living room ZERO times. Get one with smart mapping; not one that just pings around randomly.

Review Text: This has been a lifesaver in our household.  With two huskies who shed a lot, this gem saves me from daily vacuuming. Review Text: I am extremely pleased with my Roomba. I have Multiple Sclerosis ( MS ). I could not keep up with the daily cleaning demand. After many conversations and watched videos, I decided on the Irobot Roomba 600 series.I have set this unit to vacuum on a daily schedule. I LOVE MY ROOMBA!!!

Review Text: I know some reviewers have had trouble with this model not cleaning well. However, I have had no trouble at all. We have 2.5 yr old,  2 dogs and 2 cats, so we have to be sure to keep the bin emptied throughout the duration of the cleaning process. We empty it about every 10 min (15-20 if we keep to our 2x daily routine) and our floors have never looked better!

   I purchased this vacuum after my school reduced its custodial staff, leaving my room only partially vacuumed throughout the week. Occasionally I might run it twice if needed, especially those days that are wet and the kids track in dirt and grass.
