Review Text: You don’t realize how much pet hair is in your home until you get one of these. Give your back a day off and enjoy clean socks! We’ve had this for 6 months now and couldn’t be more grateful. Definitely don’t consider this a splurge, but a necessity for anyone with pets. Plus it gets under the couch,bed,tv stand, and other places that can be difficult to vacuum!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2020

Review Text: As a poor, disabled college student who lacks a lot of energy most of the time to even do basic tasks, I was thinking about a roomba. I searched for ones that would work on carpet with pet hair, and this bad boy came up. I got him for black friday, and hoped I didn't just buy a dumb thing that doesn't suck anything up. I named him Gerald.I placed him on his docking port and let him charge until I let him go. I even downloaded the app to see what that was all about, and I gotta say, it's really nice. He can get tangled in cords, so you gotta make sure to keep those in spots he can't get around. He'll beep at you if he's stuck on something, but my floors are clean, and I'm happy.He has a little spinning thing that whacks the ground/dirt and brings it up to suck up, and watching him go around is kind of endearing. He is a little noisy, he's not completely silent but it's not a bother to me. He does have a small dirt container, so if you got a big place and/or mess you're gonna have to empty him a couple of times at least.It took him a bit to kind of learn that there are other places to vacuum, which then he ran low on battery and stopped, but I'm not mad. I love this already, because it's a cleaner place and we all know just being around a dirty place can make your mood bad, which gets worse if you're disabled and have a hard time just doing things in general.I honestly will recommend a robot vacuum to anybody now, but especially this one if you have carpets and/or pets, and ESPECIALLY if you're chronically ill/disabled - it makes me feel a little more autonomous in my life, and my life is a little bit cleaner.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019

Review Text: FUNCTION 3/10: Ok, so its been 2 full years. This product simply doesn't work. It get stuck extremely easily. at least once per use, and often 4-5 times or more. (whats the point of a hands free vacuum if you have to reset it several times per use?) It even gets stuck on nothing at all, often just circling in the middle of the floor. It can't clean my living room and dining room on one charge, not due to short battery life but due to it ramming into the same wall or corner, over and over. If you have *any cords, cables, or wires dangling this will get stuck. If you have a couch *slightly too low this will get stuck. It gets stuck on my dishwasher, its gets stuck on a shoelace. I have a friend with the top tier version and I asked him if he likes his, since I've learned to loath mine. And he responded that he doesn't like it, and its been turned off for almost a year now. He just sweeps and spot mops his hardwoods on occasion. This is a WASTE OF MONEY.PRIVACY 1/10: Did you know you need to review and follow a privacy policy and terms of service for this product? But, not to worry, the terms of service and privacy policy are updated and adhered too automatically. Which means that even if you read the entire thing when you bought it, they'll simply change it later and follow a new policy. Hope no one is listening in, or mapping your apartment...APP 2/10: Terrible. Why have an app if the only options are to set when it runs, and turn it off and on? Further, it continually logs me out of the app. Like how am I going to remember a password for a vacuum clearner (a hilarious thought in itself) that I made 4 months ago and used once? I wont. So I about 5 times per year I simply have to reset my password for my vacuum cleaner. Its really crazy when it tells me I cant use the same password I've used before, or its too similar to my user name. ...my vacuum user name and password have a high security protocol I suppose.In short: DO NOT BUY. this product is a waste of money. It wont work. You're just being lazy like I was. But a nice vacuum and vacuum once a week like everyone else. It'll probably take you less time than hearing this thing whine/drone on for an hour and a half before getting stuck *again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2020

Review Text: Seriously disappointed with this buy & I'm not gonna lie, a little peeved at the 5 star reviews- especially from vine reviewers. I didn't get this vacuum for free. After tons of research, I settled on this vacuum, for almost $200- & that was on sale. Reviews were mostly raves and said how it was a miraclulously silent, god-tier vacuum. This is not the case. The only pro I've found yet it that it's good at cleaning hardwood floors. The cons list however, is numerous. It's seriously loud af. I turned it on & even though it was nowhere near my cat, it freaked her out so bad that she bolted. I sat watching it from the bed for a half hour & while it would ride up onto the carpet, it would spaz out less that a foot onto the carpet, spin around & go right back off it. & I don't even have shag carpet- it's a flat carpet that I bought on Amazon (For reference: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00NG14P9C/ref=cm_sw_r_cp_apa_fabc_d9MaGb5B6DFTA?_encoding=UTF8&psc=1 ). Everytime it hit anything larger than a 1"x1" piece of paper, it would spaz out, spin in circles and go back over the same space it just vacuumed. After the full "clean everything" cycle, it returned to it's base with none of my carpets vacuumed, but all the hardwood around them was spotless. When it sent itself back to it's home base, it kept getting caught on the trash can 3 feet from the base. I had to scoop it up and place it back on the base. If you have, oh I don't know, furniture in your house - opt for the Roomba that does floor mapping, which I thought this one did - but that's my mistake. It does not. It is random. I'll give it another week, to see if it adjusts to my carpets, but if not, I'll be returning. So far, definitely NOT worth $2-300.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021

Review Text: So they took out the smart features that originally came when it was released. Those features only available for newer versions. Watching it, it immediately goes to areas it got “stuck”. Had it for a month has only completed or docked it’s self 3 times.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2018

Review Text: My husband had always wanted a Roomba. Obviously I was just as intrigued as the next person with the idea of a robot vacuum, but I never saw the need. Then my husband bought one on and whim and boy, oh, boy. There is no going back for me.Does this Roomba replace a traditional vacuum in a home with three kids, three cats, and a dog? No. But does it help keep said home a whole lot cleaner? Yes!While I do still vacuum frequently, it’s not nearly as often as it used to be. Sometimes I actually vacuum WHILE the Roomba is vacuuming. We’re like a little vacuuming duo and it honestly just makes my heart happy to work alongside my little robot buddy.The Roomba won’t do any deep cleaning, so I will still suck up hair and dirt with my upright vacuum after the Roomba has finished. But it goes the other way as well. I can vacuum a room, then send out the Roomba and it picks up stuff I missed. If you don’t have animals, I think a Roomba could easily be all you need to keep your floors clean.Where the Roomba really shines is for under furniture. If you have animals that love to sleep under couches and beds, you know how hairy things can get under there. I wouldn’t vacuum under my bed nearly often enough. Who wants to be pulling out a huge bed, especially in a small space? Send in the robot! I couldn’t believe how clean the Roomba got the floor the first time I had it clean under my bed!And I love the spot clean feature! I’ve used it on small rugs, to clean up tiny bits of glass after a cup was dropped on the floor, and one of my favorite ways to use it is as a dust pan. I put the Roomba on spot mode and then I sweep toward it. So much easier and faster than sweeping everything into a dust pan.We loved scheduling the vacuum to clean at night while we slept so we could wake up to a freshly vacuumed floor. But then our dog pooped on the floor in the night. I will say that the Roomba did a fairly decent job at cleaning it up. But needless to say, we don’t do that anymore. Now I just start it first thing in the morning.My only complaint is the rotating bristle brushy thing. It started squeaking on the second day we had the Roomba. My husband has to keep greasing it, but the squeaking always comes back in a couple days. Other than that though, this thing is pure magic. If you’re on the fence, just go ahead and get it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2020

Review Text: Ok, the operation of the vacuum is 5 stars (and I have wood floors and pets that shed A LOT) but in order to use the app you have to consent to being tracked and your info being stolen. Unlike most people I read those "agreements" and was barred from using the app since I wouldn't agree.  This cuts the available functions by more than half (no scheduled vacuuming, no start/stop operation from your phone etc). I have to manually press start and stop on the vacuum every time, so if I'm not home the house doesn't get vacuumed.If I paid full price for the product I shouldn't lose functionality because I won't agree to tracking and info theft.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2021

Review Text: I would love to say I love this vacuum. I really like it and these are the reasons I don’t love it.It takes forever to go back to the dick station to a point I have had to get up lots of times and finically bring it to its hub station.Idk if it is the app or the bit it’s self but I am always getting errors or miss information. Example I send it to duck from the phone app and it work or I’ll tell google to send it home and it would say it is already docked when in fact it is still running around.It could get loud if you want to have a peaceful evening tv moment how I usually use it at nights it is just too loud. If you are going about doing chores and kids playing around it shouldn’t be an issue.Seems like it just goes around the house but not at any precise pattern In Which you can  say honestly that it cleaned everything.Some times it gets on my kitchen mat and cleans it and other times it seems to struggle.I wish it would clean my rug as well as usual vacuum do but it just gets stuck and gives me error.Overall I would still get it for simple daily cleaning but not if I’m counting on that being the only cleaning method for my floor.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020

Review Text: I really like my new Roomba. It does a great job picking up dog hair and dust. The set up was really easy and the app is very user friendly.The reason for 3 stars is:1) The dirt chamber is really small. I have about 1000 sq ft condo and the dirt chamber fills up with dog hair with about 1/2 of my apt covered (I vacuum everyday)2) It runs in to everything. The vacuum its self is much quieter than a traditional vacuum, but what is irritating to listen to is the bot hitting all on walls and books shelfs multiple times. There is an option in the app to rate the bots performance, for I am hoping it may get smarter over time.3) The bot has a hard time finding it's base. The last few times I run the bot it has pent more than 20 mins trying to find the base. This last time the battery ran out before it could find its way home.5/6 updatedThe vacuum has still not learned not to run full force into my furniture, and has cause damage to the base of my furniture. While it does a good job cleaning, I would prefer it if stopped kicking my bookshelves and end tables.5/28 updateI dropped a star on my review because of poor customer service from iRobot. I recently moved and am not longer able to get my vacuum to connect to my phone. After trying all the troubleshooting recommendations from the iRobot help site and not having any luck I contacted customer service. It has been over a week and I have still not heard back. The vacuum does work, but I cannot set a schedule or start the vacuum from my phone only from the buttons on top of the vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021

Review Text: Purchased this Roomba for my dad for Christmas. He lives alone in his house with a cat. He's still working full-time, so vacuuming is not a top priority.He affectionately named his Roomba "Robert." Robert was very easy to set-up. The app was simple to install into my dad's older iPhone, and it is very easy to navigate.We let Robert explore his new environment, and it was amazing how much junk he sucked up over a little under an hour of vacuuming!My dad lives in a ranch-style home, so Robert didn't make it down the hallway into all the bedrooms during his first voyage, but he did cover a lot of space! My dad sent me a video of him on Saturday, and he had made it all the way to the bedroom on the opposite side of the house! (My dad's house is 1300 sq. feet)Here are the pros and cons so far:Pros:1) Covers a lot of square footage during a vacuuming episode.2) Battery lasts about 1hr 20 mins, and then he goes home to rest and recharge at his dock.3) Very maneuverable! He is able to get into and out of some surprisingly small spaces. If it's quite narrow, he'll bump around a bit, but will eventually make his way back out.4) Cliff sensor! He won't fall down the stairs unless you push him. Why would you do that?! He's so cute!5) He slows down before bumping into things. And will only do so very gently.6) Noise is not bad. To me he is quieter than any other non-robot vacuum. For those of you who complain about noise, come on, he's a VACUUM!7) You can program his cleaning schedule in the app that is very easy to navigate.8) Easy to empty the canister.9) Fits under a lot of difficult to reach areas: beds, couches, dressers (if high enough).10) Does great on low-pile carpeting and climbs easily from linoleum to carpet.11) Can climb easily onto low-pile rugs.Cons:1) This is a "random" model, meaning he won't learn the layout of your home. He is more likely to go over the same spots a few times and not reach distant areas as frequently (but he still makes it!).2) You should empty the canister after every 1-2 vacuuming sessions, and this may be difficult to remember if he cleans while you're at work.3) He can get stuck on some rugs that have long threads (just like your normal vacuum would), and cannot climb into high-pile rugs, so he will go around them.Overall, my dad loves Robert the Roomba. No, Robert does not perform as thorough of a job as a "human" one, and you should still physically vacuum to get into the nooks and crannies of your home. But, the Roomba is great for those in-between vacuum jobs!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021

Review Text: I have used Roombas since 2003.  They have all had handles until now.  Model # 694 has NO handle!  Whatever genius decided to drop the handle is certainly not a 78 yr old female. Review Text: The picture is my name brand robot stopping yet again after 5 minutes.This is probably my 3rd robot vacuum in a little over a year. When my Eufy stopped working (my favorite of all), I decided to make an investment and get the name brand as well as an extended warranty. I told my husband that it would be my anniversary and Christmas present. Right off, I didn't like that it didn't have a remote control. The app on your phone doesn't allow you to navigate it. It constantly stops 10 minutes after it starts. My Eufy would stop if it got tangled, but when I restarted it, it worked fine. The roomba has never worked long enough to go back to the docking station. It also doesn't pick up much when it does run. Even on spot, it just pushes stuff around. Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2020

Review Text: I have never had a Roomba since we bought the very first one that came out. This was back before it would auto-dock, when the dirt catch trap was very small, when we didn't have much money, and we had full carpet in the house plus a rug in the living room on top of the carpet. We also had toddlers and much clutter. We were not very impressed with that first Roomba, and all of the things I would have changed were in fact changed with the second one, but we didn't have the money at the time to get the second one.Imagine my surprise then, upon getting this Roomba 675, at how far things have come in 15 years.The Roomba can be scheduled and goes back home to his dock when he's finished cleaning.We have replaced all our floors with laminate and only have a few area rugs.The Roomba has a larger dirt catch and a bunch of other cool features and brushes that were not on the first one.We don't have toddlers any more, and picking up everything before it comes out to vacuum is much more straightforward.Quirks of the Roomba that a person vacuuming wouldn't have-1. Sometimes it "finishes" a job with visible dirt still on the floor. This is because it doesn't have real eyeballs but rather uses a special algorithm to clean the floor which leaves dirt sometimes.2. Sometimes it has problems docking. The dock is pretty lightweight and easy to push around, and the docking process involves a sideways push that often just pushes it out of place. (There are non-slip pads on the bottom of the dock that don't really work. We had to use double-sided tape) When it fails to dock it goes away from the dock and casually pretends that it didn't need to dock yet. Sometimes it wanders off for a few minutes until it tries again.3. In fact when the app tells me it's docking or I tell it to dock, it usually takes another ten minutes to actually go back to the dock. Of course I could go over there and put it on the dock myself but I've been trying to see how much of life it can actually handle on its own.4. When I don't want it to vacuum a room (because it's not dirty, or I haven't picked it up, or to keep the cycle shorter by eliminating areas), the easiest way to prevent that is to spend money on an invisible wall, or do what I do and just lay a chair down in the doorway, put a laundry basket in the way, etc. Basically anything heavier than a few pounds will make it stop trying to go that way. Of course if I was vacuuming as a human, I would just choose not to go in certain areas.5. If I really want the Roomba to concentrate on a certain area, I can use the "spot" button, which will make it go in a spiral for a couple minutes, or I can shut it in a room, like a closet or bathroom. This is more effective than letting it roam the whole house and hoping it will stumble upon the closet and spend enough time in there to get it really clean. I find myself carrying it around, setting it in a room, shutting the door, and pressing the "clean" button. It will vacuum for about 10-20 minutes depending on the size of the room and then declare itself finished with an audible tone and a push notification from the app.Some of the Roombas learn the house and draw a map so they aren't forever wandering, but this one does not have that capability. Set up was very straightforward.Pros: My floors are cleaner than they've ever been, first because it really is good at picking up dirt, and second because it's willing to vacuum every day or multiple times a day, whereas I'm not (lol). I'm actually happy to walk barefoot, and I'm not sad when the dog sheds because I know the Roomba will take care of it.Cons:1. My dog is scared of it. Frankly she's scared of a lot of things but since this goes for such a long time (60 minutes) I feel bad that she won't be anywhere near it for that time, compared to when I vacuum for only 15 minutes or so to cover the same areas.2. It IS loud, and since our family often has at least one person home, it's going to be hard to find a time that isn't annoying to someone to vacuum.3. My small area rugs are just wrong for the Roomba to handle. They are too easy to vacuum up, or too thick to go up on, or something. Of course when I vacuum I just avoid them or pick them up, but it's a bit of a chore to pick them up every day.4. You do need to be aware of cords and small debris. The sock it tried to pick up just jammed it a little so I had to rescue it, but I think it could pull lamps down etc. So you'll need to check your house for areas you can block with furniture, or move the cords away.As with any vacuum you'll want to keep it very clean and hair free, so that it works better. There's a cleaning kit available with extra filters and everything you'll need to keep it in top condition.Overall I'm super happy so far. I was very surprised by the way it has changed and the effectiveness of its cleaning power. I'll still keep a regular vacuum for certain applications, but the Roomba will definitely be used much more.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2018

Review Text: I wanted to wait a few months to write my review so that I could be as thorough as possible. I currently have a love hate relationship with our Roomba. Here are the pros...you can run it with Alexa, you can run it when you aren’t home, if you have a large, single level house, it can do a lot of work for you, while you do something else. However, it has a lot of cons, in my opinion. As far as I can tell, it hasn’t learned our house that well yet. It constantly bumps into things and the route it takes seems pretty random. It will eventually get almost everything off the floor after running for a good two hours, but it has to run for a while to get everything and it will go through the same room multiple times, instead of doing one room to completion and then moving on to the next room. It also frequently shoots dust/dirt/food away from itself instead of sucking it up, which is infuriating if your doing a spot clean. It also has a very small canister for storing dirt and debris, so you have to clean it every time you use it.  I’ve found that it is very loud. I have friends who run theirs at night while they sleep, but ours is too loud for that, it keeps me awake if I do that. Also, you have to make sure nothing is on the ground (chords, shoes). I can’t tell you how many times ours has gotten messed up because it got ahold of our phone chord. Mine also has this one spot under the couch and next to an end table that it gets stuck almost every day (again, it doesn’t seem to be learning my house). So, if you do run it when you aren’t home, you often have to go searching for it (dead) in your house somewhere and take it back to the base to charge it.  Lastly, we have very thick carpet in our kids’ bedrooms. Our Roomba will get to the entrance of the kids bedrooms, bump into the carpet and turn around and not go in their rooms.  This has ended up working in our favor, because the kids leave their stuff everywhere and it would probably ruin the Roomba, but I didn’t expect that to happen when I purchased it.Overall, I’m glad we have it, because our house is too big and has too much dust/hair/food on the floor for me to vacuum the whole house every day.  However, there are several areas where it could be improved.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2019

Review Text: Recently, in an effort to help my family's issues with minor allergies, we completely remodeled out main levels flooring, replacing mixed laminate, linoleum, and carpet all with thick vinyl plank and a few select washable rugs. We then picked one of these up to run daily to pick up any dust, dirt, pet hair, dander, or anything else it found.  We wer very deliberate before running it of course and gave the house a thorough post construction deep clean, vacuuming the entire place, followed but a dust mop, followed by steam mopping the entire house. We have 2 dogs, and a household with 1 half ball man and 3 girls.First, the hair. omg, so. much. hair. It picks it up so there's that, and it then proceeds to rap around every moving part of the roomba and within a couple days it needs to be cleaned out before the different parts begin to lock up. Today it was happily bouncing around, the gimpy little yellow flipper brush completely dead stuck(and warm to the touch). No warning or anything, just jammed up.Suction strength. Between the suction and the rollers it is able to do ok, picking up all the dog hair and a fair bit of the small bits of dust/drywall/sawdust, but randomly misses stuff like small 1/2" pieces of paper from the kids. I should have done a bit more research at this point and chose at least a model E5 or higher for this reason. The 675 is better suited for carpet/rugs than it is hard surfaces.My bigger complaint, is how often it gets stuck. It's just barely over a 50% successful run rate at this point, often stopping on a low pile rug stating it's on a cliff or rammed itself upwards on a table leg and got hung up. I don't get it.If we ever purchase another vac like this I will pay the money for a higher end unit that has better suction and actively plots it's course, listening/watching this thing bounce off everything in the house for an hour and a half is a bit ridiculous especially when some rooms get cleaned  3 times and other areas get missed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2021

Review Text: I purchased this a few weeks ago after my Neato gave out.PROS-The app and wifi connection is awesome. I can tell my alexa to turn it on or off etc.- It doesn't get stuck or caught on things nearly as often as my neato did. My neato was shaped like the letter D. So it was bound to get stuck a lot. This little guy is round and can work his way out of most situations.- It picks up a TON of lint and trash off the floor. We don't have dogs but we do have 2 kids. And my husband is a mechanic that loves to ride 4 wheelers in mud. My daughter and I both have long hair that falls out everywhere. And my 1 year old son drops food like no bodys business.  So my floor always needs a good vacuuming. This does the job. I can run my regular vacuum over the floors and then turn this on and it still gives me a full bin of lint and dirt.CONS.. - The biggest drawback for me is the fact that my house is pretty open concept. It cleans pretty sporadically and does miss some areas. Next time I will be getting the roomba that you can set boundaries for. So that you can pick one room for it to clean at a time. For example my kitchen has 4 door ways (weird I know). Honestly I just need that room cleaned most the time when I turn it on but I can't block it in there because it would be nearly impossible with all the ways for it to escape. I have read that Irobot sells something for this so I'm going to look into it. But keep in mind that if your home is open concept it DOES clean pretty sporadically. I usually put it in a room and shut the door. It cleans the room and does a great job. When it's done it plays its little jingle and a notification is sent to my phone. I go and move it to another area. Kind of annoying but better than having to lug my vacuum around to do the whole house.- As I said before, my daughter and I both have long hair and we shed a lot. So every week I am cutting hair out of all the nooks and crannies on this thing. Hair is wrapped around everything! I know it is probably wrapped around the wheels too.. as that is what happened with my neato. So I know I will eventually have to take it apart and cut hair out of all the hard to reach places such as the axels. I'm really not sure if the more expensive ones would do a better job or not. This might just be a curse that we long haired girls are forever doomed to.Overall I am happy with this purchase. We named our vacuum Sir Cleans-a-lot. Hes part of the family and we love him.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020

Review Text: I bought a Roomba 675 and used it for a month.  Because of a bunch of issues, I decided to return it.  Today, I received my Eufy, and I now can say for sure that the Roomba is a poor product.1.  The Roomba was always stopping and giving me annoying error codes, even though nothing was wrong2.  The Eufy is a flatter device, and doesn't get stuck like the Roomba did.. constantly3.  The Roomba side brush requires screws to secure them.  When I changed the brush, the screw never fit correctly and the brush would fall off (two brushes, two screws)4.  The Eufy has TWO side brushes, making it much more efficient5.  The Roomba would prevent me from watching TV, it was so noisy.  The Eufy isn't silent, but its nothing compared to the Roomba.6.  Even though I used the Roomba yesterday, the dirt cup of my Eufy was completely full today -- meaning, the Roomba wasn't really doing a very good job7.  The Eufy has many more features, including being able to direct the unit without picking it up, and changing the intensity of the cleaning8.  The Eufy is cheaper.  I'm anticipating that no unit will last forever since I use it twice a day... so a lower cost unit with better capabilities is very appealing9.  The Roomba wasn't great about docking. Most times I'd have to manually dock it.  Eufy docks every time so farI will update as I use the eufy!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2019

Review Text: First off, I bought this roomba on prime day for 25% off which was a great deal!Pros: the roomba picks up pretty much everything, eventually. It does sometimes take a while to get the entire floor but it will eventually get everything just be patient. Easy to empty and change the liner. Also very convenient that it will clean while you sit on the couch!Cons- if the roomba gets stuck on something (cords, a loose sock, ect.) it will make a very loud beeping and flash a warning sign. I cannot leave it running while I am not home because of this. It is also quite loud, if I am watching TV I have to turn the TVs volume up to hear over the roomba. I have also had some issues connecting the app. Every time I try it says there is not a roomba within range even though I am right next to it. I am seriously disappointed with this because I read the app has a lot of good features.Overall, worth the money not to have to clean yourself
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021

Review Text: If I could give zero stars I would. As it is, I am just waiting for it to die, be sent repeatedly for that nifty warranty I bought (don't even ask), have it come back the same and finally get reimbursed for a new machine.It gets stuck in the same places every single day. It often gets stuck in the same place three times in one session, which is when I dock it and give up.It consistently becomes wedged under cabinets. The molding strip around the fireplace baffles it completely. Despite putting up barriers, it finds a way to get around and get stuck under the sofa or the bar cart or the rocking chair runners.On good days you can dock it in one try. On miracle days it actually docks itself. But usually it runs into the docking station, shoves it around and then gets tangled in the docking station cord.I hate it. Before this, I had a succession on Neato robo-vacs, which often had mechanical problems but actually cleaned the floors without the drama. I only bought this one because of the glowing reviews.Ignore them.This thing is a disater.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2021

Review Text: Omg! This thing is just soooo amazing I don’t even know where to start. So I grew up sweeping my house every day. But, Like 2 yrs ago I noticed my back ached terribly if I swept or mopped my floor. Turns out I have slipped disk and spine injury. Long story short I haven’t been able to keep up with my floor. My mom discovered there was a lot if dust under my bed! So embarrassing. Well, hubby bought me this thingy for xmas and I couldn’t be any happier! I will no longer have to pay someone to come help me “clean” really just sweep my house. This thing made my floor look waxed and all. I run it everyday and it is absolutely amazing! Now, keep in mind it is not a human!  so, yeah, I have to mind it. Like most appliances or gadgets with lithium battery , you must be mindful and careful with it!  I would not let this thing run by itself unsupervised! It is just a robot! Not sure how people don’t have any sense to expect this thing to be flawless! Impossible!  .... I rather mind this than have mybback hurting; or me having to pay someone whom I have to also micromanage. This thing is really amazing and a must have for every couple. At this point it had exceeded my expectations! Don’t wait to get one.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019

Review Text: I had been waiting and hoping to be able to afford a Roomba when I saw this model at Black Friday prices.  I couldn't wait to get it and was excited to "hook" it up.  I found the right spot, put it on the base for the recommended time, pressed the cleaning button and left the bedroom when it started to move.  After about one half hour I went down the hall to see why it had not come into the dining or living rooms, and then I saw it.  Practically spinning in place, in circles, not sweeping around the furniture and the worst part was, it was still pretty much where I left it.  I decided that I needed to learn more about how to use it and took the manual out.  After review, I did not learn anything new.  I am a caregiver for my ill husband and was trying to make my life a little bit easier but this was not what I expected.  I think I reached out to a Roomba website for help, I really can't remember right now with so many things going on this Christmas season.  I will take up with this again after the holidays to try to figure out what is wrong.  Fellow Amazon reviewers told me that my model was not "geared" to switch rooms and would need to be physically moved.  Plus, this model will not return it self to base.  In my case, this will be more work than I wanted.  It makes me sad that I did not purchase the 900 series, which I am told has the capabilities I am looking for.  I can tell you one thing, the small area it covered was "cleaned to death!".  To be continued.  Merry Christmas to you.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2018

Review Text: Not sure what the big deal is. It’s not really smart. Gets stuck and doesn’t dock properly. Needs serious improvements navigating. 3 stars for the novelty and so I can keep up with the Jones’s.

Review Text: We have a fairly large two story house and vacuuming takes a significant amount of time.  Thus, for Black Friday deals we decided to give this guy a try.  Spending 45+ minutes to vacuum each week is time we really would like back. This Roomba was $100 off with a money back guarantee so if it didn't work we were going to return it.The setup was easy.  You download the app and follow the instructions to connect it to your home network.  It didn't come fully charged but was fairly close.  In about 30+ minutes it was done.The app is fairly useless other than telling the Roomba to go vacuum or to return to the dock. For this model you have no other control of the unit.  The app is more of a message device.  It will tell you how much battery power is left, if the Roomba gets stuck and needs help, or if it's charging and docked. You can schedule automatic cleaning sessions with the app but realize it may not return back to the dock correctly.  You will need to verify it made it home after each session either visually or by looking at the app.After a couple weeks with a fair amount of use here is our verdict:This unit is a time saver without question.  It just requires some babysitting.  Do NOT expect for it run off in the distance, perform perfectly, get every section of the floor, then return home and sleep. It WILL get stuck and it's highly possible it won't work on some area rugs (the design patterns and cliff sensors appear to have trouble with a couple of ours), and unless you Roomba can get near the docking station by accident it won't dock before the battery dies.  Ours has a difficult time getting out of a couple rooms once it finds it's way into these rooms.The vacuuming and movement is almost random.  It does not realize where it's been so expect it to cover some areas numerous times.  It's brain does start to realize when it hits items frequently and is in confined spaces or under and around tables and chairs.  The pattern of random movement will then change. For example it can follow a wall or chair and circle around the perimeter when it thinks one is near.  Still, it doesn't know the placement of things in your house, the size or shape, so don't expect it to remember their location at all.  It will just bounce around and follow edges with the hope it eventually covers the entire area. Sadly however it won't normally unless you close the area/room off so it can't accidentally leave.  Lastly, strings, hair, etc. will get caught in the roller.  You will need to clean it regularly and be careful with what's on the floor just as you would with your own vacuum. Our daughters bed-skirt has a ruffle which was caught once as we didn't realize a small section was starting to come loose.After numerous times using the Roomba we have figured out how to make it successful for our home.  First, when away on errands we will have it run with the hopes it returns to dock.  If not we replace it when we get home. Second, we don't use it at night as it's loud, but instead while home.  We will place it in an area we want cleaned and close off doors to keep it there.  (We can see where the accessories to create borders would be highly useful.)  Third, areas such as the kitchen, living room and halls will need to be done several times, and you will still need to pull out the master vacuum to reach some difficult locations. We just let the unit run around and do it's business.  After about two or three jobs the area is clean. Since our house has a light colored tile so we can tell how well it's done and if necessary manually place it around to help finish a job.  Fourth, it does vacuum carpet very well.  Our second floor is all carpet with stairs and after having the unit perform two jobs the upstairs is complete. Since we keep the dock on the first floor we just carry it up and down the stairs.Verdict:  If you don't have crazy expectations and are willing to do some periodic babysitting then a robot vacuum is a clear time saver, especially with a big house such as ours. If you are a clean freak that wants everything done perfectly each time it leaves the dock then stay away. It won't meet your requirements.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2020

Review Text: I'm sitting here on Sunday, moved to finally write this review. The robot is great in some ways ... we vacuum less than we used to. But three times in an hour today it has bleeped at me, and sent me a notification, because it has gotten stuck on the corner of some rug, or between the legs of the dining room chairs, or choked on a cat toy, or gone over the threshold into some room it can't get out of.Maybe one time in 100 has this robot actually completed a job without getting stuck somewhere. This is not some crazy house. This is a normal house, on a fairly open plan, actually, with normal amounts of things in it. If I wasn't stuck at home for the pandemic, this robot would not be worth it. I'm here so I can get up, move it an inch, and hit the button twice a day. But if you're thinking that this thing can do your vacuuming while you're not around, think again.This is our first iRobot, we've had it for three months. We've had Deebots before; they're not better. This is a robot problem, not an iRobot problem.UPDATE: now it broke, four months in. One of the drive wheels won't spin. After 3 weeks I'm still waiting for the replacement part from Roomba, which they shipped via "UPS Mail Innovations," i.e. that service where UPS drops it off at a USPS location. It's in Crestview, FL, where it's been sitting for 5 days, and I'm in PA.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2021

Review Text: I have a 650 model for years which can be scheduled on the device. Now, for model 675 this function need to be done with its APP. The APP has an updated version and asked me to download. Alas! When I open the updated APP, I was asked to login. The APP is so poorly designed that it cannot even recognize the very iPhone which has a previous version and is in login status. Moreover, unlike many APP, in case the user forgot the user name and password, there are ways to restore the user name and reset password. This APP is so designed that you can only reset the password. But without the user name, the password cannot be reset. When trying to create a new account, I was told that this device has been registered with another user name. So, I am stuck. The only option for me is to let the Roomba run the way it was first set up when I bought it. As a result, I deleted this useless APP. It is amazing that the engineers who work on AI and robot can design a robot that is so user unfriendly!BTW, as mentioned above, when I used a different email to register, I got an error message. But then I received a welcome message from iRobot thanking me for create a new account. I guess iRobot is using this APP to collect buyer's message. This makes me feel sick.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021

Review Text: First off, a little background. We have a poodle and a mini schnauzer that do not shed. Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   I'll get right into. I personally think the pathing algorithm is terrible. When it starts, it consistently ends up in the cleaning every room except for the room it starts in. It also seems to prefer smaller spaces, as it cleans my laundry room and the guest bathroom about 5-6 times every run and has a hard time covering large spaces as it tends to leave the larger areas before completing.Also, it's unable at docking itself (video included) It refuses to dock on its own and will repeat this process 5-6 times until you're fed up at watching it and dock it yourself.Lastly, it really just pushes a lot of dirt around then blows it away when it turns around with it's vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2020

Review Text: I would have liked to have written an amazing review about this Roomba, but alas it came in a damaged (as in crushed) shipping box, with evidence that it was NOT a new item (broken seals inside). This crushed box was then shipped to me inside a regular larger box to hide the damage. So, what did I find inside? A dead Robot. No amount of charging would wake the poor thing. It actually looked ok, but obviously something had gone quite wrong. It was dead. I did inspect it carefully and these are the things you may be interested in: It has only one side brush - I thought this was odd for a floor vacuum, but clearly there is not meant to be another one, so it wasn't just missing. It seems to have extra sensors so it won't fall down the stairs - I assume that is what they were for, since I was never able to test it. It has two main brushes that should work in tandem with one another. The Dust bin is regular in size but then there is a weird half cone shaped filter inside of it that takes up a lot of space, so if you could use it there is lots less room for it to actually collect dust. meaning you would have to empty it more often. It does come with a charging dock and cord, it comes with an extra cone filter. It does NOT come with a remote. Since it was DOA that's all I can tell you. so Here are my assumed pros and cons:Pro:it looks nicedual main brushesextra filterdocking stationCons:No remoteonly one side brushfilter takes up a lot of bin spacedocking station power cord must come out only on the right, no option to direct it to the left
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2020

Review Text: We had been wanting a Roomba for a long time, and finally treated ourselves with some money we got for our wedding. Since both my husband and I have physical disabilities, vacuuming is a feat, and we were hoping this would solve that issue and help us keep our house clean. Mr. Worldwide literally has one job, and he just can't seem to accomplish it. I wish we had returned this when we had the chance. Besides the fact that it has to be perfectly place in order to align with the docking station to charge- it just doesn't pick up dirt. It will suck up a doggie pee pad, and pull an iphone charger out of the wall no problem, but the smallest pieces of dust or debris on the floor, he will simply push around or circle them before going back to his home (which is a huge achievement in itself).  We run this on occasion for maybe some psychological satisfaction, or the thought that maybe it will somehow make our floors look cleaner but like others have said, save your money and just buy a compact vacuum, or different model, maybe there are some out there that work? This ain't it kid.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2021

Review Text: Ever shell out a LOT of money to buy a product that had a lot of buzz and former reputation and then get burned finding out it kind of barely works the way you want it to?  Well welcome to 2021.  The actual Roomba does clean well kind of and is to maintain (clean out).  The app to connect it to your home network or phone is flat out garbage, I keep mine updated and have tried to use it... most of the time it won;t even see the roomba and connect, it dies not show when the roomba is cleaning, or docking, or its charge level.  And the roomba does clean well as long as you forgive it's programmed need to spend twice as much time going over the same areas it already cleaned in a random pattern. The algorithm for how this robot is completely random and stupid, it spends twice as much time doing a job as it should, and it runs thru its entire battery capacity cleaning a 14 by 16 room and taking a damn long time to it.  Buyers remorse I would say on this one..... I should have spent money for a product not living off a name and gotten something better that actually performs well.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021

Review Text: Understand there's not really much "robotic" about this vacuum.  It just randomly ping-pongs around and if you have several rooms it may spend hours in one room never to touch another.  I had a Neato brand years ago that had lidar and would start at one end of the room and cross precisely over to the other side, make a perfect 180 and come back to vacuum the next strip.  The carpet looked like a freshly plowed farm field.  The Roomba will not do that.I'm not sure what the point of the wifi/phone interface is other than to set a schedule - it wont do anything more than that, plus stop the vacuum if you want it stopped.  The "return to base" has never worked for me.Now, all that said, it generally does what it's supposed to do.  If you sit and watch it, you'll be struck by how dumb it is.  If you just set it to start after you leave for work. you'll come back to find the dustbin full, so there is a point to it.  It won't supplant a regular vacuuming, but it will help keep your house clean.  Seems to work fine on hardwood floors and makes the transition to carpet just fine, where it seems to excel.  Good for going under beds, couches etc.  If I had to do it again, I would not pay for the wifi version as it doesn't seem to add anything.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020

Review Text: When my wife ordered this and it arrived, I nearly went ballistic. We don't need a robot vacuum, especially for this money. Boy was I wrong. This things ROCKS! Seriously, it runs here, there, it moves around me if I am standing in front of it and it'll circle back later, it goes on carpet, hardwood, tile, concrete... that sucker just moves around like a boss. The cats hate it, but I love it. It has saved me a ton of vacuuming and sweeping over the past few weeks we've had it and I have no complaints. It'll tell you if it gets stuck (on your phone), and it docks when it runs low. I have it on a timer for every morning and it runs anywhere from 1hr 15m - 1hr 45m then it docks and recharges for the next day.To think I though Roomba was a gimmick. I was wrong. And my wife got a huge mass of brownie points with this purchase. I love this little guy!

Review Text: It will get stuck on the exact same place like 4 times in the span of 15 minutes. And it vacuums the same spots over and over and over again and will skip other spots.

Review Text: Not overly impressed. Bought to pick up pet hair & it doesn’t do a great job. Seems like it is always getting caught in something or not charged completely.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2021

Review Text: It is a lot of fun to watch.  Good on carpets but not with feathers (my cockatiels shed),  There a re a few things I pick up to get out of the way, Mrs. Roomba almost strangled herself on a piece of elastic untilI rescued her. Great invention.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020

Review Text: Love, Love, Love this Roomba!  We have 3 cats and it picks up all the cat hair.  We have all wood and tile floors with some scatter rugs.  It does a great job cleaning on all surfaces.  Only negative, and I do not consider it a negative since we have 3 cats, is that we have to pause it a couple times during a cleaning cycle to empty the bin.  Without the cat hair, it would do a whole cycle before emptying.  We are seniors and it is so nice to sit in our recliners and have the Roomba do it's job. Another plus is that it will connect to our echo dot and so all we have to do is say Alexa start the Roomba.  Now if they make a model that can cook, we will be the first to buy it! LOL
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2018

Review Text: The iRobot 675 has changed my life. I’m a mom to 4 young children living in a 1880 square foot house on a large wooded lot. My kids are outside A LOT and track in all kinds of dirt, mud, leaves, grass, etc. My husband, while I love him, is also kind of a mess and has a bad habit of not wiping his shoes and bringing in a ton of sawdust from his projects. On top of all of that, add in the fact that children under 7 really don’t know how to eat properly and drop about seven thousand crumbs per meal per child. Our floors, wood, tile, and carpet, have been a disaster for years.Enter the Roomba. I have been eyeing this little piece of wizardry for years and wondering if this could be the tool that could change my life. I swept and vacuumed (with a Dyson DC33) multiple times a day. I was constantly telling guests, “hey sorry about the floor but I think we’re just gross and I can never get on top of it”. Well, after finally biting the bullet I regret that I didn’t buy a Roomba years ago. I don’t have to apologize to guests and I can finally walk barefoot in my house without having 100 tiny crumbs attaching to the bottom of my feet. I love this thing more than I have ever loved any appliance or cleaning tool I have every owned.About half of our home is our 2 living areas, dining, kitchen, and mud room. The other half are 4 bedrooms and two bathrooms. I have a baby gate dividing the two halves which acts as a barrier that the Roomba can’t get through. I really like having that barrier and if I didn’t use that baby gate I probably would have gone with the 690 for the virtual wall but I don’t see a purpose for it for us. I run the Roomba every night in our living/eating/kitchen area after we pick up the toys and straighten up the house. This is like magic. I always WANT to have things picked up and put away but I didn’t always do that before the Roomba because we are TIRED. But I love running the Roomba so much that since we have owned this thing we have cleaned up every night since we have owned it. Magic. I run the Roomba in the bedroom/bathroom areas 2-3 times a week in our house. Our kids are a little afraid of it (I want them to be, I don’t want them to touch it, and I may have told them it will bite them) and it does make noise so between all of our napping and sleeping I don’t have as much time to run it back there. I don’t mind though, because the bedrooms do not get nearly as dirty as our living areas.The things I wish I would have known before purchasing:- It really does clean all of the floor. It picks everything up. The crumbs and leaves are gone. It doesn’t miss any part of the floor. I was afraid it would kind of get half of the floor and not the other half because it isn’t as intelligent as the higher trim lines of the Roomba. I was wrong. This thing is amazing. I heard from someone else that you shouldn’t watch the Roomba because it will just drive you crazy. This is totally true. I watch it and question every move it makes. Why did it roll right past that crumb? Why is it spending 20 minutes under that couch? Just don’t watch it! It so nice to lay in bed at night, tell it to clean from my smart phone, go to sleep, and wake up in the morning to spotless floors!- I have needed to clean out the dust bin after every cleaning. I read a lot of reviews that said once you get into the swing of things with your Roomba you only need to clean out the dust bin once or twice a week. That hasn’t been true for us. I’m telling you, we are gross. So if your kids are especially messy or you have really messy pets or track in a lot from being outside that might just be your reality. But that’s fine with me because emptying the dustbin is a lot easier than vacuuming my own floors!- It charges really quickly. I thought I’d be waiting half a day for a charge. Not so. Ours charges within an hour which is nice because I like to charge in between doing both halves of my house. With as dirty as our floors get I don’t think the Roomba could do the entire 1880 square feet on one charge.- Unless you really, really want the features the higher end Roombas provide you really shouldn’t look at this vacuum as a cheap item. The technology in this thing is awesome (or at least I think it is, I’m not really super techy). This is a great robot that does an amazing job and seems very durable.- It does make noise. My mother in law commented that she was surprised it made noise. It’s a vacuum.- It has changed my life. I am excited to clean my house. I am excited to pick up toys. Nothing has ever made me happier about cleaning. This thing is the real deal. I wake up to clean floors every morning and I didn’t do any of the work. Get yourself one.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2019

Review Text: When I purchase something like this item, I hold off submitting a review until I’ve had the chance to use it for a duration, usually a year. I read a funny review online yesterday, about Roomba, which reminded me I needed to do a Roomba review myself. Yesterday’s reviewer gave a one star review, and returned his purchase, stating his Roomba acted like it was drunk, wandered aimlessly, ran into the same item repeatedly, was unable to locate its charging station, and would send him messages saying things like “Help Roomba is stuck on a cliff!”, only to come home and find Roomba sitting in the middle of the kitchen, no cliffs in sight. I read this review, and every thing he says is straight up gospel, even the ridiculous cliff SOS, all 100% true. We call our vacuum Roombo, men vacuum too, unfortunately Roombo, like Roomba, is not the intuitive robotic vacuum I thought I was getting. Roomba and the word intuitive have never met. So why three stars? Because I have 3 dogs and 2 cats living in my home, and even if Roomba spins in a circle in a single room, she is a hair catcher like nobody’s business. Packed full of dirt and hair after every single cycle. That’s dirt and hair I don’t have to worry about. So even if I have to send out a search party to find her occasionally, I’ll keep her. So far, she’s been low maintenance, clean her occasionally and she off to find another cliff to fall off of.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2019

Review Text: With this you get what you pay for. When it works it works well but you have to be there to watch the entire time it cleans.  Attached are some photos of where it is been stuck, and the battery dies. Have had a few weeks and it is not worth it. Loved the concept of the device just not this one.2nd review.This just gets worse... ordered again to try to get the correct item and it was used! Picture included. I ordered a new one and they repackaged. This is unacceptable
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2019

Review Text: Got this on cyber Monday, used it 5x since getting it, pros, totally worth not having to sweep daily (husky hair and a husband that wears shoes inside daily), cons; gets full fast, loud on tile, laminate, gets stuck if you have clothes or crap on floor (basically before you run it you should pick up clutter or it won’t work), pI feel like my house is soooo much cleaner, less dust and less pet hair. Set up is easy (I had an issue with 2.5 WiFi but a quick call to support line had it figured out in 5 min). I feel like it’s totally worth the money just for saving me 3-5 hours per week plus reduced dust and hair...I will sill have to vacuum occasionally though.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018

Review Text: My new rescue dog is a major shedder and I find hair everywhere so I decided to try a robot vacuum with a gift certificate I received for x-mas. I read review after review and for the price point I bought the Deik. It also had great reviews but it was horrible. Even the return process was bad but I won't get into all that. The Roomba is amazing. The install was instant. Adding it to my wi-fi and Alexa was so easy. I like the simple clean or dock mode. No special cleaning modes to choose just clean or sleep. The Deik got stuck everywhere, chair legs, throw rugs, corners, etc. etc. Roomba is like a 4-wheel drive compared to the Deik. You can see it as it lifts itself up to get over obstacles. It is so much faster and doesn't seem to go in circles like the Deik. Roomba on it's first day covered every room. Every 15 minutes I would find it and empty the container which was always packed full of hair and even dirt which I didn't think I had. It pushes obstacles like shoes and cords out of its way. The only thing it sucked up was a couple of socks and a dryer sheet but it stops and notifies you on your phone that it has a problem. I didn't go around and pick up cords, dog toys, etc. It seems to just roll over them or push them out of the way. It hugs corners and turns very well. The dogs could care less. It bumps into my big dog and he doesn't even move. My little dog who goes outside when I'm vacuuming could care less about the Roomba. Compared to the Deik it is also very quiet. Somewhere I saw it compared to a microwave and that's pretty accurate. I'm 100% happy with this purchase and totally recommend it if you have a pet hair problem.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2019

Review Text: This is definitely a must buy product for anyone who absolutely hates vacuuming.... like me.On the whole, the Roomba 675 is doing it's job. It gets under my couch and beneath furniture that I am honestly way too lazy to sweep and vacuum myself.It is important to remember, however, that this does not replace a real-life human doing the sweeping and vacuuming. It's much slower, it can't see spots it may have missed, and it bumps into more furniture and walls than a drunk freshman undergraduate.When I have guests coming over, I run the Roomba while I'm away and the do a final sweep/vacuum before they arrive. I'd say the Roomba picks up 85% of the dirt, dust, and other crud on my hardwood and area carpets.This unit is a bit loud. Watching TV, talking on the phone, or having a conversation is a bit tough with the Roomba buzzing around the house and the dust bin is a bit small.End of the day, if you can spare the cash and you'd prefer to not vacuum or sweep daily/weekly, this is 100% the product for you. Buy it. Now.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2018

Review Text: The iRobot vacuum works well.However, docking is very unreliable. In fact, it's so unreliable that I must give the product only 1 star.If I put the docking station next to a wall, the iRobot seems to get confused (by signal reflection from the wall?), that it would dock then leave and go search somewhere else. It's almost as if it were saying "hey that's not the right docking station."If I put the docking station in the middle of the floor it would dock correctly, but only if the docking station is glued to the floor! (Otherwise the docking station gets pushed around, again confusing the iRobot.) Holding the docking station with my hand has the same effect as putting it against the wall - confusing the iRobot.Worse: when the iRobot is confused, even manaully putting it on top of the docking station won't cause it to charge. The only way around is the unplug and re-plug the power to the docking station.On average, it takes me about half dozen tries to get it to charge.I returned the original unit for an exchange, thinking it was a one-off defect. Alas, the replacement unit wasn't any better.I am a long time iRobot user. I can tell you the older models don't have this defect. For example, the one I purchased 5 or 6 years ago - still functioning today - docks every single time no matter where I place the docking station.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2019

Review Text: This little machine is very powerful and saves me so much time. I have such a floor area and didn't want to spend all day sweeping. It really does the job.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2018

Review Text: UPDATE: Decided to return the product.  Noticed various scratches on my newly refinished hardwood floors which was basically the last straw.  There are a few metal pieces on the bottom of the device which I imagine are the culprit.  If you own wood floors then you know that you can't have anything metal coming in contact with your floors and sliding or dragging or you're going to get scratches.  iRobot is the most well known company in this space, but their Roomba product is really not good, still has a ton of issues 10 years later.  I signed up for Consumer Reports as a way to figure out which vacuum to purchase instead of the Roomba.  Ended up buying the Eufy RoboVac 30 for $269.  Rated #3/36 robotic vacuums tested.  Top 2 were above $600, which is why I landed on #3.Keeps vacuuming the same areas over and over and doesn't vacuum whole rooms.  The lack of mapping seems to be a big hold back and I'm wishing I bought a product that mapped smarter and I could check to see which areas were cleaned and which weren't.  It picks up light dust, but has trouble with bigger pieces of dirt.  Will go over the bigger pieces multiple times and not pick them up.  Overall, not satisfied with the produce and will likely send it back for a full refund.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018

Review Text: Best purchase I've ever made! This is my second robot vacuum, but my first Roomba. I can tell a big difference between this and my last robot vacuum (Deebot 79s).My last vacuum would ram pretty hard into barriers that got in its way, however this Roomba seems to have better sensors and can tell earlier on when it's about to hit something. Instead of ramming into something at full force, it slows down a lot and will do a gentle bump. This seems to keep the vacuum from getting stuck, which can get a bit annoying at times.I have a dog who sheds quite a bit. This has no problem getting all her fur. It works on my wood floors, my thinner rugs, and my regular carpet.The dirt container isn't the biggest, so I make sure to empty it once every few days.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2019

Review Text: This is a good vacuum to get for a small-midsize apartment. It really does get almost everywhere with the exception of furniture it cannot fit under. It can go over chords, however, for the sake of your motor and battery I suggest you use chord covers for any chords running across the floor or get the really tiny command hooks to help lift chords up off the ground around your computer or tv area, you can easily find a 40 pack of them.When I first started using it I had to clean the dust bin out 3 times during cleaning, it will not tell you when it is full. So I just usually run it while I am home cooking and cleaning and every 30 minutes just empty it (totalling 3 times). I have two dogs and letting this thing go daily is probably going to rescue my carpet from all of the pet hair. It is a bit noisy but I find it is about as loud as an RC car (the bigger ones). One dog fears it after trying to use it as a pillow and getting an alarming wakeup call. Setup can be a B had issues with that (some of which was user error, could not remember my wifi password). It is apparently not uncommon for the app to sort of lock up on the final setup page where it says "connecting roomba to wi-fi" (or something to that effect) if that happens completely exit app then reopen, it should be discoverable when you reopen the app and setup should be complete. It is a toss-up whether it will dock itself or not. This bothers me none because it usually is fairly easy to find in my 850sqft apt. and I have no qualms with letting the battery discharge completely. It did have issues with a rug that was raised at the edge because someone in our household drags their feet but I resolved this issue.It may sometime run over a dark part of the floor and think it's a cliff it needs rescuing from.This thing probably needs more babysitting than you were expecting but less work than a regular vacuum. It's really a good model to get without breaking the bank if you have less than 1000 sqft of living space. Once you pass 1200 sqft you are probably going to have to manually make it clean again once recharged. Which is honestly just a push of a button and not a big deal to me if I do ever need it to go another round.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019

Review Text: Honestly, I love this thing, in that it cleans really well (way better than I ever did with a hand-held vac) and I can vacuum when I'm not home. But it never, ever, ever completes a job without getting stuck on something, no matter how hard I try to clear all obstacles from the floor. Whatever it gets stuck on, the next time I vacuum I make sure to clear that obstacle, and it just finds something else. It's frustrating because there's nothing I can do about it until I get home 9-10 hours later. And the app is really, really slow; it seems to take forever to connect, and sometimes won't connect at all.In addition, the thing never -- and I mean never -- finds its way back to the dock at the end of a cleaning cycle. I noticed this when running it while I'm home. When the "DOCK" light starts to flash, instead of moving toward the dock it moves itself as far away from the dock as possible, always in the wrong direction, circles around the same space over and over again, always turning the wrong way so it can't get out, until the battery dies. Perhaps only the more expensive models can dock themselves, but I thought this one could too.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2021

Review Text: It's a good product and does what it claims to do.Pros:- Controlled on the app or on device- One can put it on an schedule- It does well knowing where stairs are and won't go off the edgeCons:- If you have any black or darker colored area rugs THIS IS NOT THE PRODUCT FOR YOU, unless you want to pick them up before each vacuuming. The sensor that makes this product "smart" at detecting extra dirty areas is also the sensor that makes it automatically shut off if it encounters a ledge. And because my area rug is black, it thinks it's about to fall into a black hole and shuts off.- Compared to a cheaper competitor's product, the Roomba costs about $100 more and does the same quality job. There's no "better" that comes with the extra $100 that you would expect.- This Roomba is a BRUTE. It's very "heavy handed" and hits things quite hard before it changes course. The cheaper product I owned by one of the iRobot competitors was much more gentle with walls/barriers.- All robot vacuums are loud but this Roomba is a little louder than others. Maybe it's because of power of the engine that smashes it into things so hard?OVERALL: Good quality product that is made well and works well. But for the price you can get a competitor's product for significantly less and it'll perform as well as this Roomba model. I'm sure there are higher end Roomba models so my review is SPECIFICALLY based on the Roomba 675.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020

Review Text: I purchased a Roomba in early July as a gift for my daughter.  She LOVED it until if stopped working a few weeks ago, she Got an error message about BIN.  She ordered a new bin, did not resolve the issue.  Contacted Amazon was told to contact Roomba direct.  Roomba said they would send a box to return Roomba (without battery) to them ASAP.  It's been several weeks and still no box.  I have also read where others have purchased Roomba batteries via Amazon and received no support from Roomba when there was an issue with their batteries... What exactly is the story, if we purchase Roomba products from Amazon does consumer get no support?  I really would like to know if and when my gift to my daughter will be serviced.Thank you, Grammie in Louisianna
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2020

Review Text: Worst robot vacuum that I've ever owned. It gets stuck everywhere and my house is tidy. It can get itself on a scale and get stuck. It gets stuck at the toilet, dining chairs, cabinets, bathroom rugs. I reached out to the manufacturer. At first they were helpful. Gave me 2 invisible barriers which they did and I performed every task they told me do to improve it's efficiency. This only thing that helped was moving it to center and cleaning the metal charging areas with a Mr. Eraser. At least it didn't die as it had been in combination with getting stuck. The only time it completes a job is if I'm home and able to redirect it. Utterly awful. Contacted them multiple times they repeated themselves frequently stating it was "environmental" and that is just not acceptable. My house is tidy. I've had cheaper models that performed 100% better than this one. In addition, it is extremely loud. And it is absurd that the vacuum can't transition from tile to bathroom rugs that are heavy some of the time but not all the time. I spoke to a supervisor. She continued to refer me to Amazon repeated over and over that they couldn't do anything even though I offered several times that I'm willing to ship it back in original packaging and pay the difference for a better model. They repeated over and over that they didn't have that "program" and refused to escalate my unsatisfactory experience and lack of resolution to a higher manager stating they would tell me the same thing. DO NOT buy! Awful!!!!!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020

Review Text: I purchased this vacuum to replace our cheaper eufy vacuum that my husband stepped on and broke so I will provide my comparison. Also, I named her Monica (from friends) so I reference "her" and "she".I've had this vacuum almost 2 weeks and would not recommend it. I had higher hopes for an iRobot vacuum, the original robot vacuum. I choose this one after hours of research and based on the Amazon reviews. It was a top rated vacuum on multiple lists,  especially for pet hair but I'm starting to think they just paid there way onto the lists. I wanted a vacuum that could work on both hard floor and carpet and was good with pet hair, highly rated and didn't break the bank. I was hoping this was the one...First, this vacuum leaves hair on the edge of my rug when transitioning from hard floor to rug. I did not have this problem with enfy. For reference, I have 3 dogs, one that always sheds and two huskies (its shedding season).There is no way to control the vacuum. Enfy came with a remote control. I thought maybe the app would allow me to move her to a different part of the house if needed but there is no option. If I'm working in my office and she comes in, I have no way of getting her out without picking her up and moving her.The vacuum is loud and bumps into everything!She doesn't always finds her way back to the docking station on her own. I've had to dock her a few times in the less than 10 days she has run. This was very rarely a problem with enfy.One time she docked herself but she didn't charge! I usually empty the bin daily but that day I didn't. So she didn't run as scheduled due to no battery.The bin is always full so she seems to have good suction. I don't know how I feel about the brush yet. The bristles clump together a lot so I worry if not probably cleaned everytime, this could be an issue. Pictures are from today but I spent 15 minutes cleaning her yesterday, including brushing her bristles to separate them.Also, they don't provide any cleaning tools. Luckily I have my tool from enfy still I use.Overall, she gets the job done for the most part, but she needs a lot of supervision, maintenance and I still have to clean hair she leaves behind around the rug (see pictures). She does have a good battery. She ran over 2 hours today (see pictures). If I could go back, I would just buy the cheap eufy vacuum again.Update: I've decided to return it. The whole point was to not have to see dog hair everyday, however, my rug edges always had clumps of dog hair. Going back to Eufy which never had this problem.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2021

Review Text: Save yourself the trouble, do not buy.  Piece of absolute &#^@ garbage.  I have a single floor, open plan house.  It gets stuck on the air vents, a yoga mat, door threshold (which is small) and often doesn't even make it into the other rooms!  There are no controls, so if you spill flour in the kitchen?  You have to get it (not fun picking it up with old knees and a bad back) carry it in and put it on the spot.  Again, not fun with old joints!  How hard is it to put in a remote control?  Oh, and that flour?  It doesn't pick it up off of hard wood floors....so, while it sucks...it doesn't suck!  It also only has one rotating sweeper, so if it has a wall on the left side...the corner doesn't get clean.I had a cheaper Chinese model that worked better, and just got a more advanced model....for the same cost as the roomba.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2021

Review Text: Had it for a week, all the sudden it would stop in the middle of a flat floor and say it was near a cliff, it does this constantly despite thoroughly cleaning the sensors and brushes in a week! When I click it to go back to docking station it says it cant locate the home, tried all the online suggestions still acts dumb. Even when I first got it, it will find a room like my kitchen and spend the entire battery life cleaning the kitchen, i live in a 1 bedroom apartment, it should take at most 10 minutes and it spends over an hour in there. I was really excited to finally own one of these and my friends all said it was worth it. I dont know if I just got a messed up one or not but I'll be asking for a refund unless they offer one to replace it and it does better. For sure this is not worth it, buy a different brand or something dont spend your money on this or u will be very disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019

Review Text: I bought this for my mother's birthday, because she hates sweeping the ground, but don't think this actually does the job. It cleans the same area over and over and over again, and misses huge chunks. It also dies 7/10 times mid-clean and is unable to make it back to the loading dock, and no one in my family (including the PhDs and engineers) can seem to figure out why. We've only used it about 10 times, but it often seems like too much of a hassle to use it because we have to monitor the direction it goes and then fetch it once it's done cleaning.

Review Text: I have had this dive feb 4 and it doesn’t work any more and I can’t get any help with it. That’s not a good product!!!

Review Text: We had an original Roomba so we’re skeptical that this would be able to handle our 4 dogs worth of cleaning. As long as we remember to clean out the unit regularly it is working better than expected. It also does a great job on rugs and runners

Review Text: I've only used it once so far. I have set up in the new bedroom & bath that has wood like floors. (My carpet is filthy from remodeling,  so won't waste it on those floors ) but I do like it. I had to help it dock, so hoping next time it'll dock itself.  It cleaned for over 1½ hrs.

Review Text: Money well spent. It cleans super well and I don't have to ever lift a finger again. Fast shipping and easy to set up. I have it scheduled to clean every morning. It does my whole apartment in 1hr 30mins. It's a bit loud so if you are not a heavy sleep it will wake you up.

Review Text: Hard working little robot, but has a tendency to eat charging cables, get stuck under low clearance furniture, and have trouble finding it’s way home.  I love it!  But it requires supervision.  I wouldn’t set it to run while on vacation, for instance.

Review Text: This is a good little vacuum. I didn't give it 5 stars because it seems to always have a hard time finding it's way home and then we have to go searching for it to put it back on the charger. But it does a great job of vacuuming!

Review Text: Does a decent job of picking up dirt. But not great. After three uses we saw it wobbling around and when we looked underneath we saw a big wad of hair entangled around one of the spinning side brushes. Had to surgically cut it apart with a pair of scissors.

Review Text: I like it.  Sometimes it gets stuck and I need to rescue it. Usually does  good job.  If it would just dust the furniture and clean the sinks. Good for daily crumbs etc.

Review Text: What a wonderful creation this lil robot is!  Couldn’t be happier. Picks up everything. I have 3 dogs and 3 cats, and this baby handles all their fluff. I run it 3 times a day just to see how much it can pick up. Very noticeable difference in the cleanliness of the house. Highly recommended.

Review Text: I am very unhappy with this product. Thought the big brand name would be better than my old one and it was not. Vacuum ran to a place and kept repeating. Then wouldn’t dock when requested. If didn’t complete and went home never returned to finish. I want to give it back. Going for a Roborock!

Review Text: Yes. I have a dog. It cleans dog hair very well. I bought this cute er Monday at $200. What a deal!. I would buy another. It is nice to sit on the couch and watch it vacuum while I relax. I do direct it with my feet to the bedroom. It does my whole apartment. Under my coffee table, couch and chairs.
