It's so nice not to pull out my big old vacuum cleaner. I've told my niece to buy my sister one. What a great XMas present. I LOVE IT!!!!!!! 10 stars.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018

Review Text: Ended up returning this item for a number of reasons. First off, it is very noisy. Secondly, it gets “lost.” Even when placed right in front of its charging station, it bumps around like a drunken fool. Tried multiple locations and it just kept getting lost and losing charge contacts. I would manually place in on its charging station, and it would come off the dock even though not charged. Its suctioning isn’t all that, either. I bought it for the name recognition. After this disappointing experience, I did a more thorough research on these kind of vacuums, and purchased another brand that was top rated on consumer reports.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020

Review Text: I am going to start off by telling you I was a non believer.  I have always had top of the line vacuums, via Kirby & dyson that have lasted over 40 years.  I couldn’t understand how this little disc was going to go around and do a better job.  Well, clearly I was wrong.  I love our little “Hazel”, she has changed our lives.  My husband the vacuumer is no long a slave to that chore.  She wakes up on my schedule (iRobot 675) and comes out and does a fantastic job.  I am walking barefoot again and at the end of the day my feet are clean.  But more than that I look all over my floor and no more little bits of anything on the floor.  I can tell you I am a believer and my dyson is crying in the closet.  If your not sure about this item put it in your cart and bring it home, you won’t regret it, I don’t.  Lastly I would rate it much higher if I could.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2019

Review Text: This thing was trash out of the box and I should have returned it but I kept putting off messing with it and by then it was to late. It never fully connected to the wifi. I got it to halfway connect once where it let me put in a schedule but that was it. At some point during my troubleshooting I factory reset it and that cleared the schedule, after that I was never able to get it that far again. I tried multiple calls to their tech support with no progress. They wanted to blame it on my wifi...that I have over 20 devices connected too. Did I mention I am a sys admin with over 20 years of IT experience? I did everything possible on my end and more. I even set it up on its own network with zero security just to get it to connect once so I could schedule it. Nope.I started just pushing the run button on it to manually do it and with in a short time of doing that its run time diminished greatly. It probably only ran 20 times or so and the battery quit holding a charge.It would never go on the shaggy rug in our living room, gues it thought it was to high.I had an older 880 for years that worked great for a long time, rather then keep replacing parts on it i figured I would just bite the bullet and get something new and improved...I was wrong. It is now in the trash and I ordered a competitors robot vacuum. Irobot will not get my money ever again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2021

Review Text: My wife wanted one of these, so I finally went all in with this model. I really thought that it was going to be one of those gadgets you get and it quickly becomes just another thing sitting around the house. It works mostly well, with some caveats. If you are looking to purchase this product or a similar one, I recommend you read on and get lots of advice on which one to get.We named our Donald, because it wanders around aimlessly making lots of noise, and it sucks. That said, it does a surprisingly good job. You have to run it every day. It is truly dumb, and has no memory of where it has been. Some days it vacuums some areas multiple times while missing other areas entirely. But if you let it run every day, it does eventually get around to it. I can put up with the noise for about 30 minutes at a time.Some details about my house: I have a small house: about 1100 sq ft. I have fake hardwood floors. I have a short hair dog and a short hair cat, who both shed more than one would expect. I have no carpets. There are some door jams that Donald successfully navigates. I have a loft area and have let Donald wander around up there. He is smart enough to not throw himself down the stairs. When I want him to clean the loft, I just grab the handle and carry him up the stairs and let him loose. When I am tired of listening to his noise, I carry him down stairs, press the docking button and eventually he finds his way home.One thing I was worried about was where to put the docking station. A lot of the models I read about need a large open area for docking. I have a small house and don't have any place with 4 ft of space around it. I do have this spot under the stairs to the loft area.  It usually docks just fine. You can see in the picture.It picks up a lot of dirt and pet hair. Cleaning it out at the end of the session is disgusting, but not more so than other bagless systems. The rollers and brushes get clogged up with pet hair and need to be manually removed and have all the hair picked out and then put back in every few days. This is easy to do, but even more disgusting. Oh well, we love our pets.Setting it up and getting the app installed and connected wasn't terribly difficult. For some reason, the second day the app couldn't connect, and getting it reconnected was a pain. However, you don't really need the app. Pressing the buttons on top of the device work just fine for the basic functions you use every day.To get 5 stars Donald would have to be smarter about where he goes and where he's been and less disgusting to clean out.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2019

Review Text: I ordered two by mistake...the first one I tried worked so well, I kept the second one and use one upstairs and one downstairs.Especially for the price (less than $200 US), this product cleans very well...especially with pet hair. I send out my robots (Ashley and Twinkle) once or twice a day...the house has never been cleaner. I love the blue tooth app for my phone. I can send out the robots from anywhere I am in the world if I have a Wi-Fi connection.You definitely need to plan for using these robot however. For example:Make sure cords or not on the floor.Although the robots can go between the legs of my dinning table and bar chairs, I like to put the chairs up when running the robots.If your house is cluttered, you would not find these robots as helpful.I periodically pull the furniture away from the wall so the robots can clean behind the furniture.The robots should be cleaned after each use. Cleaning is easy and the replace filter and other parts that can wear out (which I bought, but have not had to use yet) are very reasonably priced (if you shop around) and easy to install.You need to put the docking/charging station tight against a wall.The robots fit under most of my beds and dressers.The cliff sensors need periodic cleaning (just wipe the dirt off) but have worked perfectly around the stairs.The robots go over thresholds very well and adjust from hardwoods to carpet seamlessly.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2020

Review Text: Reviews for all products are becoming irrelevant nowadays especially on amazon , looks like product owners post them . , do not trust them .Suction power is very poor , went over same debris like 6 times , still didn't picked up  .Only pick up big chunks for trash  .Keep on going same place again and again , no mechanism to remind that it already went through that place .In half an hour covered same area of 16 sq feet .If goes inside table or chair  , keep on running between legs of table again and again .This is big round vacuum but vacuum area from where it sucks the debris is very very small in that , like 6 inch  , which is ridiculous . Debris container is only a small cup big .Only good thing : before collision slows down and hence avoid collision at high speed and recognizes some areas very good , like area around kitchen island .Not worth the money for sure , i can clean 5 times bigger area in half time .
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2021

Review Text: Every negative review is some sort of person expecting this machine to be incredibly intelligent and the greatest clean they have ever gotten. That's not what it's for.I work 12 hours a day. I don't like to vacuum and I maybe would do it once a week or two, just because i'm not trying to lug out the vacuum and do this with my day off. I have a cat and i wear shoes in the house, so it needs it. My girlfriend wants to be barefoot in the house but it was always kinda gross to do so.Now I have this robot. I have it scheduled to go at 12 every day besides the days I'm off. I get a message at around 130 that he is done. I get home and the floor is vacuumed. I walk barefoot in my house and it feels clean and looks clean. My house went from being vacuumed 30 minutes biweekly to an hour and a half daily and I do nothing.This is not a search and destroy missile. It's not the deepest clean your house will ever get. It is essentially an RC car with a vacuum on it that won't fall down the stairs and do an 8/10 job 7 days a week while you do stuff you actually want to do with your life.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020

Review Text: I like being able to program my Robot (I call it "Asimov")from my phone.  You can schedule it for anytime and track the progress.  It does not pick up solid soil such as small pieces of paper.  I had dropped a dry lentil bean and left it there to see if Asimov picked it up.  He didn't.  I good note is that when you look into the dust bin, you see it full after just one day's job.  It gets the dust and hair as well as any fuzz.  I love the fact that I can put it in my bedroom and let it go under my king sized bed.  It gets all the dust off.  If it is not near the docking station, it cannot find it's way back. Hopefully, in the future, they will solve that problem.  In the overall, I love my Robot and consider it part of the family lol!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2021

Review Text: I have 2 dogs that shed constantly on dark wood floors. I have thought of buying one of these for awhile and decided to wait hoping the tech would improve and price would reduce. Black Friday I gave in and thought why not. It works about like i expected after reading reviews. It’s random patterns cover some some areas repeatedly while missing others completely. I have run it twice a day for a week and it seems to have covered most everywhere at some point. It runs for about 1 1/2 hr before the battery runs low and it returns to dock. App shows all history as “canceled?” I have decided to keep it as an “extra hand” knowing I will still need to vacuum once a week to know it is all done.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2018

Review Text: Do not purchase if you have a dark carpet or patterned area rug with dark or black colors. My Roomba refuses to vacuum over the black patterns of my area rug, which is about 50% of the rug. I’ve tried the hacks (foil, laminated paper, you name it) nothing works to make the Roomba think it’s not falling off a cliff. The manufacturers need to fix this really bad flaw. The areas it does go over actually do get clean, though. UPDATE: I called Roomba's customer service to complain and they didn't seem too concerned about the problem. It was pretty much: "Oh well. We are sorry for the inconvenience."
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2021

Review Text: My household consists of the following:Me: Shoulder length hairMy Boyfriend: middle of his back long hair (very cute)Cat 1: Domestic Shorthaired Calico (very cute)Cat 2: Long haired garbage dumpling (very cute)Needless to say, there's a lot of hair on my floors and Fred, (yes, I named it Fred) is one of the best purchases I've made. While I still have to clean out corners, Fred does a great job of picking up debris and returning home when he's full. We have a combination of hardwood/laminate and a few rugs, so he works well for us. I don't think he would be as great if you have high pile carpet.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2021

Review Text: This is not the first time have ha an iRobot. I love them! No more dragging along a vacuum with cords and emtying bags of lint, etc. Very satisfied that after roomba makes his rounds he had something inhis drum and I don;t need to do anything but press a bottom. Concerned about this one as it doesn;t light when it redocks as all my others have in the past When I clean my roombas, I curently have two, well then it is like a medication or a baby. It gives me pleasure to have him sparkle as he takes care of me well. My cleaning system is fast, usually done befoe I give my self a mani/pedi.Currently, I do not have a dog or cat so I am not knowledgeable if roomba could do an excellent job but he would need to be cleaned every three uses as I do now. Mine does not charge on the top plate at least it does not have a heartbeat flashing in green so I am concerned. Return process not easy-give you a label and then they want you to go to a Kohl;'s store of which I known of none in NYC. Returns must be made simple or else buyers go elsewhere to purchase.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2019

Review Text: I love the convenience of the Roomba, but this version doesn't quite hit the mark for me.  As an owner of a long-haired cat, I spend quite a bit of time cleaning the brushes of hair.  It seems to clog more frequently than my traditional vacuum.  I also can't say that it completely relieves me of additional vacuuming and sweeping.  The Roomba doesn't clean ad deeply as a traditional vacuum and leaves a bit to be desired in getting edges and corners clean.  Overall, though it does keep a general sense of cleanliness on a regular basis unless it gets stuck.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2019

Review Text: The product works great until 1 month goes by, it will not charge even when its on the charger.  I have cleaned the charging area over and over again and then you have to place an object under the roomba to get the connection and then eventually that doesn't work.  I have found this to be the problem that many have with this brand.  It doesn't matter that the product is wonderful if it doesn't charge.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020

Review Text: I am a single, working mom (also in grad school) who has no time to keep up with all the cleaning a house requires, but not enough disposable income to afford a regular maid service.  Even with a hypo-allergenic dog and only one child, my floors get dirty daily; the dog's fur is velcro for leaves and pollen-y tassels that fall from trees, the child's shoes somehow end up on every surface imaginable, and crumbs are just a fact of life.  I'd recruit the kid's help but she's not yet big enough to do the job well.A couple years ago I tried to get a cheaper robot vacuum instead of spending the extra $ on a roomba, but ended up disappointed and frustrated with how much I had to "rescue" the vacuum.  It didn't perform any better than I did, so I eventually threw it away.Enter corona quarantine:  we are in our house 24/7 whereas before we were here to sleep and maybe 4-5 waking hours. Those extra waking hours walking across the floors magnified the problem: I realized I was spending at least 30 minutes per day trying to keep the floors clean, and not doing a great job as I have arthritis and bending is difficult.  I caved.  I need help, and decided to give robot vacuums another shot.  After extensive research and seeing the affordable price on Amazon, I ordered this Roomba and figured if it had performance issues like the last one I could just return it.It arrived and I could tell right away that the quality of the materials was superior to the previous vacuum - the wheels alone are like monster truck wheels compared to the previous one's toy-like wheels.  But did it REALLY perform any better?Yes. yes. yes. If I could marry this vacuum, I would. It cleaned my floors so well, I had to empty the canister twice on  the first run.  It has an app that lets you start it and send it home. I have been using it daily on both floors of my house, and it looks like they were just cleaned all of the time.  No more stepping on pollen tassels, wondering "is that a leaf or a bug over there?" or looking at tiny fluffy undercoat hairs that fly off my hypoallergenic dog.  This thing is a godsend. Total game changer. Do it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2020

Review Text: Update: A month in & I have Roomba proofed my apartment. Requires 7 separate fixes to prevent my iRobot getting stuck (cushion blocks my recliner base, shoes block multiple places under furniture, lift towel off bathroom floor, leave open one door to prevent Roomba running over Apple device charging wires getting torn up & couple of others). Frequency of complete cycles increased to 4 a week, 5th day the battery runs out before Roomba can make it home. Still a disappointing 3 stars, performs a needed job at my home.It’s probably my fault for expecting faultless operation & some Robot characteristics. Truth is my 675 gets stuck 4 days out of 5 when it runs in my 1250 sq ft wood floor apartment on weekdays when I am at work. It can barely find its way home & runs out of battery power dying on the floor couple of times a month. Generates dust in the air that settles on everything although it appears to fill the dust storage drawer every day. Thinking my Home Depot rug is releasing rug dust daily. Noisier than I expected, not very smart, bumps & turns at random probably covers 90% of the floor in an hour & 50 minutes which appears to be run time when it does not get stuck & finds its way back to base. Ok for the price, as a single guy who does not clean much, keeps me from looking like a complete slob. Dust build up on electronic equipment & shiny furniture requires me to dust more often than I would, in fairness dusting ismuch easier than sweeping...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2020

Review Text: My husband got me this for Christmas and I love it! It is a bit loud, but we only have tile and wood flooring so I’m sure that’s a contributing factor. We have dark wood floors and this model has no issues with it like the older models. We did have a little trouble getting it to find the WiFi network to be able to use the app, but after a few tries with pairing, we got it. We have a 1750 sq ft house, single story, and could do the whole house on one charge before going back to its base.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2018

Review Text: We had an older model years ago, she lasted about five years before living in the home of people who rescue cats finally got  the better of her.  It's been quite a while since we had a robot and last year I bought a machine that was a different brand (Eufy)... that bot was stupid.. headed straight for places it would get stuck, every.single.time.I got this bot because..well, I wanted another one.She's been awesome.  First day was challenging - she kept finding the things that I missed (a cord ran under a couch, a sock drug under a chair by a cat, etc) but since then, she's been rocking it! The floors are clean.The robot vacuums will likely never replace a full-scale vac, but they are a great supplement.  I'm saving up to buy one for upstairs now.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020

Review Text: Where do I start when I saw I am so happy to have "Zoomba" in our apartment. I did a sweep through while the iRobot was charging and prior to letting it do its thing. Let's just say that I am clearly terrible at sweeping because what was picked up by the vacuum was enough to build another small dog. Our iRobot isn't perfect and seemed obsessed with cleaning the living room and around the dog bowl. It barely came into the bedroom or closet but when it did, it cleaned very well. We have it running on a schedule and after EACH cleanup, we do a thorough cleaning of the dust bin, wheels, and filter so that it is ready for the next cleanup. Because we have long-haired dogs this is crucial for maintenance and we want this iRobot to last a very long time.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2020

Review Text: I had no idea what to expect of this type of vacuum. It has surpassed our e expectations. I am disabled and vacuuming it really difficult for me and we have three dogs! We run the Roomba daily and no longer have hair bunnies up the hallway.We have dark wood in our bedroom which shows dirt and dust every time our dogs traipse in and out. The Roomba actually picks up that as well so put flour stays and looks clean.You do have to be sure charger cords etc are up off the floor or it will tangle in them. And.. as others have commented we are living proof that the Roomba will smear dog poop around.  We had a sick pup that had an accident but fortunately we discovered it soon after the vacuum started to go so it was a mess but mostly limited to the Roomba itself. Which,by the way, was easy to disassemble and clean.After watching ours run for a bit our friends also bought the same one and couldn’t be happier. I thought it was kind of noisy until my daughter pulled out the stand up vacuum and I realized the Roomba is way quieter. Definitely glad we bought it. Not gonna lie.. outs weirdly fun to watch too;-)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019

Review Text: This worked ok for the first month, but it’s never been the same since. We’ve cleaned the sensors, bushes, etc. replaced all the replaceable parts multiple times and done all the maintenance suggested by the app. It just never works the same again, and it wasn’t THAT great to begin with. Poor suction, constantly getting stuck, it can’t clean anything black (rugs, etc). It is even scared of the natural coloration of our wood floors sometimes! Plus there are problems with the design: there’s only one side with a sweeper brush so half the area it covers doesn’t get cleaned, and the programming on the robot is not great. It will vacuum the same spot for hours. Now after 6 months of use, it refuses to charge. Wish I had spent more on one of the better versions...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2021

Review Text: I had high hopes based on reviews.  I have a giant rabbit that sheds pretty good in one room in the house.  We've tried various "easy" ways to deal with this, but failed.  So we bought the roomba...almost exclusively because of the reviews.  However...three things.- because it is so loud, we really have to schedule a time for it to run (given everyone is home during the pandemic).  While not large, we have a 4 bedroom house and, when the roomba is running, it can be heard in every corner of the house.- whenever i go to use it, I find it is not charged.  I have to move the unit until it comes alive again (lights turn on) as the electrical connections are made between the unit and its base.  This means, I schedule its use (due to noise) and then cannot run it when desired because i have to wait for it to charge (and, no, I don't have the mental capacity to think ahead to charge it)- and finally, I would say it gets about 80 - 90% of the hair that is on the rug.  It is a tightly woven rug so i would expect it is much closer to a hard surface that something shaggy.  That 10-20% of the hair that is left is spread pretty evenly across the carpet, showing the path the roomba took.  Great, right?It probably should get 1 star, but it does make the carpet marginally better.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021

Review Text: I was skeptical about this little machine, but after letting it run around my house with tile floors, rugs, and carpet in 3 bedrooms, I admit I was impressed.This is not a quiet machine though if you're trying to watch TV while the tiny robot gathers the long hair of 2 women, a dog, and a cat.  I work at home, so I'll have to let it run and keep it out of my office.I also had to cut the hair off the brush and remove things I didn't pick up like hair ties, stray dryer sheets that wrapped around the brush roller.  But once I got over the initial disgust at everything my old vacuum and dry swiffer and were swiffer, etc.  missed, then cleaned the machine out which was easy, it is all good now.The horror of what this thing picked up that I have been missing will haunt my dreams.I also bought a cordless Dyson with attachments that will suck a large rug off the floor with the strength of that motor for when I need to quickly vacuum specific rooms or areas, or my SUVs.The Roomba will not always go up from tile floors onto a good, plush living room area rug though, but that was not why I bought it anyway.For tile floors and regular rugs and carpet, I love this and highly recommend it.  Let's see how long it takes for me to wear it out.Warning:  you think you're already getting all the long, human hair and pet hair and dust before you set this loose on hard floors with dry and wet swiffers, vacuums, brooms, etc.  You're wrong.  Dead wrong.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2019

Review Text: I gave this a 2 star only because I really liked the suction.  I have 2 dogs and I vacuum my house at least once a day.  This did a great job of getting all the dog hair picked up....... when it worked.  I have completely used up 4 Eufy vacuums through rigorous use.... they still run, but the suction isn't great any more.  So I thought I would spend a little more money and upgrade - big mistake.#1 Too loud.  It's twice as loud as my Eufy vacuum.  We couldn't watch TV if it was running (not even in the same room)#2  It couldn't find it's way back to the dock.  When it did dock, it wouldn't completely latch on to the dock, so it wasn't charging.#3  It would just stop in the middle of a clean - for no reason.#4 (minor complaint) There's a little sensor that sticks up another 1/4 inch above the actual body of the Roomba.  When it would try to go under low tables or bookcases, it would get caught up on the sensor.I'm returning this vacuum and I'm going to try a different no-name brand.  Trusting a brand that has a good reputation has failed me.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2021

Review Text: I was excited about getting one of these, but that didn’t last long. This device aimlessly goes around downstairs and it bangs into everything. It was my understanding it was supposed to sense when something was in front of it, not hit it to find out. I contacted support and they said it would hit things and then turn around. Everyday it finds a way to get stuck somewhere new even though I prepare the areas. I can’t run it when I leave the house because it will never finish. It actually picks up the dog hair which is why I didn’t return, but the other things make it a nuisance. Very disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021

Review Text: ETA 10/9/2020:  This unit does great on hard surfaces like the front hall and the kitchen.  It does great around the perimeter of the room and under furniture.  It goes over those areas about a billion times.  It's actually under the dining room table for the fifth time this morning right now.  We don't eat at the table, so there's only hair/dust for it to vacuum.  I'm sure it got all of that the first or second pass,What it doesn't do a good job of is the center of the room (i.e. the high-traffic areas).  Seriously, I think I could do better with dustbuster!  I think it would do much better if it went back and forth in a logical pattern instead of rambling around aimlessly.ETA:  I'm annoyed that when I use the app or the button on top of the robot to tell it to go back to its dock, it keeps on cleaning and cleaning and cleaning.  This morning, my cats activated it around 6am, and I heard it running when my alarm went off at 6:30.  I used the app to tell it to go back to the dock.  When I came downstairs a little before 7, it was still running.  I pushed the dock button on top of the robot, and it kept cleaning till the battery ran out, at which time I had to move the sofa to get to it so I could carry it back to the dock.The Roomba has run 5 times so far.  I ran it twice the first day since it spent most of its time on the perimeters of the rooms and not enough time in the center where the hair shedding feline monster spends most of his time.  I wasn't terribly impressed the first day.  I did learn how to get it to concentrate on a specific area, though.The second day was better.  It was able to figure out how to get into the front hall and the kitchen and did a decent job overall.  The cats managed to turn it on at 10 o'clock last night, but when they came charging upstairs I heard the whirring and used the app to send it back to the dock.  It's now running for the 5th time.I empty the bin after each run, and it's been full each time.  I'm absolutely amazed by how much dust, human hair, and cat hair it has picked up, and a little embarrassed that I didn't realize the carpet was so dirty!  Roomba even sucked up two catnip toys that it found hidden under the sofa the first day, but I was able to retrieve them.If it keeps cleaning this well, I'll be happy with the money I spent.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   I own three tabby cats and one husky dog, all of whom shed an insane amount of fur. I'm also highly allergic to all of them in addition to suffering from seasonal and dust allergies. (Benefits of pet ownership > my sinuses, apparently.)My house is also quite large. I mainly use it on the main floor, which has a very large and open family room, dining room, kitchen, front entryway, bathroom, and back door area. I also move the Roomba to my upstairs floor to clean the bedrooms. All rooms have hardwood floors with a few area or entry rugs. Prior to owning the Roomba, if I wanted fur-free floors I had to vacuum at least twice a week while wearing a filter mask to avoid sinus infections. I was so exhausted of the upkeep.I was worried that the Roomba wouldn't be able to keep up with the amount of fur in my house and/or would struggle with the transition between rugs and hardwood, but I decided to risk the expense. I'm so glad I did and wish I had bought one years ago!!!!The Roomba is an excellent option for keeping up with daily pet fur and small messes on hardwood floors and carpet. I set it to clean once a day on my main floor, and two or three times a week I carry it upstairs to clean. Every evening I use my large, upright vacuum to vacuum out the Roomba's canister and filter, which takes about a minute's worth of time. Check out my photo to see how much it picks up on my main floor every day! At least once a week I inspect the bottom of the Roomba to check the brushes. Sometimes I remove the brushes and pull or cut out out any stuck threads or fur.It takes about an hour and a half each day to complete its job on my main floor and usually returns to the home base to charge again without issue. If the house is particularly messy I let it charge and run it a second time, but I don't usually need to do this. Sometimes it misses small sections of floor, but since I run it every day it usually hits everywhere at least every other day.One small complaint I have is that when the Roomba moves off a carpeted area or rug and onto the hardwood floor, sometimes it leaves small chunks of fur that must have been caught underneath it. (See my second photo and video.) Considering how amazing a job it does on a daily basis on keeping the hardwood floors fur-free and what my upkeep used to be I'm not going to complain too much about this inconvenience, but I hope that the engineers at Roomba find a way to improve their product over time. Maybe the suction power needs to be increased?The Roomba has greatly reduced my need to do frequent vacuuming and now I can get away with a deep clean vacuum job once every other week. It has been a mental health and sinus saver and I'm so glad I bought it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020

Review Text: I did a lot of research before purchasing. This was a birthday gift to myself.  I have a short haired cat that is a shedding beast! I work full time and to be honest I’m exhausted at the end of my work day.  I made this purchase to aid in my daily housework.  This has been an AMAZING addition to my top household cleaning tools.  I have used this Roomba weekly since I purchased and it definitely aids my housework needs.  I generally run my Roomba, once to twice throughout the week with my majoring housework being done each weekend.  My Roomba is an excellent addition to my household regimen.  I would definitely recommend and in fact I purchased a second Roomba as a gift to my mother who has difficulty vacuuming since having undergone a mastectomy. I would DEFINITELY Recommend this product!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2020

Review Text: Overall, I do recommend it and would buy again.Pros:1. Can run often because it doesn't take too long to charge (2-3 times per day).2. After a few weeks of mapping the house, it easily finds its home without help.3. CLEAN FLOORS - It does a great job picking up hair and dirt, and really does cover the whole house fairly well with regular use. We have not had to use a manual vacuum since getting it, other than for spot jobs like fan blades and corners.4. Price is very good considering it does most everything the newer ones can do, but much less expensive.Neutral observations:1. The bin has to be emptied each run, but it's very easy and quick. (I have many animals and a toddler in my home, so it may be less often for others.)2. Would be true for any vacuum, but you have to pick up items it will suck up, because it will eat it and get stuck, including curtains, bed skirts, and animal toys, etc.Cons:1. It gets stuck under some appliances and scratches itself up thanks to the little antenna bump on the front.2. If you have the standard roller, it will need to be cleaned of hair pretty often. It just wraps around it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2021

Review Text: I use a power wheelchair. For those not familiar, power wheelchairs are great for bringing the outdoors inside - all over your floors! Vacuuming two or three times a day just isn't something I enjoy, but I live alone and somebody's got to do it. With my little Roomba, I no longer have to. I just tell Alexa on my Echo Plus to start Roomba and off he goes and gets my entire 1,500 sq ft house done on a single charge before needing a nap. I've set the app for him to run once a day, but often ask him to wake up and run again if I've messed up the floors. He NEVER complains. With a couple of ears taped to his top and a little tail on his back, it's like having a new pet in the house. Careful, though. I caught myself talking to it once already asking it if it needed help when it was doing circles under my couch!  He was fine and quickly figured a way out. He does an impressive job of eating all the tracked in dirt and dried mud from my linoleum, tile, and carpet, and climbs through threshold transitions between floor types with ease.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2021

Review Text: I've had this roomba for about a year now. For the most part, it does a good job. It'll never get everything, but I knew that going in. With 3 cats, just helping maintain the tumbleweeds of hair they leave is worth it. And it does help quite a bit with getting a lot of excess hair, crumbs, and other debris that accumulates on out floors in just a couple days.My biggest issue, and the primary reason this only gets 3 stars, is the charging base. 1. The Roomba can almost never find the base on its own, even if placed directly in front of it and told to go home. 2. More importantly, it never seems to charge! Even when we place it on ourselves, or are able to get it to get there on its "own," it somehow loses connection. And then the next time we go to use it, oops there's no charge. We've moved the base to different locations, on tile, on carpet, and we've secured it as best we can so it won't move (it's light as heck, and the barest touch can move it a mile). Despite this, the roomba always seems to be sitting just off so it won't charge.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2021

Review Text: Stops 7-8 times during one vacuum, with error to move to another location. Why? Gets stuck on a simple short pile rug. Description  says 3.5 in clearance , but doesn’t fit under my furniture that has a 4 in clearance. I have 2 chows that shed like 20 cats!!  I want some that cleans under the furniture.  And NOISY!!  If I didn’t have to babysit it the entire time it was running that would be okay. Bottom line, I can use the Dyson upright, do the entire house including moving the furniture in less time it takes to watch this noisy beast bounce off the furniture... make it’s way to the middle of the floor.. and announce... error 6... please move to a new location.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019

Review Text: Worked fantastically for two weeks. We absolutely loved it. Really helped out with the household cleaning, keeping the floor in great shape. Then after two weeks it suddenly stopped charging. Gave an error when on the charger. Tried the troubleshooting tips to no avail. Exchanged it for a new one. The new one came and wouldn't charge either. On with tech support again and they're sending a new battery which will take a week to arrive. Two defective products in a row. If this new battery doesn't fix the issue we will return and seek another brand.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2021

Review Text: I have wanted an iRobot for a while now, but was very skeptical!  After much research, I went with the iRobot Roomba 675.  Needless to say, I am very pleased.  This unit vacuums my tongue and groove oak floors, moves to my carpet, and then tile with ease.  It also cleans my rugs very well with no problem!  I have been amazed each time i dump it at the hair, dirt and fine dust it has gotten from the floor!  If there is an extremely sandy spot, she will concentrate on that specifically!  The Roomba 675 is easy to use and can be set to vacuum at specific times throughout the day and week!  It runs for approximately 90-100 minutes and reruns to her charger.  We live in the country and have grown children and grandchildren in and out all the time, leaving my floors a sandy mess; Now, I just run my Roomba!  Great choice, great product!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2020

Review Text: set up is easy the thing really does work it filled up the waste container quickly just from some bedroom carpet the problem with this thing is that it refuses to go over any carpet that is black or partially black I have a large rug With some black patterns that just freak it out and it refuses to clean I had to return it and bought a higher end model hopefully this one won’t have that issue besides that it’s great but this is a huge dealbreaker many people may have black rugs carpet or even mats that this thing won’t go over they should be mentioned at the forefront of its description and yet it’s not you have to dig for it online to find out that it’s even an issue the old models you could block the little sensors with paper or foil this one you cannot do that and there’s no way to disable the sensors which is totally ridiculous for people who don’t have stairs or any kind of drops these are completely useless so for that alone think twice about getting this if you may have any black surfaces that you need cleaned otherwise it’s a great unit
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020

Review Text: Let's start with the good news:- I got this vacuum for a reasonable price (on sale for under $180).- It does a pretty good job of cleaning on hardwood & rugs (no carpet where I use it).- The filter is really easy to clean.- It holds a charge quite well.Bad news:- This thing will clean some areas a dozen times or more and ignore other areas.- It gets stuck fairly easy and seems to like going to those areas where it gets stuck a lot.- The dirt storage bin is pretty small.- It wanders around like a robotic chicken with its robotic head chopped off.I would recommend that you get a more expensive version of this, but the price difference is way to much to justify that.Tip: If you have this and it is unable to dock itself (just happened to me), start by unplugging the power cord from the docking unit and then plugging back in. See if that helps before calling customer support.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2021

Review Text: This is my second robot. The first one kept getting stuck under the table and always got lost so I returned it for this one. Instant regret. It’s noisy which isn’t a big deal until it’s been on for 30 minutes. It’s bulky so it doesn’t fit under the hutch like the old one. Also my mom has a step from the kitchen to the living room and always gets stuck. We have to move it away from the “cliff” and hit the button. Also you have to spend forty dollars on a separate contraption if you don’t want going in a certain spot which is unreliable according to the reviews. The old robot had the strips you could put down. Im returning this one and getting the one on sale at Walmart for Black Friday. Hopefully 3rd times a charm
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020

Review Text: I really had high hopes for this thing (let's blame the marketing frenzy surrounding it). The reality is, it's not that great. It cleans mediocre at best, and that's if it remembers rooms and doesn't just goes willy nilly all over the place, or spends most of its time in a room of its choosing and barely any time in others. Don't get me started on the fact that most times it forgets where to duct so it has to be nudged back to its station, and it gets stuck so many times the amount of times I get up to help it, I might as well just get a broom and sweep my house myself. Then out of the blue, one random day, it would clean well, need little help, go to each room as it should, and get all the noticeable crumbs on the hard wood instead of passing around it...and just when my hope builds, it goes back to being willy-nilly-and-needy as before. Hence three stars-I'm sadly holding on to hope.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2021

Review Text: Purchased this for our 1,400 square foot home that has multiple surfaces such as carpet, laminate and linoleum. This Roomba has no trouble going over each surface or conforming to each surface. The Roomba was easy to set up and connected to the phone app without any issues or frustrations. The app will alert you when the Roomba has finished its "job" or if the Roomba itself is stuck in a location (it gets stuck often and will absolutely eat your charges and cables). The Roomba will return to the docking station to charge once it has done it's job. The collection container is pretty small, but holds a lot of debris and can be easily dumped. There is a large button on the top of the machine that turns it on and there is also a button to quit the job and return to docking station. There is a battery symbol that lets you know at all times the battery life. Our family owns a small, short haired dog and the Roomba does a pretty good job of picking up hair and debris, although we also let the Roomba go over a room twice before moving on. Recommend for convenience but not a replacement for vacuuming.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020

Review Text: It's tremendously inefficient. It goes back and forth endlessly over the same spots. But eventually it gets the entire floor clean, so the results are good if you don't mind the bizarre process. It also confuses/ frustrates my girlfriend. She's always baffled by it and tries to tell it to be more logical. Watching her interact with it is priceless entertainment. These are the actual reasons why I purchased it: nonstop hilarity and surprisingly clean floors.Update several months later: It's still hilarious to watch and still great at cleaning my floors. I just bought a second one for upstairs.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021

Review Text: I got this in the hopes that it was as good as its hype. The first problem came when I tried to charge it before I even had the chance to use it. The unit would not charge at all. I thought since it was on carpet it was not stabilize enough to connect the sensors to charge the unit. So the next day, I moved it to a flatter service. SAME thing, it would not charge at all. So I put something heavy on it to stabilize it and made sure it "sensed" the unit to charge it. After a full day of charging, I finally tested it. It was WAY too loud for what I needed. I have a Kyvol robot vacuum and it was way quieter than the Roomba. However, I would have to say that the Roomba did do a better job at cleaning that the Kyvol. BUT when the Roomba was short on battery, it did not return to its charging base. It just stopped. That is an annoying feature. I was also never able to connect it to Alexa or the app, so that was annoying as well. Returned it and will not buy anything by iRobot again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020

Review Text: Get a Roomba they said, save time!  So here is my typical day Since Roomba .  Before I leave for work I have to go through the entire house check for any power cords or charging cords on the floor (unplugging several table lamps), shut doors to bathrooms, closets and guest rooms (where it can't find its way out) putting things in areas where it has gotten stuck before, (but it seems to find someplace new every time).  Pictures attached are a couple places where it has repeated gotten stuck.  It is programed to start at noon, so about 12:20 or so receive a text it is stuck.  Get home and play hide and seek to find out where it is, move it, restart it and get to enjoy the festive show of watching a drunk sailor with ADD wandering around  over the same spots repeated while completely missing a third of the room.Running it everyday for a month it has only found its charging station twice and has never made it through the entire house (2000 sq ft  with two rooms and the bathrooms closed off so it has to cover maybe 1500 sq. ft).  I have to again play hide and seek to bring it back to its charging station.  Then I have to empty and clean out the brushes every day due to the small collection chamber and the fact it rolls my dogs hair into the brush to the point I have to use scissors to cut it out.  Figuring it up it takes me about 20 minutes each day to prepare for and take care of my `time saving convenience'  when I used to only vacuum about  30 minutes twice a week.  They must have programed the AI off of either Forrest Gump or Abby Normal, because I have not seen any improvement since day 1.  The final straw is when yesterday I can't get it to charge in its docking station unless I prop it up front with something.  Returning today.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021

Review Text: The roomba cannot go onto my rugs (which are not thick), it also cannot make the transition from hardwood to carpet. I’m disappointed that I have to pick everything up off of the floor because it does not navigate well
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2018

Review Text: I absolutely love ❤️ this thing!!! I got it from Amazon Warehouse for a lot cheaper then buying it new and it came in the original box 📦 with all the packing as if new. It looked like someone opened the box then closed it and returned it. It had all original parts and booklets and was still in the new wrapping. The booklet says to charge for 3 hours but I recommend charging longer before you use it for your first sweeping 🧹 job. It was really easy to hook up to WiFi and the Roomba/iRobot app gave you step by step easy instructions that I believe anyone could follow and set up this lil guy. The app allows you to control the Roomba and start/stop jobs; return to the dock; and make it play sounds when you want to find it in your home.  It dose excellent in the space I have it set up for and cleans 3/4 rooms no problems. I honestly was shocked after emptying the dirt/dust bin on this and seeing how much was in it considering I gust swept 🧹 my floors with my Shark and Dyson about 2 days prior to running the Roomba for the first time. It dose good on carpet but obviously it will not deep clean the carpet as a standard vacuum. It handle the thick rugs no problem and leaves the hardwood and linoleum/tile floors spotless! I run it every day and am truly amazed on how much it picks up! It would do great at picking up pet hair as well. I am very satisfied with my purchase and may be ordering a second one for the other portion of the house 🏡. This thing saves so much time it is incredibly! Instead of sweeping sweeping every day or every other day I can sweep once a week or every other week with my traditional vacuumed and my house is spotless. My floors have never been cleaner and I am not ashamed to say it’s because of my Roomba!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   We call her "Tilley".  I received Tilley on 12/24/19, so she's been part of our family for about 3 weeks.  I am very pleased with her!  What I feel is important to know about us is that we are a retired couple, and both of us have lower back issues.  Vacuuming is a definite no-no for both of us.  The only rooms where we have area rugs is bedroom.  Our living room, dining room and hallway (see video) are hardwood floors, and kitchen is vinyl tile, and we have no wall-to-wall carpeting.I approached my purchase of Tilley feeling that, if she picked up 80% and I needed to sweep up the rest, I'd be very pleased.  I'm happy to say that this is truly the case.Tilley runs approximately 1.5 hours on one charge.Tilley DOES transition easily from solid floors to carpets.You can see in my video that she seems to "wander" around, "willy-nilly", not going in any pattern, and I was concerned about this at first.  But eventually she comes back around.Negatives:  As I mentioned, she DOES miss a few areas.  After all, the unit's shape is ROUND, so getting into corners may not be to the degree you would like.  So, if you're picky, you get out a broom and brush out what she missed.  To me, not a big negative.  Another point is that the cup that holds the dirt is small.  This should be obvious - the unit is not as large as a regular size vacuum!  Because we are home when she's going about her job, I usually let her run around for about 45 mins, then I empty her cup, replace it, and send her on her way again!  I find this is most necessary when she does the bedroom carpets.  In my bathrooms, I pick up the throw rugs before I let her loose.  Probably not necessary, but I just choose to take them outside and shake them.  Makes it easier for Tilley to get around in my small bathrooms.Connecting to WIFI was not possible - my iPad and iPhone are both older and will not update to IOS 11.  I'm home most of the time anyway, so I really didn't need that feature.This was probably the best Christmas present I ever bought for myself.  My floors are a lot cleaner than they've been in a long time!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2020

Review Text: This is our 2nd robot vac. Bought it Nov 2018 during Amazon Days. Glad I didn't pay full price. We used it on the main floor of our home but blocked off 2 rooms, leaving approximately 1,000 sq feet for it to vacuum. All but one room is hardwood with the one being carpet. Within 6 months we had to start propping it up to connect to the base to fully charge. At first used a small piece of cardboard. Around 6 months ago we upgraded to a small halloween mask we had laying around. Fast forward to last week when had to use a pair of fluffy socks stuffed under the bottom to angle it in such a way to make contact. Starting last week (Aug 2020, now owned for 21 months) it stopped making contact between unit and base no matter what we did, including sitting on floor holding the unit ON the base. It has officially died. When it ran, it did good. We have 2 short haired dogs and it always got their hair. We emptied the bin daily and kept the unit clean (which you must do often). Overall I would not recommend at its full price. But, if you're someone with a small home or apartment who can get this at a good price, it could be a good fit for you.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2020

Review Text: I hate cleaning and have wanted one of these for a LONG time.  I am happy to have it and use it weekly, BUT it was not the cleaning savior I had hoped for.  We have 3 cats and dark wood floors, so I bought it mostly to handle the hair, which it does wonderfully.  Suction is great, no complaints there.  My main problem with this machine is that it gets stuck in the same room/area for much longer than needed, and sometimes never goes to other parts of the house that need it.  It does not do a good job getting under the toe kick of the kitchen cabinets.  If I had it to do over again, I would have paid for one of the more upgraded models.  Also, it is VERY LOUD.  I work from home and if this thing is running in the next room, I have to pause it to take a phone call.  Overall I am glad to have it, but it is not the cleaning superman of my dreams.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2019

Review Text: I’ve had this little thing for a few weeks and I am absolutely loving it.  Our house is about 1000 sq ft so it’s pretty small and the vacuum covers the entire house in one run.  I can run this thing a handful of times in one day!  It’s a bit loud so I don’t, but it’s not as loud as our normal vacuum.  The living area is tile and the bedrooms are carpet, and it goes in the rooms no problem.  It goes right over my low pile runners no problem but doesn’t go up onto my shag area rug.  It has no problem going into my kitchen mat/runner which surprised me. We have a dog who sheds a lot and the tile was so difficult to clean because the broom pretty much sends half of it floating into the air.  This thing is so low profile it doesn’t stir up the fur and it has good enough suction that it picks up a ton.I also have a husband and four kids who go in and out of the house pretty much constantly and sweeping multiple times a day was annoying.  Since I got this thing, not only does it get up all of the dirt, but my kids are more conscious about wiping their feet.  We named him Bertram after the butler in their favorite kids comedy show and giving him that personality has been fun for us.And every single day all of the beds in the house get vacuumed under while I take care of other things!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2021

Review Text: From the get go, the Roomba I received would run for 20 minutes, then stop and announce an error message indicating that the wheels were obstructed. They weren't. I'd reset it and the same thing would happen. Also, it would stay in one small area of the room and not cover the entire floor. iRobot sent me a wheel replacement unit. Same problem. They sent an entire replacement unit (expect for the battery and dock). Same problem. So they sent me a second replacement unit. Same problem, except this time it stopped after 5 minutes. iRobot asked me to send it back to them to repair it. It took over 2 weeks for them to get the proper shipping supplies to me. This is now 2 months later and a total of over 2 hours on the phone with them, never mind the time packing and unpacking the various replacements. I had an Eufy for 4 years that worked like a charm. Very sorry I decided to change brands and am purchasing an Eufy replacement now.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2021

Review Text: Well, I went back and forth for several years before I finally “bit the bullet” and purchased this jewel. His name is Tobor and I’m wondering why I didn’t get him sooner! Seriously, my floors have never been cleaner! I can walk around barefoot without feeling like I have gunk on my feet. I have a long haired cat so there seems to always be cat hair as well as my human hair everywhere. I was a little apprehensive about getting him set up as I can sometimes be technically challenged. But this was a breeze. If you can read you can get this thing set up in a few minutes. I got him all charged up and started with cleaned, mopped floors. We have ceramic tile and wood floors with one large area rug and the transition between the difference surfaces is great.  He does run around in a very haphazard way, so if this is gonna bug you, I’d recommend you set him to do his job when you aren’t around. He does get the job done! I have him scheduled to run every morning and he keeps the floors nice and clean! I love the fact that he fits under most of our furniture including the beds! Vacuuming under beds is not my idea of fun. I wouldn’t consider this a method for deep cleaning but it sure is a wonderful addition to our family! We love Tobor and consider this as money very well invested!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020

Review Text: This little guy is a must! I have a 65 lb lab/pit dog and she NEVER stops shedding. I was using my regular vacuum at least once a day, as I can not stand dirty floors. This Roomba does an amazing job! I have a very expensive Miele vacuum, which I love, so I wasn’t too excited to spend a lot on the Roomba. I can’t see why, after having it for a few weeks, anyone would buy the more expensive ones. This 675 cleans my hardwoods and area rugs perfectly.Setting up the WiFi was a bit of a pain and though the app shows connected, I’ve never been able to get my phone to run the Roomba, but that doesn’t bother me. I just manually push the button.I have this little guy clean nearly every night. Before I go to bed, I do a walkthrough my house, picking up items that might compromise little Roomba’s efforts. Lucky for me, my furniture is high enough off the ground so it’s able to easily clean under my sofa and arm chairs.As someone else mentioned, DO NOT watch this thing in action. It will make you crazy watching the completely random pattern. That’s why I run it at night. As a test, I did put a piece of string in a specific spot in my kitchen, the next morning, it was gone. Yay Roomba! The amount of ick in its little dirt compartment every morning is a testament to a job well done. (One time my husband asked if I’d just mopped... nope, but little Roomba had cleaned in the night) I make sure to clean the bin every time (and remove the filter and bang it against the garbage can) it has cleaned, and about once a week I remove the brush and clean it as well.I’ve now only used my Miele vacuum once since having this and that was after I took down my Christmas tree - there were needles all over the floor. ( I don’t sweep with a broom, as I feel like the dirt would buildup in between my hardwood) I suppose that’s the ONLY drawback to a Roomba... when you want immediate and specific results. I could have pushed the spot clean and it would have probably cleaned it, now that I think about it.To all of you clean freaks out there: this Roomba is better, WAY better, than sliced bread. Even if you don’t eat glutton.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020

Review Text: I wavered on buying a robot vacuum for a long time, but finally caved and bought Minion. Even with the cons listed below, I would 100% recommend this Roomba to family and friends (which I already have)! Minion has saved me so much time, and I'm enjoying actually walking barefoot on my floors again.PROS:Easy to set up and use. I especially love the "scheduled clean" feature on the app! I've scheduled Minion to run while I am at work, so all I do the day of cleaning is move a few items like cat toys off the floor and then simply empty the dust bin when I get home.Cleans pretty thoroughly. Previously no mater how much I swept, my floor seemed to always be covered in cat litter, dirt, clumps of black kitty hair...Minion is great at getting about 98% of it, switching between my carpets and hardwood/tile with ease. (My apartment is mostly hardwood with a few large area rugs and tile in the kitchen.)Charge lasts a while. Minion is able to clean my entire 700-sq foot apartment (except for the bathroom) on one charge, about 1.5 hours.Doesn't scratch my hardwood floors.CONS:The Roomba is louder than I expected, especially on hardwood or tile. Because I live in an apartment building with thin walls, I only run Minion during the day.It's also a bit thicker/taller than I expected, but is still able to fit under most of my furniture (6 inches seems to be the lowest it can fit under).I get that the robot has to bump into things to get a sense of where it's at, but it bumps objects fairly roughly. You can expect your kitchen chairs, trashcans, etc. to move around. There's actually marks on the front of my Roomba from where it's bumped into the wall, etc.I had to buy a separate virtual wall to stop Minion from running into my cat's dishes. You WILL need one of these devices if you have a pet. It was very necessary and does its job, but it was a little annoying to have to buy a separate expensive accessory.It can take a few tries for the vacuum to dock itself. It'll run into the docking station and move it around. Also, I found out that if you physically pick up the Roomba during a cleaning cycle (say, to move it to another spot), it won't be able to dock itself. Just fyi. Now, I just leave Minion to do its thing and dock itself whenever it finishes.All that being said, I love how much time Minion has saved me, and coming home to clean floors every day with so little effort. For those reasons alone, worth every penny!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020

Review Text: Two Australian Cattle Dogs NOT blowing their coats.  Leave this vacuum needing care each time it is used.  The image shown is an example of the daily cleaning of this vacuum.  Both large wheels, the small wheel, the brush and the sweep.  All have to be cleaned DURING use.  (You can see the circles of hair from the brush and sweep spindles.)  The detritus receptacle is large.  However, so is the very useful filter which inhabits nearly one half of the detritus receptacle.  This vacuum pinballs its way through a room.  There seems to be no charting a path for this vacuum.  However this vacuum is not an entire loss.  I do like the option to "beep" the vacuum to see where it resides.  When for some reason it has not returned to its charger.  I am off to see if I can return this vacuum.  Then I am returning to vacuuming, using my Dyson.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2020

Review Text: This irobot repeatedly rammed into furniture and cabinets.  After 10 days and 5 calls for tech service it did not clean all rooms in my house, it was stuck repeatedly sometimes in the middle of the floor with nothing around it, it continued to ram furniture. I have used robot vacuums since 2012. This did not compare to Neato brand. I do think this unit was faulty,  yet working with customer support was useless.  They treated me as if I didn't have a clue how to operate anything.  They did not listen,  just went down their list.  At one point they suggested I put up boundaries for areas it didn't clean. Then after it cleaned other areas and charged,  I could pick it up, take it to rooms not cleaned and set it down to clean, then repeat in other uncleaned room. When I said I was returning it, they sent the info to 'tech support ' promised to call in 48 hours.  I waited 3 business days.  I called them on the 4th day. They offered to send a new battery to see if that would help.  I returned it instead.  I only considered it because of the consumer report reviews.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2021

Review Text: Husband had bought us a 900 series for our 5 room town house of mixed carpet and hard floors which works wonderfully, so when I had to move away this year for work I went cheaper for my tiny apartment.I love that I can tell it to clean when I’m at work from the app so the noise doesn’t bother anyone.I noticed that there seems to be no discernible pattern to the way this robot vacuum “drives”. The 900 series leaves precise back and forth patterns of parallel lines on carpet. This one looks like a kindergartener scribbled the cleaning route when it’s done LOL! But it seems to get every inch it can fit into and it doesn’t seem like it takes any longer than the “better” version does.It gets hair better from hard floors than carpet, and there are times I have to chase crumbs from corners and tight spaces. But it’s easy to dump the debris container without making a huge mess or a dust cloud behind and it’s doing work for me while I’m busy so I don’t mind it!One thing of note, it often gets stuck under our recliner chair driving over a foot underneath so I leave it a little out when I plan to clean when not at home.Also explain to any elderly folks that it does play messages but is not voice command so they don’t freak out on it like my dad does when he’s visiting haha! “Go to your home, robot! Stop cleaning!” Hahaha...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2019

Review Text: Amazing device if it did was it was supposed to. The potential to never worry about vacuuming with pets is amazing. That being said, I bought this roomba thinking it would be able to autonomously vacuum my place. It can't. I have it running every day, and it's only successfully completed one job (meaning it started and docked itself without help). I cannot understand how the design team would allow an autonomous VACUUM to get stuck on virtually any carpet that includes black somewhere in the design. Instead of relying on optical sensors for cliff detection, they should use sonar or something else. At a MINIMUM, they should allow you to turn the cliff sensors off with the app. Instead, you can find videos of people literally opening the case of the roomba and modifying the circuit board so that it will do what it's supposed to out of the box.3 stars until they add a software disable to the cliff sensors. Selling additional hardware (lighthouses and islands or whatever they are called) to bandaid your bad design is even worse. I'm a design engineer, I get where the corners were cut.UPDATE: lowering to a 1 star. This stupid thing won't even charge now without tons of assistance. We've cleaned the charging contacts, and still it sits there repeatedly trying to dock itself. It's now been running for an hour and the couple of area rugs that I have are not clean.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018

Review Text: I was really excited about this roomba and it worked great until it got to my big area rug.  It has black lines on it and every time it encounters them it stops and gives error 6 saying it's on the edge of a cliff.  It's basically the cliff sensors on the roomba thinking it's going to fall down stairs.  Customer services only solution to this is to block of the room where the issue is.  This is a big area of my house and defeats the purpose of having it.  I'm contemplating returning it, not sure if it's worth it if I have to vacuum that room anyway.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019

Review Text: HOLY MOLY!!! I didn't know what to expect when I bought this vacuum, so I will say this 1- we are gross and my robot vacuum proved it. 2- it's been a very long time since I bought something that exceeded my expectations, but this vacuum blew any previous notions away.PROs: easy set up on app and Alexa, feels sturdy and well built, engineered to access most of the moving parts to clear things like Legos, has a schedule feature (set and forget), texts you if it gets stuck or ate a sock, and when it finished the job, has NAV in it for getting the corners of the room.CONs: kinda loud, you "can" watch TV while it's working, would suggest letting it run when your not home.I'm a real person, a parent and pet owner, do yourself a favor and get a Roomba, you will not be disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2020

Review Text: This has changed our lives. We just had a baby and didn't want to have to sweep every day on top of other duties. Basically, we tidy up a few things before running roomba. We move shoes to a certain place, put baby  toys away, get papers and other obstacles put away and close doors to rooms we don't want to clean or know that roomba will get stuck in. The two common issues are roomba sucking up a string or toy that we missed, and roomba accidentally closing a door and getting trapped. Otherwise, it's pretty interesting to watch roomba bump around at random and actually hit all of the spots over the course of the cleaning. He cleans the best when the floors are already pretty clean and he is just collecting the loose dirt that the dogs have dragged in.Noise wise, it is a little louder than we expected. We have hard floors with little cracks. Roomba kind of stumbles around and makes noise, making it hard to watch tv without cranking up the volume. I run it when I am doing something I don't need to listen to. It's great white noise and doesn't disturb the sleeping baby.On carpet it isn't very loud. Cleans great.Easy to clean out. Press one button and a compartment pops off to dump in the trash.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2021

Review Text: Two girls with long hair, two cats, and a dog. That's what this Roomba has to deal with. He does a decent job tidying up the place, but I still vacuum once or twice a week and pick up a disgusting amount of hair that he misses.He's also dumb as a box of rocks. He's constantly getting stuck under stuff and has to beat his way out of it. He also doesn't go in a nice, neat pattern. Oh no, he goes all over the damn place for one corner to the other. He misses spots if you aren't guiding him. A lot of missed spots.He offers a little bit of pet exercise. The animals used to follow him around until they bored of him. Now that point is null and void for me.I bought my Roomba on Black Friday and two weeks later, I had to buy a new TV and TV stand because of him. He kept getting stuck under the TV stand and banging against the leg of it until the leg finally moved out from under the stand and sent the 50" flat screen TV stand crashing down. So yeah, I might have saved $150 or whatever it was on the Black Friday deal, but he cost me a helluva lot more than that. Thankfully the Roomba wasn't hurt in the Fall of the TV. Even though he's just average at his job, because of how much he cost me, he will vacuum my house until he can't vacuum no more.Honestly, I'm not sure if I would recommend or not.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020

Review Text: Disclaimer: I have two medium dogs. I also switched from a Roborock because I felt the mop function wasn't worth the price. I was looking for a simple robot vacuum for an affordable price.I chose this model because it has good reviews and a reasonable price. Unfortunately it didn't work out for me. Here's why..1. Before purchasing, do yourself a favor and check out the app reviews. It has a 2.4 rating. It's useless, to be kind. Regardless, I decided to run the roomba and give it a chance.2. The photos I included were taken AFTER the Roomba ran for about an hour. It got stuck multiple times and required assistance to break free. The biggest deal breaker was it's inability to pick up the dog hair. It mostly moved the hair around until it was lining the rugs in our house. The photo I included of my shark vacuum was the amount of hair/dirt that was picked up AFTER the Roomba. I could see this being a decent investment if you A: don't have animals, B: live in a small apartment/house, C: don't mind using it without the app.In the end I gave it two stars - one for the price, one for amazon return ease.I'll be switching back to Roborock (a more affordable model than my previous purchase). It always did a good job, my only complaint was the price.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021

Review Text: So I sampled a few vacuums (ilife, uefy, bobsweep, samsung, and this) and did my own review since I couldn't find it. Imo, all of these vacuums in the under $300 range a lacking. (I didn't try any more expensive vacuums.) The strong points of this vacuum is it's cleaning power. It seemed to do the best job cleaning and was able to get under things the other vacuums didn't, like a sofa with a dust skirt. All other vacuums encountered it and stopped and turned around, this touched it to see if it could pass and kept going slowly until it did. The other vacuums also somehow managed to get caught under this sofa when they made it under but then could not come out passed the dust skirt. This vacuum is by far the loudest of the bunch, which can get a little annoying. I'd recommend this to someone who would have it work when not home, but if you're gonna use it when home, i'd recommend ilife or uefy. another issue is it has a hard time docking. Even when it finds the dock which is a crapshoot in itself, it somehow manages to screw it up and not dock. Then it moves from side to side which only moves the dock into an awkward position which then makes docking without human assistance almost impossible. If they could figure out the noise, docking, and added another "spinny whisker" on the other side it would be great! Another thing would be to learn the house. In this age of technology that has to be fairly simple.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2019

Review Text: Buy it.Here's why:Cost/benefit analysis:How often do I want to vacuum?  about 2-3 times per week.  But I don't...Time: 1/2 hour x 2.5 x 52 = 75 hours.If your time is worth $3/hour, that's $225 in value.So, the thing pays for itself in the first year.  (I bought it on special at $200.It also has tons of non-monetary value.  of course.I actually only vacuum every 1-2 weeks.Now, I'm happier because I can ALWAYS walk around bare-foot with no dog hair around, no dirt or anything.That's awesome.I'm also happier because...I never like vacuuming.  How I have freed up timeIf I was vacuuming like ever 10 days, x 30 minutes-- I guess I vacuumed like 36.5 times per year x 30 minutes = 18 hours.OK...summary:Now I spend zero hours worried that i haven't vacuumed but I really should.I stopped spending 18 hours a year on something I hate.I spend 18 hours on things i like.I can walk around barefootThe place smells better.Ahh.....and this was a good purchase.-------------------------EDIT: Put towel under front or it won't charge.My Roomba wouldn't charge.  I think my floor is slightly uneven.I put a thin towel, folded, under the end that opposite the part that charges/connects to the charger.Lifted that side of roomba up just enough so the metal pieces made contact.Turned off schedule cleanings, all good.Every few days I pull the towl out and start it up.Easy enough to do.Plus, it doesn't get stuck or lost under the bed when I'm out, so I avoid that chaos.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020

Review Text: I was reluctant to purchase this product based on the mixed reviews, so I went with the least expensive version. I love it. OMG, it's been life changing! It's one less thing I have to do. I don't know how to control it or use the app, I just turn it on and let it do it's thing in whatever pattern it does it in (I only care about the end result!). It cleans the entire upstairs of my town home and then goes back to its dock. Of course, I fist pick up large prices of debris like I would if I was vacuuming with a higher powered model. When I want it to vacuum downstairs I carry it down there and let it do its thing as well. It does not vacuum my shag rug (too high and thick) nor does it go over the bathroom mat (also too high). It does vacuum the kitchen rug which is thin. Other than that it vacuums hardwood and low profile carpet. I always do a preliminary sweep of the kitchen which tends to attract larger particles (The vacuum is an assistant not a miracle worker). I do not have pets so I can't speak to the efficiency of that. You must have an unobstructed area for it to vacuum so no clutter, no wires or cords on the floor and I lift my office chair onto the desk and dining room chairs onto the table to allow the vacuum to roam free. It may sound like a lot of preliminary work but it's not AND you don't have to vacuum anymore!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2021

Review Text: I don't regret getting a Roomba. It has it good and bad things. The good; it is a time saver and I don't have to worry about lugging my vacuum up the stairs (tri-level house). Letting it run for an hour or so gets about 98% of the cat litter spilled on to the floor and carpet.The Bad: I got the Stupid Roomba. Yes, in order to do the 98%, it's just all over the place and sometimes it stays in one spot, in the room, for, maybe 5 to 10 minutes just going in circles. And most times, it gets caught up on a ledge and shuts itself off. I have to come to the rescue and start it up again. Today was a good day. Stalled only once in the hour it was running.The first night I had it, I scheduled it to run at 2am. 15 minutes later, it stalled. The noise on my cell and her screaming, downstairs, woke me up and I had to get up and move it to another location in order to get it to run, again.  That happened twice before I put it back on it pad and went back to bed.I got this Roomba; it was on sale, only $249, I figured I could afford it at that price. After all the research I did, the Roomba I wanted was over $1100!! It was way smarter. The next few I checked on were priced at $400 and $600, both with smart A.I. Those are for another day...maybe.Oh well, I'm happy thought, I just can't schedule if to run overnight, I have to stand around and baby-sit it so it doesn't stall out on a ledge or on those string things at the end of the carpet.Besides, the cats are getting use to it, now. They will walk to their food, if and only if that thing is on the other side of the room.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020

Review Text: This is my first robot vacuum, so I wasn't sure what to expect on performance and reliability. Waited a month before writing review. It has vacuumed approximately 18 times so far. Its total job is about 750 square feet of the first floor of our house.
