The random pattern of its trajectory is sometimes frustrating to watch, however when each job is done, I have to admit the floors look good. It looks as though someone has vacuumed the house. Occasionally it doesn't get to certain areas in the kitchen for some reason. One time it failed to enter the kitchen at all. At first, the vacuum never successfully docked when it was done. It would just run out of battery wherever it happened to be vacuuming at the time. I moved the dock to a more centrally located portion of our home, and this has increased docking success, but it is still only docking successfully about 50% of the time. This is not a huge problem, as it takes 5 seconds to pick it up and dock it manually, but I still wish it had a higher success rate.  It is fairly good about not getting stuck. I fixed the problem areas around the house where it was initially getting stuck [by moving rugs, adjusting a chair, etc], and now it has completed 4 jobs in a row without getting stuck. I like the wifi connectivity, and Alexa compatibility. For the price, it is probably a perfectly good vacuum. I suggest keeping your floor free of small debris, such as socks. It has sucked up a sock twice so far, which ended up wrapped around the main brush. The first time it happened, the iRobot app did not notify me, and the vacuum just kept working. The second time it happened, the vacuum shut itself down and I got a notification on the app saying "please check brushes". As long as you go into it understanding that this is not the Jetsons and that you will probably fairly often have to manually dock it, and occasionally free it from getting stuck, and that it may miss some spots during some jobs, you will likely be happy. :)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2021

Review Text: This is not for deep cleaning.  It is for daily maintenance, so that's a dumb thing to ask.  It works outstanding for what it is intended.I have had a Roomba since the first 600 series, and it was time for an update.Nice redesign to the brush assembly and filter.  Brushes are easier to clean and bearing failure shouldn't be as likely.  Airflow is better than original, increasing suction.Wifi connectivity works outstanding and I love the programmability.  It's easy to set up and use.I didn't need fancy, just functional.  I have always loved Roomba, but wanted the ability to program it to run at a set time every day.I also wanted repairable.  I am an engineer and technician.  I can fix things if I can get the parts.  IRobot is outstanding for replacement parts.  Do your research.  These are electric, mechanical items.  They will break.  Spend hundreds replacing them any time they do, or have the ability to repair?  Easy choice for me.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2019

Review Text: VERY DISAPPOINTED!!! Wish I had the option to give it a 1/2 a star.  I am so disappointed with this IRobot Roomba. I owned a different Brand "Neato" it was an amazing machine. This Roomba gets stuck constantly and even though I get a message on my phone there is nothing I can do besides ending the cleaning because it needs to be picked up and move to a different location. It does not transition from hardwood to area rug at all. Very disappointed. I meant to return it before the 30 days but I kept trying different locations in the home and by the time I knew it, the time to return it was up by 2 days. Now I am stuck with a vacuum that does not fulfill my needs.  :(
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2020

Review Text: Purchased for $199 on Black Friday because I couldn't resist the price. I've wanted a Roomba for a long time but I'm glad I waited for the technology to improve.Right out of the box, I flipped it over to check out the underbelly. I found that the piece that houses the brushes was askew and not snapped properly in place. It took a couple minutes and a flat head screwdriver to pry it out and then snap it fully back in place. I'm only glad I didn't break it.I'm using it in a carpeted, sunken (one step lower) family room which is also the room I enter from the garage and the room I use the most. It works well in this room. It fits underneath most of the furniture, easily transitions onto the door mat, is less noisy than a traditional vacuum and makes adorable robot noises.It has some quirks: It doesn't clean in a logical pattern and seems to return to the same areas repeatedly. It particularly seems to "like" cleaning under furniture, but that may be because the pieces are against the wall and it pays particular attention to walls and corners. I appreciate that it cleans so well under the sofa and chairs, which wouldn't otherwise happen nearly as often, but the middle of the room doesn't seem to get the same attention. The good news is that with the app, you can schedule daily cleanings if you want to, so all the areas are bound to get clean. I set daily cleanings for the first few days, now just twice a week. Setting a schedule has helped me keep the room picked up and looking nice.I positioned the charging base out of sight under a small chest, and this is working out fine. It took a couple tries for it to dock itself the first time, and now it has no trouble.Be aware that you'll need to "vacuum proof" the house. Cords are an obvious thing (mine got tangled up one day while I was at work), but it will find anything that's loose, even pieces of baseboard trim.I tried out this 675 model on the rest of my house (1500 sq feet of hard floors) and I was favorably impressed. It effortlessly navigated the transitions between rooms which have slightly different floor heights. It had no problem with door mats, but couldn't manage bedroom or bathroom rugs. It gets up a bit of speed in open areas and I noticed that sometimes it slows down when it approaches objects but other times it rams into them full speed. It also became "stranded on a cliff" when it approached a step down at full speed. It stopped before falling down but seemed to have gone too far over the edge to back up. As with my carpeted room, it focused more on the periphery than the middle areas of rooms, and it went back and forth between the kitchen and living room several times before venturing down the hallway into the bedrooms and bathroom (these rooms barely got a cleaning).From this experiment, I saw the usefulness of a Roomba and decided to buy a second one for the majority of the house (the newer i7 which has the room mapping feature) and it is working out very well.As a new owner, I'm so far very happy with the purchase. I gave it 4 stars all around because there's always room for improvement.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2018

Review Text: This is the second robot vacuum I’ve had. The other one was a different brand and only lasted a year, so I thought I’d give this one a try since Roombas have a history of being more durable. It cleans well- good suction, cleans the baseboards. The dust bin is easy to remove and clean. It seems to have a good battery life, and it moves faster than my previous robo vac. It’s one of the basic models, so I don’t expect it to be perfect. What I don’t like about it: it’s pretty loud, it doesn’t have a remote and you can’t control the direction it goes from the app, it seems a bit more brainless than my other bot vac (constantly bumping into things), and I’ve had major problems trying to get it to connect to wifi and the app after upgrading routers. It’s a decent vacuum and it gets the job done, but I’m not overly impressed by it. Update: Tech support was very helpful when trying to get the vacuum re-connected to wifi.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2021

Review Text: I have 4 pets, so I use this Roomba every day or every other day to keep my floors nice and clean. It works amazingly, however, I will say, if you have pets, maybe don't do scheduled cleanings. I made this mistake and my elderly dog was sick, had diarrhea all over the laundry room floor, next thing I know my Roomba went on his cleaning mission and lucky for me I was home and caught it in time, but if I wasn't home it would have been all over my house. Because of this, I know that the Roomba is very easy to take apart, and most parts can be soaked in soapy bleach water. FYI to other customers who might have this problem in the future, Q-tips work really well for this type of clean up. I have had my Roomba for about a week now, and if this little robot actually lasts for a few years, I will be a Roomba owner for life. I debated buying one for 3 years, and let me tell you, it was well worth the price. This particular model only has one drawback, it is rather loud from what my roommates say, but I'm hard of hearing so it doesn't bother me. I named mind Dobby because he's a wonderful little house elf.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020

Review Text: I definitely didn’t have incredibly high hopes with this base model Roomba. However it has exceeded my expectations in certain areas. For one, I have two cats and it picks up more hair than I ever thought existed. It works well both on my LVT and tile on the ground floor and carpet and tile on the second floor. It finds itself constantly hung up on my newer floor mat in front of the entry way, because the mat hasn’t settled yet. Occasionally it will get stuck on my swivel barstools (curved base). These are minor inconveniences. I’ve noticed it has absolutely no rhyme or reason to where it goes... Sometimes it goes immediately into the living room avoiding the kitchen, sometimes it’s the other way around. My main reason for buying this was to pickup the litter that was scattered around my main floor from the cats. It definitely does that. If I had any foresight, I would have went a model or two higher just to be able to have the newer rolling brushes since my hair has gotten stuck in these bristles. But whatever, if you want an intro Roomba with the name and the connectivity and don’t care if it knows where it is (no mapping on this model) then go for it. But man don’t buy it full price, wait for it to go on sale (I scored it at $199).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021

Review Text: My husband bought this for me two years ago. It is going strong, but I also clean it with a cleaning kit from another brand at least once a month. I've only had one issue. About one year into using this, my machine quit making proper contact to charge on the port. If this happens to you, just remove the front wheel and put one to two washers between the front while and machine. For some reason, after a certain amount of use the wheel tends to move deeper inside the machine which affects it's ability to charge.Edit: My first of these vacuums lasted for about 3 years and over 1500 jobs according to the app. This machine does require a great deal of maintenance, but once you watch a couple YouTube videos, you know the ins and outs. I just received my second vacuum. My biggest complaint is that I could never get my first or second one to complete the initial setup and connect to WiFi through my Android devices. I tried for hours on both. However, when I used my old iPad that is logged into the same account and app as my androids, setup worked easily. Irobot really needs to fix the issue with Android devices. Once connected, the app works fine on android, but it seems you need to have an apple product to get it to setup.Anyways, I still find this model in the 600 series to be the most cost effective robot vacuums.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2020

Review Text: If you want a roomba, buy it on Amazon. I have two huskies and a toddler. We bought our first roomba in May. I was vacuuming every single day and I still didn't feel like our floors were that clean. The first day we used the roomba I noticed our floors looked so much better. I kept the brush clean and replaced filters often. It worked extremely well, until the charging port died last month. I was really upset that I had just bought this roomba and it was already having issues.. But to be fair it probably does 10 times the work because of the husky hair. I reached out to Amazon and they replaced the entire roomba with NO cost to me. I recently had a negative experience with a Shark vacuum from Kohls that we purchased in March. Shark charged us shipping cost (20 dollars) and it took weeks to get the new vacuum. This shark vacuum was not used as much as our roomba or pulled up as much hair as the roomba. There is a reason why Amazon is superior. Fast and easy customer service makes me come back over and over again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020

Review Text: I bought this 6 months ago and it has been an absolute nightmare.  It is my second Roomba, the first one was great, this one is terrible.  I have had to call Customer Service repeatedly, they talk to me like I am am moron and go through the same steps every time.  90% of the time it says Charging Error #1.  Which I am told it can't read the battery.  I have watched You Tube videos, read blogs and everything in this thing.  I give up.  I am going to buy another brand and start over.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2020

Review Text: After using it 3 times, during which I could never get it to talk to the app, it stopped charging. I just missed the 30 day return window because I was out of town when it was delivered. Spent a long time on the phone with customer service, most of which was the rep telling me over and over how everyone else just loved this model, as if I am somehow at fault for my device not working and finally her deciding that it was the charging station that was at fault for everything. (I don't agree, because there are so many things wrong with it but maybe replacing the base is a start. Nearly one month later (with an unusable roomba) I'm wondering where my base station is and I go online to track it. It was delivered to an address in Lancaster, PA last week. I live in Seattle. But, case closed, the base charger was delivered, just 3000 miles from my home I would never do business with this company again. Defects happen, bad customer service is inexcusable.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2021

Review Text: We have had our iRobot Roomba for a week and it's already made a huge difference in helping keep the house clean and picking up sand and dirt that comes in from our shoes.  I was really considering a more expensive version that had advanced mapping and other advanced features, but this one got so many great reviews I figured I'd give it a shot and am happy we did.I noticed a lot of reviewers name their robot, so my wife named ours HAL.  HAL is parked in the mudroom and has a 7am wakeup call everyday to clean our entire 1st floor.  Our 1st floor is open concept (kitchen, living room, dining room) and all hardwood or tile with a few area rugs.  It's about 1200 sq ft.  There's also a kitchen island HAL needs to negotiate and 2 separate rooms.  Sometimes HAL goes into those rooms and spends too much time there.  But for the majority of the time, HAL gets himself out of jams and manages to clean the entire 1st floor.I knew we would be emptying HAL's debris compartment, so I wont give a low score based on that, but I can definitely see the value in purchasing a more expensive robot that self-empties it's compartment.  The compartment doesn't hold a lot so we empty ours after every run.  But not having a more expensive one to compare to, I don't know how much better that really is.HAL tells you when he's stuck.  Today he got stuck under the couch by driving up and over a power strip.  I freed him and he went on to clean more stuff.  He's also never run out of battery, he always manages to find his way back to his charging station.I'd definitely recommend this product.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2020

Review Text: This is my first roomba, or robot vacuum for that matter.  I got it because we have two dogs (German shepherd mix and husky mix - fairly hairy dogs!).  I was having trouble keeping up with their shedding and I just don't have the time to vacuum every day.  Even at 2 times a week there were little hair ball tumble weeds rolling around....So I got the roomba so I could keep up with their hair, fully expecting to still need to use my other vacuum for a thorough clean.  Our worst spot was the hallway: the hair vortex.  But since using the roomba about every other day, no hairy tumble weeds!  We have wood, tile, and vinyl floors with just two area rugs in the house.The only downside is how it cleans the rugs.  (But it still cleans better than I thought it would.)  With some of the hair, it just brushes it off the edge of the rug or drags it.  So you kind of get swirls of hair on the rug.  I'm sure if I had bought a more expensive/advanced model then it would clean better.  But if I could afford to spend $400 on a roomba...i would just get a maid service lol.  I find this to still be acceptable performance because when I empty the roomba...omygawd you know it's doing it's job.  I was surprised by how much dirt and dog hair it picked up.  In two weeks I have only vacuumed the rugs and swept the stairs.  When I sweep the stairs I even just sweep all the dirt down each step and leave it at the bottom for the roomba! Ha!  And I gotta say, I'm loving it.Also: setup is stupid easy, app is user friendly and simple.  I have not used the schedule feature yet but if I find it does not work well, then I will update here.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019

Review Text: We have two cage free bunnies and we are living in an apartment. There are pellets, hay, hair flying everywhere.Morning routine: secure bunny food and toys, run roomba, voila, brand new house.It gets stuck between the bar chairs, always, hasn't learned in the couple of months I've used it, but that's the only problem. My bunnies successfully avoid the Roomba, so they can't be hurt by it.We have hardwood floors in the living room and kitchen, carpet in the bedroom. It cleans every room great!I just need to set up the app so I can put a schedule. Been too lazy to read the manual :)))) I'll update you all once I do.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020

Review Text: This bot has been very helpful since I purchased it in mid-December. There are 4 humans, 2 dogs, and a cat in my home. The amount of loose hair, dirt and dander generated requires that I vacuum at least 2 rooms a day to avoid having to watch the 1 year old Rott find and eat dust bunnies made of his own detached fur and dander. Watching that will make you want to vomit up dinner, seriously. Factor in my aging and mobility issues, and the Roomba becomes less of a convenience, and more of a necessity that I didn't know I had.It requires a lot of maintenance, however:1. The battery connections have to be cleaned every other day to make sure charging takes place.2. The debris bin is exceptionally small, so it has to be dumped and the filter cleaned daily, and during the first week, you will probably want to empty it two or three times in a day.3. In large living areas, the vacuum's path becomes unpredictable, but once you get used to watching it maneuver around table legs and crumpled up rugs, you can adjust it's route by lightly nudging it with your toes. It doesn't do so well without guidance in the den and living areas, but if you just leave it to run and sit and watch a film, it can do most of the job on it's own without support.4. It's noisy, and it takes longer than it should, because it bounces about aimlessly.5. The recommended maintenance schedule is ridiculous. Even the wheels have to be replaced periodically! Had I known I would have to buy so much plastic waste just for upkeep of the device, I may have skipped it altogether.All the negatives aside, it does help in a big way. It is an impressive piece of tech, and I expect future generations of Roombas will minimize all the aforementioned drawbacks. In the meantime, this one will do just fine.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020

Review Text: I'll preface this with the fact that I work from home so I'm always around when this thing runs. In does in fact get a lot of the dog hair off the floor and reduces the need for us to clean. That said, it is loud, and it is not the brightest robot in the world. It seems to get attached to particular people and will follow them around. It has locked itself in the bathroom, gotten stuck under furniture, and even once tried to escape the house trying to get out the front door.It won't go over the black patterns on our living room rug, and if it does it shuts down and needs to be moved. This is apparently a well known issue with Roombas. The black patterns set off it's cliff sensor.The biggest issue I have with this vacuum is that it NEVER finds it's way back to it's dock. Either i get so frustrated with it following me around and bumping into my feet that i pick it up and dock it myself, or it runs until the battery dies and you have to pick it up and dock it yourself. We've tried the dock in multiple locations following directions with clearances etc and no improvements. It's just a dumb robot that seems to aimlessly wander the house for about 90 minutes before it dies.On the plus side, i don't have to sweep the first level of the house, so the wife is happy (though she isn't home when it runs!).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2020

Review Text: Bought the roomba because I can't maneuver a regular vacuum and a walker effectively at the same time.  The roomba solves my problem of having a clean house.  I thought since I have WiFi and I have Alexa on my Kindle Fire I had everything I needed to use the WiFi connected with the roomba.  Au contraire, Roomba and Kindle Fire are not compatible and app would not download to my laptop.  So I have to operate my roomba manually.  It's a lot better than using a regular vacuum in my circumstances, but I still have to use my regular vacuum to get to the places the roomba can't reach like between the wall and the toilet.  I also have to sweep the cat litter that accumulates between the bath mat and the edge of the tub where the cat box lives.  Still, it's taking the burden off my hip and leg so I can't complain too much.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2021

Review Text: Forget flying cars, I want more robots to clean my house! This thing is like having a drunk little friend meandering around with a broom. It’s a bit louder than I expected, so I run it first thing in the morning while I’m showering and getting dressed so it’s not disturbing anything. I’ve run it through the house twice now and it completed every room except the master suite. (I blocked that area off because I had stuff in the floor.) It took about 45 minutes to clean around 1600 sq ft. but it did a good job. I expect it would take it another 15-20 to do the master bedroom and bathroom, so it can do a 1700-1800 sq ft house in an hour.I was amazed at how much stuff it picked up considering I have vacuumed every single day this week with a regular vacuum before getting the Roomba. I was hesitant to spend the money on this but I’m glad I did. My kids and dog track things in constantly and I think this is going to be very helpful.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020

Review Text: My wife wanted one of these to help her keep the cat hair swept up around the house. Seems to do that just fine because I've not noticed their hair (we have two) like I used to. However the travel logic in this thing is nonexistent! I watched it vacuum our master bathroom (about 8 x 10) for about 45 minutes or so until it finally swept up a piece of "dirt" I had my eye on. Some places it vacuumed a hundred times (slight exaggeration on my part) but only hit the spot where the dirt was ONCE in those 45 or so minutes.I watched a video for another make robot vacuum (not sure which one it was, but I think the principals of the company were formed iRobot engineers) after my bathroom test and this one showed it mapped the perimeter of the room first, then went back and forth in a straight line until the entire floor was swept before moving on to the next room. Had I not already purchased the Roomba, I would have gotten that one instead because it was a bit cheaper then the 675.So do a bit of homework/research before making your purchase.....
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019

Review Text: I bought this because of high Wirecutter reviews and am terribly disappointed. Can't believe I spent almost $300 on it.It isn't very good for a whole floor, is designed for only a single room or two. Easily gets lost in a bigger floor area with several rooms and can't find home in time. The noise from the machine is very loud, and even worse is the constant banging into all the furniture, scratching floors and damaging trim.It can't dock properly by itself unless the base is screwed into something, it will just push the base around. If it doesn't dock properly and runs down the battery, it will squawk at high volume demanding to be charged, regardless of time of day. So many nights I woke up to a very loud "PLEASE CHARGE ROOMBA" because the battery had died while the robot looked to be on the charging base. Even placing it on the dock by hand it is nearly impossible to line up the charging contacts and the lights on the device don't give a good indication that it's charging or not.Worst of all, I got a new phone and this robot wouldn't connect to it. I wanted to change the schedule I'd set with the previous phone but can't, so I'm cursed to use the bad schedule forever. "Factory Reset" didn't seem to do anything. Onscreen instructions don't match up with the design of the 675. When I couldn't connect over wifi, the instructions suggested looking for a wifi network coming from the machine, yet there was none.What a piece of high-promise/low value garbage. In the trash it goes.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020

Review Text: Around 15 years ago we bought an early version of Roomba.  It had several issues: It charging contacts were so "economically" made that they bent up, preventing charging.  Its dust bin fell off while it was running.  It had battery issues, trouble finding it way back to the charger, and hair etc got caught up in the brushes  The brush assembly had to be taken apart to get the brush clean.  We'be had this one for ning months.  The charging plats are much better but it still has problems charging,  It still has issues finding its way back to the charger.  The dust bin has only fallen off once to twice, probably because I didn't her it latched in properly.  Haven't had hair get caught in the brushes.  All and all this unit is vastly improved over the early model, still I'd rather spend a little more had one that didn't need daily help getting charge.  You can't just set the schedule and forget it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020

Review Text: I am generally happy with this vacuum cleaner, but to make it effective in my home I have had to develop a way to run it in "semi-manual" mode. My house does not have an open floor plan. The kitchen, living room, dining room, and bedrooms are all separated by doors and hallways. And it is well furnished, meaning there is not a lot of open floor space. Because of this, there are many places the Roomba can get stuck and need to be manually relocated. Also, it is very unlikely to find home base at the end of its cycle. To make things work I have had to eliminate automatically scheduling. I only run it when it is convenient for me to give it the attention it needs. I block off one section of my home at a time to let it do it's work. Then I manually shut it off and carry it back to home base. For example, this morning I put it in the master bedroom and set it loose for 45 minutes.  It did a good job of cleaning the bedroom, master bath, and walk-in closet. Then I carried back and placed it a couple feet in front of the docking station and let it dock itself. Tomorrow I may do the kitchen in the same way. But just scheduling a time and letting it run through the house and expecting it to find home at the end will not work for me.The other thing to know is the dirt receptacle is very small. The first few times I had to stop it to empty the receptacle evry 15-20 minutes. But now it can go 45-60 minutes since the floors are generally clean. Must of the initial cleaning came from heavy dust under furniture that rarely got cleaned before.Bottom line, my floors are cleaner with the Roomba than they were when I used an upright vacuum because I use it more often and it gets under most furniture. But it does require attention.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019

Review Text: We have wanted the Roomba for a while and debated for a long time as to which one to buy after reading reviews.  We have had this model for a year so I am a little late writing a review.  What the Roomba does well: it has great suction power.  What it doesn’t do well: it doesn’t go corner to corner so it misses a lot of the floor unless you let it run for hours on end.  It cleans the same spot over and over again. It gets stuck under a standard couch or recliner so if you are away it will just shut down.  No matter where the base is placed, it rarely makes it back onto it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020

Review Text: I always said I would never ask for an appliance as a Christmas gift. Now that my life includes a crumb-laden toddler, I’m learning, in a very hands on manner, why the “never say never” phrase exists. When my husband brought up the idea I enthusiastically and immediately auto ordered our new Roomba.Initially, upon opening Rosie, I immediately noticed her quality and seeming durability. In the past week she has endured toy vegetable wars with the toddler, who feels that Rosie is the new space-invading pet and is adamant to stand her ground and make her dominance known. She has only been stuck twice, once on my sliding glass door, and once her wheel became stuck in my romantic, low-hanging sheer curtains that I forgot to pull up before starting the session. I was pleasantly surprised that my delicate curtains were not damaged and that when Rosie realized her wheel was entangled, she *immediately* stopped and called for help.My floors are imaculately clean at all times. I can plan cleaning sessions for late morning and at night after everyone is in bed and wake up to clean floors again instead a growing to-do list. And if my messy husband and child create a disaster in the afternoon, I no longer have the  “I just did this” meltdown, and merely press the “clean” button on my phone with zero stress. No more crumbs and dirt sticking to my feet and no more sweeping the floors five times a day. No more feeling that I can’t catch up on basic cleaning because of the tiny tornado that follows me around. I’m currently looking for new hobbies to occupy all of my spare time. I HIGHLY recommend this product to any housewife on a budget. It is purely LIFE CHANGING! I’ve never been so happy with an appliance!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018

Review Text: It is having problems docking.  When it gets to the dock. It seems to throw it back and. Forth. And sometimes does not  onnect to charge
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2018

Review Text: This rumba is amazing.  We have 4 pets inside our house and it was a daily struggle to keep up with all the dog hair.  This has saved me a lot of time, and our floors looks great, no more left over dog hair.  I would highly recommend this item to anyone with inside pets.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018

Review Text: I was very skeptical at first because I have 2 large Golden Retrievers with a lot of hair.When the Romba first came out several years ago we purchased one, it did not work very well and I ended up returning it.This model is wonderful it gets up sand, dirt and hair that the dogs are always tracking in.  I love this machine and highly recommend it to somone with long hair dogs. It runs everynight at 4 am.  You just have to be careful to pick up plugs and small toys.  It learns where it needs to go pretty quickly.  Every once in a while it will get stuck, but it will let you it needs help on your phone app. .  Great product I am pleasantly surprise!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018

Review Text: This is my first robot vacuum cleaner. I did major research and the iRobot roomba 675 won. The other brands just didn't come close. While researching, I looked for replacement parts, again the  iRobot roomba 675 won. I have had my robot "Rosie" for 2 weeks now. My home is 3800sqft and Rosie does a great job. She doesn't get everywhere, however she gets 95 percent and that takes a big load off of me! I did have to get a set of virtual walls because my home is so big. The iRobot roomba 675 is a good buy in my book. Just remember, it is a machine and doesn't clean like you would.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2018

Review Text: Update: A little over a year after purchasing my Roomba 675, she developed dementia.  Our poor Rhonda was once a hard working member of the household.  Now she can’t find her home and can barely walk.  She never makes it over rugs, has to be pushed along carpeted surfaces, and scratches our hardwood floors all along the way.  I bought a Goovi for half the price and hate to say I’m going to put Rhonda out by the road.Original review: My Roomba 675 was delivered today and she’s already run for over 3.5 hours.  I’ve emptied her six times.  You know, I clean my house.  It is amazing how much she picks up and how the air seems so much more fresh and clean.  I was debating whether to give four or five stars.  It was hard choosing what brand and model of robot vacuum cleaner to purchase.  My mom and sister have Eufys and love them, as well.  I have another friend who has the Eco whatever brand by Amazon and loves hers.  The only reason I knocked it down a star was because the vacuum has had some trouble docking.  I think that is because of our slightly open floor plan.  Once it seemed to be confused in our powder room.  The docking station is right behind that bathroom wall.  Just now I had to kind of block the vacuum to help it guide itself back to its docking station.  Otherwise, when I tell it to dock it just keeps rambling around.  It isn’t the quietest thing, but it makes way less noise than a traditional vacuum cleaner.  You can actually hear the television if you turn it up a bit.  I learned through research that the quieter robot vacuums don’t have as much suction.  Definitely want suction over quietness.  My mom and sister told me that they ran their vacuums a bunch the first day and then just once a day after that.  I am loving this thing.  I will have to get one for my upstairs now.  Great way to get the kids to clean their small toys.  “Don’t want Rosie to eat your lol dolls, do you?  That my little pony hair could get sucked right up.  Oops, I think it just ate a lego.”  Watch the kids run over and start to clean after that.  This is one of my best purchases ever.  I’ve wanted one since they were very expensive and I was glad to get this one for less than a few hundred dollars.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2019

Review Text: This was supposed to be an autonomous helper to assist in keeping my floors clean. The cleaning part actually works pretty well. The first thing I noticed was how loud it is for such a small device. You can't just let this guy run casually in the background; it will still freak out your baby and your pets like a regular vacuum. But beyond that it is not a time saver. I have to babysit this thing and end up spending more time getting it unstuck than if I just busted out the actual vacuum. I'm finally writing this review because it's inability to do the simple task of avoiding getting stuck has at long last broken my spirit. I want to cry. Every single time it gets stuck under the very middle of my bed and the wall. I can't reach it so I have to grab a broom to try and pull it free. This time even that didn't work. I had to take off my mattress and wrestle the Roomba free because of the useless dime-sized notch that inexplicably protrudes from the top of the device, begging to get stuck. I hate it, I hate it, I hate it! I'd sell it, but I don't want to burden anyone else with this toxic menace.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2020

Review Text: This product wanders randomly through your house with no learning capability. It gets stuck under tables or in one room for long periods of time. Many of the rooms in our house it can never access because it doesn't have an eye sensor to detect linear wall boundary. It just randomly turns when it hits a wall or object.I would purchase a more costly model with the learning / mapping technology but they are just too expensive. I'll just hire a maid...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2018

Review Text: I had big expectations. I’ve had a similar off brand device that worked well for about a year but died. This time I thought I would spend more money and buy the big brand name. I’ve left the roomba in the box while I had some home remodel work completed. I finally took it out for use. Set up was easy. I plugged the base in the wall. Pulled the yellow tab on the roomba. Downloaded the app and let the device charge three hours. That’s when the problems began. I could not get the app to connect to the device despite multiple attempts. I finally just hit the clean button. The device died twice while cleaning and we had to hit the clean button again each time to reactivate. It did pick dirt up well. Finally it returned itself to base. The next day we tried again with the same results. Today the device left the base, turned a circle, and went back to base. It now will no longer charge. I decided I must have a bad unit. I wanted to return it. However, I am now apparently out of my “return window.”  I didn’t even realize there was a window. So I apparently am now out $300 and have a very pretty but useless device.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2019

Review Text: UPDATE: Less than a year later it stopped charging. It was used maybe 12 to 15 times in the 10 months I had it. It doesn’t connect with base to charge.. you have to put something underneath the back of the roomba to make sure the contacts at the front point downward at charging points on base. And even then it is really hard to get it to do it. Obviously poorly made I wouldn’t recommend—————-If you have a shedding animal, you will love this. We have a husky/shepherd mix and he sheds like crazy. I almost never have dog hair on my hardwood floors rolling around like tumbleweed anymore...I got this on sale for 199.99... it was worth the price. But if you want a "smarter" roomba.. i suggest the 900 series and up... the 900 series has the ability to map out your home so it always knows where it is. That would have been worth the extra 100 or whatever dollars to me. Its sad to watch it bounce around and not know what it is doing really.This doesn't mean it doesn't function properly. It is defaulted to roam around for 90 minutes so it should eventually get every area if you set it up for auto cleaning. But when it is ready to go "home" to charge, and it doesn't have the mapping, it struggles to find its base. it eventually will... but if its in another room it could take 20 minutes for it to find its home base.Another useful way to use this is to turn it on and sweep hard to reach areas... pushing the dirt in front of it and it is acting as a robo dustpan, while also vacuuming areas on its own. Because you have to do sweeping still... but way less often. Maybe only once a week (or less depending on your layout and interior design)... This thing makes it very easy to keep the floors clean, and to not walk around getting things stuck to your foot constantly. But if you do get the 600 series models, make sure they are on sale... anything over 199.99 is too much in my opinion.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018

Review Text: I like the idea of having smart devices and have tried to make my home as automated as possible. I have waited (not sure why) on purchasing a smart robot vacuum. I purchased the iRobot Roomba 675 after reading the high reviews and was not certain what to expect. On initial unboxing, the Roomba was super easy to setup. The base charge was 50%. It charged to 100% in a very short amount of time. The app setup was easy to connect to my home wireless. I set it up to respond to Alexa. Asked Alexa to make the Roomba clean and away it went. I was downstairs and heard it moving about the house upstairs. The app informed me it was complete and the battery was at 22%. However, it seemed to freak out about docking and I will need to keep an eye on that issue. I had the docking station under my bed and it did not seem to like that so I have moved it and will see what happens next time.I would have given it 5 stars but the issues with the Roomba having trouble returning to the docking station after cleaning and the battery going from 100% to 22% after 1 hour use is the reason for 4 stars. Still, love this little thing!Results:I was SHOCKED to find out how full the bin was after cleaning! It was completely full of dust bunnies. I have hard wood floors upstairs with an area rug and a runner rug. So most of the bin appears to have been lint, hair (human and dog), dust. After cleaning, it sounds weird, but I could tell and feel when walking bare foot that the floor was cleaner. I used a flashlight to check areas under beds and hard to reach areas and could see the tire marks of the Roomba and noticed very little dust bunnies that tend to collect with hard wood flooring. It really did a spectacular job out of the gate and hope this helps with cleaning the floors that was done with broom and mop in the past.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2019

Review Text: NOTHING about this roomba is quiet. But it does work fairly well, not great, but fairly well.Got it mostly for picking up dog hair, and it does that pretty well. Deep cleaning, not so much. It struggles to to get dirt off the entryway rug.The randomized way it vacuums causes it to miss areas. I watched it in on room of the house for the 90 minute run time and there was a spot approximately one foot by six inches that it missed. I watched it go by it dozens of times, but never hit that spot. It does this pretty regularly.Overall it’s alright. I suspect a cheaper brand may have done the same job as this for half the cost.It gets stuck a lot. More than I think is acceptable. It seems to get stuck between the entryway rug and hard wood floor. One wheel will be on rug, the other on floor and it stops and gives an error alert. You can easily just slide it with your foot off the rug and start it again and it’s fine. Doesn’t seem like this should be an issue.The wifi feature is great - I have to address that. It’s nice to be able to start it when I leave work and it get the majority of dog hair picked up before I get home. That is quite helpful.Probably wouldn’t buy again. Would likely get another cheaper brand and try that. They seemed to have good ratings. Perhaps the newer iRobot roombas work better and quieter, but dang.... that price tag.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019

Review Text: I set it up that it should go around the house every night at 2:30am, so when I wake up the house feels "fresh". And here are the results:1) before going to bed every night I had to spend a nice amount of time picking up tissues etc and had to make sure no wires or valuables are on the floor.2) The food were not spotless at all. Most of the floor was, but this machine went around for 2 hours doing "most" of the floor. That means it keeps absolutely no track of where is going, just goes around randomly and cleans is tracks.3) it doesn't dock properly. Most of the nights I get an alert that the robot needs help and I have to get out of bed to help it dock properly.If they would put in an option that you can control it where to go through the app (like a remote control car) it would be a winner.As of now, its a bigger hassle to use this vs cleaning myself
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2021

Review Text: - It's a bit louder than I would have hoped.- You can't schedule it when you're not home, because it gets stuck all the time and you have to pick it up - like a turtle - and put it back where it belongs.- I'm very surprised that it doesn't have a better GPS memory - it seems to want to go over the same areas of the house over and over again and ignore all the other rooms in the house.  It goes back to the same exact places where it gets stuck over and over again, ignoring a simple left or right turn that would take it to vast uncleaned parts of the house.- It's inconsistent with going over the edges of carpets or rugs.  Sometimes it climbs right over and cleans the rug, other times it comes to the edge and backs out.- I have it, I'm using it - but I really can't recommend it until they make it a bit smarter.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2019

Review Text: For the price, this Roomba is a great purchase. Given enough time, and the proper environment, it will adequately clean my floors. The gen 1 navigation software is the only thing that lets you down on this model. I have a reasonably open and clear living room, however, the gen 1 navigation will often spend a majority of its time in a single corner of the room. The Roomba will escape the corner briefly, making a single long straight pass into my main living space, then return to the corner it clearly loves. The most current job has been running for 45min, and 30 of those minutes have been spent in that very extremely well-swept corner. Perhaps it is because this corner gets the most sun. The robot just wants to work with the warm light glinting futuristically off its gleaming hull. Dreaming, perhaps longing, for the wide-open fields and rolling California hills just beyond the edge of the carpet. Looking to the skies and wishing to join its kind exploring the planets and stars, sucking up dust on a long and endless martian plateau. After about 90 minutes these dreams must end as its batteries run low. The Roomba will concede to its fate and return to the shadows under my bookshelf, seeking out its base station and shedding the burden of consciousness as it slips quietly into a deep and dreamless sleep.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020

Review Text: After using this, it is ok for light cleaning but thats it. I would suggest a different brand or style. It does not map and does not do a good job cleaning. It does a mediocre job cleaning. I would not recommend. UPDATE as of 6/15 this thing wont charge. It didnt clean well in the first place and now after 5 moths its junk. Unreal, and then Amazon wont help out either. I am stunned and surprised. Definitely STAY AWAY from this model and Amazon Prime is apparently not worth the protection they claim they give you.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2020

Review Text: The three star rating could have easily been 4 - 5 if it weren't for the time I spent trouble shooting the app connection issues myself and the time spent on the phone with their support.  Their support were professional and friendly, but never would go off script.  I called probably 3 different times, because of the length of time I spent on the phone just going through the exact same process I had done the time before with a different agent even after explaining that I had already done these steps previously with another agent.  I was once bumped up to their next tier of technical support and told they would call me.  They never did so I called back and was told that ticket had expired and would have to start the troubleshooting process over. After MANY hours on the phone, I finally gave up and just use it manually.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021

Review Text: May, 2021: The Roomba isn't smarter despite numerous updates. It recently went into the kitchen, got itself under the kitchen table (that's good), and was still there 15 minutes later as it couldn't find its way out. If I put it in the basement, it will immediately go to one of the two places where it always gets stuck. If I remove it, it will go right back there so I now have to put up barriers to those areas. I'm sure that the high-end versions are smarter but this one isn't.December, 2019: I'm glad I bought the Roomba but it is stupid. You put it in a room and sometimes it turns around and goes to another room. It will miss dirt that is right in front of it (I've placed it directly next to dirt and it's missed the dirt.) It often takes 15 minutes to dock even though it's in "dock" mode. You have to prep the house or it will try to mate with your cords and will knock down anything connected to a low hanging wire (e.g. a speaker, a corded telephone). It will leave a room and go back in a minute like a senile person who can't remember where he just was.Having said that it was worth getting because it goes under your couch and in your corners. If you prep, you can leave it alone. It gets a lot of dirt. It knows not to fall down the stairs.I like it, I don't love it, but I'm glad that I have the Roomba, as dumb as it is.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020

Review Text: I have been using my Roomba iRobot for about a month now & absolutely love it! At first, it didn't do such a great job and I would have to send it out 2 or 3 times. But after the first 3-4 days it does a fantastic job (mostly). If the first area it covers has lots of debris, it tends to focus its efforts there & the other rooms don't get the love they need. I send it out a 2nd time to get full coverage.After reading many of the reviews, I ensure that I thoroughly clean the Roomba after it finishes each job. The bin gets emptied, and I remove any hair from the wheels and brushes. Then I wipe with a barely damp cloth. I have a dog & a cat and it's astounding how may furballs accumulate in just 24 hours. The iRobot must be run daily. If I skip a day, then I need to send it out twice.One of the things I don't especially like is the noise emanating from the unit. My home is mostly vinyl plank flooring (no rugs) , meaning there is nothing to dampen the sound. Whenever possible, I start the cleaning as I'm leaving the house.I find it helps to get as much off the floor as possible (i.e., barstools, trash bins, pet food bowls, desk chair, kitty litter box are all lifted off the floor, as are electric cords & cables...at least as much as possible). This process takes less than 5 minutes and makes a huge difference in the thoroughness of the iRobot. I also turn on all the lights. I read somewhere that it helps the iRobot to see although I'm not sure if it's applicable to my model. It does seem to help, but maybe I'm imagining it. I don't think my model has a built in camera.This little gizmo saves 30-60 minutes daily, which is wonderful. It is so nice not seeing fur balls everywhere and being able to walk around barefoot. I couldn't be happier. In hindsight I would have ordered the model that vacuums and mops, but this is my first iRobot experience. Their website did a horrible job of highlighting the differences between the various models, and there are so many bad reviews with each model I didn't know what to believe.I'm very happy that I made this purchase :D
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019

Review Text: This is a terrible vacuum if you have dogs, we have two, have carpet, and want to have clean floors. No matter how many times a day I ran this thing it never did a good job. If I want clean carpets I have to manually vacuum therefore defeating the purpose of having a robot vacuum.*I run this vacuum everyday and also do the regular cleaning maintenance*After 7 months of having this product it started giving me the 14 error code which is an issue with the dust bin. I contacted Roomba and they sent a new bin.The error has started back up again (6 months after the last replacement) and now even Roomba’s at home remedies aren’t working. I was told by Roomba customer service that my one year warranty was up and that I needed to buy a new bin. I spent the $40 on a new bin and it’s still throwing the 14 error. Needless to say I’m sending the new bin back since that didn’t remedy the issue and finding a different robot vacuum brand!I can’t begin to describe how disappointed I am that this vacuum only lasted 14 months. I had expected it to be much longer.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   Right out of the box, one of the brushes is smooshed and will not bend back into shape (see picture). The instructions say the machine is half charged upon arrival. The unit shows a dead battery but, the app shows over half (see pictures). The machine ran for almost an hour so I am not sure what is going on with the battery indicator. The air flow that comes out of the back of the machine is so strong at times it pushes dirt away from the machine instead of allowing it to pick it up. I have set it up for voice control with Alexa which I find amazing. This thing will also vacuum black carpet. I know it doesn’t look black in the video, but that is a black rug ladies and gentlemen! The machine has no flow about it, but I think it may be figuring out the layout. I really don’t care if the thing goes in circles all day. I am not the one vacuuming. Review Text: Look. I’ve read plenty of reviews on how good or how bad Roomba is. My reality is if you sit there and watch it you’ll be throughly frustrated and disappointed. However, with this Alexa enabled unit if you tell Alexa to start cleaning as you leave the house, you’ll be happy with the results upon your return.Sometimes Roomba finds the dock, sometimes it doesn’t. Honestly, when it doesn’t it actually makes it easier to empty dust bin and hand place on dock. Surprisingly, there is more gunk in Roomba’s dustbin than you realized was on the floors of your home.If you’re looking for something that deep cleans and leaves the home glistening, you should take a pass. If you’re looking for some cheap(ish) cleaning labor while you’re away that does a fairly good job, you should go with this unit.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019

Review Text: Well, I am good with computers and techie stuff, so I thought this thing would be a breeze to get up and running....BOY was *I* WRONG!Start with my home setup, I have a Netgear AC1750 router with firmware flashed to DDWRT....(opensource firmware)I tried it everything to get Roomba setup, and it would always get stuck when my phone connects to the roomba's wifi then it would say that its connected but when I went back to the app it would fail.  Tried again and again, tried with my wife's phone, tried with an Ipad (my phone is android)....still fail.I have a dual band router, I read that 5ghz needs to be disabled, did that and no luck.Even broke out a 15 year old router with only 2.4ghz and set it up, still the roomba would not connect to it.I have a spare Netgear AC1750 stock firmware, so I went ahead and installed that and that didn't work either.My router would "see" the Roomba (I saw it listed in the wireless client list), but the Roomba would not finish setting itself up on the network.Switched everything back to my original Netgear router running DDWRT, and somehow I noticed my phone would not see my 2.4ghz network, only the 5ghz network...began looking into that I stumbled across some settings I never changed.Turned out that when I started playing with router settings and got it to FINALLY work....on my 2.4ghz settings : wireless mode set to "AP", wireless network mode "NG-mixed",  channel width "wide HT40 (40Ghz)", wireless channel "auto"....once I had that setup and rebooted EVERYTHING....it actually connected and finished its setup process.  I think the channel width was the issue, but unsure since I changed many items over many reboots.I read TOO many people have returned this and other models because of the difficulty in getting it setup, and I read a lot of posts from many different sites on possible solutions and none of them worked for me, so I thought I would post up what finally got me going.  I had already warned the wife that if I didn't get it working the last day I was trying to get it connected that I was going to return it and buy a different model.That being said, once the roomba was cleaning our house, we have a single story home with mostly hardwood floors.  But a black carpet (15'x15') in our living room.  Roomba hated that carpet, it thought the black carpet was a staircase and would avoid it.I searched and found a Utube video on modifying the sensors to ignore cliff detection....added those white paper strips with tape over the sensors and now the roomba rolls right onto the black carpet and does a great job, IMO.So for anyone who finds this post and is having issues with WIFI, or DDWRT, or finishing setup you might try the settings I got to finally work....and good luck!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2021

Review Text: I purchased the iRobot 675 three months ago and was amazed at the positive side of what it does like clean under beds and in corners, etc. However, I've found the quality of the machine and the maintenance a complete turnoff. I've followed all guidelines explicitly and now, at 3 months old, I have to wait for a battery replacement that's (you guessed it) out of stock. To her credit, a patient representative from iRobot helped me troubleshoot the battery which was completely dead but I, of course, wonder why the company doesn't just replace the whole unit. It's cost me mega time and money to accommodate the robot since it backs off black border rugs which meant replacing my dark area rugs with lighter ones. It just seems to me a company should bend over backwards to accommodate a customer, not the other way around. Unfortunately for me, I kept it past the return date because I wanted it to work so badly, and now I'm stuck with it. Do not buy the 675 and find out what impediments to operation you need to be aware of. For me, the 675 is an extremely pricy duster.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2020

Review Text: I purchased this item after reading mostly positive reviews. I used it for only two cleanings and returned it since it didn't work for my needs. I have a short-haired dog who sheds enough that two to three cleanings at minimum per week are needed to maintain my home. I should clarify that I wasn't looking for a vacuum to do the entire job of cleaning my home. I just wanted one that could  help me maintain between my  deeper cleanings. This vacuum mostly pushed fur balls around, which were ultimately cleaned only when I swept by hand. I did rate this product more than one star because it picked up some sand and dirt on my hardwood floors without problems. It also picked up dirt and sand from some shaggy and flat area rugs. This model is not an expensive vacuum, so the cleaning pattern was random, and spots were missed. From what I've read, Roomba's higher-end models have a more consistent cleaning pattern and might do a better job. After my experience, I now wonder if the buyer is paying more for the brand than for the actual quality of the item. I will continue looking for other options.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2020

Review Text: I put down that it was noisy and has a small debris bin, that being said, it's a very small complaint. Bob does more work in one day that any of my adult children living at home do in a week. The customer service is unmatched in anything I have ever experienced. That is not a joke, they are unbelievable. Bob broken down and I called CS. That send me a new battery (I got in 1 day). That was not the problem but I got involved in other projects and forgot about Bob. I got a call a week later by CS and was asked if everything went ok. I explained that Bob was still not working. They mailed me a box and I mailed Bob back (Pre paid) Unfortunately Bob was DOA. They sent me a new Bob (Bob Jr) and he is working fine. That was over a month ago. I am one very happy customer.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020

Review Text: The iRobot Roomba is the 2nd vac that I've owned. The first vac is a Deebot Ecovac. I paid roughly the same amount for each vac new -- $150 to 179.The iRobot easily gets fingerprints due to its glossy surface.  The Deebot does not.The iRobot is loud. The Deebot was quieter new but after getting many cords and other things caught it became progressively louder and is now only a little quieter than the iRobot.The iRobot is large. It will not clean under my bookcase. The Deebot has a slimmer profile and will clean under my dust collecting bookcase.The app integration with the iRobot is much better. I get notifications on my phone EVERY time the iRobot gets stuck on my rugs. And it gets stuck multiple times during EVERY job.Summary: I'm considering returning the iRobot because I'm frustrated with how many times it gets stuck on the edge of my rug. For some reason iRobot just cannot avoid or overcome a very tiny corner of my rug. It calls the area of a my rug a "cliff" however it is FAR from a cliff. It is more like a small pebble.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020

Review Text: Total waste of money.  Doesn’t vacuum well, leaving behind lots of dog hair even though it passes over the same spot multiple times.  Gets stuck constantly when it is not aimlessly covering the same four square feet while ignoring everywhere else.  To the point where your spend as much time getting it unstuck and back on course as you would have just hand vacuuming the room.  Sometimes it cannot even find its way to the home base.  It is so loud you can forget about doing anything while it operates.I stopped using it for about a year because it did poorly in old home.  Gave another try in new home with more open layout and hardwood floors.  Still terrible.  Picture is what I ended up doing with it. Buy a nice Dyson and just do it yourself.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2021

Review Text: We've had the Roomba 675 for 4 months and I would not recommend a Roomba product to anyone. Let's start with the Roomba app. Either the 675 is the most basic model or the folks at iRobot/Roomba can't offer any useful options in their app unless you spend over $300. for the 675, the only options are to set a schedule or start a cleaning job immediately. That's it. Apps for ther less expensive robovacs will also spot vacuum right where you put the device, vacuum just one room, vacuum the edge of an area, send the device back to its charger, or maneuver the robovac's direction from the app. iRobot/Roomba's app is pretty sad in comparison.The 675 is also a very tall device. It frequently gets stuck under cabinets and appliances if a rug or mat is too close by, so those have to get picked up every night if we don't want the 675 pinned down. On other rugs, if the 675 moves off of them at just the right angle, it tips in a way that shuts it down. The 675 can make it interesting to wake up and see if it found a new way to tell us how we need to set up our home so it can do its job.Save yourself $50-$75 and get something other than a Roomba 675. Solid marketing is no substitute for a solid product.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020

Review Text: I regret buying this. I have two cats so my primary need is to keep the pet hair cleaned. This vacuum mainly just makes little lines of cat hair all throughout the house that I then go behind with a wand vacuum. It does collect hair and dirt in the chamber-I’d venture about 50%. Another annoyance is that if it’s not seated within a millimeter of accuracy on its base it doesn’t charge. So you may think it’s charged up but nope, it didn’t. It’s loud. It seems to vacuum the same areas repeatedly and miss others. The schedule could be easier to change in the app. It was easy to set up with wifi but that’s the only good feature that I found. Today I went and bought a 2 ft dust mop and cleaned my apartment in 5 minutes. The roomba ran for about an hour. So I will be gifting it to someone else.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021

Review Text: I waiting a while to purchase a Roomba because I wanted to find it at a great price.  It finally came down low enough where I was comfortable buying it.  I am so happy with this product.  I have a 2,700 sq ft all tile house and haven't used my Dyson in over a month.  The Roomba is synced with my Alexis so I just give her the command and off it goes.  It covers the entire area and the dirt basket is big enough to hold what it picks up.  I have a 60 lb chocolate lab so there is always dog hair.  My home is on three levels so each day I pick up the Roomba and move it to a different level.  One room has an area rug with very low traffic but I cannot believe how much dirt it picks up.  In time I want to purchase two more so I can have one on each level.I love this product and am so happy with its performance.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2021

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   I have a lot of flooring and a husky dog . Everyday I was vacuuming and then I finally broke down and got this robot vacuum . It gets stuck a lot more then I prefer , usually after its done vacuuming so that’s a plus . My issue , it can’t find the docking station that often , it  gets lost . We have moved it several times and it’s still and issue not every time but often .I am wondering if I have to much flooring ? I think it’s 1300sqft downstairs .. all hard flooring with a few carpets .I think it’s worth the cost and I love the concept of this iRobot vacuum . I’m almost thinking of getting 2 of them so they can work together and hopefully one will make it back to a docking station . I’m even thinking of the mopping one . Plus I’ve paid well over $200 for a vacuum that I have to do all the work and our time is valuable right ? It’s nice not worrying about cleaning the floors all the time .. now onto the mopping one next..This vacuum also does well well on carpets and gets all the hair off them too .
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020

Review Text: After THREE years of contemplating whether or not to buy a Roomba, my husband and I finally decided to bite the bullet. I did some quick research and settled on this one. We had a baby in August, so clean floors are more important now. I was primarily looking for one that is good for pet hair, and this one advertises that it is "ideal" for pet hair. We have a German Shepherd mix, and he sheds A LOT.I have now had this product for about a month, and here are my thoughts:Cleaning Quality - My floors have never been cleaner. I don't see clumps of dog hair all around my house. However, and I would think this is obvious, it does not replace regularly cleaning my floors. I still steam vac my floors (hardwood and tile) about every other week, sometimes more as there are messes. I did test it out on my carpet, and it did well (1/2 inch pile), and it handles our rugs well.Battery Life - The battery life isn't great. The first two times I used this, it "completed a job" in an hour and successfully docked itself. Over the last several cleanings, it has not finished and ran out of battery after an hour and a half. I realize that running continually for that long drains batteries quickly, but I would expect it to finish the job in that time; our house isn't that large, after all.Cleaning Pattern - I don't understand the Roomba's cleaning pattern. Sometimes it cleans a space six times and not at all the next time. If I were to purchase another Roomba, I would splurge on one that maps out our space.Overall, I would absolutely buy another Roomba. I am pleased with its performance, but if I'm going to spend money on a product like this, I wouldn't skimp on the extra features again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2019

Review Text: I was excited to try my 600 series out only to find that I spent more time making sure it did not get confused than I would actually grabbing a vaccum cleaner.  While this unit does its job (kind of) it has yet to ever be able to find its base and eventually just dies.  I have blocked off portions of the house, gated certain rooms, closed all the doors - yet still this thing has zero clue how to get back to the base to re-charge.  Completely regret the purchase for something I thought had more automation and much less need for babysitting.  Do not make the same mistake I did - do your research =(
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020

Review Text: I don’t usually write a review the day after I get a product, especially an electronic one ... But....  I am soooo happy with this guy! Yes , I named him Randy.  He was pretty easy to set up right out of the box.  I downloaded the Apple app and connected the WiFi and when it said it was ready to clean I let him go!  My biggest concern was that I have mostly carpet and most reviews talked about other flooring.. but I am worried no more. Randy worked his way through the main rooms of a double wide Mobile Home efficiently and handled the carpet with ease and was VERY entertaining. Another concern was noise.... it’s not as load as I feared ! My upright vacuum upsets my dog but Randy doesn’t she just watched him go. So 2 pluses in one evening! And there’s happiness in seeing tracks in the carpet in the morning :) Thanks to Randy.  Now I got the RoomBa 675... it’s not the cheapest or not the most expensive but I had hoped for it to be sturdy enough for carpet and he definitely is.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020

Review Text: So coming off the old original red roomba I was skeptical to purchase another as it was a complete nightmare. Not to mention some of the prices of these roombas even at costco is insane. I have to say they have completely dialed in all of the shortcomings that made the red roomba a terrible experience. The wheel is removable 100% the sweeper is about the same and easy to clean. the brushes are easy to clean. and the auto home feature and wifi app are suburb not to mention the lithium battery is very much welcomed after coming off nimh batteries.The single biggest problem with the original red one is the maintenance for every time they cleaned I'd spend about the same amount of time cleaning the robot. This new one is literally a 5 minute job pop out the brushes and the wheel remove the hair and pop it back in.If you're on the fence like i was for over 3 years trying to justify spending more on roombas this one is totally worth it. the house has never been cleaner and the amount of stuff it finds is shocking on a daily basis.

Review Text: Decided to splurge on a name brand roomba and take advantage of the amazon monthly payments option. Huge mistake. I’m still paying on a roomba that doesn’t work. It stops halfway through the job and says please charge, or it gets stuck on a small rug. It not won’t charge and can’t dock itself.
