Review Text: I've had mainly hardwood and now tile floors. Our new house is much larger and having to vacuum and sweep was getting to be a lot of work due to cat hair and lots of dust & debris. Due to the recent stay at home orders, I cancelled my cleaning lady and wasn't looking forward to doing that. So at the suggestion of my friend who has a Roomba, I ordered one.The first time I used it, I just let it loose in the house. I cleaned its basket every 30 mins, and boy, was it dusty after going under furniture that needed cleaning. After 2 hours the battery was done & it returned to base to recharge but there was still so much more to do. My friend said put up some barriers around the rooms/areas you want to do, and just do that. Then move to another area after its charged up again. That worked!Yes, I talk to it. Its very entertaining. I asked "The Borg", the name I gave it, what are you trying to do? I love that it talks to me when it's stuck, and that the app on my cell updates me how its doing. Its a bit noisy so I don't do it while anyone is around and that's working too.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020

Review Text: So far, I like it enough to keep it.  Still working out the kinks.It’s only been 3 days and yet haven’t completed a whole cycle.  Starting from base and return back to base.  Scheduled to start and now my routine is look for it when I get home.  First time it died under my bed.  Yesterday got an alert that it was stuck on an edge off a cliff.  My house is all one level and zero stairs.  It got caught up on a smooth base to my floor speaker.  Which was manageable before.  Only time that I’ve had it successfully dock is when I physically move the robot and place it working 6 feet of its dock.  Even then, it’s comical.  It continues to vacuum randomly, away from the dock. Only once did it successfully dock.  Other times just continues to vacuum into another room.  But I still like this little robot.  Does vacuum my entire house and I’m happy with the coverage.  Just need to fine tweak it or be patient to see if it learns eventually.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020

Review Text: I was quite skeptical about this vacuum being up to the job since we live on a farm and have 3 large dogs, one of which is a Great Pyrenes. No matter how many times I sweep or vacuum, my house has a constant layer of fur on the floor. My husband gave this to me for Christmas and I was absolutely amazed at how well it did.This little thing was designed by a genius. Instead of having a stiff-bristled brush, this brush is lush and soft. The dog fur wraps gently around it and is easily removed after each use. I used to have to cut the fur with scissors and pick and pull at it for ages to clean my so called "pet friendly" upright vacuum. In addition to making it easy to clear the dog fur, the soft bristle brush gathers the sand and dirt that gets tracked in, rather than spray it all over the room like a traditional, stiff-bristled vacuum.This vacuum is also much quieter than a traditional vacuum, which means it can run in the background even during zoom classes and online work.There are places it can't go (it gets stuck under the claw foot tub), and once a week I need to do a deep clean of the corners and other tight places, but all in all, this is a great labor saver. My 17 year old son even commented on how much cleaner the floors looked. I can let it do it's thing twice a day if I need to and my house have never looked cleaner.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021

Review Text: I am giving this robot vacuum a fair chance. It sure beats pulling the upright vacuum out. I purchased in August 2020. It is the end of January 2021 now. I’m pretty unsatisfied with this thing. It’s constantly getting stuck underneath my dishwasher, it can’t find its battery charging station 90% of the time, it’s pretty loud. The good thing about the thing is that it runs for a super long time and definitely covers 75% of my house in one charge. I try to keep it off of the rugs in my bedrooms because running it on the hardwood in the main part of the house is where our collection of pet hair mostly is. About once a week I put it in the bedrooms and let it go and I have been able to stay away from my upright vac. Lately it’s been leaving behind hairballs. I’ve cleaned the brushes I clean the filters I’ve dumped the canister I have no idea why.  It does for sure miss a lot of stuff for instance,  I spilled a bunch of ground coffee on the floor and thought to myself what a brilliant idea it would be to use our robot vacuum to clean it up and what do you know it left behind a ton of coffee grounds. It was useless to run it. Previously I had owned a Samsung and I think I’m going to go back to a Samsung
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021

Review Text: Works well for cleaning up pet hair! I was very nervous about buying this but we've had it over a month now and it makes a huge difference. We ran it right after a bbq when a bunch of people had tracked in dirt through the living room and kitchen and in no time at all it was clean. My only complaint is it sometimes takes forever to dock because it doesn't get the right angle or something so it has to keep redoing it. absolutely love it though and so worth the money!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2021

Review Text: We have had this roomba for about 3 months and use it almost daily.  My original expectations was to have it running through various rooms while we were at work.  We quickly discovered that the roomba cannot be unattended.  I spend a lot of time getting it “unstuck” from various locations around the house. It does clean well but it’s not perfect.  My vacuum cleaner does a better job.  It does leave stuff behind but if you use it frequently it will eventually get the entire room.I run it daily in the kitchen because that is where the most activity and dirt occurs.  It does a wonderful job in there.  I alternate between rooms every day. We have pets and I have not noticed any pet hair accumulation since purchasing the roomba.  My floors are always clean and that saves me time in the long run.The roomba has the most difficult time in the living room because of more obstacles in there. It gets stuck underneath the couches and in between furniture and it is a pain to retrieve it.We use it upstairs in the bedrooms on the weekends and it does fine. Enviably it will die underneath our king size bed just out of arms reach.It does not find the docking station very well and rarely will return on its on.  I have to place it on there which is difficult to get it lined up perfectly.  I usually set it a few feet away and “send it home” so it will align itself on the station. Another issue I have recently encountered is it is having a hard time docking correctly.  It goes to the docking station but won’t attach to it.  I finally moved the docking station to a carpeted area because it seemed to work better on the carpet than the wood floor.Overall I am happy with the purchase.  The app and being able to control with Alexa is very beneficial. It has a few flaws but I’m sure later models will resolve some of these issues.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2020

Review Text: It seems its mission is to knock over delicate pedestal tables and dent furniture! It goes ramming speed into all furniture and rarely senses it’s near something, gets perpetually hung up under chairs and constantly gets stuck on the step because its edge-detection doesn’t really work. It does good with sucking up pet hair, but with how it damages the furniture I can’t recommend it to anyone, unless you only have cardboard boxes as end tables and beanbag chairs. It also often returns home with only having done one room. Don’t buy this.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020

Review Text: Best purchase I made in 2019. I have a medium dog who sheds like a pound of hair a day. I have 4 foot long hair myself and i shed another pount a day. Foot traffic dirt for 3-6 people and my floor looks pretty darn spiffy considering i never have a moment to sweep myself cause i work, he works and we also have a 4 yr old. At first id empty it like 3-5 times in a run but now it is 1 or 2 depending if im home while it runs. It works great with our multi shade gray laminate flooring. Light to dark gray spectrum no issues. A few charcoal black entry rugs. About 1400 sq feet of cleaning to do and it does pretty well with 1 or 2 routes a day. Only gets hung up once in a while on the bottoms of recliners cause it is aggressive trying to clean up under the chairs lol. Also the occasional sock gets stuck in it. VERY EASY cleaning, just pull apart and put back together super simple. As long as you make sure there's nothing for it to get hung up under or loose cord/rope/fabric it runs continuously and works wonderfully. Also watch out for dog dishes lol it attacks them like crazy. Goes over door jams just fine, cleans on tile. It is probably 1/3 the volume of a classic vac. You can have an easy conversation and it is not a disruption.  Does well on corners. Oh and my toddler and dog find it super fascinating so plus!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2020

Review Text: Remember that Roomba is a little two wheeled robot:Will only go under an X high space - can get caught perfectly if the space tapers down a little or is X minus 6mmGets caught on wires and weird flooring transitions and holesCan easily quit while under your bed (get all your shoes, socks and other stuff out BEFORE your run Roomba)Will go looking for  a charger when it flashes a red battery symbol - let it go, rescue if it dies.NO WATER AND NO FEEDING AFTER MIDNIGHT  Seriously (and a nod to all you 80's kids)EMPTY OUT THE TINY LITTLE DUST BIN EVERY RUN  USE A GENTLE SOFT BRUSH ON THE FILTER AND PUT IT BACK  - BOTH Disgusting, but a must-doCLEAN THE HAIR AND FIBERS OUT THE ROLLERS  Have a care they will unwind or you can even cut them out if you are very carefulWIPE THE UNDERSIDE SENSORS AND  ROLLER SOCKETS WITH A DISINFECTANT DAMP CLOTH  You will understand after the second time your clean out the rollers.2Other than that list of things to watch out for, Roomba is  a cute bot that your cat can even get accustomed to.Cheers.

Review Text: Good for basic sweeping & dust, fair at picking up pet hair, tends to clog up the sweeper bin fair job sweeping up light sand has trouble even on low nap rugs, sometimes sees rugs as a obstacle and ignore or partially climbs low nap rug and hangs up having to move and relocate to flat floor and restart. Review Text: I have had it for under a year now. It runs every other day at noon in my main floor. It does great for all my pet hair on my hardwood floors. It does however bang up against the walls hard enough it actually recieved scratches and even paint transfer from my baseboards. It seems to have learned the layout almost and is not hitting things as often or as hard. I used it in my airbnb rooms after vacuuming just to see and let it get under the beds. HoWEVER the battery is not no longer holding a charge and it cost $90 just for a battery. Making the rokmba total not worth it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019

Review Text: Sadly this Robot is awful. It's my 4th one in 10 years so I know exactly how well they can work. I've had this one for only 5 months- its stops all the time, crashes all the time and does not work anywhere near as well as the others that I have purchased. Find something else and save your money on a working robot. When they work, they are fantastic, but this one is a lemon.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2020

Review Text: I love this vacuum!  Previously owned a Samsung robot vacuum and it finally broke after several years.  I tried going without, but honestly, with two cats in the house it was tough.  Rather than dealing with furballs I decided to invest in a new one.Overall, this vacuum does a nice job. It transitions from carpet to hard floor quite well.  There have been some mishaps when it gets caught up on the stair ledge, but I am quickly noticed through the app that the terminator has a problem.  Which is nice.  I am hopeful in time it will learn to avoid that area.This was well worth the money and I have it set to run every day.  It runs for around 90 minutes and cleans the living room, bathroom, hallway and bedroom quite well.  It is not too noisy.It does require emptying after each run, but that is quite easy to do.  Set up was also a breeze with the WiFi.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020

Review Text: Let me preface this review with saying I love my Roomba. It has saved me so much time from vacuuming. However, I was really hoping for something that you just leave and it vacuums multiple rooms on 1 charge. And that’s not what happens. It has a battery of about 1 1/2 hours which lasts for one large room. If there are multiple doors open, it usually gets lost and then can’t find its docking station to recharge and runs out of battery. What I do is put it in a room with the door closed. When it finishes that room, I pick it plus the docking station up, move it to another room, close the door, and it vacuums that room. So it takes me 2 to 3 days to vacuum our 3000 square-foot house because I have to move it from room to room and it eventually loses its charge and then needs at least an hour to fully charge. It does an amazing job though.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2020

Review Text: I have a combined garage and wood working shop.  The cars bring in dirt and grit, especially in the winter.  The wood shop generates dust and wood shavings.  If the shop is vacuumed, it is so much nicer to work in -- no lofting dust, no grit underfoot.  Over the years I have had three different robot vacuums.  This one is the best so far, but it gets stuck stupid places, like at the garage doors or behind a bin of wood shavings.  My other gripe is that when it has an issue it has a voice that instead of telling you the issue tells you to open an phone application.  It would be much better to say "can't detect refuse bin" than "error 14.  Open the blah, blah, blah app".  So far (5 months or so), this continues to work.  It *seems* like it will continue to work.Some background on previous vacuums.  I had a Roomba 410 years ago.  It got stuck less of fewer things, but didn't clean quite as well and would become completely disabled by an ash plane shaving.  After six or eight months, its gears had worn down to nubs due to the grit from the cars.  I managed to replace the main gear train, but it wore down again after a similar time, and I decided it wasn't worth the expense at that rate.After that, my brother gave me a Neato brand vacuum.  This is similar to the Roomba, but, instead of the random-walk vacuum pattern follows a satisfying back-and-forth pattern.  Unfortunately, as much as it was more pleasing to watch, it didn't do as good a job.  I had to run it three or four times to get the same quality of material pick-up as the Roomba 410 did in one pass.  Additionally, it is just a bit taller than the Roomba, which made it not fit underneath my lumber drying rack.  It got stuck about the same amount as the Roomba 410.  The batteries stopped holding a charge after 8 months or so.  I replaced them and the second set lasted vaguely half as long.  I replaced them again and that set lasted only a couple of months.  Additionally, at some point the bin sensor failed (so it never detected that the bin was in place), so I bypassed it with some solder.This Roomba (the 675) cleans in roughly the same random pattern as the 410.  It definitely picks up more and doesn't fail as badly on wood shavings or blown in leaves.  The battery life has been fine so far, and the gears look like they haven't worn too much so far.  I wish it didn't get stuck so often.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2019

Review Text: This thing works ! I was very skeptical when I bit the bullet and bought it. I live in a cabin out in the smokey mountains and its just me and my dog. I'm pretty clean, but always building something or doing something outside. To lazy to pull on and off my work boots, and the dog always seems to be on the wrong side of the door. So she comes and goes like the weather. I usually try to vacuum when I get some down time, but hey, I'm a guy. So, I bought this thing, charged it up, picked up all my stuff on the floor, put the chairs up, moved all the loose items on the floor, dog bowl, cloths, trash cans, etc.. Fired that baby up and Wham ! she cleaned up the bottom floor with in a couple of hours. Had to clean it out a couple or times, take off all the hair, string and stuff from the rollers. But, hey it was easier than me getting on my knees trying to hair ball and fuzzy stuff hunting. I ran it for about 3 day's carried it up stairs did all the prep, and Pow, it cleaned every nook and cranny. Went places I've never been. Cheaper than a maid, and not as vocal as my ex-wife. So yea, it was worth the dough. When ever I want to freak my dog out, I put it on while my dog looks at it in wonder. Cheap hillbilly entertainment.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2019

Review Text: Great entry level robot vacuum. We use this to clean the hardwood and rugs in our living room and kitchen and it does a great job cleaning up all the cat and dog hair and all the dirt the pets bring in. The floors are spotless after it runs a full cycle. The Roomba app is great and you can easily set your cleaning schedule or start a new cycle while you're away. You do have to make sure any loose objects are off the floor, so as we leave for the day we take 2 minutes and move the pet food bowls and anything else up and out of the way. Same for any loose cords or curtains that are hanging on the floor.Knocking off one star because it sometimes sometimes freezes when it goes to far out over the ledge between our living room and family room that's one step down. 95% of the time it senses the ledge and turns around, but other times it goes too far out and gets stuck. You have to turn it around yourself and press start again to get it back running. It also sometimes get stuck under the couch. Our couch is just the right height that the Roomba can get under the couch in one certain spot, but then gets stuck. If it was a fraction taller or shorter, it would work just fine. It can be annoying when you expect it to clean the whole area, but get's stuck after just a few minutes of cleaning.It also seems to have a hard time finding it's docking station after it gets done cleaning. It's probably our fault in where we located the docking station, but this spot works for us and is out of the way. We just have to pick up the dead Roomba and carry it back to the dock. Not a huge deal, and the convenience of the robot vacuum outweighs the issue of having to carry it back when it's done.Due to the layout of our house, if it finds it's way into the bedrooms/office, it would usually get stuck back there, so we block off that area of the house now. We didn't feel like spending the large amount of extra money to buy a vacuum that comes with house mapping, so we still vacuum those areas with our cordless stick vacuum.If you're hoping this vacuum will clean your entire house and return to it's charging dock perfectly, you probably need to spend the extra money and buy one with mapping features. But, if you want a vacuum to thoroughly clean you main living areas and save a little money, this is the one for you.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020

Review Text: If you’re looking for a robot vacuum that doesn’t have any rhyme or reason to it’s cleaning pattern, bounces off of walls, gets stuck under chairs/tables, is LOUD, and struggles to return to its docking station, look no further; this is the device for you! I will say this, it does a good job at actually picking up dirty, debris, and pet hair. In the 3 days of owning this turd, I’ve spent more time redirecting its path and helping it get unstuck from beneath tables and chairs. It seems to spend a lot of time cleaning the area around its docking station and when we repositioned it to another room, it always returns back to the room where it’s docking station is located. Setting it up was fairly easy and the app does offer complete control and cleaning schedules which is nice. We were really looking for a device that we could schedule to run over night while the family slept but, this wasn’t it; it sounds a tone when it begins cleaning which is unnecessarily loud to go along with the noisiness of the robot “clunking” around while it cleans. This was the first robot vacuum that we’ve purchased so we didn’t know what we didn’t know. We have since returned the vacuum and plan to purchase the RoboRock S4 Max which offers room mapping and based on reviews, is much quieter
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020

Review Text: I bought this product because I though it will help between cleaning days but I was wrong.I have to constatly baby sit because it gets stuck, miss spots, doesn't pick all the hairs. Very unhappy with the results.If you are latina and you like to clean perfectly this is not a product for you!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020

Review Text: Mind you, I'm not Betty Crocker but when I moved in here 1 1/2 years ago all hardwood, tile and carpet were brand new. My intention has always been to keep them looking that way. It's just my small dog and me. Sweeping 2-3 times a week. Vacuuming every other week. Swiffer once a month. Shampoo once a year. I thought I was doing good.Got my Roomba 1 1/2 weeks ago. Even on the hardwood and tile this little demon (her name is Rosie) is finding dog hair and dirt I couldn't see or feel! She makes me ashamed of myself for being so slack! Now consider the following when deciding if a Roomba is what you need:1. How many minutes do you vacuum a room per event? 5-7 minutes maybe?  Let this thing go for 30-60 minutes and see what it can do!2. Does your carpet get "trained" to lay one way or another? It will vacuum in multiple directions keeping your carpet honest and straight.3. When was the last time you swept under the bed or couch? Yeah. You'll clean out that bin several times in the first few runs.4. Wouldn't you rather be doing something else anyway?Bottom line and as I type it is doing it's thing. The points above are the realisations I've had in this short time and am very happy I made this decision! It's quieter than a regular vacuum and very easy to learn. 5x5 stars from me!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2018

Review Text: For the most part I love my Roomba! She works great! The only part I don’t like is she gets stuck in the weirdest ways. I used to have the couch up against a wall with an area rug in front of it and the Roomba would get stuck underneath the couch. Also I had a small step down (2.5”) and it wouldn’t sense the step so it would fall down and get stuck down there. Other than that I really like my Roomba.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020

Review Text:

   My second roomba, first one still working after 5 years but this one keeps having issues not charging getting stuck etc, I contacted roomba several times sent tons of videos and pictures and they always keep requesting more information, (until I got tired of wasting my time contact up them) It is obvious mine is not charging  7 of 10 times doesn’t go back o the dock so when I want it to vacuum is out of battery, on the video you can see is not making good contact, as I mentioned I contacted roomba several times en the last year. All they did was asking for more proofs and having me do more tests, is very frustrating!  I have 3  robot vacuums at home, 2 of them are roomba and  I would EVER waste my money on a roomba because if is not working (like mine) they don’t provide  a good customer support.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2021

Review Text: This is our second Roomba.  The first was a 950 series.  We like the fact that this one is a LITTLE bit quieter than the first one was.  It seems a little erratic and misses places, but does alright if we run it twice over the same area. The main things that we dislike are that the flap covering the dustbin opens out from the side and is flimsy. It flops around and is easy to knock off while dumping the dust.  Hasn't broken yet, but I always worry that it will.Also, the rollers are very high maintenance. This model has a rubber roller and a brush.  About every other time I run it, I have to remove the brush and cut hair and carpet fibersout of the brush with a pair of scissors.  Hair also gets hung up in the ends of both roller bars, and scissors are almost always necessary.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2021

Review Text: Love it! Living in a house with 4 dogs this Roomba was something I always wanted & its been an absolute blessing.  Happy Mothers Day to me!  Roomba, aka Suzy runs every night as scheduled. Its been a life saver & my tile floors have never been so clean. I'm amazed at the amount of dog hair that is in the dump bin.  The first few days the Roomba ran 2 to 3 times a day, every time catching massive amounts of dog hair.  Dry dog food will send her back to the dock. Due to the amount of sand & dirt brought in by the dogs. I clean the brushes almost daily. Its an easy & quick task.  I use a damp paper towel & old toothbrush to keep my new friend nice & clean, wiping down the wheels & around the dump bin.  Maybe a little too OCD,its just a little spit bath.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2020

Review Text: I use this daily as I have a special needs child who tends to leave dirt and crumbs in her path. I don't have time to vacuum after her every day and bought this so I could set it and go. The price good in comparison to the other brands and models. I love the concept and it does the job well enough in between my big house cleaning days. I'm not sue how much of a deep clean I am getting, but I use my Dyson for that. I'm a little disappointed in the battery life. It seems to only have enough for one room at a time and a few instances it returned to the charging dock before finishing the job.I do like to run it under the beds to eliminate dust bunnies and such Like I said, this is my way of staying on top of day to day dirt, but  I would never depend upon it just this to be my only vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2019

Review Text: I wish I had bought this sooner.  We live in the country and with two dogs we track dirt in all day.  Now, instead of sweeping the floors every day and sometimes twice a day.  I start "Rosie" a couple of hours before we plan to come in the house for the evening and when we come in it is so clean.Be sure to give the iRobot plenty of room to maneuver around the room.  I even pull out the couches and tables once a week so she can vacuum behind them.  No more dust bunnies or spider webs in hidden spots. Absolutely one of the best purchases we have made.  I am actually surprised at the dog hair and dirt in the cup when I empty it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2021

Review Text: We recently purchased 2 iRobot Roomba's to replace our dated Neato Botvacs.  At first I assumed the devices were doing a good job since their bins contained lint and other dirt particles.  However, after using them both for about 5 times each, I would like to offer the following feedback:1.  The Botvac in no way maps the house or attempts to run a strategic path.  It literally runs into everything at almost full speed, spins around, and goes in an entirely different direction.  Entire swaths of rooms are left untouched.  More importantly, it skips rooms all together.  It will spend an hour and a half cleaning one room before docking again.2.  The app is good for starting a job, but ignores the command to stop cleaning and return to base.3.  It will literally get stuck in a corner and never figure-out how to correct.  In fact, it gets stuck so much more than our Neato ever did.  You cannot leave the house, start a job, and expect it to finish without an issue.4.  It does not clean as well as our Neato used to.  It certainly gets the basics, but we always see missed debris that should have been caught during the cleaning.We had such a good experience with our Neato Botvacs that we were excited about switching to iRobot's version with wifi capabilities.  Overall, it pains me to write a bad review or not recommend a product, but this was a bad purchase on our part.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021

Review Text: Was not impressed at all!! I bought these to helo clean up after my kids after they eat.....after over a hour of traveling around the house it never got to the spot where I was wanting it to clean up. It would of been easier and faster to just grab a broom and on myself and do it! Needless to say...it was returned!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020

Review Text: We have a Roomba and love it (dog owners) and decided to purchase one for my mother in law. She seemed hesitant at first but after she began using it...she loved it. She watches our dogs occasionally which would cause her stress from their shedding and mess they would create. This helped ease some of that stress. She uses it daily. The only con is that it doesn't work on carpets...but it works well on hard surfaces. It doesn't give a deep clean but definitely keeps the floor clear of dust bunnies.Its definitely more reliable than my husband. It also does what I want...better than my husband. I turn it on and leave the house and when I come back...it at least did what I wanted it to. No excuses.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020

Review Text: I did not have high expectations. I will agree that you need to pick up first, and she, Rosie, seems aimless in how she goes about cleaning. I will also agree that she is LOUD. That being said, she has been amazing at getting my kids to pick up before bed so their legos and such won’t get destroyed. She is a great kid trainer! I have a Dyson pet and Shark vacuum I use all the time, added to daily sweeping. My wool rug seemed to hold tight to the dog hair, giving a grey tone to my blue. This Roomba, our Rosie, has brought the blue back! My rug looks like new, saving me from the professional cleaning I was thinking of doing. The shedding dog fur in corners-gone! I absolutely love this. My house is spotless every morning. She may seem aimless, but she’s definitely effective! Highly recommend!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2021

Review Text: This roomba is great.  I have a bible study each week and all the ladies remarked on how good my hardwood floors looked.  They said my floors looked shiner every week.  I thought they we looking better.  But since they said that. I know they are!!!  It took Rhoda about 10 days to learn my house.  The air is cleaner now.  I love my roomba! My floors looked so good, that my friend bought one for herself and she loves it.  It is great on carpet also.  I only have carpet in one room.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2018

Review Text: ORIGINAL REVIEW: We have a cat, a dog, and 2 girls in our house, we all shed a lot of hair and our Roomba does a great job! We didn’t buy the more expensive version and took our chances with this one - we were not disappointed!!!Our house is completely tile with some throw rugs. The Roomba keeps the whole house looking great! We are split level, so after she cleans the regular level of the house, returns to her dock and charges up, we put her down in the lower level and let her tackle that too. When she’s done, she lets us know and we place her back on her dock since she can’t get there from the step down.If you’re on the fence, get one!!! You won’t be disappointed!!UPDATE:Lowered from 5 stars to 1 stars after running our Roomba for only 3 months, we are having battery issues. It is not holding a charge like it use to. We stopped using it on the split level after one month. It cleans once a day and returns to the dock everyday. But the battery level was still rapidly getting lower and lower. It never gets a full charge, even after charging for 22 straight hours after docking. The battery is so bad it isn't even charging anymore.iRobot/Roomba, do you have any help for us? I don't want to replace the battery every 3 months!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2019

Review Text: Good for spot cleaning but you have to make sure you don’t have any cords or carpet strings that will get sucked up. It also wanders in random patterns like it’s questioning its existence. Base model does not do zones. After having it for almost 2 years, I only use it for a quick spot cleaning. Either don’t buy one at all or invest in one that has a logical pattern just like you would vacuum a room as well as virtual barriers. I’m going to upgrade to one that works with Alexa where I can tell it to clean a specific room or zone. I purchased one of the originals along time ago and returned it And after seeing this one, the industry and the brands are definitely going in the right direction. Hopefully one day someone will make an outdoor one or an industrial size one that can clean my shop floor.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   I am obsessed with roombas. I always buy them as gifts for my loved ones and they all agree it is life changing if you have pets. I have 2 dogs and it is insanely helpful with dog hair. Never had a problem and the app notifies you if roombie gets stuck under the entertainment stand like mine does. I don’t buy filters you can use an air compressor to clean the filter. Every 30 minutes while he’s running I empty out the tummy due to him filling up quickly from dog hair. Have had for 2 years and run the roomba once a week. You could daily like I have in the past. You can also set times while you’re away for it to clean. Does pretty good job getting back to the unit when you hit “home” button. Sometimes I go over over with a vacuum but don’t see a major difference when I do.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 28, 2021

Review Text: It is so nice to be able to run this whenever I want to without having to actually take time to vacuum. It picks up the fine dust that we get everywhere in our area, which is really nice. The only thing I would change about it is how random it is. There is no pattern to where it vacuums. Sometimes it will do the same area over and over and over and never get to other areas. It also follows no discernible path. I watch it bypass a bot of dirt repeatedly, but in the end, it always seems to get everything. I have been using it for about two months and in that time have only gotten out the full sized vacuum. That was when I wanted to mop immediately and needed the whole floor vacuumed quickly without waiting for the Roomba's hit and miss style of cleaning.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2021

Review Text: This is our second robot vacuum. The first was a cheaper shark ninja that did a great job but broke after just 18 months. It also had a very poor app. So we figured we'd upgrade to the real thing. What a mistake.This thing is LOUD on the hardwood floors. Easily 2x as loud as the ninja. It gets stuck in places our old robot navigated easily. It makes all kinds of beeping noises that you can't turn off. It has trouble docking, so much that we have to pick it up and place it back on the dock about half the time.And most importantly, it's a mediocre vacuum. It does not do nearly as good a job on the hardwood as the ninja. And it pushes big piles of dog hair and dirt to the edges of the area rugs, but the 1/2" height difference means the vacuum can't pick up the piles. So I am sweeping a full dustpan every day after it is done.I would return it but we missed the window because we were distracted by pandemic issues. Now I'm stuck with this $270 piece of junk. I am likely going to trash it after a few months and buy another brand.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020

Review Text: If you don't have one of these and your situation is even remotely similar to mine, you NEED one. We named ours Alice (you know, from the Brady Bunch), and she's fun to watch after all the kids go to bed. Sometimes she gets stuck, but we're learning how to better prepare for her work. I've been placing the dining chairs on the table, and taped some extension/lamp cords to the baseboard to keep her from getting tripped up. The dust/dirt chamber is full after every use!! My wife finds it funny when I refer to the robot as "her," but she's also the first to ask Alexa how to spell something, so... I digress. Alice does quality sweeping and docks herself to charge. Just empty the dust chamber every day, and the floors are cheerio-/dog treat-/cat food-/cracker crumb-/bird seed-/feather-/dog hair-/popcorn-free! It's great to place bare feet on clean hardwood floors.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021

Review Text: We like Rudi The Roomba. He works very hard and does a great job cleaning multiple floors PLUS an outside deck. The biggest drawback is HE IS REALLY LOUD! I MEAN LIKE ANNOYS THE SH*T OUT OF YOUR LOUD SO YOU DON'T WANT TO BE IN THE SAME ROOM.There is a handy time function for your phone/iPad but if he starts up while we are in the room, we send him back to the docking station. That is somewhat amusing as it is if he doesn't know the way and must bump into lots of things trying to find his way back home. I'm former US Navy so reminds me of a late night in the Philippines watching guys trying to get back to the ship.  Typically we deploy Rudi on a floor where we don't plan to be for a few hours and let him have at it. He will go till he runs out of battery power and the floor/ carpet with be pretty clean. We will then dump the dust bin thingy in the trash and charge him up for the next floor.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2020

Review Text: Why does this thing repeatedly headbutt everything in sight?  I realize it has to scour the perimeter of the house, the furniture, etc., but it seems like this thing goes out of its way to do things that REPEATEDLY result in the unit getting stuck ... such as ramming itself HARD into small areas over and over.  I thought this AI crap was supposed to "learn".I'm not kidding, this unit has wedged itself nearly irretrievable in the same areas multiple times (such as behind my toilet).  It even ceases operation to send me a notification that it is stuck.  You'd think such events would lead to .... learning.  But no.  This thing is dumber than a kid on three pounds of pixie sticks and keeps making the same mistake.But ... when it does happen to be in the vicinity of dirt, hair, etc., it does a *reasonably good* job fulfilling its purpose.  I just wish it was a little nicer to my furniture.My cats despise this thing.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2020

Review Text: First off, I am a neat freak/OCD, and I am always vacuuming my wood floors and area rugs.  My husband decided to rescue a Shepard, and my first thought was, "are you friggen kidding me?!?!, I am going to die with all the dog hair."  Literally, I was up all night thinking about the masses of dog hair everywhere. There was no arguing about his decision because we also rescued a Maltipoo 9 years ago, and he's been wanting a Sheppard.  Therefore, I  supported his decision because he's a great guy, and it helped that he gifted me Cartier love bracelets for my birthday - since  COVID ruined my 50th.  I digress.  "Rambling Rose," the name we gave our Rhumba is a god-send! I have her scheduled every day to go on at 9 AM, and in about two hours, the entire house is hair-free.  She picks up mostly everything, but most importantly, she manages to get every last hair on the floor!  OUTSTANDING appliance and I will be gifting this number to several people this holiday season!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020

Review Text: For a robot, this thing is stupid. It misses lots of debris and spots on the floor while working. Haphazardly bumps around the room. Many times I just pick it up and place it where I want vacuumed and it still misses. It also has a hard time finding the dock although it's not in a hidden spot. The app is also useless for this model. It would appear that you can set different cleaning routines through the app, and thats not possible with this model. There is also no mapping for this model in the app, so unless you are watching the vacuum go through the house, you don't know where it goes. In this case, the well known name brand is NOT better. Save your money and get a different robovac.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2021

Review Text: Bought the Roomba to replace my Neato because it got great reviews and was less expensive.  I have not been nearly as happy with it.  I do like that it connects to WiFi and I get an announcement via the app when a job has been completed or if he is stuck.  Many times I will come home from work and find him in the middle of the room rather than on the base.  He misses quite a bit, and even though I have a fairly small (2,400 sq ft) one-story home (and have three of the rooms closed off), he still doesn’t clean the entire area.  My Neato followed a straight path in open areas, but the Roomba is random and the carpet tracks he leaves are every which way.  In reading over the cleaning log in the app, I realized there are more days he gets stuck or doesn’t return to the base than he completes a cycle and returns for recharging.  He does not go back to the base, recharge, then finish; once he runs out of juice, he either stops right where he is Or returns to the base and stays there.  When I need to replace again, will go back to the Neato.  Guess you get what you pay for.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   I got this as a Christmas gift for my wife, and she was ecstatic about it! Sadly though, our excitement seemed to end there. I wanted to use it for at least two weeks before we left a review, so I could give a qualitative review. Three weeks into using it we found quite a few problems with the Roomba 675, and what was even more disappointing is how customer service was over the phone.1. The iRobot Roomba 675 claims it can transition from hard flooring to carpet/rug with ease due to its auto-adjusting cleaning heads and +Power boost technology. Sadly, this is not true. We have two rugs that are relatively short in fiber hight, and the Roomba 675 rarely gets onto them. At first, I thought that maybe we got a defective unit that just struggled to get over rugs and onto the carpet. After calling customer service, I was told that my carpet is over 1.6cm or 5/8in and that it cannot get over that height. After measuring my carpet, I found that my carpet is just under 1.6cm, which is supposedly within the hight limit. However, customer support concluded that I was wrong, and had no help or advice to offer me.2. The Roomba 675 claims that it has intelligent navigation. If you can call it running into walls and obstacles, then randomly changing directions intelligent navigation, then sure, its got it. Supposedly this also helps it "navigate under and around objects and under furniture", yet it CONSTANTLY gets stuck, under our fridge, under our couches, under our coffee table, and when it manages to get onto our rug.3. This unit was not made to last, which is why they sell replacement parts. We've been using the Roomba 675 for about three weeks now, and already the edge sweeping brush has broken. Sure, this is an easy fix and can be replaced for about $20, but that seems unreasonable to replace that often.4. The Roomba 675 claims that it automatically docs and recharges itself. Sadly, we've rarely seen this happen. If the Roomba 675 isn't within direct sight of its docking station, then it CANNOT find it. You'd think it'd use that "intelligent navigation" to remember where it has been and how to get back to its docking station, but it doesn't. From what I've noticed, it aimlessly vacumes and bumps into things, when its battery gets low, it seems like it searches for its dock, but usually cannot find it.5. Ultimately, we found that it can't clean deep or well enough to replace our normal vacuum, so we will still be doing that every week.To finish, if it was my choice, I'd return the Roomba 675 in a heartbeat, especially since it can't hold up to what it claims. But, my wife claims it's not a bad broom replacer... so if you want to give up sweeping, its got that going for it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2020

Review Text: Maybe it’s me because this seemed to work really well at first. I’v gotten Forgetful about emptying it or making sure cords or other items are up and out of the way. Several times i’ve Had to untangle cell phone cords fro the brush even after insuring furniture like ottomans are up and out of the way because I like to schedule it to clean in the early morning hours when I’m asleep. It’s a great product but ‘m inclined to forget about emptying it out or clearing out the hair from the brushes. Maybe you are more disciplined than I. I guess if it stands the test of time and my negligence, it will be a superior product in my case. I grow tired of dealing with it every morning or before it’s next scheduled cleaning. Ended up just sweeping and mopping the floor today cuz there was dog hair everywhere.  Could be because my bf was finding it stalled for some reason or other and it never finished its cleaning cycle. Not an important detail we remember to discuss any longer. Busy lives......
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2020

Review Text: I had it for 3 months and it worked great. Then it quit docking. Called customer service and they sent a new battery. Worked fine for another month and then quit docking again. I just got use to putting it back on its charger each time. I tried everything. Cleaned it up like they suggested no luck. Then 2 months ago it kept going in circles. Did what they suggested cleaned brushes, wheels, etc. Didn't matter still went in circles. Now for what ever reason it just won't charge again, so haven't used it in a month. Way to much money for all the troubles its caused. Loved it for the 3 months it worked...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2020

Review Text: Update: Good when it works. I don't know if I got a lemon or what, but the brush error repeats so often, I've gotten very little use out of it in the two months I've owned it. I've kept it very clean, which is tedious. Customer service is amazing and said they are sending me new brushes and a new control unit.  Hopefully those fix it, bc right now it is an expensive paperweight. I have a monster shedder dog, but don't want to spend every day vacuuming. I am amazed at how thorough the ROOMBA is when let loose to do it's thing. It is kind of cool to watch it's logic. The only thing I have found, is that mine has a great deal of problems getting "home" after cleaning. No problem, I can easily take him "home" in exchange for my not having to push a vacuum around for an hour. This thing really vacuums!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021

Review Text: I bought the Roomba 675 mostly because of pet hair.  My 30 pound long haired dog and 11 pound short haired cat are indoor pets, and they’re both good shedders.Roomba worked as advertised—scooted across my mostly-hardwood floors and didn’t have any trouble climbing onto my area rugs.  The best thing was that it zipped underneath the couch and beds, places that are harder for me to clean.  The worst part was hearing it blunder around in the forest of table and chair legs in the dining room, whacking into things, spinning, whacking again.  But it did find its way out!The dust cup was full—mostly fur—after half the house was vacuumed.  I set the Roomba loose in the bedrooms and the dust cup filled up again.  The front wheel and brushes were also clogged with fur after one trip around my house.  This takes a few minutes to remove, and your hands get dirty.  Tip: try a cheap plastic “rat-tail” comb to pull the fur out of the brushes.  It worked for me.After one use, the pluses were the ease of using this machine, and it was pretty good at getting up the fur.  Minuses: cleaning the brushes and emptying the dust cup as often as I did.  This model doesn’t show an indicator light for a full dust cup, you just have to check it.  Also, Roomba doesn’t do corners very well (or maybe at all).I’ll definitely keep it and it will be useful, but not a magic solution.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2020

Review Text: This isn't worth the money. You need to pickup everything including cords which is extremely annoying but if you don't, roomba will tangle itself and start dragging whatever is attached which will end up breaking things. It's already broken a mirror which ended up falling on the roomba and damaging it. Anything light, it will ram causing it to fall. It just goes around randomly which means it misses a lot of spots. It tends to obsess over certain spots, constantly trying to go back to the same spot and stay there while absolutely avoiding other areas and never cleaning there.It needs to be watched while it's on meaning I'm not saving any time having it vacuum. It's not noisier than a vacuum but I can vacuum faster and the roomba needs over an hour to actually clean so the sound gets pretty annoying.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021

Review Text: Impressed for my first robotic vacuum. It does a pretty decent job vacuuming. I have hardwood floors and it tends to blow some of the dog hair around at first but eventually gets most of it. Not impressed with the front cliff sensor. If it goes at my stairs head on I will get the cliff warning and have to move the Roomba. But if it goes towards the stairs at an angle the side cliff sensors work great.This unit doesn't have do virtual mapping so it will run around, sometimes vacuuming a spot 5 or 6 times. It will continue cleaning until the dust bin is full (generally an hour and a half). I do wish it did virtual mapping so it wouldn't have to run so long each time but, doing the barefoot test afterwards I can tell that it did it's job.Overall for my first robotic vacuum I'm definitely happy with it. I can honestly see myself eventually upgrading to the unit that dumps the dust bin automatically. Not immediately but that will definitely be my next robotic vacuum purchase when I decide to upgrade.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2020

Review Text: After researching many different brands and models of robot vacuum cleaners, and talking with people who owned them, I settled on this one. The name of my iRobot is Ruby. Ruby works every day and she is so awesome at her job. She even cleans under my bed occasionally. With two dogs she finds enough hair to fill up every day. One of the best purchases I’ve ever made. The app is easy to use and with the exception of needing to robot-proof the house, this couldn’t be any better. I got to the point where I couldn’t find the time to vacuum my house even once a month. When I got Ruby, I had her run two or three times in the same day. She was full after each cycle. I did this probably two days in a row and then just ran her once a day for the remainder of two weeks. Then I pulled out my high-quality $300+ manual vacuum cleaner that I got as a wedding gift.  I was expecting to get find dirt and things that Ruby had missed because of lower section, but after slowly vacuuming my whole house there was almost no dirt in the canister. Usually just doing a good job with my manual vacuum cleaner would allow me to collect enough dirt and hair to empty the canister two or three times. I am extremely impressed with the quality of this vacuum and would highly recommend
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2019

Review Text: I wanted to like this vacuum so much but we've had CONSTANT issues with it. This is our 3rd robot vacuum in 8 years. We had 2 Neatos before this but they are extremely expensive now so we decided to give this one a try. The first few days were great but we noticed this thing doesn't follow a pattern. It's literally all over the place. The lines on the carpet make it look like the Roomba had too much to drink before work.Next issue is that you have to do quite a bit of work to keep this thing going. It's not just about cleaning the filter and the brushes. The hair makes it's way around EVERYTHING in this vacuum.  You have to take the front wheel off every couple of days. Because the hair clogs it so fast that it stops rolling. When you take the brushes out to clean them the hair isn't just around the brush, it's caked and stuck around the tiny parts that hold the brush in place and there is no easy way to remove it so you have to get scissors and start cutting itNext issue is that I can't get ours to charge without a daily fight. I don't know if the wheels aren't level or if ours is just defective but I have to slide something (usually a few pieces of mail to lift the back end of the roomba up so it will start charging because it cannot position itself in a way that it will charge without help. I've never had to work so hard on a robot vacuum.The plus side is that when it does work, it works well.Overall, I wouldn't recomend this to a friend. It's priced well but it never works right and takes daily maintenanceLet me also add that we've tried placing it in several areas of our house to make sure it just didn't need a better balance point to charge but none have worked. The photos I've added were taken about 2 days after taking it apart and cleaning all of those areas of hair. Our Neatos were made in a way that the hair couldnt get into any part but the brush and trash area so we had very little maintenance to do. I think we still have a manufacturer warranty on it that I will be looking into.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2019

Review Text: So the first time I set the Roomba to work I thought "that's a pretty good job!", despite the fact that it got lost and I had to manually go dock it.The second time we had taken away the living room furniture and upon rolling up the rug I found a very dusty floor and thought "perfect, this is a job for Roomba!" Well, I was mistaken. After the first run it left the tracks on the first picture shown before letting me know very happily that it had finished the job. Yes, I can see the turns where it detected more dirt and went more thorough, but it didn't really do that, did it? So I waited for a full charge and ran it again, and the results are the second photo. Really tempts me to put powder or something all over the house, set it to go and see what it actually does, but I know that the answer will be run around aimlessly all over the place missing a good percentage of the area.Very disappointed, will be returning.Oh, I ran it a few more times where it got stuck in the ledge to a step and I had to rescue it, I'm not counting those towards the cleaning of under the rug .
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019

Review Text: I have a large breed and small breed dog, and a cat, spending alot of time free-range indoors.  I have owned a very reputable upright vac for years now, and usually have to hit the entire house about 3 times a week.  The Roomba 675 has changed my routine forever!  This robot will easily adapt from hardwood floors to heavy carpet with no problem at all.  It is amazing to watch, and even more amazing that my upright vac, and my lower back, can now let the Roomba 675 do most of the work!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2021

Review Text: I was initially excited to receive the Roomba as a Christmas gift from my family; however, after a month I discovered the Roomba has major issues returning and maintaining a charge. I assumed that Amazon would be helpful and responsive, but unfortunately, they told me my vacuum was no longer under warranty; and that it would be best to contact the company directly. One can imagine the run-around I received from iRoomba. First, I was told to send a video, then I was given specific excerpts (which were of no help) to fix the "problem." It is now day 7 of going back and forth with a company that runs a call center in a foreign country. Needless to say, I am extremely disappointed that my expensive gift is useless.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2021

Review Text: I live in a two bedroom apartment and have managed to keep the floors very clean due to my Roomba. We have it scheduled to run 3 times a week, and I'd say it learned the layout of the apartment within the first 2 weeks. It cleans different sections of the apartment on different days, and gets into its groove more as time goes on, so you just have to trust its process at first.The only slightly annoying issue we've had with the Roomba is that once it starts running, the charge only lasts for an hour and fifteen minutes to ~maybe~ an hour and thirty minutes max. There have been 2 or 3 times where it's just died while cleaning, or died while on its way back to the dock, and then I've had to go grab it and place it on the charging dock manually. However, it is a "robot vacuum", and so I think you need to expect it to have dumb moments like this sometimes.You have to keep floors fairly clean of small objects to, or else the roomba may get stuck on top of them - I've had it get stuck on my laptop cord, and then again, you have to go manually untangle the cord and move the roomba to get back on track.Regardless, the Roomba purchase was well worth the money for me - I hate vacuuming, and this has saved me the trouble of adding it to my to-do list. The noise is slightly quieter than that of a manual vacuum, too, so that's an added plus. Maybe one of the best features is the app compatibility. The push notifications on the phone alert you if the Roomba is stuck on something, or if the battery is running low, and you can choose to send it home if needed.All around, I'd recommend this purchase to a friend. It might be a little more expensive than a manual vacuum, but to me, the convenience pays for itself.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 9, 2020

Review Text: My husband and I are so impressed with this machine.  we have a Kirby Upright Vacuum which is supposed to very good but I am amazed at how much soil this little machine picks up every day.  First time out, I had to clean out the dust bin 3 times, it picked up so much.  We were embarrassed at how much it picked up.  I wanted one of these for years but thought they were a gimmick.  Nope!  This is one hard working machine.  It has restored the nap in my carpets that I thought was gone forever and our allergies are greatly improved as well.  I have  our robot set to run every morning at 9 am.  It runs for about 1 hour 20 minutes, always a different pattern.  I figure over the course of a week, the entire house gets covered twice.  I was so impressed my sister bought one and had the same experience.  She now has purchased a second one for the upstairs so she does not have to keep moving them.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2020

Review Text: This was my first Roomba since my 6 year old 440 died in 2017.  I used a $99 Deebot N79 after my 440 died and was surprised by how much better it worked despite the price differential.  My N79 died after two years and I decided that if a cheapo Deebot worked so well Roomba's must have improved tremendously since the days of the 440.  I got the 675 and found a lot of features on this model that my Deebot N79 didn't have.Feature 1:  No remoteFeature 2:  Gets stuck under cabinets and tables.  The sensor on the front top doesn't so much sense as act as a leveraging tool to make sure you can't easily get the Roomba out from wherever it got stuck this time.Feature 3:  Doesn't pick up a lot of the debris that the Deebot does.Feature 4:  Premium price for discount performance.Feature 5:  Much louder than the Deebot.Feature 6:  Stops charging after 2 weeks of light use.Feature 7:  Gets stuck on thresholds and rug edges that the Deebot has no trouble traveling over.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020

Review Text: I purchased this on a flash deal for the roomba 675. I've been eyeballing robot vacuums for a while now, but couldn't justify the cost. I also have 4 cats and 1 dog and have been a bit paranoid about the horror stories I've read. Once it was delivered, I proceeded to unpackage it. Quick instructions on setting this up. I let it charge (which took less time than the instructions stated). Once it was charged, I set up the house with "barriers" in places I didn't want it to go. Shut the door to the mud room so it didn't go in there and then started it up.Off it went like a drunk uncle during Christmas dinner. It was banging into everything all over the place. I chalked it up to the learning phase. But boy, oh boy, did it remind of the drunk uncle stories. You know, that uncle that gets drunk during family gatherings, but everyone still loves. From this point on, I decided it needed a drunk uncle name. Mine is called uncle Otis.Uncle Otis went to town on my house. So much that I didn't think he was going to make it back before the battery ran out. On the app, I told it to go dock. Uncle Otis (like a typical drunk uncle) didn't really listen and just kept on cleaning. I think he finally staggered home, but barely. I really was not expecting uncle Otis to actually clean as well as my regular vacuum. I have an expensive Kirby vacuum and couldn't imagine this little guy could outdo it. I also had vacuumed previous to getting this just to give the poor guy a chance. To my surprise, the container was chalk FULL of animal hair and debris. I couldn't believe it, but uncle Otis was able to get a deeper clean than my expensive, fancy vacuum.Day two: I started uncle Otis up. Still banged into a bunch of things, but not as hard this time. I guess he finally started get some lay of the land. Poor guy was also going into nooks and crannies I couldn't reach with my regular vacuum. I think he became friends with a spider under my entertainment center. He came out fully decorated in spider silk... Only catch today was that he tried to get under the coffee table and got stuck. Had to free him and start him back up. Off he went again. After he was done cleaning, I emptied him. The container was 3/4 full of hair and debris. Man, uncle Otis is a beast!Day three: I gave uncle Otis the day off.Day four: I was working from home, so I started him up and went upstairs to work. I swear, about every 10 minutes, uncle Otis was stuck under the coffee table again. I finally let him have his way and raised the coffee table with some wood blocks. Uncle Otis was happy he could get under there. Still a decent amount of hair and debris after the run. I'm not sure, but I think uncle Otis is trying to mess with me. Either that, or my animals are filthy!Overall, I am extremely happy with this purchase. Uncle Otis does a great job vacuuming. He hasn't had any problem transitioning from carpet to hardwood floors to rugs. I even braved taking him upstairs to clean. I was a bit concerned about him stumbling down the stairs, but he was great at stopping before the great tumble. It is a bit scary, as he does head toward the edge at a pretty fast speed. But he never once tumbled.He still picks up a ton of hair and debris. This actually makes me happy as that is nasty that I could be breathing. And it's wonderful having a happy little robot that can vacuum while I do something else.Every once in a while, he has his "moments". The last time I ran him, he had somehow knocked the charging station into the middle of the hallway and placed himself where he should have docked... But sideways. Goofy ole uncle Otis.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2020

Review Text: Just got today, couldn't connect to wifi on smartphone. After running for 30 minutes, she says clean brushes, empty, half full, then after running every 5 minutes, voice tells me to empty, clean brushes. Recharged several hours did exact same thing. Does not clean thoroughly, sweeps over dirt, does not pick up. So far 1 day very disappointed. Will give several more tries, and will return and buy other brand.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019

Review Text: This type of vacumn did not work for me. My house is an avg size Ranch house,but my rooms are smaller. I have too much stuff sitting on the floor like plants or wastebaskets. You have to have a clear space with electric cords not hanging down from sockets. It kept going into corners&getting stuck&sat spinning. It also was not the newest model&did not work with my new 5G network. You need to check details closely. It also does not hold much waste,so it has to be used more times per week to get everything.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020

Review Text: We have a German Shepard who,leaves hair everywhere.  "Robo" helps in keeping the hair at bay.  But within a couple of months stopped returning to the charger,  hard to make charge even after cleaning the charging contacts.  Now cannot get to connect to WiFi.Overall happy, but can see having to replace every 2 years or so.  I guess that since it runs every day that is almost acceptable.  Before we had a no name robot vac.  Lasted about 5 months cost close to the same, so overall the Roomba unit is better.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019

Review Text: I got my Roomba to help manage my cat’s hair and his habit of tracking litter about the house. In that, the Roomba does really well, especially using the app to keep it on a schedule through the week so it gets a quick cleaning in while I’m at work. However, I will admit that there are some issues.It’s not the most powerful vacuum out there. If you’re expecting a deep cleaning every time the Roomba starts up, I think you’re going to be disappointed. Also, yes, the Roomba will occasionally get stuck. I’ve gotten notifications that he’s fallen off a cliff, gotten stuck, gobbled up something he shouldn’t have, etc. Some of this is on me, and I forgot to pick up a cable or napkin or what have you. Some of it is my furniture and my Roomba will find a way underneath and then not be able to get out. Also, he does bang into everything, that’s just what Roomba’s do as they clean. If you’re worried about marks on furniture, that’s something to be aware of. I’ve found that a soft foam strip on the bumper will solve the bumping problem, and the iRobot Virtual Wall kits will help keep the Roomba away from areas that he might get stuck in. Is that an added expense? Sure. Is it a deal breaker? I don’t think so, especially since a self mapping Roomba 960 is over $500 and the Virtual Wall kits are about $35 a pop.If you’re expecting your Roomba to keep your home completely spotless and never get hung up on something, I can say at the very least this isn’t the Roomba for you. If you’re willing to get a Roomba that will do fine maintenance cleanings with relatively few problems, and be willing to do a deeper vacuuming once in a while and/or set up some virtual walls to manage issues here and there, this one will do you fine.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2019

Review Text: This has got to be a case of a company degrading their product via firmware updates.  This iRobot worked perfectly when we first got it.  Before an update about a year ago, it would always clean in a zig-zag motion, since one of the firmware updates it constantly wants to do circles.  I have checked all the sensors, cleaned the unit thoroughly, it is something in the firmware that they changed the pattern.  Please IROBOT if you are viewing this change it back to the zig-zag pattern, the circle pattern DOES NOT WORK.  It is consistently getting stuck in corners and smaller areas now.  I do not recommend an IROBOT product, buyer beware!  If they fix this problem in the next firmware I may change my rating.  Please let others know if they have the same issue.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020

Review Text: Well to start off what I like about the vacuum is that it is compact and has good suction for it size. But the negative just outweigh the positives. So what I dislike about is that it constantly gets stuck on every little thing. Second for cleaning it does not do a good clean I had a Chinese brand which was a few bucks more but he did such an amazing job that he would not mess a lot of dirt and pieces. The last thing that I dislike about it is how fast it goes with disregards to sensing what’s around and so it will get scratched at the top very fast just by getting underneath cabinets and other items because ages rams into items in your house. I don’t write many reviews but I feel like I had to write this review I was deeply disappointed with this purchase and will be returning this item maybe I can try one out there better models which are twice or three times the price but that defeats the point of having an affordable robotic vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2020

Review Text: Here’s the thing - I cleans under stuff. Under the bed, under the dresser, under the TV stand. I like that. Is it perfect? not close. Is it well worth $150? Yep. Are you going to get highly annoyed at it missing a pile of dirt just for it to find that pile 30 mins later? Yep.I got this because I have a cat and a toddler who manage to destroy my floor every day & my toddler hates when there is any piece of dirt on her feet so having help keeping the floors clean is a life saver.This robot will get stuck if you don’t make a few adjustments around your house before you set it to work. This allows you to be a certain level of lazy but not completely teenager level lazy.If you’re neurotic about your floors and think this is going to make them spotless, get a more expensive version.This is perfect for an average person who wants to keep dirt off their bare feet and dust from accumulating in the corners and under stuff.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2021

Review Text: While I don't technically need a smart vacuum I didn't realize how much I want one until purchasing this. It works better than my old vacuum and I don't have to do anything but get out of the way, usually. Had I known how much I would love it I would have sprung for one that empties itself and doesn't seem to randomly bounce off my walls, it hits every spot though.I've only used it about ten times and it seems fantastic so far but I am a single person with no kids or pets so I don't have much to clean up. My only issues that I didn't know about before purchasing are minor and some are specific to my household:1. One time it wasn't able to find it's way back to the charging station before it died. My apartment is narrow with a bunch of turns and it got stuck on the wrong side for too long near the end. 2. It is probably capable of climbing on my bathroom floor mat but the sensor doesn't allow it to. 3. I've had some issues using the scheduler on the app. It changed PM to AM on the schedules I've tried to save so far, I was able to change them again to get them to save as PM though. It is also weird that you have to set a time for each specific weekday and can't do a recurring event like daily or every other day. 4. My refrigerator is just the right height that it can get a little bit underneath it but one time it got stuck when trying to turn back out.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020

Review Text: I'm sure the reviews don't lie as to the quality of this item, but be aware "cliff" sensors which prevent it from going over stairs are designed to reflect off any surface that isn't black. If you have black tile, marble etc, the roomba WILL STOP dead in its tracks. Also, if you have a filtered router, it also won't work/run using your home internet because you can't get it verified/recognized into your home internet in order to program it unless you obtain its MAC address.  It can work/run manually if you press the  CLEAN button. The Biggest disadvantage or problem not mentioned by Roomba (I found out through Google reviews), is this vac won't run on black tile or very dark floors, and/or black rugs (even the outdoor type that's very thin).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2020

Review Text: OMG! How did I live without my little bot? So one thing I need to state right off the bat is how easy this was to set up! It practically set up itself! I ordered a different one first and battled it for hours, I felt kind of like I was in the new Griswalds meet the Jetsons movie. Hysterical if you're watching, not so fun if you are actually battling the robot. Anyway after messing with it until the wee hours of the night... I sent the little jerk back and ordered this one. I really wish more people would have stated how easy this little gem is to set up! Took me 10 minutes!!!! If anyone out there is NOT a techie, this one is for you!I sent it to work and I thought I lost it under the couch, but it was okay, I'm hoping I dont have to keep emptying it as often once it gets all the hard to reach places. Even so, I'm in love with this little guy... I have a Golden Retriever and a Ragdoll cat. So plenty of hair, it never complained.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2020

Review Text: Wall-E is headed to the Island of Misfit Tools...  Apparently he has suffered brain damage from crashing into things and now just wants to clean the same area 8 or 10 times to really make sure it's clean, really clean...  Then after several Amber Alerts he's found stuck under the dining room table mumbling "It's four o'clock, time for Whapner"...  From the movie Rainman...But I did give him a 3 star for effort...  It's kinda like a participation trophy...We've upgraded to Wall-E's big brother, the 960...  Walter...  He hasn't arrived as yet..
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019

Review Text: Bought this for myself for my birthday in Dec 2019. In Oct of 2020 it still works so well. We run it 5 days a week in the mornings in the main part of our home and close it in bedrooms of an evening while we are eating dinner. Make sure you empty after every use and it will pick up all sorts of muck in your house. We have a 3 & 1/2 year old child that loves ‘Rosie’ as well as a yellow lab and an American short haired cat. Between the 5 of us, we make a MESS and I’m so glad we can easily vacuum daily with our busy work, school and general schedules.

Review Text: the bad:It cannot find it's way back to the dock-everIt gets stuck on rugsIt is noisy as heck- very loudIt gets stuck under counters all the time (which might be way there are so many ones for sale with damaged tops)does not really detect dirtThe good:picks up dirt, crumbs, pet hair really well when it finds itcan go for 90 minutes when it does not get stuck (which is does all but one time so far)its fun to have and helps a great dealthe floors look great when it is doneworks best if closed in a room until it is clean, then moved to the next otherwise wanders endlessly sometimes in the same patterns without deviations (running the battery down and shutting off)The videos made me think this one was one that mops and does other things but this model is basic.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020

Review Text: There are good things about this product.  It's powerful and can roll over most everything.  It does a deep cleaning (at least at the beginning).  Excellent for cat hair.BUT ... It is LOUD!  It gets clogged with debris/hair around the rollers and wheels.  I've cleaned this up many times.  I've become nearly an expert at vacuum repair.  However, as time goes on, it loses suction.  Unforgivable on our hardwood.  Still does better on the carpet.  It also knocks into things with a huge amount of force which could knock things over.  Also, the algorithm for it cleaning multiple rooms isn't very good.  Ours seems to have a preference for certain rooms with few obstacles and leaves rooms with obstacles with untouched areas (kitchen with island, dining room with table and chairs).  Jeez, this is where the mess is!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   Well, I sure like the idea of a robot vacuuming for me but I have 3 dogs and 3 cats so I get a fair amount of pet hair in a weeks time. I have all vinyl flooring except an area rug in the living room and a few rugs at the doors. What I saw was the robot picks up some of the hair and dirt that is not blown around by the robot but it got itself stuck under a piece of furniture and could not get back up on the rug which is a large, 10'x 14', synthetic, short fiber carpet with no padding under it. When I did get it to vacuum some of the carpet it left the area still looking like it needed to be vacuumed. I bought the 675 and was told I probably needed the 960 but I don't want to pay over $500. for a vacuum so I am returning to doing it myself
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2019

Review Text: Update* After further review and science experiments, I have come to the conclusion my roomba is half tarded. It's kinda like my kids,  gets in the way,  takes forever to clean and does a half @** job.  I've tried to reason with it and lecturing it,  I even guide it to where it needs to clean.  But unfortunately I bought the special needs roomba and I don't have the means or patience to deal with something like that.I believe my Roomba is dumb. This thing takesforever to clean. This thing wants to go in the same spots over and over and over again and just keep bumping walls. I got this because I've heard a lot about it and I have a dog and kids and thought this will help with some of the cleaning. But it's really dumb and takes way to long. I'll just do the cleaning. I think I may fire roomba
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018

Review Text: I bought this as a replacement to my original roomba. Which is now 9 years old. It's in no way of the same quality. It doesn't get in the corners. The roller and brush are flimsy, sparse and very cheaply made by comparison.  Leaves lots of debris on floors.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018

Review Text: We have a blind dog and so far, from two cleanings, I am pretty sure if we attached a vaccuum to him and let him wander around the house, it would probably be a lot like watching the roomba work.
