Lots of seeming aimlessness and bumping into things.  The roomba is also kind of loud.  Not unpleasantly so but is louder than I imagined.  And so far, during both cleanings the roomba has gotten caught up on the legs of our recliner which is apparently what it imagines hanging off a cliff to be like because that is the error message I get.  Now.  Let me tell you why you should ignore all that and buy this anyway.Now, I don't want to overstate this but basically, 'The Tiger King' on Netflix changed our life.  Our 13 year old daughter just randomly now blames EVERYTHING on Carole Baskin.  So, when we got the Roomba, she was DELIGHTED to know we could name it.  Guess what she named it? Yep.  Now, "...that b*tch, Carole Baskin" doesn't fit in the spaces allowed so we did have to settle for "Carole Baskin".  This name was chosen because we have four cats and "Carole"  just goes around cleaning up cat hair.This is important because when you setup your Roomba, you need to download an app so you can schedule, name and manage your Roomba.  When your Roomba gets "caught up on a cliff" like recliner legs in our case, your app will alert you that your Roomba requires assistance.  For example, my alerts look something like, "Carole Baskin is caught on a cliff.  Please relocate Carole Baskin..."My daughter HOWLS over this.At this point, being in quarantine and in a home that takes that VERY seriously, if this thing did not work for crap, I would still give it a 5 star rating. The hilarity and entertainment is just worth the money at this point, honestly.However, that being said, "Carole" works AMAZINGLY well.  As I said, four cats across approximately 1,500 sq. ft. of our first floor (of a 2 story home) 24-7 is a lot to keep up with and I routinely feel overwhelmed by the upkeep.  Our floors are SO clean!  I could not be more impressed at this point.Corners, edges, all of it... it's the best money I have spent in a long time which is saying something.  Being in quarantine, I have made some interesting purchases so far including a woodburning kit. I don't have wood, guys.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020

Review Text: This product has absolutely outdone any idea of  what I hoped it could actually do! I have three kids two dogs and a cat plus a husband and three nephews that are here every day in and out of the house. I cannot believe how much this has helped me. I have a bad back so I have to rely on the kids to clean the floor which, if you can imagine,they are not so happy to do. Now I only have to nag them every once in a while. Mostly for the bathrooms because it obviously doesn’t fit arounthe toilet. Is there a mini version?!My downstairs is all ceramic tile with five big area rugs. It has gotten caught under the TV stand a couple of times but that’s it most of all it just does it’s thing and keeps it very clean. I hope this is helpful.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2018

Review Text: I was a little hesitant to go this route but needed something for general pet hair clean-up as we have 3 dogs, 2 of which are 75+ lbs. Although they each have fine, thin hair - they tend to shed quite a bit. "Rosie" does everything we expected her to do! We have mostly tile and hardwood floors throughout and she cruises through rooms and over general rugs such as bathmats and area rugs with ease. She's "learning". Day 1 she had her work cut over for her. We found she got tangled up in our floor-length curtains, but to be fair, they do gather a bit on the floor. Not her fault. The first day she made it back to her docking station w/out issue; day 2+ we haven't been as successful as her battery died before she made the full return trip. I personally don't mind; I have to seek her out to empty the bin anyway. But each day she is scheduled to run, the bin is full when the cycle is complete. It's almost conerning how much is picked up by "Rosie" on a regular basis.  You do need to apply some common sense and manage your expectations. She's not a housekeeper. If objects are left on the floor, such as shoes, toys, etc. she's going to clean around them. If cables or wires are hanging loose along the walls or across floors, there's a good chance she's going to get caught up in them. Overall, we're happy witht the purchase.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2019

Review Text: I tried many no name brands and decided to upgrade to a roomba. First day and it got stuck between two table legs spinning. It also kept trying to take the base when returning home.Robot 1: Exchanged because it keep giving then error 14 even when docked and not in use. Kept wedging itself under areas lower than the vacuum.Robot 2: Keeps getting suck on the dock and trying to drag it away. Kept wedging itself under areas lower than the vacuum. Even added the rubber bumpers to stop wedging. It still forces itself in tight areas.UPDATE: Amazon would not send a new replacement so I tried my best to make it work. I was able to wedge proof my house. Now, there’s a 50% chance it won’t dock correctly. It’s on a flat surfaceGarbage product. Will be returning.UPDATE: Decided to keep and hope I could make it work. This is by far the worst product. It can never find the dock even if in an open spot. The tray is never detected. The cheap plastic cover over the brushes broke. It can’t go over dark carpets. It gets wedged everywhere. DO NOT BUY
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2019

Review Text: It does exactly what it says it is going to do. Was super easy to program and just let it go. It re docks itself, cleans my floors (about 900 square feet with 2 carpeted areas, linoleum, and hardwood), and while it is a little noisy it isn't enough to wake me up (I programmed it to clean at midnight).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2018

Review Text: Awesome product - I would echo most of the positive comments on the 4 and 5 star reviews here. We have a large house with mostly hardwood floors and this product is perfect for it. HOWEVER - on the third cycle after purchase, the machine got hung up on some cords under a piece of furniture. Simple enough, just lift it out to a clear area and restart right? Well no matter what I do I cannot get it to clear Error Code 1. I’ve followed all the troubleshooting steps, taken the wheels out, cleaned all the main nooks and crannies and brushes... no luck. Even tried factory rest. It just keeps telling me to put it back on a clean flat surface and hit the start button. I put a call into customer support. If they help me fix the unit satisfactorily I will likely make this a 4 or 5 star review.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018

Review Text: Disclaimer: I bought this model, 675, with my own money and these are my honest opinions.I've never owned one of these and literally bought it on a whim. I was initially looking at a cheaper Eufy brand vacuum because I trust its parent company (Anker), but once I saw that iRobot had Alexa enabled and app integrated robots I went for this one. A lot of my house consists of smart devices so it only made sense.The Alexa integration was very simple. Just download the app, log into your wifi, and the Roomba connects very easily. Then you just have to enable the iRobot Home skill in your Alexa app. I had trouble figuring out the appropriate commands but just google search "roomba alexa comands" to find them. Once you set up scheduled cleaning in the iRobot app you don't have to control it through Alexa very often unless you want to do multiple cleanings in a day.I placed the dock appropriately, following spacial instructions, and charged the robot for about an hour. The instructions say 3 hours initially but I checked the app and it was fully charged. The Roomba responds very quickly to the app and it started cleaning right when I tapped "Clean" on the app. It moves very randomly and can seem to get stuck for a bit but it usually finds its way. I have an area rug with dark brown/black sections that I wasn't worried about but it will not pass over them because it assumes they're "cliffs." I'm grateful for the "cliff protection" feature and can live with this hiccup, just beware if you have black rugs. I have others that are solid chocolate brown and it passes over those just fine.I was frustrated that it wouldn't return to base the first couple times, but that's because I moved it manually because it couldn't find its way out from under my dining table and I was inpatient. IF YOU MOVE IT DURING CLEANING IT CAN'T FIND THE BASE. It will only find its way back to the dock it it starts there and is left uninterrupted. Occasionally it will actually get stuck and it will turn off and chime some tones to get your attention. You also get a notification on your phone to go help it. The only times it's gotten really stuck was on the edge of a really high pile shag rug (which is warned against in the instructions) and when it wedged under a headboard that was just the perfect height to pin it to the ground.Some have said it sucks up cords but I keep my cords/electronics VERY tidy so its not an issue for me. Emptying the bin is very easy, and it filled up really quickly the first few runs, which is expected. Its kind of gross how much it captures in my house because I keep it very clean as it is. It was able to pick up standard clay cat litter fairly well. Toward the end of its cleaning cycle when the bin and filter were more obstructed it didn't always capture the litter though, which is what you'd expect. It did bump into my cats' food and water bowls and push them around a bit. It worries me a little that water may spill if I'm not there to monitor it. I've ordered a "iRobot Dual Mode Virtual Wall Barrier (Renewed)" that i'll put in "Lighthouse" mode to fix that (the renewed model is half the price of a new one so I'm giving it a shot. it has a 90 day amazon guarantee).Overall I love this thing and it's only been 2 days. It's very convenient to be able to schedule cleaning when your away at work, or if you are expecting company and have other things to prepare. I think my Roomba will continue to serve me well. If any glaring issues come up I'll update this review as needed.UPDATE 9/19/19I still love the thing. I ordered some white felt tape and put that over the black borders of my trouble rug under my couches so it seamlessly travels over those areas. I also ordered 8 2" risers for my couch and loveseat because they were just barely too low for the roomba. The iRobot virtual walls (Renewed) are a life saver. I have 3 of them now, one to protect the cat food bowls, one to block off the dining room (it gets caught in the chair legs forever and would rather it spend time in other areas), and one to block off a room with a high pile shag rug.I've officially "roomba-proofed" my house and I have it clean everyday while I'm at work and I havent gotten a "Roomba is stuck" notification since. I love this thing and highly recommend it as long as you have REALISTIC EXPECTATIONS and READ THE INSTRUCTIONS.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2019

Review Text: The product is very good. The set up was very simple and quick. The app (which is used to control) is good as well. There is no problem at all as such with the product...... but if you have a large room (or set of rooms) it doesn't reach where it needs attention. It may not go to the particular spot which needs attention for 30-40 minutes...or it may not even reach there at all unless you manually take it there. Then it misses the point of cleaning entirely in my opinion.  It is good cleaning machine when everything is kind of "okay clean" in the first place or just as a weekly cleaning with a  a cool robotic cleaning machine that can be controlled by app.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020

Review Text: GO TO VACUUM WARS ON YOUTUBE FOR IN DEPTH REVIEWS:A robot vacuum is only as good as the person and place it is being used. I bought one after much research because I wanted one that was cheap, but would clean German Shepherd hair and Cat Litter off of hard wood floors. I would love to afford a $1400 model or even a $500 competitor model with LIDAR guidance. $200 is what I picked up this model for.I let the roomba clean one room at a time. After each room, I clean it out. I remove all the hair and debris that I can. The newer, smarter roombas, also had a brush redesign. They use two rubber brushes. The model here and the one I got has one rubber brush and one bristle brush.The dog hair is picked up very well and gets everywhere. In the brushes, the wheels , etc. I was not bothered by this. It is easy to remove. I take the dog brush I got, brush the bristle brush, and the hair comes right off. Roomba makes a tool but any pet hair brush does the same thing.I live in a dusty area as well. It is amazing how much dirt and debris the Roomba picks up, that you can't see. I've been more than thrilled. You may have to do some slight cleaning around the edges of the room if you are a super clean freak. I've never let the Roomba run until it has run out of battery. It goes to the dock automatically before it does. Or it is suppose to.I was happy how easily it navigated over wires. I prefer to pickup all wires or block off areas to them. I block access to other rooms with trash cans or chairs. Doesn't need a heavy object. If the roomba touches something it turns around. No need to buy the virtual barriers.If you're expecting to buy this, drop it in your nasty house, and work miracles... it won't happen. You need to do some prep work and then the Roomba will maintain it with regular use.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020

Review Text: I bought this hoping it would add more convenience to my life. But its very annoying to operate.First just setting it up is a pain. The registration and connection process is slow and glitchy. If you registered a TV or game console or cell phone you might think setting up a cleaning robot is no big deal. Its actually much harder. The app also asks for your location. I don't think that's necessary.Secondly its very annoying to watch it clean. I had the impression that the roomba had some sort of radar or memory so it would actually clean up on a grid system. It does not. It bounces from wall to wall cleaning the same area over and over. It seems to purposely do things to annoy you like take a left to clean the same part of the room rather than a right to get into the dirty corner. Also it does not seemlessly move around obstacles. The roomba easily gets it self stuck under a chair or in a corner and just bounces around for twenty minutes.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020

Review Text: It's a pretty noisy and disruptive cleaning experience. It clatters into walls, gets stuck on door jams, tangles up in wires, knocks over pet food bowls. I have to rescue it half a dozen times every time it cleans and it has no system intelligence to avoid repeating the same mistake it just made. I've had to pull it out from under my Christmas tree only for it to spend the next half hour repeatedly going back under it. If there is a right way to go that is clear of debris it will repeatedly go right back for the wall or the wires or the cliff. It chooses to hit things I swear.It does clean, but slowly and inefficiently and it'll miss spots while cleaning one spot 5 times over.I've seen the competition at other people's homes and I'd recommend the Shark Ion over this. The shark stops before hitting walls and is much quieter and does a better job.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2020

Review Text: We bought a new model and when we opened it up it looked like it was refurbished. A lot of scratching along the front bumper and we could see lent/hair/dist on the bottom side of this machine. When we picked it up a chunk of lent fell out of it. Definitely not new and was very disappointed hoping to exchange it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2019

Review Text: I bought 2 of these in 2019 (it is now June 2020) - one for my household and a second for a gift for my parents.  As always, both worked great in the beginning.  Great suction for our dogs double coated fur.  Now, a year later both have stopped charging as of a couple of months ago.  I have wiped down the charging ports, attempted to plug it into different outlets, and several other trouble start methods without any luck.  I would not recommend this model.However, strange thing my 2015 model is a work horse and still going.  The more recent roomba’s, not so much.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020

Review Text: This is not the 'top of the line' model, if fact, it's the lower end model. But I bought this because I have a dog with a 'blow coat's, and it is everything I could want. I set it to clean everyday at a certain time and it faithfully cleans every floor in my house. The thing is, you have to understand that the commercials you see on TV are for the higher end models. This one cleans randomly. It does not clean in straight paths. So it get's kind of lost at times. I cleans my laminate floor in my kitchen about 3 times daily. But for a low end model, I have to say it does a great job. I have osteoarthritis and can't handle the heave electrolux that I bought years ago. So this little gem is a blessing. No more dog hair everywhere. I named mine Myrtie after my great aunt who was a clean freak. She would be proud of the job this thing does. She might get a little lost at times, but she gets the job done!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2021

Review Text: We mainly have hardwood floors with one area rug and mats by the doors and kitchen sink. We have three dogs which is the main reason we got this. Our area rug has fringe/tassels. Have owned since Nov 2018Pros: can schedule it to run in the middle of the day or night depending on your preference.Set up is easy.Connects to WiFiCons: could not keep up with the high demands of being a home with pets.Got caught in the rug constantly.Didn’t have any type of pattern of where it went.Had to replace the battery in sept 2019 (11 months after purchase - it kept running at shorter and shorter intervals)Not able to map out the floors and program to run in specific rooms like other newer models.Had to replace the brushes.We just upgraded to a different brand (Neato) at a higher price for several reasons including being able to manage the dog hair and higher volume we require. Also this maps put the floors so we can schedule to prioritize and run in certain areas first.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019

Review Text: OK... so if you know that it works like a ping pong ball, then you understand, that it isn't smart. But the algorithm is pretty effective, and though it wont get every inch every time, you keep emptying the dirt that you didn't have to look for, and after the job, the house looks picked up. We have 1.7K square feet of hardwood floors , and if you don't keep up with it, it will show crumbs and dog hair. The best use, is the dust bunnies underneath the bed. Yes you can buy cheaper, but if you have to get maintenance parts, getting a Roomba is the way to go. If you're the overly picky get the more expensive mapping model you can order into different rooms, or self empty. This model takes a bit of stewardship, to plan for the job, pick up throw rugs, and anything that will bind it. If you have a maze of a house, you need to limit it's running area, or pause and pick it up. If you have an open concept with fewer obstacles, you'll have the best results.  If you want one and don't take care of your stuff, buy cheaper competitors. This model works as advertised. One problem with the base and docking is that the tires will get glazed with dust, and you need to wipe them occasionally. Another suggestion is to put sponge or "Magic Eraser" behind the dock, to absorb the push and reduce side-ward motion. We have a Persian cat, and you must clean the rollers and the ball roller in the front. It's easy enough to do, but no robot is impervious to pet hair,  if you are buying it to pickup after your long haired animal, you will have more maintenance, or you will have all sorts of running issues, and battery life issues (because the hair binds the wheels) People expect R2D2, and it ain't that.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2019

Review Text: For the record, I almost never leave reviews, but I couldn’t sleep at night without warning others about this device. I wouldn’t recommend this vacuum to my worst enemy. I don’t have anything positive to say other than it does “ok” with sweeping/vacuuming the floor. We had a Shark robot vacuum before and we will be going back to Shark when this Roomba dies or I murder it in cold blood... whichever happens first (likely the latter)!  It’s extremely loud... like you can’t have it in the same room if you’re planning to talk, watch tv, listen to music, nap, Jack hammer, whatever... it’s REALLY LOUD. If you value the look of your furniture, this ones not for you. The robot smashes into the legs on the furniture, slowly chipping away at the wood, like an axe to a tree. It has ripped the wood floor transition pieces off (more than once) that are liquid nailed to the subfloor. Roomba gets stuck multiple times during its cleaning cycle, cannot find the dock on its own and often doesn’t charge, even when hand placed on the dock. Would I recommend... hard no!This thing is likely to become a moving target for practice while I exercise my 2nd amendment right.A much cheaper Shark robot blew this Roomba away. STAY AWAY from this vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2021

Review Text: The product does a decent enough job as far as vacuuming is concerned.  The app worked well and paired with the robot easily.  It's mapping doesn't seem very efficient, missing the same spots time after time.  I noticed that it would run over it's own home base during every clean cycle and the unit would simply stop in the middle of whatever it was doing after about an hour and a half.  When asked to dock, the unit either wouldn't, or it would roll over to the home base, run it over, then take off in a random direction.I talked to iRobot support, which was incredibly helpful.  They responded by email quickly and walked me through as many steps as possible to resolve the issue.  They then requested a phone call, which was quick and very helpful.  They used a neat streaming feature to watch what the unit would do when asked to dock.  Without much hassle, they sent me a new base unit very quickly (1 or 2 days later).  Unfortunately, the problem continued unchanged, even after performing a factory reset.Given that my concern seems pretty common, and issues like the inefficient mapping (if it was mapping the room at all, given that it would run over it's own base), I decided to return the unit to purchase a different one from another reputable company.I've used iRobot Roombas before, but they were all older units.  When I'm in the market for a higher end model, I would definitely consider another iRobot, but I can't recommend this one.  +1 star for excellent customer support.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2020

Review Text: The time spent cleaning out the dust trap and taking hair off of the brushes is so time consuming. If you don’t clean the brushes each session you won’t get a good clean, the brushes are not sturdy enough to maintain their shape with hair on them. This is a cute gadget that will pick up surface things for about 120 days then it no longer even does that. The side brush, which is critical for edging around hardwood floors, stopped working. This makes the floor look like it was never vacuumed. The carpet has a nice pattern making it appear clean. When I ran my real vacuum over it after a session my real vacuum filled with dirt and dust. It is good for surface light cleaning but I don’t think it’s meant to take the place of your vacuum. Not worth it for how much it cost! You still have to vacuum for real.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020

Review Text: The concept is great - why not have a robot sweep for you daily? The issue with this is, if you have a bigger house/area that needs cleaning, it’s so inefficient and does such a poor job of covering/cleaning the entire area that it’s counterintuitive.I found myself having to stop it and put it back on my area rugs over and over again. Instead of going in a logical pattern to clean the area, it goes in a straight line right off the area rug, and continually navigates to a small hallway area (3x5 feet) by my garage and will stay there for like 15 min. It will then come out, only to go back and stay there for another 10 min.The whole purpose of this product is to not have to worry about cleaning, and I found myself spending more time moving it to areas I actually needed cleaning than if I just cleaned the area myself.Save yourself $270 and buy a broom or a much less expensive vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020

Review Text: “Roberta” has her moments. On carpet it does very well, on hard wood not so much. It tends to leave stuff behind, will go over little messes and not pick up and single thing. One thing about it is it’s great at picking up pet hair. It has a tendency to go in circles or hit up the same area multiple times. Not very good at docking itself but it’s super useful that you can control it from the app or through Alexa, I just usually have to manually dock it. It will easily get wrapped up in cords like phone chargers or a sock my 5 year old shoved under his bed. Overall I’d recommend because it does do a decent job and cuts cleaning time in half when you don’t have to manually vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2021

Review Text: The roomba was fine for about a month, except it only went through parts of the house. It got an error saying that the roomba needed to be moved to another location after the first 4 weeks of use and I've not been able to use it since then. We've tried everything to fix this error and it just won't stop showing this error therefor it won't vacuum anymore.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2020

Review Text: Just got my Roomba yesterday and am SO disappointed.  This isn't the newest model, but it had great reviews and I thought it would make my busy life a little easier.  I have a black floral area rug in my kitchen and two black floral accent rugs.  The Roomba will not clean these, and after reading about the error message I'm receiving have discovered that it thinks dark floors are drop-offs.  There apparently is no solution to this, and the support center recommends simply blocking the area off so that the Roomba can clean everything else.  Would never have bought this if I'd read about this in any of the reviews....in my opinion there isn't much point in using the Roomba (and having paid for it) if I'm going to have to lug out the regular vacuum to finish the job and get the rugs clean (and they need vacuumed the most as they are in the kitchen).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2019

Review Text: Since I got the device i felt something is wrong. The box has already a clear tape around it but I still didn't think something is wrong. I had a chance to use it once before I had to leave home for 3 months but even this one time i felt wrong. I had to guide it to work then when asked it to return to dock it took the wrong direction and kept on working then battery was not charging right. Now when I am back and tried it again it did the same thing most of the time. Very poor performance and not reliable. I tend to believe that this company sold me refurbish as if it is a new device and something was wrong with it. Because I know IRobot is a good device. This is unfortunate because they give the company bad name. I consider not to get another I Robot but EcoVac instead.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2019

Review Text: I have two robot vacuums running daily in this joint (lots of sq.footage). I bought two different brands because I didn’t want there to be a docking issue, etc., or so Hubby thinks.  I secretly just wanted to compare them.Anyhow here’s my take:Shark will go anywhere (including black cushion mat in kitchen)at 100mi /hr and is quiet. Bounces around like a pinball and sometimes needs help finding his dock. He’s the ADHD one of the two.Roomba is louder, but seems smarter. Follows the edges of room/furniture, seems more thorough and picks up really well.  Roomba thinks he’s gonna fall off a cliff with black mats/rugs.I would recommend Roomba if you’re only buying one. I think they compliment each other well. Daughter has named them Wall E and Eva. Dogs Hate them.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2020

Review Text: I purchased this Roomba in 2019 after a recommendation. I hoped I would love it but I don’t.First, it is very noisy!!! I try to run it when I am out of the house bc of how loud it is.It is ALWAYS getting stuck. I run it daily and it gets stuck at least 5/7 days.It gets stuck under random things...under my couch, under my table, under the dishwasher, under the fridge.It also doesn’t like dark rugs. I have dark brown door mats on top of my oak colored floors, it will stop working bc it thinks it’s going to “ fall off a cliff”Now the positive.  It has great suction. I have a golden retriever and it picks up all his hair and dirt that he tracks in.I am looking at buying a different brand that’s maybe thinner and won’t get stuck as much.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2021

Review Text: My old Roomba gave out after many years. I decided to buy the 675 after reading so many good reviews. I have to admit i was looking for a remote until i go smarter and figured out it was an app on my phone, I’m old! It was easy to get the app and set it up with our wireless. I patiently let it charge for three hours as instructed. Then it ran for 90 minutes just like it said it would.  I was so pleasantly surprised because my old one would not run more than 30 minutes even when the battery was new. I just got it today so all i can say is so far so good.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2020

Review Text: I dreamed of owning a Roomba since I first saw one. Finally, I decided I would trade the suction and cleaning power of a real vacuum for the convenience of the Roomba. Unfortunately, it's the most useless piece of garbage on Earth. It cannot even finish a cleaning cycle.Oh, don't get me wrong. It often thinks it does. Because it's useless. Right now it thinks it has finished the job, because it's done most of my bedroom. The rest of the apartment is up to me, I suppose.This may be because of how difficult it is for the Roomba to actually do any cleaning. Originally, the plan was that I could take the dog for walks while Roomba cleans. But that's not possible because about every 90 seconds I need to move it. Roomba thinks it's near a cliff. It's not. Usually it's just sitting on hardwood floor. One time there was a small, half centimeter bump in the rug. That was Kilimanjaro to this useless robot.Now, you may be thinking "I'm sure his cleaning needs are much more than mine." Oh, but they're probably not. I have a 700 square foot apartment with no steps, and only a small carpet and one rug. Roomba still can't clean my place.Reluctantly, I gave my dream purchase one star. I gave it a second star because if the geniuses behind iRobot are any indication, we will never have to worry about robots taking over the world.UPDATE: I've included photos of things that are too difficult for Roomba to handle. Both of these Roomba could not handle as it was "near a cliff" requiring me to manual move it. The former you can clearly see the MASSIVE drop off from the rug to the floor. The second, it's difficult to tell because, yes, it looks perfectly flat, but that's deceiving. There's a slight bump in the rug!! Honestly I don't understand how I don't trip over it constantly. No vacuum, particularly not one that I paid a not insignificant sum for, could possibly handle a slight bump in a rug. I've limited the photos to two of the - no exaggeration - THIRTEEN times Roomba encountered an error on this one area rug and I have to pick it up, move it, and restart. What a great purchase! Thanks, iRobot!SECOND UPDATE: After months of just getting used to how horrible Roomba is, I finally have lowered my review to one star. After painstakingly cleaning my area rug by hand, I have returned it's vibrant black color which it had lost due to dust and dirt and doghair. Now, Roomba can't cross it! Apparently, the darkness makes its sensors think it's a cliff. iRobot's helpful solution is to purchase virtual walls from them so Roomba won't go on my rug. Yes, that's correct. They want me to give them MORE MONEY so that their vacuum won't even attempt to vacuum.I've been an adult for 20 years, and have bought a lot of stuff. I've bought a lot of great things. I've bought a lot of mediocre things. And I've bought a lot of useless crap. I have NEVER bought anything I hate more than the iRobot Roomba. It is, easily, the worst piece of electronics I've ever owned. The used Betamax tape player I had as a kid was more advanced. I suppose you could buy one for someone you desperately hate in the most passive aggressive move ever. Otherwise, I don't know why anyone would ever buy this.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020

Review Text: My disappointed, honest, venting reviewWorks well, if this is your first auto vacuum...My old ecovac deebot n79 BLOWS this out of the waterHeres whyThe 675 CONSTANTLY gets stuck!It gives up and sends alerts after 2/3 triesWhile the ecovac will keep at it untill free and has never asked me for helpOn the same topic, i have a 3/4” thick high pile grey area rug very common in most people’s homes, the n79 will back itself right up onto it. The irobot fails to shimmy itself onto it, let alone START on it. because the front wheel burrows itself into the shag and tricks the poorly placed sensors into thinking its on a “cliff”CostSee for yourself i can buy two n79’s for the same price...NOISESpecs rate the irobot two 2DB. Lower than the ecovac. That may be true but, the irobot makes a morbid grinding high pitch nuisance from the drivetrain whilst the ecovac makes an even somewhat soothing white noise humFiltrationThe n79 has overall three filters including a washable prefilter that keeps the 2nd and 3rd stage cleaner, thus not having to buy a stockpile of filters for the yearThe irobot 675 has one... crappy barely cleanable coffee filter like piece of paper.This is why the irobot has better suction and cleaning power spec wise because it is basically unrestricted airflow.A couple of other quick things-volumeThe irobot doesnt stfu its constantly talking and beeps at fire alarm level VolumeThe ecovac beeps at a moderate volume at start and that’s itThe only pros i have on the irobot wheel/motor assembly are replaceable.Assumably longer lifespanruntime and cleaning power are better on the irobot.. but personally who cares its an auto vacuum im going to be running it 24/7 therefor its eventually going to clean everything
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019

Review Text: The quality and function of the unit was great and I would recommend it, if you don't have black in your carpet.We have an oriental rug that covers most of the living room and it has an elaborate pattern where the background is black. Whenever it was on that carpet it would get confused and signal that it "was going to fall off a cliff" and it would stop. I talked to their support and they said there was nothing that could be done. It is strange because we also have a black marble entry (with white flecks) and it didn't get confused there. I think it may have to do with the size of the completely black areas, which are and inch or two all over the carpet.Not all robots get confused, we now use a "eufy BoostIQ RoboVac 11S" and it does not get confused. Maybe it would fall off a cliff however, the house is a single story so we don't know.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2020

Review Text: Actually never had a problem even with 5 small dogs in the house hand cleaning.  Hair was a factor but was hoping this would clean up seed from our pet and rescue parrots.  As many birds as we have living in our living room seed hulls and seed on the floor is a common problem.  Yes our birds and dogs all are part of the family, so they are out to socialize with us, although the birds are in or on their cages based on size most of the day.  Found that this works pretty much as well as a standard pet hair vac to clean up most.  She understood how to control it within 2 minutes of my putting the app on her phone.  Dogs and cats leave hair, birds leave lots of seed hulls and seed outside the cage.  Yes I would purchase this again, does it job without question, was impressed with its cleaning up where we were 2 days since we had ran the vacuum.  Well worth the price, it even cleans up under large parrot cages minimizing the need to move them around.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020

Review Text: I purchased this, as you might have guessed, through Amazon Warehouse.  It was listed as being in "very good" condition, in a box that was damaged.  Imagine my surprise when I received this new member of my family filthy and with brushes that were so choked with hair that they couldn't turn.  (The box was trashed too, by the way, and there was no instruction manual or other paperwork enclosed.)  I can only guess that the previous owners of my new family member had owned her for 5 years and made her toil ceaselessly outdoors on their Angora goat farm.  I spent an hour picking hair out of the brushes and wiping the device down.  Judging by the tenacity with which all of the goat hair stuck in the brushes, I suspect that there was bubblegum involved at some point.  It. Was. Gross.  It still is gross.  If this thing vacuums at all I'll be surprised.  I'll update if it does.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2020

Review Text: First I will say that it does a decent enough job for every day cleaning. We have hardwood floors and area rugs, the transitions are good and does a good job. The cons, it does not follow any kind of pattern, it moves randomly from room to room which is very ineffective and inefficient. It rarely finds its way home, we can tell it to dock in the same room as the dock station and it will leave the room ramble about the house, 4 out of 5 times I have to pick it up and set it in front of the dock. It also gets stuck a lot in place you would not expect, like a corner. It just spins until it gives up sometimes. We have the 675 model, if this were the more expensive models I would have returned it by now. I would hope the higher priced models work better. This one would work well in a single room like a bedroom but not great for the living areas.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020

Review Text: OMG i am shocked how much cleaner my carpets are since I got this!!!  I have it set to run 4 nights a week after I go to bed, and it's amazing. Easy to use, easy to empty the bin.  I can pop it in another room, close the door, and it does its thing.  Now they need to invent one that can do stairs and my life is complete.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020

Review Text: Admittedly, I was incredibly skeptical about the cleaning potential of any Roomba product. I felt that just because it was so small, it would lack any kind of suction power. Man was I pleasantly surprised when discovering just how powerful this device turned out to be. There's a good amount of dust that goes completely uncollected and Roomba seems to be have a large amount of dust collected after each and every usage. Makes me wonder if I was breathing this amount of dust the whole day. The only complaint I have is that this specific model acts in a particularly stupid manner. There's a lot of randomness in the way that any given room is cleaned. It's not enough to dissuade me from using the product, but it is something to keep in mind.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2021

Review Text: I did a lot of research before purchasing this model and the main reason I decided on it is because it said it was good for pets. There are quite a few things I do not like about it.Before sucking up the big fuzzies it blows them up in the air or to an area it already went through. It will also do the same area over and over again. Instead of it going along the walls/baseboards it doesn’t continue, it leaves the area and will go across the room. I tried to send it back to “home” it’s docking station and it went around the whole house before I finally picked it up and carried it to the station.I don’t have carpeting so the thing glides along very easily. I pickup all pet toys and electrical wires and I let it go for about 3 hours. The only downside is that it cannot find its way home 😂 and it blows the hair around instead of picking it up.I was very impressed that when I took it upstairs to clean it sensed the edge of the stairs and it turned around.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020

Review Text: I bought this Roomba for my personal training studio - I already have one at home that I LOVE and thought what a help this would be at my work!  I decided to splurge a bit and bought the kind that can connect to Wifi so I could schedule jobs remotely, as well as connect to my Alexa Echo Dot that I already have.This robot is pretty amazing!  Besides the neat tech features, the most important part is how well it cleans.  While it looks quite haphazard in its pattern (which is completely nonexistent that I can see), it picks up a remarkable amount of stuff when I got to empty its little dirt bin!This Roomba is awesome at picking up dust, small particles that people track in front outside, and hair.  I love that I can leave it go while I do other cleaning and know that it is getting most of the nastiness on the floors.  I probably run it close to every day or every other day, so even if it misses a spot or two on one occasion, I know it will get it the next time.I will note that if it bumps into something just above its height that it can't quite fit under, it does have a propensity to get stuck (in which case I get a notification from Roomba letting me know it's stuck or near an edge).  You can get the little walls that help to keep it away from things like this, if necessary.I highly recommend Roomba - your floors will be cleaner than ever!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2019

Review Text: I never knew how much I would need one of these in my life. We have three kids and two dogs. My wife sweeps and vacuums everyday, by the end of the day the floors are dirty and disgusting. This came on sale one day and we had to try it, with her permission of course. We have it setup to clean after we have gone to bed each night because it is quite loud for a robot. Our floors are swept and look clean each morning and now my wife doesn’t have to lose her mind because of the dirt from our little circus. It cleans up all of the dog hair and dust. You do need to be careful not to leave any phone cords on the floor, the robot will get stuck trying to eat it. Kind of looks like a fish on the end of a line. Easier to clean than our vacuum as well.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2021

Review Text: Vacuum does great at cleaning and picking up things other vacuums miss. The problem is the battery only last about 30 minutes instead of the 2.5 hours it says it does. No matter where you put the base the vacuum never is able to make it back to the base and dies randomly when cleaning the floor. Every day we have to pick it up and put it on the base to charge but the other problem is that it almost never charges fully on the base and is super picky about how you put it on the base in order to have it charge. We have cleaned both the base and vacuum several times and the vacuum is almost never able to dock on the base by itself and even if it does dock on the base it almost never is able to charge fully. We are very disappointed in this vacuum for the price.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020

Review Text: This little guy does a good job when you don't have time or just feel like being lazy about cleaning floors. It is quite noisy. Does a good job of cleaning most of the time. Then sometimes it just drives all over the house and miss some of the particles. Also has trouble finding home most of the time. Gets stuck under the couch or loveseat often but no big deal. After a few cleanings you can figure out where it gets stuck at mostly and make adjustments to the area or just block it off. It does pick up a lot of dirt, I was really surprised at how much dirt is hiding in plain site and you can't see it. Overall I think it's worth the purchase. I don't use it daily so it might be better if I did. Good luck!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2019

Review Text: Cleans the floors, wood , tile and carpet .  Any garlic or onions peel cleaned off the kitchen floor, crumbs etc. come home to wall to wall carpeting with that fluffy groomed look that the power carpet head gives on your stand up vacuum.  Cleans the bath mat rug without getting tangled up. Great for pet owners picks up all my long haired cat hair , and any litter granules that are flung out of the box . Gets all the dust from under the bed.  I’m going to find furniture risers so it can go under anything it’s not fitting under now . I can schedule when it cleans from the app on my phone or use the app to start or stop it from anywhere.  The thing cleans then goes back to its dock and charges its self . this  machine will inspire you to de clutter your floor to give the robot free rein to clean where normally shoes, sewing baskets, tote bags or other stuff should be put away and are not. If you have a lot of pets , keep after robot maintenance re brushes and bearings ( pick the hair off) and empty the bin but you have to do that with a regular vacuum cleaner too.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018

Review Text: Got this yesterday for my wife for Christmas (yes.. she asked for it lol). Setup of iRobot home app was a little tricky in regard to getting the phone and roomba connected to WiFi. This roomba ONLY connects to 2.4ghz WiFi for setup. Once it’s set up you can go back to dual 2.4/5.0 WiFi. Spent about an hour trying to figure out why it wouldn’t connect to WiFi and then noticed that the “VPN” setting was turned on on my phone (which will block the roomba / app from initial connection), once I turned this off the roomba setup worked fine. Ran it this morning to see how it worked and what possible trouble spots we’d have for it getting stuck. Flooring is a mix of tile, high and low pile rugs. Roomba handled tile and low pile rugs with no problem. It treated high pile rugs like “obstacles” which is what I hoped for. Took it about an hour to do entire lower level (about 1500sq ft). Didn’t get stuck once and maneuvered through many things I thought would stop it (chair legs, coffee table legs etc) although it takes a while for it to find the way in and out of those spots, it did. It could not find the home base until I moved it closer but I believe that is because of where I have it. I will move it to a more open area and test again. Initial run looks promising. Support for WiFi / app needs more detail.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019

Review Text: While this Roomba does clean when it is running, it uses no logic to decide where it will clean. Ours will try to get under a coffee table over and over until it gets stuck. We move it our from under the table and place it in another area and it will return to the coffee table and get stuck again. This happens over and over, every day until we send it back to the dock. I have cleaned it thoroughly on a regular basis so this is not a sensor issue. We have had this one for a year now and it has reduced the vacuuming that we need to do...as long as it doesn't get stuck, which is not very often.  Some days it comes off the dock and goes straight to the same coffee table or kitchen shelf that it can't go under, tries over and over until it is wedged underneath, and then stops because it is stuck. The 675 has no logic to how it cleans. I have considered buying an I3 but worry that it will have the same issues.  We have two virtual walls that keep it from running out an open slider door and out of the guest rooms. These work fine but I don't want to have to buy 4 or 5 of them to place all around the house where the 675 gets stuck. Just beware if you are not going to use this in a single room with no possible low cabinets or shelves where it can get stuck, it will work fine. If you do have low cabinets, don't use this one.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2021

Review Text: Love, love-love-love my new Roomba! I had a different robot vacuum before but it just couldn't compare to the Roomba brand. First of all, the suction power is much, much stronger. Second, Roomba easily cleans carpets on which my previous robot used to get stuck. It's also great for pet hair (we have two dogs, so you can imagine what it's like here during the shedding season). And the best part, it's easily connected and controlled via SmartHome (Alexa), and can be scheduled to clean through an app - super convenient. I'm sticking with Roomba from now on. I'm officially obsessed and not even sorry. Great vacuum robot!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2021

Review Text: Our children love our new pet "Bobby"!He gets into all sorts of mischief as he aimlessly bumps around the house. He finds all sorts of things like Barbie shoes, hair bows, ponytail bands, floss, pet hair, and more! It's like a virtual treasure trove of random items every time you take him to the trash to poop!He does seem as if he's gotten into the drink on many occasions as he bumbles around and passes out in random locations throughout the house. Sometimes you need to pick him up and tuck him into bed so he can get some rest and recharge to do it all again another day.All things considered, if your looking for an amusing pet who doesn't tear things up or poop and pee on the carpet, this thing is perfect!Hours of fun for you and the kids!Fun tip. Set the timer to have him start in the middle of the night and watch your wife jump up from bed freaking out.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020

Review Text: I have affectionately started referring to this little idiot as “Wido” (get it? Like Fido, but… why though?).It’s dumb. Like… real dumb. It gets stuck on everything (check out the screenshot!) and I’m constantly having to rescue it as it cries out from a distant place in my house. I had to move it from my living room to the bedroom because there were just too many “obstacles” 🙄, but it still manages to get hung up at the top of my stairs EVERY morning.It does it’s job well though. I wish I had spent a little more for a model with room mapping, but… me and Wido are a team now, and I wouldn’t trade the little idiot for anything ♥️
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2021

Review Text: I've had my Roomba for almost a year and really love it however I've had a couple of issues.  It doesn't always go back to the docking station so when it runs out of battery I have to go find it and put it on the docking station.  I had issues with it getting to the station but it doesn't charge so I have to go adjust it so it begins to charge.  The front caster wheel doesn't come off the casing and my dog hair gets all tangled in the actual wheel and I have to spend several mins trying to get the hair out of the wheel.  I wish they made it so the actual wheel comes out of the casing so it easier to clean.  I have 2 dogs that shed a lot so I use it every day, sometimes twice and it does very well picking up all the hair.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2021

Review Text: I ordered this and the Eufy "dumber" robot vacuum on black Friday deals. I expected this one, being more expensive and a recognizable brand, to do better. However, it did not and I kept the other one and retuned this.On hard floors this performed well, but got stuck in spots where the other robot vacuum didn't get stuck, like in my bathroom and under the dining table.I cannot give it more than 1 star or rate it for carpet because it was unable to get from the hard tile floor to our low area rugs, which is a necessity! They're not thick rugs and the other robot vacuum had no issue transitioning between floor types, even though it is smaller and cheaper than this roomba.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020

Review Text: This new robot ("she") has become part of our family and is now called "Ruby" .  I was skeptical about using this type of cleaner (as I am a fanatical cleaner type), but we are all won over.  Now, I only on occasion bring out my small stick vac to get into deep corners where "she" cannot reach.  Also, this being a basic model, one must empty, however this is very simple to accomplish.  I must add we have a medium size, shedding Collie dog, and it pick up so much dog dander and fur one must think how extreme these dogs shed!  Love them both (dog and vacuum)!  Will defiantly replace vac (in the future when needed).  Would encourage folks to purchase one.  PS--my dog is curious, but ignores vac when in motion and only sniffs around the docking station  to see whats up!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2021

Review Text: 8 month update - DON'T BUY THIS ROBOT. I TRULY BELIEVE IT IS A KNOCK OFF. WOULD GIVE 0 STARS IF I COULD. IT DOESN'T SUCK, IT DOESN'T WORK WELL. IT'S GARBAGE. WE'VE EVEN CLEANED IT OUT REALLY WELL AND IT STILL DOESN'T DO WHAT IT SHOULD. IT DIES WITHIN AN HOUR, DOESN'T PROPERLY DOCK ITSELF (YES, WE HAVE CLEANED ALL PARTS TO MAKE SURE NOTHING WAS CAUSING AN ISSUE). IROBOTS CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS OF NO HELP. BASICALLY KEPT SAYING OPERATOR ERROR WITH THE VACUUM NOT WORKING PROPERLY. IT'S GARBAGE, THEY'RE GARBAGE. BY A CORDLESS DYSON INSTEAD. YOU'LL THANK ME LATER.4 month update - I'm not a fan of this particular iRobot. It never stays charged, never docks home, takes at least 45 minutes to find it's docking station and when it does, half the time it rolls over the dock and goes back on it's merry way to find the docker again. It also does a pretty mediocre job at sucking up stuff. I usually still have to sweep.I have wanted a Roomba for a long time as we have dogs & the constant sweeping/vacuuming the hair was getting old. Purchased this and the first 2 (maybe 3) times we used it it worked great; takes a very long time to clean my tiny home. Now, the wheel constantly gets stuck on the rug and jams. So we can't have "Patch" go around while we are not home which is pretty inconvenient. He also has trouble getting back to the dock when cleaning is done. Takes nearly 15 minutes. You'd think for it being a little robot it would memorize where it goes after a couple of times.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2019

Review Text: I was originally rather encouraged by the reviews here that it would pick up cat litter. I'd already vacuumed the room the day before so when I just ran my Roomba for the first time, there wasn't much for it to pick up. Unfortunately, it didn't really clean up any of the little scattered bits of kitty litter. I was really disappointed as this was the entire reason I purchased the Roomba. It also didn't get a small area between a piece of furniture and the wall - which I did set it in directly so knew it would fit. I'll run it a second time and see if it'll get these items on the second pass or not, otherwise this robot is going back.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021

Review Text: This was the worst purchase I have ever made in my entire life, it is completely useless and all the features that were promised not one was delivered!!! What smart mapping ... it just bumps into everything super hard, it even knocked down my plant from a little side table!!I’ve only used it maybe 5 to 7 times and it’s already full of scratches as if it’s many years old. It constantly keeps getting stuck and needs my assistance nonstop it’s actually more work than vacuuming yourself. My husband even made a video of it going right over the litter and not picking up a damn thing, this was such a waste of money...I genuinely don’t know if I’m more sad or disappointed, I really wish the company would see my review and give me a full refund for this horrible experience and it really does pain me to say this because I’ve heard such good things about the Roomba robots
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2020

Review Text: This little guy is so awesome! The first few runs we did were just 45 minutes as the vacuum would get full. I didn’t mind because I knew he would get the little crevices and under furniture that I couldn’t otherwise see. Now that he’s run half a dozen times, he doesn’t fill up as quickly. He keeps all the pet hair out of our house, gets the little rocks that we track in, and more. We are over the MOON with this vacuum. Totally amazing. Totally should have purchased sooner. PS we purchased for our downstairs (apps 1100 square feet) and it works well. Finds its way around without a problem.Edit - 12 runs later (yes we are hooked... one week in) and we are now able to run three cycles on one ‘empty’. He’s finally caught up with our messy floors and made them a DREAM to walk on. Who needs a maid when you have a Roomba :)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020

Review Text: Mighty impressed with my Roomba 675.  I thought we had very clean floors, and when I used the Roomba the first time, the amount of dust it cleaned was unbelievable.  But what really sold me the Toomba was the next day use...  I thought the floor would be clean...  and it picked up half of what was collected the day before.  Mind you, I live in the Caribbean, so open windows are common at home, plus have kids going in and out during the day.  The floor surface feels totally different when walking barefoot afte the Roomba cleanup, similar to when floor is just mopped (ceramic tiles in place).  All in all, very please with the unit, albeit battery life...  can be a tad better.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2019

Review Text: I decided to get the Roomba after my Eufy RoboVac broke, but immediately regret that decision. Firstly the vacuum is so loud, like I can hear it over my noise cancelling headphones loud, and it will clean for over an hour, so if you are in the house, be prepared for that. Secondly, it is really really stupid. iRobot claim it has all these sensors, but it ends up so often just raming itself into places and getting stuck, spinning around and around in the middle of an open room for no reason. I was watching it try and get through a doorway on its last clean and it took 20 minutes for it to figure out that it needs to go through the big gap, not just ram itself into the door frame, turn around, drive back 2 metres and then do the exact same thing. I also have had to just lift it up and put it on its charging dock several times as it spends so long searching for it, despite driving centimetres past the dock several times while it searches. Twice (in the one month I have owned it), it has ran out of battery searching for its home base (its home base is in a clear and open location the middle of my hallway). The Eufy I had previously seemed much smarter than this, and A LOT quieter. I would recommend if you really want a robot vacuum to get a Eufy, or maybe just stick to manual vacuums.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2019

Review Text: I just returned this product and decided to trade it in for one that does self-mapping and hopefully that’ll make me more pleased with it.Pros:-I love the schedule I can create on my app and how I could press “clean” on my phone. I had it clean every Sunday and Wednesday and it would notify me when it was done cleaning or had any issues: such as that it needed to be charged or that it was stuck.-The cleaning was thorough and got my German Shepherd’s long fur out of the carpet, which is amazing.Cons:-The Roomba is very loud and scares my dog and cat as well as wakes everyone from upstairs.-Would get stuck on rugs, curtains, and almost anything laying in the floor.-Has a hard time navigating and can spend up to an hour in one location. Thus, making it die without successfully cleaning the whole area.I’m not entirely disappointed with the product, but think that it could be improved!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2020

Review Text: I returned one already for not charging upon returning to the dock. At first I thought it was because of unlevel floor and tried different surfaces. I had to slip wedges underneath to get a good connection. Now, the current one is doing the same thing and I can't do anything because it's just past the return date. This one never even returns to the dock on its own and I have to fumble with it for 5 minutes to get it to charge.My dad has had a Roomba that works perfectly for two years now. I reasonably assumed that the brand was solid and now question why the quality is so poor from Amazon.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   So I got this robot vacuum for a 500+ ft studio. Obviously the studio has a good number of furniture articles in it. The robot cleans good enough to remove hair and dust, but not without my assistance. I need to remove articles from the surface so that it can do its job. Not super convenient when I was hoping to schedule an auto-cleaning on a daily basis, because every time I have to move the chair, etc. up the coffee table, etc. Nor does it clean the area rug; it gets stuck when it gets accidentally up on the rug and awaits me to put it down. Most importantly... it does not know when to stop cleaning. I let it run its course one day and it ran for 1 hour 49 minutes until it got tangled with a cable. The room is already clean but it doesn't go back to the dock on its own. Perhaps the robot was made with one bedroom plus in mind, so it gets screwed up when it is put to work in a studio. All in all... yes it is better to have a robot to clean the room for you, but be mindful that it is not completely independent. It's almost like your pet - needs constant attention and tender care.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2019

Review Text: I was obsessed with the Roomba when we first got it. It did a great job picking up our pets hair, got our entire apartment, and charged itself. About a year after owning it, the Roomba stopped connecting well with the charging base. Fine, no problem. We would manually put the Roomba on the base ourselves. A month doing that and then the charging base and Roomba stopped connecting no matter what we did. Of course we are way past our return window and manufacture warranty at that point so there is no way to get my money back. It's been sitting in my closet collection dust for the last year or so. NOT worth the money. It will break after you no longer have the chance for a refund.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021

Review Text: I had high expectations from a roomba. For some reason I expected it to “learn” the layout of the house and not cruise around erratically. It manages to get stuck in a 5x5 bathroom for 10+ minutes, even longer in bigger rooms, and misses one of the regular heavy dirt areas. We call it the drunk college student because it wanders around pretty aimlessly and does not seem to have any system to how it cleans. That being said, it does suck up a fairly impressive amount of first and dog hair (i have 2 medium sized dogs). If you have pets or don’t run it every day, you have to empty it halfway through the cleaning cycle to make sure it keeps cleaning effectively. The brushes accumulate quite a bit of hair, but they’re easy enough to take out and clean (or replace if needed).I was hoping I could program it so it can run while I’m at work, but it fits under some pieces of furniture just enough to get stuck and needs rescued, so that’s not an option for me. Overall, I love having a robotic vacuum, but I’d say I would probably buy a different brand that gets good reviews for less money.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2019

Review Text: I wasn't expecting too much out of a "bump into the walls" vacuum cleaner.  But, the Roomba is fascinating to watch.  It has some clever algorithms that goes all around the house without getting hung up.  It easily transitions from hardwood floors to carpet to slightly raised tile floors.  It doesn't seem to overdo an area either, it seems to hit pretty much everywhere it can get into.  The little sweeper wand looked cheesy but works quite well.We have two short hair shedding dogs that get hair everywhere.  The Roomba fills up pretty quickly in about 30 minutes.  I can see the luxury of having a self emptying container as well as a geo fence model to focus on specific areas but that may be a future purchase.  For now, we are quite pleased and amazed at the 675.Recommended!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2020

Review Text: After owning a iRobot that worked like a champ for 7+ years it died.  I bought this one as a replacement and have been incredibly disappointed.A) It never marries with the charging station. I have to manually put it in place so that it charges.B) The software, for some reason, is not as good.  The previous model in the same house covered the entire 1 story(tiled) floor plan.  This one does not.  Gets lost in a single room every time no matter where it starts.C  THIS PIECE OF GARBAGE ONLY LASTED 1 YEAR!  11 months to be more exact.  THAT'S RIGHT.  It is dead as 1/15/19.  No lights, no chargeing, etc....D) it sits on in the middle of the room and asks to be recharged like 10 times before I had to leave my desk to shut it off manually.So disappointed.  Loved the first model.I won't buy another one and would caution anyone about buying this item.Last year I bought a cheaper brand and it died within the year.  So this last 6 months I have done without and missed the cleaning terribly. So, the new machine arrived last week and its off to the races.  Love this thing.  The software works great.  It cleans my entire 1400sqft home easily.The negatives:1) It is too loud to run when I am at home.2) It locks itself in the bathrooms every time!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2019

Review Text: I spent quite a bit of time researching robot vacuums and for what I wanted, I landed on this one. We have 2 medium - 55lb dogs. 1 with short hair and the other with long hair so that's truly my biggest focus. We also have carpet and hardwood floors so I wanted something that would move easily from one to the other. With that said, I'm impressed with how well it transitions. Even with rugs on the hardwood, no issues. I'm also happy with how easy set up was and how easy it is to get the robot going / scheduled. Literally tell it to clean (push the button, tell Alexa, push clean on the app, etc) and it takes off.  I read reviews that the 675 is better with dog hair compared to others in their 900's series so that was honestly a deal breaker for me. Cleaning / emptying it after it runs is also super easy. Personally, we didn't want to put tape on the ground so I liked that we didn't have to with this. It has gotten stuck on the bathroom rugs so before we run it, I just shut the bathroom doors - not a big deal. But the cons.. The biggest is it's so loud! We were hoping to schedule running it at night, but that's not an option as it will wake you up even if it's just on the other side of the house. The other con that I've honestly "gotten over" is the random lines it creates on the carpet. It jumps all around so afterwards, don't expect pretty straight lines like you'd create with a vacuum, it will look more like a maze is on the carpet - super random lines.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020

Review Text: Pros: I must say it works varry well and is a tuff little bugger, I bought my roomba for my 2 bedroom 1 bath bachelor pad and it works wonders but you have to do your initial vacuuming and cleaning/ setting up any wires or moving any furniture. Once that's done your roomba will pick up after you and make it so you dont have to clean your floors every week, just add some carpet powder (if you use it) and watch this little guy go... so after about 50 mins it has most of my place cleaned so it saves me lots of time and a bit on money since I dont have to buy new bags on my vacuum so often. It goes great with my smart home and it does learn and adapt to new obstaclesCons: in small places (like in the dimensions of a small Box) the roomba does not do so well so If you have small pantries just sweep everything outside the door and close it the roomba will do the rest. The app is really buggy but still works you just have to
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2021

Review Text: I have all hardwood floors and set it to clean Mondays and Thursdays when I leave the house. I always forget and come home and the house just feels cleaner. There is no dust on the floor when I walk around barefoot. It got stuck the first time I ran it so now I move things off the floor. Every other week I move the couch and chairs away from the wall so it can get back there too. The only thing I don't like is when I am home and Alice runs. Not because it hits me or is too loud, because it will enter a room for 10 minutes and then leave, then come back for 5 minutes, then leave. After the 10th time I get mad and send it home, but it's just my OCD. When I am not home, it's awesome. Looking to get the mopping version soon.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020

Review Text: I thought this would be a great time saver for me, and in a few ways it has been.  However, it chews up my Echo Dot cords and other cords that are on the floor.  It also has gotten stuck in my closet, caught on clothing that hangs low.  I spent an hour searching for it!  I've turned it on because I see something that needs to be vacuumed up,  but it misses it.I do love that it gets under beds and some furniture, but gets caught between the legs of some chairs too.I would love for it to work satisfactorily for me as it would be a great time saver, but unfortunately, I'll be going back to a cordless vaccum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2019

Review Text: Whether you get the expensive deep-cleaning type or the cheaper one such as this - you will be thrilled you did. As you can see from the picture – I have a lot of hardwood floors and area rugs. The roomba (Rosey – named after the housecleaner on the Jetsons) cleans really well. And because I have to pick up mild clutter stuff such as shoes, clothing on the floor, etc. (so she doesn't get caught up in them), my house is so much cleaner by default. People could stop by and I wouldn't be embarrassed (you know what I mean). However, I wouldn’t want to have it run without me around. Sometimes it to need to be moved to other locations. It will shut down and request to be moved to a new cleaning spot because for some reason it gets stuck in a cleaning loop. But for me – I don’t care about that. I have a lot of things to do and don’t have time to do the mild daily sweep/vacuum clean up and she does those daily jobs very well. Worth $199! Does an excellent job of picking up hair, dirt and other debris. My floors are nice and clean. Don't second guess it - just do it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2020

Review Text: This is our second one of these and they just don’t hold up.  It will last until just out of warranty and then things start to break.  The same stuff that was poorly designed on the older models is no better on the newer model.  The side rotator brush motor has plastic gears and they wear out quickly, which requires the entire module to be replaced ($40 or more).  The shaft of the side brush motor gets easily wrapped and filled with hair which is tough the clean out, contributing to the motor module breakage issue.  The shafts of the bottom brush and beater also get twisted up with hair and are a pain to clean off.  The thing gets hung up quite easily by furniture, edges of area rugs, refrigerator, etc.  I feel like we are constantly rescuing it from situations.  You can use the invisible barriers, which do work, but you’ll need a bunch of them in an average home.  Eventually, you’ll have nothing but barriers and only half of your floors actually getting cleaned.  There’s got to be something better out there for the price.  We are moving on to try out another brand.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2020

Review Text: Set up took about 5 minutes. Charging is fast only took about an hour. After that we set our new Roomba free in the house. I can’t believe how good this vacuum does. It doesn’t seem like it is going to get everything but it does. The back and forth and around is fun and entertaining to watch. The noise is minimal compared to my other vacuum. Not sure it can completely replace my other vacuum but it is close. Picks up great under the table but I do have to pull the chairs out so it can get under the table.  I love that this fits under my bed (let’s face it I maybe do that once a year). So this is great. You can buy an expensive “fence” to keep your Roomba from going places you don’t want but I have chosen to just put furniture in the way that Roomba cannot get under. Sometimes I have certain areas I want done and not others. Overall a great purchase for my house.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2019

Review Text: Okay so most importantly, this vacuum DOES NOT VACCUUM ON SHAG CARPET.We had a Shark originally that worked well but died on us. After doing some research decided to spend the extra money and try out the Roomba. I specifically chose this one because of it’s bragging about how great it is for transitioning to carpet from hard floor. What they fail to mention is that it will not make that transition if your carpet or rug is a shag material. The roomba would hit the carpet and turn around as if it’s an obstacle. I attempted to place the roomba on the carpet myself, where it then acted as if it was having a tough time being on the surface and did everything it could to get back to hard floor.I called and spoke to support, because I thought surely something was wrong with our vaccuum, and after speaking with a very kind support person and sharing multiple video calls so they could see exactly what was going on, it was confirmed that the issue was because it was shag carpet and “the roomba does not work on shag”.Needless to say, we returned it and received a refund.The vacuum worked great on our hardwood and did seem to be more intuitive than our shark in general, so I really wanted to keep it and be pleased with it, but our shark had no problem getting up on our shag carpet so we will be going back to it.Also, be aware that this Roomba seemed to have an issue with dark rugs as well, because the sensors would think it was “on a clif”.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2021

Review Text: I want to preface this with telling you that I own a mighty pet hair vacuum. I only got irobot for some maintenance cleaning every once in awhile. I stopped using it around 1.5 months ago when I realized it wasn't being effective. I just tried it again today, and I am so irritated by how terrible of a product this is that I felt the urge to write this review.Honestly, this product sucks (and not in a good way). I haven't even had it that long, and I just want to put it in the trash. There is a spining arm that stopped working very quickly. It gets stuck on all kinds of stuff and does repetitive motions, so it appears to clean the same part of the room over and over again. The hair gets caught up in the brush, I constantly clean out the brush, but it's not enough. Today, it appears to not even be actually sucking up anything. The little tray that holds dirt is literally empty and it's been running for 20 minutes. This is not worth the money. I want my money back. I tried to return it, but the return window closed. It's the worst. Don't buy it. Spend your money either on a way more expensive one or get a traditional vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020

Review Text: I work 2 jobs and my husband none.  He used to do the housework but has slacked.  I don't want to vacuum when I get home so this is great...especially with a dog in the house.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2020

Review Text: Is it neat to think you have a little automatic vacuum cleaner? Absolutely. Too bad that's not what this is. I have had this do two runs and so far it just follows the same path, working on two rooms, and attacking my Christmas tree. Over and over and over again. And I use the term "work" loosely. I have watched this thing go over the tiniest piece of dirt and hair and it sucks up nothing. Just knocks into stuff, on the same path not going everywhere and not even actually vacuuming up anything.I'd love to have one of these things that actually worked and I'd happily pay for it if it did. But so far, this one is not worth it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019

Review Text: The Roomba does fine and the app is reasonably convenient.  Out of the box it constantly gets stuck under furniture, but with the addition of some rubber bumpers added to the top that make the rest of the Roomba the same height as the sensor at the front this is no longer an issue.The primary issue I face are the cliff sensors.  The sensors trigger any time the unit tries to go up on brown rugs (light or dark).  I live in a one story home with 0 risk of it falling off a cliff.  iRobot should allow users to turn off these sensors.  The only options available right now are either to take the unit apart and alter the sensors manually or use aluminum foil or some other reflective material to cover the sensors, but this is frustrating to set up and requires maintenance as the taps and foil wear from bumping into things.  This has been a complaint since Roomba came out.
