Users deserve to be able to toggle this on and off depending on the layout of their homes.Out of the box my Roomba delivered false positives of being stuck on a cliff when really it was just going over a rug and when the sensor goes off and causes it to back up it can often trap it in an area that uses its battery life very inefficiently.Compared to other units that I would not mind letting run while I was on a work conference call this one is extremely loud.  I'd recommend only running when you are out of the house, but out of the box it needs constant manual intervention to keep it running. our time is better spent using a more powerful upright vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2021

Review Text: This is one of the best products I've purchased in awhile. It gets under all the furniture and along the base boards where a normal vacuum often misses. One thing you have to do before staring the cleaning process is to pick up things and insure there's no phone chargers, cables, or anything else for it to eat. Everyone who comes over is impressed by it and usually ends up purchasing their own. I recommend this product to anyone who gets tired of vacuuming all the time, don't get rid of your vacuum though as the Roomba compliments a vacuum but by no means works as a replacement due to the random patterns it follows.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2019

Review Text: This has changed my life. I work full time and have two long haired dogs and two kids. Vacuuming on the weekends just wasn’t cutting it.I set Roomba up to clean every morning at 8am right after we leave. I know some people are worried about the dog poop thing, but my thought is if you have it set up to go right after you leave for work, then the pets have just been outside.Another perk is that my dogs HATE the regular vacuum cleaner, but they don’t mind Roomba at all -not even when it bumps in to them.Now and then the Roomba can’t find its way back to the charger and just keeps going and going until the battery runs down.  But that doesn’t bother me- I will get a notification that Roomba cleaned for 2 hours and 35 minutes but then ended the job with low battery. You can imagine how great the floors look after being vacuumed for that long!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020

Review Text: Only had him a month and he has far exceeded my expectations.  I live in a dusty place and it really accumulates along the floor moldings (saltiel tile floor).  Talus (that's his name) does a great job of keeping the floor dust-free and that is really my biggest need.  There are a couple places he gets stuck, and when his front cliff sensors get dusty he will stop at the edge and call for help rather than turning away.  So he really does best if I am around to rescue him on the occasions he runs into trouble.  But it happens seldom enough that it is not a bother.  He won't pick up heavy stuff but that really isn't an issue for me.He doesn't have a problem with bathmats or door mats.My girlfriend, who is much neater than I am, raves about how clean the floor is now.I don't have a pet so can't say anything about pet hair.Time will tell how he holds up, but for now I am pleased.  And, to be honest, he is pretty entertaining.  I guess I am easily amused.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020

Review Text: My whole household loves "Bob the Roomba" and I don't know how we lived without him so long!  He weaves through the chair legs and under tables to pick up every crumb and spec of dirt.... places normal vacuums don't easily go  Sure, his pattern may seem a bit random, but he gets it done and the floors look great every time!When we moved from our last house, I noticed all the dust that had accumulated under the beds where we couldn't vacuum.  As I look back on my allergies, I wonder if some of it wasn't because of all the difficult places where dust hides.  Now that Bob is on the job, the areas under the beds gets vacuumed regularly, just like the rest of the carpets and floors.I researched lots of different models and manufacturers before purchasing this specific model.  Many had more features,bells & whistles, but seemed to have mixed reviews.  The Roomba 675 is a solid performer with all the features we need and the dependability we wanted.  After 3 months of use, it gets the floors clean every time and doesn't have any problems (other than a wooden base on a rocker which traps it occasionally.  It also finds its own charging base when done about 90% of the time.I'm considering getting a 2nd unit to keep upstairs so I don't have to carry Bob up/down the stairs and you can be sure it will be the same Roomba 675.  Its a workhorse!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2019

Review Text: Such a great product! Easy to use, cleans very well and entertaining all at the same time. We have a house full of cats and dogs and I’m impressed by the ability to collect animal hair efficiently.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018

Review Text: Overall, I think this is a great investment for our family. A few issues keep it from being a 5 star item:  1) It's noisy.  2) It's infuriating to watch it go right past debris and never return. 3) It eats long drapes.  4) It gets stuck on patio door track.  But it's still easier than pushing around  a vacuum. I picked up a handheld vac so I could spot clean the items it misses. With 3 cats I had to have something to pick up the drifting hair bunnies as needed.  We also had to correct all the drapery rod heights so there is NO puddling of drapes on the floor. As for the patio door issue, it only occurs on a very long expanse with three tracks. I just put someting in front of it before vaccuming, problem solved.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2020

Review Text: I read a lot of critical reviews about these devices and was reluctant to spend the money. You have to understand that these robots are not intelligent, but they do a great job of sucking up the dirt and dust bunnies. We have two cats and a 50/50 split between hardwood and carpet. It does a great job of keeping the hardwood clean and works on the carpet okay. Keep in mind you do have to prep the house a little bit, for large debris/toys etc, and also identify places it will get wedged under furniture. Otherwise we absolutely love this robot,  what a time saver! Don't set your expectations of this thing too high, it does what it says but has no memory of where its  been, just let it do its thing and you'll be very pleased at the results.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019

Review Text: I was excited to buy a roomba vacuum because I hate vacuuming and also hate per fur tumbleweeds in my apartment. I was disappointed with the Roomba 675 model. After one job, I had to stop it half-way through to disentangle both my long hair and my cat's hair from the bristle brushes, because it had gotten so wound up it wouldn't work. If you're a single person living alone in a small apartment with no long hair or pet hair floating around, it may be a good option. But for almost everyone else, especially if you're specifically getting a roomba because you have a pet, I would recommend upgrading at least to the E5, which has silicone brushes and doesn't get stuck and tangled like this one. Luckily I returned my Roomba and was able to buy the upgraded model, which I am exceedingly happy with.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020

Review Text: Honestly this is one of the best products I've ever bought. It does exactly what it's supposed to do it cleans up while I'm taking care of other things. The people that are complaining with one star reviews are mad because they have to adjust it here or there as if they want it to do everything for them I wouldn't be surprised if they expected the Roomba to cook for them or read tree kids a bedtime story. but there are a few minor issues that are not a big deal at all. It can get stuck on uneven surfaces. for example we have a table that has support bars on the floor and obviously if it tries to roll up on that it could get stuck but it will notify you through the app and you can go and readjusted and let it keep cleaning. so what we do is we put a laundry basket in the way so it doesn't get caught in that area. Other than that we do have indoor dogs that use potty pads so we just make sure to clean that up beforehand and remove the potty pads so that it doesn't try to suck those up. You definitely don't want your Roomba rolling through a pile of dog poop because it'll smeared across the floor. It's an extremely huge help with dog hair, kids glitter, and dirt that gets tracked in through our daily routines. This is a great product and I 100% recommended. But of course there are small issues that could be fixed that's why I give it 4 stars instead of 5. Other than that I'm completely satisfied with it. We just choose to use it while we're home so we can keep an eye on it we don't set a routine for it to go running while we're out of the house. That way we can readjust it if needed
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2021

Review Text: So 2 hairy dogs & 2 women with long hair that all sheds often, this thing keeps up really well! I'd recommend cleaning the brush every 2nd or 3rd day because the long hair tends to wrap and get a little stuck but it doesn't change the power of suction.He's also not the smartest of the Roombas. He does zig zags and cleans the same rooms 3 or 4 or 5 times before cleaning another room once. If he gets stuck on barstools one day, don't expect him to learn his lesson. He'll get stuck on barstools every day.But again, for all the hair and dirt we track in daily, we feel comfortable walking around barefoot. For our first ever Roomba, he's a good (and sometimes dumb) little Robot.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020

Review Text: I gave this Product 2 chances. First one did a decent job of vacuuming but just stopped once it got on the area rug.  So I exchanged it hoping it was a fluke.  Second one did a lousy job of vacuuming (I literally swept up piles of dog hair and dust balls in every room after it docked in its recharge unit).  Finally realized that it shuts down if the carpet is dark in color...seriously????  Then I suggest the manufacturers add that to the description!!!  Believe me, I WANTED this thing to work.  It felt great hearing  that Roomba while I was doing other housework until I saw how ineffective it was.  Don’t waste your time or money.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019

Review Text: I was concerned about the noise this would make--however, it really wasn't that loud--not as loud as a regular vacuum.  I didn't expect some of the issues I encountered that frustrated the heck out of me.It did go from hardwoods to carpet with ease--but that is all it did with ease.It would get stuck going in a very small area becasue it would hit something, turn, hit something, turn, hit the first thing again, turn, hit the second thing, turn.  ON AND ON AND ON--just back and forth--or small squares....10 min, 20 min, 30 min, etc.  UNTIL, we manually picked it up and rerouted.often, it took 3 times to go over dog hair--german shepherd hair--before it would get it all.in our family room it would go over the same spots over and over and over and over---and leave 80% not vacuumed.  it wasn't efficient.  it wasn't smart about its paths.  and i believe we could have left it go for hours and it still would not have vacuumed much of the room.Dining room chairs tripped it up.  end tables tripped it up.  anything that has legs that it is trying to go around.  It isn't practical for us to put up our end tables and dining room chairs and sofa table, etc.it took it an exceptionally long time to find its dock when we told it--and about 3 out of 7 times we needed to assist it.It was fun to watch the dogs try to figure it out....but other than that, it is not a good tool for us.  Perhaps the 900 series would work for us in our space--but this model does not.  apparently the 900 series is smarter in its patterning--which helps in a larger house.It did pick up dog hair on the hard woods--but for dog hair on the carpet it was not efficient or reliable.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2018

Review Text: I've had this vacuum for less than 2 months and I've called support three times ...and getting ready to call again.  It worked great the first three or four times I used it, but It doesn’t dock itself anymore, despite changing the docking location per support’s suggestion.  It does not fully recharge and just quit today after 28 minutes.  When it worked properly I loved it.....but that was a very short window if time.  I guess its too late for return, so I’m stuck with an expensive non working appliance.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2019

Review Text: This roomba only lasted 40 days and they will not let me return it saying if it works on regular floors it’s fine, but since it’s not working on the carpet then it must be because it’s thick carpet.  15 year old carpet is not thick.  Would not recommend this company or product to anyone.  I’m out over 200 dollars!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   Love it! I sweep every day and can’t get up all the dog hair I feel like I constantly walk around with hair stuck to my feet. I pre-swept before the first time I ran the roomba and showed the results in the picture of how much dirt was picked up. The picture was taken the second day after a second run by rumba with even more hair picked up. You can see in the first picture of the debris picked up that it even picked up a heavy washer which is impressive suction power for a tiny vacuum. I love that it can get under most of my tables and cabinets where I have trouble getting all of the dirt out with the broom . Obviously my dogs are not a fan but they adjusted after it ran for a bit.I will say it’s a little louder than I thought it would be but I can still sit and watch TV while it’s running around me downstairs.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2020

Review Text: I own 2 Roomba vacuums. This one that connects to wifi with app controls and all. It is constant need of help because if it makes it up in an area rug when it tries to come off of it it thinks it’s falling off a cliff. I may as well just take my stand up vacuum and do the job myself. If you live a busy life, this isn’t the one for you. Get the cheapest Roomba you can get. Although I have to manually press the button to start it, it would run up my back if I was laying on the floor and keep going. The cheaper Roomba will finish the job every single time. I can’t remember the last time I had to save it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2020

Review Text: I has an Irobot previously, and it was worthless.  My son had this model and convinced it was great and they fixed all the issues.  The only thing better is the battery - this one can go 1.5 hrs where my prior one was much less. But it wanders around and will clean an area over again and not go to new area.  We I tell it to go home on the app, it will wander around lost until i pick it up an put it in front of the docking station.  Even then it takes several minutes of wandering around until if finally docks itself.  I wanted to get the Shark that ran straight lines, but my son talked me into this one - big mistake.  I wasted my money (AGAIN).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2021

Review Text: I've waited quite some time to get a robot vacuum to give Roomba ample time to perfect their product. Unfortunately, they've got a ways to go. This poor little Roomba struggles to cover the main level of my house (which is around 900sq ft). If you have nothing but hard woods, go for it but if you have even light tan colored carpets, you're better off passing. This little thing wears its battery out covering the same three rooms with hard woods but can't handle making it to either of the bedrooms consistently. Support has suggested relocating the base as a solution, which works at first before it's right back to its old ways. I feel like I keep waiting for this little machine to have it's epiphany and figure out which areas need vacuuming but unfortunately, I continue to grow increasingly skeptical it will ever happen.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2021

Review Text: I had a hard time sifting thru these reviews. This is my first time owning a “”robot vacuum” and I am very satisfied. It boils down to this...we just bought a home with dark hard wood floors. They are beautiful but after a week I discovered they show EVERYTHING! Ugh. I was sweeping every day or two and having twin toddlers at home that just wasn’t sustainable for me. Now with running my Roomba every other day or so I only have to sweep and mop every 1.5-2 weeks. Big improvement! I’m a happy camper.  I have included pictures of my rugs I have at home. It has no trouble with two out of three of them. One is a high pile so I expected it would have trouble with it. All in all  it gets in all the little corners, even under my furniture. It is one of the best purchases I’ve made.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020

Review Text: I have a love hate relationship with this iRobot. First off, it does clean and it’s kind of cool. I’ve never had one before. That said, it keeps getting stuck in the same spot. I thought It wa supposed to be smart- nope not at all. The charging mechanism isn’t great either and sits in the charging station and appears to charge indicated by the green light but within minutes, it turns off. Does it clean? Yes. But it does need me to babsysit while it does or it will get lost or stuck in the same spots - every single time.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020

Review Text: What I like about Romana:1- Easy to use.2- Easy to schedule.3- Saves me time (I work, study, and take care of my dad and family)4- Does a very good job removing cat hair, hair, and the suction power is very very good ( 10 out of 10).What needs to be improved:1- Controls, it would be nice to be able to control the movement and direction of Romba using the phone or even a remote control. Sometimes I want to clean a place more than once, or if for some reason Romba turned the other direction, i can easily turn it back. Currently this is not possible. It is very annoying to have to get up each time to get Romba back to the place I want it to clean.Nevertheless Romba is amazing and does a really good job.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2020

Review Text: It is constantly getting stuck. I have to run it when I’m home so I can babysit it because it is always getting stuck. A lot of times the battery runs out before it gets all of my floor because it seems to wander aimlessly and vacuum the same spaces over and over while completely missing other areas. I bought this approximately three months ago and it’s already telling me to replace the brushes, which are not cheap at $50. Not even sure I want to replace the brushes now. Doesn’t seem worth it. Disappointing. I would not recommend this product.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2020

Review Text: (Update)2-3 weeks in the roomba has been making an awful squeaking sound! Super annoying!!!After reading about the squeaking seems to be a problem with inside parts....So keep in mind you might need to spend extra money to (upkeep it)At first once I took it if the box I wasn’t aware it wasn’t charged fully.After a proper charge this bad boy clean my apart and left it spotless!!!. I just moved to a 156sq studio apartment.This roomba cleaned the carpet deep after one pass the roomba was full I feel much better knowing this bad boy cleaned the carpet.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2021

Review Text: I wasn't sure I needed a robot vac and felt like it was a little indulgent, but now having used it twice, I don't know how I ever lived without it. This is a basic model without as many features as the more sophisticated and expensive models, but for a small house or apartment it does a great job. I love that it can get to places that are hard to reach like underneath the bed, and it did a great job picking up pet hair. It's relatively quiet and can be controlled using the app on your phone. It snagged on some loose rug fringe but that's my fault for not trimming it. When it has a problem, you'll receive a error message on your phone and can fix it easily.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020

Review Text: It cleans fairly well where it travels but that's about it. It just wanders aimlessly, sometimes staying in a room for thirty minutes and other times going into a room and than right back out, never to return. I have not had trouble with the app but it really only allows me to set a schedule or start the unit. If I tell it to go home, it receives the message and keeps on going. It is supposed to go home before the battery runs out. It never does that, it just goes until the battery dies. I would return it but I didn't begin using it until after my return window closed. If this is the future of robotics, we are in for a disappointing future.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2020

Review Text: This is simply amazing. I have a six pet household (plus three kids) and this bad boy is unphased by the massive amounts of hair and dirt that accumulates on the floors. I am obsessed with emptying the reservoir because I’m always amazed by how much it picks up (including big things, like nerf darts so it’s a good idea to pick up before it gets doing). I also like that all of the components on the undercarriage are removable for easy cleaning. I need to get in there and unwrap the long human hairs from some of the spinny thingys from time-to-time and it’s convenient that I can just pop them out, clean them up and put them back on.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2019

Review Text: This is the worst robot vacuum I have owned! I assumed being a Roomba that it would be fairly intuitive, however it was nearly impossible to connect to the app. It gets stuck everywhere and can't maneuver out of the places it gets itself into. If it gets bumped slightly on its charging base it dill not reconnect itself, rather it will just let its battery die. Finally, for whatever reason, if you cancel a cleaning and send it back to its home base it will random travel around your house for another solid 15 minutes going nowhere near the base. There are cheaper options out there that are so much better than this machine.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2020

Review Text: I'm definitely liking it (Wall-E) so far. He has drastically reduced the amount of dust and dog hair in my home. He is a bit noisy but I run him in the evening time right before I go to bed. I set up a schedule on the app and haven't got used to the time because I do get startled for a second when he comes on. I haven't ran him while away yet because he did get stuck a couple times. I do recommend decluttering your areas before starting a cleaning. I tend to pull out dining room chairs and pick up larger items like shoes first. I do have to remember to empty the bin before the next cleaning though. I also do notice that I have to sweep still in areas like under cabinets where he doesn't have enough clearance but not enough to not use him. The setup was super easy. I did have to figure out where the best place to put the dock as I didn't have enough clearance in the spot I originally was going to put him. He does tend to repeat certain areas but I try to ignore him and let him do his thang. Oh and my dog is not quite sure what to make of him and is annoyed with having to find a new laying spot when Wall-E comes around. But glad he's not barking at it otherwise I'd have to find a new home for the dog..lol jk
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020

Review Text: I’d give it zero if I could.  It can’t get o to any area rugs it gets jammed und stuck under the lid of the dishwasher and the couch and just about everywhere.  It is also very loud and the notifications are blaring.  It is all s ranch up already from being stuck.  It has only one whirlly brush and I watch it just glide over dirt and not pick it.  It’s garbage.  I had a shark robot vac and it was superior to this. On the recommendation of my sister in law I decided to purchase a roomba.  BigMistake.  It also bumps or I should say crashes into everything and makes loud noises.  Don’t buy.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2021

Review Text: I was impressed with the overall quality and performance but when she picked up a 3 inch sewing needle off of a wood floor my jaw dropped.  My biggest shop vac can't do that.  Think about it.  The length and diameter of a sewing needle with no rough surfaces to grab on a Pergo floor.  Try to do that with your fingers sometime and see just how difficult it is.  She did it though (we call her Giget which is why it is a "she") and she did it on the first pass. If that doesn't impress you, well.... you figure it out.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2020

Review Text: This little guy does a great job, I am in a  700 sqft apartment, wood floors with rugs, and random furniture. It spends it's time bumping into everything, and making random direction changes, but over the course of a week (3 times a week with the schedule you can set up in the app), it keeps the floors clean. I chose this one over the type that maps the house because I am constantly moving things in and out.It is not the smartest thing in the world, but it is easy enough to just go move it if it gets stuck, or sucks up a usb cable. If you have a carpet, don't expect straight vacuum patterns, it wanders your home like a drunk toddler. I have dark baseboards, so I can not speak to it leaving marks, I will say it can move light chairs around with the force it runs into things.I haven't had to fix anything, but they do sell new parts for this thing, all the motor driven parts, which is better than most actual vacuum cleaners out there.Bottom line, for under 180 bucks your house will be clean, and you just have to empty the bin.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021

Review Text: iRobt roomba 675 gets stuck under all of my bedroom furniture, coffee table and kitchen chairs.  It is unable to get in any corners so you have to manually follow up with another vacuum.  It's  supposed to recognize a step to prevent it from falling so instead it gets stuck or falls down the step. It takes a good hour to vacuum an 11' X 16' bedroom. It goes over the same spots repeatedly and skips others. I live in a small 1100 square foot home by myself so there isn't much traffic in and out to bring dirt in. I use the iRobot once every two weeks and the battery only lasted one year.  A replacement battery costs $85 and the brushes don't last long either.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021

Review Text: This is the second robot vacuum that I have purchased through Amazon. This thing sucks.....not in the right way either!  It does clean up pet hair well, but it gets stuck EVERYWHERE too easy and now, the side brush screw is stripped out and reviews recommend not replacing that part, as it will continue to break. It's loud and annoying too!  I wish I had done my research.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2019

Review Text: Purchased this based upon the predominantly good reviews. After using this for a week i am amazed at the number of good reviews. My experience was quite the opposite. The reason i did not give this product a single star is that the software is good, where the unit goes it does clean well, the battery life in the limited time i had it was good. The cons are out of over 12 tries it only returned to base twice. Most of the time it would just run until the battery was dead and stop where it was. It would do this even when i saw the battery was low and instructed it to return to base. Other times it would get stuck even when there was no compelling reason seen. To me the reason to purchase this is to perform a task with little to no intervention, in this regard it failed miserably as it had to be watched and helped along constantly. My house is large, but clutter free and is as simple an environment as this item would be expected to encounter. Thankfully this was purchased on Amazon and i will be returning it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2018

Review Text: I hesitated to get one of these because of the reviews saying it didn't do that good of a job, and because I thought it would be really noisy. It actually cleans the floor really well, and it is not that loud. It goes around the floor in a seemingly random pattern, but at the end the floor is clean. Of course it doesn't get behind things, I don't expect it to, but the part of the floor that's seen and walked on is clean. It's bigger than I thought it would be (13.5 inches across), so there are a few places it can't get to. The instructions say the dock needs 1.5 feet on either side, with 4 feet in front. I do not have that kind of wall space with an outlet, so I have it between two things, but it works just fine.PROS- Cleans all the pet hair and dirt from the floor.- Is not as noisy as I feared.CON (this is a pretty big con)- I could not get it to connect to the Wi-Fi. The app told me to join the roomba network then come back. I did. It then told me to join the regular network and come back. I did. Then it told me--again--to join the roomba network and come back...in an endless loop. I searched for help with this and found nothing. So, I am unable to program it and have to manually start it each time. I work in IT and it's not like I don't know how to do it; the app DOES NOT WORK!Overall very happy with purchase, but it would be great if the wi-fi would connect.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2018

Review Text: We have a dog who sheds like crazy. At any point we can sweep up the hair in the house and make a new dog.  This thing has changed that.  If you want a nice deep clean you wont get it from this. But for every day removal of hair, dust, dirt from the floor THIS IS WHAT YOU NEED.  If your life is as busy as ours this product will lighten your load significantly.  It's less noisy than a standard upright so it wont become annoying when watching TV.  Everything has worked beautifully so far and it does an amazing job at pushing things out of the way to clean as well as it wont suck up wires etc..  I know the cost of these puts people off but it is worth it I promise.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2019

Review Text: If you want a bull in a china shop, this thing is for you. Gets hung up on thin rugs, loud as a normal vacuum, doesn’t stop sucking up chords, slams into everything, and last but not least, utilizes the same route over and over again. There are way better brands out there that are equivalent in cost, quieter, do a better job, aren’t the size of a VCR and have a remote so you can control the vacuum when the horse gets out of the barn. Eufy is one of them. I’ll be sending this back, and from the looks of it, Roomba will offer no support in the process. If you are serious about a iRobot Roomba and have the budget, get one that maps rooms and can be controlled remotely when it decides to wreak havoc. I’d give this model a negative overall star if I could. I have the 675 model just to finally add
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2020

Review Text: I’m not sure if we got a broken product or if the product just sucks. It’s supposed to run for up to 90 mins and then dock itself. Ours ran for about 7 minutes and then announced an error. We cleared the error and restarted, and about 5 mins later it reported the same error. This happened over and over until we had to return the product.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019

Review Text: Of the cheap robot vacuums I've owned this is the worst one. It is actually starting to fill me with anger whenever I have to deal with it, which is constant.I had an early Neato vacuum years and years ago, pet editon since I have two cats. It did its job, it was super simple, it couldn't go under my kitchen rolly-counter but it could get over the lip into my bathroom, it almost always made it back to its base unless it found a forgotten sock or loose wire. It had a mildly annoying beep if it was stuck but not incessent. It had shitty battery life though and eventually it died altogether.Then I bought one put out briefly by Anker, of course it had great battery, that was never a problem. It could fit under my kitchen cart, it ocassionally got stuck trying to get into my bathroom but usually it worked its way out of problems, it may have beeped once or twice when it first got into trouble but then would stay quiet. It usually made its way back to the base, but if not it had such great battery life that it didn't actually need the base for a couple days. Anker stopped selling them though and while I think they're probably the same as the eufy ones? but I wasn't surewhen I broke my Anker while cleaning it (completely my fault) I thought I would try Roomba. I mean, roomba is the big brand and should be better. While this is a cheaper roomba it is more expensive than my earlier robot vacuums.Why I hate it- It is loud as hell, but doesn't do any better job- it gets stuck on the lip into my bathroom every time where the others were able to go in and clean that room- it can't get under the kitchen cart, it also gets stuck on my desk and another thing in my office because of that wierd little outcropping it has on top- when it gets stuck somewhere, or can't find the base, or is low on battery, or is sitting on its base but not charging it both tells me via text message and LOUD voice message - the voice message repeats LOUDLY every now and again, like in the middle of the night.- It finds the dock every 3rd or 4th time it runs. I live in NY, my apartment is not big. The dock is in a very central place, the other vacuums had no problems with their docks in that spot.- On the rare occasion that it can find its dock It often fails to charge because it can't get its finicky self onto the charger correctly, my other vacuums just backed up and re-docked. I think I might be able to fix this by taping the dock to the floor, but that wasn't necessary with the other vacuums- it has shit for battery life. Yesterday it started up on schedule but I turned it off because I was in the middle of something, but it didn't redock ... it wasn't doing anything, there was nothing that should have drained its batteries, but today it is dead.- The neato used a pattern to clean, the Anker bumbled around at random, both always managed to hit my whole apartment. The roomba I have to keep carrying into my living room, from which it constantly returns back into my hall without cleaning the living room. I have to barricade the sucker into the living room to get it to clear the largest room I have. The other robots had no issues whatsoever with this, I don't even understand how it is an issue.The good?The app works really well with it, impressively so. I did have trouble initially connecting to the Amazon Echo, there was some sort of server error, but whatever the issue was they'd fixed it when I tried again a few weeks later.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2020

Review Text: It works great I have it scheduled to clean every workday morning at 4:00 and weekends at 8:00.  If you have a dog that sheds make sure you clean the brushes frequently.  I bought a refill kit that came with a brush cleaner and razor blade that works great to help clean the brushes.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2018

Review Text: This is my first experience with a robot vacuum.  I have only used two times.  I find the product to be okay for in between cleaning but nothing replaces a human to really get consistent coverage on every surface.  We have tile, carpet and hardwood.  When moving from hardwood to carpet the side brush will deposit dirt particles onto the carpet.  I do love the ability to vacuum under beds.  Some rooms, the vacuum goes over the same areas several times and completely missed other areas.  I don't know if this will eventually be corrected by learning our floor plan.  I hope so.  Also, the ability to link up with Google Assistant doesn't impress me.  The app is very minimal in it's abilities.  I doubt I will ever use the schedule feature unless the vacuum improves and surprises me by doing a better job cleaning floors than me without supervision.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2018

Review Text: I absolutely adore this little vacuum. I have a large one bedroom with hardwood and tile throughout, and it does a fantastic job of keeping the place clean. It even works under my couch and bed, places I'd maybe clean once a year before. It does a good job of returning to base, provided it doesn't get tangled up in something along the way. It only took a few cleans to identify all the things it didn't like and (mostly) roomba-proof my apartment. The serviceable parts are clearly labeled, easy to get to, and easy to clean which is a massive plus in my book.I'm knocking off two stars though, one for each area of my apartment the robot refuses to clean. This Roomba has the same bewildering problem that all previous Roombas have had, and that is that I can't disable the over-sensitive cliff sensors. I have no cliffs in my apartment, it's all one level, all hard floor, so there's absolutely no need for them. What I do have is a black checkerboard kitchen, and black bath mats. Roomba steadfastly refuses to go into the kitchen because of the black tile, and if it hits the bath mats it fails the clean and sits there until its battery dies. The robot does a great job of cleaning other colors of bathroom rug, and obviously shouldn't have a problem with tile.If you search the internet for this problem, there are hundreds of videos and forum posts dating back to 2012 of various ways to disable the sensors. Most involve putting some kind of foil or tape over them, but unfortunately they've changed the 600 series so that hack no longer works. The only one I've found that actually might work on mine is to open the device up (a couple dozen screws and many loose parts) and modify the sensors themselves. This voids the warranty.This is ridiculous. What's the deal iRobot? How hard would it be to put a toggle in the app to disable cliff sensors? I haven't tried the other brands of robot vacuum, but if they haven't fixed the problem by the time the battery in this one is going (an $80 replacement part), then that's where I'm gonna go. At least they listen to their customers.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2019

Review Text: I wanted a vacuum that wouldn't leave me stranded if our Wifi wasn't working or phones were updating. You can just push the "clean" button and it works. Hubby loves the "app" and programming it, but I prefer not to get entangled with all that. So this was a great compromise. Not all models and types work without Wifi so read the fine print.It is quieter on carpet, but very loud on the tile. Hubby works from home so it goes off at 7:30 am 2x per week. Not the best wake-up call.Dogs barked at it the first week, but now they just ignore it.We are renting a small 1 level home so it is adequate for that on battery life before recharging.Will get hung up on cords and such so be careful what you leave on the floor and under the bed!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018

Review Text: I have an area rug in my living room which is apparently the bane of a Roomba's existence. It refuses to climb onto the rug from one side - I'm assuming the reason for this is that either the change in elevation is too extreme, or there's a dark spot on the carpet that tricks the robot into thinking it's falling off a cliff. Because again, this is a really stupid robot. It will refuse to climb onto the rug even if it has just "dismounted" the rug from that same side. One would think that if it has just rolled over an area without falling off a cliff, it would retain the memory of that area being "safe", but again... really stupid robot.My dock is in my bedroom, and apparently that's too complicated for the robot, as instead of returning home when it's done with its job, it will aimlessly roll around crashing into things until its battery dies. Because this is a very stupid robot.I ran the robot five or six times over two weeks before requesting a return.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2021

Review Text: The robot does a decent job of bouncing around the house cleaning, but it does not learn its environment or make a map so it doesn't vacuum efficiently and I am never sure what rooms got covered. The purpose of the wifi is pretty limited. I have mine connected to my Echo and I can say "Alexa tell roomba to clean" and it will start the robot. This is nice because the charging dock is under a cabinet where it camps nicely out of the way, but also where I couldn't easily push the clean button on top. The app only shows that a job is started or finished, how long it took and if the robot got stuck or ran out of battery. I can remember only one time that the robot left it's base, cleaned for an hour and then made it back to its base by itself to charge. It usually just runs out of battery after about 1.5 hours and I find it somewhere in the house. After vacuuming for an hour and a half, the bin is always full of dust and crumbs. I keep a clean house and have a cleaner come twice a month. If you don't have a robot vacuum, you are likely living in filth and just don't know it. There are some obstacles it doesn't handle well. It will get wedged under my futon if I don't put something in place to block it from going under. If there is a phone charging cable on the floor it will get tangled up in it. Sometimes it sees dark lines in the carpet and turns as if it is the edge of a cliff. Jarvis (what I named my roomba) is kind of a dick to my one year old son and I think the experience will put some deep seeded mistrust of robots in his psyche.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2020

Review Text: Had this Roomba for about two weeks, and I have to say so far so good (let's hope I didn't just jinx myself).  I agree with some other reviewers though, this model does seem to wonder aimlessly.  I do start with a relatively "clean" floor.  I let it run everyday and figure that ANYTHING it picks up is something I would have to do if I do not have Rosie (my husband named it Rosie after the Jetsons).  I do plan to upgrade it to a better model (if I can find an amazing deal on Black Friday, which is a little more than 1 month away), one that can actually map out the rooms, and have better suction power.  This one does not climb onto my high-pile rug, it sees it as a piece of furniture.  It does climb up to the low-pile rug.  Mine does find "home" and so far it'll run for about 2 hours every morning.  So for maintenance, i think this works well.  But if you start with a very dirty room and want this one to completely clean up for you then I think you'll be disappointed, you'll need Mary Poppin's snapping fingers to do that.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020

Review Text: This is my second iRobot. I loved the first and I love this one too. It does a wonderful job of cleaning. You do have to learn what problems you have in a room to address before starting the iRobot. I lock my dishwasher before using it in the kitchen for instance to keep it from getting stuck there. I also make sure my indoor plants don't skim the floor because otherwise  they will be eaten. Also electrical cords need to be out of the way to protect them.  Once you figure out the few things to get a room ready to vacuum, it's fast to get the cleaning done.  I love the device and also gave my sister one for Christmas.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021

Review Text: We hate vacuuming and sweeping and it showed .. so after years of hesitation, we got the Roomba 675. Set it up, let it charge, connected it to the wifi, the phone, and Alexa -  and the next day let it go. It vacuumed and swept, the dust bin was full. Same the next day but I had to empty the bin half way through .. since then we let it do it's thing every day and the house looks great! No more full dust bins!For the three and a half weeks, it always found it's way back. Now it seems that sometimes if it is on the far side of our small house, it won't find it's way back. Not a big deal, easy to pick up and put back on the charging station - we have  a lot of obstacles in our house. It does great around them but I'm sure there's times when it just can't find it's way to the base.One reviewer said "don't watch it" .. and they had a point - it just acts like the dumbest thing in the universe and you'll just question its every move - and if these are the types of robots that are going to take over the universe, have no fear! But if you just let it do it's thing, each day the end result is amazing! We love it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2019

Review Text: The battery died in less than a year.  The cost fore replacement is about 38% of the cost of a new unit.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020

Review Text: Just received my roomba 675 for Christmas. In trying to set the app up, it asked to hit the home button and the spot button at the same time and hold for two seconds. Unfortunately there is no home button, only a clean, spot and dock button. Tried different combo's several times but no luck using the Home app. If you are unsuccessful setting up the app, you cannot set up the schedule. Tried customer support but they were no help. Didn't even sound like they knew how the product operated. Gave up on them. My husband finally found the right combination after trying for half and hour. Also the unit does not come room the wall units that prevent the roomba from going into a room. Other models have them. Finally got it set up after awhile. Will have to rate it on other features later. Very frustrating. They need better instructions and all the parts should be included.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019

Review Text: This was ridiculous to setup and required help from tech support.  After a few months It can not seem to find it's way back to the base to recharge.  I have go find where it stopped at and carry it to the base to recharge.  Once on the charger, it is very difficult to get it to maintain contact with the two electrical contact points (this is on a very flat/level hard wood floor).  When it does charge and run the next morning it doesn't do a very good job picking up dirt and it also has scuffed up a lot of my furniture as the Roomba bounces off of everything over and over.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2021

Review Text: Everywhere I go, it seems people (and companies) claim that a robot vacuum can only play second-fiddle to an upright vacuum. Well, pleased to report this is not so!I am quite impressed with Robby (yeah, my robot has a name) and his ability to deep-clean my carpets. He really sucks up that dirt and hair! In addition, he is able to reach the sort of dirt and debris that tends to accumulate along the edges of my walls; not even my upright can do that.As if all of this is not good enough, Robby behaves himself nicely. He sits quietly and compactly on his charger under an end table ready to go at a moment's notice. His dust bin is remarkably easy to empty.Wish I'd bought a Roomba decades ago!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2019

Review Text: To start with, purchasing a robot vacuum changed my life. I am busy busy busy, and I have a dog that sheds constantly. My floors, hardwood and carpet, were one of those things I never got around to because it took too much time and work. I have my room a set to run every night... and I love it! I would buy it again in a heartbeat. But I have learned some things that I think would make it better. Things that I think a more expensive model would get you.I had some trouble getting mine to link to my Internet initially, it took about four or five tries and when it finally connected it needed The software update. Which could’ve been part of the problem.This model does not come with mapping, and just bounces around your house. That doesn’t bother me, but I know it would drive some people crazy. The product manual talks about how if you run it frequently enough as a whole it will touch every surface.The main reason I gave poor Roomba a three star rating, is that it only makes it back to the base about half the time for me. Sometimes it gets wedged in underneath the cabinet. The other day it got stuck behind the door in the bathroom and just spun around till the battery died. But most comically, and where it gets stuck most, is next to a large floor vent in my hundred-year-old house. Two or three times a week I wake up to the room a next to the vent, telling me that it is stuck near a cliff.Again, for the price point, and the fact that I don’t have to physically vacuum my house. I would buy another one of these in a heartbeat.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2021

Review Text: After a year of use and almost 117 hours vacuuming according to the app, "Ruthie" has performed fairly well.  With a 90lb German Shepard and a cat, she has had her work to do.  I find she picks up the majority of the pet hair and many other things in her travels.  She does seem to get stuck semi frequently on a carpet in our dinning room when transitioning to it from hardwood floors.  Not a deal breaker for me as she goes places where I don't want to.  Under the couch and other hard to reach places are key to not having to move stuff while vacuuming.  **PLEASE NOTE**  Ruthie's battery went dead and she would not charge no matter how I positioned her on the dock.  I hoped the battery had not expired after only a year so I called iRobot help.  The first suggestion was to clean the metal connections.  The base had a small amount of dirt/grime on it's connectors.  Didn't appear to be enough to impede a charge but I cleaned them and that took care of it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021

Review Text: I started out a couple of years ago with my first robotic vacuum.  It was not a Roomba.  It worked pretty well, but always got stuck and died on uneven floors.  I ended up giving it to my ex-wife.  I'm in a wheel chair and really have trouble with a regular vacuum, so I decided to get a roomba.  I really wasn't expecting much.  So after charging it up I turned it loose.  I was so amazed.  The Roomba took that uneven flooring right in stride.  Didn't even slow down.  It was so amazing watching it navigate through every obstacle. And it picked up everything.  I have a dog with long white fur and he leaves it every where.  The Roomba found it and sucked it right up.The only thing that I don't like about it is that it didn't come with a remote control like my old one did.  It tells you to download an app to your phone, yada yada yada.  I don't have a fancy phone that I could do that with.  So I just touch the on/off button with my toe and off it goes.  It ran for around an hour and came back an docked itself into it's charger cradle.  I am very pleased with my unit and would recommend it to anyone.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2019

Review Text: I recently moved into a new 2-story home with wood laminate downstairs (carpet upstairs) and didn't want to bring my vacuum up and down the stairs to clean both areas. I decided to keep my vacuum upstairs and bit the bullet and bought a Roomba for downstairs. My downstairs area is quite small (approx. 650 sq. ft.) but I have a decent amount of furniture so it is not what I would call an "easy clean." I also have a dog and a cat who shed A LOT, and as any pet owner know, hair finds its way into every crevice possible. So far my Roomba has done an amazing job picking up pet hair and dirt downstairs. It easily cleans the floor and rugs and seems to get "smarter" with each use navigating around furniture/obstacles. It runs for close to two hours (until the battery runs low) then docks itself back at the charging station. The app is awesome and allows you to schedule cleaning times/days so you can start the cleaning mode while you're at work or away from home.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020

Review Text: I was very skeptical at first how well this machine works, and it turns out that it is the best vacuum cleaner I ever bought beside my old dyson. I gotta tell you I vacuumed with my dyson (not that it does not do a good job at all) but this roomba still gets to collect stuff that I probably missed while I vacuumed. My mother in law grinched when I bought this because it was $200 at the holiday season time, but I let her vaccines the house, then clean floors with mop, and then I tuned the rooomba on, only to be able to show her that this machine bipasses human good instincts when cleaning (LOL)So I only assume that if you buy the more high tech version of this product, the results should be higher. WORTH SPENDING YOUR MONEY if you want a really clean house!!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2020

Review Text: First of all, I love the idea of a robo vac. This was my first and for it to be able to turn it on and let it go is great. This does work amazing at picking up debris and hair on hardwood floors.The cons- I was very disappointed at the way it picks up hair on carpet. It just leaves so much behind, and the hair gets caught in the rollers, causing you to clean them pretty much after each use. It relys way too much on bumping into things to move, and for whatever reason, it will not move into my bedroom with carpet, it doesn’t like to go over the hardwood floor to carpet. I have to keep moving it in the room.Overall, this vacuum is great. It would be perfect for a household with no pets, and hardwood floors. If your like me with a animal that sheds and had some carpet, skip this one and look at a different model
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021

Review Text: Overall I love this vacuum. I program it to run while we’re all at work and it has to be rescued pretty much every day because it’s gotten locked in the bathroom or stuck or the battery died...but I don’t mind because my floors are CLEAN! It does a fantastic job on hard floors and probably gets 80% of my labs fur off the rugs. My biggest concern was our floors have high transitions (1/2” is the highest) but the Roomba handles it no problem.If it’ll drive you nuts to find/save your Roomba then get a higher tech option but if you don’t mind the random cleaning pattern and saving it then this option works great and is a much better price point to see if you’ll like it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019

Review Text: I wasn't sure what I was ordering when I bought the  Robot Roomba... what could it do that a vacuum cleaner couldn't do.... Wow, this wonderful machine quietly runs around a room getting in every corner, under chairs, and does a super job under the beds....we have nicked named him Jeffrey... he is a gem and I would suggest anyone looking to a machine to keep their floors and rugs in good shape think about buying this Robot...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021

Review Text: I like the ability to control through the app.  It seems to work well for picking up dog hair, however, the dust cup is small, and can't hold a lot of hair.  If you have multiple pets, you might want a different model.  It does have an issue with jamming if you do not pick up things prior to use (such as if drapes or tablecloths hit the floor).  the get caught in the roller, but the machine will send you a "help me" text!  This model has a random pattern, but seems to clean thoroughly throught the house.  Some of the upgraded models have a specific cleaning pattern, sweeping from side to side in even rows.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2021

Review Text: Doesn’t pick up cat litter, etc along the edges of rugs which is of course the dirtiest part of the house. And most of the litter that’s in the middle of the floor gets thrown towards said rug edges only to be left behind. I have to push all the crap far away from the rug edges before I run the thing. It does pick up cat hair off the rugs though. I can’t run it when I’m not home cause it’s not accurate unless I’m following behind it picking it up and putting it in different rooms. It’s only a 920 sq foot single level house... It’s still better than dragging out the heavy vacuum and fighting with cords so I would recommend getting one if your hopes aren’t too high. I bet the $1000 model works much better.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2020

Review Text: I have an ilife v5s and it worked great until after a year or so one of the wheels stopped turning. So I bought this roomba because I saw online that I can get new wheels from Roomba and replace them pretty easily. We have an old house with a lot of dust, so I figure it'll happen to the Roomba eventually also.The problem is that this one is taller than the ilife and the little camera nub on top keeps it from going under cabinets and things. It doesn't fit under the cabinet overhang in the kitchen, so it gets stuck under them, it doesn't even try to go under the vanity in the bathroom, it gets stuck trying to go under the entertainment center also.It also doesn't seem to pull up as much dirt and dust as the ilife.It isn't as good at docking either because the dock weighs less and it just pushes the dock around.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2020

Review Text: I love this!! . I got it for a Christmas gift and wasn’t sure it would work as good as it does.I have 2 dogs and it picks up the hair perfectly. (Short hair dogs)I have removed most all the rugs in my house due to potty training the puppy but have left all the door rugs. They are flat rugs and it rolls over them just fine. I did have to fold under the fringe on one of the rugs (honestly I didn’t want to even try- i figured if my upright vacuum can’t do it this little guy can’t)It’s a little louder than I expected but as long as it’s running during the day and  not in the evenings when we watch our tv shows it’s not an issue. It’s fun to watch and I have found myself talking to it :)It’s nice to be able to walk bare foot in the house and keep clean feet without any extra work :)Highly recommend! Super cool!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020

Review Text: This replaced my Samsung Powerbot. Paid nearly $600 for that. After a year it wouldn’t charge on the dock. Warranty sent a new dock but wouldn’t work still.Decided to get a Roomba. Little skeptical since it was half the cost. All I can say is wow.Sometimes it gets lost and can’t find its way back. Big deal. The $600 mapping Samsung did too.Downside is the rollers are much smaller and fit inside the wheels instead of running the full width of the machine. The side spinning brush doesn’t do much.The robot randomly bounces around. Everyday there is a bunch of hair and dirt in the catch bin so it’s definitely working. The bin is much larger than the Samsung I had.I ended up getting a second Roomba for my upstairs. Great value.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2020

Review Text: I purchased this robot vacuum to help keep up on the every day messes around our house. We mostly have hard wood floors with carpet only in our two bedrooms. We also have two dogs that shed like crazy, no matter what we do. I and my husband were constantly frustrated with the piles of dog hair that would accumulate around our house. Both working full time and spending only a couple hours each evening at home we didn't want to spend our nights, every night, vacuuming to keep up with the dog hair. So we purchased the vacuum to do the work for us. It has been amazing the difference in the state of our floors. I'm so in love with it and will deal with the few "issues" that I have with the robot. Personally I feel the robot is very loud when vacuuming, I'm not sure how people program it to run at night. It would keep me awake. I would prefer to run it at night as I'd rather not run it while I'm at work and potentially terrorize my dogs with this little vacuum running around. I'd been very disappointed if one of my dogs were to attack the vacuum and destroy it while I wasn't home. Second, when you tell it to go home, it still takes a good 5-10 minutes for it to find it's way back to home. The vacuum continues to clean and make circles till it gets close to the home base and can line up to dock. Neither of these issues are bad enough for me to not want to keep the vacuum, again because the flip side is my floors stay cleaner and I don't have to physically do the vacuuming. I will warn that the vacuum will not pick up every little spec, I never expected it to. But if that is a determining factor for you be warned. If you run it daily then yes eventually your floors will be darn near spotless as the vacuum runs in random patterns. So one day it may spend a lot of time running around your living room, the next it will run around your kitchen more. Over all your floors will be a lot cleaner with it running daily. I have not tried it on the carpet, and if I do I may come back and update the is review.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2019

Review Text: This thing works pretty well. My house is entirely hardwood floors and it's great to be able to run it a couple times a week and keep the floor clean enough for me to walk on barefoot without constantly getting stuff stuck on the bottom of my feet.Pros:- Easy setup and the app is easy to use- Seems to have good battery life. Cleans my 1450 sf house in one charge- Usually pretty good about getting itself unstuck from places like my bathroom rug and my 1" tall hearth- Easy to empty the bin and dump out the filter- I didn't pay $1000 for itCons:- Noisy- No mapping in this model means that sometimes it cleans the same room over and over while ignoring another roomOverall it works great for the price and I'm happy with it. I don't currently have pets so I can't speak to its ability to pick up pet fur, but I do have a messy toddler and it handles his trails of crumbs like a pro.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2019

Review Text: I had my last roomba for four years. This one is a complete dissapointment. Stopped being able to charge it after 3 months, complete waste of money. Before that would run it and could not tell the area had been done.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2020

Review Text: My absolute favorite!! I love that when I say it’s time to vacuum your room, my kids get excited that the roomba is going to clean they clean up anything left on there floors and close the roomba in there room, it vacuums under the beds and in the closets, which is amazing!! I also love that it cleans as I’m cleaning other parts of the house! Frees up so much time for me! We living in the country so it’s dirt and dust and all the messes w kids and the roomba has helped me stay on top of the messes! It vacuums while I spend that time with my husband and kids! Definitely recommend!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2021

Review Text: I have to admit that this was a Prime Day impulse purchase and I probably should have done more research. I have two cats and all hardwood or laminate flooring, no carpet. It seems to do really well with getting into corners and in places that are hard to reach like under a bed. I have an open floor plan, so  sometimes  I confine it to a small area to get it to clean thoroughly in one area at a time. It does well with the cat hair on the hardwood and Pergo flooring, but I have laminate flooring in the bathroom and it won’t pick up my hair. :-/ I wish it had better suction, but overall it does a good job, and it’s very easy to use with the app.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021

Review Text: This is probably one of the worst products I have ever used. I have always seen the commercials and have had a few friends who liked it and some who didn’t but decided to make my own decision.I purchased it and try setting it up. The phone app didn’t work at all. I am a pretty nerdy kid and gadget freak yet this was not easy to set up and after set up it still didn’t allow me to set up a time to make the iRobot work when I wasn’t home.The iRobot is not very smart and I didn’t even have carpet as my apartment is all hardwood floors. I would literally go in circles and every time itWould bump into anything or a door it would turn around and almost repeat its same steps over and over. After an hour of cleaning, I would say perhaps it cleaned 1/4 of my apartment and my apartment is not that big as I live in NY. Furthermore, it would get stuck under things like my heater/air conditions which is a floor unit as most are in NY. This IRobotHas the communication tab which is about 1” high and this gets stuck and I have to go and find it and pull out every Time. Just drove me crazy as this was supposed to be a self cleaner.I don’t think this product is honestly worth the cost.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2019

Review Text: So far I've only had this for close to a week and it has worked out better than I thought with my tiny 400 sqft studio. I purposely didn't vaccum and picked up the huge things I knew would be a problem and it has been working super well.I had to pull up my black runner rugs to get it to go into my kitchen and only had it get stuck once. Seeing how opposed it is to the color black, you could probably save on the barriers and just put down a black $10 rug haha!It has definitely cleaned up a lot. I've been running it every day to help with the cat hair and it has not disappointed me yet.My only issue is the smallness of the dust container. I wish it was a bit bigger it is about 1/3 of the tank size of my $50 black and decker.We shall see how long I'm loving it after using it for a few months.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   We used to have an Ecovacs brand and used it for more than 2 years before we decided it's time to get a new one. Because of good reviews, I decided to get this Roomba model. This has the strangest behavior. I have an area rug in our family room that has black prints on it. The Roomba sees it as an obstruction and avoids it. It took a video so you can see that it's avoiding the black prints on the rug. That's the area on the rug that needs cleaning the most as that's where the pet hair and dirt is most visible. I hope this can be fixed by a software update or something or this is going back.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2020

Review Text: I've had this since December.  I find myself constantly cleaning its workings, and it seems to be designed so that dirt spreads all over its insides.I was trying to replace the side brush today and the screw snapped off - it seems to be made of the cheapest softest metal imaginable.  I called Customer Service but they are unavailable, although I called within their posted hours. Similarly, their online chat service was not working.Sigh.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   Family with two cats here —We’ve tried multiple robot cleaners and as we found ourselves in the market for a new one, we thought this would be a great choice based on the reviews. However, because it only has one brush versus two like we’ve had in the past, it just couldn’t handle the job. We’d have to run it multiple times a day for it to have done a decent job and even then, it just didn’t meet our standards. Also, from day one it had a difficult time docking itself. It would either die before it could make it back, or struggle once it found the dock to place itself on top. We’ve not had this issue with other brands. Finally, after each job, I would have to clean hair and dirt out of the wheels and other parts of the vacuum. Again, didn’t have to do this with past robots & found it very tedious. We are returning this & getting a Eufy.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021

Review Text: We have had 3 Robot vacuum cleaners now. We use them daily and have hardwood/ carpet combo. The previous models were Deebot N79s and they actually worked really well. We were excited to “upgrade to the Roomba when getting a unit for another floor,” but honestly the Roomba is much noisier, does not pick up as many crumbs and debris with only 1 side brush(very frustrating), and rams into our baseboards and furniture like an oaf causing notice damage over time. I personally think this is a very competitive space and you can get a much better vacuum for less money if you don’t have to buy the Roomba name. Maybe their more expensive models are better, but this thing side by side to competitors is terrible. Battery life does seem to be better than others on Roomba though.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020

Review Text: This robot vacuum does an ok job picking up pet hair, crumbs etc when it actually gets to those areas. It somehow seems drawn to areas it will get stuck such as a higher pile carpet, a dining chair, or even under the edge of the fridge somehow. It seems to have an affinity for those spots because it goes for them each time and will try to go back into those same areas right after you ‘rescue’ it from being stuck. It also has a poor dock connection and is difficult to charge. I have to use a light hand weight on top of it to get it to charge now. I regret buying this and truly feel I should’ve spent more money and bought a better product.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2021

Review Text: I've had my roomba for a couple of weeks now and I'm loving it!Pros:Sweeps up dog hair (fine short weimeraner hair of 3 massive dogs)Sweeps up dust, dirt, and rocksSweeps cornersCleans up spilled dog food*It gets smarter and starts finding its way along edges and corners after 2 weeksConsMy hair gets wrapped around the brush that sweeps large debris up and I have to take it apart all the time to untangle itSometimes it can't find it's way into or out of roomsIt has lots of trouble docking on its ownOverall I really like it and can overlook the bad parts. I  only vacuum or sweep now on my own once a week compared to 3 times a day. This gets under furniture and into corners I had a hard time with. I run it twice a day and usually empty it out 3 times a day. I live on a farm with lots of mud and 3 big dogs that come in and out all day. This gets surface dirt on hardwood vinyl floors but not ground in. However it does amazing on rugs. I highly recommend this!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2019

Review Text: This is the best thing we received from our wedding registry. We have a golden retriever who sheds about half of himself every day onto our stained concrete floor, so there is constantly blonde chunks whisping around our apartment. This vacuum has been our saving grace. We run it a few times a week, usually emptying it once or twice during a run depending on how bad the floor is. The bin inside the vacuum is fairly small, but taking a few seconds to empty it is a much easier job than doing a full vacuum or mop of the floor. We love it and recommend it to all friends that are getting dogs.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2021

Review Text: I bought this to help in keeping dog hair off the floor in my new house. The first floor is entirely hardwood, so the hair from my dog is ready to spot. Sure, it does a good job getting must of the hair up and does pretty well on the rugs as well. However, the pattern it uses makes absolutely no sense. It goes from room to room to room in no pattern at all, often times visiting the same room multiple times for a couple minutes at a time. There's a reason this is the lower end model. If you're going to get a robot vacuum, spend a little more money and get a better model
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2021

Review Text: Is it what expected to be? No. But with some intervention it gets the job done. It’s been 4 days I’ve been using it. I live in a two bedroom apartment and have a kid and a cat. We have a center rug in the living room. Roomba hasn’t been able to get up on it yet. It’s probably too high for it.  For the rug, I use the spot clean setting. Still beats me doing the vacuuming. The cleaning pattern is crazy like a drunk person but I have learned to live with it. However, to clean the entire apartment, it runs out of charge (1.5 hours). And the job is not neat. So what I have started to is I would take the roomba to one room and close the door behind it. This way I have clean rooms and I don’t need to vacuum. I turn it on everyday and all I need to do is clean the bin after every use. like I said, it’s not perfect but good enough for me.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019

Review Text: Avoid this garbage like the plague. The damn thing can never find its way back to the charging dock, so we have to place it on the dock or else it'll just die in the middle of the room every single day. We don't even have that large of an area. I've tried leaving it inches in front of the dock and getting it to return, but it tries to get onto the dock once, gives up since it didn't line up just perfectly, then goes back to vacuuming. I've also seen it run directly over dirt/sand and it just doesn't clean it up. It'll take 3-4 times for it to get close to clean. Great idea, but terrible execution. Since this can't map the room and can't sense the dock from more than .1 inches away it gets really damn annoying to deal with it. This is the model they want you to get frustrated with so you buy a more expensive model than can actually not be terrible.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2019

Review Text: For all the hype on iRobot we had a cheapo one that was way better. This one always gets lost and always wants to stay in one area. It is the dumbest one I have seen due to it wants to clean the same area over and over again. And the program on it is dumb you can not do anything with it except start time. Our cheap one you could program it some like to follow base boards and then it would get the center of the rooms. For all the iRobot hype I thought this would be a lot better at tracking and learning rooms than it is. I guess you pay for name not quality with iRobot!!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019

Review Text: I live in a single-story home with hardwood floors. I bought this for me and my roommates as a Christmas gift and it has become a game changer. We also own a dog. All we do is turn it on and let it run every day. We don’t need to be home—it docks itself when the container is full.The only thing we need to do is hoist up the curtains at our windows (since they touch the floor) so that the Roomba doesn’t accidentally get stuck. But that’s with any vacuum, so it makes sense. Other than that, it does the job really well.The thing I enjoy most is that it cleans under the bed and behind furniture. C’mon... nobody wants to deal with that. Roomba does it for you.Highly recommend if you’re on the fence. It has saved us a lot of time having to sweep our floors multiple times a week.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019

Review Text: This one works great, don't get me wrong, but it collects sooo much debris it is ridiculous.  Where does it all come from???  One piece of advice regardless of the model...  prep your area before starting Roomba.  It can and will get stuck in odd places (corners, under table and chair legs, shaggy rugs, etc.).  Give it a chance to run wildly throughout the intended area without obstacles interrupting or confusing it.  In order to return to its cradle after about  90 or more minutes of continuous operation, it has to be in the path of the IR beam sent by the cradle in order to dock.  Otherwise, it will run out of battery somewhere in the house and stop.  It will send an SOS message to your cell though. One of them is funny when it gets stuck somewhere... Roomba needs your help at the edge of a cliff.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020

Review Text: The squeaker! It worked great for last month up until a week ago, it started making this horrible loud squeaking noise when cleaning and the brush on the front will stop spinning after about five minutes of cleaning. My husband took the brush off and cleaned the pet hair and debree from around it, but this is only a temporary fix until the next time it turns on to clean, where it does it again!! I expected far more from an Irobot vacuum, as i have owned a Deebot vacuum before and it didn’t have any problems at all for the first year i had it. It was quieter too. This vacuum is very loud before it started squeaking on top of the motor noise! Not super happy with this for the price.. i am going to request a new spinner brush for the front and if that doesn’t help with the problem, i am unsure what my next course of action will be.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2020

Review Text: This was a purchase that was sort of experimental.  My fiancée wanted nothing to do with a robot vacuum, but we were vacuuming two to three times a week to pick up animal and working dirt and hair (we are horse/cattle people with dogs, animal hair and dirt finds its way in daily).  We have loved this machine.  It runs every day without an issue.  The suction is powerful, the dogged determination of the machine is almost anthropomorphic, and my fiancée is talking about getting a second for upstairs.  Well worth the purchase.  A note, we have to clean the rollers weakly to keep built up hair from interfering with function
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2021

Review Text: I run this guy 3x a week, and the bottom of my beds have never been cleaner. It’s good to run when you’re not home and don’t have pets that will go barking after it. I recommend a rumba to everyone who’s tidy because it helps me so much!However:1. you must pick up all ropes, strings, clothes so tidy people will likely find this more useful. Otherwise, he gets stuck and there goes the entire session unless you can untangle and move him.2.
