Sometimes his home base is right in front of him and when you press “Dock,” he still runs around for a while before actually docking3. Sometimes he’s circling the dock and doesn’t actually dock. Needs assistance and some cleaning of the dock/cords around the station and under the rumba. I’ve had him for about a month and sometimes he’s confused.4. It’s really annoying watching him bounce back and forth and not picking up the one thing you want him to. Probably best to leave him alone and run him more often to pick up the dirt when you’re not watching.5. Loud. I usually schedule him to run downstairs while I’m upstairs still asleep. He’s loud though, so it’s not super pleasant. Because I have a dog, I can’t run him while I’m not home, so I’m stuck doing it in the morning. Door closed, it’s not too bad.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021

Review Text: I had a Roomba many years ago for a new product worked very well at the time  and never had the problems I have now.  The batteries died and very expensive to replace. I have always wanted another one.  Finally I settled on the 675 roobma vaccines I arrived and I couldn't wait to use it.  I have it for 2 months and I don't think it is gong to get bettrr.  It picks up a.Log of dirt and some hair.  I kept it often do it is not jammed.with hair, take the rollers it and remove any hauntings wheels. Follow all the manual,'s instructions.  It seems not to pick up the stairwell I keep going around with it to brush hair in it's path.  Sometimes it picks it up and than outdoors it out usually in a nice little round ball.  If.I could I would.return it and maybe upgrade but it.is to late I think it is 2 months. So I guess I will have to keep it and continue t regret the purchase and continue to be very disappointed. I certainly will let people kw.  I am so sad.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2019

Review Text: I bought this on Prime Day as a treat for myself! I know, I know but I've been wanting one for some time and when something is on sale I can't help myself. Anyways. I was really looking forward to using my Roomba. Once I got it all charged up I quickly had it start a "job". It completely missed my office though! Huh, weird. Well maybe next time! Nope. Missed it again. No weird entry, door, anything blocking. Nothing. When it finally went into the office (probably 3rd time trying) the 3 prong rotating brush (not clear on part names) caught on the end of a rug. This stopped the job (which I understand) and led me to go help it out. Except it broke off!!! I have used the Roomba less than 5 times and something already broke! Really?!? Ugh. Granted the replacement part is like $10 but on principle I'm disappointed to already have to buy something for it. Be prepared to do the same.Other areas to note: it misses parts in each room. I can still see cat litter throughout the house both randomly and in chunks (where didnt go over spot at all). Disappointing since this was part of why I wanted to purchase! The cat hair and litter bits.Also it's WAY louder than thought it'd be. Won't be running while baby naps, I'm working from home or need to concentrate. I'd recommend running when you know you'll be out running errands.Overall I dont know if I just got my hopes up but it doesn't replace what a human can do by any means. I'll still be vacuuming the house...to go over what the Roomba missed!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021

Review Text: took a 1 cup measure of dry potting soil, dog hair and flour and spread that in the living room and hallways. it has 2 complete cycles to prove itself to me... once tonite and the other tommorow. failure to impress will result in it being returned. despite the positive reviews i have reservations based on the fact that a person could do a much much better job - more complete* than this thing with a vacuum cleaner in less time. as it stands right now these things seem more like a novelty then being harcore practical. i have no doubt that they will become truly impressive with time but i dont think they are there just yet.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020

Review Text: I finally decided to buy a robot vacuum. After a mediocre experience many years ago with my roommate’s off brand robot vacuum, I knew I wanted a Roomba. The 675 is one of the less advanced models, but it’s affordable. I tell friends that it cleans like a child: easily distracted, repeats the same spots over and over, and gets stuck in tight spaces, but it saves my back and gets most of the dirt and pet hair in the house. So far, it has only damaged one edge of one piece of furniture. If you take a few minutes to Roomba-proof your house, it makes the cleaning cycle more efficient. I enjoy having it, and in a few years I’ll buy a newer model.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2020

Review Text: We have 3 dogs and grandkids ruing all over. So keeping my floors clean was a little overwhelming. After putting in dark hardwood flooring on my main level, (about 600 square feet) my floor never seemed clean. It always felt gritty to my bare feet. But after adding our Roomba “lil Hoe” my floors are always clean. No more dust, no more grit. She even keeps up with the dark hair from my 125 pound Great Dane puppy. She is amazing. I have her set to run every day. I do need to clean out her dust bin, and clean her sensors and brush often, but my floors are amazing! I love lil Hoe, she is much more effective than kids, and knowing she is going to start in the morning before school motivates us to keep the floor clean all the time! Get a Hoe for yourself, because ours is taken.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2020

Review Text: We been using this for a while now and it's terrible. It doesn't clean well at all .... just spreading whatever in on the floor. There hasn't been a day that its not dead somewhere in the house because it either run out of "juice" and never made to the base or it got stuck somewhere. Don't buy this garbage to clean your house. Look elsewhere! Very disappointed!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2020

Review Text: It seems like such a non needed splurge item, but I’m in love with our Wall-E! I love that it’s preset to run on specific days/times, and that I can control it with my Echo dot. I have hardwood floors and a low rug and it works perfect. I do have to empty it every time it runs, so kind of a downer, but the self emptying one is very pricey. I wouldn’t suggest this for carpets. We ran it on our upstairs carpet and while it is much quieter on carpet, I had to cut a lot of hair etc off of the brushes. It seems like a silly thing to buy, but I really do love it, and haven’t swept since we bought it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021

Review Text: Like how it’s easy to start a cleaning and just let it go for 15, 30,or 45 minutes. I wish it had the mapping tech but that would be the more newer models and more expensive. Had to buy 3 of the virtual wall barriers for my house and it’s fine manually turning those on when need be. Don’t like how it takes forever to Dock after its cleaning cycle is over if it’s far from the dock. Wish it would just end its cycle and go dock instead of taking another 15-30 mins cleaning until it randomly is in range and Docks. Is a little loud on tile but cleans enough. Deep clean still takes a regular vacuum on tile.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021

Review Text: I named him Alfred. He runs 3 times a week all over my downstairs common areas. I have the iRobot app on my phone and I have set a schedule for Alfred so I don't have to do much. He runs for a little over an hour. Sometimes he makes it back to his base on his own or sometimes he dies in another room. He's not as powerful as my big vacuum, but he keeps my floors clean even with 2 pups who shed quite a bit, since he runs several times a week. I vacuumed really well before I started him on his schedule to take over and he's managed to maintain my floors all by himself for several weeks now. He does a good job on my carpet, tile, and hardwood. I couldn't be happier for the price although my pups don't love him as much as I do.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2021

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   Ok.... So I’ve literally only had it for a few hours lol and after set up it had enough battery power to clean and at least show me a little bit what it can do. I personally love it because it does what I wanted it to do which was pick up the cat hair that seems to be appearing even right after vacuuming and sweeping. No it does not deep clean as it can’t fit into every crease and crevice of your house... so if you’re looking for it to look like a maid just left your house then don’t bother buying it. But if you would love some help keeping your house tidy but still having to sweep and or vacuum occasionally as it helps to keep the dust and cat hair down to a minimum, then I would say this is a yes for you. Knowing that it was coming today I didn’t sweep because I wanted to see how much it could actually pick up and what it would possibly leave behind. Well as you can see a lot!!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2020

Review Text: Very easy to set up and use (I didn't download the app). It is loud and in bumps into things with some force, but hasn't caused any damage to furniture that I've noticed. I did have a loose piece of quarter round on the baseboard in my kitchen and it pushed it completely off, but was an easy fix. It does bump around pretty randomly, but gets the job done. You do have to pick things up before you run it, but if you like clean floors and have kids and/pets, go ahead and buy it. It's not perfect but it's better than spending time sweeping and vacuuming! Better for using when you are out of the house (I had planned on running it at night, but even in a 2 story house it's too loud and kept waking me up). Overall, I'm happy with my purchase and do recommend.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020

Review Text: The 675 wasn't able to clean my space (about 1000 sq ft) like I had hoped. It misses spots and got hung up on things like going from hard floor onto a rug. Not worth it for me. In its defense our space was pretty large and has furniture and lots of 90º angles. Without having any navigation memory features it just isn't able to handle the space efficiently. I'll need to get the more advanced models with better navigation. I think this would work well for a smaller space.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2020

Review Text: I waited until this model was available for $200.  At that price it is a good value.  Works well.  Of course it lacks some of the features available on higher end models but those cost a fortune.  I would like it to do "mapping" of rooms as it cleans but this one uses the "random" approach of wandering and bumping into stuff.  Still, it eventually finds it's way around the entire space.  Cleans well.  Dust bin is small on all of these so I generally empty and clean the dust bin after use.  Time will tell how long it lasts, battery, filter etc.  But after a months use I'm very satisfied and bought one for another family member as well
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2021

Review Text: This has the potential to be the best purchase I have every made.  When it does its job, I absolutely love it.  However, it is near impossible to get it to charge and has been this way from the beginning.  Trying to get it on the dock just right to get it to charge it very frustrating.  And when it tried to do it itself, it cannot get on properly.  Almost every time I need to use it, it is sitting on the dock with a dead battery.  According to my sister if you take the back off, it will charge.  I am currently testing this, but the point of having this is to not have to worry about sweeping and vacuuming.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2019

Review Text: I’m not a huge fan of using it on my hardwood floors only because it will often push stuff away as it goes by, eventually it will come back around and get it (usually). On my carpets I really enjoy using it! Cleans up so much dust and hair that you didn’t even think was there! It could be better at detecting before it runs into things. It doesn’t seem to have any rhyme or reason on where it cleans and how it detects when it has completed its job. Overall battery life is pretty decent. I have a 1600 sq ft house and I usually have to use it in two sessions but if I clean upstairs and then start it is usually close to finished when I’m done cleaning downstairs and then I let it charge and then move it downstairs. It does great detecting not to fall down the stairs but sometimes will ramp over things like my sons baby swing legs and get stuck. The alerts are nice one my phone letting me know when it needs charged, is stuck, or needs my attention because it tries to suck up a stray sock. Over all I’m satisfied. I use it about 3 times a week.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020

Review Text: If you’re neat and stuff and actually like cleaning, you might not approve. However, if you’re a normal person who wants to arrive at their grave with the least amount of lifetime spent cleaning, this is your guy. It’s a no-brainer. This lil beast vacuums my apartment 5 times a week. You have to baby-proof your space, but once you do, ohhhh, it’s truly sublime. It randomly beebops through five rooms and gets literally everything, almost every time. If it misses, it’ll get it tomorrow. I will have a robot vacuum for the rest of my life.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021

Review Text: Except for a couple of area rugs, there is no carpet in my house at all and the Roomba does a great job of picking up debris, as in grass that falls off my tennis shoes, dropped Fritos, etc., from my hard floors and rugs  The app downloaded to my phone works great.  The Roomba beeps if she is in trouble.  (I say "she" because we named her Cinderella.)  All in all, we are very pleased with her performance.A couple of minor complaints:  She seems to have a preference for some rooms over others.  She has worked the study to death and ignored a bedroom.  And a couple of times she seems to get lost and does not dock herself to recharge.  Both concerns are easy to fix by picking up the Roomba and moving her to the desired location. Doing so is still much easier than running a vacuum cleaner.I actually find it interesting to watch her work as she bounces and dances around the house vacuuming our floors.  I think of it as the Roomba Rhumba.  But then I have been self-quarantined for a long time..
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2020

Review Text: The point of purchasing this vacuum was so that I didn't have to worry about the day to day maintenance of my floors. This is the most needy piece of machinery I own. Constantly stuck on "cliffs" (my rug) and getting stuck under numerous items in my home. I've raised several low pieces of furniture but Roomba seems to find a new thing every week to have issue with. It has a 10% success rate of finding the docking station after cleaning. It's in an easy to access location with no obstacles. It will not connect to the charging base, it's incredibly finicky. I can spend 10 minutes adjusting it around and making sure the connection plates are clean to no avail. Waste of money, and far more of an annoyance than a weekly vacuuming. I gave it 9 months to figure it out but the product just kept getting worse.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2020

Review Text: This is a noisy stupid vacuum. I replaced a vacuum that died too quickly made by Samsung with this vacuum, It's terrible. Constantly stuck under furniture, goes over and over the least needed areas of the room. I hardly use it because the noise is obnoxious and it can't be left alone due to getting stuck in the same areas over and over. I am so disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2019

Review Text: This is my third Roomba.  First I owned a cheaper model my kids bought me for Christmas. I was in love. This was the closet thing to a maid I would ever get!!!  Then ‘she’ had charging problems and luckily Bed Bath and Betond took her back. With the credit I upgraded. Then she went into storage while we built our home. She didn’t work after we unpacked. I found this one on Amazon. It is actually slightly lower grade than my second but NO complaints!!!!  I love that they have added technology.  I can start her up when I am at work. I get an alert when she is done cleaning. Sometimes she will get stuck and I get an alert as well as an alarm to help locate her!  I am considering a second one so my home can be split in half...this one doesn’t teach to the far end of the house even though I have her in as central a location as possible.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019

Review Text: She doesn't go systematically like my sisters. She kind of willy nillys around the house, but it always gets everywhere.  she also fails to return home a lot, and just sort of passes out in the middle of the room, thus her drunken reputation. but my floors have never looked so good!!!! worth the money!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018

Review Text: I was very sceptical about these but went on the recommendation of my daughter. It has changed my life (or at least my cleaning routine ). It does take some getting used to, but give it a week and you won’t be able to live without it ! As shown in my photo it picks up pet hair. It appears to be randomly going around my hardwood floors but must work on some kind of internal grid because it doesn’t miss much. Before this purchase I swept my floors approximately 3x per week  because of cat hair.  This goes around every morning while I shower and get dressed and picks up a full bin if dust! I wouldn’t run it when not at home if you own pets but I think it’s perfectly fine to run while I do other things. ( it once ran over my cat’s tail bc he was too lazy to move) Occasionally it gets stuck but I just go around and do a quick pick up to make sure I get maximum results. I hadn’t planned on using it on my deep pile carpet, but was amazed at how great a job it did! The room looked as though I had used a full size vacuum! Get one! You won’t regret it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2019

Review Text: Got it on sale for below $180. It doesn't vacuum in certain pattern but wandering all over the place, bouncing like a ping-pong. That makes it missing spots here and there not very sufficient especially taking more than an hour to vacuum some area normally would take 30 minutes. Therefore, the battery doesn't last long enough for the machine to finish up a decent size room. The side brush got bent very easily and at time, by design, it doesn't brush at all. Other brushes seem to be durable and can easily be replaced w/o hefty costs. Since I cannot afford expensive one, I am not really happy with it but will keep it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2020

Review Text: My apartment is significantly cleaner now that this little guy cleans it on a schedule. Kinda noisy, but what do you expect with a vacuum on wheels?He does eat things he's not supposed to sometimes. I found a cell phone charger in the middle of the living room the other day, which had been pulled out by the cord. Another time, he got stuck on a cliff. When I came home, he was sitting on a cell phone charging cord. Another time, he started cleaning, went straight into the bathroom, knocked a roll of toilet paper off the rack (it's a little rickety), proceeded to eat half of the roll, and then went home and went to sleep since he was full.Overall, a good purchase, and I'd do it again. I just have to make sure there's nothing on the floor that he shouldn't eat.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020

Review Text: I love my Roomba.  It doesn't deep clean but if you deep clean then let your Roomba pick up after the family on an every other day basis, it's great.I have mostly hard floors and the battery has pretty good life .  Carpet takes more battery, but not bad and it docks itself and recharges automatically.As an extremely busy mom, wife, and professional who is gone from home a lot, it makes me feel so much better about the appearance of my house.  It has been worth the expense.It has a small collection chamber so has to be emptied with every other use or so, if you live on a farm and have a wood stove, indoor dog, and a 7 year old boy. =)Highly recommend.  It was recommended to me by my cousin, who loves hers as well.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020

Review Text: UPDATE: Roomba customer service reached out to me asking if I had decided to repair the robot. I told them what I essentially what I wrote below, and they said they understood, and were going to fix the robot for free. So thumbs up for customer service.Product defective from day one. Wouldn't connect to the wifi. So I used the manual buttons to run. Did decent job of cleaning for 2 months. Then it just stopped working. I contacted them support team and was told it was actually a 614 robot and that it would cost $135 to fix. Won't buy refurbished from this seller ever again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021

Review Text: I bought this roomba after having a generic robot vacuum for many years. With the name and the reviews I thought it would be an upgrade. It was not! When comparing this roomba to my previous generic, it only has one circular spinning brush versus the two on the generic. Because of this is do see roomba spreading items versus sucking them up. Oh and It’s loud!!!!! Very loud. You can’t watch TV or even concentrate while it’s running. It’s sensors to avoid bumping  into items is not consistent. It crashes into items without using the sensors to lightly approach it. When it dies, it doesn’t drive itself back to the charging station like others, instead it dies where it dies, and if you’re not paying attention it could be anywhere. It’s a pain really. It did not come with cleaning brushes to clean out the dust compartment so trying to clean that is not easy. Finally, and here’s the cherry on top, it started making a squealing noise after 45 days. Like an animal dying squealing noise! Now I’ve cleaned it out entirely, and still no change. After weighing how much stress this has caused me, I completed a refund request and will be buying another generic option.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2021

Review Text: I hate vacuum cleaning and cleaning in general and Roomba is making my home soooo much cleaner. I have a slight allergy and I appreciate the fact that I can breathe better when there is less dust. I have Roomba clean our apartment every other day. I also love that it's possible to set up a schedule for it, so there is no need to turn it on even, it starts automatically.We have dark grey carpets and is perfectly capable to navigate those. It occasionally gets stuck, but it's not a big deal. It occasionally can't find it's home base which isn't a big deal either.The only thing that's annoying is cleaning the brushes from hair. I spend maybe half an hour doing that every 2 months or so, and nobody in our household has very long hair
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2020

Review Text: I've purchased several off brand robotic vacuums and this is the first time I've regretted one.  I opted for the name brand because with the other ones I have to replace them about once a year.  This vacuum is terrible, first off the app doesn't work.  We tried  several different devices and it doesn't connect, so there's no way to control it.  Second, there's only 1 brush, on one side instead of multiple like other vacuums.  It basically doesn't work, and I'll be looking into returning it and getting a cheaper generic one again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2021

Review Text: This is my 3rd robotic vacuum cleaner and I am extremely disappointed with it. I actually hate using it. My other 2, a Eufy and  Cordey are great. In fact my Eufy was basically destroyed by my dogs, taped up and runs like a new one. My issue with the Roomba is there are NO controls, remote, or ability to change different modes. As an IRobot I expected more. Both my others have remotes that you can control suction, where you want it to sweep (around the edges, spot, or all over), and controls the movement of the robot separately.  The Roomba does none of that. Go with a cheaper sweeper!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2021

Review Text: Did not expect great suction from such a small appliance not that it would be able to get corners, BUT that said, it does an amazing job of finding its way around the house. It can even find its way over the foam mats in the kitchen,  gently leap up over throw rugs and go from my low pile carpet to the vinyl flooring.It is best to deep vacuum to get the Roomba doing its great little job of maintaining the floors and it works beautifully with Alexa to set up a routine. I gave this to my daughter for her birthday and it is a real time and effort saver for her.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2021

Review Text: I’ve had my roomba for about 3 months now and overall really love it. It does have its pros and cons thoughPro:- I have long hair and it picks up all of it. I don’t have pets but I imagine it’d be good for pet hair too- So easy to use especially with Alexa integration. I literally just tell Alexa to start my roomba and that’s that!- Does seem to do well on both hard wood and carpeted areas. My apartment is about 70% carpet, 30% faux woodCons:- I can see how people think it’s a little loud. I don’t mind it while I’m reading or relaxing, but it’s hard to take meetings (currently working remote) with it on. When I watch the while it’s running, I turn up my tv volume a few notches- As shown in the picture, it kind of beats itself up with how many walls it rams into. After the first few runs, it was pretty scratched up on the bumper. It doesn’t bother me though- it is super good at picking up hair but I have to clean it out of the bristles every few weeks. The hair will really build up- It’s a little dramatic when transitioning from carpet to non carpet occasionally because it thinks it’s near a cliff. Sometimes it’ll go to clean my bath mat and I’ll have to go move it because it can’t get off the bath mat because it thinks it’s near a cliff- It seems to favor certain parts of my apartment as it’ll spend 75% of its time cleaning certain areas as opposed to others. This is consistent every time I run my roomba. It might just be that those areas really are super dirty- it doesn’t clean on dark carpet. This is the most annoying part for me. There are tons of YouTube videos on this but because of the way the infrared sensors work for making sure it doesn’t actually drop off a cliff, it doesn’t work on super dark colored carpets.Overall I super love my roomba and would definitely purchase again. I think the most annoying thing for me is the dark carpet issue but even with that, this purchase was still worth it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2021

Review Text: Loving my roomba!  Our floors are clean in places they have never been clean before.  It gets under beds and furniture.  At first I placed it in an out of the way spot in the front of the house.  I kept getting lost and was unable to find its way back to base.  I tried placing the base towards the center of the house and it returns to base every time.  Our house is 2400  square feet, so it does not do the entire house each time.  It runs for around 90 minutes.  If I was able to do it again, I would have spent the extra $200 for the smart mapping kind.  It goes up onto our large area rugs and carpet without a problem.  It kind of shoves around the smaller rugs and bath mats.  It’s picks up soooo much hair, fur, and dust bunnies.  We have a cat and a dog, and all of the floor fur is gone.  Wishing I had gotten a roomba sooner.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019

Review Text: We got this on sale and when we removed our carpet and changed our downstairs to hardwood. The ability to have it run while we sleep is nice and it works pretty good if you don’t have a lot of stuff around the floor to block it up or prevent it from cleaning. We have multiple German shepherds and the amount of shedding that goes on is over the top for any GSD lovers, you know what I mean. This picks up the hair nicely though and saves a ton of effort and need to vacuum downstairs. Just need to make sure to empty the container once every morning and you won’t have any issues! The app allows for you to schedule whatever time you want it to run as well, which of course I have it going when we are sleeping.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2019

Review Text: How did I live so many years without one of these!????? OMG, We just bought a new home, and the previous owner had a pet before.... keep in mind that I love my house sparking clean..... Roomba for 5 days straight keeps getting pet hair out of every corner of the house....I am not even sure where this hair was hiding, I could not find it otherwise I would have cleaned it. This is my new BFF, works for me when I am working.... I don't have to worry about vacuum, or having pet hair in my house!  The only thing I do is pick up Yute rugs that are a little thick and she might get stuck... The app sometimes does not work, but when it does, it is awesome! Absolutely love it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2020

Review Text: I’ve had my Roomba for at least 2 weeks and it definitely makes a difference in the amount of dog fur and human hair all over the house. It is pretty big, definitely much larger than a basketball. I can say that it is NOT silent on hardwood floors (but not as loud as a regular vacuum) and it does bump into objects pretty hard (knocked over a mini Christmas tree on a stool). I had to pick up all fuzzy rugs, bath mats, bedding, extension cords, etc to prevent the Roomba from getting stuck. On at least 2 occasions, it cleaned for 1 hr 40 mins but the battery died before it could make its way back to the dock on its own. The app is easy to use, I schedule the Roomba to run on days that I need to get up early as another alarm.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020

Review Text: Set up was easy, works with Alexa through the I robot skill.  This was on sale from the Truck, so I was a little apprehensive about this purchase.  It was well worth the money.  Phone app will  notify you when it is done or if it is stuck.  Cleans good after running for a month can see the difference in the carpet clean.  con Small collection box fills up, but if you use it weekly it seems to be more then enough to handle collection.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2020

Review Text: Started working from home as many of you.  Well, that means I was expected to have the house clean at all costs.  But with so much work that wasn’t happening.  Finally decided to buy the Roomba and put it right to work.  This thing rocks!  Set it and let it do it’s thing.  I was very surprised at the amount of fuzz, hair and dirt it picked up.  My wife was very suspect about this purchase but after coming home to clean floors she’s a new believer and blessed our first home robot!  I’ve already had to remove all the hair from the brush rollers after one day of cleaning all 4 bedrooms.  Really does a great job.  Highly recommend so you can focus in on work and have piece of mind your floors are being cleaned up!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020

Review Text: I have had a Roomba for three years and it’s been run daily. It’s one of the top five products that I have ever bought. It keeps my big house clean at an incredibly low price per use. I have four separate levels that it cleans. I used to very rarely vacuum now it’s vacuumed daily. I buy the spare parts and clean and maintain the Roomba regularly. The only frustration is that it gets stuck under a couple things and never learns to not get stuck in those spots. All in all it’s great timesaver and improvement.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020

Review Text: I read many reviews for the iRobot Roomba 675. Most were very favorable so I decided to get one. I think if I lived in a house that was sparsely furnished and laid out linearly it might be successful. That is not what I have. I live in a 1790's large home with very large rooms. The Roomba will never be able to find its way back to its charger, it doesn't stay in one room long enough to clean it, and it smashes into furniture like a blind person on crystal meth.  On a positive note, if I lock it in a bedroom with little furniture, it does a half way decent job and cleans under the bed-- a job I despise with a conventional vacuum. Last night I was upstairs watching tv and heard a strange noise downstairs, It was the Roomba, which magically went on a dust-busting expedition by itself. I found it dead and hung up on a door tread this morning. The other issue I have is that I've never been able to properly download the app so I could operate it wirelessly. That doesn't matter much to me but it might to someone in the right style house with no furniture.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2019

Review Text: I bought this back in November 2019 it stopped charging a couple months ago, I wrote roomba to see if they could help me diagnose the problem,  first this,  they told me my receipt and purchase showed that I bought a 675, but my serial number shows that it's actually a 655! Not only did this thing not last even a year with me cleaning it every use and caring for it it still stopped charging! Then to find out that I didn't actually purchase what I bought makes it even more upsetting. Review your sellers people,  or you'll be ripped off! Now roomba is telling me that I didn't purchase this from am authorized dealer and they cannot honor warranty! Lesson learned!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2020

Review Text: We have named him MouseDroid and I love this dumb machine. We take bets in the morning where he’ll be stuck, because 3 out of 5 days he’s somewhere stuck or dead battery.Despite all that he does suck up our cat fur and my shedding hair. The floors look much better than they have been in a while. We have him run while we’re at work, but before we go we clear up the floor of large items and cords.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020

Review Text: While this unit did a great job cleaning up my apartment, it really is next to worthless.1. The unit does not move with any logic. when it bumps against something, it would rotate roughly 120 degrees and move off diagonally. when it does this, it misses large areas. very rarely would it try to move around the object.2. After only 2 months of use, the included docking station stopped working3. 90% of the time it failed to move back to the dock to charge. I would  have to hunt it down (a major pain when it was under furniture, and have to place it back on the dock.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2021

Review Text: I bought the iRobot Roomba 675, which was $200 at the time of purchase. After comparing all the Roomba models, it seemed to me that all the extra features of the higher-end models were unnecessary. It does a pretty good job overall of picking up dirt and other debris on a wood floor, but if you prefer to have things really clean, you'll still have to hand-sweep once every few days. You can control it with your phone, and it tells you if there is any issue. If you're only trying to vacuum a certain area, you will need to physically block off the area or separately purchase a laser blocker. Even though I use it for the same area, it will occasionally get stuck. After it's done cleaning, it will automatically go back to its charger, which is a nice feature. It is a little bit on the louder side, but if you're not in the same room while it's cleaning, it's a non-issue.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2019

Review Text: It would not pick up debris from hardwood floors. Even when I had it run on a small area for even an hour you couldn't tell that any cleaning had been done. Surely it picked up some, because I did have to empty the dustbin. Unfortunately not nearly enough to make the floors look clean. It seemed to be working a bit better on carpet. What drove me crazy also is its completely random manner of traversing the layout. If I wanted to make sure an area really got cleaned properly, I had to put up all sorts of barriers to confine the Roomba to this area. I realized that took me longer than just picking up a vacuum myself to clean. Even with the patience or confidence that eventually its random pathways would reach every part of an area, I couldn't just leave it to it because it often would get stuck with an error.I can attest that it does pick up long hair because after only two uses I had to cut it off painstakingly from the brush.I have sent it back because it was in no way doing the job I expected it to do.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2020

Review Text: What I like about this Roomba is that it is not that expensive. I use it between the times my cleaning lady comes. I make sure it goes under the beds every week as I have allergies and it cleans very well. We have a long haired dog and it cleans up her fur well. I have to remove it from around the brushes. It picked up a bunch of tissues under our guest bedroom from under the bed. What I dislike most is that it just goes without a system or organized path. It just randomly cleans but I'm OK with that as I did not want to spend a lot for a more expensive Roomba. It serves my need.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2020

Review Text: I bought the Roomba 675 because I saw it worked well with pet hair and I own 3 dogs and 2 cats (plus my roommates 2 cats at the time of this writing). I really should have done more research before I purchased this and I've had this Rooma since March 22, 2020...Pros: works great on LIGHT colored carpet, easy to maintain (I use a dog grooming brush to clean the bristles of the copious amounts of animal fur), it's easy to locate with the location chime, and the app is pretty straightforward with reminders to clean the brushes and change out the filter.Cons: if you have ANY dark marks on the carpet, the stupid things sensors will get stuck because it detects a "cliff" which will then require you to move it to a new location before it can resume operations; it doesn't have very good mapping technology. It goes around the same way and has completely missed rooms and obvious spots of my 1200 sq ft house (half of which I don't even have it clean!) even after I set it up over the uncleaned spots; the battery doesn't last very long (1-1.5 hours of run time before it dies) so if you have a large house you will need more than 1 to clean all of your floors. The battery has died just doing my bedroom, which is only 120 sq ft.Overall, just having it do my bedroom is mostly awesome but the rest of my house is never clean unless I manually vacuum or sweep it. Either the battery dies before it finishes, it gets stuck on the dark patterns on my large living room rug and I refuse to get it since it happens CONSTANTLY (at least 5-6 times in the same spots each time it runs; hence why I say the mapping technology is rubbish), or it just doesn't go into the other rooms.I wish I had gotten a different Roomba...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2020

Review Text: I have two cats so there is always a lot of cleaning to do.  I thought having a roomba would remove a bit of stress from my life by cleaning my apartment when I'm at work.  Unfortunately, it can't handle my rug; you know, the thing you would want to vacuum most?The picture is of the roomba "stuck near a cliff".  The "cliff sensors" are there so the roomba won't fall down stairs.  It "sees" the dark sections of my rug (which are navy blue) as "cliffs" and I have to "rescue" it 4-5 times every time I have it run.I have a 700 sq. ft, single-floor apartment, so there's no where for it to fall, but iRobot makes no provision for people like me and doesn't seem interested in it, either.  There are videos out there of people taking their roombas apart to disable the sensors, but obviously this isn't a  great situation.  All it would take is a software checkbox to disable this protection for people for whom it isn't an issue.I'm going to keep the roomba and replace my rug eventually, because it does keep my house much cleaner than I was doing, but its pretty irritating and I thought it'd be reasonable to let others know about this issue.  Otherwise, the roomba actually works pretty well and is pretty impressive at getting out of tight spots.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019

Review Text: DO NOT waste your money we bought one 5 months ago it worked for two months then quit working then a month a go it decided to charge and work again for three days then quit again my husband found reviews on this on i robot in google play and it was nothing but negative reviews for the same thing and other stuff again DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS POS.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2020

Review Text: First off after reading all the 2 stars and below I have discovered that people are letting the world know they are slops. Pick your s#$% up people and the thing will work.Ok so why I gave it 3 stars and returned it. I have dark area rugs on my wood floor. After going tech support with amazon this is what the manufacturer stated. "If the floor color is too dark, Roomba can mistake these surfaces for a cliff and will try to back away from them or eventually stop with an error 6. This is unavoidable in certain situations, use Virtual Walls to confine Roomba to desired areas. "Yes, would of been nice to be in the description of the product from iRobot.  Works great on wood floors. Hair does get tangled up in the brush but really that's unavoidable . It;s called MAINTENANCE people!! It's a machine that gets dirty, of course you have to maintain it.In final, I would own this if I didn't have dark rugs. That is all.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2019

Review Text: Our household has quite a few furry animals. I purchased Roomba to help maintain the floors daily and in between regular cleanings. We are 1 week into our Roomba, now named Barnibus, and it is a regular part of our family. We have only had one major incident when the big fluffy dog didn’t move out of the way of Barnibus’ daily route and now, the dog moves. I wish the docking port was heavier as Barnibus sometimes moves it when going home or cleaning and it confuses it, but otherwise I love my Roomba, it really has helped keep the hair as minimal as possible.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2021

Review Text: We love our “Rosie”, we named her after the cleaning robot on the jetsons. She has sucked up a puzzle piece or two, but I was able to get them out of her tray no problem. She does not like the fringe on our bathroom rug, and I get an alert on my phone when she hits it. She goes over all our rugs except the thick shag like rug we have in the living room. She has gotten stuck under the cabinet a time or two and she has a tendency to “finish” cleaning while under our bed, so I have to get on my app and tell her to return home. She has yet to actually return to her dock on her own. She does a great job cleaning up everything including dry playdoh and she offers so much entertainment to this mama... my girls are terrified she is going to “eat a toy” so they keep their toys picked up off the floor. Kind of weird that I talked about our vacuum like a person but she really is great.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019

Review Text: Good but not greatI’ve had my roomba for a little under a year now while it’s good it’s not as great as I thought. I live with laminate flooring through out and yes this thing picks up every single piece of dirt and hair it can find it leaves noticeable tracks behind. When the light catches the floor you can see the circles and tracks left behind it. Also the “will auto dock after 90 minutes feature” is a lie. Never once has it auto docked after 90 minutes it will after 90 minutes continue cleaning then die somewhere in my unit forcing me to play the world’s lamest game Of hide and seek because the battery is dead and I can’t use the “hit this button and the roomba will chime so you can locate it”. I would still recommend it because it does its job well and I’m sure would be great if they fixed these with an update.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020

Review Text: I was skeptical. Friends have Roombas and I still wasn't sold. Then it was on the Treasure Truck and sale on the site. I caved. 2 cats and me having blonde hair plus hard floors means hairballs no matter how often we swept and vaccumed. Not anymore. I've never been a household gadget lover like I am now. Or maybe it's just my Roomba. I may even get another one--one for each floor of the house.It runs for about an hour and a half on either floor right now. I'm a freak, so I try to pause it in the middle to empty the dirt cup. It doesn't always work out that way, which is fine. I do make sure to run it every other day, though. The app lets you schedule day and time, making using it easy and worry-free.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020

Review Text: I'm a single person that runs this twice a week and I clean the filter, wheels & brushes regularly. After 16 months, the motor just quit. I have it programmed to run and the app will say it's cleaning for about three minutes and then it will time out. All the while, the Roomba never came off the dock. It is fully charged and I can hear the chiming that it's going to start cleaning...and then...nothing. Contacted the Customer Service email that Amazon provides...hoping to get a satisfactory resolution. I will update this review to let potential buyers know of the service recovery experience from this company!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2020

Review Text: I’ve researched On Amazon before buying this one and selected this model because I thought I would be able to setup the rooms and areas on the phone but I guess this version do not have this feature so it would be the same as buying any other cheaper model that uses remote control. The machine is really dumb, goes hitting everywhere until it finds an open area to clean, it does not clean everywhere, it keeps going to the same places and leave others dirty. So really no point in having it if I still need to go vacuum myself. Also, since it keeps hitting all the walls, it’s hurting all the trims in the house, leaving black marks everywhere and white marks on the machine. Not worth to have something that doesn’t clean and in the long run will make us repaint or replace all trims. Maybe if the machine had rubber material around wouldn’t hurt the walls as much.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2020

Review Text: Replaced an Evovac robot with this one when it died after warranty had expired (of course).  Was disappointed that the Roomba was much louder and it rarely returns to its docking station.  It more often than not stops in the middle of the floor and you hear the message "please charge Roomba".  Have moved the docking station a couple of times trying to find a more centralized area but only marginally improved docking success.  Never once did my Evovac fail to dock.  The dirt collection bin also cannot be washed because the electronic wall sensor is in that bin and washing it would damage or destroy it so all you can do is wipe the inside with a damp cloth.  Poor design IMHO because there are nooks & crannies in the bin you just can't clean.  Today, the Roomba stopped in the middle of the floor and no message at all.  All the app said was it had lost connection to the cloud.  Put it on the charger and it wouldn't charge at all.  So here's the one really good thing.  I called tech support and they were able to walk me thru some troubleshooting.  Took it all apart,  cleaned it,  removed and replaced the battery and was finally able to get it to light up and start charging.  The agent was very competent, thorough,  and pleasant to deal with so 5 stars for customer support.  3 Stars for all else.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020

Review Text: Comprar esta aspiradora robot es la mejor decisión que pude tomar. Tengo un perro negro que suelta pelo constantemente y el piso de mi casa es blanco. Desde que tengo esta aspiradora ya no me preocupo por limpiar, ella se encarga de mantener mi piso y mis alfombras libres de pelo y suciedad. Es un gran alivio para mi ya que trabajo de pie y llego a casa muy cansada. Al principio mi perro le ladraba pero ya se han hecho amigos. Le puse nombre a mi aspiradora. Se llama Flora. Ha sido una gran solución para un gran problema. No puedo dejar de mencionar que es muy fácil de usar y muy simple la labor de desechar las partículas aspiradas una vez terminada su labor.  Gracias Flora 😘
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2019

Review Text: First of all, it won't dock.  I've done everything the websites and app tell me to do and have even called only to be told - "sometimes they just won't dock."  It never docked, not one single time.  Straight out of the box, it would not dock.I returned it and am waiting on my refund.  The thing wedged itself under one particular piece of furniture repeatedly.  I've put things in in place to block the roomba, but for some reason it is obsessed with getting wedged under this cabinet.  It will relentlessly pound against whatever is blocking until it has moved it out of the way so it can go halfway under and stay there.  I can tap it with my toe to make it change directions, but oh no, it's going to get under this particular piece of furniture each and every time.  The top of the roomba is scratched from having to be forcibly removed from it's confinement.It also never picked up much of anything.  Just not a good purchase.I can't believe how much money I spent on this absolute garbage.  So disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2020

Review Text: As someone who has been selling on Amazon for 10 years,  this will be the first time I'll be leaving a negative review. The item did not come with any instructions on how to set up the Robot with your phone.  I had to google and no matter which option I followed, it just won't connect with my phone. I get to setting where it says "Connect Romba to Wi-fi  and then cme back to the iRobot." I did it million times and it's just stuck on that page. I even tried 2.4g network instead of 5g and it just won't work. Never have I gotten frustrated with such an item before.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019

Review Text: I purchased this after buying an off brand and using it until it died. I figured that I was paying more for quality. I was wrong.The right wheel became stuck and stopped working 6 weeks after purchase. When I sought help via the app + website, the app crashed and the website wouldn’t allow me to log in or reset my password. I called and was promised a replacement part within 2 days. It has been almost a week, and I still don’t have that part.I rarely write reviews. However, people generally think that they are buying quality when they spend money on something from iRobot. I don’t believe that a product that malfunctions within the first 6 weeks of light use qualifies.Perhaps more importantly, the robot emits an error message, even when docked.  It woke me up in the middle of the night a few times before I let the battery drain. There isn’t any way to turn this function off through the app or the robot itself. It will just keep doing it until the error is fixed or the battery dies. In my case, because iRobot hasn’t sent me the part within 2 business days as promised, I had to let the battery die.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019

Review Text: Not worth the money. Decided to upgrade from our broken Deebot. Thicker than Deebot, got stuck under furniture. Super small collecting basket, got full well before it was done cleaning. (Pet hair)Only one side brush, very inefficient. Got stuck in places where the deebot didn’t and had constant unexplained errors. I’m sure the errors were probably a factory defect but with all the other shortfalls we decided to just return it and get another deebot, which was also less money. Very disappointed. I thought we were stepping up but it turns out we were stepping down
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2019

Review Text: Let me just fill y’all in. I received the first vacuum and it worked great for about three days and then stopped charging. Tried for three days to get it to charge because I thought surely this new vacuum isn’t defunct. Nothing worked. Sent the request for a replacement, no big deal, it happens right? Finally a week later, I get the “replacement”. Haha. No, it was apparently another return that had somehow been shipped to me. Came in NASTY pieces and a full trash bin. Call customer service, “eh I’m so sorry that happened a new one will be here by Friday.” Yea, nope. Get an email for maybe Monday. So I call AGAIN. There’s nothing they can do. No money back, no quicker shipping. Nothing. I just have to sit and wait until Monday, so I can now ship two pieces of crap back and hope like heck the new one works. NEVER again. DO NOT BUY.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020

Review Text: The idea is good but the implementation is crazy loco. I had my neighbor come over and say, "why is it doing the same place over and over again?" Yes, that is correct. It is what it was doing over and over. I noticed it myself too and it got frustratingly annoying while waiting for it to clean rest of the room/area.After a week or so, I just couldn't take it. If you have patience then its for you.. If you have all the time in the world then its for you. If you like playing pong then its for you. If you like hearing all the 'bam and slam' against furnitures then its for you.Now, does it clean, yes, it is pretty good at collecting dust and other stuff. It is just not efficient for me in terms of time it takes to clean. Anyhow, its cheap and its pretty good. Just not for me.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2020

Review Text: Many features do not work correctly. It does not return to base when battery gets low - it just stops wherever it is.  My main floor is large enough that it RARELY finishes on one charge, so I have to hunt it down and take it back to the base nearly every time.  It also does not sense when the dirt container is full, which is not helpful if I run it while I am gone, as I need to empty it several times (the dirt container seems very small to me).  It claims to be "good for pet hair", but the brush CONSTANTLY fills up with pet hair, after which it doesn't pick up any pet hair.  I need to remove the hair from the roller brush after every second cleaning or so.  It also gets hung up on edges of stairs REALLY easily ("Roomba is on a cliff").  Again, not helpful if I'm not around to rescue it.  VERY unhappy with this purchase and would not recommend.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020

Review Text: I bought this as a replacement for my Neato. Thought I was upgrading. What a mistake. It gets stuck behind my recliners, gets hung up on any cord it encounters that is close to an object where it has to change direction. When transitioning from my rugs to the hardwood floors (and I have all hardwood floors) It leaves behind a clump of dog hair that the brushes are pushing around. I was watching it "learn" it's environment and watched it go right over my dogs hair as it ran. I don't expect perfection. After all a vacuum is only as good as the suction the motor creates. But this thing doesn't suck up anything. I wanted to use it to supplement my normal vacuuming to help keep the dog hair down. What a waste of money. I pissed away $200 bucks for something that is going to just take up space sitting on the docking station on my floor. I've tried this thing numerous times. This thing doesn't suck up anything. As mentioned in my previous post every time it transitions off the rug to the hardwood floor it leaves a pile of dog hair. AND it skips around and misses all kinds of areas. Stay away, very far away from this piece of junk
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019

Review Text: Purchased this model in January 2020 to evaluate the overall performance of iRobot products and robot vacs in general. Although the cleaning hasn't been super, it is still a help for in between deeper manual vacuuming and that's something. Felt the performance was sufficient enough and that maybe it was time to upgrade to the i7/Braava Jet bundle. Changed my mind on that after this model completely died in February 2020, just weeks after it's 1st birthday. Funny thing is, we only used this thing maybe once every 3 weeks. Not a very good track record. Dead after 1 year, I'm unwilling to spend over $1000 on products that will likely only last 1 year. Very unsatisfactory.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2021

Review Text: I have been waffling back and forth for some time about getting a robot vacuum. Haven't had much luck with corded stand up vacs, so my husband and I caved to get the Roomba. I had high hopes, and after reading all the reviews, thought I had finally made a good decision in getting this product. The first day we had it and everyday since, it has needed a LOT of attention. We are very busy and the Roomba was supposed to help us clean our very messy dog-haired floors to ease us up from having to clean it constantly. This vacuum requires constant attention because it keeps getting "stuck near a cliff" WHEN THERE ARE NO CLIFFS AROUND. We live in a one floor duplex and it constantly gets stuck and we have to intervene. Constantly. Another thing about it is it will clean the same spot for 10 minutes, forgetting the rest of the floor. It doesn't have any sort of path and never gets everything. It's very annoying and frustrating considering what this robo vac is supposed to do. I don't recommend it. Just stick with a stand up vac and do it yourself. It takes less time and is a lot more thorough.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020

Review Text: It seriously put our previous typical vacuum cleaner to shame.  5 runs over the same carpet and it was still was pulling up stuff!  It truly made the carpet look NEW!It runs about 80-90 minutes per charge.  great transitions from different flooring.I was apprehensive about it near stairs, but it expertly knows when it’s at stairs and turns back!My only complaint (for now—subject to further cleanings) is that it seems to take a long time to “go home” to the charging base.This machine is my first robot vacuum, so I got a lower-priced model ($199 on sale here).  It’s done so well I plan to get another for another floor in my house instead of bringing it downstairs each time I need to vacuum that particular floor!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020

Review Text: OK. I've been skeptical about a robot vac for a long time. I've heard mixed reviews. But damn, this is such a game changer. I have a little puppy that leaves crumbs all over the floors, and far too many dust bunnies under the couch and beds. This little guy gets rid of all of it at 4:30AM in the morning, while we are sleeping! We have a fairly open home without much clutter, so that helps. Cleaning under the beds involved getting on the ground and half way under the bed before the Roomba. Now, I just place this under the bed and its clean in 10 mins. Great for allergy sufferers!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020

Review Text: After using Eufy 11s in my basement, which works well, I decided to kick it up a notch and buy the iRobot Roomba 675 for the main house. What a disappointment. After three hours of charging, I download the app and tried o set it up. It took several tries and although the app reported that the device is connected to the Wifi, it could not communicate with the machine. Finally after restarting my phone, it manage to connect. The machine is quite noisy compare to the Eufy, but that was not the issue. after starting vacuuming, the Roomba went over a carpet which by no means I would consider as "shaggy" and then it started going back and forth and in circles as if trying to "shake off" that carpet. After couple of attempts, it stopped with "Error #6", I moved it somewhere else and it worked until it had to go over that carpet again. It stopped again with error #6. At that point I gave up. What good is it to have a robovac if it cannot vacuum the carpet?I returned it yesterday and order another Eufy.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2019

Review Text: I did a lot of research on all the different types and models - I didn’t want to invest a ton into vacuums they don’t have the technology down yet.This iRobot did a great job picking up dirtI found it does kinda wonder and repeat clean a lot, because technology not exact yet. Just set up to vacuum longer it will coveriRobot was a great purchase for my 1500 square foot home with a cat and a Siberian Husky in it.If your”Helga” is getting stuck a lot it’s your fault not hers -unclutter - mine only stuck once under desk in a pile of wires she told me through Alexa
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020

Review Text: If I could give no stars I would. I don't know if i received a defective machine, but this roomba does not work on hard floors such as tiles! I had invested into this product due to all the great reviews. Do not waste your money. It barely has any suction power. It does an okay job on carpets and also it never finds it's way back to the dock.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020

Review Text: Yes..my Roomba is a girl and she's fabulous :o)Moved into a home with wood flooring and the lint & specs of anything on the dark chocolate wood flooring was driving me absolutely bananas.Roomba to the rescue. 1st time Roomba owner and I'm hooked.The suction is perfect and the entire 1st floor is taken care of with ONE LESS THING FOR ME TO HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT....set it and forget it for real!!!!My 1st floor is a mix of wood (majority) .. a few rugs (with varying pile thickness) and tile (in kitchen)….Roomba floats over all areas seamlessly! And when all her work is done...she quietly resumes back to her charging port. What!?!?!The first few times I'd track back looking for areas she certainly had to have missed....I never could find one???The pattern that seems almost completely random actually does the job....each and every time.My only "job" is to dump the reservoir...too easy!  Roomba is the real MVP!!!!  Don't hesitate...it's a worthy investment.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2020

Review Text: This thing is so good for the price. I had always wanted one so when I saw it go on sale, I went for it. Im a clean freak but I’m also 30 weeks pregnant so I can’t clean as much as I want to without having a sore back. I run the roomba almost every day and it really maintains the house in between “real” cleans. This version doesn’t learn your house so you have to be patient with it because it will go over the same spot a thousand times and maybe do things that don’t make sense lol. Because it doesn’t map out your house, it takes longer because it relies on bumping into things to get around. Mine always gets stuck in the sliding door rail even though the doors are closed and sucks up charger cables if left dangling on the floor so just watch out for those little things. With that said, I think its super cool, makes my life much easier and I would definitely recommend it 👍🏻
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 16, 2020

Review Text: I got the iRobot so that I could clean underneath my beds without having to move them.  It has more than fulfilled that need!  I have cleaned one room per day since I got it and while it's running, I can do other things.  Needless to say, my regular vacuum is a lot faster and more efficient, but I have to move everything in order to really do a good job so it doesn't get done often. I like the ease with which this iRobot was set up and ready to go.  I'm puzzled by how it establishes the pattern it chooses to use but it cleans the whole  room then tells you to move it so I can't complain.  The battery holds up well.  Overall, I'm delighted with what I call my new old lady toy!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2020

Review Text: Always disconnecting from the WiFi, so I can’t turn on from the  app. This vacuum cleaner going to the same position more than 20 times, navigation is so terrible. Going to return it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020

Review Text: I’m going to give Roomba one more chance tomorrow morning before I just wash my hands and be done with it!  It got off the charger, turned left and bumped into my recliner chair.  For 3 minutes, it kept bumping itself in the same 2 spots and then when I clicked home, it couldn’t find the base 2 ft away it went in the other room!  2nd time I tried it, downloaded IRoomba and started it from the app.  It got off the base and went to the same spot did the same thing as before.  After 5 minutes, I pressed home and it went in a different room and was lost in the room for 7 minutes.  I brought it out into the hallway and pressed base and it went into the kitchen to go back and forth from cabinet to cabiney.  After 2 minutes I stopped it, picked it up and walked It to the base.  If this is how my house is suppose to be vacuumed she. I’m not home, nothing would get done & I might as well use a regular vacuum to do the job myself!!!  Not impressed even with everyone raving how wonderful this item is...I’ll give it one more chance tomorrow before I say bye bye!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019

Review Text: I got this vacuum for Christmas 2019. I've had it just over a week now and so far, I absolutely love it! I've ran it almost every day since I got it and it definitely helps maintain the dirt and hair in my house. I have 4 dogs, 3 cats, a cockatiel, and 2 children. I was a little concerned that with as many animals that I have that it would be way too much for this little thing to handle. Boy was I wrong! This little thing keeps the hair too a minimum. Of course it doesn't pick up everything and yes, I have to empty it 2-3 times in the hour and forty minutes it runs each day, but it's really simple and I don't mind one bit. It keeps the dirt from the Nevada desert and hair from several animals to a minimum and I love it! Would definitely recommend to anyone who hates to sweep and vacuum but hates dirt and hair at the same time. You just have to empty it and keep it maintained which is simple. Again, I definitely recommend this vacuum!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020

Review Text: I've had this romba for 4 months and I absolutely like it. It's not perfect for sure but it does its jobs.1) clean the dirt'sI scheduled my romba to clean 5 days a week. My apartment isn't that big (2B2B). So the Roomba can cover most of the corners at least once a week. I am satisfied with the cleaness of my apartment and never feel dusty.2) stuck sometimesLike many other robot vacuums, this Roomba can't always return to the dock. It sometimes locks itself in the bathroom/closets or something stucks. I would say 1/3 of the chances it returns and rest of the time I need to rescue it. However it's not that big of an issue since you can easily find it with app.3) app/alexaThough I can call Alexa to clean the room, it's not a common usecase and I don't know why I would ever do that.. you can schedule the clean jobs in the app and you pretty much only want it to clean when you are not at home. The app itself is very handy and you can see some stats.4) hit the furnituresSince it doesn't have a sensor it hits the furnitures and turn around. These hits actually hurt.I would not suggest home owners or people with enough budget yo buy this model. But it does most of the jobs as a basic vacuum. So if you are just out of college renting an apartment like me, it's a nice budget purchase and save you tons of time.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2019

Review Text: This vacuum is perfect for me. I put it on once a day, our whole downstairs is wood floors, with are rugs in sections. This vacuum goes up and down all rugs and goes under furniture and eliminates dust and dirt. Before this vacuum we swept the floor with a broom at least twice a day. While it is true it has its own pattern and seems to go wherever it wants, at the end of the cycle you can walk in the floor without anything attaching to your foot! My grandchildren love it and have given her the name if Rita the robot. Rita is definitely a win. The side benefit is she also finds lost remotes from under the couch, pacifiers that were seemingly lost, keys, you name it! But do make sure your charging cables for IPads etcetera are picked up
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2021

Review Text: I purchased this because I was tired of having to sweep the litter my cats dragged outside of the box. My wife and I do not wear shoes inside our house and having litter around was a hassle. Let me tell you that this little thing does an amazing job at keeping the cats area clean and litter free.No longer do I have to worry about stepping in litter the cats dragged out of their box or out into the hallway.It also lasts long enough to clean both our offices, living/dining room and work out space. It takes about 1:13 min to go around the house and it does a fantastic job!If you also do not wear shoes inside your house, have pets and want to have your floors debris free, this is the one for you.I'll update with some video of how much it actually picks up.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020

Review Text: The right wheel stopped working about two weeks after we started using the Roomba 675.  Honestly, it's not a huge deal.  Things with this many moving parts are bound to have problems at times.  I called up customer service and after troubleshooting stopped working they sent us out wheel replacements.  The wheel replacements got here two days later and fixed the issue.  I'm as happy as I can be with this customer service.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2021

Review Text: I was really really skeptical prior to purchasing the Roomba. First of all, it's a lot of money, and I never spend that kind of money on anything that I don't absolutely need. Secondly, I figured, even if it works well, I'm still going to need to vacuum regularly, so is it really going to save that much time? But I caved, because, with work, kids, and life, who has time to vacuum? I am so glad I made the investment, it has saved us so much time and has really worked wonderfully. We run it three times a week while we are at work, and the floors are spotless when we get home in the evenings. I have not had to use our vacuum since we bought it. It picks up everything! I should mention, we don't have any pets, so that may make a difference for others. But really, if you're on the fence just go for it. It will give you your time and your sanity back.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2019

Review Text: So, I have wanted a Roomba since my brother got one 10 yrs ago, but seeing as I don’t live on 250K/year like him, I would never splurge a grand on a vacuum cleaner. Finally, prices have dropped on these older models and they seem to have the best reviews anyway, so I bit the bullet. Wish I would have spent the grand 10 years ago bc these are legitimately amazing!I will say that the first one that came in (refurbished) had been damaged in shipping. One of the sensors was busted and the packaging showed damage as well, so contacted Amazon - they re-shipped immediately, and Roomba 2.0 was here in 2 days, and this time they threw in a free virtual wall! Bonus!! (This little thing has proved invaluable, so get it if you can!!)First day, got home from work, opened it up, charged it, and before bed, picked up everything off the living room/kitchen area. It felt a lot like child proofing for a toddler. But we got anything you would pick up for regular vacuuming up and pulled the bar chairs out a little so it could get to the dirtiest areas. Used the virtual wall to block off the hall to the bedrooms, and went to bed (after watching in amazement for about 30 minutes!) Satisfied that it wouldn’t get stuck, finally went to bed. We could barely hear it running and bumping, but not bothersome at all. Almost like leaving a fan on while sleeping - it was nice white noise and I actually slept better knowing my house was being cleaned while I slept!!Next morning, I expected the floors to be clean, but it exceeded my expectations. I could literally feel the difference on my bare feet. Almost like it had been mopped and waxed. I mean this thing must have some serious suction. Emptying the filter reconfirmed this! We have 3 cats, my daughter and I have long hair, and my two boys track in all kinds of trash daily from just being in and out. It got it all! Plus, I guess you just don’t realize the amount of dust that collects on the floors. Anyway, the filter was full and it was really gross...So over the next few days, we have used it to clean all the rooms. I use the virtual wall and doors to contain it to one room at a time which works best since it only has about 2.5-3 hours of battery and it can really do a good job on one room at a time vs running it over the whole house. It even fluffed up my medium-high pile carpet in the bedrooms and covered every square inch even with the weird random pattern! It did get hung a couple of times under the bed on a sock or scrunchie but it always notifies me on my phone through the app, and I can go rescue it and get her going!Overall, I love her!! My daughter named her Roxanne, and she is definitely our Rock Star! The app is really convenient. I have not used it to schedule, just monitor. I like the history section and tells how dirty your floor was for each job, the time duration, etc. So, large rooms take about 2 hours, bathrooms about 15-20 minutes, kids rooms about an hour. If you’ve read this far, congrats!! You want this, now add to cart and check out. This is the right one!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2019

Review Text: I bought this because I had wanted one but the price always intimidated me. So I bought it as the Black Friday deal. This is everything I never knew I needed. It does a wonderful job keeping my floors clean. I have 2 inside dogs (one is long haired), 2 small sons and a husband. It doesn’t necessarily “deep clean” but it keeps me from having to “deep clean” every week. I have used it almost everyday since I’ve had it and it amazes me that it cleans for about 2 hours and the dust bin is usually full. I highly recommend this product.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019

Review Text: This is well worth its price.  I hate housework, and particularly vacuuming and sweeping, but I have pets who shed, and this is the best purchase I've ever made in terms of helping me with housework.  I turn Roomba on when I leave the house, and when I come back, she's either finished vacuuming or is still working.  I am going to order one for my daughter.  At first, she would get caught on things, but now that she knows her way around, I can turn her on and go out and not have to worry about her getting stuck.  It's also really easy to clean out the dust receptacle.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2018

Review Text: I run this about once a day downstairs. I have two dogs. One sheds a lot and then other a little. They both love to dig in the backyard. This vacuum handles it all and I don’t have to worry about it.The app you can use with it is really nice. I can set and change the cleaning schedule from it. It also tells you when it’s time to clean the various parts and includes a video showing you how. You can order replacement parts from the app. I haven’t done that yet.The downsides are it doesn’t seem to run in a logical pattern. It’ll zoom in and out of the living room and then all the way back to the kitchen and out again. I think it eventually covers everything but all the excess back and forth sometimes runs the battery down. Sometimes it completes the whole downstairs in about an hour and sometimes it’ll run for an hour and a half and the battery dies and it cancels the job and goes back to the charger. Since I run it daily it still works for me though.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2019

Review Text: I bought this device a month ago to replace an automatic vacuum I bought a year ago which cost less than this roomba and it has failed miserably!!! Do Not Purchase!! I should also mention that I purchased 2 originally and returned the other one this past weekend. I was hoping that it was just a lemon so I moved it upstairs and moved the other one downstairs and that one is equally as bad!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019

Review Text: This is my first robot vacuum and I am just disappointed in the performance and very unimpressed. It literally just vacuumed in the same places for 30 mins and barely vacuums a room cleanly. 260$ and no mapping capabilities, it followed the same path like 10x...as I watched it vacuum for a whole 30 mins, it made me very irritated that it left spots unvacummed with its weird zig zagging method...I didn't think this would be a problem when going over the reviews but it was a lot worst than I thought. Seriously, at this point, I might as well just vacuum myself and be done with it in 15 to 20 mins. It is not good with rugs and low pile carpeting. The side brush just swept the debris/dirt away and didn't even pick it up. I'm going to give it another couple of tries.Update: Second try and still very disappointed...going to be returning it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021

Review Text: As hard as I try to keep it clean in here, my cat is constantly making a mess of my apartment.
