Either food gets spread around the floor on its way into her mouth, or litter gets flung all over when she's done with it. I sweep and vacuum but it's a never-ending uphill battle.I run the Roomba every morning, and its base station is right across the room from the litter box. It's very simple to set it up to automatically run on a schedule. Its first order of business is to go and suck up the day's litter, then it bangs around for another hour and a half until its batteries die, it finds its way back to the charging station, or it sucks up a cord and cries for help. It's fairly loud so its essentially my alarm clock - impossible to ignore, and since it almost always gets into trouble, a reason to get out of bed.The way that it finds its way is frustrating but amusingly simple in its simplicity: it just drives straight until it runs into something, then turns in a random direction and tries again. There's no reasoning or planning involved, so sometimes it'll get into the bedroom and spend an hour bumping around under the bed until its battery dies. Sometimes it makes it under the TV and cruises over a power strip like a little monster truck, pushes a notification to my phone claiming  that it's "stuck near a cliff" and plays a very loud and spooky "Error! Please move Roomba..." recording.The cat is not afraid of it, and sometimes likes to watch it. Mostly she ignores it.The brushes collect a lot of hair, but cleaning them out is simple and easy without any tools. It doesn't clean deeply, but it does a lot more to keep the apartment clean by running every day than I do vacuuming once a week. Its simple-minded programming is its only real drawback, but the utility of it cleaning up superficial messes every day more than makes up for it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019

Review Text: I seriously love this little vacuum. I live in a 1000ish sqft apartment with mostly linoleum floors. I also have 2 cats and because of my allergies, I use silica cat litter. Anyone else who uses silica litter probably knows, stepping on a single piece isn't fun. Also, the amount of fur around my apartment was ludicrous. This vacuum helps so much. It doesn't have a huge capacity wastebin, but, for my apartment, it is plenty; provided I empty it after it runs. I have it linked with an iRobot account and my Alexa, and I love the expanded features, like being able to start it from anywhere in my apartment. I haven't tried to schedule it yet, I'm not sure how well that would work considering one of my cats likes to try and start it, and he knocks it slightly off the base. (As of yet, he hasn't figured out the button starts it, but I'm sure that is only a matter of time.) I check the robot every morning to make sure it is charging and run it in the mid-afternoon, when the cats are napping and unlikely to mess with it. I have to say, I run this every day, and I am constantly surprised at how much it actually picks up every single day. I didn't know how much dirt gets tracked into my apartment until I bought this vacuum.My one complaint, is that the front wheel gets a lot of fur stuck in it. While this doesn't affect the running of the vacuum, it is one of those little things that bugs me and is surprisingly hard to clean out.The one feature I would love to see tho, is a locator. Like a little beep you can activate if it gets stuck under the couch or bed, or something similar.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020

Review Text: For context, my living situation is in a second story apartment with myself, one other adult, and our medium-to-long haired white hair dog who has about average shedding (white hair is kind of hard to notice, but it's definitely there).The 675 is diligent about vacuuming, where I'm not. The first couple of runs filled the dust bin. Now, after running it once a day for about a week, the dust bin is significantly emptier each time I run it.  The front rotating brushes are already a little worn, and I can't imagine them lasting more than three or four months.  The part looks trivial to replace when they do wear out, which is good. The inner/central vacuum brushes pick up and get tangled with dog hair about on par with other non-robot vacuum cleaners. Recommendations are to clean out the brushes once a week, which seems about right if you're running your vacuum cleaner daily.I did an "arts and crafts" disable for all but one of the cliff sensors (I kept the one by the rotating brush alone).  The Roomba was having a bad day with a living room rug with a black border.  Scotch tape and white paper did the trick to disable the sensors in my case, and now it's working much better (though I imagine if I had stairs it would preform poorly with them). iRobot definitely doesn't recommend disabling cliff sensors under any circumstances, but there are videos floating around for various ways to disable those sensors with varying degrees of "hackiness."Maybe iRobot will figure out how to get the "dumber" Roombas to not stop for carpets with black borders some day. It's a notable complaint, and would be pretty bad if I had both stairs *and* carpets with black borders.  I don't have that scenario though, so I'm lucky and I'm fine with a hacked together solution.The robot vacuum gives the dog anxiety. He doesn't like the noise it makes or the fact it moves on its own accord.  The same dog also doesn't like regular vacuum cleaners, blenders, food processors, or similar appliances (though I'd put the Roomba at a level below the volume of those appliances). Personally, I wouldn't schedule the vacuum cleaner to run with the dog home alone (the dog is spoiled though, and is rarely home alone for very long).  Know your own pet when purchasing an appliance like this.Speaking of knowing your pet, also know your household. The Roomba isn't afraid to run smack into, say, the dog food water bowl or to try and vacuum stray dog toys.  There's some element of setting your Roomba up for success by being cognizant of your environment and either doing things like blocking off the dog food area, having proper cable management around your home, or cleaning up stray items and toys of various flavors before the robot runs a vacuum job.Even with all those caveats, I'm extremely happy, which is probably a testament to how awesome robot vacuum cleaners are.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2021

Review Text: Arrived on time and worked right out of the box. We have saltillo tile thought out the living area and ceramic in the office and bedrooms. ( no carpet) I was originally concerned that it might not do well with the spacing we have in the Saltillo tile but the Roomba  runs like a champ.  The first time she ran, we needed to empty the bin twice. Since then, the floors are beautiful and and I empty the bin once a day when I get home. She has been running every day at 10am since we ordered it and is usually done in an hour or so and docks herself.2 Recommendations.  1 - hot glue the base to the floor. It's too light and gets knocked over too easily.2 - buy a few cans of air to clean out the bin and help with the weekly clean up of the wheels.  LOVE LOVE LOVE the machine...and My wife loves me too!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2019

Review Text: This is such a time saver. Wish I would have bought one before now. Our pets aren't to sure about the new Roomba, But we absolutely love it. It has only been a couple days, So far so good. You really want to make sure you have everything picked up off the floor. Dusty caught a mouse (toy) that the kitten left on the floor. and it needed assistance. So if you plan on using Roomba while your gone check your floors and any flimsy rugs. It is unbelievable how much stuff is collected on the floors on the daily. Hope this helps any future buyers.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021

Review Text: I've had "Alice" about 6 weeks now!  I absolutely love her!  I have 3 short haired chihuahuas, a cat, and all hardwood floors.  She is amazing!  I feel like I have a maid!  I run her everyday and everyday her little basket is full!  I've heard some people say they don't like how she goes from room to room without finishing in one room. She is amazing to remember where she's been, and if I run her everyday eventually she is picking up every little thing in every little space! She sweeps over the throw rugs beautifully! She goes in and out of the kitchen chairs wonderfully! She cleans under the beds like there is no tomorrow! She goes under couches and chairs, gets all those places that are hard to reach! She just gets stuck every now and then on a register, under a table, at the top of the stairs, and she needs your assistance. She runs for about 2 and 1/2 hours before she takes her little self back to the dock and charges up again!  She's easy to clean and wipe off! Going forward I cannot imagine life without her!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020

Review Text: Here's what I like about the Roomba.  It cleaned surface materials pretty well, including wood and carpet floors. It worked itself around most obstacles (but it did get frequently stuck). I liked the app to control it. Cleaning was easy and straightforward.Unfortunately, there were a number of issues.  It cleans randomly; it's not smart and it doesn't map. So it can spend a lot of time in one small area. The battery life is only 1-2h at most, and it could only clean part of the lower floor before needing a recharge. It got stuck frequently; wires, loose fabric, certain corners, under a table. And most baffling, the machine rarely found it's way back to the home base as advertised. Even when I put it in front of the base, it would sometimes head in the other direction.Now I understand this one of the cheapest Roombas, yet I did expect it do what it claimed, and it didn't work for me, so I'll be returning it. Perhaps I'd do better with a more expensive smart model. All in all, a great idea, but disappointing execution.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020

Review Text: I had to replace my first robot vacuum (another brand) so I decided to try a Roomba given it’s supposed high reputation.  As advertised, it offered an app to operate, but it wasn’t clear that there wasn’t an option of a remote.  What it didn’t detail is that you have to agree to have iRobot access and be able to sell/ share all your info from your phone to get the app.  I have no interest in sharing this info with a vacuum! Without the app, the only buttons are to clean, spot clean and dock. It doesn’t seem to learn the floor plan like my previous vacuum, frequently and repeatedly gets stuck under the same chairs, at door jams, etc., can’t seem to find the docking station (even when placed a foot away!) It also doesn’t clean as well as my first vacuum (Ecovacs Deetbot which I highly recommend!)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2021

Review Text: Good deal for a lower priced robo vac. Picks up a lot of dirt/debris. The hopper is small but filling it up 3-4 times a week makes a difference. Does not replace your standard vacuum. Is pretty noisy. Fits under most things, but not a low couch (like mine). Hooks up to wifi, you can schedule cleanings. Got stuck the first time out in a bedroom. Pushed open the door and the door swung closed behind it. Not really its fault. Did pick up a lot of dirt before getting stuck. Good entry into the category. When I upgrade would like something with a little more smarts (eg mapping).One other thing, it is a little hit or miss on the docking. If it is too far away docking doesn't happen. It just wanders around for a while and eventually you have to physically go get it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2018

Review Text: So far we are very happy with it. With two dogs, he fills up the dust bin nearly every single time he runs. It's a substantial amount of hair and dirt that I don't have to pick up myself and it helps us "bridge" the time between using the full strength vacuum.I think it's worth the $200 - especially if you are beginning to consider alternatives like paying for house cleaners.My only "con" is that sometimes he doesn't make it back on the charger (1/5 times probably). I'm OK with that, though. It's no big deal to plop him back on the charger when I get home.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019

Review Text: It cleans great so I guess I should be grateful. This is my third robot vac.  I keep it because it returns to its home without dying somewhere (in my tiny house). However it annoys me endlessly while it's on. It's loud, it bumps chairs loudly and incrementally moves them around my hardwood floor. I used to love cleaning daily but have realized how much it grates on my nerves. The sensing technology for chair legs is not equivalent to the sensing technology for baseboards and other larger objects thus its aggressive there where it's not against walls or large appliances.  I need it to clean daily for dog hair but have finally realized just how much it gets on my nerves. Cleans well but if you have hardwood floors and lots of movable chairs or other non-permenant furnishings, beware.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021

Review Text: Does'nt clean all areas downstairs. Keeps goin back to my living room over n over again. Literally have to pick it up and place it wherever i want vaccumed, annoying. Constantly getting stuck and unable to find home station. Super annoying. Bump tech my ass! Its like a blind man in a maze 🤬🤬. Highly recommend buying a different brand that uses sensors for same price. This thing is garbage!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020

Review Text: We’ve had this a few weeks now so here are some pros and cons we have discovered since using it consistentlyPROS: Generally gets the job done-it seems at first like it just goes randomly wherever with no pattern or method, but it actually cleans everywhere!  Perfect for dust, dirt, and pet hair  Quick and effortless to set up and use  Can be started with the app when you’re away from home  Works with Google Home (“hey google, start the roomba”)  Easy to empty the binCONS: very loud operation  Takes a long time to clean the whole downstairs  Gets “stuck” easily under the couch and under the dishwasher door (this is annoying because we usually start it when we leave and half an hour later, it notifies us through the app that it’s stuck. Sometimes this can be resolved by simply clicking “resume,” but other times, it’s legitimately stuck on-or under-something)I do think it’s worth it, and I assume the more expensive ones would operate more quietly and get stuck less frequently. But we usually let it clean when we are out of the house, so the noise isn’t ever much of a problem.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020

Review Text: I did a lot of research before placing a purchase and i was looking for something that had reasonable price but still decent quality that would do the job for a long time. My daughter was 9 months old and started crawling when i purchased this product. We don't have pets but my long hairs and my husband's body hairs were all around the apartment despite vacuuming almost everyday, but still my daughter could manage to find hairs tangled among her fingers and make me panic for not being able to get appropriate clean house that I wished I had. Besides I have to clean my apartment everyday while having a full time job (not easy, trust me). I looked for cheaper companies reviews, more expensive ones like Dyson as well and etc. Most cheaper robots mostly had bad charge keeping reviews, some of them even told about stopping working at all after few days of usage. Finally I decided to purchase from Roomba but a cheaper one, as it did not have complaining reviews about losing to keep charge day by day or bad suctioning ability. It arrived really fast and in a safe packaging. I am using it for almost 2 months now, everyday and it is amazing. I have 1180 sq. ft 2 bedrooms, a dining room and a kitchen apartment with hardwood floors, and a small carpet in one bedroom. App works perfect and sends notifications when robot needs an attention. It got stuck under a couch few times, as it has gradual fall in height underneath ( I dont know how to explain it otherwise, sorry), but I fixed it by putting some books to the lowest parts to stop the robot to go in there, but you can purchase a virtual wall barrier as well to prevent the robot to go places where you dont want it to go. So it does not stuck anymore and completes its job in 90- 110 mins almost everyday and charge lasts the same like in day 1. And finally I am getting clean floors without hairs and dust. Robot kind of keeps in memory the map of the rooms and everyday starts with the same room. It finds its way back to charging dock every time, except 2 times that it could not as it ran off the charge before arriving the "home". Generally I am satisfied with the product. You will get handy cleaning tool for decent price. It is worth it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019

Review Text: I purchased this Roomba to replace a Shark that had run through a puppy accident. I knew Roomba be the leader of these robo vacs so I went ahead and choose this model based on it's more affordable price point.  Unlike my Shark, it has an app & you can either schedule a job daily or just access the app and it will run. It cleans fine, but it's always getting lost or running out of battery begore returning to the base.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020

Review Text: We scheduled Roomba to vacuum once a week, Tuesday at 9:00 AM, when we had time to prepare.  We pick up loose rugs and secure inside doors so they cannot shut accidentally.  We came home once and found Roomba stuck in my study behind a closed door.  Another time it tried to "eat" a throw rug we forgot to pick up and got stuck.  It does a good job of cleansing except in small places where it cannot go.  Goes under beds, where we could not vacuum before, and got stuck against the wall one time.  Had to search for it and rescue it like a lost puppy.  It doesn't always dock itself when the battery gets low.  It is fun to watch (and dodge!) as it works through the house, over hard floors and carpet.  The app works well with it, monitoring its status even from afar.  Picks up a lot of dust, hair, etc.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020

Review Text: Ultimately, I wish I had invested more. This vacuum is okay, but definitely could be better. First off, it's quite loud. It gets itself stuck somewhere most days. Once it fell down the stairs, it was good thing I was watching it to catch it. It seems to understand where the walls are but bumps into any furniture at full speed. This is especially loud and annoying on my hard wood furniture. Sometimes when you tell it to dock, it will just continue to do its own thing for however long it wants, often I have to tell it a couple times. It's only okay at sucking up bits of cat litter on the hard wood floor, so there really could be more suction. Often this vacuum will go over the same area multiple times within a cleaning cycle but will completely miss some large areas.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020

Review Text: This particular model doesn’t “learn” the layout of the house, so, doesn’t cover the whole house on each use, gets stuck, etc..  amazed at how much stuff it does pick up though.  I’d spend a little more and get one that really can map out the floor plan and let you define zones that it recognizes and can be told to go to, like on the tv commercial.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2021

Review Text: We have a ranch style home with hardwood and carpet. Two adults, not much clutter, pretty open floor space. This thing wanders aimlessly, no rhyme or reason and it made me crazy. It got stuck constantly in the strangest places, almost on purpose. It cleaned the same strange spots over and over yet ignored high traffic open areas(for example the middle of the living room floor). It had difficulty finding its docking station and would run out of battery. I tried several times to send it home and it could not do it! Despite there being a completely open pathway 6 feet away. The 675 would work ok for a single, small room with nothing in it. We upgraded to the i7 which is a million times better but way more then we wanted to spend on a vacuum. My personal opinion is this is the flip phone of the roomba line. They sell them in hopes you will upgrade to a “smart” model so they can phase it out. If you have any expectations for a robot vacuum, this is not your machine.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2021

Review Text: It's great to have a robot at home, a lot of fun for kids! Also it does clean up all the rooms sometimes.But sometimes it just gets stuck in one place and can't get out even if you press the Dock button.Sometimes it doesn't go to other rooms.Sometimes the battery dies just in the middle of vacuuming.Connecting it to the WiFi also took a fair amount of time (around 1 hour). Updating firmware took like 5 tries. I'm surprised that so many years have passed and there's no algorithm for it to cover all space for certain.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2020

Review Text: I purchased this to help keep up with all the hair from my 3 dogs, 2 cats, and 3 humans.  When I first got it, it was working great!  It would sometimes get hung up and need to be relocated but I thought it was adorable so I was happy to go and move it to a new location.  As time went on, I noticed that the little spinning brush wasn't spinning.  It was yellow so I took it apart.  There was so much hair wrapped around it that it had stopped spinning.  I had to disassemble the unit, not just take the yellow part off, to get all the hair out so it would start working again.  I made a mental note and made sure to keep that clean.  By late July, early August, the Roomba would get hung up in the same area over and over.  It was like it wasn't learning the room and I had to set up barriers to keep it from going off a cliff.  It would also finish a cleaning job without cleaning certain parts of the room.  After it stopped charging and I had to do a complete reset of the system, I decided that it wasn't worth my aggravation anymore.  I unplugged it put it in the donation pile.  Turns out the donation place didn't want it either.  They had so many of them that they couldn't get rid of so they sent it back home with me.  I let it languish in the basement, hoping that it would think about what it had done.  The middle of October, I decided that I would give it a shot again.  I gave it a good cleaning and reset everything up.  First week, everything was great.  After that, the honeymoon period was over.  It stopped charging and when it was looking to dock, it would spin, which would cause the base to move and there was no way it would be able to dock.  I unplugged the base while it was spinning drunkenly around the basement thinking that unplugging the base would cause it to stop but it didn't.  The thing is STILL sitting, in pieces, on the floor of the basement.  Not sure if I'll be replacing it or not.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2019

Review Text: With 2 cats, I was looking forward to owning a Roomba. Pros: It does the job! I cleaned out the vacuum after 1 hour and was surprised by the amount of dust and cat hair. It moves around the house freely and gets the job done. CONS: VERY LOUD! I expect some noise, but the Roomba sounds louder than a traditional vacuum. Doesn't allow you to turn it on and ignore it, since its so loud. Another CON is that it stays in one spot for too long. It kept going in and out of the bathroom (which is very small) several times when I wish it would take longer vacuuming rugs. It fixates on certain areas that don't really appear to need cleaning. I am hoping that with time it learns the layout of my home and improves where it decides to clean longer.Overall, its great for pet owners. Especially for hard to reach areas like under the couch and bed. I wish it was quieter and smarter!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2019

Review Text: Bought this Roomba 675 Robot vac to make my life easier only to find out the Roomba Model will not cross over anything with Black lines on the carpet because the sensors think there is nothing there. I called Roomba tech support hoping I could find a workaround, but in order to do that I would have to spend $800-$1000 on a more expensive model, (cheaper to replace my carpet). Now I'm sending back a brand new model for a different brand purchased through Amazon Renewed. Hoping the next robot vac will cross over black lines on my carpet.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2021

Review Text: Roomba cleans up a fair amount of fine dust and hair; however, I have yet to run it once where it doesn't get stuck on something within five minutes. I basically need to spend another $40-$80 on "virtual walls" just to clean my bedroom because of a small step that Roomba gets stuck on and I can't block off. Even though they advertise having "cliff detect sensors" these only keep the Roomba from falling off the stair- the Roomba still gets stuck on the stair and can no longer function. So basically I clean my whole house, set Roomba just as I leave and get a notification five minutes after I'm gone that Roomba requires attention. All that work wasted.Also, Roomba is incredibly loud and obnoxious and takes forever, so running it while your home to babysit it is also not a great solution.Roomba advertises "Full suite of sensors intelligently navigate the robot under and around objects and under furniture to help thoroughly clean your floors" which basically means Roomba rams itself into stuff over and over again until it gets stuck or turned in another direction.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2020

Review Text: Bought one of the first versions of Roomba years ago.  Unfortunately not much has changed in the over price to novelty of the device.  It’s a cool novelty item but functionality it doesn’t come close to a stand vacuum.  Initial cost, continued maintenance cost and overall cleaning ability doesn’t match the cost of the device.  So far only had it several months and already won’t dock by itself.  The storage compartment for debris is tiny and it doesn’t clean much of the area close to walls or furniture (which surprises me since they can make a self driving car but can’t a Roomba  to properly map a room).  I still have hope that some day this will be a viable device but in the meanwhile buy it as novelty gift for relative but not as a replacement for an actual vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020

Review Text: With 2 dogs, 2 cats, a turtle and a parrot, I have more than my share of pet related mess in my home.  For years, I would spend every other day with a broom and dust pan, trying to keep the accumulation to a minimum.  My buddy has raved about his Roomba for more than a year, so I decided to give it a try.  The results has been outstanding!I have my Roomba programmed to clean every day at 1000.  When I come home in the afternoon, I find it waiting on its charge dock with a basket full of dust and pet hair.  The first couple of days, it found so much hair, it would pause in the middle of the cleaning cycle because the bin was full!  I absolutely love my Roomba!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019

Review Text: I have been on the search for a decent robot vacuum for a while, and I have tried a few of them.  I thought this would be the keeper, but I'm sending it back.  Here's why...It does a good job of cleaning the floor, but it cleans in a random pattern.  It hits some spots several times and misses other spots altogether, but overall it has decent coverage.  The problem with mine is that it keeps going and going and going, but it doesn't realize when the battery is low, so it doesn't go back and charge itself on its own.  I have used it four times, and each time I came back to find it dead in the middle of the floor.  I thought it was supposed to head back to the charger when it needed to.  Mine never did.  Maybe it was just mine that was defective.  I tried to test it out today to see what was going on, so I started it and let it run for like 20 minutes, then I told it to go back to the docking station through the app.  It looked like it was going to- the little light that says "dock" came on and everything, but it was like it didn't know where the docking station was.  I hadn't moved the docking station, but the robot was confused and started randomly going back and forth in another room until the battery died.  Again.From the reviews, I can see that a lot of people really like this robot.  Maybe mine was a one off, but it'll be going back as soon as the UPS store opens again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2021

Review Text: If you have any part of any carpet that has black in it ...  The Roomba will stop and give you an error ...There are what is called CLIFF Sensors, and if those sensors see anything black, they think the Roomba is going off a cliff (or more likely a stairwell) ...  There is NO WAY to turn these sensors off, every web-site about this issue says to tape slips of white paper over the sensors ...  I paid $250 to tape paper over 4 sensors on the Roomba to get it to work ...  Ridiculous !!!  I did the paper trick, worked for awhile, then stopped working ... (Paper got dirty)  so then other sites suggested taking the brand-new Roomba apart (a 2 to 3 hour process with dozens of screws) ....  Pull the LEDs from the sensors and point them at each other ...  Didn't work ...  tried 3 times ...  Hours of frustration ...  Brand new Roomba, $250 dollars into the trash !!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020

Review Text: I does an ok job of picking up dog hair when it runs but it gets stuck under furniture, etc at least 3 times every cycle. The amount of time I have to spend taking it apart to clear hair and debris from the wheels, I could have just vacuumed manually. Seriously, it’s about once a week for 15 min fixing it. I wish I had returned it but kept wanting to want to like it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2020

Review Text: Pros:  Picks up dirt and debris great.  Easy to clean.  Seems well made and I expect it will last.Cons:  Gets stuck often under cabinet kick panel or refrigerator overhang.  Often can't find the dock even if it's within 2 feet.We do like the vacuum but it looks like they could easily improve it.  With today's technology it should be pretty easy to devise a system that will allow the vac to track back into the dock.  This one is maybe 50% on that.  Many times you'll find it off somewhere else out of battery because it is lost.  You also need to do a bit of room prep before it runs so it doesn't get stuck on rugs, etc.  If the laundry room door isn't propped open, the vac will go in, push the door closed, and run around in there until it runs out of batter.  Overall, it is a worthy home tool, but I look forward to some improvements in the future which should be simple to implement.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2019

Review Text: I have to admit that I get a kick out of this little robot.  I bought the Roomba 675 because of the reviews that raved about how it cleaned up pet hair.  I am very impressed!  Not only does it do a great job on wood and vinyl, but also the low pile carpets in the bedrooms!  It does have an occasional problem getting stuck under the kitchen cabinets but it is very vocal about telling you so, which is one of the reasons it amuses me.  It also bounces around the walls and cabinets like an old-fashioned pinball; you can never tell which way it is going to ricochet.Yes, like any vacuum, the hair from my Newfoundland and long-haired tiny lion do get wrapped around the brushes.  The brushes are very simple to remove from the Roomba once you remove the dirt catcher.  I use a pair of scissors to cut through one side of the tangled hair and then easily unwrap the hair from the brushes.  Then I snap them back in place, replace the now clean dirt catcher, and dock the pinball for another day.I don't use the Roomba as my full-time vacuum as it does not get in tight places well, but I run it a couple of days a week so the dog and cat hair stay under control until I can do a full vacuuming when I have a day off.  It keeps me saner and I definitely recommend it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2019

Review Text: Great suction and does a great job cleaning up pet hair. Pretty good battery, lasts about 1.5 hour continuous on a full charge. Like I said, the suction power is really good and you can see the results both in the full filter and the lines left on the carpet. Only one real noticeable flaw. It's not always very smart and it often struggles to make it back to the base before the battery dies. I live in a small apartment so it's not like the base is far away or anything but it just doesn't seem to try until it's way too late. I'll get the notice on my phone that it has completed cleaning but I can see it's still just roaming around the living room and not even trying to head to the base in the next room. If I press the return to base button to manually force it to go "home" it still struggles and often will head in the opposite direction of where the base is located. Finally, with all that great cleaning and suction, comes a strong motor that is not very quiet. This is not a flaw but definitely something to be aware of.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2019

Review Text: Totally pleased with this life-changing Appliance. It gets confused on one of my wild pattern throw rugs and it’s gotten stuck a couple times but these minor problems are nothing compared to how handy this has been and how much cleaner my house is because of it. I really expected to be a bit disappointed— Especially because this is one of the lower end models —but I’m sorry I hadn’t gotten one of these a while back. I totally Recommend these to people. Lots of new technology tends to have a downside to it but I can’t see any downside to having one of these available in my house. I have three stories in my home and I just carry it upstairs when I want it up there. No problem.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020

Review Text: I originally bought a Eufy but returned it due to poor performance against our two shedding dogs hair. I bought this due to great reviews of dog hair. It does a great job with pet hair but has a few draw backs. The biggest one is that it has yet to make it back to the docking station at night. Most nights I find it dead in the middle of nowhere. A few times it's been tied up on some obstruction. It seems to clean for a while before this happens, so not sure if it dies or what happens. Minor inconvenience picking it up and putting on charger, but better than vacuuming myself. Still hoping it learns to get back to charge soon.Update: within a few more days, it started to learn the space better and now completes a job quickly and very efficiently. Updated to 5 star.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2019

Review Text: I was extremely happy with this product for 29 days! I purchased and “open box” item via amazon. It was open boxed as the box had a rip in it. After exactly 30 days, the side sweeper on this machine broke! I thought about returning it as it was the last day via amazon to return, but I instead contacted the manufacture. A day later they got back and said the warrantee was void since it was an open box. So either buy it brand new so you get the warrantee because you’ll need it, or flush your money down the toilet. The company was rude, not helpful and I will never buy their product again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2020

Review Text: This Roomba model is about as good as any I've purchased before. I bought this one because it was supposed to be 'SMART' and tie to Alexa. I expected that it would have room mapping. And even though I checked with Google search and on the IRobot site, I found no list of which models had that feature. A response from iRobot says only the latest 17 models do.. That's an $1100 vacuum. Meh!  .. The 'Smarts' is basically 'Alexa, have Roomba start cleaning' and 'Alexa, have Roomba stop cleaning'.... My dog is smarter than that.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2019

Review Text: We just received our new Roomba 675 via Prime a few days ago and have used it twice. According to iRobot’s website, this device should have come with an included cleaning tool, but it’s nowhere to be found in the packaging (see my attached pic from iRobot’s website).Anyhow, we have a very hairy puppy ( a 15-month-old Great Pyrenees) and this seemed to be the model to get for keeping his loose hair under control. Well, having used it twice in four days, I can say that it does a good job of getting our pup’s hair off the floor, in fact, perhaps too good of a job. I’ve run just two cleaning jobs with it and have already had to perform a thorough cleaning of the brushes, filter, sensors, charging contacts, etc., as the device was full of dog hair after just two cleaning jobs. Additionally, it got hung up a few times on rugs and cords during those two cleaning jobs and had to be manually repositioned in order to continue cleaning.On the second job, our Roomba 675 failed to automatically return to its home base and instead played a vocal track telling us to manually put it on its charger/base. The battery seemed not to be charging, so I performed the thorough cleaning that I mentioned above hoping that it might alleviate the non-charging issue. It now appears to be charging normally, so we’ll see how it holds up. It’s a cool little device, but the jury’s still out for us.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2020

Review Text: Love this thing! I haven't tried setting it up to work with my phone or Alexa but it's easy enough to just push the button before you leave the house. Gone are my days of stepping on cat litter tracked around the house by my tiny demons! Gone are the days of sweeping up twice a day!Pros: compact, very effective (laminate floors) gets corners and around furnitureCons: routing algorithm is a little wonky, some days it spends minutes cleaning the same area, the next it's like it can't find my kitchen. It has some difficulty climbing from the hard floor to the rug and usually just goes around; rug must be vacuumed manually. It's LOUD. Not as loud as a regular vacuum but sure as hell not quiet either
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2020

Review Text: On the up side, it does work well in terms of picking up the dirt.  I run it about every other day. It gets stuck on one low pile rug and shuts down every time so I have to manually move it off that one rug. So, I have to be home when it’s running to help it when it gets stuck.  It does run on other lower piles rugs. The docking feature is worthless. It does find the station but when it moves up onto the platform, it just wiggles around and then sort of falls off the platform.  When it gets low on battery, it’s supposed to find the docking station and shut itself down. This rarely happens. It usually just stops wherever it is and shuts down and I have to manually pick it up and place it on the dock.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020

Review Text: Overall, it seems to be a decent little vacuum that has good suction power. However, it doesn't clean in anything resembling a logical or linear fashion - to say that it wanders around the house like a drunken sailor is an insult to drunken sailors. I watched for five minutes as it tried to get out from under my desk. There was a clear shot right ahead of it that it could have easily fit through, but instead it kept driving straight into the legs of my chair over and over and over again. Eventually, it got itself unstuck, got to the door of my office, stopped at the threshold, then turned around and went back under the desk and got itself stuck again. I understand this among the cheaper of the Roombas, and I don't need fancy house-mapping or anything like that, but you'd think they could write at least semi-coherent software to prevent it from wasting its battery getting stuck in the same spot multiple times.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020

Review Text: The roomba is pretty loud for how little suction power it has, my friend's $80 Yeedi brand vacuum robot makes almost no noise and does at least as good of a job if not better. This roomba's algorithm for clearing a whole floor is terrible, it will run through my kitchen seemingly three whole times and barely touch the living room. It's honestly just an idiot, will literally let itself run out of battery instead of guiding itself towards the dock when its low. And even if you manually hit the "dock" button yourself, 9/10 times it won't be able to find it. If its charging and you accidentally slightly bump into, it will disconnect from the wireless charging port and over the next couple days the battery will just drain from doing nothing so it will have no juice once the next weekly cleaning cycle comes up. To top it all off, it will just do the dumbest things like wake up at 7am on Tuesday to start cleaning even though the set schedule has always been 9am Sundays. This is literally the dumbest thing I have ever bought and its crazy that it's still hundreds of dollars when an off brand $80 vacuum, is literally 10 times as good.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2020

Review Text: I read all the mixed reviews and really went back and forth about even needing a robot vacuum. I have an upright Dyson and a cordless Dyson and a 3 story home. I also have 4 dogs, teenagers and a full time job which leaves me very little time for shlepping vacuums around every day. After the reviews I was nervous because some people made it sound like an aimless wanderer that got stuck everywhere. My experience has been great, it took some experimenting and moving the hub to a different spot but I love it! I seriously feel like I hired a cleaning lady! Pros: 1. It picks up so much hair! I empty the canister and am always happy with the huge hair ball it produces. 2. It’s so easy to use on my app. 3 Fits under all the furniture easily Cons: 1. It’s not gong to get all of the hair when there is a rug that meets wood floor. It’s a very small amount that it misses 3. It’s too noisy to run while sleeping if you’re a light sleeper... it bumps into stuff and while it’s less noisy than a regular vacuum it’s not super quiet either.My tips: put your chairs up before you clean and block off areas where it could stuck with a blanket ! My dogs go to their kennels when I have it on and I block that area off because they hate it and it bumps their kennels.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020

Review Text: I was so impressed with this machine - easy to setup and use and it went right to work.  I have a kitty that sheds black hair everywhere... and I am a papercrafter, so forever making a mess with scraps in my work area... and I don't like to lug out the heavy vacuum... this machine took care of the cat hair and the paper scraps and even docks itself when done!  Has it's own easy app, but also works with Alexa, so I am very happy!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2018

Review Text: I have two Huskies and if you know what a husky is you know how much they for they drop everywhere. I have tile floors and the roomba does a good job of keeping the floor clean of hair. It does get stuck in some of the weirdest places lol. Some things I have notice that the spinning hand gets stuck and doesn't move. I have found that hair gets in between the shaft and cause it to seize. You have to take the screw off and clean it up then it starts back up no problem. The app only let's you set a time for once a day. I wish there was an opinion for twice a day. I also paired it with Alexa and that's works great. Overall I'm satisfied with the roomba.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2020

Review Text: Can't argue, it's a good stuff for the money, but my old Rumba was much smarter :-( The new navigation algorithm is not as good as it used to be. Robot frequently repeats the same navigation decisions and goes in circles. Docking is a problem. Sometimes it makes U-turn in a few inches distance from the dock and goes back to nowhere. Sometimes already on the docking pad it starts fidgeting and smashes the dock against the wall so it's impossible to dock anymore. Not sure if it's a firmware issue, maybe something electromechanical. Though, it's good to have firmware update via Wi-Fi.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020

Review Text: Roomba 675: Love this, esp during quarantine when I've got enough to do/worry about. Suction is great, works on carpet, handwood, rugs. Battery life = approx 2 hrs. Can run at night & didn't wake my child (our bedrooms are on the 1st floor). Not as loud as a conventional stand up. Love the ability to connect to my phone/Alexa.Def check/clean the brush for hair - daughter/I both have long/thick hair. Canister held more dust/dirt than I expected. Makes life easier!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2020

Review Text: I have 4 dogs and being at quarantined at home all the time made me acutely aware of just how much hair and fur was floating around the house in between weekend cleanups.Therefore, I decided to purchase this Roomba to mitigate some of that problem. And let me tell you, this was one of the best purchases I’ve made all year. I used to spend about 2 hours every Saturday just vacuuming. Our Roomba, whom we’ve named Eugene, has cut that time down to 20 minutes. The Roomba can’t always get sharp corners, which we seem to have a lot of in the house. So, if you’re buying a Roomba to stop hand-vacuuming completely, you’re going to be disappointed. But, as an aid to the house, The Roomba has revolutionized my household’s cleanliness.Furthermore, I’ve been running it everyday since it arrived and it’s only gotten stuck once on a dog toy. I’ve added emptying it every day to my afternoon routine, but it usually only needs it every other day. It does get some hair stuck along the inside cleaning rod but I just comb it out once every 5-7 days and voila, all good again.TLDR: Roomba is awesome if you just need help keeping a clean house, but it might not completely replace a normal vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2020

Review Text: I have had this product now for about 2 months.  I named her Alice.  I can have Alexa send her off cleaning with in seconds.  I have to admit I think she vacuums better than me.  She goes under my beds and furniture that I can't reach without moving furniture.  The power from it is just as good as my Dyson and Rainbow I hate to say.  It has not disappointed me.  It does not get hung up on rugs and if it does get hung up or the battery is run down it immediately alerts my phone for me to give it my attention.  I like the easy of it vacuuming for me every other day.  I have wood plank floors except the bedrooms have carpet.  I can put it in a room and shut the door and it covers every inch of carpet and floor.  It is perfect for me and I am very glad I purchased it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020

Review Text: Good for dog hair and low carpet. Decent for hard floors.Started squeaking 4 days after I received and started using it -ran once a day each of those 4 days. Cleaned it, did everything suggested to fix the squeak. Still squeaks.Also it cannot dock itself. It hasn’t been able to “find home” and dock itself once. Which is annoying but not the worst thing.Not the greatest suction power either. It will go over something it can easily pick up multiple times before it gets it or doesn’t get it at all for seeming no reason.Spot cleans great but for way too short of a time and you cannot control the spot clean function from the app which isn’t ideal especially since the clean time in it is so short.  Cleans dog hair pretty good. Fills up fast from dog hair.I think it actually does better on low carpet then hard floor. Gets into corners and small spaces well.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021

Review Text: First of all, I bought this so I wouldn't have to keep sweeping up cat litter.  All it does is fling the cat litter around, so I'm still having to sweep it up.  Secondly, it just randomly roams around the same areas repeatedly, while bypassing other areas altogether.  I have to follow it around the house and get in its way, or pick it up and move it, if I want it to vacuum any other areas.  I am not impressed and will be returning it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020

Review Text: This is my best purchase ever for saving time and energy in cleaning house.  It works great.  I'm sorry I waited so long to try it.. .didn't know what I was missing.  My carpets stand up nice and fluffy after Roomba is done.  It gets to areas that I can't get to with my vacuum cleaner.  I am very happy with my Roomba.UPDATED..............WAS GOING TO CHANGE THE EDGE SWEEPER BRUSH AND DISCOVERED THAT THE SPINNER WAS PLASTIC!  IT STRIPPED OUT WHEN UNSCREWING THE BRUSH TO REPLACE WITH NEW EDGE SWEEPER BRUSH.  I AM SO DISAPPOINTED!!!!  ALL OTHER PARTS ARE SO EASY TO CHANGE ..............NO PROBLEM WITH THEM.  HOW DISGUSTING TO GO FROM GREAT PRODUCT TO UNUSABLE PRODUCT THAT IS ONLY 2 MONTHSOLD!!!!  I WASTED MY MONEY  :  (
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020

Review Text: I always knew having a roomba would increase my life quality and was I RIGHT !!!! There’s something special about being able to turn on a vacuum while you’re at work from your phone and return home and all of your floors are flawless. I feel like the charging life is extreme too. Everytime I go to hit clean there’s never an issue, it’s always fully charged. It DOES look like the roomba goes in random directions and it may be “missing areas” but I promise it will return to those areas and get those clean it just takes time. We have only had one issue where it got stuck on a sweater of mine that had fringe on the bottom - it was cleaning my closet and my sweater was on the bottom hanger and it caught that fringe. All I had to do was untangle it and move my sweater and hit clean and it resumed the job. If you’re going to purchase this product do a double take of your home to make sure nothing like that is in the way before you hit clean.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2019

Review Text: I had a Eufy robot before and it was a good vacuum, but couldn't get over the door thresholds so was pretty useless.  The Roomba gets over them easily (except for the bathroom entry, which is a 1" marble threshold, so I have to put the Roomba in there and close the door for it to clean the bathroom).  It's gotten stuck a few times, but usually when it's gotten caught up in hanging cords, which I've learned to keep up and away from the floor.  Overall, the Roomba has done a good job and I love coming home from work to a clean place.  I have a smallish apartment (~650 SF), and the two-hour charge lasts just long enough to get all the rooms (except aforementioned bathroom).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2020

Review Text: I had a knock-off version of a robot vacuum prior to this, and although it was certainly better than nothing, it really only did a somewhat decent job on hard floors. I have a flat (zero pile) 8 x 10 rug in my living room, and all the knock-off did was deposit clumps of pet hair on it that it had picked up elsewhere.  I had to re-vacuum every time with a regular vac.  Not so with this Roomba!  My home's floors have not been this dust and pet hair-free in quite some time - including the rug!  The difference is amazing.  They say you get what you pay for, and in this instance, the extra $100 or so bucks over the cheap model is far and away worth it.  I've named him Wall-E, and he's awesome. :)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019

Review Text: This thing brings to mind the Chad Mitchel TRio's  'Wonderful little toy'. It goes 'zip' when it moves and 'bop' when it stops and 'whirr' when it stands still. Well, it doesn't do all of that, but it does go around my floor and picks up stuff. It also gets lost in a floor plan that is anything more complicated than rectangular, so I can't run it when I am not there. It does save a little effort, but then emptying it's trash bin and clearing the brushes of hair is itself a chore. I am not sure that it saves any effort over a real, portable vacuum cleaner.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019

Review Text: First off, WOW. We sweep and mop every day and turns out we were missing A LOT. This thing gets everything. We have a cat and it is EXCELLENT at picking up all her loose hair! So far, it has saved me literally 24 hours worth of sweeping.My only complaints:1. We have an awfully squeaky wheel. We've tried seeing if something is catching it, but nope. Sometimes it's worse than others.2. Docking is a NIGHTMARE. We basically have to pick it up and put it directly in front of the dock for it to dock itself. If we don't, it wanders aimlessly. It seems to only detect its dock when it's a yard away from it, and facing it.3. It goes it very weird, erratic patterns. Gets the job done in about an hour, though.Despite this, it was still worth the money. I can control it with Google Assistant and with my phone. It's a champ.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2020

Review Text: SO LOUD. Wish I could return this but it is used and outside the 30 day window. It is too loud to run while we are home during the day and too loud to run overnight when we are trying to sleep. Our friends have a shark robot vacuum and I cannot believe how much quieter it is. So frustrating. Also, it has had trouble multiple times trying to return to its docking station.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020

Review Text: I currently have three different types of tile in my house and it works on two out of three. The one it doesn’t work on has a bunch of designs and is really rough- the other two are both smooth. I have three German shepherds and a cat so hair on the floor is pretty much a given.It picks up the hair okay but I’ve noticed it doesn’t have any kind of structure- Just cruises by in random directions. The fan behind it also blows the hair away when making turns.In certain parts of my house it gets stuck a lot and needs to be rescued. Usually if it gets on cords or between chair legs. It also only removes about half of the hair on the carpet (which I don’t blame it cuz it’s usually a lot of hair but keep that in mind if you have carpet and have pets that she’d a ton).It works better if I lock it in a specific room while I’m taking a shower or walking the dogs or making food. Otherwise, it leaves the area without finishing it.The trash storage space is kind of small so keep that in mind. I have to empty it out after it cleans each area. In all honesty, I’m going to keep it because it does help my floors stay a bit tidier than before while still allowing me to do other things. I still have to sweep (but not as often) to make sure dirt or hair doesn’t built up in the areas that it misses. Will I keep it? Yes. Would I buy it again if I know what I know now and I had the choice? No.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2020

Review Text: I've been pining after a smart vacuum for some time, and decided to go with this one. Ill start with the bad:-the dirt tray is very small. I have had to empty it in the middle of cleaning cycles depending on how dirty my house is (two animals make the hair situation a mess)-The fridge seems to be just out of the way of the sensor. the vacuum regularly gets stuck under the fridge door unless we put something in the way during the cleaning cycle-It is extremely loud. Much louder than anticipated, altho it is a vacuum so ive made my peace with this issueThe good-- i can set a schedule and not worry about turning it on or off- it docks itself if the battery is low or when the cycle is over-I can locate it easily with a chime feature if it gets lost under furniture-I never have to push a vacuum around my house again, which to me is worth the bad stuff
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2019

Review Text: I've been considering a robot vacuum for years but never thought it could do the job with dog hair.  I had to vacuum daily to keep up with the shedding pet hair.  I finally decided to give it a shot and purchased this device.  I had not vacuumed for a few days so the floors were very dirty.  I started up my machine and it went to work.  I was blown away by how much it picked up without getting clogged.  The suction is very powerful; make sure your socks are off the floor.  The set up was very simple as was downloading the app and getting it connected to the internet.  I've been so happy with this purchase and should have purchased it a long time ago.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2020

Review Text: I was pretty on the fence about this purchase. We have three dogs and two cats and an older house with several rooms (as opposed to an open floor plan). I wasn't convinced that this little robot would be up to the task. I was wrong.This is one of the best modern devices I've purchased ever. Our floors have never been so clean. The first time I plugged it in, it randomly bounced from one edge to the next and seemed like there was no way it would actually get everywhere. But it runs for about 1 hr 45 min and remarkably manages to cover the entire first floor of our house (about 1200sf -- mostly wood, with a couple of rugs).A few caveats. One, I don't let it run unattended because it occasionally gets itself stuck somewhere and needs a little nudge. Two, I empty the tray out at least twice while it's operating. We run the Roomba daily, yet it's amazing how much dirt, dust, and hair it picks up. Makes me cringe when I think about our floors before! Finally, it's a little loud which makes it tempting to run when we're not home, but the trade-off is well worth a little extra noise. I wish we'd bought one years ago!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020

Review Text: I expected more from the Roomba hype.  I used this vacuum more than once giving it a fair chance.  But I was not satisfied with the job it did. Especially with pet hair.  I already had a different Shark and so finally I decided to buy and try a Shark Ion.  I received it yesterday,  let it charge overnight and then used it today.  It does a much better job and the battery is lasting longer than the Roomba.  Unfortunately I did not decide to go ahead and get the Shark while I could still return the Roomba.  But my window closed 9 days ago,  otherwise I would be returning the Roomba.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2021

Review Text: I have considered purchasing this item for several years as a dog owner, and finally decided to get it. I run the vacuum once a day so far. It is not the smartest, I am perplexed the paths it chooses although I think it does a ok job picking up dog hair and dust on this daily basis. The bin is quite small for the amount of hair my dog delivers around the house. So, most likely I will have to run the vacuum more often and try to limit it to the dog’s favorite room. While it is convenient to have to avoid the accumulation of dog hair, it is definitely not a replacement for a real vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020

Review Text: I've had this product for a few months now and I have basically given up on it.  I note that it is very bad at picking up pet hair.  Basically, all it does is push the hair around and create piles of hair next to the corners of carpets (please see pictures).  The room actually looks worse when the job is "done" because it extracts pet hair from the carpet and deposits it where it's more visible.  Vacuuming again with a real vacuum is a must when you use the Roomba.  Really disappointed that this has amounted to little more than a $250 toy, since it hasn't really reduced the burden of cleaning up pet hair messes.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2021

Review Text: We named her Rosey.  Definitely a female robot.  Does not go any direction using a logical path.  Just when you think you've figured her out, she changes her mind and does something different.  She sometimes finds a spot that you wouldn't think needs run over a dozen times - and goes at that one area a dozen times, leaving other areas as yet untouched.  With that said you have to trust her.  She will get to 99% of the floors eventually, just some areas more than others.She hauls butt too.  You'd think she thinks company is coming and this vacuuming needs done NOW!  Low profile means she will get under most furniture and tables.  Edge cleaning is amazing.  Rosey does all this with minimum noise.  We can watch TV while she runs amok through our 6 room main floor.I think Rosey grew up on the East Side as she does not have a delicate manner.  She will run head on into whatever is in her way.  I can see where a vase on an end table would be knocked to the floor.  Not a problem for us, but you may want to pretend a toddler is on the loose in your house before you let her loose.Rosey does seem to get herself out of jams okay.  In a month of cleaning we only had to rescue her once when she got hung up on a power cord that I should have secured away anyway.  Most rugs on a hardwood floor are handled okay.  We had an issue with one area rug that Rosey would bunch up because it slid on the floor too easily.Dog hair is gone.  Great on that.  Easy to clean, and all rollers, etc are easy to clean when needed.  All I can tell you about battery life is that ours exceeds 90 minutes and still has half a charge.  When done Rosey goes home for a recharge without a hitch.Easy to set up and control with or without the app.Ready for one that does the dishes.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020

Review Text: First time owning a robot vacuum. Rather expensive in my opinion. Downside is it bounces around and wanders aimlessly. Battery doesn’t last as long as I thought it would. I have a small home too. I would only recommend this if your rooms are small, square, and free of clutter. Helps me buy time from sweeping and vacuuming with a corded vacuum. I usually use this before I carpet clean. For $180 I’d prefer a cordless vacuum to get jobs done quickly
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020

Review Text: I love letting roomba vacuum while I do other chores. She is my teammate in this keeping it clean game! She does a great quick clean. I still go through maybe once a week or so & do a deeper clean w the other vacuum. She misses tight spots, but for a quick overall... she’s my girl! Love having a helper!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2021

Review Text: We named our iRobot Diana.  When we got Diana she was a blessing. I prefer to be barefoot and she kept the floors clean enough for me to do so.  She was wonderful.  She would get stuck here and there but not often.The first time I got an alert that she was near a cliff, I laughed so hard.  She's a riot.  Here we are 6-7 months later, and poor Diana is having mishaps all over the house.  Her battery gets low so fast, she is dying all over the house.  I am constantly getting alerts that she is near a cliff or stuck somewhere. I think I work her too hard, 3 days a week may be too much.  When I go to check on her, she is in the middle of the floor dead, with nothing near her and nothing stuck in her wheels.  She is constantly stuck under the coffee table where there is NOTHING around but her and her shadow.  Maybe she is napping. Maybe she just wants attention.  Maybe she is confused.  Old age? What's the lifespan on these things?  Are they like dog years?  Poor Diana.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2021

Review Text: I really wanted to love this but it just did not meet (or come anywhere near) my expectations. I have a multi floor house with all tile and super low pile (Ruggable) rugs but I also have two dogs and three cats so I need help keeping up. I ordered 2 of these based on reviews and I ended up returning them and replacing them with a massively more effective competitor. The Roombas were LOUD — like holy cow loud. They didn’t pick up nearly as much hair or debris as their competitor. And they ALWAYS had cliff sensor fails at the top of my stairs so I ended up rescuing them 100% of the time we used them. They cost twice as much for a quarter of the cleaning and 10x the noise level. No thanks.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2020

Review Text: Finally decided to write a review. I have this vacuum since 2018 and love it. I have hardwood floors so it will be able to suck up the filth. I don’t think it does that well with carpet. I have it connected to my Alexa and I just simply tell it to start cleaning. The sensors aren’t that great because is still bumps into things. It moved non heavy items on the floor a lot, like my coffee table or my sub woofer that’s on the ground. Doesn’t do mapping at all. Love how it goes back to its dock and does a good job in doing so.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2020

Review Text: I have had issues with this vacuum from day 1. I waited like a month to even hook it up since we were busy. BAD mistake as i thought amazon would cover it like everything else to be returned, NOPE. You only have 30 days. So we have a robot vacuum that wont ever return to its base and the battery always dies while searching for home base. they said bc this one doesn't have a memory on it so it just randomly searches for home base. My home is 1,000 sq foot and it can't even clean it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2020

Review Text: Anything that saves my back is a blessing.  I am really pleased so far with this roomba 675.  First of all, I have a dog, so just the hair pick-up and dust is great.  So, I have to empty the bin and clean the rollers after a good clean and it runs about an hour with the automatic stops.  I would imagine that this vacuum would work really well on new carpet just to keep it clean.  Mine is old so the heavy traffic areas are hard to clean with my shark.  I used to go thru a vacuum every year but now I have two vacuums that I can easily clean, take apart because my house is lived in.  Great for under the king bed and couches I don't want to move anymore.  Just the right price, too, although I already have a good vacuum for about the same price.  I move it around myself, I prop it on the washer to recharge and haven't hassled with the wifi yet but I can't imaging it will make the use much easier.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018

Review Text: This Robovac is far too loud to use at any point of the day. It stopped charging after only a few weeks of use. It constantly got stuck and would shout announcements in the middle of the night. It bumped so aggressively into furniture it sounded like someone was breaking into the house. It left black marks all over the trim in our house. It cleaned well enough, but all its other shortcomings made that irrelevant. We returned this unit as defective and ordered the EUFY 30C in its place. The EUFY is awesome, quiet, gentle and effective.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2021

Review Text: I am extremely happy w/my new iRobot 675 Roomba.  We have a small long haired dog that sheds quite a bit & the Roomba does a very good job of cleaning up the dog hair.  It cleans under the beds & the sectional - all areas that were causing me back pain.  Love it!!!  I stop it & move it around if need be - or just let it clean a certain area.  Easy to clean & easy to program if you watch the video.  Don't have an Alexa or something like it, just did it on my phone.  I like the option of just placing where ever I want & pushing the "Clean" button & letting it go.  I am delighted w/this product & pleased w/how easy it is to maintain.  Thank you
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2020

Review Text: Wonderful productI was so skeptical about buying it. My friend said she loved hers. I thought well if I don’t like it I will just send it back. I love it so much next time it’s on sale I plan to buy one for the upstairs. It has replaced my vacuum.If you really need a negative then it takes time to vacuum if you have large rooms like I do. I suspect it’s taking this long because I have 3 cats and a Great Dane. Mastiff mix who shed a lot.  You have to take it up & down the stairs to clean but it’s lighter than a vacuum.This is a must buy!!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2021

Review Text: I have thought about a Roomba for YEARS! I never pulled the trigger because it felt a bit indulgent...well, indulge, Queen! We got our second fluffy dog this past summer and I just couldn’t take the hair tumble weeds. We have a mix of hardwood, area rugs, and upstairs carpet. This is the second night running it and it’s wonderful. We pick it up and move it around as needed, but you could go all fancy with the additional accessories and such too. I bought the cheapest model because I was afraid of the reviews about it getting stuck on everything. I figured I should start with a $265 model in case I was let down. I don’t think she is deep cleaning, but she is cleaning far more than I was every day. I run it once my son has gone to bed so that I can pick up his toys and such. Sure, it would be wonderful if Roomba stood up, put on a French maid outfit, and did all that for me, but the way I look at it, I had to do all that with the regular vacuum. At least now, I don’t have to lug around a cleaner. Plus, I’m not going to set the timers and risk that my son or dogs have left any kind of hidden surprises. Roomba...I’m going to need you to get fancy and come up with a stairs model. My upstairs carpet is clean (I just walk RoboSuper, as named by our 5 year old, upstairs and let her do her thing since the dock is downstairs) and the downstairs hardwood and rugs are clean...but the poor stairs have hair problems. I suppose the good ‘ole Dyson will have to be whipped out from time to time. Seriously, though...you deserve this convenience. You deserve to treat yourself to it. Do it!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2019

Review Text: Well... what can I say? Laziness never pays off. I was told by a friend to get one of these and it was a major and expensive disappointment. I was using more energy to find it and put it back on track than I would have spent just getting out the vacuum and cleaning myself. To be clear... we don't have any kids/pets and live in a one story 2 bed 2 bath apartment. I tried it for a week and it never even realized there was a second bedroom even after resetting it.... what the heck?Some people think there is a "method" to the random patterns It has... but I am pretty certain It is just bad programming design. There is NO method to the madness and It does not improve the cleaning quality that is severely lacking. It is not good for people with hair.... i had to cut my hair out of the spinning brush part 3x. It was not picking up obvious dirt by the door so I tried *spot clean* mode and it started spinning in circles and then hit the wall a few times and then started spinning again until finally it went back on its charger. Honestly- by the time I had this for a week.... I was ready the hit my head against the wall too.I just don't think the technology is there yet. The only good thing that came out of this purchase is my husband got a few good laughs at me yelling and smack talking the stupid thing.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2019

Review Text: Update4.15.20 now won't charge seems contacts having trouble making connection. I tried one of these when it first came out. I was very dissatisfied. Mainly the area they call the dust bin. So if you have pets , like a long hairy dog, you know what kind of hair they can shed. I really debated on a 500 dollar model of another brand I think shark that had a separate bin to empty into. First this thing is kinda noisy. You don't want it running while you home. I bought it this time because I got new wood floors. Got rid of carpet. If you have carpet don't buy this , so I swept first to help it out. So it comes on and drives around a few minutes . I thought I would test the dock feature. From ten feet away it could not find its way back. Also I started to buy another model with brushless rollers. After one vaccum I had to take this apart, remove brush which was totally clogged with dog hair. Had to take scissors and cut hair off the brush. Its designed just like a human hair brush, which is terrible for dog hair. Then there's the dust bin. Common sense tells you if the bin is small then you going to have trouble. Sure enough it was packed , so if you have a wad of dog hair about the size of your fist, that's it, that's all it holds . So basically if you start out with brand new floors and your pets live outside and never come in and this bot runs daily all day, then maybe it's ok, for real world situations it's not worth it . I recently after years bought a big upright vaccum with brushless rollers. Best thing I ever did. It think it was a shark, but mainly it's the rollers. If they have brissels like a human hair brush don't buy it.So I would spend the extra money and try for a robot with the rubber fins instead of brissels like a human hair brush unless you like getting scissors out all the time to cut hair off rollers. Then look for one with a bin to unload in. I did see I think a shark for 500 . This 675 is NOT  for pets and should not be advertised for pets, also there are several kits you can also get that that has extra roller brushes for this model, go ahead and order one or two you will be needing to replace the dollar very soon. Also look for one of these robots with brushless rollers, the kind it comes with has brissels like a human hair brush , I have to remove the brush every time I use it and take  sissors to cut out tangled hair . Look for a robot that has rubber fins instead of a bristel brush
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2020

Review Text: I finally decided to bite the bullet and get the 675 when it was on sale. It arrived today and after a quick 3 hour charge, I let her do her thing.The pattern is haphazard BUT it does get my whole main level pretty clean. There are a few missed spots but overall the floor is quite clean. I'm not at all disappointed. The Roomba managed to get itself unstuck from some cords under the TV stand without any help. It did get wedged under the lip of the dishwasher and I had to help it a bit but that was no problem. It let me know it was stuck.The noise is quieter than a regular vacuum but its still slightly noisy. I'd say it is close to the level of a box fan.I will still probably have to sweep once in awhile to get into the nooks and crannies she can't reach but that is no biggie. Overall a good tool for busy folks.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2020

Review Text: The Roomba 675 is a great product it cleans our floors better than our regular vacuum.  The reason I bought it was dog hair that our 100 lb dog sheds and it has done a great job, in fact it is doing a better than I expected.I’m confused by the few negative reviews I read now that we have one. It is not loud at all yes you can hear it, but it has to make some noise, it has gotten stuck but if you make sure you clean wires off the ground and remove other little objects that can get caught in the brush you will be fine. I highly recommend the Roomba 675!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2019

Review Text: I wanted to leave a review, because this model had so few I almost didn't buy it in the first place, but it has been amazing! We have a dog, a cat, and cedar trees in the front and back yard so we are always tracking in little bits of cedar everywhere. Our house has standard house carpet (low-med pile), hard wood, linoleum, and various textured rugs. So far, the only thing I've seen the roomba struggle with is one very "high-pile" shag rug we have in front of the sink. It doesn't seem to struggle with any obstacles, though I do use it as an excuse to pick up all our socks and junk off the floor, which has an added benefit of encouraging me to keep a tidier house. It's only needed help getting 'unstuck' once, and when I heard the noise and tracked it down I found that it had ambitiously mounted the base of our cat's climbing tree and high-centered itself. The one draw-back I've noticed is that it doesn't alert you when the debris compartment is full, it just stops picking stuff up as well. But I've found if I run it 3 times a week (it takes about 40min to do our whole small house) the smaller volume of debris from regular maintenance means I don't have to empty it mid-job.Overall I'm very pleased with it. I absolutely hate vacuuming, so I view it as kindof an assistant, and will often do other chores while its running. The first night it cleaned the kitchen, I just followed after it with a wet rag and mopped down the corners of the floor. My house hasn't been so clean since we moved in! I even took it in a backpack to work and let it loose in my office, since we don't have a cleaning service and it was getting gross under my desk. XDI actively chose this model because it didn't come with the barrier tower things. we're trying to be more minimalist, and I don't want a bunch of extra tech just cluttering up the place. A rolled up yoga mat in the doorway is plenty to block it in or out of a room for me.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2018

Review Text: This is a useless tool:1.  It cannot stay connected to the internet, so every time we have to use it, we have to manually reconnect to our home WiFi.2.  You still have to be an active participant in the cleaning cycle - the 675 will devour any cords that are left on the ground, easily gets stuck in corners, and because we have end tables with a slightly raised circular base, as opposed to traditional legs, will “beach” itself on them.  If you try to pick up the 675 to move it, it shuts down.3.  There is no rhyme or reason to the cleaning pattern.  It will not simply go in straight lines backs and forth across the room.
