It seemingly tries to go out of its way to avoid dirt.4.  There’s no way to program the unit to stay within the confines of certain areas.  We were under the impression that was a feature on this model but it isn’t.5.  Trying to get the unit to dock itself is useless.  You’re better off picking it up and docking it manually.We would’ve been better burning our money.  Or not purchasing this useless piece of junk at all.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2019

Review Text: Review written by Christopher's wife.I loved the idea of a Robot Vacuum. I still do. But I love the idea of one that works well. The Roomba 675 is, unfortunately, not that. We did know ahead of time that this vacuum was the type that bounced around aimlessly until it was finished cleaning, and we did wonder how it would get everything clean, but we had read/seen good things and decided to give this one a shot. Sigh. This has turned out to be the robot vacuum that bounces around aimlessly until it ultimately gets stuck somewhere or runs out of battery trying to find its home. We've had it for several days now, running it during the night and sometimes during the day, and it has yet to impress us or even make us think it's worth its weight. We were going to give it an entire week, but we have determined that it is pointless to continue giving it opportunities to impress us.We have to close the powder room door because it thinks that our daughter's toddler potty is a hill to try to climb. One morning we were notified that it was stuck on a cliff. We came downstairs to see that it was simply up against a toy in the playroom. We moved our kitchen mats and stood them on their sides, leaning them up against the couch to block the path to the toys pushed under the couch. In the morning we learned that it had gotten stuck trying to mountain climb the mats, wedged itself between the mats and a chair, somehow turned around, but was unable to climb down forward. We had to move the docking station because it was unable to find it after telling it to go home. It wandered around for 10-15 minutes before finally finding it's docking station. It has gotten stuck underneath our easy chair. It has run out of battery before making it home, leaving us to go on a quest to finally find it chilling in the dining room. We are not surprised when it cannot finish a job due to being stuck or running out of battery life. We'd likely be surprised to find it in the morning resting peacefully in its docking station. But alas, we don't expect that to happen, and will thus be returning it.One positive is that it does well with the spot clean feature. That was pretty neat, but definitely not enough to make me want to keep it and/or give it a great review. Oh well.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2019

Review Text: I highly recommend NOT buying this vacuum!!!!  It is not worth the money at all.  The idea behind it is great and to be honest it vacuums really well.....however it rarely vacuums for longer than 10 minutes before it is stuck under our couch or one of our lazy boys. It actually forces itself under the furniture so hard it takes a bit just to get it out.  Its way too loud to use while we are home so we turn it on when we leave and always come back to a stuck Roomba and dirty floors. If there was a unit that would fix this issue I would be all about it but this one is not it!!!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019

Review Text: I have a 25lb dog that sheds a lot of hair.  Getting tired of finding hair everywhere just one day after vacuuming.  Bought this to try to keep the dog hair on the floor under control. My house is all tile accept for the two guest bedrooms.  Total area is over 2100 sq ft. I initially placed the charging base in the master bedroom.  Roomba ran well but couldn't find its way back to the charging base.  Otherwise I was impressed with it's ability to get under things and find its way out of tight spaces.  I moved the base to the kitchen table area.  It's part of the open concept great room.  I hoped it would be able to detect the infrared beam from the base better in a more open area.  Worked great the first couple of times and then it got stuck in a bedroom when it sucked part of the drapes into a wheel.  I decided to keep the guest bedroom doors closed to see how it worked.  Next run it never got stuck but battery died in the master bedroom when it couldn't find its way out and back to the kitchen to get to the base.  Not really surprised since the master bedroom is a fairly long way from the kitchen.  I added a second charging base in the master bedroom.  This has mostly solve the issue of not being able to return the base as there is now one in each of the 2 largest spaces in the house, the great room and the master bedroom.  Yesterday it somehow managed to back under the china cabinet and wedge itself in too tightly to get out.  Not sure how this happened since it doesn't normally go backwards. Even with these annoyances I'm happy with the results.  The bin holds capacity has been more than adequate.  The first 3 runs did completely fill since it was going under furniture I hadn't been too thorough in vacuuming beneath. Now the bin bin is about 1/3 full after a complete cleaning cycle.  Most impressed with its ability to get under the dining and kitchen table and chairs.  These are areas where dog hair would always accumulate.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2019

Review Text: This is my second. The first one lasted 10 years. Actually the first one is still running , but the wire cage around the brushes has lost most of its wire supports. When I saw one on Black Friday sales, I jumped on it. I love these. They are not the strongest suction, and they fall short of corner cleanup, but they are better than any of my former housekeepers because they go under furniture. I use these weekly in every room. On occasion, (maybe once a decade) I use the regular vacuum for a deeper clean.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2021

Review Text: I use this in a relatively small space (approximately 500 sqft) with few obstacles, yet it regularly gets hung up in places that my Ecovacs Deebot had no trouble with.  The other challenge is that it is not reliable in seating itself properly in the charging station.  I would not go with this model Roomba again.Previously I had a Deebot N79 which rarely had issues.  I'm regretting not sticking with that line.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020

Review Text: Best damn thing I bought from Amazon in ages. This little robot kicks butt! I kept putting it off. I did not want to spend that kind of money for what I considered a luxury. But I swear, this is the best damn thing I’ve purchased in years. It works it’s a little butt off. Zero difficulty setting it up. And it just chugs along. It’s a bit loud. It’s not something that you can have running while you’re watching TV. But while I’m at work it does its chores. It really is awesome. I can’t recommend it enough
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2021

Review Text: I have had robotic vacuums for many years, recently we moved into a new home and decided to buy an additional one for the main floor and move our old model upstairs. I tried several models including this rumba and I was pretty unimpressed compared to our old Neato vac. In the price range I would much rather purchase the Neato, which I eventually did as it has ladar and maps your floor. To get that on roomba is much more expensive. I returned this model after 2 days unhappy with it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021

Review Text: We named ours Henry.  He does a pretty good job, fills his dust bin on every cleaning mission.  He misses some spots but so do I.  I think my only gripe pertains to docking - he has a hard time finding his recharge station, and then has issues sometimes connecting to it.  He’ll abort, then stumble around for a while until he eventually comes back for another try.  I am going to try some double sided tape to hold the dock down because it’s fairly light and slides around when he is trying to re-connect and charge.We like him, he does a halfway decent job and picks up dirt and cat hair so we are quite happy with him.  For the price this one is hard to beat.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019

Review Text: I would give this iRobot 4.5 starts. It’s great, not perfect but I’m pretty impressed with how it cleans. It does a nice job getting under furniture, and going a round table legs. I would say it’s totally worth it and wish we got one sooner.After about 10 days of owning it and running it once a day, I swiffered the whole house to see what I would find. I was very impressed with how little dirt I picked up. Normally it would have taken multiple swifter pads and been pretty gross.It does need a little babysitting but not much. It does favor certain rooms, I have to kick it out of the bathroom cuz it will go in the bathroom like ten times.It’s kinda annoying, it bumps into everything and is pretty loud. But you do adjust to it. It sometimes has a hard time docking and will need help.It will clean our 800sf condo with one cat pretty nicely in about 1.5hrs. We have never had it get a full in the middle of cleaning. Works super well for our space.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020

Review Text: Make sure to pick up cords, socks and other little things in the room you plan to vacuum before running this or it is guartanteed it will get stuck.The robot works excellent for what it is. The fact that it doesn’t have any kind of intelligent mapping  of rooms mean it can miss areas, but if you let it run frequently, it doensnt seem to be an issue because it will get the other area on the next run.Overall, I love it. I haven’t had to sweep my wood floor since I bought it, but I have had to vacuum my carpets, even though I didn’t pick up as much as I normally would. My only regret is that I didn’t spend more money on a smarter robot.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020

Review Text: I was hoping for more. I was thinking that this vacuum would clean the whole floor in a *somewhat* methodical way. Instead, it just shuffles around aimlessly and totally randomly, passing right by debris as it goes. You can't program it to learn your floorplans. What's even more frustrating is that we have rugs with different colored square patterns. This stupid thing just gets stuck in one tiny square because it mistakes the edges of each color for different "obstacles" and won't cross over the lines. I wish I had spent more money and gotten a better product.I will say that it picks up a lot of dust in the places it suck-cessfully goes. (ha - get it?)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020

Review Text: Ok, so I waited way too long to write a review for this.  life is insane and I really wanted to test this thing out too.  Hands down, very satisfied with the purchase.  I have been using this product for well over a year now and the only issue I have had was a slight charging issue.  I simply cleaned all the contacts with rubbing alcohol really well and its all good.I have a husky mix and she sheds 24/7 365....  This thing does wonders for helping maintain a fur free house.It is hooked to my home wifi and I am able to control the iRobot with my phone or by using my Alexa.Buy one.  you'll be happy.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2020

Review Text: I thought buying a Roomba was  a good idea... This thing is so poorly designed it can't get on it's own charger! I have back and neck issues, which is why I use a vac bot and i have to kneel down to adjust this stupid thing to get it on it's charge. I continually go to start it and suprise it did not charge properly.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2021

Review Text: Use  - Hardwood & vinyl floors  | 1 cat & dog | 6 rooms approxOverall -  While we have to clean out the Roomba after each use and sometimes reset it on its base, having the Roomba has drastically helped keep our floors maintained. Instead of every day, we now personally sweep once a week and let Roomba run daily.Pros - picks up dog hair, removable/replaceable parts make cleaning less of a hassle. can traverse minor obstacles, (dog toys, rugs,cords)Cons - base is lightweight and sometimes gets pushed around when Roomba is trying to "return home"  and the floor needs to be very flat otherwise it may not chargeOther comments - there are metal prongs that connect the trash bin to the device. These need to be cleaned each time you empty it otherwise it may cause an "error" and Roomba will not run. 7/10 this has been the issue of roomba not working properly. a minor fix saves a lot of timeThoughts - It would be great if the base could be better set to uneven surfaces to make sure the metal charging pads touch the machine uninterrupted. *Older house so finding an even wood floor surface is not easy.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2020

Review Text: Like convenience when it works.  Within 90 days,after receiving, the vacuum reduced run time from 90 minutes to 60 minutes. Now it runs out of battery power before it goes back to docking station. Have replaced filter and brushes and cleaned charging pad already.  When it works, it is great. When I contact online help I felt in a loop of FAQs that are not helpful. At first the online chat feature was helpful but now I am told to go back to the FAQ.  I even purchased a warranty.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2021

Review Text: I have 2 low shedding dogs but they are constantly tracking in grass, dirt, and leaves from the backyard. The floor was needing vacuumed every day or other day. I couldn’t keep up and was tired of dragging the vacuum out. This Roomba is a lifesaver. It has no problem on my hard wood or tile floors. It transitions between my area rug and other flat laying rugs to the hardwood effortlessly. I can’t believe I waited so long to buy one! Love that I can set it on a schedule or tell it to clean whenever.My only negative is that it has to move directly over the debris to suck it up. But one cleaning cycle usually takes care of my main level. Would still buy over and over
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020

Review Text: This roomba is ok, just make sure you don’t have any small items or cords on the floor that you don’t want sucked up. I am however upset with how I revived this roomba. I was clearly given a roomba that was returned. Their was hair and string in one of the rotating balls, the plastic part you pull out was already pulled out and the roomba itself had scratches on it. I wouldn’t have minded if I was told I got a pre opened package, but no one said anything and tried to sell this to me as a product that was brand new.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2020

Review Text: The device is awesome. It is a little wonky seeing it move about the house and our dogs are terrified but it works great on the hair but for carpet and hardwood. Only issue is the app is not the best, but you can run it without the app.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2019

Review Text: When purchasing a Roomba, properly setting expectations is key. Yes, the Roomba will travel in a random pattern and sometimes get stuck or cover the same area multiple times. Yes, you have to put some thought into the area being cleaned for the robot to be effective (e.g., shut the door to a bathroom with a thick rug, pick things up off the floor, invest some time in cord management behind the sofa). No, this is not the product for you if you want cleaning service-like vacuum lines on your carpet.I am someone who keeps a very clean home — the kind that makes people wonder if anyone actually lives there. I continue to be floored by how much hidden dust and small particles the Roomba picks up, even with just one day between uses. The real value of this product is being able to kick it off when you’re leaving the house, or jumping in the shower, and discovering afterwards how much hidden dirt would still be on your floors had the Roomba not done it’s job. It’s a no-effort refresh of my home that allows me to spend my time elsewhere, and cleans in places that I wouldn’t normally touch on a weekday (e.g., under the sofa or bed).If you’re already pretty tidy and want to be even cleaner, this is the product for you. If your house isn’t normally “picked up” and needs deep cleaning, then this probably isn’t what you are looking for.Minor issues with docking, etc. are annoying but not deal breakers. The worst thing that happens is that the Roomba never makes it home, dies after cleaning, and has to be manually placed on the charger.While the self-emptying models are probably nice, I didn’t want to look at the extra apparatus in my home, and I like to monitor what the Roomba picks up. Manually emptying the container every couple of days does not bother me one but.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020

Review Text: Another disappointing product. I bought it to save my back. I have to follow it around and use my feet to get guide it in the direction I want it to go. It seems to go in random directions. It does not pick up pet hair, it just leaves it in clumps for me to pick up. It is ok for getting other easy dirt up, but I have to follow it, as I said above.  It has a hard time docking itself, I have to help it. Huge waste of money.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2020

Review Text: I would not have paid $200 for this without Amazon offering it for 5 x $40/month...fit my impulse buying nature easily. It is fun to use, though it's random cleaning pattern is like a spider on LSD making a web. It eventually does seem to clean all of my one level condo, with some caveats to note. First, Roomba-proof your house... get all mini blind cords, extension cords, loose items off of the floor. It will find them all without fail. Move chairs out from under tables so it can get around chair legs. You get the idea. It does find a surprising amount of dirt, even though it cleans every other day. One more toy in my arsenal for being a neat/clean freak.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020

Review Text: I purchased the renewed unit and other then there being no instructions it looks brand new.  I have to say for a base model it works pretry good.ProsStops at the edge of my steps so i dont need to worry about it fallingPicks up all the dog hair that it comes in contact withGets under the couch and tablesSuction is goodConsDoes not get edges well. When it bumps into an edge it tends to turn a little to muchOnly get to about 80% of the floor due to lack of mapping technology but for the price i cannot complainOverall we love it and it cuts down on our daily vacuuming which we takes forever with 3 dogs
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2019

Review Text: Useless to you if you have multiple surfaces on the same floor, I can't believe this can't transition from hardwood floors to carpet, and the 99.00 bargain robo vac does it without a problem, and I can say for sure,it also has better suction and the irobot home app is not worthy of The cheapest vac on the market. This will be going back. One more attempt, and this thing can't even get over a flat runner on the hardwood floors. What a POS
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2020

Review Text: I really wanted to like this thing but it just won't stop getting stuck. It literally won't even bump into anything and it still will give you an error stating to clear the bumper. After reading reviews and even seeing some of the videos I'm convinced I got a lemon or something is wrong with this model.  I have used this almost every other day since I got it on Dec. 25th and it still won't remember rooms, won't dock on it's own unless i literally carry it and put 3 feet away from the charger. My floors are mainly hardwood with one area rug.  I've changed the docking spot to make it easier and reboot, clean the brushes and empty the bin each time. And still, it manages to to continue to get stuck in plain air - nothing around it. I will press the vacuum everywhere on the app and it will literally do a little section and look to dock itself. I mean this thing is suppose to make my life easier not harder. It's literally stressing me the hell out so I will be returning this. It's not worth the frustration. I've read the responses from iRobot about its rhyme and reason for how and why it cleans the way it does but I'm not convinced.  I need to find something else and I can't recommend this thing.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2021

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   It is strange that the vacuum moves around in such an odd way. It's supposed to be able to navigate, but I think it's just running a confused path. It misses some spots but eventually goes back gets the misses. It seems to spend a lot of time going over the same spot before it moves on.It sure beats doing it myself with a manual vacuum. But it has absolutely no intelligence. I expected a robot vacuum to have some intelligence and be able to map out my house and then vacuum everywhere...boy I was wrong. It really is a dumb bot. I hope someone designs a smart bot soon. . . iRobot!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2020

Review Text: Occasionally, you'll see it run over something and not pick it up.  It does do a "good" job, it's pretty thorough as far as covering the floor space, going around corners and other objects, and it's easy to use with an iPhone.  If the suction was better, I'd give it a better rating.  It's pretty easy to clean, some parts need to be removed in order to remove hair that gets wrapped around them.  I clean it after every use to keep it it good working condition.  Overall, we're happy with it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021

Review Text: I have a couple large short-haired dogs and my place is all hard floors. Before the Roomba when I would sweep and mop once a week I would pick up a ton of fur. Now I have my roomba set to run every other day and when it gets to my weekly clean I barely have to sweep and I don't find much fur.That being said, the only frustration I have is that the Roomba sometimes has a hard time returning to its base, but that might be where I have it. It also tend to wedge itself under the refrigerator door and errors out as a "stuck bumper". I haven't figured out a fix for this yet.All in all, I have been really happy with the purchase I made a few months ago and it's made cleaning a lot easier. I would definitely recommend this unit. Setup was super easy and it seems to do a decent job.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2020

Review Text: We are so happy with this iRobot!!  For reference our house is 2700 Sq ft.  It cleans all of it easily from tile to carpet to room sized rugs on tile... even under the beds.  FYI-empty the tray every time it finishes and keep the wheels, sensors & brushes clean.  We are impressed with how much it covers in one hour.  We love the phone app which works very well.  My DH one day said to release the Kraken... so that is her name.... which Alexa will release or return to dock on command.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2021

Review Text: Received as Xmas gift (2020). Worked fine for two weeks. All of a sudden it starts going only in circles with the message “error #10, right wheel problem”. Called Roomba customer service who sent us a new right wheel assembly. Now it is 2 weeks without a Roomba that works. Replaced wheel assembly, same problem and same message. Call to Roomba service...they asked us to send a video of the Roomba going in circles! Pardon me. After a long haggle they  have issued a return label and a credit to our credit card.A great idea, quite “high tech”, but if it does not work beyond 2 weeks they should go back to the drawing board.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2021

Review Text: Owned an ilife V5 vacuum/mop robot for three years and the battery started falling. Went from almost 2 hrs to 30 mins. vacuum time. Decided on purchasing a Roomba (although more expensive) with hopes it would be better.... Well, very disappointed. Fully charged, Roomba only worked for 30-40 minutes (the description said 90 minutes). We tried it multiple times and timing was the same... Noticed it was a bit louder than the ilife V5. Also noticed it would not clean as well and would leave particles behind... Maybe got a defective product? In any case; not trying to promote a different brand, but returned the Roomba and purchased the latest ilife V5 Pro which has vacuum and mop integrated (plus it is cost effective). Very happy with the ilife unit. It lasts almost two hours and it cleans much better than the Roomba. Oh, almost forgot to mention: could never get the irobot app to work. Would stay stuck in the connect to network page. Would follow the steps again and again and it would not work... So frustrating.  Uninstalled the app, rebooted the system and it would still not work. Tried multiple times and it just would not work... Will not say whether to purchase this product or not (some are fans of the Roomba, I thought I was going to be), but in my experiance it is just not worth it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2019

Review Text: This is a major oversight that has been a topic of discussion on the iRobot web site. There are times when it is necessary to manually guide a vacuum out of a situation. My last robot vacuum had a remote control with arrow keys. The Roomba doesn't come with a remote and the App for Roomba doesn't include this capability. The app includes a "Start" button and a "Pause" button but no "Stop" or "Dock" button either. So to end a cleaning session early and return to the dock you have to push the button on the robot. And if you pick up the Roomba and move it, then the Roomba can't find its way back to the charger. Come on iRobot! Your customers are demanding that you include the capability to manually control the Roomba in the App.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2021

Review Text: Always wanted one....could not really believe the great reviews...I mean HOW could it really clean so well?Well, it DOES!  It is seriously amazing!  The first time I used it, I stayed downstairs and watched it go all over in seemingly random patterns...and the result was dust-free marble tile and area rugs!!  The funny thing is, when Roomba cleans the floors, it inspires me to do the other cleaning things I might put off.  So it's a double win!  We took it upstairs then, and it was super at cleaningall areas including the carpet under our bed (where I tend to neglect).  So much dust gone now.  We are thinking of getting a second unit just for the 2nd floor.  Have not used the wireless-phone-connect app yet, but that's next.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020

Review Text: Don't buy this. It's the worst vacuum ever created.  Mine was always stuck in odd places, breaking, not cleaning, then I got parts and they didn't fit right.  I thought the iRobot name was gold but it's crap crap crap.  Go with the Amazon recommended eufy or anything else.  THIS VACUUM IS AWFUL!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020

Review Text: Does a pretty good job! Cleans a surprising amount, very satisfying to empty it each time. It gets stuck on a plush rug and I once had to cut it out with a scissors. So don’t let it go on things like that. I did purchase over a different brand because it was supposed to be better at plush rugs... but I guess mine are too plush. It’s pretty loud and the dog hates it... though I think likes it better than the regular vacuum! Overall I think it does a good job. Kind of random though and hasn’t found its way “home” yet so I have to bring it.

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   I will start off by saying that the iRobot Roomba has definitely helped my family with the day-to-day cleanup.My wife and I recently welcomed A firstborn son into the family. In the beginning, it was a struggle to keep up with the household chores while one of us went to work and the other stayed home.  The baby did not like the loud vacuum we had, and taking the vacuum in and out each day was a big hassle, not to mention took one of us away from the baby.I purchased this product so that it could do the cleanup after feedings, and pick up the items that we might have missed. Out of the box it worked fantastically! Yes it runs around the room a bit randomly, but it’s still gets the job done hugging the walls, and doing the different rooms that we have. The vacuum is decently quiet for what it is able to do, and on multiple occasions has not woken up our son when he is sleeping in the evening and for daily naps.This model does not have room recognition, so it will clean any area that you leave open. If you really want that level A vacuum where you can ask her to clean specific rooms, go with a newer model.The only issue that I have right now with the Roomba, is that It will not go onto our very short shag carpet. After contacting the iRobot team, they said none of their models would be able to clean a shag carpet. They suggested putting the Roomba onto the carpet to start, but that did not help.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2020

Review Text: The customer Support is horrible. They do not know how to make their own App work. The machine has poor suction and just runs with no pattern. You have to buy expensive add on blocks to keep the robot out of unwanted areas. They did not work as well. Tried the machine with replacement same results. Do yourself a favor don't waste your time and money!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2020

Review Text: So difficult to connect to the WiFi that I returned it. Spent 90 minutes on the tech support line at iRobot before giving up. They wanted to send the problem to their advanced team and get back to me in a couple of days.  I’ll have a different brand robot in those same two days.  Went through a crazy number of attempts, reboots, etc with tech support.  It is defective or so sensitive it didn’t function.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2019

Review Text: Have to agree with the same negative comments as others on here.  Docking connection is unreliable, does not clean all areas, not programmable as advertised, brushes are a pain to remove and clean.  Wasn’t sure if I bought too cheap of a model or what. Would like to try another model but this wasn’t exactly cheap so don’t want to invest in another. I’ve gone back to factory settings and tried to reprogram and NOPE! Very disappointing.March 31, 2021: picked up my house to run Roomba. All ready to go AND nothin’!! So angry. Requesting a refund.

Review Text: We resisted for years and finally decided to try. It has been one week and I say what good is a robot if it can’t see or if it has no memory! True on both counts. It can’t find the base, it wanders off to farthest corners of the house, without cleaning the areas on the way. Then it can’t return to base. I am not ready to shell out another $100 or so on virtual walls. So I am back to my Dyson and wait another five years then check out the bot world again. May be Tesla will come up with something worth calling a bot.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020

Review Text: I had a cheaper knock off product, and although this product cleans better, it always stops with a "stuck" error, or "stuck on a cliff" error.  The cliff is my flat area rug and the base of my fan.  It heads for these two areas every time I turn it on.  I have never had it run a cycle without getting stuck 3,4,5 times.  I've gotten to where I don't even look for it until the next day.  I've had it 3 months.  I'd take the cheaper model that doesn't have as much suction than this thing.  They should name it dumb blondie.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020

Review Text: I previously had another brand and it was ok, but this one is WAY better and it has no problems climbing over thresholds. I love that this connects to Alexa and I absolutely love the app. If there is a problem like being stuck or even when its finished doing a job,, I get a notification on my ohone. I love it.  Everything is so easy to work. This little helper  moves fast too and is effective also. It does a really good job. My fav thing is how it can clean under my bed, dressers, and entertainment centers of which was unreachable before with a regular vac. I love this model and I love the app. Best investment, ever!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2021

Review Text: This is a very basic robot-vacuum cleaner, in that it does not map the room/house but does adhoc zig-zag cleaning every time you turn it on. It's battery is not very long. For our 2 bedroom apartment, it would die out after doing the living room and one bedroom - and it wouldn't resume after that. I had to manually take it to the 2nd bedroom and have it clean that, which is a pain. Some times it would clean the same room twice (because it doesn't know it has gone there before).I guess I should have done more research on the different variants of roomba before buying this. This is one is suitable for only small 1 room type apartments which can be cleaned in one shot. I finally ended up returning this one and going for an advanced model, which was twice the cost but maps the rooms first and has a pause, recharge and resume feature - which I think should be present in all models.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2020

Review Text: Having owned a first edition Roomba back in the day, I was reticent to purchase another one but was intrigued by the newer features. I've had it for a week now and I am nothing but impressed. First of all, I can program it through the app on my phone. I currently have it set to start at 6 am each morning. It leaves its charging station dutifully each and every time. Then it roams around my house and cleans until it puts itself back to "bed." Most impressive is the amount of debris, hair, and fine dust it picks up every single day. I am truly shocked at how well it works, how little attention it needs from me (aside from emptying the dust bin each day), and how great my house looks! I am recommending this thing to all my friends!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020

Review Text: It works very well, is easy to program, and almost always finds its way back to recharge. My only complaints are that it is pretty thick and will get wedged under things, doesn't always backup when detecting a "cliff" which means you have to go save it (it does alert you through the app when both of these things happen and you can have it make an audible sound to make it easier to locate), and finally, (this is more of an OCD thing) but it only vacuums on a zig-zag pattern so the vacuum lines are not pretty on the carpet.

One of my friends has this same machine and her brush doesn't work either...pfft!

Plus, when placed back onto the charger, it doesn't make proper connection to fully charge without  multiple efforts to lift and press it into precise place. It appears the wheels cause misalignment in height, so the battery connection doesn't take place.  Our former unit was a different brand and lasted years.  I wish we had NOT tried this one. Worst xmas gift. Waste of money!

Review Text: This is my second roomba, had an Eufy in between roombas as well. Roomba is definitely the superior floor vacuum . Does a much better job cleaning and for the most part not getting stuck however I would think that it would be a little less noisy.It is a nice feature that you can turn it on/off and return to the base with your phone. The app gives you visibility of how long it cleaned and the dirt detection and will also notify you if it gets stuck.All in all, it is great. This is a replacement of my first one because it went through dog poop and ruined it. Dog poop:1 Roomba 0

Review Text: Rating it 5 stars based on first use.Really writing this to comment on Amazon Warehouse. (Will update actual product after we’ve used it a while).I purchased this thru amazon warehouse for $150. I was expecting “fair, with damage” condition but I was ok with that due to it being half price and also... It’s a vacuum cleaner, not a livingroom center piece. Review Text: I purchased this for my son because he has a cat, and I have always been intrigued with this gadget.  He was very happy to receive it and set it up right away.  It is amazing the amount of stuff that it can find in your rugs and floors. 5 stars for the cleaning power  The device does its job well and returns back to the housing unit when its done.However, I have notice that it is very noisy, I give 1 star for the noise.  When I press the dock button, the device goes not recognize that it is close to the docking station and goes all over the room before actually docking, I give 3 stars for that function because it does finds it way back home. However, if the device is full it will stop in the middle of the room.

Review Text: Finally, I found the right robot vacuum for our needs.  We have two corgis … enough said, hair everywhere.  We've tried two other robot vacuums and this one seems to do the job fantastically!!  Easy dust bin cleaning, moves around my house at a faster speed than the other ones and vacuums the heavy traffic areas thoroughly by going over it several times.  This is our first day of using it and the only thing I noticed was having to pick it up and place it in the hall after it vacuumed the living room about four times but had not gone down the hall and bed/bath rooms.  So far I really like it.  I only wished it had a remote as we have dumb phones, no smart phones to use the app.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020

Review Text: There are 6 kids and 3 dogs in this house. I didn't have super high hopes, but turns out this little guy is amazing so far! The bin isn't huge, but I just empty it a few times while it's running, easy enough. I got this because I'm quite pregnant and it's nice to not have to lug the vaccuum around twice a day to keep up with the dog hair tumbleweeds. Transitions great from the rugs to the hard floors. Would buy again! Considering getting another already.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2021

Review Text: This may be a little on the expensive side but, in the long run it's a great investment. We moved in to a new house and having a border collie that sheds lots of hair we knew it was going to be challenging that's why we decided to purchase it.Pros:- It's great handling pet hair.- It will decrease the amount of manual work you have to put in cleaning the floor.- It's also great with other things like dirt or food crumbs.- You can start it without moving using the app or schedule cleaning jobs.Cons:-Sometimes it may take a while for her to return to the home base. We found out it was because the home base needs to be separate from other things so make sure you locate the home base somewhere that has lots of space.Overall 10/10.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 6, 2020

Review Text: I have 3 cats and a Great Pyrenees (giant long haired dog). I have laminate over my whole house and needed help with the dust hair piles and cat litter. This doesn’t “get to know your house” so it doesn’t remember where it’s going. So I close off areas of the house so it focuses on where I want it. It goes underneath the couch and the bed. It climbs on top of area rugs. If it encounters an object like a table, it will navigate around it back and forth until it cleans. It will enter in little areas like the pantry for you. Sometimes it will have an affinity for one area so I just pick it up and move it. I usually let it do it’s thing for 45 minutes and it gets the whole main area of my house and I have very minimal clean up afterward. I’m done with spending anytime sweeping! It’s a little loud so if you want to watch a movie, you might need the subtitles if it’s in the same area.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021

Review Text: This thing sucks. It really does. It will suck up all the dirt and hair in your house.It makes a terrible noise on carpet though. Like a cat screaming...We returned one thinking it was defective but that wasn't it as the other one does the same. WD-40 this thing up around the spinning thingy and its not as bad.We thought about returning it and getting one that isn't annoying but it quickly became part of our family as the app has you name it. So Frieda stayed with us and does her thing once a day while we are out.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2020

Review Text: Like most people I hate vacuuming. The iRobot allows me to vacuum while sitting or laying down.I am a live alone senior and I like having a clean house, but hate housework.  This gadget allows meto have that.  I was amazed at how dirty my carpet was after the first cleaning.  I let Rambo run untilit ran out of power.  It ran for 90 minutes the first time and then went to the dock without prompting.That was so cool.  I have had it for about 6 weeks and when I let it run now, there is much less hair and dirt.A great buy.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2019

Review Text: This thing is great! She cleans every inch of my floor and can even reach corners with her bristles. It's very user friendly and the app is pretty cool to use too.I have 3 dogs and my hair falls out like crazy, so she is great at picking up the hair! My hair is long so sometimes it gets wrapped around the wheels, but they are very easy to remove and clean. If there is hair stuck in her wheels, she keeps cleaning like a pro, though!She also does well with a few carpet rugs I have.. the transition from tile floor to carpet is seamless.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2021

Review Text: I’ve come to really love this roomba. I have it scheduled to clean when I’m at work so when I get home the apartment is clean! It’s great! Easy to operate and clean. The only reason I’m giving it 4 stars is because sometimes it gets stuck on the edge of a floor mat and I get a message saying that its “near a cliff and needs assistance”. So I have to start it up again when I get home. It doesn’t happen all the time but often enough to where it gets a tad bit annoying. Other than that, I love it. Highly recommend!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2021

Review Text: This is by far my favorite purchase, it cleans so well. After a full vacuum it comes clogged full of dog hair (in a good way) even after cleaning the night before.My biggest complaint is for how easy it is for something to go wrong. We have had it 10 days and I've had to take it apart and deep clean it already because the brush wasn't spinning properly. Hair can tangle pretty easily. I love it, but it has its flaws!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2021

Review Text: This thing has changed my life! We have two dogs and a new baby and with hardwood floors I was dreading needing to vacuum/sweep every single day once she started crawling. We purchased the least expensive model knowing it was not a deep cleaner and that it would not get all the dog hair from our area rugs. We are so pleased with this model. To address other reviews, it is not silent, with dogs out needs to be emptied after each cleaning, it does not entirely replace our vacuum. We bought it knowing these things and I'm Soo grateful we did. While I do still get out the two vacuum once a week or so, I no longer see piles of dog hair under my end tables! I let my daughter explore the floor comfortable that she won't get a mouth full of hair when she inevitably face plants!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2019

Review Text: I have love/hate relationship with this vacuum.Pros:-I can set it to a schedule, and it will automatically run at the scheduled time.-I can manage the vacuum from the app on my phone.-It works well as a daily cleaner in between my regular, deeper cleans.Cons:-Super noisy. I don’t like to have it run when I’m home because it is quite loud.-Has no real pattern. It will vacuum the same area for 45 minutes, and not even touch other areas. It just kind of beepops around randomly, and misses lots of spots.-It gets stuck constantly.*BEWARE! It eats socks!Overall, this vacuum is just ok. I don’t love it, but I don’t hate it, either. It is helpful to not have to sweep or vacuum everyday, but these things do still need to be done, occasionally, as this vacuum is not very efficient.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020

Review Text: Where the hell does this thing find all the dirt?!!? - Simple setup, connected with mobile device and Alexa. My only complaint is you must clean it more often than suggested - but we use the Dyson a lot less now. This thing goes on every morning at 9AM by itself - we can walk barefoot and feel how clean the floor is. We have 2 golden retrievers so there is a lot of hair - so you must clean the rollers and the wheels a lot. BUT for the price and how clean it gets the floors - it is worth it. It is a great supplement for manual cleaning. It does get stuck every now and then, but it alerts you on the phone and you can tell the app to send a signal to it so you can find it - unless the battery is dead when it got stuck. I am continually amazed at the dust / dirt in the collection bin. We run it multiple times sometimes in a day - and it always manages to find something lol. Worth the $179 we paid.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020

Review Text: I would not buy this. The algorithm is random and dumb so it cleans the same corner of the room repeatedly and misses the same spots after running for an hour (it doesn't go back and forth like you might expect, it randomly bounces off walls). It gets itself lodged in weird spots and contrary to other comments it's very loud. I'm not sure how it got so many positive reviews but I deeply regret purchasing.After doing more research, I would get the more expensive model with room mapping or get another brand. As is it's useless and ridiculous.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020

Review Text: This Roomba makes life so much easier. We have an anxiety ridden Shellie that sheds like crazy. My wife and I used to spend 2 hours sweeping and vacuuming every couple of days just to get rid of the dog hair but, this roomba takes care of everything with zero effort on our behalf. Very impressed.Prior to this we owned a fake roomba and it sucked, short battery life and poor suction but, this particular roomba delivers. Triple the battery life of the fake roomba and fabulous cleaning power and, the Shellie fur does not wrap around the spinner brush or clog the suction.Well done Roomba! 5 Stars!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020

Review Text: We have two big dogs and two small.  Lots of dog hair.  We also have a newly constructed home, which brings lots of dirt into the house.  I was sweeping and mopping twice a week for our baby, who is crawling everywhere.  This thing is a life saver and does a terrific job!  I run it everyday and somehow it manages to find pet hair and dirt.  The floors look and feel spotless.I decided to buy this one over the more expensive ones due to the fact that the reviews were just as good and I didn't see a huge difference besides a camera (which is pointless after a few uses in my opinion) and a bin that emtpies itself.  The bin feature would be nice, but it's really not a big deal to empty the bin once a day.  Save yourself some money... This one is just as good.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2019

Review Text: Have had Roomba for about two weeks and very happy with performance. Our main floor is hardwood and we have two dogs so pet hair was primary reason for purchasing. First week we used it every day at least twice a day and emptied it each time as it was completely full. Funny how excited a family gets over watching a vacuum do its job. Very important to keep components clean for robot to run effectively.Bedrooms with carpet have never felt cleaner as it goes under the bed and close to walls where a standard vacuum cant reach.Not sure why you would be the more expensive models when this one does a great job.YouTube videos will show you how to clean components and take care of it to keep it running smoothly.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2019

Review Text: I love not having to vacuum my downstairs as much anymore thanks to this vacuum. We have a dog that sheds a lot and this is able to suck it up with no issues. Only thing thats frustrating is when it cant dock in time so it dies in the middle of nowhere and also you have to make sure everything is picked up off the floor before it starts cleaning because it will suck it up and get stuck until you clear it out. If you have kids that are messy like mines and leave there little toys around this can be an issue at times. Otherwise very helpful product and I am glad to have it regardless due to having a big home.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2020

Review Text: I can’t believe people rave about this. It’s useless!  All it does is move the dirt and dust around the house. There’s no pattern to the movement so it misses whole parts of the room and spends way too much time over others. It has trouble moving from hard wood floors to carpet and just spins. I end up supervising it so that it actually cleans the whole room! I might as well get out the vacuum and do it myself! What a waste of money!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2020

Review Text: The Roomba is something I always had on my "Wish List." I waited for YEARS to get one, and now there are so many different versions of it I was so confused ordering. Reviews helped me the most in choosing, which is why I'm taking the time to review this one!I have 2 dogs, and 2 cats. My two dogs are 75 pounds each, full of sand at ALL TIMES (current construction in the back yard does NOT help). We had sand everywhere, AT ALL TIMES. Our furniture (even with the pads on the feet) started scratching our new wood floor because we couldn't keep up with the fur and the sand every day. We bought Shark Stick vacuum from Target, used it a couple of times, but realized we are honestly way to busy/lazy to spend our time vacuuming ourselves! That vacuum is now a dust collector in the closet, as we decided to bite the bullet and just try out the Roomba. We opened it, let it charge overnight (only needs 2-3 hours) and used it one Saturday morning. This thing just started scooting around, cleaning up corners I hadn't reached with a vacuum in weeks! It did have trouble docking the first time, as we chose a bad spot to keep the charging base. The charging base is the only thing I would change. it seems a little light weight and would be better if it was heavier and easier for the Roomba to dock to it without being SOLID against a wall. Anyways, once we moved it, it works perfectly every time now! We connected Roomba to our Alexa, and when we leave the house we pick up the dogs toys, and tell Alexa to turn on the Roomba. We come home to a fully charged Roomba, and a beautifully clean house! Our dogs don't mind it when they are by it, and our cats don't even know it's there.We also use it on our second level, but we only use it down there when we are home as it can't make it back up stairs to the charging dock on it's own (obviously). But again, we either press the clean button down there, or tell Alexa to start the Roomba and continue on with our daily tasks, not even thinking about physically vacuuming the house ourselves. We replaced all the soft pads on our furniture, repaired our floors in the places it was scratched, and now our furniture glides like butter across them! **We have a huge rug in our downstairs living room, and Roomba has cleaned this very well without getting stuck, but most of our house is tile or wood floors. Roomba did get stuck on my bathroom rug, but it stopped immediately and had no damage to the Roomba what so ever!Another note, Our couches are too low to the ground for the Roomba to fit underneath (Not Roomba's fault) so before we turn the Roomba on, we will sometimes slide the couch forward a foot that day, so it gets a bit under the couch. Then when we get home, we slide the couch back. The next day we will slide the couch backwards a foot, and when we get home move it back to it's original place. (Sand creeps under the couch frequently is the only reason we have to do this)Another random side note- The Roomba has a very easy to clean basket! (ours is full EVERY DAY) which is embarrassing, and makes anyone wish they didn't have 4 animals and a messy husband, but whatever :) They recommend replacements of different parts every couple months/twice a year depending on the part. We found a 8 pack of each part online(Amazon) for $20 TOTAL, so maintenance on this device is going to be low cost as well.All around- saved my sanity and I can go barefoot in my house!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2019

Review Text: This was our first robot vacuum purchase.  It arrived Oct 8, 2019. After having it for about one month I started researching models that actually map the footprint of your home.  My thought now is seeing how our second purchase performs, I wish i would of waited and bought a laser guided model.  But for this Roomba, I am very pleased as it performs exactly as advertised.  We have two levels to our home.  I use the Rommba on the top level and our newest purchase robot vacuum that is laser driven ( a must versus the camera driven models)  on our lower level.  Overall the Roomba is great.  The prices for the brands/models that just bounce around are coming down as other manufactures are getting in on the robot vacuum market.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2019

Review Text: I had high expectations for this robot and hopes it would make my life easier. We have a Great Pyrenees, and a peekapoo so we have lots of dog hair, on top of 2 boys. The first few runs were just okay. It left some things behind but I could over look it.About 2-3 months after having it I started to get a battery error. It wouldn’t charge correctly. I contacted roomba they walked me through how to fix it. Awesome. Then the right wheel kept being “stuck” so it just spun in circles. They sent a replacement wheel. Still doing it. So now I have to ship it off to them to see if they can fix it. This robot has been more of a headache than just sweeping the floors!I will say their costumer service is fantastic. Hopefully they’ll be able to fix it, and I can update to a more positive review.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2019

Review Text: Absolutely love this little workhorse. Download iRobot app and I can set the schedule for each day. Goes from room to room on the main floor.Mud room, full bath, kitchen and large living room. Just set it and go. Has a sense of humor too.She (has a female voice) if gets stuck when I forget to pick up all the dog toys, will send me a message to phone that iRobot has fallen off a cliff. When done cleaning the iRobot will go back to the charging station on its own.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2021

Review Text:

   Choca muy duro con los muebles
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020

Review Text: We've had our iroomba for a few weeks now, and I'm not super impressed. It does clean the floor in ideal conditions. It has a hard time going over transitions like tile to carpet. It gets stuck a lot. When it runs out of battery it just stops wherever it is and we ha e to go get it and pick it up and put it back on the charger. It bumps into everything and not lightly either. It is surprisingly loud, like can't watch TV or have a conversation loud. Will probably find something else that is a little more advanced.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020

Review Text: I love this product.  The only reason it did not get a 5 star rating is because I have another model as well and I cannot get both of them to work with the app.  This should be easily done; but I cannot find any instructions as to how to add the second robot in the app.  We have a large home and I have two robots now and need a third.  The app should allow for multiples!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2020

Review Text: I returned this item a few weeks ago. I bought it because I had a cheaper vacuum that didn't work, and thought this costs more so maybe it'll work better. It didn't. It kept bumping into things and going to the same spots, completely missing messes. It was also very loud! And lastly, it said it needed to charge but never turned on again!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020

Review Text: She isn't as smart as it claims, still gets stuck in the same spots, but overall cleans the floors very well. I have a Great Dane and Pitbull who both shes quite a bit and a husband who is equally as messy and our floors still look great. I only wish she mopped as well! The app it comes with actually works too, we leave for work and I can turn it on without having to be near. But like I said it does get stuck in the same spots so we usually find her stuck when we get home. Still better than taking the time to vacuum myself.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2021

Review Text: I have 2 cats and, boy, does the floor get dirty. My partner and I both take off our shoes before entering the house and I vacuum with my Miele once a week. Still, it was as if I needed to vacuum every day which I do not have the time to do.My brother who has very bad allergies had recommended to me to get a roomba over the years, and I couldn’t justify the cost. It was Black Friday and my brother emphasized, again, the power of his roomba. I caved and got one not expecting much.Wow! What an amazing little robot this is! I put him to the test the first night and although my cats were skeptical as well, they soon learned this little robot is their friend.Once I saw this little robot work his magic, I bought another roomba for my downstairs.Thanks to the roomba, I no longer walk around with cat hair or dirt specs getting stuck to the bottoms of my feet.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020

Review Text: Have a husky retriever lots of hair. Cleans it no problem. Saunders around aimlessly but cleans surprisingly well. It cannot however don’t the home station. If I hit the home button On the bot or in the app it still fails to. That’s the only bad part but not a big deal. In the morning I just have to do a little hunt to find it. I have it set to clean at night, the battery dies and it always stops in a random area. It can’t find home, but I have to empty the tray anyway, and every time it’s full. Cleans edges under furniture one of the best purchases ever.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2021

Review Text: I was amazed at how much dust this thing collected on it's first use. One thing I learned is that it will get tangled up in electric cords that lie on the floor so try to have them out of the way when you want it to run. This is not the most sophisticated model so it runs randomly around the floor but eventually cleans it all.  A more expensive model might run a tractor-like pattern but I am happy with the job this thing does. I don't have any pets so I did not rate it for picking up pet hair.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2020

Review Text: We have hardwood floors and two cats.  You'd think we have a dozen cats the way these two shed.  The Roomba does an outstanding job keeping two rooms clean (livingroom and bedroom).  It's only gotten hung up once in the month we've owned it, and that was on a cord we left on the ground.  We've found that it doesn't like some of our furniture that it can't "see" such as an old fashioned rocking chair, but it still manages to clean around it.  It seems to take random paths, but I haven't seen it miss any debris yet.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020

Review Text: I LOVE IT! I did not purchase this with the idea that it would take over my regular vaccuuming - it was simply to help me stay on top of damn pet hair that seems to get everywhere! I just purchased a new home with - ugh - carpet, and while we wait for renovations, this has been a life saver. I'm shocked at how much pet hair this thing picks up each afternoon!As I said, I still need to do thorough vacuums every once in a while, but not nearly as often which is amazing. It does run into some weird problems - such as thinking the edge of my very low rug is a "cliff" or finding its way under my dining room table but unable to find its way out. But overall, this thing is amazing. Worth every penny.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019

Review Text: I had a 675 and when it died, after 4 years of daily use, I upgraded to an 890 because of the fact it had 2 rollers instead of a brush and a roller.  WHAT A MISTAKE!  After 1-1/2 years, I gave the 890 to my daughter and went back to the 675.  This machine is a powerhouse.  I will never complain about cleaning the brush again.  It cleans the two rooms I use it for in under an hour, returns to its dock and is ready to go the next day.  I use it every day because I'm a little OCD about clean floors and this Roomba is the greatest!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2020

Review Text: This robot uses fairly dumb bump and turn navigation. As a result, it misses spots and frequently can't find the charging base before the battery is exhausted.It works OK but it's not the Jetsonian godsend it's cracked up to be. I regret purchasing this model a bit. I should have bought a more expensive model, which actually maps your house and remembers which rooms it's done. But those models are 2-3 times more expensive.I can't complain too much for the price point but it's not really a great robot. When it comes time to replace it, I'll be mote careful about the type of intelligence the robot has.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2020

Review Text: I was quite impressed by the value of this sub $200 Roomba.  It works great at maintaining clean on my carpet and tile.  It is much better than I expected at navigating around complex objects.  Only disappointment is that it seems to pick up tangle on the roller even faster than my regular vacuum.  Although the roller is easy to remove and replace, it isn't particularly well designed for hair tangle removal and that seems as though it is going to be needed regularly.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2021

Review Text: I researched several different models of Roomba and settled on this one for several reasons. First, I have a dog. I wanted it to be able to pick up all the extra fur he’s dropping all over the place. Second, I have both tile and carpet- I needed it to be able to conquer both.After having this little Zumba Roomba for a month and a half or so, I am super pleased! My expectation was to be able to run this buddy between deep cleans and help stave off the build up of shed fur and BOY does Zumba Roomba do his job! A normal vacuuming every 2 weeks helps keep this place very clean.Key points to remember: it’s just a robot. It’s not exceptionally smart at remembering where it’s already been. If that is what you are looking for, up your price point to one of the newer models of Roomba. Something that drives my husband crazy is there is no straight lines or rhyme/reason where Zumba Roomba goes, though that doesn’t bother me at all. It will get stuck under tables and on high pile throw rugs every once in a while.Also- yes. Yes we did name our Roomba “Zumba.”  It’s 2020 and it makes me giggle.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2020

Review Text: I dont have carpets so I can't comment on that end. Seems to get the dirt and dog hair around my home. Louder than expected. Also gets stuck on thresholds to other rooms about half the time. Another flaw is if you hit dock before it is done, it still takes 20 min or so to find its way home. Also if you don't have carpets like myself, it can push the docking station around when trying to dock. Had to tape mine down. Other than that, makes it more convenient than sweeping the entire house.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2021

Review Text: I have purchased two of these machines and this is my opinion. The one that I have at my work office works great because it's a large square room. Only a few times has the machine died trying to find the dock. However, I have one for my home, and it's the worst investment for my home I have ever done. First of all, it doesn't pick up dog hair at all... horrible suction. I have literally stood and watched it roll right over a piece of dog hair and left it there. Second, it never knows where to go... always makes its way into an area/room and will it there spinning in circles for 15-20 minutes because it can't get out! the base is so lightweight that you cant place it on anything but carpet to dock because the machine, when trying to dock, pushes the base all over the place and can never dock. So you would have to use sticky tape or something to hold the docking station in place... which might ruin your floors. So I have placed it in the wide-open living room on the carpet and it still can't dock on its own. I have had the one in my house for 4 months now and run it every morning and not one time has it docked on its own...it always dies somewhere and I have to hunt it down and place it on the dock.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2021

Review Text: Overall a great product, but it is frustrating that I cannot just take the vacuum out for two seconds to clean a spot. It says that there is spot clean, so I will try it but for spot cleaning it seems less efficient than a normal vacuum. I like how compact it is. I LOVE that I get home to a clan house every day. I do come home to find the roomba stuck on random items which is quite funny...but shows that it is getting stuck. I don't think it can clean my area rugs unless I put the roomba on top of the carpet myself. Overall we are glad we got it, but we also purchased it at $199 during black friday...which was a huge win.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2019

Review Text: Nice concept. But the 675 that I purchased freaks out in my dark brown hardwood floors sensing “a cliff”. It’s completely unreliable. Might work fine on carpets or light wood floors...but not mine. See photo. Keeps getting stuck right here. Nothing around it. Tech support says there’s nothing to do except spend 3X more in the 7-series. It’s going back.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2019

Review Text: This is my new favorite thing! I have a large home daycare, 3 kids of my own and hardwood floors throughout my house with carpeted bedrooms. I don't like to sweep and although my house was picked up and tidy, it often felt dirty. I've had the irobot for 3 weeks now. I run it almost daily and my floors are so clean. I don't even have to mop as often and there is less dust because it cleans under my couches, furniture and beds. It is amazing! My house is a 4 bedroom with a living room and den so I run it for an hour and a half in one half of the house, let it charge, then run it in the other half of the house. I clean out the collected dirt tray everyday because I don't want it to be full. Once a week or as needed I clean out the brushes and parts that build up hair. My daughters and I have long hair so it doesn't bother me to clean the brushes. I am reminded of all the hair I didn't have to sweep up. People think it is pricey but the time it is freeing up in my life is worth the price. I really don't have many complaints. I'm telling all my family and friends to get one.I can control it through my phone and my Alexa. It goes over my area rugs and from hardwood to carpet with no problems. It doesn't suck up curtains or bed skirts and if it happens to snag something it stops and I am alerted. All the things that I thought could go wrong are not a problem. It's a really great product for me and my home.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2020

Review Text: Lack of functionality that any robot vacuum should have. You can not prevent if from generating error sounds and voice messages in the middle of the night, it has no mapping capability, so there's no way to tell it not to go into certain areas. Sometimes jobs refuse to start and iRobot says the resolution is to remove the battery to force a hard reset and it's a ridiculous and difficult solution. You will be very disappointed and it's too late for me to return it since it's been over one month.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2021

Review Text: I love this thing! Picks up all the dog hair left around the house and I can finally walk barefoot without worrying about dust. Keep in mind, my house is 1 level and open concept. It's perfect for open concept. I can see people getting frustrated if it doesnt clean everything, but if you've got tons of obstacles you might want to go for a higher model that learns the layout of your home.Minor con: wont clean my black rug, but that's seriously not a big deal.My advice, just make sure you keep it maintained and empty it after every use.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2019

Review Text: It's neat to watch him run around the house bonking into things, but I swear I can do better in 5 minutes with a vacuum cleaner than it does in 3 hours.  The little twirly brush tends to shoot things out of the way and the machine will then miss it.  Does very well going from hard wood to carpet and over molding between them.  You will have to move everything off the floor!!!  We have an Oriental carpet with fringe on the ends; had to tuck them under, have to move a couple of small statues we have on the floor, and we have to move the wires for our lamp, etc.  All in all, probably best to run it every single day (which we don't!)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 19, 2021

Review Text: I owned a robot vacuum by Shark before this one. When it died, I replaced it with this one by Roomba. This vacuum is much faster, has a great battery life, and it cleans very well (including let hair). However; it is way louder. It also doesn’t come with anything to act as a boundary. You can buy the virtual wall barriers separately (2 for roughly $80). The Shark uses boundary strips that come with the vacuum, or you can buy your own for roughly $20. I’m happy with this vacuum, though. It’s taller than the Shark, so gets stuck under things less.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2021

Review Text: This is my second purchase of the this model. It does a good job of picking up dust and hair on hardwood and low pile rugs. It does not work on carpet which is the reason that I  bought the second one to put upstairs so I moved to downstairs and have two roombas on the first floor of our home. The  first one works great and returns to it’s base. This one does not and I have to find somewhere in the house and manually return to the base/charging station. Even when I manually try to charge it, it’s very temperamental and I spend several minutes trying to get it position just the right way so it will charge. I should have returned and had it replaced because I think this one was just a lemon and not indicative of the performance of the rest of the line.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2019

Review Text: It cleans well if it’s charged. Most of the time some how it doesn’t charge properly. The self docking doesn’t seem to work all the time. Also if someone touches roomba while charging I think it gets disconnected and stops charging. The charger could have been more robust. It looses charge quickly too. I bought mine Jan 30th 2020. It hardly can do 1 small living in an apartment and then it’s done out of batttery. Might be good for small kitchen and very small rooms. Need more powerful battery for large rooms.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020

Review Text: I have owned several these and its always the same. They start working great. They clean very well and they don't crash into anything. But, over time the plastic cover over the cameras or whatever it uses to see gets scratched and then they begin to crash into all my furniture and walls and get stuck on nothing. I had one that literally sat in the middle of the floor, did circles and then sent me a warning that it was stuck. There was nothing within 10 feet of it to get stuck on.  Unfortunately you cannot replace that piece. Also, most recently it doesn’t return to the base and the battery simply runs out. I then have to go hunting for it. Anyway, works great initially, but over time it becomes a nuisance.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2019

Review Text: This is a good in-between cleaner, but it does not replace my upright for heavy duty cleaning.  I like that I can program it to vacuum while I am at work.  2 negatives.  Every few uses I have to use scissors to remove hair that is wound around brush.  Also, the Roomba will sometimes get trapped under furniture or hung up going from hard wood floor to carpet.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2020

Review Text: My Roomba has saved me so much time! I have two dogs who track in dirt quite a bit. My oldest dog loves to attack vacuums, but he learned pretty early to leave the Roomba alone. I only use it when I am inside or they are in a room with the door closed, but I haven't had issues with them and the Roomba (I am sure this is the worry of many dog owners). The Roomba does a great job of cleaning my house! The app makes it super easy. It hasn't caused any damage to baseboards/furniture/etc. I do recommend making sure wires are out of the way, but other than that it is pretty hassle free! Don't waste your money on higher end models, this model does all that is needed!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2018

Review Text: Definitely a good buy! We gave away out vacuum cleaner after seeing how an hour of roomba locked in a room CLEANS! Need to come out with a contraption that works for steps and we are great! Def recommend for pets! The amount of hair it gets is wow! Changed the air quality and everything! Only slight annoyance is cleaning out the filter but at leasts it gives me inventory of dirt. Clear floor of ALL cords beforehand bc roomba will eat it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2021

Review Text: I actually was coming to RETURN this Roomba and the window for returning it ended about 2 weeks ago. SUCKS FOR ME! It is constantly getting stuck and doesn’t go over thresholds very well from the bathroom to the carpeted halls/bedrooms. It bangs into the bottom of my kitchen cabinets and gets stuck EVERY SINGLE TIME it goes in there. I would not buy this again. I wish I would’ve just gotten a normal vacuum that I could do myself in 1/4 the time!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2021

Review Text: Not what I thought it was going to be. 4 months into using this product...wish I had not ordered it! Take a chance but beware! Mine may just be a lemon. With all the stress in the world now-a-days I thought this would be simple but NO...
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2020

Review Text: I am very pleased with “Ivan” our daily assistant. We’ve had him 2 weeks and he has mapped the areas of our house and today he successfully docked himself. We purchased the I robot as a daily cleaner for the “crumbs” of life, not as a deep cleaner. The first time we used him he went everywhere, under beds, behind couches, under tables, etc. so it can do all of that if you want but we still use a vacuum on a regular basis for that so we mainly wanted it to catch the daily living messes and crumbs and that it does well! It’s also fascinating to watch so provides great entertainment!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2020

Review Text: This was the biggest waste of money. I thought I was making the right move by buying the brand name option, however, I quickly learned that was not the case. Biggest issues -1) Power. This puppy is plugged in 24/7 and yet it still dies before it completes it's work of vacuuming my 800 sq ft apartment. I manually vacuum the place 3-4 times a week (I have 2 pets) so it's not like it's working that hard to clean.2) Noise - I purchased this with the intention of using it when I was "at work". I realized that working from home while using it is not an option. It's incredibly loud and distracting, and does not focus on one room at a time. It zigs and zags all over the place so the noise is constantly bothersome3) Rugs - I have all wood floors with 2 very low pile rugs. Every time the roomba goes off the rug - like it's finished cleaning the rug - it will start loudly beeping and say it's on a cliff and I have to rescue it. The same thing happens when it bumps into the legs of my barstools. It's not practical to move 3 barstools every single day when I use it.4) App - when I use the app to send it "home" before it's finished its job, it has never once successfully returned home. In an 800 sq ft apartment.I couldn't be more disappointed in this. I think the bottom line is - just do your own vacuuming. I have no kids, no extreme messes, and just wanted this thing to do the bare minimum. That was too much to ask.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020

Review Text: This vacuum would be useful if it functioned as advertised, but in the 3 weeks I have used it, it has never sucessfully completed a job. The only thing it will do correctly is to charge its battery, but only if I place it on the charger after picking it up from where it tried to climb a wall and became stuck, or ran out of battery and expired 10 feet away from the charging station. One 18 X 22 carpeted room and one 15 X 18 tiled room is all it is required to clean. Every day I have scheduled it has been met with disappointment when I receive a message on the app that it has failed to complete the job due to becoming stuck or running until the battery has lost all power. If this is the future of robotics we are doomed as a species.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020
