Review Text: I did a lot of research and was so excited for this!  However, after one day it was returned.1) It didn't pic up the simplest dirt.  I watched it go over areas multiple times and there were still specks of dirt (both on carpet and hard wood).  Yes it picked up dust under the couch, but all the visible dirt was still there.  And we don't have a super dirty house - just two of us no pets no kids2) It's very loud, louder even than my normal vacuum.  Add to that it's always running into things to add to the noise and it drove me nuts.  You'd never be able to run this while sleeping or even watching tv3) It's zip zag random dumb motion - it goes in the most non-sensical motions!  It got stuck under the couch about 3 times, but totally ignored parts of our room.  It went from room to room constantly4) This random pattern means it took forever to clean! I could vacuum myself in a tiny amount of time it took the roombaFor a $300 vacuum I would expect to not have to babysit it and clean up after it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2020

Review Text: Not as good as cheaper versions! I’ve owned 2 iLife robot vacuums at half the price of this and they cleaned better and came with a remote that lets you change the direction of the robots path, select spot, home, etc. This roomba only lets you select home or clean from your phone.  Which means only the person with the app can do it and you can’t control where it goes. Plus it is SO NOISY!  That is the main reason I am returning it. It wakes us up and the bedrooms are on a different floor in the house! I can’t even think while it’s running it’s so loud. Maybe if you have carpet it’s ok, but not on hardwood. Plus the suction is horrible. Wouldn’t even pick up tiny little pieces of leaves. Just scatters them all over.  Going back to the cheaper iLife!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2018

Review Text: I have had this for 2 weeks:So far it is amazing! It picks up SO much dirt and hair. We have 3 dogs and a cat and my floors are spotless.We decided to get this cheaper one to see if it was something that would work for us and I am amazed! For the first week, we let it run everyday. We made sure we picked everything up and it only got stuck 1 time and that was because it went behind our couch that had been moved out accident.During week 2, I did the maintenance on it and it was super simple. We use it every other day and have it schedule to run just before we get home. This thing even picks up cat litter!If you are on the fence, try it. Has made my life so much easier not having to sweep everyday!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2019

Review Text: The Roomba has a difficult time parking in its charging base. It tries. It actually climbs in to the base then fidgets left and right to try and connect. It then leaves the base and dies somewhere else in the house. We try to place it manually on n the base bit to get it to charge we have to prop it up on the left side to make contact with the charger. This takes about 15 minutes.  I contacted customer service and they did not respond to address. Rather they sent a survey to ask how the customer service I got was and claimed I got an email response. I was not nice on my survey and finally got an email asking for pics which I sent. No response. This place is our second Roomba but most like our last. They are too expensive to risk a lemon.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2020

Review Text: Bought a slightly used version because of how pricey these are. Works really well on wood floors, sometimes struggles with small rugs as it can get stuck sometimes and can flip parts of the rug up. Does really well with pet hair. Also does well with dust and dirt on the floor; you can tell when it’s done with a room because you can walk barefoot and not have any dirt or anything on your feet. Doesn’t always clean every room, so sometimes I have to gate off an area it already focused on so it can focus on a different area. When it’s in docking mode, sometimes it will still be cleaning for a bit until it gets close enough to the dock to sense it, then it’ll finally dock. It’s about as loud as a small standalone handheld vacuum cleaner for a car
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2019

Review Text: This vacuum's a glitchy mess. It requires constant baby-sitting and doesn't save any time.Half the time, it can't dock by itself. It just runs until the battery runs out, and depending on your house/apartment, it might be hard to find and rescue. Manually docking it is really annoying: it needs to be positioned extremely precisely or it won't charge.When it does dock automatically, it usually doesn't charge. I have to wiggle it around for 1-2 minutes until it starts charging. The scheduling feature in the app is pretty useless since I have to do everything myself anyway.There are problems while it's vacuuming too: it often gets stuck, it often gets clogged, it bumps into things violently. Sometimes it gets stuck on nothing. It often yells ERROR 23452345 CHECK THE APP. But there's nothing in the app.There are even problems while it's docked and should be doing absolutely nothing. Sometimes it randomly starts vacuuming in the middle of the night. Sometimes it randomly yells ERROR.The app is poorly designed. You know how you can schedule repeating alarms on iPhones and Androids? And you can disable those schedules without deleting them completely? Seems like a no-brainer, but the Roomba app doesn't let you do that--you can only delete schedules.Definitely do not get this if you have pets. If a pet poops or vomits, the Roomba will smear it everywhere. The manufacturer's official solution is that you should inspect "floor conditions" every time you vacuum. So it's yet another task you need to perform yourself. Even if you can get past the "poopocalypse" problem, there are plenty more. If a pet slightly bumps into the Roomba, it just starts vacuuming.There are many other issues when the Roomba works "correctly." It's loud and it takes 1-2 hours to vacuum. No using the phone for 1-2 hours then. It requires frequent brush cleanings--much more than a regular upright vacuum. It will sometimes randomly ignore some rooms. Very unreliable.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2020

Review Text: Works great as expected.  I have tiled floors, my floors looks and feel clean.  Picks up the  pet hair and thats why I wanted the roomba,  Frees my time to focus on other things.  You still have to sweep behind stuff, and get the house roomba friendly because it can get caught up on wires, etc.  pick up pet bowls.  I dont have the barrier, I dont think I really need it..  Its a little noisey but not annoying at least not to me and its not as loud as a regular vacuum.  It runs about 60mins more like 50 mins.  My cat keeps an eye on it and when its finishes and docks my cat goes around were the roomba went and inspected what it was doing.  He doesnt like it but he doesnt run and hide from it just watches it.. so Im disappointed because the ads show a cat sitting on it.  That would be awesome if he would ride it....LOL
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2018

Review Text: I had a Eufi before the Roomba. The Roomba was more expensive but I was curious about the hype behind the brand. It is more powerful and larger than some of the others. I will say that it's cleaning power is impressive. But what good is cleaning power if it can't get itself back onto the charger and begins to have problems after only 6 months. Additionally, because it's so powerful, it can actually do a lot of damage. It pushes around my end table, knocks things off of other tables, and scuffs up furniture it can roll over. Its motors are very powerful and it can roll over a lot.It also has developed odd behaviors. It will finish the job and get back onto the charger, then three hours later start saying "Please move roomba to another location" and "Please charge roomba". It also doesn't have a remote control or any other controlling features. You can start it and stop it, that's it. If you want any sort of features you have to buy the more expensive models. And I do mean MORE EXPENSIVE. I talked my partner into buying the $800 version and it's not really any better. After this thing dies I'll probably go back to the Eufi or try one of the others. The Roomba isn't worth the high price tag and doesn't live up to the hype.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2020

Review Text: We had purchased the i7 vac and MP6 mop a month ago.  So impressed with the products and technology that I thought I would try a robot to clean my screened in porch of 600 sq ft. Did not need the higher tech mapping products, just the older style 'bump and run' type robot cleaning for this single room area. It is finished cement floor with 1/4 wide expansion/drainage joints.  Had several answered questions that indicated that this would not end well.  No idea what problems the others faced, but the 675 performed flawlessly.  No problem with scattered leaves or the joints in the concrete or working on concrete at all.  The 675 got this semi outdoor area remarkably clean.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020

Review Text: it will spend 15 minutes in one room and then skip a room or two, and can't find it's way back to the home charger.  This would be great if you had one big room, but not at a home with multiple rooms.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2020

Review Text: Bought this based on Wirecutter recommendation. Out of the box it refused to connect to the wifi.  I followed the instructions exactly at least a half a dozen times. I downloaded the required iRobot app and got through to the final step where it continually displayed and error message, “cannot connect to internet, try moving base closer to wifi”. So I tried one last time with the unit literally NEXT TO the wifi antenna.  No luck.  OK, so I figure I’ll just have to use it without the wifi. Theres a big button on the top that says “Clean”. I pressed that and off the roomba went.  It wandered around the house for an hour or so, then died without returning to the base as it was supposed to do. For the last two weeks, we have started the cleaning cycle at night before going to bed each night.  Each morning, I come down to find the roomba dead somewhere in the house, without returning to the base.  Once it became entangled on the fringe of an area rug. All in all, not much of a help or time saver, except that it can clean a bit beneath the furniture. It’s fun to watch it motor around but it clearly isn’t as automatic or smart as the company claims it to be.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2020

Review Text: 2021 UPDATE: STILL IN LOVE. I have used and abused my Roomba - often running more than once a day (especially when I am working from home and can easily put him back on the charger as soon as he finishes). Roomba has really helped motivate me to keep my floors clear of clutter for him, and on top of that does a fantastic job cleaning.  I do sometimes wish he could find his way back to the base, but honestly it hasn't been terrible having to track him down. I have a dog, and Roomba has NEVER failed to find a fistful of fur, even though I run it every day/multiple times a day. I cannot see any fur, but roomba still finds it.This guy is not smart (e.g. does not do the mapping advertised in the 900 series) and kind of just bumps around like a drunken sailor. BUT he cleans my 2 bedroom apartment FAR more thoroughly than I ever did, and coming home to a clean carpet has really motivated me to clean other areas, like dishes and laundry. Maybe this just came at the right time in my life, but this guy is everything I hoped for. It's reasonably quiet - I would say it's the same noise as an RC car, which is not silent but very tolerable, at least to me.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2019

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   The Roomba was really great at the beginning. We use it for a shop with concrete floors. Really made a difference at first. Not long after we started using it, it was clear that the little metal contacts on the bottom were getting dusty and weren't making good contact with the dock, so that the Roomba kept trying to dock over and over again. We would just pick the Roomba up from wherever it died, clean the contacts, and then set it on its dock. Now, however, even with cleaned contacts, the Roomba still doesn't seem to make contact with the charger. It tries to dock over and over, each time shoving the dock all over the place, so that it ends up pointing in some random direction, making the process even more impossible. The dock weighs nearly nothing and needs to be heavier in order to withstand the force of the Roomba as it tries to "park" on it. We tried to tape it down, but the Roomba just dislodges the tape.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2019

Review Text: This vac seems to be twice as fast as my old neato xv21 and does its cleans a single charging (instead of two).It does not like the throw rug with a black line around the edge stopping because it sees a cliff and does turns every 6 inches in the interior of the throw rug.It taps it way along the edge wall to clean the edge but I worry it will wear the paint off over the years.It also has brush of the right side to sweep dust away from the edge of the wall.  The original brush was mangled when the ribbons of a cat toy got wrapped around it.  Shoe laces too.After a month of use, contacts between the charger and the vac turned black and it wouldn't charge.  I cleaned the contacts with a rag and it would charge for a couple of days before not charging reliably.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2019

Review Text: Only had since December and now wont even charge. Not to mention the amount of ‘de-hairing’ the wheels and spinning parts. Took me an hour to clip all the hair off.. 3 Autralian shephards and this do not go well. A bust for us and a waste of $200. Was SO excited for this, and hugely disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2021

Review Text: I LOVE this product, I have 3 SIBERIAN HUSKIES and I will run Roomba while we take the dogs on a run or to the dog park and when we return home the Roomba has completed it's job (usually 1.5 hrs) and our living room, kitchen, and bedrooms all are absolutely spotless and I have no bad words to say about this product, I would recommend this to everyone!! Our flooring types include Hard Wood Floors, Tile, Carpet, and an area rug! all is totally rid of dog hair and debris! The only thing I could think of with people having issues with Roomba and dog hair is that they don't clean out the deposit enough after it completes jobs! With dog hair you do have to clean and possibly cut the hair out of the sweepers to keep it clear and clean! if you have dogs and want to get you house cleaned without lifting a finger ORDER THIS NOW :) hope this helped people with LOTS of doggo hair like me!! This product is a life changer!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2020

Review Text: My wife loves it.  I'm impressed, too.  To my surprise and amazement, it picks up HUGE wads of dog and cat fur.  Navigates around all kinds of obstacles, under beds and furniture, and over transitions from smooth flooring to rugs or thresholds between rooms.  Finds it way back to it's charging dock (although it may take a while searching).  The only thing I would do differently would be to lay out the extra cash for the model that empties itself.  If you have furry pets, expect to empty the collection container after each room, or consider getting the more expensive model that empties itself at the charging dock.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2018

Review Text: Brand new Roomba is better than my older 4 yr Roomba model. The advantage of this model was its price, it’s WIFI features and simple design dust collectors over my old Roomba.  It collects more dusts with less air filter parts, easier to clean the collected garbage and it tells me if the unit is stuck over an obstacle via WIFI.  Again, my Roomba is cleaning hardwood floors and not a carpeted floor.  It does have a strong ability to push objects like shoes and slippers and suck up rubber bands, earrings and dental floss.  It best to clean the rollers every week to ensure nothing is jamming the rollers
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020

Review Text: After 3 months, so far it has knocked over multiple items and caused a lot of headache (it hits furniture often). It gets stuck on all sorts of things, you cannot leave anything at all out anywhere. It will suck up a cord and possibly pull everything off your dresser, causing drinks to spill all over your room (this it has done a few times). We can only use it in one room that doesn’t have anything that can be damaged. If we do use it around the house, we have to thoroughly check for all of the places it will get stuck, knock things over, or suck things up. At first we loved it... I still do for limited uses.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2021

Review Text: These things don't last longer then a year. I've bought 2 in 2 years and both of them have took a dump on me. The first one stopped connecting to wifi, alexa and then stopped turning on. The second one randomly started spinning in circles cleaning the same spot over and over with the clean button blinking. About 2 weeks after it randomly going from spinning in circles to regular cleaning everytime it cleaned, it had the same fate as the first one. I didn't get the warranty because I thought a vacuum that cost me 300$ the first year and 260$ the second year would last longer then 300 some odd days. Do NOT buy this. I'm sure there are better brands out there that don't dump on you after minimal use and a years time.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021

Review Text: Used it on Hard wood floor. Cleaning is good. But software is all but. Half of the time it does not come out of the dock. Just start and turns and pushes the dock away. It's loud. Bounces to pretty much everything with force. Half of the time when you send it home, it can take up to 20 minutes or not find it at all. Cleaning it does a perfect job. Other than that. No Either I got a faulty united or it's designed that way. I don't know. Returned the unit.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021

Review Text: Works similar to my old 650. Good for hard surface floors. This one has WiFi control which is nice to have. Quieter than the 650 for sure. Set up is easy. Suction is typical for small hard floor vacuums.-0.5 stars because the battery terminal was bent on arrival and the unit wouldn't charge. Easy enough to bend back in place and it works, but this shouldn't be an issue when NIB.-0.5 stars because you still can't schedule mutiple cleanings in one day.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020

Review Text: I was hesitant for years to buy one of these because I have two large dogs that shed a lot ,I own a Dyson regular vacuum and it picks up a lot, what I love about the Roomba is it gets under the dining room table and under all the spots you miss unless you move your furniture, if you make sure you move all your stuff off the floor and let it do its job it does it well,I turn it on every morning and it does a great thorough job the bin is easy to clean and it picks up ALOT.it comes with a second filter and I change them out after I wash one it dries in a day or two n I swap it out.it also has wifi connect I downloaded the free app and it works great.i highly recommend this little friend of mine!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2019

Review Text: Works well, although it is inclined to get jammed under things that are too low. If it can get under something, it pushes until it escapes or gets stuck. It rarely backs away from tight fits. It's extremely noisy. It does a nice job in our foyer, which tends to get a lot of tracked in dirt and debris, but it rarely finishes a job without getting stuck in the same place. If I'm organized, I block the area to save myself having to intervene.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2021

Review Text: The first unit stopped running after about 20 minutes.  Not sure what the problem was, but Amazon sent a new one right out before we returned the old  Roomba.  This new unit works super!!  I am surprised how well it works.  We have found "she" (my wife named it "Florence") does work best if you lock her in a room and let her do her thing.  Otherwise, Roomba will wander all over the house until the battery dies which takes over an hour.  If "she" is more than about 20-30 feet from the dock when the battery gets low, it does not make it back to the dock for recharge.  Overall, it is a cool product!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020

Review Text: We have a one story house with hardwood, tile in the kitchen and carpeted bedrooms. Overall I’d say it does a pretty good job. Wouldn’t say it could replace normal vacuuming but it mainstains a clean house. Sometimes it’s a little frustrating when I see dirt on the ground and it just goes past it by a few inches because It doesn’t detect it. It does have a spot clean function for this, but that means you have to be moving it around. In terms of getting stuck, it’s been great. No problems going from tile to carpet to hard wood to area carpets. Usually covers almost our whole house in one cleaning. And in terms of docking, so far it has always found its way back to the dock before the battery died. I simply tell Alexa to send it ‘home’ and it goes to the dock.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2019

Review Text: I had bought a Shark vacuum for the same price a few years back as what I paid for this iRobot Roomba.  This iRobot is so much better.  Just have to remember to not only clean out the debris container, but also clean the brush roller (I have a dog) or it won't pick up the hair.  Once it's all cleaned out, works great.  I love it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2020

Review Text: Great for the money. Well worth it. I got it so I would have help cleaning up dog hair off my laminate floors. It has done that and more. I can EASILY tell the difference when rando particles are sticking to my feet after not using the roomba for a few days. I run it while I’m at work and it cleans up fine. It does appear to work extremely randomly but I have yet to notice it missing any spots. So whatever gets the job done. I would recommend running it at least once a week while you’re at home in case it gets stuck or you want to make sure it only gets certain areas. Oh and make sure you tidy before you. It has gotten stuck on cords and moved things all around the house like someone broke in lol.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2020

Review Text: Overall I’m satisfied with the unit. The only fault it has it won’t vacuum my shaggy rug on top of the carpet. Which isn’t a dealbreaker. I have a large coffee table covering most of it. I do have a hand and shop vac. Thanks to COVID-19 I was able to afford a luxury I didn’t know I needed.  It goes over the carpet several times. I can watch tv while its running. It doesn’t scare the rabbit into hiding. I do wished it came with two sweeping arms. But that is just me thinking of more efficiency. I like you can name it and program for auto cleaning.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2020

Review Text: I had the Roomba 550 for 11ish years! I used it almost everyday for my now family of 6 kids, 2 adults, 3 dogs and 3 cats. Vacuum grew with us and was my trusty sweeping companion. When it took its last constantly circling final sweep we knew it was time to say goodbye.What to do? I certainly couldn’t live without it.... I could but don’t tell the hubby. We decided to look at a new brand. Mistake.So we went back to the trusty iRobot brand. We got the 675 and it’s just like my old one with a few new upgrades. I have been so relieved!•The extra parts from my old unit (filters, brushes, invisible walls, charging dock) all work with my new buddy!•It does an even better job at getting up dust and hair then my old one. Although I would still recommend using a manual vacuum on occasion to get the deep down stuff in carpet.• It has pleasant alert sounds. (Some people would say that this doesn’t matter but get one that sends blaring beeps at you and you’ll change your mind) This one has a lost robot feature. When you push the button from your phone the robot makes a sound so you can find it. It sounds like ‘Marco.... Polo....’ is being played. I delight in that. (Lay off I’m a girly girl and find things like that cute.)•The phone app is nice but I don’t find it too useful. It will do the lost robot thing, scheduling (which I would use if I didn’t have kids), remote clean, etc. nothing really earth shattering.All in all I love my new one like I did my old one and that’s all I wanted.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020

Review Text: I have to admit I bought this before reading a lot of reviews and kind of wished I had bought one with home mapping after I started reading them but realized I don't really need that.  I received it late in the day about 6pm and immediately set it up.  After a preliminary test to see how it ran I let it charge all night.  This morning I turned it on and shut off two rooms that I didn't want it to go in.  It does bump around a lot but in 1.5 hours had completely vacuumed the parts of my house that I let it do.  The random pattern confused me at first but it did cover all areas including those I don't normally do all the time like under tables etc.  It even did under beds and under our dresser in our master.  It did dock itself when it was out of juice.  Amazing for the price.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2019

Review Text: While it may just have been a defective unit, I have little patience for things that don't work out of the box.  This ran for 20 minutes or so before giving "Error 14" which is the indicator that the dust bin is missing (this model doesn't have sensors for when it's full).  No amount of cleaning the metal contacts, re-inserting the bin, rebooting the unit and app got it to run for more than 5-10 minutes without stopping with that error message again.  The vacuum was also significantly louder than our old Deebot that bit the dust after a few years recently.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2019

Review Text: Bought this roomba to replace our 650 and it absolutely sucks and vacuuming up dog hair transitioning from hard wood to any rug at all it will leave a 3-5” boarder or dog hair and you will have to vacuum it up yourself with a stick vacuum every single day. I tried returning the roomba and they offered me $200 towards a new $700 model. Absolute biggest waste of money. Don’t but this if you have dogs.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2019

Review Text: I wanted this to pick up the kitchen crumbs and misc dust so I wouldn’t have to vacuum every day. It just doesn’t work. I gave it a chance to learn my house but it just goes randomly and misses many spots. It seems to like smaller rooms and carpet better than a big room with hardwood. I sent it back. It also woke me up with error messages in the middle of the night and got stuck on things and couldn’t find its way back to the base.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2021

Review Text: I really wanted to love this vacuum, but it’s just not worth the money. It’s obviously ideal for homes without children or messes because it just can’t handle them at all. On day two, my roomba couldn’t dock itself. It’s docking capabilities come and go, but the machine requires so much regular maintenance. I’d say it charges itself maybe 75% of the time. Unless I follow it around the entire time, it will find a way to get stuck. It’s so frustrating watching it roll right over a piece of cereal or some dirt to inevitably get itself stuck on the edge of a rug or on the threshold between rooms. Save your money and buy a real vacuum. Trust me.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2020

Review Text: For the price, I'd have expected a little more, but I do love it!  It is a time saver for a working Mom of teens and dogs!  It does a good job cleaning and maneuvering around in different areas, but it will stop and state the message "Please move to another area" when it is not done with the area it's cleaning.  The updated version detects stairs so you no longer need to stair detection gadget that sits on the floor.  Don't forget to name your device!  Apparently, we are supposed to, it's "robot etiquette."
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 14, 2020

Review Text: Perfect for apartments. When you run it for the very first time it runs around like a psycho but then figures its way.  Glides underneath furniture with no issue and really picks up dust!!Be sure to move any loose wires on the floor, like phone chargers as it will try to run it over but the brushes do reverse incase that happens.For WiFi with Alexa - be sure to connect it under 2ghz on  your network as 5ghz won’t connect it properly.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2021

Review Text: Won’t work on black & cream colored rug. Will not go onto it or come off the rug😫.IRobot support says “it doesn’t like that color rug”. No kidding but where does it disclose that it won’t work on certain color rugs!!!  Customer support wants me to stand on 1 foot, rub my belly & clap @ same time.I said it was easier just to use my Dyson !It’s at best ok for in between cleaning but I would not recommend it at all.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2021

Review Text: I've had my Roomba for about a month. It is okay. If you spent a little more and got the one that maps your house it probably would bump less. It's whatever. The real issue is it's suction power. It basically has none. It can suck up things but it takes it going over them several times. The fur usually gets sucked up if it goes directly over it but a lot of times it just kind of floats away. If you need a product that can just lessen the amount you have to use the larger vacuum then great. If you're depending on this to be your one and only, You will be gravely disappointed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2021

Review Text: I purchased this as a gift for my wife for Christmas (violating my rule of don't buy your wife something you plug in for Christmas ;) so was hopeful it would work as advertised. In using it over the last month we have been very pleased. It covers four rooms that are on the same level in our home (kitchen, dining room, living room and main entry way). The flooring is vinyl and 1 room has a large rug.  I use it 3-4 times a week. We turn it on when leaving for the day and have always been very pleased with how clean the floor and rug are when I return home.  The first week we had it we were dog-sitting for a friend. This dog shed a lot of hair! It did a great job picking up the dog hair. My only issue has been getting the app to load and work but the robot does just fine by walking across the room and pushing the start button. We have been very pleased. I have tried to stay diligent in cleaning the brushes so they don't get full of hair, etc. I would recommend this model to anyone who is interested.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2021

Review Text: Vacuum gets stuck in the same place all the time. Tries to go underneath cabinets which it can’t fit under. Vacuum can never find its way home even though it is placed in an open area. I would not purchase this product again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020

Review Text: I LOVE this vacuum. It has limited my times spent cleaning and is very easy to manage.The only downfall is that it sometimes has trouble understanding the apartment, so will miss spots and go over other areas many times. I sometimes have to pick it up and redirect it or take it to another room.It does a great job of avoiding furniture and other things (shoes etc.) on the floor and is also good at rolling over wires and the small step of doorframes.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021

Review Text: This vacuum works great! I have 2 dogs that shed a lot and my house is half carpet / half hard floor. It does well transitioning between the two types of flooring and picks up all the dog hair. It connects to my phone and my Alexa so I can start it from either of those or push the button on the vacuum. My dog has learned how to push the button to stop it so I have to keep an eye on him while it is running or he will stop it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2021

Review Text: I am quite smitten with this Roomba! I bought it for my small condo with marble floors and a couple of small rugs. I do not have room for or need for large product so I gave this a try. Quick delivery, easy setup and this little Roomba picks up dog and cat hairs as well as cleaning my 2 rugs, it does a nice job! I have to empty it every 2nd or 3rd time it picks up so much! I just pour a glass of wine and watch “Alice” clean for me! Occasionally it gets stuck, but most of the time it frees itself and off it goes! So far, about 25 cleaning jobs later, I have no complaints!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2020

Review Text: Very poorly programmed. Misses spots, gets stuck, and cant even dock properly. Its a cool concept but we have to be real here its not worth the money and it doesn't clean well. I wouldn't spend more than $30 on something like this. Returning asap!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020

Review Text: Have had it for 2 years and this is my honest review: this vacuum sucks. I’ve been in the flooring industry for 20 years and this is the worst carpet cleaning I have ever seen. Does not do a recommended job for proper cleaning. I recommend a standard carpet vac...it has more suction power and doesn’t roam around aimlessly. This roomba should cost only $40, it’s that bad. If you think being lazy and laying around having this robot clean for you is working you are either dumb or blind and never look at your carpet. Avoid this purchase!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2021

Review Text: Does a great job cleaning but...unbelievably noisy. Really. I normally have no problem working on line when a vacuum is running but the loud whining made being in the same room very difficult.  Also, wouldn't clean the kitchen unless physically carried there, and the kitchen was open floor plan and next to the docking station. We tried a complete reboot but it didn't work.  No modem in kitchen,  just standard appliances - no smart appliances  - and plenty of light. Easy to clean, good cleaning, but returned.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2020

Review Text: Es una buena solución. Se limpia fácil salvo por los pelos largos  q se enredan en los cepillos y ruedas q dan un poco más d trabajo. Lo peor es q hace mucho ruido, no la toleras en tu misma habitación. Fue una buena compra. Para los pisos de parquet es bárbara porq saca bien la mugre d cada ranura. Para alfombras pelo largo no sirve, se tranca
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2019

Review Text: At first I thought our  “Rosie” was doing a good job, but it doesn’t pick up a lot.  It goes over fuzz/threads on our rugs and doesn’t pick it up.  On the hardwood floors it gets a little of the dog hair, but not enough to warrant the cost.  It just blows it around. The brushes spin, hit it, and out it comes flying!  I’m going to try cleaning it, but it’s really not worth the money spent.....and the space it takes up against the wall.  Oh, I’m currently sending it to Home Base and I started that command 15 minutes ago.  It ended up in another room entirely so I brought it in and sat it two feet from Home Base and it’s wandering around like a lost child!  I always have to shut it off, pick it up and carry it over myself.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2019

Review Text: UPDATE:  I would NOT recommend this for wood floors.  We started seeing white marks that look like scuffs or dirt on the floors.  It will not come off with regular cleaning.  I am now trying to figure out how to get these marks off my new wood floors.  I have subsequently read that this item can damage some wood floors.  I am hoping I can get the marks off but I would not recommend this product for use on wood floors.Overall very good for the value.  We have lots of pet hair and dust due to construction but this still cleans up very well.  Only negative is that you really have to clean it out good each time after cleaning.  This has lots of spots for pet hair to get stuck in.  Works better on dirt.  If you have a lot of pet hair you may want to consider a different product but this works very well overall.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2021

Review Text: Got stuck so often we switched to manual canister vac. At 88 days of 90 day warranty it failed to charge. Multiple attempts to get help from the company failed. It said I had registered the product but failed to respond. Amazon return window was 30 days so we missed that. We decided to put in trash. We highly recommend you not buy this or any other iRobot product. We just ate the $300 loss as a lesson learned. You do not need to follow our example. DO NOT BUY IT.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2020

Review Text: This worthless piece of crap always stops because it thinks it's on a cliff edge, even though there are no stairs in my apartment. There is no Roomba-sanctioned way to disable the cliff censors, so I wasted my money on this thing!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020

Review Text: This product works has a vacuum cleaner just fine but don't be fooled by some of the tech hype.  The vacuum easily gets stuck under items, after three days it's gotten stuck under the corner of my couch, under the lip of the dish washer and under one of my coffee tables. I had block block off there areas to keep thing moving.  For the returning home when done part:  I tries to return home when the battery gets low; but it has no idea where home is unless it's within about 6 FT and has direct line of sight.  The cleaning pattern is random, nothing at all intelligent about it.  If your trying to clean more then one room on a single level and the robot is a room separate from the docking station it's won't find before the battery dies.  It does a great job at the cleaning part, horrible job at the robot part.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2020

Review Text: Rosie the Roomba does a great job picking up my hair (which is very long) as well as my two cats' hair. Much easier to just prep the house (pick up loose things on the floor, move some furniture around) and start Rosie than to vacuum--which forces my teenager to pick up her room! Also helped us take control of the flea problem we were having. Connects to the app and lets you know when she's stuck, low on battery, or done with the job (and she returns to her dock to recharge). Easy to empty bin (just remember to do it every time as it's not very big). Very happy we finally got her!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2020

Review Text: 1st best was lasik.Like others suggested, I started with a clean house and have the vacuum run daily. There are 2 cats and 2 preteens living in my house, as a single dad sometimes its hard to get to everything, this makes it much easier. I have it set to run while we're not home daily - no more cat fur, no more stepping on crumbs the kids didn't notice. I absolutely love this product. Also gets under beds.Run it daily.Empty it daily.Expensive but worth every penny.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020

Review Text: The wife wanted one of these for Christmas so she got one. We have a couple dogs and the hair does add up fast. This will pick up some of the hair but I wouldn't tell anyone it does carpets all too well. It gets stuck under things almost every time she runs it. She runs it during the night while we sleep but it wakes me up about half the time because I hear it bumping in to walls or pushing toys across the hardwood floors. First few times she used it at night I got up expecting a burglar. Not quite as impressed a I expected to be.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2019

Review Text: This product worked as it should during the first six months I had it. After that, the battery started to go. I live in a 500 sq feet apartment and this would die after going through 1/3 of the space. Now, the battery does not charge at all even after cleaning the charging port. The vacuum is essentially useless. If you're looking for a short-term vacuum, then sure. But not something that lasts.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020

Review Text: If I could give this little guy more than 5 stars I would! He’s not the brightest robot out there. Gets stuck. Tries to climb or go under things he shouldn’t.... lol. But omg. I have 2 cats and a dog. I run my roomba everyday. And IVE NEVER SEEN SO MUCH HAIR. it vacuums the same rooms everyday and still full canister after full canister. I am amazed. I live in a split level so all I have to do is carry into whatever room or level I want it to vacuum and it goes and goes! It shuts off automatically when the job is complete. I love the spot clean feature. Just clean it like you should and it will do a GREAT job.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020

Review Text: We love this robot. We have had it for about a week now. It has ran every night as scheduled and a couple times during the day so we could see where it might get stuck and fix and issues that might come up in the night. We have 4 kids, a dog (low shedding), and a cat. One of the best things about it is the kids have to clean up every night so Bucket (the decided name) can run with no problems. I get up on the morning to a clean house. We have a multi floor house but have about 900-1000 square feet on our main floor and it cleans it all in one charge. Hard floors and carpet. Although we did have a higher pile rug that we took out that it couldn’t do. It’s quiet enough that we can talk, watch tv, play video games and all that stuff with no problems while it’s running. I’m still figuring out all the Alexa commands but it’s paired easily enough and works just fine. It’s definitely worth it and we are all in love.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2019

Review Text: So far, I am unimpressed with this and it may be returned shortly.  It is so Incredibly loud thatIt wakes me up when it it starts cleaning at 3:00 am on the floor below us. This is the number one issue for Certain. All of my floors on the main level are hardwood or linoleum.  It gets trapped on a small, very low pile rug in my entry way.  Frequently it does not make it back to its charging dock securely enough to be charging.  A friend of mine raved about hers, which is why I made the purchase, but it has been a headache thus far.  If we can’t get better results very soon it is going back.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2020

Review Text: This cleans up so much dust and cat hair.  I am very pleased at how well it removes particles from the floor.  I bought it to clean under the beds but it works great on the living room carpet.  I feel comfortable having the 1 year old twins crawling around after it cleans.  Dirt cup is easy to empty and extra filter in nice as I can wash one and use the other.  Clean up all the cat toys and wires as this will suck them up along with the dirt. Goes from bare floors to carpet without trouble.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020

Review Text: My unit had a hard time cleaning up anything. It kinda just blew things around and ran over it without really sucking up the majority of things. Additionally, it got stuck in my doorway because the lip of the carpet was too high (even though it shows in the pictures that should definitely be able to climb over it). It also wasn't able to go over my rug, which wasn't that high either.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020

Review Text: I've spoken to a lot of people, all pet owners, who say that they've broken several of these. I can say that this is 100% due to neglect of the device.We have 3 cats and this thing is amazing.Also, my Roomba 675 B2-T2 Droid is cooler than yours!2 coats flat grey primer2 coats flat olive drabOlive drab dark wash.Hull red and rust wash.More olive drab.I'll be painting the top of the B2-T2 Droid a lighter shade of green or greenish-yellow, and adding some other details to make this a unique service droid. :) Yes, there are decal kits for these but i prefer to hand paint for weathering effects.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2020

Review Text: 2 women with long hair, a Border collie, 2 cats in the house. I don't like leaving a review until I've had a good chance to use the product. I've been using the Rumba now for well over a month and it is totally awesome. My floors have never been cleaner. Gobbles up dog hair and dirt. Gets every nook it can reach. I have it programed to vacuum everyday- took a couple of weeks to really get CLEAN floors. Boy do my carpets look awesome now. I've taken Rumba to the basement and I'm grossed out by all the dead bugs and dirt it finds, but hey- my basement has never been cleaner. LOVE LOVE LOVE this vacuum. I highly recommend it. One criticism or dislike is that it rarely finds its dock, definitely NOT a deal breaker. I wish I had one of these when the kids were small.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2021

Review Text: We've been using this for a while now.  There are things we love about it (Alexa enabled, easy to use phone app, cleans certain areas really well) and there are things that are not so impressive (won't climb to clean a shaggy area rug, has difficulty returning to base, does not come with barriers).  We set it to go off daily at specific times which it does but will sometimes get stuck.  I am reading that these issues are common with most of these robot vacuums so I shouldn't be too critical, especially for the relatively reasonable price for a name brand compared to others.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020

Review Text: This 675 is our third and newest Roomba.  All do a good job; the oldest had a more limited battery.  Battery problem is solved here.  Cleaning is excellent.  However, this 675 takes at least ten minutes to empty and clean out.  Hair and dust clumps get caught around the brushes in the brush rollers and have to be picked out, tediously.  The other Roombas we have use rubber rollers that are much easier to clean and can be cleaned in a couple of minutes.  Since we clean the Roombas every time we use them, the caught hair in this one makes it our least favorite.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2020

Review Text: I have my roomba running first thing in the morning every single day. It does about an hour cleaning downstairs and everyday I clear out the dirt tray and it’s full! You cannot see the crumbs or dirt on the floor but when you see it all piled up in the tray it looks pretty gross. We have 2 kids who are always snacking and coming in and out of the house so this vacuum has been extremely helpful.The only thing I can’t get used to is the noise. It’s loud but just like any other vacuum.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2021

Review Text: Hands down the best purchase we made in 2019! We have it set up to go clean at 2:00am and it’s done well before we get up for work at 4:45am. We were a little worried about how noisy it would be and if it would wake up our dog, but she doesn’t mind it and we haven’t heard it at all. We have a husky and the amount of hair she produces is ENDLESS even with vacuuming a few times a week 😭 but this machine works it’s magic and every morning we wake up to hair free floors. I will note that we had a thin rug with fringe that it would always catch on, but we moved the rug upstairs and now we have no issues. Highly recommend!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020

Review Text: Love this little guy! I have a HUGE dog (160 lbs) who sheds a LOT (Anatolia shepherd, so its medium length hair) and I hated how often I had to vacuum.  Ever since Skittles (that's the new iRobot vac) came into my life, I wake up daily to clean floors.  He starts his daily routine at 6 and is usually done by about 730....as an added bonus, its hilarious to watch the dog act like he's going to eat Skittles only to chicken out and run away at the last moment.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2020

Review Text: The vacuum works good as far as picking up dirt from the floor , the problem is it gets trapped in corners of the room or under chairs or on the corner of an area rug etc .... the whole point of buying one of these is so you don’t have to walk around behind a vacuum but I should have just bought a nice shark or dyson instead
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2020

Review Text: I have had this vacuum for 6 mo.  At first it seemed to clean ok (not great).  I actually had a less expensive brand that amazon used to carry (150$) that I bought just to try the robot vacuum thing out.  I had it for a year it was an amazing cleaner! I would run it after I ran my big vacuum and it still picked enough stuff to fill it'shuge dust bin.  So I gave the older cheaper model to my son in order to buy a more expensive brand name version...BIG mistake! First the dust bin is tiny and I would have to empty it out at least twice during it's running cycle, when it was actually working.  The filter takes up too much room in the dust bin. It will run for almost two hours but leaves all kinds of stuff behind and I would have to come behind it with the big vacuum. So what is the point?? It ran for two hours this morning. I went to empty the dust bin after about 45 min. and the dust bin was EMPTY! It had not picked up anything.  Took all the brushes out and cleaned everything, tried it again. It was a bit better this time at least there was something to empty.  In my opinion the cheaper vacuum cleaned better at a year old than this one did brand new! I decided to write this because I am on Amazon looking for a replacement for this stupid thing after only six months!  It was a waist of money.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 23, 2020

Review Text: Works great! Have had for 5 months. I have dark wood flooring, carpet and vinyl. It took the Roomba a few days to get used to finding its home base and to go over the transition pieces but has had no issues with that after the first few days. I have it cleaning about a 1200sqft area and it does awesome. It sucks up hair, Cheerios, nerf darts, little kid socks. It does a surprisingly good job on carpet! Some people say that the collection bin is too small- how dirty is your house!? I empty it about once a week unless it gets some nerf darts in it. This thing is amazing and I highly recommend. The app to schedule it to run while you are at work is the key.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020

Review Text: Ok I bought on the amazon warehouse / return version as it noted a small cosmetic scratch. Hummm box was damaged and no scratch. Unfortunately, the 675 had network issues and would not go into WiFi connection mode. Spent 90 minutes on hold w Rumba with someone speaking a foreign language. It wasn’t English. They escalated to an email where they wanted all my network info and every aspect of my network! Are u kidding me? The device will not go into finding network mode so why would it be my network?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2020

Review Text: I absolutely Love my roomba. I was very skeptical about a robot vac but this is just amazing. It cleans well, it goes from hardwood to carpet easily and efficiently, it gets into corners, under beds, dressers, furniture whereas my dysentery doesn’t fit, it saves me so much time and labor. I just can’t figure out how it seems to know where to go. It even knows where the stairs going down are and stops, turns around and off it goes. Love, love, love it and very reasonably priced too.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2020

Review Text: Jesus this thing is dumb. Seriously! I spend more time chasing him around getting him unstuck than he does vacuuming and I dont have an obstacle course he has to run through. It will vacuum the same spot 100 times and completely miss 50% of the room. Constantly and I mean CONSTANTLY gets hung up in the same spot. You would think it could navigate a kitchen table, nope, it will spend 30 minutes trying to get around one leg....
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019

Review Text: Wasn't sure at first but now I am feeling this was a good purchase. I have used this for a while but resisted writing a review because I wasn't sure about the suction power. I did a test. I swept my area rug and floors and put all the debris in the center of the room. I set the roomba to spotclean and it sucked it right up. I also walked on my bare feet, which I never do, and the floor was clean. I can say this is a good vacuum. My only complaint is that it is louder than I wanted, since I live in an apartment building, and want to avoid annoying my neighbors. Hence, 4 stars.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2018

Review Text: First I purchased a slightly cheaper look alike, it couldn't deal with my multicolored/speckled floors and just spun in circles then fell off every ledge. I returned it and paid a bit more for the Roomba. This machine is like a maid in the house who just improved my overall existence ten fold!! No joking. My husband and dogs make every surface, especially floors crumb magnets, this has stopped that (or me noticing) entirely. I should have got this years ago.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020

Review Text: I decided to try one of these since the price was right and I had heard good things about them.  I am so glad I got my IRobot.  I named her Rhonda (the Robot) because she really does clean up dust and cat hair very well.  Having two cats and two people living here much of the time I got so tired of running the vacuum cleaner every day so now I run my IRobot a couple of times a week and she gets the job done.  Highly recommend.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2021

Review Text: I have contractor grade flooring, nothing special. This roomba wouldn’t go from my linoleum to my low pile carpet. Called the company several times, measured everything for them and they said it wouldn’t work. My friends have roombas and they have no problem going from one flooring to another. There is no indication anywhere when reading description that this would be a problem. No help from roomba. Returned it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020

Review Text: This product doesn’t really do a good job at all. We got it to help keep the floor clean in between deep cleans, and while it’s able to pick up cat hair, it just pushes all other kinds of dirt/debris around. I might as well just use a broom!Of course I’ve missed the return window by 2 days, so have a shiny, twice-used Roomba-shaped paperweight taking up space in my living room.Very disappointed (and Amazon customer service was abysmal).Look elsewhere, buy a different product.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2021

Review Text: I LOVE this thing! We have a heavy shedding dog, and it’s awesome to be able to run a sweep cycle mid-day and come home to clean floors.The big downside is the noise- it’s pretty loud, so I really only like sending it around when I’m not home. The cycles take about an hour and a half for three medium-sized rooms, which is about all the batter can do. It will not leave your house spotless, but it made a huge difference for us in cutting down on loose bits tracked in by daily in/out activity and dog hair.I would recommend it as long as you’re not hoping to run it while at home.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2020

Review Text: Let me just say I am very happy with my purchase! This little vacuum has saved me a lot of cleaning time. I have three dogs and babysit dogs for a living so you can imagine the hair and dander I have all around my house. I have this little guy clean twice a day and can feel the difference on my feet and in my nose. It makes minimum noise and gets the entire room eventually, by that I mean it doesn't go in a straight line but within 20 minutes it will get half your house done. I would change it after every job and make sure to clean the brush so it will last longer and you get your moneys worth.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020

Review Text: There is no doubt this machine can suck up dirt but mine traveled the same route over and over and over again. Plus, no one ever tells you before you buy one that you have to “prep” the room for cleaning: pull up long curtains, check for loose cords on things plugged into the wall, move pet food dishes off the floor, etc. Sure, there are additional accessory items one can BUY to make these things less of a hassle but I didn’t want my apartment to look like it was booby trapped. Maybe my expectations were unrealistic. The thing is cute to watch and definitely sucks up the dirt - from only one path in my case! I returned mine. (Easy return, BTW - thanks, Amazon!)
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2021

Review Text: This unit is not smart in any way.  It cleans the same spots over and over and misses other spots. You watch it ram (rather hard) into things repeatedly. It does not learn. It will get stuck in the same places ever time.  It also gets very loud after the first week or so of use. I tried blocking problem areas off, attaching unicorns and bumper pads.  For $10 or $20 bucks it might be a good buy but if you value your sanity STAY AWAY! I'm going to buy a Roborock S4 and throw this thing in the trash.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020

Review Text: I purchased this sweeper to take care of a task that my recently departed wife took care of for 53 years.  I named it Beth after her.  I have to say that this machine cleans in areas my wife never cleaned like under the beds, furniture, chairs and cabinets and does it every day.  It does get stuck some times but is easy to find and restart.  My only complaint is that it doesn't dust on top of the furniture..  And, I'm not sure how much time it saves me because I find myself watching it and trying to figure out where it is going to go next.'
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2019

Review Text: It's no joke--this thing really does work.  I especially like that it can work through Alexa--easy to start even away from home.  It  does require some preparation (long curtains pulled up, shoes moved, doors with high sills closed), but all in all, a great purchase.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2021

Review Text: The question we ask ourselves whenever this right-sized cleaner is skittering around our floor is, “why did we wait so long to get one?” Our house has never been cleaner and never with so little effort on our part. It is a good idea to de clutter your house of charger cables, shoestrings, loose clothing, etc. before turning any robot vacuum on. A plus is that these vacs scoot under beds and other places that are difficult to access with a conventional upright. Our house is about 1200 sf, if you have a lager house you might want to consider a larger model.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2019

Review Text: For the price I am disappointed. It will not even attempt to go onto area rugs. Set it on the rug and it won't operate at all. Videos on YouTube about blocking the cliff sensors and it will work on thick rugs. But I didn't pay that much to start taping paper over the sensors. Why aren't they programable. On or Off? I have one story house. I don't need cliff sensors for stairs and yet it won't work right because of a feature I don't even want or need. I think I'll send it back. No point in having to get out the old vac and do the area rugs separately.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2020

Review Text: Does a good job of getting the cat hair and cat litter out of deep pile carpet. However, it tends to get stuck under something at least once every time it runs. It also goes around in circles a lot. I assumed there would be a pattern develop after a while, but it’s like the first time every time it runs. But, I can set it to run at a certain time on certain days, and it will run. Just need to be around to pull it out from under the sofa once or twice. Oh! Added bonus; it fits under the beds! First it’s been vacuumed under there in a while, I can tell you!  Good value for the price. We’ve had it about a month.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020

Review Text: I was very skeptical of a robot vacuum. I figured I'd give it a shot since we have hardwood throughout the house. I was very surprised to see how well it does. Wall-E, as we named it, has significantly reduced the need for full vacuuming with the upright. Wall-E gets in every nook and cranny, gets under the couch and chairs, and leaves the floors looking great. I have a chocolate Lab and a Shiba Inu that leave hair and dust bunnies all over. Wall-E picks it all up. Even with the Shiba going through his early winter molting stage.Wall-E has mapped out our house and only gets stuck under the edge of the dishwasher every once in a great while.Super easy to set up and easy to maintain.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020

Review Text: After owning it for 4 months this thing gets stuck in my house almost everytime it runs a program. It does require maintenance every month or so to clean the bristles to assure that the brushes are not covered in hair or fur (we have a cat). The sediment bin is too small so cleaning it every after run is advisable otherwise the suction power goes low. It does the job IF it completes it but 90% of the time it gets stuck somewhere. Pay the extra for higher end robot models if you prefer efficiency and programmability.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2021

Review Text: I don’t know how I lived without this Rumba! I have arthritis and scoliosis and it is so difficult to vacuum and it always made me hurt so I put off vacuuming! I have two dogs who shed so it is imperative that my house gets vacuumed often! Now I just push the button and let it go! I do a room or two per day. It is easy to dump the debris and clean the filter! It does an excellent job and I was skeptical at first because it seemed so random but that doesn’t matter, it gets the job done!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2019

Review Text: The product gets the job done and saves me time having to sweep/vacuum my floors myself. Easy to empty the trash tray and change the filter. A little noisier than I thought it would be, but no big deal (kind of sounds like a hand-vac). I wish it was a little "smarter," and didn't keep going over the same areas over and over. With all the technology we have, I don't believe that it couldn't be programmed either by the company or by us to have better direction while sweeping, but again, it still saves me time, so it's not a huge deal. I like that it goes over carpet as well as hard floors, and that we can turn it on from an app on our phones while we aren't home. Overall, it was worth buying. Four stars.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2019

Review Text: Purchased this to replace a knock-off brand that I also bought off Amazon 13 months ago (it died on schedule, 1 month after the warranty!). The quality of this device with regard to the ability to pick up debris and pet hair is amazing. It does a great job. Running it daily, the bin in full each day.The problem is, it can't automate for the (lack of) life of itself. Each day, it's gotten stuck, gotten lost and battery died while trying to find the dock. (Perspective - It's in a 1-bedroom apartment - hard to get lost and the dock is in the dead center of a an open, minimally furnished den)Even when I'm home and tell it to dock (because it gets so lost the batter is too low to accept commands from Alexa), I have to hand guide it across the apartment step by step stopping it from going away from the dock.Will be returning this one. If you're looking for automation, don't waste your money.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020

Review Text: Previously we owned and Eufy. We liked the eufy but felt it didn’t last as long as it should have so we decided to this Roomba a try. Overall the cleaning power of the Roomba is fine. We have a couple issues with it. First, it continuously gets “trapped” in rooms for long periods of time and when this happens it dies and never makes it back to its charging station. Second, when u tell it to dock it can take it up to 30 minutes to dock. The Eufy performed much better in this two regards and was have the price so once this guy proves no longer to be useful or we get tired of the noise(it’s loud comparatively speaking) we will go back to the Eufy
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020

Review Text: I love not having to sweep anymore! My biggest annoyance is that it’s loud! We had it programmed to run itself a couple times a week & had to stop bc the baby would end up being asleep anytime we ran it & it would wake her up. Also the dock isn’t heavy enough for it to roll onto it. I had to command strip the dock to the floor to help Roomba get on. Update: that didn’t work for long; now we just pick it up & set it on the dock.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2021

Review Text: Unfortunately, this is a very negative review. The unit that we purchased always had difficulty returning to its charging station which was properly located along a wall, unencumbered by anyting. we even changed the charging station location and number of times and still had the same result. The vacuum would not return to the charging station on its own even when prompted. I always had to pick it up and place it in the charging station which was ridiculous. also the vacuum had a great deal of difficulty leaving certain rooms and completing its cleaning of the house. during the process of our ownership of this unit we actually moved to another house and we experienced the exact same problems. We found the devices cleaning operation to be sorely lacking. Specifically it didn't pick up sand and was very poor an overall cleaning. Hopefully this was just a defective product and not a defective product line, however I've lost confidence in this unit and will not accept the replacement. Amazon was good enough to issue a full refund even though the return was outside of the return window.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2020

Review Text: It works as advertised, but it’s a very stupid robot. It cleans in an aimless zigzag pattern, and often gets obsessed with one room or area. Probably because it doesn’t have any sensors, or mapping capabilities. But it’s better than sweeping and vacuuming myself. If o had it to do over, I’d spring the extra $150 or so, and get the model that has mapping and sensors.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020

Review Text: I was really skeptical about buying this because of all the reviews that I'd read. Mind you, I've only had it a few weeks but have used it almost daily, if not every other day. #1: THIS DOES NOT REPLACE A HUMAN USING A VACUUM CLEANER. You will still have to deep clean once in a while. #2: this does a perfectly adequate job for dust, dander and pet hair. Seriously, I love setting my Roomba up for a mid-day clean when I'm not home and coming home to a hairless floor. Of course, there are some spots that the roomba can't reach, but for a family home with 3 dogs- I'd buy this thing three times over. Very happy with this little guy. Two thumbs way up.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2020

Review Text: great it gets places that you normally don't sweep or mop it gets under the beds it gets under the couch it gets it all I'm going to order another one I think it's the i7 this time
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2018

Review Text: When it worked it did a decent job. Cat and dog hair mostly picked up. Supplemental vaccuming required every so often to get it all. My issue is that this robot is not built to last. I previously owned a 650 which ran like a champ for 5+ years. This one started with the persistent errors at 6 months. Error 2 is the latest even though the brushes have been thoroughly cleaned. The robot runs for 5-10 minutes then gives the error, runs again on button push, errors out 5-10 mins later.  So I am faced with a choice, babysit my vaccum or just do it myself... Kinda defeats the whole idea of buying a robot to do the job, doesn't it?Also; kind of a minor annoyance but, why are there no buttons to set a timer?  No, I do not want to connect my vaccum to the wifi... thanks.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021

Review Text: So after a year and a half the charger stopped connecting to the Roomba and it was completely dead, but I called iRobot's customer support and the rep very easily walked me through a few steps to resolve the issue and promised me a call back in a few hours once the vacuum would have had a chance to charge. Ultimately not giving 5 stars, because this troubleshoot steps should have been in the manual to save the aggravation, and because the vacuum's height keeps getting stuck in a few places in the apartment under furniture which makes it a drag to find and put it back in the dock.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2020

Review Text: $250 was quit a bit of money to fork over for something I didn’t know was going to work well or not. But I can’t say enough about this Roomba! I have only had it a week but it has been nice to start it from my phone an hour or so before I get home. I have three dogs who have moderate shedding, I usually have to vacuum a couple times a week and who wants to do that when you work all day? This Roomba has been good for me because it does all my upkeep for me. Now I can mop a couple times a week instead of tirelessly vacuuming!If you are hesitant on spending the money don’t be. It is well worth it!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2020

Review Text: I am in the process of charging Roomba and noticed it has scratches on top of unit. I thought this was a new item and would not have expected it to be scratched. It looks like it got caught under a piece of furniture. I will report back after I use it, to report how it cleans.Delivered on time and packaging looked good-not sure why scratched on top.Feb 2,2020 I have used this for the last couple days, and feel it does a good job of cleaning and picking up dog hair. I like the door on dust bin. You open door and dump dirt and hair.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   My family and I loved this product...it picks up so much dirt, pet hairs, and things I could never sweep or vacuum!! We named her RUBY and we can send it back to it’s charging base by Alexa or you can press the top of it and it will go straight to it dock! It also talks...For example: if it gets stuck somewhere it will talk and say “check roomba home app” or “stuck!!” It has dirt detection and if it misses dirt or crumbs it will go back and get it all! It gets every crack and corner in my kitchen and living room!! AMAZING!!! DO NOT HESITATE TO BUY!!! Sorry for my dirty trash can
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2021

Review Text: This makes my life so much easier!  I run my roomba every morning and it saves so much time. I am amazed at the fuzz, dirt and hair it picks up daily!  I do  wish I had ordered one with two side sweep Instead of one and an auto clean filter but, trying to save some $$.  Now, if I can get one that mops, my back will be delighted.  😉
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2020

Review Text:
Your browser does not support HTML5 video.


   So far my experience with this vacuum has been a great one. I've used it for the past 3 days and my floors have stayed clean. I don't 90 minutes of run time but it gets done what it needs to and with having a cat that likes to play in the litter box and spread it around this really helps. It picks litter, cat hair and dirt very easily, however it is a irobot and sometimes will miss a spot but it finally gets there. I'm very happy with my purchase and plan on using it as much as I can.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2019

Review Text: it does a great job of picking up dirt! but it also is a pain in the ass because it gets stuck under bed frames, if it hits the edge of a shaggy rug, accumulates long hairs around the 3 prong brush and if not cleaned regularly it will stop the unit from working until cleared. sometimes has issues getting onto the docking station and lining up the contacts to charge properly. you have to clean the unit after every use. spend more and get the smarter ones, and also the one that empties the dirt out automatically, you'll thank yourself that you did
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020

Review Text: We were looking to replace our old iRobot Roomba 870 model because it had stopped docking itself. We had the 870 for about 4-5 years and thought we would go with another Roomba since it did a good job. We were looking for a model that was great at picking up dog hair. We have a dog with long hair (Husky-Shepherd mix) and our old Roomba cleaned the pet hair pretty well. THIS 675 model was not a good replacement. It has been returned.CONS:- Roomba's are generally very loud machines and this newer model is not any quieter.- The 675 does not clean pet hair well. It uses bristle brushes and the hair gets caught and tangled in the brushes. See photo. Our older model had rubber-like brushes with no bristles.- Drops pet hair and debris when transitioning from area rug to hardwood floors, so you'll find hair along the edges of your rugs.- Stops for no reason. I would start the cleaner and then when I would walk back into the room, it had just stopped, no obstruction, nothing around it - just stopped.- It did not retain a charge very long. If not redocked, it would run out of juice in less than 12 hours. My old one would start back on the scheduled time if not redocked for 2 days.- The BIGGEST negative was the dirt reservoir (See photo). The design puts the filter inside the reservoir chamber. This means you have to CONSTANTLY empty it during its' cleaning cycle. Ridiculous! There was not a filter in the reservoir of my old 870 and I got ALL the space for trash. I generally did not have to empty it until the cleaning was finished with my 870.This machine was not worth the effort, frustration and glitches. I am so glad we did not give away our old one yet. I will just keep picking it up and putting it on the dock - at least it picked up the dog hair - until I find a model that does what I need it to.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2021

Review Text: Overall for the money I think it’s a very good buy. It does very well and I rarely fill dirt on the floor in my house when I walk around bare footed. My house is 1860sq foot heated and i have it cleaning every room but one and it finishes right at an hour. Do not watch it clean cause it will drive you crazy. Seems to run over the same areas over and over but just let it do its thing and let it be. Sometimes has a hard time finding the charging dock but it eventually will. Has only died on me once cuz it didn’t get back to the dock in time. And it’s done about 10 cleanings alrwady. I have it set to go off everyday. Takes 3 cleanings normally before I have to empty the trash bin on it. Giving it 5 stars considering the price and how well of a job it does.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2018

Review Text: I took time out of my day to write this review and I want everyone reading this to understand I am saying this with my entire chest: do not buy this vacuum. I’ve owned one other automatic vacuum from a different brand (DeeBot) that was SO much better and less expensive. Ive been using my iRobot for about 8 months and it causes me daily frustration. It never works how it’s supposed to. Sometimes it stops for no reason as if it’s stuck on something and tells me I need to clean the brushes, but there is nothing stuck in them. It doesn’t clean the entirety of my apartment (900 sq ft) and I never feel like my floor is clean after it runs. It only docks itself half the time even though I placed the charger in a spot with 6 feet on either side and in front, as the directions say, which has to be in my hallway which is an eye sore. With my DeeBot I could charge it underneath my entertainment center which was hidden and out of the way and it would still find its way back 100% of the time. I went to go run my vacuum today only for it to say it had low battery- it’s been charging all night! It’s incredibly loud as well. The only redeeming quality of this vacuum is the customer service. I’ve had to interact with them a few times because of an issue I was having with the vacuum and their responses and mail deliveries are always prompt. Otherwise, please go buy another brand. I had my DeeBot for over two years of daily use until it finally broke down and I thought I’d try another brand. Big mistake.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020

Review Text: I thought it would be a good idea to get a Roomba so I could save time time sweeping and vacuuming. Well, I now spend the time I’ve saved babysitting my vacuum. This thing is the worst. It can’t find its way back home and wanders around my house aimlessly until it eventually dies. Then I get to play the fun game of hide and seek with it in the morning so I can manually move it back home. Also, I get to spend about 5 minutes trying to line it up perfectly to charge. Lately it only will charge if it’s propped up like in the picture.The one good thing I will say it that it does clean well.
