It has surprising power for such a small machine and I’m amazed at how much it picks up. However, it’s so unpredictable in its path that sometimes it’ll clean my kitchen for an hour and then make one pass through my living room, then go back to the kitchen, and then die. So if you’re hoping for an all over consistent clean then you should probably choose something else.Honesty, I’m shocked at how many good reviews there are for this thing.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2021

Review Text: I have tried already 5 other brands, this is the worst robotic vacuum, maybe I should say a vacuum with no robotic skills.  First of all,  connecting to the network is way old fashion it takes very longtime to connect it.It has same noise level as a small power generator.  You cannot hear almost your sound when you're talking. It just goes straight and hits an obstacle and change its direction randomly. So it leaves many spots uncleaned. It goes into a room and it cannot find the way out.Also the dust cabin is wide open and smallest in the market.Stay away from this brand.It is useless and a return
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019

Review Text: Much to my chagrin, the cats have been avoiding this like the plague. However, this little robot does its job well. We ignored the comments telling users to sweep/vacuum before the first go round and let it vacuum up our cat hair covered floors as-is. It actually did a really good job!!!! My fiancé and I were both impressed by how it was able to pick up everything visible to the human eye with its seemingly random path around the house. We let it roam around every other day or so and it keeps our floors looking way cleaner than we thought possible! Almost like someone with pride of ownership lives here. We do have two thick-coated cats (i’ve attached a pic of The Big Lass so you can imagine the kind of shedding we get) and it has worked wonderfully for us!!! Our lint roller is getting a considerably smaller workout since we set up our new little friend. I am so impressed by this and wish we got one sooner. For the price, this is such an amazing deal. I’ve already recommended it to all my family and friends!!!!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021

Review Text: It does an adequate job...BUT!  It quits over and over, & that is usually out in the open with no obstacles around!  Today that happened 4 times, all but once with nothing to hinder it!...On the vinyl floor in the bathroom with no obstacles within 2 feet in any direction!😁😞😞💣  JUST QUITS and then I have to go restart it.  I don't use Alexa or the internet to run it as I'm here to get it going and I do only in one room a time, thanks to the virtual walls I bought.  If I were to program it to start when I'm not home it would be a joke!  It would quit until I got home to restart it.  Then, I'd have no idea how much of the room had been vacuumed, if any of it, and I'd have to start over again to make sure it did the total job!  It criss crosses the room and bounces around on the furniture at the sides of the room, thus cleaning there totally.  Unless I use the virtual walls to confine it to the middle of the room, where there's no obstacles, to turn it back and forth, it neglects that part, the high traffic and dirtiest part of the room and misses most debris there!It's adequate, though, just keeps hopping me & on my toes running around trying to keep it going!  Maybe in 50 years they'll be perfected to work adequately and reliably!o
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2019

Review Text: If your room is anything more than a 10ft square with little to no furniture don't bother with this vacuum. I've had it for about 4 months now and I've tried my best to "make it work" but I'm fed up with it.My chief complaint is it gets stuck ALL the time. The "cliff detection" sensors get tripped up by blue coloring on our rugs. If, by some miracle, it happens to get on top of the rug it has a bad habit of going directly to the other side and being trapped in the 1ft gap between the rug and the wall.Not only is this tripped up by a rug, but God forbid you own stools or some other chair that is smaller than a la-z-boy. The damn thing can get itself stuck just fine, but can't seem to figure out how the eff to get out from it's newfound prison.Two stars because the build quality is fine, I'm feeling generous.Just burn your money and you'll have less pain than owning this thing. If you want a decent robovac go for one of the LiDAR bots with a mapping and virtual wall feature. I've had one for a little while now and have booted my Roomba up to the attic. Fun fact, it still gets stuck even though it's a basically square room.UPDATE (July 20, 2020): My Roomba now cannot detect when it is hurtling itself off of a ledge and after 2 minutes of "cleaning" the attic it will try and hurl itself down the stairs. Within 10 minutes of starting a clean it quits, having YET AGAIN thrown one wheel off of the staircase.DO NOT BUY THIS. IT IS A WASTE OF MONEY.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2020

Review Text: I bought a Roomba 3 years ago and really liked it but it got worn out, the handle broke and it seemed like it wasn't picking up very well despite cleaning it extremely well.I bought this model and it certainly is more advanced with the biggest feature having the connection to your iphone so you know when it is stuck, etc.  But there are few features that I do not like such as the bin to empty the dirt.  This bin is very hard to open, the door gets stuck and I feel like it will break soon.  I can't believe technology like this vacuum would have such a poor trash door for the area you have to use most.I do not know what the newer models have but I suspect it must be better than this one.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2020

Review Text: This robot vacuum stalls out on both of my rugs that are a little thicker and says "cliff detected" even though it's just in the middle of the rug. It also makes obnoxious vocal alerts when it errors, which is so loud, it woke my wife up from across the house when I scheduled it to run at 5am and it errored. You cannot turn this off or turn the volume down. I don't need my robot vacuum making loud declarations around the house every time it does something.I previously had an Ecovacs one that was getting old, so I thought the nice brand for these would do better, but it simply does not.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2021

Review Text: His name is Jarvis. We are now attached. He's apart of the family. He works good. He gets really messy though and I'm not entirely sure how to clean all of it out. Works great for spot cleaning though. He can be a butthead sometimes and do things he's not suppose to do and sometimes it seems like he goes over the same spot over and over again but like I said, were attached to him now.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2021

Review Text: This is my much needed new best friend 💚 Gahlee what a big help Henry is . I named him Henry . We have vinyl wood and low pile rugs . You wouldn't believe the dust it gets off these floors . Blows me away every time . Crazy . From places we can't or don't get to often . He's needs a 4 in clearance to get under couch and such .  Seriously an awesome product for a single mom of 2 and mother caregiver . I was sweeping daily . Now floors cleaned 2-3 times a week  . Big help . I still use my auto dustpan for instant kid messes ! Thanks qvc for that nifty gadget too 😍😍😍
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019

Review Text: The 675 does not have a “ home” button...use the spot & dock, hold both down for 10 secs, the release, that reboots, then hold both down 2secs. Done, roomba will tell u are connected... this is a sweeping vacuum, not a sucking type. Let it keep cleaning, looks for dust with the sweeping arm, then turns. I’ve watched mine, it’s just looking for dust, at first , then gets deeper the more you use it..... it took awhile to go down my hallway, but veteran user told me to turn the hallway light on & it worked, darkness works against the sensors...who knew but vet....ha
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020

Review Text: This was a good idea especially for under bed cleaning. However, it didn’t deliver for me. It does pick up dust, pet hair, and deep clean the carpet however, you have no control over what it sucks up! Lol. It grabbed my phone chargers or any wires that touch the floor, the Christmas tree skirt, a hair scarf that had fallen under the bed.... it also almost never docks correctly and that was a major annoyance for me. I really only needed this for under bed cleaning but I’d probably get a stick vacuum because I like having control over what gets vacuumed. For me it’s a return.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019

Review Text: When it comes to Robot Vacuums rumba is definitely one of the most reputable brands, what I can't quite figure out is why they still charge extra for a basic sensor in the front of the vacuum that would stop it from bumping against your furniture and getting stock pretty much on anything like chairs etc. My "modern" furniture was definitely not compatible with this model and as a result, the vacuum ended up scratched and would often get stuck. make sure your house has unobstructed floor/carpet otherwise check out another brand that has floor mapping or sensors to avoid it bumping into furniture or you'll be annoyed within a week.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020

Review Text: I am disabled and simply cannot vacuum as often as needed. Having two long haired cats doesnt help the situation either.This little gem is a Godsend. It really picks up the mess from the hair factories and the little sweepers are diligent in getting close to the walls and around legs of the furniture.My chiropractor said my back is much improved already! It is a necessity when you cant drag a vacuum around!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2021

Review Text: My 2 year old son calls it a “Bobot” so that’s what we named it.I got this as a Christmas gift from my husband (I asked for it) and we love it! Such a time saver! We’ve only had a few times when it got stuck. I’ve also already cleaned the bristles (I have long hair that falls out often) and still works great! Great to run while picking up toys, or while getting food ready for a party, or while we are watching a movie! It’s fairly quiet and does a great job! I’m impressed that it goes under my couch and my bed!!! I can’t tell you the last time I vacuumed under there!A great purchase for a mom with 2 boys and 2 cats!If your wife wants one, get it for her. Don’t think of it as “I’m getting her a vacuum?” Think of it as “I’m getting her something that’s going to save her time because she won’t have to vacuum!”
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2019

Review Text: Worth every penny! My house looks awesome 24/7.Keeps the dust gone from under the furniture and it keeps the floors looking good. My wife is a lot less frustrated from the floors looking dusty.I don't use Alexa but I've got it linked to Google home and on a schedule. I go through and check for cords, move doormats, and chairs from around the table on days it cleans, and it does awesome. It will still get the job done, but it's more efficient without the kitchen chairs.  I'd also recommend this is your furniture is at least 31/2 - 4 inches off the floor, it cleans under it well.Had it a week and I don't think I'll not own one ever again.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2019

Review Text: What good is a robot vacuum if you have to pick it up and carry it back to the charging station? I had a different brand 10 years ago, same house and it  had no problem finding its way back to charge. They should fire their software engineers because this thing is useless. The software application is also lacking. The thing should record a map of the house which lets you block certain areas. Very disappointed and will be returning it
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2020

Review Text: Trash. Within the first two weeks it wouldn't dock itself. By the end of the first month no amount of work could make the damn thing charge all the tricks for trying to put it on the charger and making it set just so and still nothing.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2019

Review Text: Its definitely a great vaccum for daily cleaning, especially if you have a shedding dog. Not so great for deep cleaning or picking up. I sweep just as much as when I didn't have it, so honestly not really worth the 200 dollars for it to just pick up dog hair and small lint. Also it gets stuck so many times underneath furniture 🙄 that's pretty aggravating seeing as I cant even have it clean while I'm gone from my home or else I'll immediately get a notification that it got stuck somewhere 🤦🏻‍♀️
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020

Review Text: I always thought these were way overpriced, so never got one. But being able to pick one up for $180, I pulled the trigger. And I’m glad I did!This little droid happily goes about its business every day on my hardwood floors, and while it may look erratic, it covers 99% of my house. It gets stuck maybe once every 2-3 days, but mostly can take care of its own. I just have to remember to empty its bin every other day!If you have the chance, pick up one of these. Excellent product that will save you a lot of time!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2020

Review Text: It works great to clean our hardwood floors and the massive amounts of dog hair. When you empty the product the brushes under the Roomba also need to be cleaned. Dog hair also gets tangled around the brushes but they clean easily. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was that it is not intuitive. It seems to go in a completely random pattern. It can go over the same areas day after day and miss other areas. But you can to a spot clean in areas it missed. It will eat cords which makes since, so make sure those are off the floor. It also can get stuck under things like our recliner and dresser. But overall it is a great product and I'm very happy with it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2019

Review Text: It does pick up dirt well, notice it from emptying out dirty bin. However, in comparison to the Shark I had, this one is noisy and it gets stuck on certain parts of the area carpets. I don't get it, the carpet is not even thick. This machine tells you what's wrong and what you should do to fix it. I recommend having a clear unobstructed area to place charging station. It's not consistent in finding it  where I have it placed.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2021

Review Text: This does a great job of basic floor vacuuming, is easy to operate and to clean out the waste bin. We use it daily, it sweeps up visible dust, but I have to say that we have no pets now nor dirt tracking in on their feet. My first roomba died from that--constant clogging of pet hair and dirt from 3 lab retrievers!This Roomba is really worth the cost!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2019

Review Text: For the price, I honestly expected a better device with more functions. It’s extremely LOUD and kinda dumb... it just goes around in random zig zags and completely misses most dirty spots. Many other robot vaccums for less money will go in a pattern rather than zig zags. I’m constantly getting a notification on my phone saying the robot got stuck or ended the job stuck. I also feel like it’s not pet friendly as the fur gets easily stuck on the wheels and spinny thing. I do like that i can control it with the app and have a set cleaning schedule. I also have my robot connected to my echo dot so I can control it with Alexa and it seems to work just fine. I just wish it wasn’t so loud and had a more organized pattern rather than running around aimlessly.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2019

Review Text: I gave this to my elderly parents for Christmas and they love it. They take their shoes off at the door because of dirt and such on the ranch. But the still have a lot of dust and pet hair that must be swept and vacuumed each day. They have ran this vacuum every day since Christmas and it has made life much easier on them. They are thrilled with the vacuum and named it "John Wayne" (because it works so hard on the ranch).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2021

Review Text: I have 2 dogs and they shed and bring in enough sand from outside for 4 dogs. It is a little loud on my tile floors, but i can compare it to a little quiter then my actual vacuum. But if you have a rug it will be more quite. I run it once a day and it does the whole house on one battery charge (1300 s.f) after 2 days using it it caught up to anything I missed prior to having it,and now only have to empty it out every 4 days.I'm extremly happy with it and it is well worth the money.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2018

Review Text: This vacuum is great for picking up dog hair (our Great Pyrenees sheds like crazy) and it also picks up typical dust from wooden floors in living room and carpet in bedrooms. The random pattern is tricky, as some areas get more coverage than others. The solution is the more expensive models with row patterns and area mapping, but at a cost of two or even three of this particular model. Buying this on sale was an overall good investment.

Review Text: I have 3 large shedding dogs and I work a lot so managing my floors gets pretty difficult. I bought this roomba thinking "well I can always return it if it can't handle the hair etc.," I set it up easily in less than 30 minutes including charging time. I let it run throughout my house (half carpet/half hardwood) for 10 minutes and it picked up almost all visible hair and when I emptied it I was shocked at much hair, dust, particles it had picked up. I 100% recommend buying this if you own pets.

Review Text: did not sit on the charger correctly. Called the manufacturer and the customer service agent hung up on the amazon representative and she also hung up on me twice. Returned

Review Text: Although when it works it does a great job, only about half of the jobs complete successfully.  It either gets stuck on something, runs out of battery power, or just fails to start (when programmed to start a certain time)  It's left nicks in the legs of some of my furniture and the brushes need to be cleaned once a week ( i run it every week day.)  My next robot vacuum will not be an i robot based on this experience.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2021

Review Text: Update:  will not dock on charger, makes a lot of noise.  Sometimes it just stops in the middle of the floor.I may never sweep again.  We have ours set to run at midnight.  If you buy anything buy this.  Love that it gets all the pet hair up.  Love that my floors are cleaned before I get up.  I have had it for a week but I am in love.  The only cons is that it is a little loud.  But nothing that wakes us up at night.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020

Review Text: Good for what it does. I have 2 large dogs, a husky and a rottweiler, and it is able to clean up their hair without issue. I have tile and carpet in my house and it can clean both well.Few things about this when purchasing one, you will need to empty it often. Don't let it build up. Also make sure to clean the underneath out if there's any hair stuck in it.and also wires. this thing will suck up wires and keep going with it as long as it can. Make sure to clean up your cable/wire management when getting one of these.Other than that, I greatly appreciate this device. Works well, and will dock itself back into the charger at the end of its shift.

Review Text: compré la aspiradora hace mas de 2 semanas  y aún no puedo usarla porque la app que la hace funcionar, no está disponible en República Dominicana, para ninguna plataforma (ni App Store ni Play store), la respuesta de atención al cliente es poco menos que satisfactoria.Necesito poder resolverlo porque si no es un elefante blanco de mas de 200 dólares, algo costoso para un adorno, de hecho estoy pensando en devolver la aspiradora
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020

Review Text: I want to write sonnets about my roomba, Meryl Sweep. I run her every day and she picks up SO much pet hair and dirt. Super easy set up, tells you how to clean the filter and brushes, and works like a charm. I have a 1,000 sq foot 2 bedroom apartment with both laminate and carpet, as well as area rugs. Meryl cleans EVERYTHING. Surprisingly quiet compared to a regular vacuum. If you have pets and/or are a clean freak, you need this roomba!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2020

Review Text: Roomba seems to do a pretty good job, every time we empty the dirt tray it is full.  Gets under sofas and other furniture with ease.  It has gotten stuck a few times but not that often.  It does NOT vacuum an entire room, it is pretty hit or miss, sometimes it does the same space over and over, but then skips other areas entirely.  If you think you can throw away your regular vacuum when you get this you'd be wrong.  But overall so far we are pretty happy with it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021

Review Text: I have never been so disappointed in a product, the manufacturer or the sellers of this item.  My children bought this as a birthday gift to me.  3 months after I received it, it just stopped working. Clean light started blinking and app says "can not connect to the cloud". OK so iRobot replaced it.  Everything is great. 3 months later, same thing happens.  So I ask is this a common problem, they reply "yes it is, with the 600 series". Yet they continue to sell it.  I ask can I pay extra for an upgrade "sorry ma'am, no you can not".  This is unforgiveable. They are aware this product is defective and they will wait out the warranty period and then you are stuck with faulty merchandise.

Review Text: I couldn’t be more pleased!  I’ve considered purchasing this product for a while but was hesitant because I couldn’t believe that a little tiny vacuum would be efficient.  The IRobot Roomba is life changing!  I have it programmed to vacuum at 3pm and I come home to clean floors every day!  It works well on my hardwood floors as well as carpet. It requires little maintenance and my floors look amazing. I have already sold about seven of them to my friends and family because they can see how fantastic my floor look!  It even goes under my bed and dressers!  It cuts down on the amount of dust in the house too.  Did I mention I LOVE my Roomba??
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2019

Review Text: The first Roomba had problems so I exchanged it. This one is operationally sound. I have to keep an eye on it & help it get through a room. It can slip under furniture like my china cabinet & that’s a problem. I have pets and it’s good at picking up the hair from carpets. It does not run on my plush throw rug. I love it for the bathroom & kitchen floors. My pets think it’s a new member of the family. I’m pleased with the purchase but will still need to drag out the vacuum cleaner for a deeper cleaning.

Review Text: I was so excited to finally get a Roomba. I bought it used on amazon for an amazing price. Surprising, it was brand new, never used. It does vacuum floors and short pile carpeting, but not regular to high pile carpeting. The most annoying thing about this vacuum (which is very frustrating) is you can not control where it goes. You put it where you want to vacuum and it does it’s own thing. It also will vacuum the same area over and over again and ignore other spots. I use it, but not as much as my shark cordless vacuum.

Review Text: Wouldn’t buy this one again. Look into better ones. Constantly gets stuck on everything will sometimes take 45 minutes to catch one spot have tested that many of times. 9/10 times may take 20-40 minutes just to dock. If by any chance you do buy this one make sure you move everything you can. It constantly get stuck under my kitchen table it’s so bad that I have to put one of the chairs on the table to give it a pathway to get out and many of times still can’t find it’s way out. Listened to it the other night for 20 minutes try to get from under the table. I would not recommend this product to anyone. Whether you take my advice or not be aware of places that it will get stuck because it will for sure get stuck everywhere it can.

Review Text: The iRobot Roomba 675 is a great product. We live in a fairly small townhouse (1325 Sq Ft), so the 675 is perfect for us.  We couldn't believe all the junk the Roomba picked the first time we ran it through the house. It easily goes under raised dressers and beds, and other hard to reach places. The rotating brush picks up dust along the walls and in corners.  We highly recommend the Roomba 675 for smaller homes.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2021

Review Text: I was looking forward to having this Roomba.  After 1:13 minutes it dockedonly after cleaning two rooms.  My house is about 2000 sq ft. which is not considered large.  The Custmer Service person at Roomba said that I really need a 900 or higher model for my size of space.  That was never mentioned in any of the comunications that I read.  So, I have to pay plus $900 to get one that may be cleans my whole house without having to restart, manually move, or create so called "virtual walls"!  really?

Review Text: Am liking this a lot. I have a large German shepherd dog who brings in a lot on his feet when coming back inside and 3 cats that track cat sand around the house. I went from sweeping everyday to now allowing my new roomba to do the petty work for me. I didn’t necessarily get this to keep the pet hair away but more the dust and what not since I have tile floors. It’s nice to walk barefoot again in the house.  The only complaint I had was when I pushed Dock on the roomba it kept going to my dishwasher. Thought that was odd. 🤷🏻‍♀️
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020

Review Text: This model picked up a ton of dirt and lint.  I liked the fact that it vacuumed in places we normally can't get to with a regular vacuum -- under sofas, under beds, etc.  However, the randomness of the cleaning was frustrating.  I really needed it to clean heavily used areas of the house like the kitchen, but it kept gravitating towards the dining room which is currently unfurnished.  It also constantly got stuck on things like the track of sliding doors to the lanai or the lip of the walk in shower in the bathroom.  This made it impossible to use when no one was home, and when I did use it I had to rescue it every 10 minutes or so.  Our house is roughly 2,500 sf and there's no way it would ever clean even half the floor space with a 90 minute battery life.  And I refused to invest in additional accessories that would prevent the robot from going into areas that needed cleaning but would cause the vacuum to get stuck.  I returned it and ordered another brand with a reasonable price that has whole house mapping, a logical and efficient cleaning pattern, no go zones that can be set through the app without additional hardware, and can clean specific rooms.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020

Review Text: I was pretty happy with this until i got a new zebra print rug for my living room. Roomb #6. So, basically my entire living room can no longer be cleaned by the Roomba I own.I do NOT think that an iRobot Roomba should be able to dictate the print of the rug I use in my home.So disappointed and I don't see anything about that on Amazon's website with a warning.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2021

Review Text: ****update***** it works well for a year then refuses to charge. Lots of work to clean it. Not worth it IMO.1. This does nothing to carpet. 2. This will grab every ounce of pet hair in your house, but you MUST pull the hair out the machine and dump the filter everytime. 3. Wifi is so worth it. Don't let it run 90 min. Maybe 60min then say "dock". It takes a while to find home.... will die on you under a couch. 4. Requires picking up before running. But don't fear, 1 minute of work for your roomba to go try hard is lightweight.....

Review Text: I like the suction capability but this is not a smart vacuum. Without any type of guidance it really isn’t worth the money. I would recommend buying one with laser or camera guidance. This vacuum misses so many spots, it’s frustrating. It does a good job picking up debris on hard floors but at the same time it’s so inefficient. Than when it’s time to dock it takes around 10 minutes to find its home. Without the mapping feature it proves pointless to have. Also it gets stuck 8/10 times. I don’t have carpets or pets so I can’t review those aspects.

Review Text: I love this machine!  Great quality and easy to start using as soon as you take it out of the box.  No Assembly needed! It performs like a PRO and we are very satisfied.  Thank you!

Review Text: Unfortunately I was not impressed or even pleased with this vacuum. Suction didn’t seem to be great. Vacuum would “get lost” and not rerun to the docking station even after troubleshooting different areas. Once placed on the charger it had a difficult time lining up the sensors to charge.  Not to mention the noise was just too much.I wanted this rumba to be amazing but it was less impressive than other brands I have used.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2021

Review Text: I’m not sure about deep cleaning, but this little fellow gets a container full of hair each time we send it forth! I try to get it going every other day, and I’ve learned that I can confine it to a couple or three rooms and it will do a better job. I haven’t noticed any problems. It has gotten stuck under a dresser a couple of times and got some string wrapped around the rotary brush-but it tells you what’s wrong and it’s easy to remedy. I’ve also bought replacement parts that need a regular change ( filters and main brushes and side brushes). I’ve changed the filter once and the side brush. They were very easy to do. Our big white dog and small white cat both shed a complete puppy and kitten everyday! The Roomba has helped us keep ahead of this hair storm!!! We love it!!!

Review Text: Are used to have an older model Roomba, but it wasn’t dual voltage and I live overseas. For Black Friday I decided to get a new one since the price was right, and it was dual voltage. Man that thing works so much better than even my older one did! I have pets, and it picks up the fur and litter scatter like a champ. Granted I have mostly bare floors so I don’t know how it’ll fair on thicker carpet, but I’m definitely happy with this purchase!

Review Text: Does it work as well as our “real” vacuum?  No, but it’s cleaning function is fine.  My biggest frustration is that the documentation is less than inadequate.  Clean a specific area?  I’d love to know how..  send it back to the dock from the app?  I think you can, but....  If we weren’t retired, I’d send it back, but I’ve got the time to work around it...

Review Text: Seems to do a pretty fair job of sweeping up hair and that's exactly what it does, sweeps, vacuuming not so much. He keeps us from breaking out the real vacuum cleaner to once a week.Good value for what we paid.I bought a high-end Samsung that sucks well but only runs about 15 minutes at a time, this thing runs for an hour to an hour and 15 minutes on a single charge you get tired of watching it

Review Text: I love this little thing! We have two catA a dog and kids and she picks up most of the daily mess. It’s not perfect - sometimes she misses a little here or there and we have a thick shag carpet In one room and she doesn’t work on it but for the hard wood, tile and regular carpet she does a surprisingly good job. I also like that when I’m out for a bit I can start it via an app or at home just ask Alexa to start it and we have a daily schedule set up as well. Buy it really is worth it!

Review Text: Was skeptical to use the robotic vaccum but it is pretty effective. Review Text: Does a great job with our dog and cat hair that is so annoying.  Setting up this vacuum to run every day is a great way to keep our house cleaner because it never seems practical to operate a traditional vacuum every day....something always comes up and we get busy.  WIth the Roomba, we can set up a schedule and have it run every day whether we are home at the time it runs...or not.  Can’t beat the convenience.

Review Text: I do love this for daily tidying. It's great for picking up lint & cat hair. We've had a couple issues with ours: The outside brush broke off after a few months. Docking can sometimes be an issue. He will circle, dock, back out, repeat. (We're still not sure why)

Review Text: I am an old Roomba customer, my first Roomba was bought in 2003. However, I moved from one place to another and  in 2015 ended up buying Infinuvo QQ, primarily because Roomba was too expensive.  However, not that  there is Roomba in the price range that I was interested in (< $300) , I bought it and wasn't disappointed. The Roomba seamlessly connects to my cell phone and cleans up my entire apartment.  No crumbs left of hairs from the brushes. The handle on top for easier transport is great.  The product is easy to use and works perfectly on my hardwood floor.

Review Text: Absolutely love this! So easy to use - you download an app and can schedule a cleaning time or start a clean with your phone. Works when out of the home. I have had this product since the fall and only have had to empty it once or twice. I do still use a regular vacuum once in awhile but this product gets the job done! It senses where stairs are and stuff so it can clean without supervision. If it gets stuck somewhere, it makes a noise and sends a notification to your phone.

Review Text: For the few of you who aren't familiar with Roomba, you don't want this for your weekly cleaning.  It's just not built for that.  It's great, however, for touch up cleaning every few days.  It's also good for running over newer rugs that are still "shedding".  Since we have a spread out home, we have a couple of these units.  My only complaint, on both, is that more often than not Mr. and Mrs. (sure, we named them) Roomba can't find his/her way home before the battery dies.  It's best in a wide open area but, few of us have that luxury.

Review Text: I wish I would have dug a little deeper into the model. This one does not have a mapping feature, and it will literally bump and bumble throughout the house. Had I did a little more research, I would have spent the extra $50 to get one with mapping. It gets stuck very easily, and thinks every air register vent is a cliff. But, it’s still very handy for hard surfaces, and it’s worth the price to not have little bits stuck to the bottom of your feet every time you walk into the kitchen.

Review Text: I was fairly pleased with the cleaning ability for our wood floors.  It even got into places we normally wouldn't/couldn't vacuum.  The only problem with this model is that it does not have floor mapping.  After running it a few times, it was easy to see that that is a necessary function when you have a large or complex floorplan.  It is just too random, cleaning some spots over and over and leaving others.  Also, it also finds its way back to the base by the same method, so 9 times out of 10, it will run out of battery, stranded somewhere in the house.  I returned this model and ordered the Roomba 960, which has the floor mapping software.

Review Text: Gets stuck at like 5x the rate of other vacuums. Wedges itself under places and then gets stuck. Can’t tell the difference between carpet and tile so if you have tile that bleeds to carpet it will think it’s stuck.

Review Text: This worked well enough the first few times, then just marginal after that. I have a Labrador retriever and they shed a lot. My house is a mix of hardwood floor and area rugs. The roomba went effortlessly between the different areas, but left globs of dog hair everywhere, especially around the rug edges. I would have to go around and pick up hair each time i ran the roomba. I have returned it.

Review Text: It is great for light Cleaning but it absolutely doesn't learn the layout of the house. Constantly gets stuck under my dogs feeding station and one specific chair in my home. I've also watched it try and clean one section of my house three times over while my kitchen had dog hair and food particles on it all day. Very erratic and inconsistent. It's just OK to me and we absolutely need to vacuum with the hand held if we're having company. To backtrack on my first statement we have noticed less pet hair than usual. So for light Cleaning it has use.

Review Text: The ONLY reason this review gets a 2 star rating is, because it does clean the floors well. Im a busy mom of two kids and 3 animals, I work full time so anything help when it comes to less house work to worry about. I am literally on day 2 of having this machine and it does not find the dock and it does not connect to the app. I have tried trouble shooting it and reentering in all of the info as if I started over and still the same problem. It would be nice to use the app that is made to make things slightly easier. It would be great if the roomba would get stuck in one room for 20 mins. Slightly disappointed and its only day 2.

Review Text: This vacuum is remarkable for one reason: if there is any obvious dirt or debris anywhere on the floor, it will surely miss it, bumping around aimlessly and infuriatingly missing it over and over again. Recently the Roomba "completed" a job. There were crumbs and candy wrappers all over the floor. It's good if you don't want to maintain hard to reach areas under furniture but honestly this vacuum could use a LOT of revamping.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2019

Review Text: I used a 400 series for about 5 years before it gave out and replaced it with the 675. I'm very disappointed to find out that while the old 400 series cleaned all my bathroom rugs without difficulty, the new model will not! It is also having trouble with the transition between a hard floor and a carpeted room, despite the fact that the threshold is lower than the requisite 5/8 inch parameter. BTW - I had to ask customer service for this parameter, who then had to get help from others on their internal team to even get this information!  So, the product I purchased to clean my floors and rugs when I am not home, is actually NOT DESISIGNED to do this as well as their much older product line. And prior to purchasing, I did not read in any of the online info about the device that it will NOT work on deeper pile rugs. New should not = inferior.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021

Review Text: This roomba does exactly what we bought it for, to keep up with the dog hair on our floor every night. We have bare wood floors with two ruggable rugs. We also have really limited decor so the roomba is really able to do it’s job properly. Our main floor is probably 1300 square feet. Be warned that this product does not do well with deep cleans, cluttered spaces, lots of hair, or any major cleaning job. The best use for this is for you to do your weekly main floor clean and then use this simply as a maintenance tool daily to keep that weekly clean from being overwhelming.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2021

Review Text: First step of making something smart is not to over engineer it . Absolutely unnecessary complex charging mechanism, voice message giving error code 1 is simply disgusting.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020

Review Text: Curious unclear course of vacuuming with watching it in action. Does miss some spots. Best for smaller square spaces, which is not most rooms. Does pick up a significant amount of carpet dust/debris. Easy to use, push button and go, small dog tolerates compared to push vacuum. I like for use when I get ready to leave the house and one point of cleaning is done.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021

Review Text: Was so looking forward to loving this vacuum.  I bought it yesterday arrived today.  It did NOT pick up dog hair from area rugs. There was no particular pattern that it vacuumed. Just went very random and in mostly same spots for over 30 mins. It’s extremely loud and frankly was getting me super angry watching it do nothing. It did however fill up its tiny basket quickly with dog hair from wood floors but again only from the  random areas it went. I think I would have to run this is all day long and pray it goes everywhere. Returning ASAP and getting another dyson animal. Loved the one I had and it broke eventually. Going to just get another one. It was the best even if you have to vacuum yourself.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020

Review Text: The Rumba works well but needs attention when in use. Obviously it cannot get around chairs or other objects, so these need to be moved while the Rumba is working. For this reason I don't think programming it to run on its own would work very well.. It does a good job on surface cleaning. Its collection holder is very small. I'm fairly happy with it but does have its limitations.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021

Review Text: I call this my idiot, lazy vacuum cleaner. It is good because it picks up dog hair (which we have a lot of) on wooden floors. Also cuz I’m lazy.  But doesn’t clean very well on carpet floors for the dog hair.  Larger objects it will roll over and never get. It’s annoying because it constantly goes in circles or runs into the wall a lot repeatedly-hence why I call it the idiot vacuum. Wish it came with a remote.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2021

Review Text: Have only had it for 5 months and already having issues with it not working properly.1. It’s never been able to “dock” itself-it has to be placed on the charging station and we have to put a small piece of wood under the back of it so that that charging contacts are connected.2. The side brush stopped working-we have to manually kick start it in order for it to engage and it sometimes just stops spinning.I’ve cleaned it and done the trouble shooting and still have issues. Maybe it’s just a lemon Roomba lol. But it’s good for basic hardwood floors and getting under the couch!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2019

Review Text: it works.. all u have to do is make sure it's charged and empty out the trap once or twice a day if you run it all day.. maybe if you have a mop for a dog like i do you're gonna have to pull some dog hair out of the brushes once in a while..  otherwise i have zero complaints about the unit.. the app isn't a 5 star rating,, lol.. will sometimes say it isn't charged when it is.. if that happens just restart the app till it gets it right.. but i'm not that picky.. it works..  clean floors is one less thing to argue with the wife about. but don't buy it as a gift.,. lol,, just buy it and don;t say nuthin
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020

Review Text: 2 days prior to this vacuum being delivered I both swept, vacuumed and mopped my home. I couldn’t believe how much very fine cat hair and dust this robo vac was able to pick up. My previous vacuum is an average stick vac that has been losing power though it’s barely a year old. This robo vac is the BUSINESS!! Let’s hope it lasts long enough to justify the price!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2021

Review Text: Stopped working (Doesn't charge) after 1 month.  Then they make you do all these service fixes to see what the problem is.  I went through the steps and it still wasn't working.  Then called back to see if Roomba will send me a new one.If it's broken, just take it back and send me a NEW one!You have to jump through so many hoops, when it's the manufacturer's fault that it's not working.I got a ECOVACS DEEBOT last time and it worked way better.  Cleaned much better and at least lasted 2 years before breaking.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2020

Review Text: I love being able to turn it in and do something else- sometimes I have to run it twice because it will go back to the base before all my floors are swept. I was a bit disappointed that it wouldn’t fit under my couch but I found some 2 inch risers for my couch and now it fits under just fine. Easy to clean out bin after cleaning. I use it daily as it’s so easy to click the Rooma app on my phone to get it going. As advised from the manuf- pick up all phone chargers and cords because it will suck them up and get tangled. I’ve only had it for a few weeks now but so far so good! And I have a heavy shedding Corgi!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2021

Review Text: My new iRobot Roomba arrived yesterday afternoon and I set it to clean for about 15 minutes while I was walking my dog.  It's AMAZING how much dog hair that machine picked up.  I live in a studio apartment and there is always some dog hair and bits of sand (we live near the beach) under the couch and tables.  I vacuumed a few days ago and thought  I had done a decent job until I opened the dustbin on my Roomba.  I am so happy that I purchased this Roomba and am looking forward to years of use.  I highly recommend it to everyone!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019

Review Text: I was excited to get one of these. However, I think it would have been more worth it to get the better model. This one doesn’t map your home, which I wasn’t worried about, except that it’ll continuously go over the same spots and totally miss other parts of the house before it dies. I have to block off room by room so that it gets everything which almost defeats the purpose of having this.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2021

Review Text: This thing does what it says or does I do wish It was a little smaller.  for best results You need to make sure you empty every day the container rotate washing the filters and pick up absolutely anything and everything off the floor it does a lot of bumping around at first but it appears to be learning I’ve had it for a week and absolutely loving it every morning I am to the container and it’s just disgusting With what it picks up off the floor.  So far this is been an outstanding purchase
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2020

Review Text: I bought this at the behest of my oldest son and was hoping it would arrive before he left as I didn’t want to ‘program’ it. Alas, it arrived as I was taking him to the airport.I didn’t know I had nothing to be concerned about! The unit I have (694) is wicked simple! I plugged in the home base, pulled out the battery plastic and oi la! I then downloaded the app, named it, waited for the battery to charge and it was off to cleaning!I am very satisfied with how it cleans. It is relatively quiet, the app is very easy to use and I offer a solid vote of confidence if this is your (like mine) your first robot!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2021

Review Text: this product is great. I don't know why I didn't get this sooner. it cleanes better then my hand vacuum, and easy to clean. My floors and carpet have been extremely clean in the past 2 days of usage. with 2 cats and a child, it's so convenient. the next purchase will be the mop roomba.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021

Review Text: We have a few, small, black square shapes on our living room rug, and this hunk of junk WILL NOT sweep those areas. We tried every hack on the internet to "trick" the sensors. That they have not fixed this issue is ridiculous, and I didn't pay hundreds to have it stop and throw an error message every time it hits a dark area on the carpet. Save your money and hire a housekeeper. Total JUNK!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2021

Review Text: Connected it to Alexa. set it up to get to work, and it did a fine job on the first run. It won't get EVERYTHING, but it will cover 95% of the area is has access to. Picked up a LOT from my carpets and floors on the first run, which was about 30 minutes due to not having been fully charged. Got it all charged up and it did really great work picking up pet hair, random bits of dust, and other little pieces I set out. I am pleasantly surprised.Other users complain about how "loud" it is. It's no louder than a box fan. Almost unnoticeable from behind a thick door. Definitely not disruptive in any way.I'll try to remember to update this in a week or two.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2021

Review Text: I had no expectation of how it performs.  So I am pleasantly surprised by how happy I am with it.  I have COPD so vacuuming is a real chore me sometimes impossible.This little guy takes care of it all for me on one charge.  12-1400 sqft.  does as well on carpet as tile.  I don't know how managed before this purchase.  So ya I recommend the Roomba 675
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2020

Review Text:

Review Text: We do have two dogs, but it’s not that big of space and it runs out of juice before it can effectively clean 4 smallish rooms. All wood floors, no rugs so it’s not like it’s struggling with carpet. Also disappointing is it hardly ever finds the base. I always have to carry it back and line it up to charge.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2020

Review Text: I had a different make previously which worked fine but it needed parts  so for not much more than parts for a 9 y/o I decided to get this Roomba. I am disappointed. It picks up dust  and surface debris, but judging by the bin, not much else.When I watched it a couple days ago in the living/dining area, it kept repeating going over the same places over and over. totally missing other areas. Again, little plant debris mainly and bird seed near the door. It docked itself. I still had to use a Dyson stick to finish the job where Roomba never went.The worst issue was yesterday it was put fully-charged in my closed bedroom. There were some little pieces of fern on the floor which were not picked up anywhere in the circled around the fern, and a few other places were missed. Roomba had died in the closet.

Review Text: I will have to say I was really sceptical. This thing is amazing! It isn't perfect, however it does a great job keeping my floor pet hair free. I don't see tumbling "hairballs". They have thought of many things that are a plus. The brushes and wheels are easily removable for cleaning. We have tile and hardwood floors.I think the only thing I don't like about this is it's loud.I am gonna get a second one for upstairs. Well worth the investment.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2021

Review Text: At first I really loved this vacuum. I have 3 dogs, they dont shed very much and the robot was doing a good job picking up hair and everything from our rug and works great on the rest of the house which is hard floors. But I began to notice that when it leaves the rug on to our hard floor it leaves hair all over and its gross. I just end up using the regular vacuum on the rug which is a bit of a pain as the roomba was supposed to be good enough. Overall I do like it for the rest of the house.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2020

Review Text: this is a review of a SECOND RUMBA. Ii had to return the first one . !. it could not find charger . it also refused to clean thin carpet around my coffee table .Rumba is TOO LOW and the front bumper prevents it on getting on carped. Works in an chaotic pattern .  So in total all I can say is : I EXPECTED MORE  from it.I would look for one with better suction and HIGHER so it can get on carpet
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2020

Review Text: Solid product, but this version does not empty itself.  I thought when I bought it that it did, but I guess that version is much more expensive.  But it definitely performs as expected, and we have lots of pets leaving hair everywhere.  And it is cool that it returns to recharge (I think this is what made me think it was the version that empties itself too).
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2021

Review Text: This model Roomba does not map your house and allow you to restrict certain rooms. It just wanders around picking up anything in it's path. We have 2 dogs and a cat, and it does a good job picking up hair, but sometimes the brush gets clogged and we have to manually remove the hair. The most frustrating part of this vacuum, and the reason I'm giving it 2 stars, is the docking station/charging. This Roomba finds its way back to dock but almost never charges. I have to manually adjust the placement on the charging pins perfectly (I'm talking millimeter adjustments here) to get it to actually charge. If I don't do this after it runs every day it will die on me and miss it's cleaning job. I've tried moving the docking station to a carpeted, hardwood, or tile surface and still no luck. In fact on the hard surfaces the Roomba just knocks over the dock like a lunatic for a while before eventually dying. What a joke.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2021

Review Text: I purchased this vacuum about a year or so ago. At first I thought it was doing a pretty good job. After having it for some time, I found it getting stuck under some furniture that it hadn't in the past. Then it kept going back to the same rooms it had already cleaned and I would have to stop it and move it. I found myself having to watch it the whole time it cleaned. I would try to send it back to it's charging station and it would get lost. Not worth my time. Faster to just vacuum myself.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2020

Review Text: Honestly so happy I finally got one! I went back and forth for a while because we have a small space (~700 square feet) and I was worried it wouldn’t be effective since there are lots of obstacles for it to get around. It does a GREAT job of cleaning up, and I can tell a huge difference after just a few runs. It does a good job of working around/over cords, tassels on the rug, and gets around chair legs and out from under the couch just fine. I have a dog and two cats in here, and the Roomba is great for pet hair. I don’t see little hair poofs in corners anymore. So happy I got this!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2020

Review Text: It does a pretty good job, and the idea of hitting ‘clean’ and walking away is making me so happy. The spinning brush though keeps getting stuck. It’s pretty easy to fix by popping it out and clearing any debris. But I’ve had to do this many times now.... after thinking it was cleaning a room only to find out it was just pushing dust/dog hair around. The spinner is stuck again and even after cleaning it thoroughly it isn’t working. This thing is too pricey and I haven’t had it two months. I didn’t get a warranty because of all of the great reviews, I’ll have to pay for a new spinning brush most likely. I think I love the roomba (except for this spinning brush issue) but I would say to get the warranty!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 24, 2020

Review Text: my wife’s loves not having to vacuum any more.  We got the rumba 675 and call it buzz.  what you will find is your buzz will need constant cleaning and maintenance.  the side brush is a really neat feature but my side brush module locked up due to the lack of a real bearing on the output shat of the gearbox.  therefore nylon shaft running on plastic housing as a bearing surface seized and side brush no longer worked. i just contacted irobot just 5 days shy of owning buzz for 3 months and thy were happy to send my another side brush module.  i am fairly confident i will be operating on buzz again for the same reason in a few months.  but will step up the maintenance schedule from now on to avoid other problems.  this thing is definitely a hair catcher and wraps hair tightly around the brush bristle roller.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2021

Review Text: This little robot is worth every penny. It gets right up next to baseboards (where pet hair and dust accumulated on hardwood floors) and sucks it away. We even watched it pick up a poinsettia leaf that had fallen. Our first time, it got caught in a number of places but once freed, it just kept going. The first haul was a full catchment. Today I did the upstairs and it's spotless. We have 4 floors and it even senses stairs and doesn't fall. A great investment in a cleaner house with zero effort. Who wouldn't want that?
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020

Review Text: This Roomba seems more powerful than the other model I bought a few years ago.  That one is still fine, but I'm using it in my second home.  I love how Roomba can be cleaning my house while I work on something else.  My dog, "meh"...she is not a big fan!  Regardless, a lot of the heavy lifting Roomba does is picking up dog hair!  Great invention.  Love it.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2021

Review Text: Is the hair stuck in the rush free or do I still owe money. So far cat get it to charge and definitely was used or at least kicked down 3 flights of stairs caught by a group of kids with sticky fingers and puppies. If by the grace of god this thing works at all like I heard I’ll change my review but as of right now, I wouldn’t recommend this to anyone.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020

Review Text: Does not work very well with dog hair. Have to vacuum every other day to keep up with the hair it leaves behind. This is forgivable as dog hair is a challenge. What is not forgiveable is after less than 3 months of use it no longer charges. Can sometimes out something underneath it to get it to connect with pins and charge but this only works sometimes. Overall extremely disappointed with this product. I can understand not being to keep up with a multi dog household but to not function correctly after 3 months is unforgivable. If I could give 0 stars I would.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2021

Review Text: This was my second robot vaccuum, and unfortunately it only served it's purpose for a few months and I will not buy the same model again.  It lost the ability to seat itself properly on the charging station.  So for the first few times I dealt with the problem by setting it on there manually. But after awhile even that became problematic as it would take multiple attempts before it hit the sweet spot.  Sometimes I would give up, and then randomly it would come on later and try again and again to seat itself to no avail.  I did not drop or otherwise damage the unit or the charging station, so I have no idea why this problem started. Boo.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2020

Review Text: Had an Ecovac previously. I was a bit concerned when I saw this had only one of the little brushes as the Ecovac has two but ....This does a Much Better job ! With 3 dogs and a cat I can say it honestly works extremely well picking up all the hair ! We run it every other day into every room and it does a great cleaning job . We have wooden floors and area rugs and it cleans all just great ! Only wish it had come with a remote though ! But we got it for  great price so I can’t complain ! I definitely recommend these to everyone!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2021

Review Text: I love this robot. We have had it for 3 days now and I will let you know the issues we have encountered. 1) we have to pick up our rugs (pictured) before it starts it’s process. 2) I should have researched more to find out mine doesn’t have the mapping feature. All in all we come home to a clean house and I don’t have to vacuum now. Oh btw the app works great and have had no issues with it yet!
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2021

Review Text: Works well, but very slow and loud. It’s hard to watch tv with this going on, just to give perspective. But I love that I can do other things while this is running, despite its slow speed. It’s sometimes hard to remember to empty it every session, and it’s always getting stuck on a rug or area where it can’t figure out how to get around, but my kids love rescuing it! It works for what I want it to do and that’s just keeping my floors visibly clean- but I still like to deep clean with my big vac at least weekly.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019

Review Text: This item is terrible. I bought one for myself to pick up the little things-- dust, hair and pet hair. The first week it kept crashing into furniture and just circulating over one part of my kitchen and didn't know how to circle into other rooms. It also thought my living room rug was a wall, not enough power to run over it and onto the rug to clean. I found myself constantly having to pick it up and place it in another location so that it could cover the areas that needed attention. The last straw was when I brought in my christmas tree, and the roomba couldn't even pick up the needles that fell from the tree.Secondly, I think it's important to note that I returned TWO roombas. The one I purchased for myself and the one I purchased for a relative over the holiday. She said her's couldn't do the bare minimum either. Save your money and get yourself something better that ACTUALLY works.
Review Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2021
